_nX63IAEDkzqaSyoeV_Xrg.review_text: Finally made it to this place tonight, and it was just perfect.  Everything from the decor to the music to the space between the lounge-y tables and the noise level was so well done, it's everything a lounge/bar should be.    And the drinks and desserts are just delicious.  The menu was super-tempting; I can't wait to go back & try more!  The fact that places like this exist makes me happy.

g3HFkZgloxLQCvoJ5Zs5gg.review_text: Opa for Nopa!!!!!! So chill here....locals populating it to capacity in dress-down cas, meeting friends, getting some community on. great alternative to purist lounges.  Liked our drinks more than the desserts prepared. Board and card games!:)  Highlight: Connect 4 and the lychee guava martini....soju cream soda was alright as well. Ordered flourless chocolate torte with banana and pineapple. No banana anywhere....too busy the server. We didn't bother.  As for my ice cream sundae,uh..." Macaroon", thou art stale ---eeewy, to be more exact. The brûlée on the bananas not deep enough, and the brownie underneath was also stale. No can do, say we foodies.  But the place itself, casual, is cool. Ventilation sucks so prepare to be bit warm. Tight spaces, and place seems slightly cluttered. Low dim lit interior.

10QBe4zBz8wwbeFeUtM4LA.review_text: Oh my jeebus lordus. Get their Apple Ala Mode. Do it for the love of salted caramel, hazelnuts, apples and ice cream. Party in yo mooooooooooouth.  There was barely a wait when boyf and I came on a Saturday night. I was already stuffed to brim from Izakaya Sozai, but he had a Living Social deal we had to use up, and I have a 7th stomach for dessert, so why not?  Living Social deal includes 2 cocktails and 2 desserts. We ordered the lychee martini with soju and guava juice, strawberry champagne, apple ala mode, and macaron ice cream sandwich. Apple ala mode, look above. Ice cream sandwich tasted like a honeydew hi chew. Yum. Our cocktails were sweet little concoctions as well. Probably not too strong for the average 23 year old, but enough to knock a half-shot wonder off her butt. I liked the lychee one much better since I'm not too partial to champagne.   They have a pretty good selection of desserts and cocktails. I would love to come back and try some more! They have a sampler (4 desserts) that I'd definitely get next time. Though their portions are small, this is a great place to just chill with your date or some friends, and play some board games.

RV1wQ7HxI60DkMJPPLa5hg.review_text: After hearing great reviews from the fellow yelper, I decided to make a reservation on Tuesday night.  A friend of mine and I shared the tasting menu and we were extremely disappointed with the quantity and the quality of the dessert.  Strawberry juice with lemon amuse bouche smelled really great. However, when gulped, it tasted like bad Gazpacho soup. I don't know how you can mess up the combination.  Bittersweet Chocolate Sorbet with foie gras tapioca and croutons sounded like a great concept. Unfortunately the dessert was executed poorly. ~75% of the sorbet melted, the tapioca was so small that you could barely taste anything and the croutons existence in the plate didn't add any value to the plate.  The only reason why I gave two stars for Candybar was for the Warm Vanilla Cake. The cake tasted like a good interpretation of molten chocolate cake done in vanilla flavor. Unfortunately the pickled mango with olive oil side didn't complement the cake well.   Parking is extremely hard - it took us 30 minutes on Tuesday night to find a spot.  The ambience is just OK - a little bit too dark in my opinion.  In a nutshell, spending 30 minutes to find parking is not worth your spending time at Candybar.

fbfPy5ukg2uzNoY1Igd5Mg.review_text: Red velvet cake with cream cheese and coconut icing paired with homemade mint ice cream.  Apple pie alamode with home made vanilla bean ice cream.  Glass of sangria.   Couldn't remember a whole lot about the experience after coming out of my sugar coma, but my friend said that I woofed down the desserts like a vacuum hose and had a big smile on my face the entire time.  Service feels proprietary, very inviting.  Ambiance is retro-new wave funky with books to peruse and games to play.  Chef Lee is doing a good job.

SBmde9cdZqkwh9L9BEO4QA.review_text: Three stars for the peanut butter jelly time and it's yummy salted peanuts and...that's about it. Well, maybe because you have board games and cool art too. My macaroon was all right, the honey dew ice cream was weird, not in a delightfully eccentric way though, just weird tasting. I tasted my friend's choco pudding with bacon and red velvet crumbs and it was more like eating pudding with imitation bacos from Fresh Choice and a chunk of red velvet cake. Not good. Hello, with the advent of the bacon reign, you should never, ever resort to imitation. Even Fresh Choice has both. Geez, I went this past weekend and I've kind of already forgotten you. Now, I can only compare you to a salad joint. Maybe I should relegate this to 2 stars... Waiter didn't really have a suggestion...how do you not effuse over at least ONE item that you are serving up to the hordes? Oh, well, I stopped listening once given that answer. If he did finally share, I couldn't hear it, nor was I interested. I became indifferent. I should have ordered my dessert from NOPA. I'm probably even more bitter because I gave up an opportunity to eat dessert there, it. Would have been fabulous, because NOPA is fabulous. Bitter also because I was cold waiting outside for a table, this place was not exceptional enough to make me want to wait again. Check mark, done. No need for another visit.

jARN0lkLIEawDRs5gGAXig.review_text: 2 things I don't understand: 1. People who write great reviews and have nothing but good to say, and then only give 3 or 4 stars. 2. People who complain about lack of parking in San Francisco. It's like complaining about rain in Seattle or heat in Phoenix. If you don't like looking for parking, become a real San Franciscan and take the bus or cab it.  In short: This place is top shelf in my book.   Candybar has a great wine selection that can be paired very very well with the desserts. The desserts, in and of themselves, are off-the-charts good. Like, "holy smokes I'll have 2 more of those" kinda good. I've never been one to use the word ambiance because I don't think I completely understand what it means, but I'll use it here and say it's great. The music is good, seating is good, lighting is good. It sets the mood for chillin' and relaxin' with good friends, your loved one, someone you're trying to catch up with, or trying to get to know better.  Yes, it's that good.

2rgzUE9BagBMWMFlcSKM8g.review_text: I came here with my girlfriend for a much needed girls night.  I ordered a strawberry kiss, which was a great drink.  We decided to get red velvet cake and a peanut butter jelly time.  Honestly, I do not remember anything about the desserts except thinking that they were a little too sweet.  We were both a little disappointed in the desserts and the ambiance of the place.  It has so much potential to be a nice little lounge area, but it just seems so lacking.  I was really hoping for more because it's a great idea.

gR7is-YzJRnRdQ0AhbiWHA.review_text: Next time, i would come to play games with friends. Ill pass on the desserts. maybe its even too dark to play games. i do want to know who painted the murals, i would like kois swimming on my walls.

auTv42WYJTgJCKlD_XNSxA.review_text: If you are in the area, you should definitely save room for dessert.  They serve cocktails and desserts.  Both of the cocktails that I've tasted were good, very tasty.  I got to try 3 desserts while i was there.  1) apple a la mode - their twist on an apple pie, very good 2) peanut butter and jelly time - i'm not much of a peanut butter fan, but this was pretty good 3) krispy creme donut pudding - this is a krispy creme donut bread pudding, it's for those that have a really SWWWEEET tooth.  a litte much for me, but i'm glad i got to try it

DeNozkS0rQSRj6kSqf6XMQ.review_text: Good concept...  New takes on traditional desserts.  My ice cream sundae had stacks of brownie + mint ice cream + macaroon, with hard carmelized sugar coated bananas  (fun to eat).  Our s'more had a graham cracker tart crust, carmel, baileys Irish creme, and a giant toasty square marshmallow drizzled with melted chocolate (yum).    Dark, loungey atmosphere, board games, dice, cards...  Cool art for sale on the walls...  Great place for sugary sweet cocktails (too sweet for pairing with desserts), and a happy hour before 7!  Overall, a fun place to get together with a group of friends...

RNo6HXYeRJZG_RsFaowULA.review_text: GREAT neighborhood-feel.  Big windows, comfy seating although we had probably the worst table back by the kitchen... will come back for a window seat and play a board game that they have available.  Used a coupon which was completely welcomed.  Had to ask for a couple of things, but was friendly warm place.  Also played very good jazz   We had the following - probably would pass on the Financier next time...was a tad dry.  But there is plenty to try and the other 2 items were marvelous.  The only other negative was while the large white plates were pretty for presentation, the small tables couldn't handle well 2 with water, drink and tea cups. Hope this gem becomes a longtime destination for SF  Triple Chocolate Bellini sparkling wine, chocolate syrup, chocolate sorbet.,  Apple a la Mode hazelnut crust, cream cheese filling, caramel, gingerbread ice cream..  Chocolate Financier Cake frozen Bavarian cream, cranberry sauce, almonds, breton crumble...

Vcadamdv04NuyAiRIWSkOg.review_text: Seeing as i am on a yelping mission, and i just left this place, i will do the right thing and YELP.  This is a cool place.  Never heard of it before, but being nearby and that i was in the mood for a drink, why not.  It seems a little girly inside.  Like a cozy place for girls to get together and gossip or trash men.  I was with a friend who happend to be female otherwise i dont know if i would have came in here alone.    The drinks are pretty tasty.  They have a selection of  cocktails and beer and wine.  They also have deserts.  We tried a couple drinks and a dessert.  The drinks were good, and the desserts were just ok.    But the big plus about this place is that its got couch like seating in the front so its pretty comfortable.  Also they have board games to play so if you get bored you can entertain yourself that way.  Candyland, Uno, connect four, and some trivia games.    The service was good, and the guy was really attentive.  I did feel that the lighting was starting to give me a headache, but if i want to spend some quality time with a female companion again, i would probably think about coming back here again.

IxQrE6BuM_QKnjSq6kVglg.review_text: Candybar is such a brilliant idea! I had the pleasure of coming here after an extended happy hour, and man were we lucky to have been seated at the right time!  Can't recall what the exact time was, but we got the last corner available one Friday night. The 3 of us got some yummy bubbly drinks along with dessert-for-2 to share. I honestly could not eat anymore at that point of the night, but managed to tried a bit of all 4 selections - the Peanut butter jelly time was definitely my favourite! 2 more joined the party and the staff was great with us :)  Even though the place was packing up and the line was forming out the door, the staff never rushed us. I sure would like to be taken back here for a date ;)

etFoG0_n_tVriAAWTYqeyg.review_text: My new fave place for a night out in the neighborhood - which seems to evolve into gourmet central lately ...  I have been twice since they re-opened (with two new chefs) and have not been disappointed so far:  ... a fun girls' night out with some amazing small plate dishes along with an eclectic mix of wines by the glass - highlights included a yummy sweet onion-apple soup and tiny beef boulettes - everything presented beautifully on different small white plates.  ... a quick-fix sugar stop with the man after sushi dinner across the street  - loved the chocolate mousse w/ peanut butter semi-freddo and enjoyed some nice bubblies by the glass.  Looks like the menu will change on a monthly basis. The October menu included a preview to next month's highlighted ingredients, so will definitely check back for more ecclectic menu options then ...

yZM8bO0dbhffVp6RCTFN5w.review_text: I hate when desserts are an after thought of simple ice cream or standard cakes.  This place solves that dilemma by only serving dessert so its full attention can be paid to creating innovative dishes!  Every dish had at least one component, if not the whole thing, that exposed me to a taste or combination I hadn't known before.  That exploration paired with general yummyness deserves high marks!  Nacho Sundae: This is one of those rare inspirational dishes that takes you to a place you've never been before.  The avocado yogurt and fruit salsa (kiwi, mango, papaya) with cilantro were a cool way to sweeten a well known presentation.  The horchata ice cream was nice, but got downplayed because of the cinnamon and sugar already on the chips.  The one candied jalapeño was a brilliant way to a zing without making it savory... wish there were more!  Red Velvet Cake: Fluffy cake - check!  Creamy and slightly sour frosting - check!  That's all I needed, but fresh coconut shavings were added on top of the frosting to innovate.  I would have preferred if a portion of it was toasted because raw coconut is only so exciting.  I liked that the vanilla bean ice cream was presented on red velvet crumbs.  Banana Bread Pudding: On par for bread pudding plus a lovely addition of bananas.  Could have been warmer.  The caramel popcorn ice cream was an unlikely star, but dang, what a memory it made!  A great innovation on something I had never thought of.  Chocolate Fudgesicle: Not your typical fudgesicle frozen treat, but more like a cold chocolate shell with a cold flowing chocolate inside.  Was great for the chocolate lover in me, but I kind of wish it was more true to the name.  I had no idea what a tonka bean was, but it made the ice cream taste like vanilla + spices... very yummy.

8hvXl0oJmU61l17LG9aDag.review_text: i dont like dessert.   dessert for me is a sambvca.... maybe a mccallans 12 on the rocks.   but if it makes the lady happy, its worth it for me.   ok i lie, i liked the stuff here. come on..... warm vanilla cake was awesome. duck liver mousse.... yum...... pork terrine, yummss.....  the staff seemed a bit off, but hey, its a new place, growing pains and all, right?  3.5 rounded up for the swanky, i wanna sex you up bathroom.

rZRCEAy-xv7TwDstUliTnA.review_text: Looks like I'm the first to review this joint after actually going there. :)  Well, Candybar is pretty sweet if I may say so myself. Right across from Tsunamis, it satisfies a craving I've had for quite a while now...a wine bar in the hood! I made it there this opening weekend and found it to be a pleasant experience - keeping in mind that opening a bar..or business takes some ramping up time. The bartenders read from the menu and bill processing was slow, but overall, the wine and desserts were B+ and above. The crowd, likely due to the opening, was on the yuppy side - but I'm not complaining. A cool crowd, a hop, skip and jump (or 3 minute cab ride home) and wine...not a bad combo at all! Make a reservation if you're set on sitting at a table.

4UlVr_fNY83wqYSkJ1C1Lg.review_text: This place was so cute!  We came here and decided to order our own drinks and split one dessert.  Service was quick and very friendly. I loved the calamansi in the strawberry limeade dessert that we shared. It was so delicious! The use of calamansi added a bit of an almost herbal-tangerine flavor to it with the tartness that you want with a sweet strawberry dessert. Also, I'm typically not at all into sweeter drinks because I can't do alcohol AND added sugars but I thought their fruitty drinks here were done quite well. Instead of fruit flavored vodka, they use a lot of real fruit purees. The prices are a little steep but that tends to be the case for such specialty bars.  I also love that there are board games around. We played Connect Four and it was just a cute date night idea... Drinks, dessert and a little ol' competition to keep things light.

XTjssaFq2XIxbRUhyjRarw.review_text: My bff Tatum recently moved to San Francisco living right off of Masonic. We had an amazing dinner on Irving St. and then went back to her place for my tour. Being that she only moved in a couple days ago, and all her stuff is still in Colorado, there was nothing to do after 5 minutes so we decided dessert would be a great idea.  My palette usually favors the savory dishes, but we Yelped desserts in the area and Candy Bar came up. 0.5 miles, only 8 pm on a Friday, we said OK!! We walked the seven blocks and came up to this savvy boutique looking place with a bar. There were booth like couches and ottomans. There was a big shelf of different board games and the different paintings on the walls. It was kind of cold that night, so we walked in to the warm place which smelled so sweet and lit by candlelight, it was almost love at first meeting.  We were greeted by a very friendly gentleman whom I later find out is the owner. We sat down, ordered and drank our water. I'll get to the food later. I went to use the restroom and immediately smiled. The bathroom was unisex, but it was big an clean and full of sexy candles. The first thing that came to mind that this is a very very sexy bathroom!;) I was over the moon. Ok, moving on.  So there was a menu of cute drinks and gourmet dessert pairings. They all sounded so amazing, it was really hard to decide, so you should look at the menu for yourself. But I had the carrot cake with bruleed bananas and some sort of granola type thing with salted caramel ice cream. MMMM right?! And Tatum had brownie with candied walnuts and caramel sauce with thyme ice cream. I practically licked both our plates clean.  So we ask for the check and our waiter/owner tells us about the tacos they have on Tues and Thurs at happy hour and my mouth starts to melt all over again. Asian tacos?! Right up my alley. I tell Tan that I can't wait for happy hour and I will be back every week to try a new dessert, and tacos! It was comfortable, delicious, warm and inviting! A well deserved 5 stars!!

6sOM7brs-Ku324GZhV9aQg.review_text: The dessert tastes great!  The arrangement is professionally placed, and it's not just looks!  Service was great, and I love that they have board games in there for you to play while you wait for your desserts.  The Strawberry limeade was great!.  The Ice cream sandwich is a must!

S-eWud-nldDYVCzrrdEoIg.review_text: My friends and I were in the mood for dessert and drinks, so Candybar couldn't have been more perfect to satisfy our cravings.  I suggest making reservations.  It can get crowded on a Friday/Saturday night.    These are the desserts I tried: Ice cream Trio: Kit Kat, Oreos, and Reese's Peanut Butter Cup.  So-so.  It just taste like Vanilla ice cream with the candy/cookies mixed in. Tiny portions of each.   I would rather have Cold Stone.  Because the atmosphere of the place is awesome, as well as the presentation of the food itself, the $5 ice cream trio is well worth it.  Ice cream sandwich: brown rice tea ice cream sandwiched in between green tea wafers.  Delish!  I could really taste the brown rice tea in the ice cream.  Big fan of this one.  Presentation is also nice.  $7 for something so small, yet again worth it b/c of the atmosphere and presentation.    These are the drinks I tried: Blueberry Pomegranate Fushion: sparking wine & soju.  It was yummy, but was dissappointed when I saw how tiny my glass was.    Strawberry Kiss: Sparking wine with gingerale.  Nothing special.  Don't waste your money on this one.    Did i mention there are boardgames for customers to play with?  My friends played a round of "Apples to Apples".  We had reservations at 10:45 pm on a Saturday night.  "Candybar" closes at 12 midnight, so we didn't have enough time to fully enjoy, because we only had an hour to hang out.  With that said, I suggest early arrival and reservations.  I would've loved to stay 2 hours at least.    I will definitely arrive earlier during my next visit.

qQpUWfDYH0kKty-RKutSlQ.review_text: Yes, I am a fan! Sure you would expect to wait because the place is packed with people and considering the place is tiny, obviously, there would not be enough room for everyone to be seated. My friend and I waited for 30 minutes to be seated on a Friday evening, but I honestly think it was worth the wait. I ordered the Mango Tango Bellini cocktail and the Lavender Honey Creme Fraiche Semi Freddo - I highly recommend both. The Mango Tango Bellini has a very tangy citrus-y punch, makes a good combination to the floating sorbet  because makes it sweeter. The Lavender Honey has a very unique texture, reminds me of Astronaut Ice Cream (if any of you had tried that before). It definitely has that floral taste (not in a bad way if you like lavender or rose flavored treats), caramelized nuts with a touch of honey. I also like the atmosphere - its a perfect place to chill with friends or to go on a date.

TGRrvpO1M0Pr5ISWiU6u2A.review_text: okay, so spending 30 minutes trying to find parking, then another 10 minutes waiting to be seated, this dessert place better be great. but eh and blah is all I can say. Not worth my time, sorry Candybar.   The dessert menu was extensive and their creations were good, but the taste was just so overbearingly sweet it was too much for me. I had a weird tarty acidic aftertaste that lingered for the next 2 hours. we ordered Lavender Honey Creme Fraiche Semi Freddo (almond brittle, Nutella powder, cantaloupe $9) and Ice Cream Sundae (macaron, bananas, brownie, vanilla anglaise, strawberries, strawberry ice cream $10) decent not awesome. I guess I just had higher expectations.   Service was swift and overall mood of the place was friendly. It is a cool place to hang out with friends over dessert and cocktails. best of luck in trying to find parking.

nYy_9YCHYKAzUd4uIC-Z9w.review_text: This place is my version of Heaven.  I have a sweet tooth that could kill an elephant, and this place delivers on all counts.  The desserts are amazing, their Happy Hour perfectly timed and they have a TV that plays the Giants game.

JnGtgOPpkjyWOvWM0SYEXg.review_text: following a lady inside...dessert after sushi...candybar is like candy...sweet aroma in the air...dim and date atmosphere...complete with pretty girly girl fizzy cocktails...pink and red...sweet, fruity and light on the alcohol...open-faced s'more ultra milky chocolaty oozing...made for the sweet tooth...a sundae fancifully deconstructed on plate...strawberries and candied banana...ice cream scoops...candybar is for the ladies...

VCoBNwAUSvo0Sz2ORszOOw.review_text: Candybar is the Best Place for dessert.  The name alone gets 5 Stars.   Happy Hour is awesome.  It occurs every day from 6pm to 8pm: $4 Sparkling Cocktails, $3 Sangria, $3 Champagne, & $2 Pacifico.  I have had all of their cocktails before.  My favorites are the Mango Tango Bellini, Triple Chocolate Bellini, and Strawberry Kiss.  The Lemon Drop Shot is good as well.   When it comes to the desserts, I recommend the Tiramisu, Japanese Cheesecake, Apple A La Mode, Buttermilk Vanilla Bean Panna Cotta, Strawberry Limeade, and Peanut Butter Jelly Time!  Every single dessert I have had at Candybar was delicious.  I Love coming here!

0cg-J0qQdQdr13-c5nL9hA.review_text: Loved this place. The service was good, I had the kir royale with the s'mores and my hubby the lychee martini with the peanut butter and jelly dessert. The dessert and drinks were impeccable and we will be returning to try other drinks/desserts.

jBSxydAzoWLgyfTlO_7nMQ.review_text: This was our first stop for my sister's bachelorette party and everyone had a GREAT time. I contacted Tan who was extremely helpful in reserving us a whole section. I don't know why people are complaining about the price because $14 for the prix fixe is not bad at all, especially in San Francisco. The ambiance was great, the servers were extremely courteous, and the desserts and wine pairings were great. The noise volume is high, but that's why it's fun. There were about 10 girls in our group, and everyone said they'd come again.

CiYRhDyFbsDbWR45uv822w.review_text: Drinks = good.  Pricey.  So enjoy the Happy Hour Specials from 6-8 p.m. daily.  Beer and wines only, so don't look for 'liquor'.   Desserts = yum.  Worth the $9+   I had the Apple A La Mode.  Such moist apple cake? and delicious ginger ice cream!  I had a bite of my sis and her bf's PB&J Time, OMG, soooo good.  I would have gotten it, except I knew that it'd be overwhelming for me to eat that alone.    Service = friendly  Decor = lounge-y.  Needs more seating, especially for big group gatherings.  I'm not sure how suitable this place is for big gatherings actually...the space is not big enough to avoid encroachment on other's sound space....    Music = good.  It's a good mix.  Definitely got the hip hop music going, which I think is good for high energy, but you gotta be into that sort of thing.  It's good for me!   Overall, I liked the place.   They do have board games, but it's all missing pieces.  So defeats the purpose of playing games here, huh?   Parking = a real pain.  So carpool if you need to; walk and/or take public transport!

1N9A5z-07MimZBU-o69kuw.review_text: Nice atmosphere and a good place to hang out with friends if you want to do something fun but low-key. They have games and yummy, interesting desserts.  My only gripe is that the desserts were small.

4Z-SVhSkhCdT7MjNnoacJA.review_text: Incredible desserts, wonderful atmosphere.   They do not take reservations, but we got in earlier in the evening and there was not a wait at all. I took my girlfriend there and we ordered tiramisu and red velvet cake. Absolutely incredible. I wish we had waited three hours longer so we would have been much hungrier.  Wine list is nothing to write home about... If you're going there, go there for the special cocktails and dessert... Not for the wine.

oICiZaax59mCR_Ejz4vTlw.review_text: Great place to have a girls night out! Lots of board games and yummy drinks and the best part? You can BRING YOUR OWN FOOD & eat there! The desserts are DELICIOUS. Definitely recommend this place!

LsfNeGnvI0oopb5tAnWq9g.review_text: I'm not a fan, but the reviews look great so I recommend trying it for yourself. My date and I went here after a fabulous meal and were wildly disappointed.  I mean, it is a dessert lounge, lots of customers, great vibe and colorful decor.  Perfect, right?  I had the japanese cheesecake and a Jasmine Sparkle specialty cocktail, he had the Chocolate Cake and an expresso.  None of it tasted that great, we both agree we wouldn't go back.  the girl next to us had the apple pie and she just picked at it, said she didn't really like it, and didn't take more than a few bites.

avxD6r3_MquP6xBbiaUHNw.review_text: There are very few dessert-focused eateries in SF, so I was VERY happy to find Candybar. I loved it's cozy atmosphere (part art gallery, part café, and part bar) and most importantly, the desserts!  I had the Apple a la Mode (hazelnut crust, cream cheese filling, topped with caramel, layers of thinly sliced apples, and gingerbread ice cream)...yummmmy! It was so good, I devoured it in 5 seconds flat. The dessert was rich, sweet, and perfectly complemented by the spicy gingerbread ice cream.   I will definitely be back for more sweets!

KURUGmYN2kwDpr6BcEcrRA.review_text: I'm torn. I think I'd actually give this place a 3.5. Came here with a Groupon, and was quite excited about this place. Desserts and sparkling wine, in a chill relaxing atmosphere? Sounds awesome!! Well, it was partly awesome. Here's why:  Loved the atmosphere. It was indeed really chill, with tons of boardgames to sit back and have fun. The night was really fun...Catchphrase and a deck of cards can last a long time!  Not quite up to par? Drinks and desserts. We ordered the green tea bread pudding with vanilla ice cream, and the peanut butter time (chocolate tart with peanut butter mousse), the 50/50, jasmine sparkle, and the blood orange cocktail. I didn't think the green tea was all that - I could taste the bitterness of the green tea, but that was about it. Lacking in flavor, I thought. The pb tart had a smooth pb mousse, and hard chocolate tart shell. This was good, but not great. It didn't tantalize my taste buds :)  Drinks were good, but the sparkling ones were just syrup mixed with champagne. After seeing them make it, I felt that it wasn't worth $7. The 50/50 tasted like orange creamsicles, which were awesome, but not really alcoholic...and was served in a round glass cup with a green straw. Funny!  I think my expectations were too high for this place. Come here for the atmosphere and company, not so much for the desserts or drinks.  Ppl were really nice, fyi.

A-G12XwH1tBb6GyyKxjHLg.review_text: Peanut Butter Jelly Time!  Chocolate Tart, Peanut Butter Cream (like Mousse) and Blackberries - to die for!!!  Went with a large group on Friday night and had the chance to taste several desserts here.    Few notes on food: PB&J was hte highlight. They have ice cream on the sides of a few that are very accurate in description - basil ice cream tastes like BASIL, not a hint, but a lot -very different though and good. Could easily share a plate between 2 but between 3 is tough.  Apple a la Mode was very high end homemade feel and the red velvet cake was a bit disappointing - every one loves this stuff but here is was a bit dry and boring - could maybe use more of the mint ice cream side?  Place: Have board games on hand to play - great date spot as dim lighting plus games means never an awk moment.  Drinks - are all sweet bc sparkling wine, no hard alcohol.  If you are having dessert already - they are  a bit too sweet for me, but props for having both red and white sangria.  While this is a normally a sweet drink, you can make versions less sweet and i would recommend they do that here.   Definitely going back

8TCKKnWkMUdp_7SU2NI75g.review_text: This place is super chill, with people dressing all fancy.  The wait to get seated was pretty darn long 30min+, but hey, we had time.  We sat, chatted and played apples to apples as we waited, really great way to distract you if the food takes a while.  I was so full from eating french soul food that I couldn't try as much as I wanted to, have a light dinner before stopping by.  The strawberry limeade is worth the hype: get it. It's so darn cute!  The passion fruit chocolate mousse: Chocolate- good, Coffee Ice cream - Mmmm, Passion fruit mousse - there's just too much of you. It's 3/4 PF and 1/4 chocolate. The ratio is just too crazy. The passion fruit took up more than my spoon could hold, it was too much. Having it with half the amount of mousse was good. The coffee ice cream was my highlight.  Cocktails all night: Strawberry kiss  - is not too strong and looks cute                                    Raspberry Delight - Stronger than I thought, but people liked it.                                    Mango Tango Bellini - I was suprised, I didn't really like it.                                    Lemon drop - My favorite of the night, or at least I think it was?                                                              It was either this or that other drink with soju in it.                                    Cherry Blossom - I really felt like the petals were in my mouth,                                                                      you can take that as good or bad.                                     50/50 - Okay, they sold out or something and I really wanted to                                                   try this: I'm coming for you next time.                                      Kir Royale - Didn't have it, but was curious, let me know how                                                             it is guys :D  Service is great and they are very nice in accommodating anything you needed. Our server was a very cool guy and makes conversation with you. It made my wait for the restroom not so boring. Thanks Glenn. Coming out of the bathroom wasn't boring either as I timed it perfectly to open the door and witness a pretty girl vomit right in front of me. Hope she made it home okay :( Didn't realize this place was so intense.

LEGudhGQU2sBvpyltEov1g.review_text: I bought a groupon for here a couple weeks ago, and we went on Sunday at 8 PM after deciding not to wait 45 minutes on a Friday without reservations.   We arrived on Sunday and the place was pretty empty. We ordered the apple tart with cream cheese mousse and hazelnut crust, the chocolate passion fruit mousse, and a mango sorbet bellini (?). The chocolate passion fruit mousse was beautiful and I enjoyed the citrusy, tart flavor of passion fruit with the chocolate, but the blow your mind dessert was definitely the apple tart. It was AMAAAAAZING!! I didn't think it would be that great, but something about the combination of cream cheese, hazelnuts, and lots of cinnamon was over the top. We had a really enjoyable time and on a Sunday, there really wasn't anyone there. On a Friday, the place was packed and bustling, so it was a very different feel.  I had called before I arrived in SF to see if I could get reservations, and whoever answered told me I didn't need to make them if our party was smaller than 6 people. Lame. Because they do take reservations. So make them!! And PS they have board games there. Looks like fun!

sngzUudHHiosW2k7NV7zAQ.review_text: I LOVE Candybar's concept...drinks (both alcoholic and non alcoholic), scrumptious desserts and board games!  The desserts are really good and priced very reasonably.  They have a dessert special...$25 for four desserts (two people).  They also have happy hour specials every night, I believe from 6-8pm.   I love desserts so I ordered the following desserts: 1)  peanut butter jelly time - really peanut buttery and delicious, totally recommend it 2) carrot cake - I am a cake snob and hate dry cake. This cake was not...it was very moist with creamy cream cheese frosting 3) lemon tart - not usually a huge fan of lemon tart but I really liked how they prepared it with the coconut macaroon 4) vanilla bean panna cotta - perfect balance, not too sweet, very light and creamy 5) lavender honey cream fraiche - great light dessert that isn't too sweet  6) Japanese cheese cake - this was the only one that I did not like. The japanese cheese cake was too bland but the gelato on the side was good.  Candybar also has a good range of yummy cocktails to choose from.  The venue is very inviting and the seats are comfortable.  Great place for friends to come, chill and catch up.

5WgGEH77p8fJKQ2KVfrGKA.review_text: Complete review: btbdesign.blogspot.com In the Know: First impression: I could not see J Crew in the people at all. I could, however, see where someone might mistake this place for a retail shop. Could it be the over sized book shelf looking object used to divide the front lounge from the back tables? It does look as though it could have housed several sweater vests and polo's on it. Possibly the bar and furniture wood accents? The sharp angular edges and color does come off a bit Banana Republicy. How about the lighting scheme? Over the bar is fantastic carbon pendant lighting system. The kooky, octopusesque chandelier would not have been my first pick but I can kinda see where they were going with that...kinda. But other than that, the form follows the function. Form: two low lounge areas with red fabric seating and chests used as tables up front. A gathering of 2 & 4 top tables with an awesome chalk board displaying the latest in dessert exquisitery in the back. Function: Serving only dessert, wines/beers, and a plethora of old school board games. Board games people...BOARD GAMES!!! Behind the Bar: The large chest that acts as a table in the front lounge is way to large for the space. I found my knees knocking against it as I was constantly standing up, laughing, and pointing as I was very respectfully making fun of how horrible people are at parallel parking. Apparently some drivers can't handle 7 people staring at them as they try to fit their Honda Civic into a space that one could easily park a mini van. (of course if the driver was an Asian woman that statement would be false.) Who's Who: One would think that since there are a plethora of board games that it would be fun for the whole family. False! I would not like to see little kids running around this place. One there isn't enough room to run around. Two if im on a romantical after dinner date, the last thing I want to concern myself with is a child staring at me as I deliver sexual innuendos over a game of Shoots and Ladders. (you might be surprise how much that game can get anyone into the right mood;) It is a great place to meet some girlfriends/boyfriends after work. It is an even better place if you go on a date, realize that you have absolutely nothing in common with the person sitting across from you, however they insist that you at least eat dessert. Instead of continuing on with the utter bore that is your date, you can take him to Candybar where at least you have a game and fantastically delicious dessert to occupy your time before rushing home to call your girlfriends and discuss how just because they are a rocket scientist for NASA doesn't make them interesting. Enjoy!

eHnysmacdRTq65a4eA1ZFA.review_text: cute place.  friendly service.  the lemon tart was yummy but the chocolate cake ok.  best part was the delicious speciality cocktails!

DhmybTvuLWthh1RTR9aogg.review_text: nice atmosphere but desserts were a bit disappointing in size and satisfaction.   attempts at creativity were good, but i expect small but painstakingly executed desserts when i go for michelin-starred restaurant, no when i'm lounging with friends while playing board games. bigger portions of home-style desserts easy for sharing are what i expect.  still a fun place to spend a few hours.  bonus points for the drink selection, but wouldn't order dessert again.

mIQV6SQviY6W2RpZm5YKJQ.review_text: I dropped by with two friends for Happy Hour from 6-7:30 on a Wednesday evening. It's walking distance from my house which is a real plus when drinking.  But, it was almost empty, which was great for seating but seemed a little odd? Anyway, I ordered the stuffed zucchini blossoms which they were out of, so instead I got the grilled cheese sandwich which was marginal at best.  The wine was fine but the service was slow considering the "crowd" was about 8 people.  I think it's nice for drinks and the prices are good by SF standards, so I'll go back.  If I have a better experience the next time maybe I'll give it one more star.

LlzQJJbS_JxKVVBgnoncHg.review_text: I love places like Candybar because of its versatility, it can be perfect for all sorts of occasions: a) happy hours b) girls night out c) date nights d) to cure post breakup glucose cravings See, anything you want it to be.  That said, we came around 7:45 on a Saturday night, and the place was still pretty empty. I liked the atmosphere, and loved how I saw people playing board games by the corner, and just having a good time. We looked at the menu and realized we were still in time for happy hour, and ordered the Strawberry Kiss and Passion Fruit Delight. The cocktails were so pretty and delicious, I couldn't stop myself from sipping on it. For the desserts, we went with the "Dessert for two" option, which allowed us to sample four desserts from the menu for $25. This was still a hard task, but in the end we went with the Lavender Honey Creme Fraiche Semi Freddo, Flourless Chocolate Cake, Tiramisu and Ice cream Sandwich. My favorite dessert was the flourless chocolate cake, it was rich and smooth, simply addictive. Then, with the slightest buzz ever, we started playing Connect 4, which I somehow managed to lose every round Overall, I had a really good time at Candybar. The desserts and cocktails are delicious. What a fun and sexy place.

GuNBz3pAXMxfB2SBd5qeuQ.review_text: The drinks were OK the deserts were OK the board games were fun but the service was POOR.  Even though you happen to be in a tiny space I recommend more than one server on a busy night such as Saturday.  I had a great time because I was in good company and perhaps I will give you another try and check out a different cocktail or two and perhaps make a drinking game out of the board games you provide.. hmmm.. could be fun.  Unfortunately I don't think I will be testing out your deserts.  Sorry Candy Bar.  I do plan on giving you a 2nd chance.  My fingers are crossed.

B7ecAeAIrXg7sgmabS38pg.review_text: Doh! I almost forgot to review this place. Duuur. Might have been the fact that I was um....hiccup.  This was a totally unexpected treat for my friend and I, who shall remain nameless to protect his identity and not get him in trouble with his lady friend and young child. We were on one of our, oh shall we say, slightly inebriated nights together. (I know, me? drunk? what? Never!!!) Anyhoo. We were out causing a lot of trouble, kickin ass, takin names and numbers and just having a blast and Candybar popped on our radar.  Sweets, you say? I don't even like sweets? I am much more of a savory kinda gal instead of sweets, but hey, maybe they have champagne? And indeed they did, along with some great sweet tasting menus to boot. I can't tell you the specifics of what we had, but I know there were some yummy chocolate offerings and again, this is coming from the girl that rarely, if ever, eats chocolate.  As far as the concept of dessert bars goes, this one is a winner. The owners are sweethearts and they are all working hard to deliver one sweet operation and I say, give em a go! I know I will again, when one of the four days a year that i actually crave sweets occurs!

r_ZOM1fF9RFS5LNr3otqAA.review_text: I bought a Groupon for Candybar while I was living in Sweden this summer; the concept sounded so fun that I couldn't wait to check them out and the deal was really good!  My boyfriend and I decided to go to Candybar the week of Thanksgiving; I checked their web site to see what the hours were and we headed over there after dinner. It really sucked that after searching for parking we walked up to a dark shop with a hand written sign stating they were closed that week. It would have been nice to post that on the web page (hello 2011). Anyway, I was still really excited so a few friends joined us in a happy hour excursion (this time we called first).   I'll break it down in pros and cons:  PROS: + Ambiance + Well thought out cocktail recipes, we had a few and all were yummy + Desserts were delicious and very creative (we shared 4 desserts) + Board games a neat touch, we started to play one but then our party grew to 6 and that was just too much to try and keep going + Happy hour pricing was cool (drinks are kinda pricey), our first round was half price  CONS: (keep in mind they were not busy, the place was maybe half full) - S-L-O-W service. The server asked us once right after seating for our order and when we asked for a few more minutes it took long stares from all six of us to get him to come back. He was one of those servers who never actually made eye contact with his patrons so flagging him down was fruitless.  - Desserts came out WAY after drinks were served. Their gimmick is drink and dessert paring, that alone suggests they should be served together.  - It took another round of stares to get a second round of drinks. And then about 15 minutes before those drinks even made it to the table.    I will go back to Candybar for three reasons; I want to believe they were just short staffed, I really like the concept and the desserts were amazing.

kgG2bQu9I4DzHozZrI5WTw.review_text: We had been excited to try this place for some time. It wasn't what I was expecting at all. I thought it would be a girly bar but even my boyfriend noticed the strong male vibe. Cushion seating was hard and not plush at all. Drinks were okay. Service was okay, although when we arrived the place was nearly empty so we took a large corner booth and were told we'd have to move for a larger party. None ever came. The desserts: yuck. I was hoping for classic decadent fare especially chocolate but the choices seemed more like something middle school girls would concoct at a sleepover. Meh. Didn't impress us at all - football game was on so not the romantic vibe I'd expected.

Vd0KAnQyGyGuP3LHK6EaWQ.review_text: Overpriced drinks and desserts.  And I love them both!!

OHMucKEdOwe13GG-uy9S1w.review_text: I went here for my friends birthday, and was really excited about trying it! I love dessert so I thought this place would be right up my alley. Unfortunately the deserts were far below our expectations. We ordered the ice cream sundae, the tiramisu and the red velvet cake. The deserts at least the ones we had, were pre-made, and as a result the quality and taste drop below average! The redvelvet cake (my order) was way to dense- bordering on the line of just plain hard, and lacked any red velvet flavor. My girlfriends didn't care for their plates either. Out of all three the sundae was the best. Bummer. The birthday girl did enjoy her chocolate martini, hence the two stars. I wont go back. Try the place in the marina if you want a better desert experience.

zZyKEl4BVJxOmQUgAUzZrg.review_text: A really cute place.  Comfy seating & great artwork.  And the music was low enough to allow for easy conversation.  The drinks are great (I had the Blood Orange Cocktail & Red Sangria).  The desserts are also great (I had the Housemade Ice Cream Trio & had a bite of the Krispy Kreme Donut Pudding!).  All in all a great experience & I highly recommend it!

7F5CmTvn06bVoibJWqXmHw.review_text: Desserts are not bad, but if judging based on price, there is something left to be desired.  Beautiful presentation on large plates, but the tables are also really small so you can probably only fit 2 plates at any given time.    Ice cream sandwich: only outstanding part was the almond parisian macaron with its delightful almond flavor and light yet crunchy texture.  The honeydew ice cream was ok, light like a sorbet but wasn't very noteworthy.  The chocolate ganache and fresh melon were run of the mill.  The melon did not taste that ripe.  (2/5)  Drunken s'mores: ok, this one was amazing.  Salted caramel flavor bombards your mouth while the graham cracker tart crumbles like butter and the marshmallow melts with the bailey's chocolate sauce.  Very nice combination.  (4/5)  Jasmine sparkle: Tastes like regular sparkling wine with an infusion of jasmine.  (3/5)  Mango tango bellini: Tastes like juice... also gets kind of nasty when the sorbet melts.  (3/5)

mn2dBGX5-brzrPr8gx8XoQ.review_text: Sooooo I was in love with this place and would have given it 5 stars after my first two visits. Unfortunately for Candy Bar I have gone back a few more times and am left a bit more disappointed each time...  The layout and seating really needs to be re-arranged, the bar stools are not that comfy and it gets fairly hot in the place and the lighting is so-so. None of this would deter me from coming back as it isn't that bad but the building is new so I would think they would of done it right when they built it.   What has been a disappointment is the food, I understand they are trying to be edgy with their desserts but you have to have a few staple things on the menu that everyone will like and know. The wine list has changed some and some of their best wines are no longer on the menu. Even the wait staff seems to of slipped a bit, or maybe I just got them on a off night the last time I was there.  Having this cool concept place in the hood is great and I hope they figure things out soon. I will be back but only in hopes that they will know what they need to fix and fix it. I am not a huge dessert person and the place isn't cool enough that I will keep coming back if they don't...

ixAzWY0pBHd-1P0gUPFcTw.review_text: I loved the ambiance and the art so much, but everything else was so meh.  My wine was stale.  My apple thingie dessert was not fresh and had a microwaved/sitting out consistancy to it and the service was overall generically unimpressive.  Maybe, I caught them on an off night?

DkXzWX28C1TtO20DTZ95SQ.review_text: So last weekend, my girlfriends and I head over to this dessert lounge as a pre-party stop. Now, I LOVE desserts, pair with a couple glasses of riesling wine... completely heaven! I tried the tasting menu for $14-- a good deal for 4 tastings, 2 of which we chose. I chose the bittersweet chocolate sorbet and the warm vanilla cake-- tasty, but not as tasty as the chevre cheesecake and chocolate brioche my friend had! The waiter forgot to give us our last tasting, so I dock a star for that. BAD!  Overall, a good experience!

C7p4AojhkDK3f6hqPSHwfg.review_text: Oh My God!  If you have not gone here you must go here asap. I mean it!!!  I had gotten a gilt city coupon where you recieved 2 drinks and a sampler of 4 desserts.  The drinks were amazing.  I love sweet stuff and if you love sweet stuff, their drinks will satisfy your sweet tooth and make you want more.  I had a mango champagne drink and they put a scoop of mango sorbet in it.  It stayed nice and fizzy and consistently mangoey.  The desserts we chose were the ice cream sandwich (yum), some lavender almond cake(I'm always a little suspicious of lavender flavored stuff becasue it tastes like perfume to me, but this was fantastic when you had the almonds with it), peanut butter chocolate thing (delish), and a cheesecake with some white chocolate on it (wow!).  The ambience is chill and the staff are very nice. I saw that there were board games in a wall shelf and thought that is brilliant.  Next time I come here I am so going to play a game and take my time to enjoy the food and atmosphere.  The music was just right too.

66ZXDQk_GNlzvyihqx5SJg.review_text: The best part about Candybar is the boardgames! Who can resist a fancy card game or Candyland? Or playing scrabble in real life instead of on your iPhones? Well, at Candybar, you have the option to multitask by letting your inner child flourish, engaging in silly conversations, savoring scrumptious desserts, and lushing on sparkly drinks.   If you're the type who loves pretty food, well, you're in for some eye candy. The desserts look 10x better than it tastes. This place is perfect for food porn photographers. My party ordered the Strawberry Limeade and the Almond-Honey Pina Cotta. The Strawberry Limeade comes in a pretty little jar, and tastes like an ice cream strawberry shortcake that I can whip up in the kitchen in the matter of minutes. The Almond-Honey Pina Cotta may not photograph well due to its white color, but I love the almond creamy flavor of this masterpiece. It's somewhat like the almond tofu pudding at Chinese dessert places, but you get less for your buck.   If you love specialty sparkly drinks, this may sway you to come. I swear sparkling wines are their signature ingredient. And occasionally, soju. The mango tango bellini tastes like an adult ice cream float, but be careful when you stir the drink, it's like an elementary school volcano eruption. The passion fruit bliss cocktail is far better than the mango tango bellini as I enjoyed the fizzy bubbles of it. It's somewhat like apple cider though.   Overall, you won't ever bored here as the ambiance is fun. Although the desserts are average, the cocktails are the added splash of jubilance.   Warning: The parking is terrible in this neighborhood! I was literally circling around for 30mins before I finally gave up and parked on Divisadero and O'Farrell. Furthermore, there's a 2 hr limit on all tables.

3W8a5Fp6s2Bw8O71ckgqpA.review_text: Came here with a Living Social coupon which was good for 2 desserts & 2 cocktails.  I think we got lucky with parking because we circled around the block once and found a space...but I could see how parking in this are could be a challenge, especially on weekends.  We waited for about 10-15 minutes before we got a table.  The host handed us a couple of menus and suggested we look over them to decide what we wanted to order while waiting in line, so that when we sat down, we wouldn't have to wait too long in get our order in.  For our cocktails, we ordered the Passion Fruit Delight and the Strawberry Kiss.  For our desserts, we ordered the Ice Cream Sandwich & Red Velvet Cake.  Both cocktails were great.  A good combo of alcohol and fruitiness.  The Ice Cream Sandwich dessert was awesome! I was pleasantly surprised by how well the flavors meshed together.  Who would have thought that an almond flavored macaroon filled with honeydew ice cream would be such a nice combo?  Certainly not I.  The red velvet cake was way too rich.  The first couple of bites were OK, but after awhile, it seemed to have become more of a chore to eat than anything.  Overall this small dessert bar has charm and personality.  With their unique wall art and tons of games for customer entertainment, I think Candybar is a cute place to visit if one is in the mood for sweets =o)

3r4X8Ty9zIshU8ta5bVoQQ.review_text: Simplistic interior showcasing interesting artwork.  Sophisticated atmosphere with a relaxed attitude.  Friendly and courteous staff with owners that are super chill.  This is not your typical snooty wine bar that sprung up all over the city these days.   I went to Candybar with a couple of friends, we ordered two savory dishes and two desserts.  The savory dishes were good, but let me tell you about the desserts.  The desserts were absolutely DE-LISH!!!!  We ordered Baked Alaska and the Chocolate Brioche, one bite of each, the only words came out of our mouths were mmMMMmm... YUMMM... OOohh...    If Candybar desserts were the first thing that popped in my mind waking up the next morning, it's definitely worthy of 5 stars!!  Can't wait to go back and try other deserts on the menu!!!

B1IQ5YmKz4WSSQXvqzZqNQ.review_text: The dessert bar is a great concept that I'm surprised I don't see more of. Candybar offers a good list of desserts, dessert wines, and even some game boards for you to play.  Candybar isn't that big but it accommodates a good amount of people. There's lounge seating and table seating. We got the lounge seating. It's uncomfortable to say the least. They seem to seat all the groups in this area but since the tables for the lounge is knee high and has limited surface area, you'll be cramming all your drinks and desserts onto one table. My back strained when I tried to reach a far plate. Added to the fact that the dessert plates are incredibly huge, it makes it more inconvenient than elegant. It would've been nice if we had the option to bring the desserts out two at a time rather than all at once.  The dessert list is pretty lengthy. You get a choice of a dozen desserts and a whole page and a half of drinks. I was really thirsty so I just stayed with water. The rest of my friends got dessert wines. Some of them are good while one was over sweet. The better choices come in smaller glasses. Since everything is on the sweet side you'll be wanting to cleanse your palate with water.  We got:  Peanut Butter Jelly Time! chocolate tart, peanut butter cream, salted candied peanuts, blackberries  Lavender Honey Creme Fraiche Semi Freddo almond brittle, nutella powder, cantaloupe  Apple a la Mode hazelnut crust, cream cheese filling, caramel, gingerbread ice cream  Passion Fruit Chocolate Mousse chocolate cake, tuile, passion fruit curd, vanilla bean ice cream  Overall I found the desserts to be fine. This is not a negative or a plus. It's just - fine. If you got these kinds of desserts at a fine dining restaurant you'd be somewhat disappointed. If your business relies on desserts I expect it to be above par. Individual elements in the dishes are tasty but as a whole it just doesn't come together. Instead of oohing and awing you'll be going "What's in my mouth?" The menu sounds better than it actually is.  While some elements can be tasty, it feels like it's all pre-made and taken out of the freezer. This was especially true for the semi freddo. Ours was like a frozen brick. Every dish seemed to have similar texture problems, out of balance flavors, and in general just too much stuff. If Candybar cut their dessert list in half it would put less strain on the kitchen. Then the kitchen could concentrate on creating high quality made to order desserts instead of combining pre-made elements.  The staff was decent but they felt a bit irritated and rushed. Understaffed? I dunno. The addition of games are okay. But since there is hardly enough room to play it can be an inconvenience. I think the tables, dim lighting, and blaring music are all designed to make you want to leave. At one point the music got even louder trying to drive its customers out the door.  ____  Candybar should visit NYC's ChikaLicious dessert bar and learn some lessons. Cut your menu in half, take your time, and focus on a quality experience. Will I be back? Probably not. Not worth the half an hour wait in the cold.

snDjs1hdh7JOWv4jjbXPDw.review_text: Stopped in for a quick dessert after dinner on a Friday night. This place was bumping. We were told the wait was 15 minutes for a table  which, wasn't terrible for our arrival time of 9:30 pm. We luckily grabbed some standing room at the bar and decided just to eat there and not wait for a table. It was really lively in Candybar, I totally could have hung out on one of the many sofas and laid back a few drinks, but it just wasn't that night.  So...............I had and espresso and we split Peanut Butter Jelly Time, on a scale of 1-20 it was a solid 8. I felt the chocolate tart shell thingy could have been better. The brittle nuts and fresh blackberries were a great addition. I'm inclined to return when I have more time and a couple other people to share some fancy diabetic delights with.

k12lMMvXiDIpczWySZVE6Q.review_text: There are board games and tons of girls/women. It's like the place to hang out for single guys looking to find a group of girls on a Friday night.   Drinks here are on the light side with barely any alcohol. If that's the type you like, you'll enjoy this place. I prefer my whiskey and bourbon so I'd have to say this isn't the place for me.   I'm a huge fan of macarons and the ones here, on the ice cream sandwich, don't do it. The cookie part gets frozen and painfully chewy. The ice cream however, is good. The smores was ok but for the price you pay, I'd much rather go to a restaurant and get a full meal out of it.

DTEa4cIRdr6T4jaIw1xubg.review_text: I absolutely adore this place! It's great for an intimate girl's night out. I went here with my boyf one time and he thought it was too girly for him so it's OK, he can stay home lol.   Right when I walked in, I instantly fell in love with their decor. My favorite piece is their huge painting/wallpaper to the left of the entrance. Very cool. They have various board games on the shelf. On both occasions, I ordered the 'lavender creme fraiche semi freddo'. The name sounds long but in short, it's just DIVINE. All the flavors down to every morsel went so well with each other. I love it.  My lovely cocktail of choice here would be the 'Mango Tango Bellini'. It's  sparkling wine, mango syrup with mango-tangerine sorbet. Delicious.   Great little place to check out if you want to get "chocolate wasted!"

s3bY53dDTJomRRusjsRwcA.review_text: Wasn't as impressive as I thought it would be based on the reviews. Desserts were definitely well planned and creative, got a little lost in all the different things going on with each dessert though. Sometimes, for me, more isn't better.  Apple a la mode was amazing. It alone deserves 5 stars but the 3 other things we tried were 2-3 stars. PB&J was meh, way too much going on, defeated the simplicity of good ol PB&J. Red velvet was so wrong. Coconut has no place on red velvet  Ice cream sandwich was pretty good bc the melon ice cream was so light and refreshing , washed away the taste of the yuck red velvet.  Cool atmosphere (wall art is so awesome) , super nice staff.. We went somewhere else for desert after this tho bc we weren't satisfied haha

e6QRXwwzhebaLVX0JEztpg.review_text: I'm a big fan of Candybar for the cozy atmosphere, boardgames, and good desserts.    The desserts are about 3.5 or 4 stars - very good, but still room for improvement.  My favorite is the strawberry limade, followed by the lavender-honey creme fraiche semi freddo and the vanilla bean panna cotta.  They seem to make small tweaks to the menu each time, but there's always a few that stay on there each time.    Although the drinks sound tempting, you'll quickly realize it's just cheap champagne with a number of different fruit syrups, so only 2 stars for the drinks.  The 50/50 is the best drink, but I don't actually think there's much  alcohol in that.    Prices are reasonable, but not cheap, about $8 for most drinks and desserts.  There's street parking available, but you might have to drive around for a bit or resort to parking a few blocks away down Divis.

pZZw7NqDFUxIg0YT0vls8g.review_text: Why didn't anyone think of this concept sooner? Dessert + cocktails = heaven!!!   Honestly, when I first walked into Candybar I thought/said-out-loud "Wow, there's a lot of Asians in here." I was just stating the facts, and at that moment I figured I think before I speak...  ANYWAYS- once we were seated it was a hard choice on what type of dessert to get. Tempted to get the dessert for two so I could try a variety, but the choices they for it had weren't popping out at me. My friend and I split the lavender creme fraiche. It was delicious!! It was light with a mix of unexpected, yet vibrant flavors. Unfortunately I wan't feeling like getting a cocktail but their prices were reasonable and everything looked yummy.   The ambiance was low lighting and candles on the table, board games on the shelf if you were feelin' a little playful and unique murals on the wall. Candybar has the laid back and effortless essence.   The one thing I would recommend, is that Candybar stay open a little later. They close at midnight on Saturdays- and didn't seem like people were quite ready to leave. Maybe 1am would be more accommodating? I'd be there!

yU9VHS_AuXUKbdrzcoDTNg.review_text: I like to have my cake and drink it too. Luckily, with the help of Candybar, I can do just that. This place combines my two favorite things, boozing and sweets. Of course I'm a fan.  I like that this place is incredibly chic. Something, I am not. However, a girl can pretend sometimes, and at Candybar I do just that. Pretend that I am chic, and not a lush that loves Mango Tango Bellini's and making a glutton out of myself with their Japanese Cheesecake.

bV4m22UFyuNYC8vvQUgFwA.review_text: Pro:  Had Blueberry Ice-cream Sandwich before and it was delicious.   Con: Too bad I didn't see it on the menu on Valentines Day.   Pro: Peanut Butter Jelly Time = really good.  Con: But it starts to taste a little heavy after about 4-5 bites in.   Pro: The cheesecake layer in the Apple a La Mode was my favorite part.   Con: The ginger taste in the ice-cream was way too over-powering for the Apple a La Mode dish.   Pro: They were sweet enough to hand all the women a nice long stem of red rose.   Con: You probably won't get their V-day macaroon dessert gift to bring home if you used a Group-On deal or your bill wasn't high enough.   Great atmosphere overall.   Note:  They seem to adjust their menu once in awhile so what you saw a month ago may no longer be on the menu today.

l-7EvDtzaTSyQcXFOIzr4Q.review_text: I really like this place, even if I've only been here once. It's such a beautiful place for happy hour. The owner was very courteous and our lovely server was amazing.   Desserts- ALL of our orders were beyond amazing!!! My friends & I ordered the panna cotta, flourless chocolate cake, Japanese cheesecake, Apple a la mode, and we had one more but I forgot. But all was so good! We had rounds of sangria and champagne before happy hour ended. We enjoyed playing their board games.   Ambiance- loved the art work that surrounds this lounge, very artsy and hip. I also like the seating area, very stylish and comfy.

AiVQEBKsTZmgp81Lfuoceg.review_text: Dessert Bar =  a brilliant idea!!!!!!!  And to make this place even cooler, they have board and card games...   Yep. So picture this: A table with adult guys and girls playing Uno in the dark... lol (distinguishing blue from green was not an easy feat) ... sipping on their delicious champagne drinks ... and eating dessert, yep, dessert at a bar.   Loved every single minute of it.   Just to give you an idea...  Guava Ice Cream....  Oreo, Kit Kat and Snickers Ice Cream...  Mango Ice Cream...  Passion Fruit - Chocolate Mousse...

Zpdh9rHGEHkwJwrsTbHnyA.review_text: don't tell the bf, but the Candybar is my new lover. clean lines, candle-lit skin, wine-soaked lips, and he knows how to use his chocolate.   $14 four-course tasting menu will make you swoon like a good kiss. I've never ever had cheesecake the way I had it here. it was deconstructive, as in, not in cake-like form. it was made with toffee and olives and the flavors filled every centimeter of my mouth. it was artistic, it was out of this world, and it was yummy. with an exotic wine menu, cozy couches, and attentive service, I would visit my lover nightly if I lived in the city.   owner is smart, polite, handsome, and oh-so-sweet. pastry chef(s) made me think french laundry thoughts. and whoever splashed the art on those walls is bold, confident, and romantic. this place, my friends is perfect. try it before others discovery the lover in the Candybar.

INi56PgdBBxz0i_V_-_cGg.review_text: This place is fantastic! I love the warm and welcoming atmosphere. Their wine selection is very good; I once had this orange scented white wine, which was mind blowing. I wish I had remembered the name. The dessert is another highlight. I had this blueberry ice cream sandwich that was tasty but not heavy. Keep in mind that the price tag for this place ain't cheap, but it's not unreasonable either. The last time I came here was for my friend Karin's going away party, and everyone had a wonderful time.  If I remember correctly, they also have board games that you can play.  ~A

Mq8wg-due_2WQApW8GkSvQ.review_text: If you are a hugeee dessert lover & pretty much eat dessert 24/7 like me or jst want to check it out, then this is the place to go!! My friend & I got the Dessert Sampler, which was a great choice  Tiramisu - it was so delicious & moist! Usually i don't like the ones that are overpowered w/ coffee and rum cream,but this was just right.  Flourless Chocolate Banana Torte - my second favorite from the sampler. I don't like pineapple in my desserts,but it really complimented the chocolate & banana ice cream together. Just melts in your mouth  Apple a La Mode - my number one favorite from the sampler. It was so soft & had jst the right amount of sweetness. Taking a bite into the warm apple & gingerbread ice cream together was heaven in my mouth!  Peanut Butter Jelly Time - this was a disappointment unfortunately, esp as a PB&J lover myself. I didn't really taste the PB that much, mainly the blackberry jelly. It might as well have been called Jelly Time instead.  Overall, as a dessert fanatic, I really enjoyed this place & absolutely recommend. The dessert sampler is a must, b/c you get to try 4 delicious unique desserts

IprKHet03baoU8heBOYuwQ.review_text: - The drinks aren't too tasty, but the desserts are yummy! Desserts are nicely presented and the ambiance of the place is perfect for a date night or girl's night.   The tables are a bit too small and cramped... you'll be sitting pretty close to your neighbors. I love the board games (Connect 4 yes!) and is a great way to spend your time while waiting for your dessert.   Parking here is non existent...unless you're super lucky! :(

3WrKkDy-Fm-9rvXoNpIwCQ.review_text: I love this place. We ordered the drunkin' s'mores and the flourless chocolate banana torte. Both were fabulous. My besty had a cocktail with lychee and ginger. Forgot what it was called but it was great! Love the ambiance. The bomb.com was seeing the O'Shaughnessy quote on the wall of the loo. That took the cake for me just when I thought I couldn't love this place even more. ;-)

q2q0mZYs9c-iKU4pat31fQ.review_text: Really I think this place is more around 3 stars.  But I had a great time, and I love the concept.  I mean a place that specializes in dessert and drinks!  OMG.  Those go so well together.    We got the sampler which included 4 desserts; we got apple pie, macaroon ice cream sandwiches, tiramisu, and chocolate banana cake.  Accompanied this with a mango tango bellini.    Tonight I learned that ice cream should be added to all sweets.  They make all of them better.    The apple pie was ridiculously sweet, nearly overpowering.  The tiramisu really didn't taste like tiramisu.  I've made tiramisu before, and I really couldn't taste the marscarpone or the lady fingers here.  The chocolate cake was okay.  The real winner was the macaroon ice cream sandwich.  The ice cream was melon which was so refreshing and the macaroons were great too!

KuwSP3a4hUlo9JUYtCcgmg.review_text: This is a fantastic spot to get some wine, enjoy a board game, eat dessert and relax with the bf.  The dessert is delicious and the wine list is small but yummy!  This is my favorite bar in SF!

xfkV5yqeihsjbjLn1nrpmw.review_text: my girlfriends and I were really excited to go to this place for long time. We finished our dinner early to avoid waiting but we were so disappointed when we got there. The host were kind of rude and told us we have only an hour if we want to stay there. Also the place is not as great as the photos from their website. The place seemed really dirty and just ewww.. We sat for awhile and ended up going to a sake bar across the street which had so much better ambiance. Plus, good luck finding parking. Take taxi if you can.

qysweZ_aRNKNjZEed3pY2A.review_text: Went here on a Saturday night after dinner.  This place had a super cozy and warm atmosphere.  Lots of good lounge seating--good for a group or a couple.  The dessert menu and drink menu were amazing...we got the red velvet cake and this chocolate mousse.  The Red Velvet was amazing!!  So moist and they frosted the entire thing so you got a good ratio of cream cheese frosting to cake :)  Wasn't a fan of the coconut on top tho (wish we had the option to not have that on there).  Chocolate mousse with mango puree was equally delicious.  Would definitely go back.  4 stars since it should stay open past midnite--we totally scrambled to get there before closing but it was worth it!

WcU-h6TC0sXEEyfvFTXQ_w.review_text: Nice atmosphere, cute and artsy. Deserts were delicious, especially carrot cake and strawberry limeade. The flourless chocolate cake and chocolate raspberry brownie was too sweet.  Mango bellini cocktail was good. Strawberry kiss was like plain strawberry soda - not good. Great for GNO, dates, mellow gatherings.

AdmLRFpilAktru8JEWUjvw.review_text: Candybar is a great place for a first date since you can busy yourself with a game to avoid the awkward silences, haha! Or, just to meet up with an old friend since it's not so loud that you can't hear one another. Three stars however because I think I like the idea and ambiance/decor of Candybar rather than the actual food.  They have couches + tables near the front area and chairs + tables at the rear. The paintings on the wall are absolutely gorgeous & the service is great!  We ordered the dessert sampler for two and got the lemon tart (pretty good but I wasn't really a fan of the coconut snow), tiramisu (I've definitely had better), apple a la mode (okay), and the flourless chocolate cake (okay). Nothing was phenomenal which you would naturally expect since you're at a dessert bar. I had the 50/50 which is a mix of soju, orange soda, and vanilla -- it was really good but it definitely will not get you buzzed (maybe if you had 10 it might happen =P).   Overall, I might come back if a friend insisted on checking it out but it's probably not worth the difficult search for parking.

_-KdsCW11_-PDc0Ue4oH8Q.review_text: This place was a nice place to go to hang out with friends or a simple first date.  The drinks were fufu looking and fancy. The place is small and cozy. They have games available to play and entertain yourself with a group of friends if you choose to.  We had an array of deserts and shared amongst ourselves and all were delicious.  They only thing I can say that might be bad is that since it's so small and so busy I think they could use more waiters. I understand our waiter was slammed but I think management should recognize it does affect the service.   This place isn't bad for a low key night.

TVo3uLPvSHeIf500AuZjmw.review_text: My boyfriend took me here for our anniversary on Tuesday. I had told him i  didn't care about a fancy dinner, i just wanted desert. (we had made the change to a healthy lifestyle about 8 months ago, and i was missing my chocolate). He found candybar.  It was quiet, only a few other patrons. we were seated immediately and order cocktails, i got the triple chocolate bellini and he got the 50/50, which tasted like a creamsicle.   we grabbed connect four from the wall and decided to do the 4 for 25 and share. we got the ice cream sandwiches, tiramisu, flourless chocolate cake, and Japanese cheesecake.   everything was wonderful. The ice cream sandwich had blueberry ice cream and cookies that looked like vanilla wafers but were filled with fudge.  The flourless chocolate cake was the best i've ever had. a lot of flourless cakes tend to come out very dense and almost grainy in texture. This one, while still somewhat dense, was creamy and rich. The Japanese cheesecake was light and delicious and went wonderfully with the guava sorbet and honeydew melon that came with it. And the tiramisu was great also.   As far as the reviews that say this place is overrated i think they're just cynical. My cousin was a pastry chef and cake decorator before his passing, and he would have loved this place.   Their deserts are inventive and tasty without being overwhelming. the wine cocktails are just as delicious, and the service was great.  it definitely made our anniversary.

JO9CPEwBjV3UJuIOgs8Zzw.review_text: This is a dessert lounge that has everything! Downside is that they close at midnight, however it's really just to say "get in here before midnight!" My friends and I arrived at 11:30pm and stayed all the way until 1:30am. The workers there don't mind you staying there to chit chat while they clean up around you (but they still filled my glass with water until we left).   We ordered: * strawberry kiss (sparkling wine, gingle ale, frozen strawberry included) * mango sparkling wine cocktail (sparkling wine, mango syrup, nice helping of mango ice cream) --- my favorite. * Japanese style cheesecake (YUM!) * chocolate ganache/raspberry cake (something like that, but it was good)  Next time I think I'll try the Jasmine sparkling wine as well as some of the dishes that are a fusion of entree/dessert during HAPPY HOUR.  All the food and drinks were great and reasonably priced, along with the service! There are boardgames to play as well! This is just like having a Creations Dessert House but more upscale and classy.  Oh yeah, don't worry if you're not 21. They'll still let you in to eat, but not drink.

oXmjz5ZpQdjnKO5TxGC-hw.review_text: Attended the opening night last Saturday at the request of my dear buddy who always has the scoop on the latest and greatest.  We had a table reserved for 10PM courtesy of my friend who knew the owner but by 11:20PM we had not been seated so we left.  On the bartending side, I understand it was the opening but 3 separate pieces of printer paper with the menu (sloshed with wine and crumpled from the heavy usage) didn't exactly leave the best impression with me.  On top of that, it was busy because of the night but the bartender/register were not getting along well apparently, causing supernaturally long waits to order drinks at a bar that only fit 8 people comfortably.  Didn't even both with the food or desserts as it isn't exactly comfortable to hold a wine glass, a fork and a plate while avoiding the hustle and bustle of the busy waitresses.  The interior- well if minimalist was the look they were going for they get an A+.  Personally I felt like I was in a basement.  Bathroom is singular- didn't bother looking inside or trying to go as I didn't want to make unecessary waiting in line a habit that evening.  Others tried to run for the back alleyway for the bushes however were scolded and told to come back in to add to the clusterfock of people inside.  The riesling was exceptionally good considering the rest of the debacle and I would have purchased additional bottles if it didn't take the bartender 30 minutes just to get to my order in the first place.  Clientele was the atypical wine bar crowd...well- and the bum that wandered in for 10 minutes and just smiled at everyone as he paced between the front and back of the establishment.  To say the least, this after hours sweets place left a sour taste in my mouth.  1 star from me overall and collectively with the rest of the people that were there I think would muster an additional 1 star.

NO36epYec7wWtzrgkPRnzw.review_text: i came here with a group of girl friends for my bday and had a great time... the "Strawberry Kiss" is great during happy hour and the apple pie i had was the best! it comes with oatmeal ice cream which was amazing :)   the only downside was that it was super packed with a bunch of people watching us eat & drink while they waited for a table.   all in all a great place, esp a date place!

GrVIegI1gjVevOMgXyoxiw.review_text: Not bad not great. The apple a la mode thing was ok but tasted a bit strange. Chocolate torte was ok but not the best. Strawberry kiss was too sweet and not very good. Not worth coming back since its pretty pricey for meh dessert.

jJpFE3IpkXeZiDkWes8u0g.review_text: Great desserts, great service, super crowded on weekends. We tried to come on Sat nite, and there was a line, so we turned back. We finally tried to come on Thurs evening instead, and got seated right away. The Tiramisu was deliicious, and the Soft Cheesecake was good, but I thought it was too sweet. I would definitely come back and try other stuff. I also tried the Mango Tango cocktails, didn't like it. I guess I'm not a fan of sparkling wine. There was a big group celebrating birthday, so it was extra loud that evening. They provide board games for you to play which I don't think it's such a brilliant idea. I mean, honestly, the place is not really big, so if I were waiting for a table, I would want people to eat their dessert, drink their cocktails, pay the bill, and leave. The way I see it, board games makes people stay longer.
