0mSHHkvQDQfvotATzYF8AA.review_text: this spot is really the best of all worlds...cocktails to relax, decadent desserts for a treat, and board games for some get together fun! the ambiance is trendy romantic. the lights are dimmed, which i feel really lightens the mood. it's an awesome place to hang out and catch up with friends over a few drinks without wondering when the next fight will break out. they've got booths to accommodate big parties, small tables for a cozy date night, and even seats by the bar for some pick up action. a definite sf jewel of a place.

ZMocFA2lNMJeiKjguUKu7g.review_text: "What is this **^?" my friend asks, disappointed because I told her this place had both alcohol and desserts.  "Soju and sparkling wine isn't what I would consider alcohol, I was expecting a full bar," she says, and that's when I knew that I would be picking up the check for dragging her here.  She orders 2 of their specialty drinks, both of which she said tasted like water, and we shared their Candybar Dessert for Two where you can choose 4 desserts. We choose the apple pie, tiramisu, peanut butter jelly tart, and their red velvet cake.  Now, I am a huge fan of both tiramisu and red velvet, and the fact that this Candybar couldn't make a decent tiramisu or red velvet cake astonished me.   I also would like it noted that all the desserts we tried tasted like it had been sitting in the refrigerator for a week.  It tasted like fridge fresh. And when I asked the waiter about it, at least he was honest and said it sits around until it's sold, and that they don't make fresh stock daily and throw away the old stock.  So we got a bunch of old desserts.  Bleh....I kept thinking of washing my mouth out with baking soda when I got home.

N8wsEh3_NTUwm4kNp1pLHA.review_text: If I hadn't read the review from Jack below I would have given  Candybar a firm 5. Instead I am giving a weak 5. But a 5 is a 5- so lucky you, Candybar. ;) Jack R said that the desserts weren't fresh. When i read this to my bf after we had just left here he said "I KNEW IT!" Honestly, I didn't know anything. I thought they were tasted recently made. #unsophisticatedpalette  Regardless I loved this place and here is why: 1. I got my money's worth. In SF, an amazing dessert would be worth more than what desserts here cost. So I actually felt like I was getting a deal, because I thought the desserts were delicious. Especially the s'more one #amazing  2. The cocktails were also very good, but we had to order tea/milk to go with our desserts and didn't end up finishing the cocktails- it was too much sweetness for my recently paleo dieted sweet tooth 3. Also don't let the sampler fool you- they are BIG samples. So it was a bad idea for my bf and me to get the 4 sampler plate and another dessert #fatties 4.Word of advice:  They only have whole milk. If you are lactose intolerant like my bf or questionably lactose intolerant like me....skip the milk- or you will be like my bf farting up a storm at Candybar or like me, go home to serenade your loved ones with some bodily tunes. 5.The atmosphere was great. I beat my boyfriend at Candyland twice and had all my ships sunk in Battleship. 6. Service was great. The waitress was super friendly and gladly accepted my 2 year expired groupon.  7. #comingbacksoon

skbZO4vHHHA-ejA_BUwKjg.review_text: After our Bar Crudo waitress informed us that her restaurant didn't do dessert, she pointed us in the direction of two nearby places that did: Candybar and Chili Pies. Being the fatties--err, foodies--that we are, we hit up both.  Candybar looks like it could be the trendy lounge section of the gold standard of dessert bars, Chikalicious in New York. Instead of bright whites and linen tablecloths, Candybar vibes more bar and less candy: thus, I got the $2 happy hour Pacifico.  That said, the sweets are to be had here. We tried a trio: the Tiramisu, the Peanut Butter & Jelly Time, and the Lavender Honey Creme Fraiche Semi-Freddo. Of the three, the latter was my favorite. All solid, none spectacular would be how I would describe it.  The cocktail menu is interesting, but isn't overly dessert-conscious. It wouldn't be surprising for it to be at a regular laid-back lounge.  That last part is what I like about Candybar most. It doesn't try too hard to be all about the sweets, letting people dig the alcohol and ambiance.  Oh, the free Connect 4 boards didn't hurt either.

Lp25c9Bp1SyiDAVHgoFcyQ.review_text: Dang it! I was just tryin to be the first one to review this place.... but someone beat me to it oh well can't wait to try the desserts. Never heard of the pastry chefs before but well see.....I'll be back to make my real review....

G5LXEaxhQMF_BVjNHkVr7g.review_text: Who doesn't want candy? I had been waiting for months for this place to open, since it just meant my neighborhood was just getting better. I wasn't at first sure of what to make of the concept -- a dessert and wine bar -- but appreciated the idea that people were wiling to take a risk on a concept they believed in.   I'd advise going on an off weeknight, after dinner, or perhaps to rendezvous after work (is there a law against have dessert before supper, I think not). In any case, it's the sort of spot that's best appreciated when not completely overwhelmed with people.   Find a cozy seat, check out your fellow patrons (or mingle with them), and let the staff help you pair up wines with a few dessert selections (or cheese, please!). There's a decadent sophistication to this sort of indulgence, and if you're lucky enough to meet owner Tan Truong later in the evening (especially on a Sunday when they're finishing up bottles opened from the weekend), you are in for a mighty night!   Or so I hear.

-OODneV01sxed0jBUv8XVg.review_text: Yesterday a bunch of us went there for happy hour...it was awesome because Kungfu Taco was parked right in front!  We were able to try out the new craze ( KUNGFU TACO ), drink, and play games!  My two fav champagne drinks at Candybar:  1) Strawberry Kiss 2) Blood Orange ( delicious)  This is a fun spot to hang out at...we were play UNO for 2 hours!  I hate that game now...hahaha  Also try the Nacho dessert...it looks just like Nachos, but it's ice cream!

uH3ERhBOXS0jLmPx4WhQSQ.review_text: So freakin cute inside!  I love dessert and this place really hit the spot.  The drinks were pretty good too (I had the mango tango something).  Def great for girls night out, date night, or just to satisfy your sweet tooth.

TwEPP_nLDMoBW-6eGrmGBA.review_text: I've been here twice and had 2 very different experiences. The first time was on a weeknight and we had a delightful time. We loved the fun but relaxed atmosphere. The red velvet cake was to die for and the infused champagne was just right. It was the perfect way to end a date night.   The second time I tried this place was after the ballet on a Friday night. They were playing 80's music and the average age of the crowd was about 23. Also, I tried the same champagne drink and it was over infused and tasted like Kool-Aid. All the kids were having fun drinking and playing board games and it's nice to know that there are fun places for youngsters to go on a Friday night that are slightly more wholesome that a meat market. However as a 40 year old woman it just wasn't my scene. It lacked elegance and sophistication for me but then again...I'm clearly not their target demographic so it's all good. I would go back on another weeknight but avoid the weekend teenyboppers. I would LOVE to see a similar concept in SF that's designed for people over 30. Some kind of replacement for Citizen Cake for a nice post theater champagne.

AxaAqZ6NbUa2TQoy24o-Mw.review_text: Do fewer things but do them right... what a great thing it is to dedicate your menu to desserts and wine! I'm not much of a drinker so I'll just comment on the desserts. Between myself and my girlfriend we had 3 (this was after dinner). Red Velvet cake was very tasty with the ice cream. The chocolate brownie was delicious with candied walnuts. But it was the peanut butter and jelly tart, with dripping sweet blackberries, that really sealed the deal. What a sweet indulgence!

kax-YTt2VZvG07CiYy3PBQ.review_text: I would say 3 1/2 stars.  Very romantic and sweet ambiance.  Dark inside with candle lighting.  I got to try 2 different desserts, the PBJ time and the strawberry limeade.  The PBJ tasted so weird at first but after a few bites, its prettty good.  The nuts in my opion, should've been crumbled or chopped up.  The strawberry limeade was sweet and sour at the same time.  It was refreshing but I got sick of it quickly.  I thought their desserts in general were decent but I will give them props for originality.  I would probably come back and try completely new desserts but it wouldn't be the first place I'd go to if I were craving.

98jzgVIShOvB2ngHwiNbPA.review_text: Just because this ain't $hit you'd make at home, doesn't mean this place shouldn't occupy a sweet spot in your heart (or stomach, as the case may be).  Went in last night, a Thurs, at 10P and the place was packed.  My friend and I took a spot at the bar and were promptly and warmly greeted.  The bartender (also from -- his words -- the 'Set) gave some great recommendations.  Rather, he helped us narrow it to two fruity sweet and two chocolate sweet.  I'll admit the savory choices did seem a bit exotic, but again, we ordered exactly what we wanted: a well made dessert that was highlighted by some fantastic wine.  Fruity: Vanilla brioche soaked in custard, served alongside candied cherries and feta ice cream.  They put the absolute right amount of each item to make each bite could be perfectly proportionate.  The bartender recommended an ice wine to go with it, which I thought too crisp.  My Rousanne/Viognier blend was perfect in taste and thickness.  Choc: The mille-fuille was divine.  Fine layers of choc with an excellent choc mousse in between.  Served alongside a madeira zabayonne (sp).  I'd do that again a thousand times.  The Priorat he suggested went toe to toe with the madeira flavors while staying grounded in earth - a difficult thing for a dessert wine to do.  Yes, there were more couples per capita than any place I've been in the City in recent history.  But hey, b/w them and the rotating art display, you'll be entertained while our taste buds are taken to a whole other plane.

Hjaqp2_ECttRmVC7lIutwA.review_text: We're huge dessert people. Even came to Candy Bar twice because it would be so up our alley. But after two times of really wanting to like it, I've concluded that this place is a sham. It has all the pretenses of being gourmet, but they mix conflicting ingredients in their desserts. That's why it's so hard to choose something that sounds good. There's always some ingredient that sounds out of place and as soon as the dish arrives and you taste it, you realize your first instinct was right.   The decor is hipster-wannabe and the service... well, let's just say that we were told we could sit anywhere and then asked to move as soon as a larger party arrived. Instead of moving, we just left, annoyed because the waiter started ignoring our requests for the check.   And they don't have a liquor license so all the "cocktails" are with a weak bubbly.

l9bBPvlxmgHragZ7qZ5Dpw.review_text: i love candybar.  i've been coming here since the beginning. and i *still* get excited about making a trip here. the menu changes every so often, meaning you get something new to try each time.   right now they have the apple pie. oh mah gah! the best, most unique apple pie i've ever tried. hands down.  they do red velvet right. i hate when i go to places and they have red-colored white cake and try to disguise it (shame on them!). candybar does no such thing. red velvet + cream cheese frosting = mouthgasms. right now they offer it as a cupcake. get one! or four!  the wine menu is great and the staff offers pairings for your dessert. chris is a genius behind the bar. please try his homemade sangria.  the red is nice but i luurrve the white!  whether you're entertaining  out of town guests, having date night with your boo, or just want a chill place to get yum yum dessert, candybar is the spot!  oh, and ps. they have board games. :)

qVBQucop3Y4NQzxeF0kaLA.review_text: Its actually a nice cozy place in the middle of the city. Yes yes parking is mostly bothersome but it is quite a nice place for getting some tacos (If the taco truck is scheduled to be around) and hang out with your Jenga-loving friends.   Its not a 'drinking pub' or a place you can get hammered so it would look really odd if you come here by yourself looking for company or several shots of tequila. But if you're into sweets and wine spritzers, then by all means this is the place. Its a place for entertaining people.  Desserts were artfully presented, drinks were mostly colorful and lots of board games around.

HCtEYgABFgwGhHB3rPQeQQ.review_text: Don't ask for anything here.  They will tell you the pastry chef does not make any modifications to any desserts. Now I could understand if I was asking for bacon on my dessert, but I simply asked for it to be warmed a little.  The flourless cake I ordered was super cold and would have been a lot better warm.  A slight modification would have had a repeat customer, but I don't think they are in the business of pleasing the guest.  This is certainly not a way to build a business.  I am new in town and was excited to try this place.  I will give them a compliment on their white sangria, but it's too bad I will never get to try it again.

JWi5vzqPsK6I9XAebiGk1w.review_text: I don't get what all the hype is about......For a place that has "dessert, wine, and art" as it's 3 objectives I don't see any representation of that.  We got a couple cocktails and I distinctly remember the apple a la mode was plain and boring. Candy bar is soooo small too....on their site it says they have a candlelit lounge & dining room, but where is it? Cuz I failed to notice the last time I was there. Sorry, not trying to be mean, but SF has plenty of cute little dessert places and this one doesn't qualify to be one of them......No one really plays boardgames anymore either....we can just do that in the comfort of our own home.

X48inrgUfxrC2jBZQ6o7RA.review_text: First off, parking can get a bit difficult around the late nights and/or weekends. Other than that, I cannot find a single thing that was wrong with the place or my experience here.   The place is small, and it can get crowded, but I have never waited longer than 15 minutes for a table. The staff here are very friendly. If you have any problems, questions, concerns, need long descriptions of the menu--they will sit it out and make sure you understand everything. They also provide board games and decks of cards for anyone that wants to have some relaxing fun.   The food/drinks are artfully made, and taste amazing. Here's my mini-list of reviews:  Japanese Cheesecake (graham cracker streusel, honeydew, champagne granita, guava sorbet) - Although I feel that this is more of a lighter dessert, the combination of everything together in your mouth is perfect. Tastes more fruity and like a custard than cheesecake.   Peanut Butter Jelly Time! (chocolate tart, peanut butter cream, salted candied peanuts, blackberries) - 3 WORDS: OH MY GOSH. This is a favorite. I have gone back multiple times just to get this one. It's definitely a little bit heavier and more chocolatey than the other desserts, but still not overdone. If you like peanut butter jelly sandwiches and have a craving for chocolate, get this.  Mango Tango Bellini (sparkling wine, mango syrup, mango-tangerine sorbet) - great flavor, perfect temperature, and tastes like mango sweet wine with a hint of citrus  Triple Chocolate Bellini (sparkling wine, chocolate syrup, chocolate sorbet) - chocolate heaven in your mouth. Very similar to the mango tango, except skip the fruit and replace with chocolate (not dark). Haha, such a generic description, but there's no other way to explain it.  50/50 (soju, orange soda, vanilla) - This tastes like a delicious orange creamsicle!  I've also had one other dessert there, but I can't seem to find it on the menu at the moment =\ Sorry! Anyways, I highly recommend this place if you've got a taste for something sweet. You won't regret it! :)

OTnxL8eHzXWJ5FWqi8S2Hw.review_text: I went here last night with a good friend and enjoyed my experience. I had the apple a la mode and two cocktails (strawberry bliss and a mango drink). The atmosphere was really cool and they had board games for customers to play and I also saw a group grab a deck of cards.   The customer service was awesome. My friend was able to get a special order of cookies and ice cream, which she really appreciated. The only reason I am giving the place 4 stars is because I didn't completely enjoy my apple pie dessert. The apples were really chewy and tart and didn't complement the meal and there were too many nuts in the dessert, but that is really just a personal preference.

xqg8EihBjem6EFYtdKoBjQ.review_text: I want to live here.  We made reservations, but ended up arriving earlier than we thought we would - though we were 30 minutes early, and we were more than willing to wait at the bar, they seated us right away, and couldn't have been nicer about it.  We went for the tasting menu, and it was divine.  Every single thing we tried was amazing, but it was the Carrot Cake Baked Alaska that intrigued us the most -that, and the toffee that was made of matzo!  We also had a Bellini, and it was the perfect drink to wash down the sugary desserts, and so refreshing on a remarkably warm SF night (!).  Wonderful food, great drinks, and a really friendly staff!  I took one star off, because they took a while to get us our check, and a couple of the garnishes (picked mango?) were a bit...strange (more strange than carrot cake baked alaska!.).

zQxDUhxKOHdZygnNRZ-4ng.review_text: Loved the service here but had to knock it down one for the cramped space. everything was really nice, going to try reservation next time. LOVE it!

ypm9IB9iZkwY71FKkYeLkg.review_text: Price: less than $10 for most desserts and cocktails. Space: ideal for groups of 6, but can accomodate up to 10.  Our group of 10 girls came at 10pm on a Saturday night and waited about 30 minutes to get seated.  Like I said above, it's ideal for smaller groups because the space isn't that big, but luckily for us a group in the corner left and we were able to all squeeze into that spot (albeit tightly).  I sampled the... - Macaron ice cream sandwich - Tiramisu - Apple a la mode  We assumed that the desserts would be overpriced with undersized portions, but we were wrong!  if you order their a la carte desserts you'll get a macaron ice cream sandwich the size of your fist.  The tiramisu and apple a la mode are generously portioned too!    As for me - my friend and I shared the dessert platter (4 desserts of your choice shared between 2 ppl for $25).  We got the macaron ice cream sandwich, peanut butter jelly time, japanese cheesecake, and lavender honey creme fraiche semi freddo.  Though everything is about half the size as the a la carte stuff, it was more than enough for the both of us.  Beware though, if anyone else in your party even takes one bite of your platter you will be fined $10!!!!  That's what happened to us, but luckily we were able to argue our way out of it.  We basically said everyone in our party ordered something, so it's not fair to charge us when they only had one bite of barely anything left over after the 2 of us stuffed our faces full.  Anyway, back to the desserts - most of them were unmemorable and the experience of fighting the bill left a sour taste in my mouth.  My favorite was the macaron even though i couldn't taste the blueberry flavor in the ice cream.  I also highly recommend the apple a la mode and japanese cheesecake (bc of the guava ice cream)!  The PB jelly one was too strong, dense, and sweet.  The lavender honey tasted like soap.  I guess I'm glad I got to experience this place, but it just didn't do it for me.

sPqHcRC--tRanPC-g4pNwQ.review_text: Boys and girls, let me take you on a trip to Candybar, a place very similar to the wonderful world of Willy Wonka's Chocolate Factory. It has just been announced to the general public that a handful of Golden Tickets have been hidden amidst a vast variety of drinks and desserts. The only way to come by these tickets is by consuming a dastardly amount of liquid and/or solid sweets in a swanky, dimly-lit, cozy venue that is perfect for a girl's night out or a date. Now, what makes these tickets so special is that they grant the lucky recipients a highly coveted, all-expenses-paid visit to... A diabetes clinic. BOOM--pessimism served. Only because I already drank more than half my drank hehe. Candybar is the perfect concept for someone with my propensity for all things sweet: simple cocktails (though I'm becoming a creative cocktail fangirl) and simple desserts at simple prices. And for those who want simpler prices, they offer a happy hour from 6-8 PM every day in which a few of their sparkling cocktails are slashed down to $4. My girl and I came here on a Wednesday evening to find that only one other couple was in our way of completely dominating the entire venue with our chatter. Plus, our waiter was the antithesis of chatty, especially when I asked him if he had any recommendations. If you don't like cocktails or non-fruit-flavored desserts...why do you choose to work here? For our desserts, we got the $10 DRUNKEN S'MORES with salted caramel, chocolate, graham cracker tart, marshmallow, topped with Bailey's chocolate sauce (yelp.com/biz_photos/cand…). Apparently, it's popular. Apparently, it didn't sit right with my taste buds. The chocolate filling tasted burnt, though my friend thought it could be because of the Bailey's sauce. I will give some mad creds for the marshmallow. But I wouldn't recommend the dessert. We both preferred the $9 gluten-free LAVENDER HONEY CREME FRAICHE SEMIFREDDO with nutella powder, almond brittle, and cantaloupe pieces (yelp.com/biz_photos/cand…). I am a sucker for sugary nuts (HAHAHA okay I couldn't help but laugh at my own line), even more so for glazed nuts (AUGH THE IMAGERY AHAHAA), and my friend adored the lavender honey flavor of the creamy ice cream. The portion was generous but did have a few huge icy parts. Also, the cantaloupe wasn't ripe. Crud. Onto the dranks. We ordered 4 total: the PASSION FRUIT DELIGHT (sparkling wine and passion fruit puree; $7 or $4 HH), the BLOOD ORANGE COCKTAIL (sparkling wine, blood orange bitters, and sugar cube; $7 or $4 HH), the LYCHEE GUAVA MARTINI (soju, lychee juice, and guava nectar; $8), and the 50/50 (soju, orange, cream, vanilla; $8). The first two bubbly-based drinks were both light and delicious. As for the soju-based drinks, the lychee guava did a horribad job of masking the soju's alcohol tones. On the other hand, the 50/50 tasted like a creamsicle, and the sugar made it lighter and more delicious. I think I still have yet to develop my appreciation for soju (and sake, actually), but I preferred the bubbly over the soju for sure. Desserts menu: yelp.com/biz_photos/cand… Specialty cocktails menu: yelp.com/biz_photos/cand… Bubbles & wine menu: yelp.com/biz_photos/cand… Beer, soft drinks, & HH menu: yelp.com/biz_photos/cand… Candybar is a great concept, but the offerings didn't quite match my expectations of a place that specializes in drinks and desserts. Plus, if something is going to be my ticket to a diabetes clinic, it'll be a cocktail bar, hollllaaaaaa.

KFaUuuvfw-6rAbTzuYwU0g.review_text: CC: This place is overpriced and parking sucks  S: RY 22 yo M w/ hx of yelping and enjoying food presents to Candybar w/ friends via Groupon (from K-Wei thanks!) experiencing a wait time of 30 mins before being seated in a artsy dim environment. Upon arrival RY complains of HA 2/2 to difficulty parking which spontaneously resolved. When finally seated pt and friends ordered the Japanese Cheesecake, Honey Creme Fraiche Semi Freddo, Tiramisu, and the Flourless Chocolate Cake. The group also ordered the pineapple vanilla bean soju shot, blueberry pomegranate fushion cocktail, Mango tango belleni, and some other drinks that RY could not recall. There were board games that the group enjoyed playing but somewhat hard to see due to lack of lighting. Lots of Michael Jackson songs in the background and service was subpar. RY is here for f/u review.  O: Vitals: WNL RBG: 200 ROS: GI: + hunger   A/P: RY 22 yo M w/ hx of yelping is disappointed in Candybar and here for f/u review.  1) Japanese Cheesecake: good presentation but very bland tasting and not smooth. Had some sorbet and fruit on the side but otherwise unremarkable. - Will d/c and will not rechallenge due to quality inferiority and price  2) Honey Creme Fraiche Semi Freddo: probably the best dessert of the 4 and tasted like ice cream with fruits. A bit savory and messy. - Possible recommendation to others as dessert of choice  3) Tiramisu: Biggest disappointment of them all. Was quite bland, not much flavor on top of 1cm thick milk/dark chocolate layer. -  Not a candidate for rechallenge. Recommend the tiramisu at Schuberts bakery instead as a cannot be substituted.  4) Flourless Chocolate Cake: tasted like a very rich lava cake topped with white chocolate pieces and sorbet on the side.  Unimpressed and probably the most simple and plain of the 4 desserts. -  d/c as current condition of cake no longer warrants continuation of therapy.   5) EtOH drinks: All were somewhat colorful and presentation was pleasant to eyes but very weak in terms of EtOH content. Mango Tango was the best tasting of the 5 ordered. No immediate signs of asian glow were observed. - Will monitor for s/s of intoxication but probably ok to drive and will not need DD  Bill came to be $85 for the 6 of us despite the groupon coupon. Will order a wallet scan evaluating hole created. Recommendation to avoid this place in the future as desserts although were artsy in presentation does not justify the cost and make up for taste.

r-8eQ28RhnQPJdZXHcTXrw.review_text: I like the idea.  The execution needs work.  I wasn't blown away by any dessert or cocktail and I think they should go for a sleeker look.  When I went to Extraordinary Desserts in San Diego, I immediately thought, "THIS is what Candybar should be doing."

SwJ4JPZux-SSS6jmMD4hwg.review_text: THEY HAVE BOARDGAMES! Board games are my thing, I absolutely love them. Catchphrase and apples to apples in particular. This place has both; as well as alcohol and desserts. Really they can't go wrong. They have the balance of casual and fancypants down to a science.  I got the Peanut Butter and Jelly Time while my friend opted for the carrot cake. We loved both of them to crumbs. Great prices and decent portions.

jipgimnSNp3qdK2dKUQvBg.review_text: I've had Candybar bookmarked for the longest time, but never got to check it out.  When I found out my Yelp buddy/college classmate, Kimmie Q. was celebrating her b-day here last night, I knew I had to go since I've been so intrigued after reading all of the Yelps.  Parking...was kinda sucky, but we got lucky about a block away.  Love the decor, yet you can still dress very casual, after all, a handful of people were sporting the orange & black, especially since the Giant's clinched the division win a couple hours prior.  We were feeling the music playing, though a lot of it was MJ.  Though we were seated by the door, which was open, the place got kind of warm.  We ordered: *Mango Tango Bellini ($8): Sparkling wine with mango syrup and mango tangerine sorbet.  Sweet but not overly sweet, and very refreshing.  I could sip on a couple of these all night. The waitress recommended this when I told her I was thinking about ordering the Strawberry Kiss and how I like sweet drinks.  She didn't steer me wrong.   *50/50 ($8): This was his drink.  Soju with Orange soda & vanilla.  It didn't look very appealing when it came out, but tastes really good like an Orange Creamsicle!  It kind of sucks though that you could not taste any soju at all, which made us wonder how much was in there! *Passion Fruit Chocolate Mousse ($10): Chocolate cake with passion fruit curd & vanilla ice cream.  Rich, but not overly insanely chocolatey and it was light enough.  The passion fruit and chocolate worked very well together.  Glad we chose this dessert, it was one of the best desserts I've had in awhile.    Though their drinks are delish, if you're not in a mood for drinks, you can also come to this late night spot for some unique desserts.  No more having to just settle for desserts at an HK cafe (though Candybar closes at 12).  This is a cute intimate place to go with a small group of friends for some laid back fun or with the bf for a date night.  I hope to come back with the bf for one of those date nights or happy hour!

wpI3AQvA5kxp-moP46m8NA.review_text: The moment I walked into Candybar I felt like I was in NYC.  The place has a very cool vibe and wonderful urban/ modern feel, but without any sort of pretentiousness.  Their menu didn't have too many  choices (which I always think is a good idea)...keep it simple people, keep it simple.  We ordered  the chocolate parfait.  And although the waiter warned us it was small, it was definitely plenty for two people.  Very rich but very good.  My only complaint would be that there is no wine pairing with the desserts.  We asked the waiter to suggest something to go with that particular dessert.  He seemed completely taken back from the question and slightly confused.  Now, that is fine.  But you would think at a place where they are specializing in wines and desserts that the staff  would have a better handle on pairing.  The port I ordered was not very good and in my opinion did not go well with the chocolate parfait.  Now, the menu does give you some indication on sweet and savory foods and wines.  But I honestly think it would be better if next to each dessert they would suggest a wine to go with it, like some restaurants do....just my opinion people.  Anyway, I will go back to Candybar.  And I would suggest it as a great place for a date, a great alternative to a birthday dinner with friends, and just a nice place to get your sweet-on :).

1YDFpQ2hhzDc3I1xZY-Djw.review_text: 1)  BOARD GAMES:  Love the fact that they have board games.  I think the waitress was pretty awed how we started off with a round of drinks and then started to play two hours of board games.  We played Apples to Apples and another game that made 2 hours go by really fast.    2)  VENUE: Low lighting and romantic.  :)  This place definitely caters to couples, women and groups that want to eat desserts while having a little fun with board games.   3)  DESSERT (3/5):  We tried the PBJ Time!, Lavender Honey Creme Fraiche Semi Freddo and Big Francesco's Tiramisu.  My favorite was the Lavender Honey Creme Fraiche because it was like eating lavender ice cream.  The flavor was pretty strong, so you have to like lavender to enjoy this dessert.  It had powdered nutella (uh.. that's a WIN right there), peanut brittle and diced pieces of cantaloupe.  The PBJ Time was pretty good, but I wasn't used to the PBJ + tart blackberry/raspberry syrup.  The Tiramisu was pretty good as well-- really soft and fluffy.  This tiramisu was subtle and not too heavy on the on the expresso powder.  I think other French patisseries have better tiramisu... maybe even the Steps of Rome has better tiramisu if you're into a stronger tiramisu flavor.   4)  HAPPY HOUR & DRINKS:  From 6-8 pm, it's happy hour time!  On selected drinks, the deal includes $3 sangria and $4 cocktails.  I ordered a drink off the menu (Mango Tango Belleni) and it was delicious!  It was a little strong, but I drank everything because that scoop of mango gelato made the drink super yummy and not too sweet.

y34uvpsfOf3D_O4CtBm6vg.review_text: I really wanted to like this place since novelty bars are kind of my thing sometimes and it's in the neighborhood. Let me reiterate: I *really* *tried*, but no amount of trying on my part can make-up for the short-falls of this place.   First of all, the 200-watt lighting. Not exactly what I look for in a bar whose aim is to be a relaxing, loungy atmosphere. The seating is just terrible. So uncomfortable and not loungy at all. The staff is obviously not having it because of the early-close license they have - they can't make as much money as they aim to, and this is exactly the attitude the staff projects. I sympathize, but I hear enough about civic issues in my daytime life. I don't want to hear about it when I'm relaxing on a Friday night.   The food falls drastically short of my expectations as well. Small portions, inconsistent flavor themes... they would definitely be in the bottom 2 of my quickfire challenge. The beverages are priced for a much more comfortable atmosphere - you know what I mean? I'd be a much better sport about paying those prices if I could at least consume my drink comfortably. And I echo the yelper who said something about their mark-up which goes above and beyond anything expected at a trendy bar.   Anyway, with a license that makes them close your doors at midnight on the weekend, they would be much better off if they were more restaurant-oriented.

l-zgWG-brcQ4iRev-pfrsg.review_text: Maybe I've matured.  Places like this used to have such allure.  Cocktails, desserts, dark mood lighting, hot red booth seating, and Connect Four!  This time around, the decor just made me sleepy and there was something crass, superficial, and uninspired about the desserts.  Red velvet cake overwhelming topped with coconut shavings was admittedly enjoyable, but screamed I am sooo bad for you!.  Peanut butter tart + blackberries was like eating a glorified PB&J.  Maybe I'm just grouchy with age.

GBj7DyTur3A0fL3CH-QGmw.review_text: I went to CandyBar a few days ago with my sisters and her fiancee. I bought a Living Social deal for this place a while back. I really like the concept of having a restaurant that serves solely desserts and cocktails. Having board games to play with friends is definitely a plus!  We ordered a Strawberry Limeade, Lavender Honey Creme Fraiche Semi Freddo, a Strawberry Kiss (Cocktail) and the CandyBar Lemon Drop Shot (also a cocktail). The desserts, in the way that it's presented, looks pretty. However, I was very disappointed with how it tasted. The strawberries on the Strawberry limeade tasted too artificially sweet. The Lavender Honey Creme Fraiche Semi Freddo was OK, but not memorable. The Lemon Drop Shot cocktail was OK, but for the Strawberry Kiss cocktail I tasted more champagne and I couldn't taste anything that's like strawberries.  I definitely appreciate that they try to be very creative when they create these desserts, but I wouldn't pay $10 for desserts that taste mediocre.

PEp5ytDnZ34r4KQuab-aog.review_text: The one word review:  "Oops"  Wait staff Did someone die?  Or is it just the depressing atmosphere?  From the door guy to the waitress, you would think something tragic happened.  Maybe it's just a foreshadowing for the future of this place... who knows.  Atmosphere As touched on above... someone shot for "hip and cool" and ended up looking the fool.  Dessert WAY overpriced for the tiny ass amounts.  The quality of the ingredients seemed fine, and the preparation was fine, but in trying to be inventive, they only manage "Yeah, you could do that, but it doesn't necessarily make it a good idea."    It's a dessert place... I HAD to try it... now I regret it.  Shit.  One star for trying to do a nice dessert place and another star for a good name.  Someone, please help these people fix this heap.

yEzkG-SwFI5B4JsDkVeuFg.review_text: I wish they had a larger drink selection but the deserts are to die for. I've been here like 4 times and live locally. It's a great place to take a friend out for some sweet bites and awesome board games. They have apples to apples!

SSWd1X8uOIqR5aw9K_rCoA.review_text: candybar's awesome. i went there with some friends and had a great night. the decor was sleek, the service was attentive, and the food was awesome. they just hired two new executive chefs that even came out and said hi to my table, none of the pretension of a lot of other places in this city; just a really chill place to hang out with friends. prices were definitely fair, too. the menu changes every month to include seasonal flavors; i'll definitely be back next month to check it out!

sOs3m1rsqQvUXIKUXyz29Q.review_text: One star for the idea to open a dessert + wine place like this.   One star for the ambiance/atmosphere. Love the wall with difference sizes of Koi. There are difference games available as well. No crazy people.   One star for the quality of desserts. Tried 5 of the desserts including the ice cream sandwich, but the taste didn't live up with the presentation.

zkcUyw1n7zRxr_aaWxXv2w.review_text: Parking can be a real pain, but once you're in,  you'll enjoy yourself!  If you want to bring a date, it can be romantic and cozy but not too stuffy, or you can just go with a group of friends for an after-dinner drink/dessert.   Their sangria is yummy, or if you want something non-alcoholic, their lattes are great too (though the bartender loathes me for ordering them).  Sorry Chris!    As for the desserts, they change their menu regularly.  I think their old dessert chef is back, so the stuff is more "normal" now (the desserts were starting to get a little too bizarre for me for a bit!).  The ambiance is comfortable, and if you get bored, you can always play a game!  If you go on a weekend and see a group playing an intense neverending game of Uno, it's probably just me and my friends.

m2SCGRZb3YtDb49XiLIDLw.review_text: This is my type of place! Sugar, booze, and games! Couldn't get any better. Candybar was the perfect spot to go on a Saturday night out in the city. A lovely friend of mine recommended to double date here and we had a blast. The atmosphere is cozy, candlelight tables, laid-back seats while they play your top classic hip-hop songs. I think they had jazz music right at the start too, very nice!  Menu- Most desserts run about $6-11 which isn't too bad, and that night my friend and I ordered a cinnamon almond torte. I'm usually not a big fan of cinnamon but this just melts right in your mouth. YUM. To top that off, I ordered the peach Bellini cocktail and that was superb.  Ok the best part of the place aside from your dessert and mix-drinks fix...they have a great selection of boardgames where you can literally spend the whole night playing. Monopoly, Connect 4, Game of Life, Clue, and the list goes on and on. All the games are situated right in the middle of the lounge area, and no need to sign in or anything. You see something you like, grab it, bring it back to your seats, and enjoy! We ended up playing Battleship for hours! Indeed, brought back my childhood memories.   Because this place is located in the heart of Hayes Valley, parking is well.....impossible. We looked around literally for 30 minutes almost wanting to just nix the plan and go somewhere else, but w/ persistence, finally got a spot. So with that in mind, have patience!   So if you're like me, this place is a must see. It's a great "after spot" for those that are tired of the bar/club scene and just want to relax, drink, and have fun!

hOeJFQl-iY5Pey54LpDdVA.review_text: reunion with the girls: el, sc, jk  the good - website is visually appealing, simple yet not boring, BUT the menu is not always up to date. at least there is a menu. - strawberry limeade had a great balance of sweet from the cream and tart from the strawberries and lime. the cream is too sweet for me on its own. the presentation was clean and simple with the jar, yet thoughtful. i would like to have had more cake.   the neutral  - the wait was reasonable  - white chocolate lemon (i think) had the same presentation in a transparent jar like the strawberry limeade so you can see the layers. this one was sweet and salty, but it wasn't as well balanced. there were chunks of what seems to be graham cracker-tasting substance which had salt unevenly distributed. fresh blueberries gave it a different texture.     the bad - apple al a mode was my least favorite of the three. i couldn't taste the hazelnut in the crust. the caramel had the taste of the medicinal-flavored ice cream on there so that was not good.   the nasty  - one of the workers there smelled pretty bad as in it greatly affected my dining experience. it didn't help that he/she was walking all over the place trailing the stench.   - the bathroom was atrocious. like portal-potty atrocious. the toilet seat cover was half in the toilet yet still sticking up past the height of the toilet seat. it was dark too, so i didn't want to step past the door and find out what else was there. i decided not to use it and just had the transitional tissue stretch a bit. people who weren't customers walked right in to use the bathroom too.  - the apple al a mode had some horrific gingerbread ice cream. there was no gingerbread flavor. there was the taste of cinnamon without the sugar. tasted quite medicinal.

ddNrziPGmcmmW_J8c0rKQQ.review_text: went here on a saturday night, and luckily got reservations for the 10 of us.  nice decor, comfortable lighting.  wine list kinda sucked. a few of us wanted some sweeter wines, but all they had for the sweet wines were dessert wines which came in these tiny as heck port glasses. c'mon...... for desserts, the al a carte only had a minimal choice, so we opted for the prix-fixe which came with a starter of strawberry juice with mint gelee. kinda sweet for me, but my buddies seemed to like it. my friend told me to order the baked alaska carrot cake, but to our disappointment, they 86ed it that night already.  my two faves were the chevre cheesecake and the fourme d'ambert panna cotta. yumm-o. they were both excellent. the cheese in the panna cotta was pretty strong, but that's why I loved it. was sooooo good.  could've done without the vanilla cake and chocolate parfait. the vanilla cake had a weird consistency, like it hasn't finished baking all the way and the chocolate parfait was way too sweet, nothing special. the last course was malted milk and cookie. that was pretty nice.   will i come back?  kinda hard to if i've got no drink to go with my dessert.  p.s. they've got a japanese beer that came along with the cutest bottle, (kinda taste like Hoegaarden, clean flavor) but that's not enough for an extra star. sorry.......

yEZBh8TdAzgTsjrjQbZ0fQ.review_text: On a cold and rainy night, I took my sweetheart on a surprise date here to celebrate his return after being gone for weeks. He was surprised and touched that I would pick such a fun and romantic place. We had awesome desserts, and even more awesome cocktails. We played several rounds of games (we played until I won actually :) This place is so much fun, my fiance said I was even sweeter than the desserts (if you can imagine that..) and needless to say, it set the stage for a sensual night....

S0Pji5ZPQwlolC7vlq1lug.review_text: I had gotten a LivingSocial deal for Candybar a while back and noticed that it was going to expire next week, so A and I headed over there yesterday to take advantage of the deal.  First of all, it's nearly impossible to find parking in this neighborhood.  Luckily for us, we only had to circle a couple of times before we found a prime parking spot only about a block and a half away.  It's a small, dimly lit spot and doesn't fit too many people inside.  There are tables for smaller groups in the back area and two areas up front for larger groups.  There's also space to sit at the bar in the front.  We got there around 6:45PM on a Saturday and there were a couple tables in the back occupied and a party getting started in the front.  We were greeted and seated immediately.  I like the spot.  The art on the walls are really cool and interesting.  You can definitely have quite a few conversations about the art themselves.  They also have a shelf separating the front and back areas that are filled with different board games.  We were going to play Battleship, but someone else got to it first.  Darn.  As for desserts, I ordered the ice cream sandwich which consisted of a green tea Parisian macaron, blueberries, and brown rice tea ice cream.  I, of course, had to order this because I {heart} macarons!  I was hesitant about brown rice tea ice cream, but it was actually really good.  Very light and refreshing.  A ordered the Chocolate Financier Cake which consisted of frozen Bavarian cream, cranberry sauce, almonds, and breton crumble.  We decided the frozen Bavarian cream tasted like frozen cheesecake.  It was a little hard to cut into that with our spoons.    We also decided to get some drinks.  A got the Mango Tango Bellini which had sparkling wine, mango syrup, and mango-tangerine sorbet.  It was odd having a lump of sorbet in a drink.  It was good, but I liked mine better.  I got the Candybar Lemon Drop Shot which had soju and frozen lemonade sorbet.  Again, kind of weird having a lump of sorbet in a drink, but it was really good and refreshing.  I'd order that again.  To sum it up, very trendy kind of place to go for desserts.  Go early because parking sucks and you don't want to wait for a seat.  Note: The menu says there's a 2 hour limit at your table if there are a lot of people waiting to be seated.

xtZMctl7AQNspIL_SF3guA.review_text: Candybar is my favorite new entrant to the continuing wine bar trend in San Francisco. I like that they are taking a slightly different approach by focusing on dessert wines (and yummy desserts). There's also a great by-the-glass list for standard white & reds, and the seating layout allows for a nice mix of larger groups and couples. Great location in the ever-changing "NOPA" neighborhood; perfect compliment to other gems like Bar821 and Little Star.

VcPj1gchy48KWnMk4kMI-A.review_text: i so want to like this place.  i'm even coming back one day for the tacos.  with that said, not overly impressed with the desserts.    i had the Japanese cheesecake...the Guava sorbet was tasty...the cheesecake....hmmm.  i'm part Japanese, and i'd probably be the first to admit that maybe it was an error on my part to order a Japanese cheesecake, as it likely is not endemic to Japan...but still...some flavor, please?  or did i miss something and Japanese cheesecake isn't supposed to have flavor?  the carrot cake was okay...a little dry.  the strawberry mousse was good though.  presentation of the desserts was great.  the vibe there is pretty cool too...i like the board games and i really like the art on the wall (not sure if they rotate or what).  i will come back again (kinda have to..i have this Groupon that i bought that i forgot to bring that evening)...maybe it was just an off night....

Q94ftNvQY9PgHc4rNf8-rA.review_text: $3 glass of happy hour champagne. And it's decent champagne, too.

Ymt69MmO5aB45a9hkuoA9Q.review_text: This place definitely has a nice dark, romantic, intimate ambiance. I love that they have a shelf full of board games for people to play with. The service was great.  I came here with a couple of girlfriends to catch up. I tried their Lavender Honey Creme Fraiche  Semi Freddo. Their portions are pretty small, but I guess it's meant to be an after-dinner type of dessert, which is pretty understandable.  Onto the dessert, the actual Lavender Honey was an ice cream cake and was delicious! To me, I feel like Lavender can get a bit overbearing, but this was just right. It wasn't too sweet or too lavendery, and was quite enjoyable to eat. It's topped with almond brittle which I didn't care too much for. I actually had a hard time eating it because I felt it was kind of tough. I had a taste of each of my friends desserts, and those were delicious as well. I will definitely make another visit :)  Oh, almost forgot. For those of you that HATE looking for parking... this place has terrible parking. It is in the busy areas of SF so it's pretty understandable, but just a heads up.

Er2yi-WarNgZL2pG7a4MlQ.review_text: Terrible service. Sat there for half an hour watching the waitress be super attentive to everyone else but my husband and I. Cocktails were gross and desserts tasted like frozen deserts. FAIL

AYPeuEr4esJ8FvoPipLEMQ.review_text: this place is probably the WORST service i have ever had in san francisco. i went on a crowded saturday night with a group of ten girls but we called ahead so we were seated right away. we were planning on getting a lot of drinks and sharing a few desserts and super excited to try this place out. we all ordered drinks and they came sporatically instead of all at once. the first one came after around 13 minutes, the next were after about 18 minutes and the rest were never brought. we reminded the server and then the dessert came, still with only about less than half of us had drinks. most of us ordered beers, which takes usually at most 2 minutes...we then received our bill and drinks that we ordered but never received were on the bill...then...we tried to split the bill and the server told us we could not use more than 3 credit cards to split the bill....we all worked in f&b and in fact had the same operating system as the restaurant (micros) and knew it was very easy to split the check multiple ways. the tip was also added when we would have left none...do not go here, especially on a saturday

TS1743yx60gkKZKumGgCsg.review_text: When I was younger, my family and I used to have a game night once a week. We'd bust out Monopoly, LIFE, checkers...pretty much whatever we had lying around the house. It'd be so much fun until my brother (or SOMETIMES myself) would get really upset because we were losing and we'd refuse to continue the game.  At Candybar, I'm sure there are lots of people who are sore losers too, but the difference is that there is alcohol and desserts to soothe things over! ;D  It's a really cool place, decor-wise. There's this amazing painting of  koi fishies...in pink clouds! The lighting is dim, but I'm sure it's a popular place for couples and dates.  I came here for a friend's birthday and had a blast! Admittedly, there aren't a lot of tables for big parties, so it was a little cozy, but whatever. It doesn't matter much when there's delicious dessert to eat! We played CandyLand and pretty much ordered everything on the menu because there were enough of us! :)  One of my favorite desserts was the peanut butter jelly time (very peanut butter-y!), the cupcakes, and the sampler plate! HMmmm! :) I feel like everything is definitely better shared, so you don't overdo it.  I would love to come back here and get my sugar fix!

OsFnM3mr5KfElBvDFNCdMA.review_text: 1 star for the board games  1 star for the yummy drinks  1 star for the desserts  1 star for the ambiance and overall experience, start to finish  great ending for a heavy day of work!  I came here after work, and night classes to meet up with friends.  Delicious selection and unique spot! Wish there were more choices for desserts (or more decadent...the chocolate cake was dry and uninspiring.  Other then that, the desserts were yum

x90Mj02E5AK6v-2dda_9cA.review_text: Really a 4.5.  After dining out but not calling it a night we heading over to Candybar.  Worked out to be a great idea, great lounge spot.  Our host set us up with 4 great desserts.  Tastes and Presentations were amazing.  Ended up pulling out one of their board games, 80s Trivia...classic:  Name Kristie Alley's characters full name on Cheers, what was Rick Astley one hit wonder?  oh how the 80s entertained us, but so did CANDYBAR.  Definitely a fun, chill spot.  Missed out on some of the wines and cocktails but would head back to try them next time.  Happy Hour (6 pm - 8 pm) $2 Pacifico  NICE!!!

oabHjRP2nComUMcyQrNW_g.review_text: Great after dinner place for two or with a small group of friends...

aLxsQj4Cc67b3ngqq8904w.review_text: Some friends and I were looking for a chill place to go after a comedy show/dinner.  Candybar was the Perfect place for that.  Desserts/drinks/board games.  Excellent mix for after dinner.  Although, they don't have very many options as far as desserts and drinks.  The drinks are yummy because they taste like desserts in itself.  I got the strawberry limeade dessert along with the strawberry kiss drink.  Both delicious.   I'd come back here again after a nice dinner in the city.

JBVb5udEEpvThHTrdkVE3g.review_text: Candybar is one of my favorite desserts spots in the city! The desserts here are AMAZE-BALLS, aca-awesome, and the bomb.com! Only downsides to this place is the long wait to get a table, parking, and the small venue. Now onto the desserts...I would highly recommend any of these: Ice Cream Sundae- ABSOLTUELY DELICIOUS Macaron / Brulee'd Bananas / Brownie / Vanilla Anglaise / Strawberries / Strawberry Sherbert (Gluten Free) Apple Ala Mode Hazelnut Crust / Cream Cheese Filling / Caramel / Gingerbread Ice Cream Passion Fruit Chocolate Mousse Cookie Crumble / Passion Fruit Gelee / Coffee Ice Cream *Smore Dessert (dont remember the name) but this one was my favorite one!!! Candybar is a chill spot to get together with the homies, eat some sweets, drank and play some board games!

63RGOpfG38zD1fGBNQ3pZQ.review_text: Seriously? 4 stars? I went here last night. Tried the green tea cake (tasted like dirtcake--the matcha wasn't blended well into the cake so its griddiness tookover)  and the nachos (omg.. I looked at it.. looked at my two friends and we all gave this disgusted look and laughed). EWWW... barf. Never again. The idea of the place is great. Date place, cute board games, dessert idea, wine, and art. BUT the dessert is limited.. and they were sold out of 2 out of 5 desserts on the menu.. and the 2 that we had. barf. :( so sad. so sad.  and why close at 12am? If its a wine and dessert place catered for people who are on dates, etc... at least open a little later. Granted if you really got game... and you took your date here... you should be back gettin some lovin' around that time.. soOOoo I guess that's justification for the early closure. haha...

iuKdlVt549hc2Kd9_tYepg.review_text: My first impression wasn't great because I didn't think the desserts were that impressive. Some can be really overly sweet. Came again and had better desserts this time around, but I LOVED their drinks. mmm.   I had the: -Candybar Dessert For Two: I didn't regret this at all. Trying a little bit of everything makes it super worth it. We chose the Tiramisu, Apple A La Mode, Lavendar Honey Creme Fraiche Semi Freddo, and Ice Cream Sandwich - they were all pretty good, but the Ice Cream Sandwich was a weird combo (almond macaron, chocolate ganache and honeydew ice cream just don't mix well for me).  I also had a Peach and Lychee (bellini?) - can't remember, but they were two separate drinks that I absolutely LOVED. They have board games here which makes this place feel really chill. I'd go here again for dessert and drinks - something that SF really doesn't offer.

WUAUa04K8T349LkkEu7ITg.review_text: I was totally impressed with this place.  Went here for a friends birthday party and I thought it was the perfect place for the occasion.  A totally mellow, chill, and relaxing environment. Great deserts. We had the Peanut butter jelly time, Panna Cotta, Apple a la mode, Japanese cheesecake, and Strawberry Limeade, All Were delicious to me but the Strawberry Limeade was my favorite, It had just a nice fresh taste to it.  The Drinks and board games were also a nice touch. Will definitely be back

ZX89s5CPARykCNX0abqw9w.review_text: I've been avoiding this place like the plague thinking it was just another shiny lure to bring more Marin(a)-based folks to my neighborhood to gobble up the parking and muck things up....but I was wrong!  I went to Candybar the other night with a friend. The food was phenomenal, the service impeccable and the crowd was suprisingly diverse and unpretentious.  We had the kobe beef and the cheese plate which were both delightful. The drinks were yummy and inventive, and the staff very attentive without being intrusive. The place is pretty and sleek. Plus they were playing songs that I rocked to at my 10th grade dance back in the 90's--no pretensions there.   I almost gave them 4 stars instead of 5 because they are a bit on the pricey side for smallish portions.  But that's why you go there on a date ladies ;)  Candybar, you are my new local haunt.

Gh7a3aAOlB2zMRocFzGEZg.review_text: Candybar is what your childhood tea party wanted to be when it grew up. Fizzy adult libations, happy hour, sweets, and even board games make Candybar a fun alternative for a night out.  My party of four showed up at 7pm to take advantage of the last half of happy hour, which runs from 6-8pm. They wouldn't seat us until everyone in our party arrived, which is understandable BUT...we definitely could have done without the attitude at the door. And I am not sensitive at all, so it's rare that I would even say that. Service, however, was friendly and as prompt as it could be considering how busy it was.  They have happy hour drink specials for $4 - my strawberry bliss mimosas went perfectly with my cheesecake. Both were as cute as they were deeeelicious!  Although they only have one bathroom there wasn't too much of a line, which is always a plus. Parking is tough in this area so be prepared.

X2Odq2U2B0kRUQ1RXRnEpg.review_text: parking sucks. i think its perfect for a date night with your special someone. their ice cream sandwich is bomb.

xcfG17oT30KX9CfT8CGLYg.review_text: Very cool and unique! I went here for a friends birthday and definitely enjoyed my visit.  Before coming here I had never been to a dessert bar.  I really enjoyed the atmosphere in Candybar; it was so nice and cozy and there were just good vibes.  The music was very chill and the chatter was at a nice level.  While you are eating dessert or drinking you can play board games at your table. All the desserts on the menu sounded delicious so of course I had a hard time deciding what to order.  I ended up having an ice cream sundae which included brownies, french macarons, bananas, and strawberries to compliment the ice cream.  It was delicious and plated very artistically.  It was a great experience and I would definitely come back!

akmzZ87dhGitfq_c600cQw.review_text: Definitely a great date spot, provided you and your date don't plan to drive to the restaurant....  Soft Cheesecake - I liked this dish although my date found it disgusting. The cheesecake was creamy and a nice contrast with the shortbread. The pink grapefruit leche was the only part that was kinda odd.  Chocolate Espresso Pudding - This was more like a chocolate mousse. Good consistency, strong espresso flavor.   Ambiance - the board games are a fun touch although the tables are a bit small for a large board + dessert plates.   I knocked this place down to 3 stars b/c of the lack of parking in the neighborhood. Don't come here if you plan to drive!! We circled for 20 minutes and finally found parking on the other side of Alamo Park. Take a taxi if you can. Even on weeknights.

9cqhaZcZJ8UMv-WrtFkiSA.review_text: The dessert sampler is the way to go!!  The have a great selection, which can change with the seasons. The atmosphere is fun - low lighting and comfy seats, which are perfect to get into a great convo or a great board game. Tasty drinks - I love the 50/50!  Also, you can buy the artwork right off the walls!

BhjseQElPkSE1qs7tqx0SA.review_text: Pro:  Very friendly and attentive service; cool board games; interesting concept  Con:  Loud, obnoxious music (is this a club or a cafe?); parking around here is horrendous (not the venue's fault I suppose) but you must invest a good 30 min to find parking; overpriced   Memo to management: the loud music has got to go, try some soft jazz tunes to let patrons know that this is a classy place.

pEpywR1p1woO2kEKaEfc0Q.review_text: Strawberry Kiss (had a strawberry piece in it) and lychee guava martini (had a lychee in it) were good. Had the Lavender Honey Creme Fraiche Semi Freddo for dessert and that was also good. The lavender was not too strong and the almond brittle was great, but the nutella powder was not that flavorful and didn't make a differene for me. Atmosphere is great and they have board games too!

yzEiBjvwQnpf9886yB37Fw.review_text: I love the concept. Sometimes I just want to go out to relax with dessert so this is a nice place to go. They have board games too! Given I would feel awkward to stay and play a game when they are busy though, but it would be nice.  It was a busy weeknight, i think a Monday. I figured it was because many people are trying to redeem their livingsocial (or groupon) before it expires. The wait wasn't too long though.   It's all street parking, quite hard to find parking.   The place is small and dim, which makes it feel like a nice yet casual lounge.   My boyfriend and I tried the Mango-tango bellini ($8), 50/50 cocktail ($8), apple a la mode ($9), and the big francescos tiramisu ($10). I like the desserts but they are a tad too sweet and the portion was too large for me. And for just dessert it's a bit too $$.  Also, my boyfriend did not like his drink. It was too sweet for him; not very well balanced as well.

HGsA_sfwEFpTVIvB8D-jig.review_text: For a place that only offers desserts and cocktails, the menu was very boring. They use a lot of fruits and not many interesting components to the dishes. We had a very hard time deciding what to order with our groupon because nothing really appealed to us. We finally decided to get the apple a la mode and the honey almond panna cotta.  Apple a la Mode - weird. Something tasted off about it. It had also been heated and then they put a quenelle of gingerbread ice cream on top, half of which melted because it's such a small portion of ice cream on a large and hot piece the apple stuff. My friend also tasted a lot of ginger towards the end so it might not have been mixed very well and there was probably a large clump of ground ginger somewhere. She finished it because she was hungry.  Honey Almond Panna Cotta - DISGUSTING DISGUSTING DISGUSTING. The soft caramel powder did not taste like caramel at all. It tasted very oily/greasy and just gross. The texture was also not very appealing and it stuck to the spoon. I didn't like the taste or texture of the panna cotta either. The chocolate ice cream was okay but because the plates weren't chilled, a large part of that was also melted. The rest of the dessert was raspberries and blueberries, booooorringgggggg. I took a few bites, ate most of the ice cream, and just left everything else because I would have thrown up if I tried to eat any more of this shit.  The groupon was not worth it because we didn't feel like drinking so we got softdrinks instead of cocktails. They weren't willing to substitute ONE dessert for TWO cocktails (even though that would have worked out better for them in terms of what the prices are). We got the raspberry Italian cream soda, which seemed alright at first, but then it just got disgusting even after I only took a few sips. Neither of us could finish our's; not even halfway.  Looking at the menu also kind of pissed me off because they offer "dessert for two" which is 4 desserts, but you only get to choose from a limited amount of desserts (pretty much only half their menu) and they charge an extra $10 if you want to share between more than 2 people. Why would you have to pay more if each person is getting less of each dessert. Makes no sense! So stingy.  This place is no...just....no. Ugh.

h6SY_r3T3iEUEeweWxaYBA.review_text: I love this place. It's definitely a more girly lounge with sweet cocktails and desserts. It's a great hangout place to talk and even play the board games they provide. The wait may be long, parking sucks but I love the Asian vibe and not too loud so you can still talk and have fun.  I came twice and once with a groupon deal that made it even sweeter.   I tried the cheesecake, tiramisu, semifreddo, strawbrerry limade, ice cream sandwich... not the best desserts out there though. They do look pretty!! My favorite so far was the Lavender Semifreddo. The ice cream sandwich was good too. The macarons were hallow (-1)  but the ice cream was honeydew(?) was so delicious!   As for drinks. They are probably cheap champagne that's flavored. I did like the lychee martini.   I will personally come with a small group. They do have room for a larger party but it won't be comfortable. I recommend wait for a livingsocial/groupon deal!

Ok4JzVqlcGmQ0ZzoIld8aA.review_text: Desserts, cocktails, and board games. At the same time. Can you say perfection?  With its selection of scrumptious desserts, delicious cocktails, and fun board games, Candybar is the perfect date night or Girls' Night Out spot. The ambiance inside is intimate and romantic with its dimmed lighting and cozy seats, but there are a few spots to accommodate parties with a few more. You may have to wait a while if the spots are taken already, though. You may have to wait a while, period, because there aren't a whole lot of seats.  On the chance of a Livingsocial deal, my boyfriend and I decided to stop by and try this place. (I was a lot more excited than he was...) As I scanned the menu, I tried to resist the temptation to order everything. They have all kinds of desserts from chocolate to fruit to cake to ice cream to cheesecake... My sweet tooth is getting excited just thinking about it. We finally settled on the Lavender Honey Creme Fraiche Semifreddo and the Passion Fruit Chocolate Mousse, and for our drinks, we ordered the Mango Tango Bellini and the Strawberry Kiss.  The desserts were... oh my gosh. The semifreddo was definitely the winner of the night. Creamy and smooth with hints of lavender and honey blended together in one decadent concoction... The chocolate mousse was airy and perfect as a mousse should be, but something about the passion fruit didn't taste quite right with the chocolate. (Maybe I got spoiled with the semifreddo first.)  The cocktails were tasty but nothing too unique. The bellini was the sweeter of the two; the Strawberry Kiss had a stronger wine taste to it, but it tasted delicious after a few sips and paired with the desserts.

OdIaJyiXXDUd0E19RL5Ncg.review_text: I LOVE candybar. It's like starbucks, but cozier. lol. This place has a hiphop feel to it, from their music, to their artwork, they also offer boardgames just to chill and hangout. A great place to unwind and kick back for good conversations. Candles lit, it's also romantic inside here, too. So for their dessert, I ordered a chocolate mousse and it was soooooooooooooo goood! Had to order jasmine sparkling wine with it. Cant go wrong with that. This is a great place to come here with friends, or your significant other.

UA2iRmtbvQKudbGq4E3lYw.review_text: Oo man, I wish I knew about more places like this. The drinks are great here! Ive never had a better soju drink than here. Although there isnt much of an alcohol taste to the drinks, the name candy bar is fitting. The only reason why this place isnt getting a 5 star is because they have board games that dont have all the pieces. Get rid of those! Also I cant remember but a few tv's around the place couldnt hurt either. Oh, bring a lot of cash for this place. I like this place a lot and I would definitely come back.

TUgxfS5KyrxeLu5Yp5vA_w.review_text: Super good spot for a girls' night out, though parking is an immense pain. Unfortunately we came at around 9 and missed happy hour, which is from 6-8, but it wasn't too crowded and for seven girls we had a corner all to ourselves. Note: I think the menu said that for Fridays and Saturdays the time limit for staying was 1 to 2 hours.  We all got various drinks and desserts and shared them, which was nice because there was so much variety. I got the honey-almond panna cotta, which was delicious. The online menu says it comes with cherries, but mine had blueberries and raspberries. Other people got the chocolate espresso pudding (the bacon added an interesting flavor), chocolate financier cake, apple a la mode (so good when I tried a small bite but probably would've become overwhelming), flourless chocolate banana torte (didn't really like the pineapple chocolate combination, but others might), and strawberry limeade (adorable presentation). The drinks were pretty tiny, especially for their price, so I think I'd only get them in the future for happy hour prices.  The best part were the activities and games littered around the tables! At ours there were these cards with different conversation topics on them that we randomly picked and answered. Kind of like fishbowl, if you've ever played it, but with better questions, and they ensured we never ran out of stuff to talk about.  Our waiter was really nice and friendly and didn't kick us out even though we stayed past closing. There was some slight confusion when he overcharged one person's card, but once we pointed it out he fixed it promptly and apologized for the mix up.   Overall, a great place to go with a group of girls--not sure if it's exactly date material since it's pretty girly, but it might work. It's very cozy and dimly lit, so it's pretty romantic. I'll definitely be trying to go again for happy hour!

UagwGNmjQNWCQWFYSj6XUw.review_text: Desserts And Drinks, what a great combination!   I never know this place existed until I purchased a coupon for this place from Living Socials. I couldn't resist, the name alone, loved it! It's more of a lounge than your typical bar, enhanced with fancy stuff all around. The coupon I purchased was $15 and you received $30 worth. Half off, not bad.  As soon as you enter this place you already know it's going to be fun. The ambiance and the overall vibe of this establishment is happy go lucky. The lights are dim, pink and cool colors all around. Not to mention cool artys stuff.  My two friends and I decided to sit at the bar since we thought it would be a little better since there a lot of larger groups at the couches and other tables. This turned out to be a good spot, since the service was a lot faster and the bar table was just big enough for us three! They only have one bartender, he definitely seemed super busy but was nice and very helpful.  This place also had various board games available to play. All sorts of games that you've placed as a child! Connect four, battleship, sorry etc.  We tried to play apples to apples, but we didn't have enough people. But the games definitely add another level of entertainment, especially if you're with a large group.  For our dessert we ordered 2 dishes:  - Japanese cheesecake: The name sounded interesting, which was what drew me to it. Cheesecake imported from Japan?! Cheesecake sliced by Samurias!? Hhahaha.. what it really was was some type of pound cake infused with cream cheese. Not that bad. It was light and fluffy and tasted a lot "healthier." Accompanying it was a scoop of Guava sorbet. Now THIS was good. I honestly woulda been happy just eating the guava sorbet. If I closed my eyes, the flavor totally transported me back on a beach in Hawaii. Next time I'll try and just order the guava sorbet alone!  -Apple pie ala mode: This wasn't too shabby either. I'm not a Apple pie fiend. But it was good tasting. They had real apple slices which i liked because it wasn't smashed or chopped up. You got an actual slice of an an apple. The caramel and cinnamon and ice cream also matched up perfectly with this dish.   Drinks: I ordered the Mango Tango drink. Wasn't too spectacular, but it was yummy. Sorta just reminded me of a Mango/Organe Mimosa, but with a scoop of sorbet in it. The sorbet made the drink a little more fun.  For some reason this drink reminded me of an Orange Push Pop hahha, i think it was because of the sorbet floating and having to multi task drinking and eating. Overall OK.  I definitely would love to come back to this place with more friends. It seems like a chill spot to come to with friends for a low key kick back night, or even for a pre-party spot before hitting up another place. Wish we had one of these in the South Bay, perhaps I'll open up my own spot just like this (but better! =)

NbdKctpJhm8iktZrrLpULg.review_text: Happy hour. $4 Sparkling Cocktails and $3 House Sparkling Wine among other deals on Sangria and such. It was a tad past 8 PM but the server was so nice in letting us have the happy hour prices. I like the fact that the host/servers are all in casual wear. Everyone is like super chill and seemed really down to earth. One of the servers seemed like RedFoo from LMFAO. YEE!  Drinks:  Strawberry Kiss: The sweetest of the three. Had a drunk strawberry at the end. Bonus Jasmine Sparkle: My personal favorite because the jasmine was just a really nice sweet and subtle flavor to the drink.  *for these 2 drinks, the flavor was really strong at the end. A super sweet and yummy end but I would have preferred it throughout. Maybe stir it around a little before you drink it.  House Sparkling Wine: EH. It was ok. The moscato I had in the water bottle in the car was better.  Dessert:  Ice Cream Sundae: I was expecting like the regular whip cream and heaps of ice cream deal. I was pleasantly surprised with a sort of deconstructed form of ice cream sundae. Three scoops of ice cream on top of brownie with a pulled apart macaron on two of the ice creams. Caramelized bananas and a decent amount of cut up strawberries. Not quite sure still it if it worth $10, but it was really yummy! I especially liked the caramelized bananas. It was the "healthiest" ice cream sundae I've had. :)  Value wise, I'm going to try the dessert plate for 2 for $25 next time I come. The drinks were not as sweet until the end so I was kinda disappointed. They were still yummy though. I had an expired groupon so overall it was $8 tax and tip. Pretty good! Saw a fellow yelper seated next to me. East Bay to SF, yee-uh. :)  TIP: Play drunk battle ship. Every time you get a hit, your partner has to take sip. Quite a fun game. Especially with yummy sparklys!

uJMTDeih7mW6YXpP18yMNA.review_text: Little tip: Places like this are magnets for "sophisticated" girls-night-outs. As my friend and dessert industry insider reasoned, "well if nobody's getting laid tonight anyway you might as well cut the crap and go straight for the 4-course dessert."   Unfortunately the prices are a bit steep for anyone to actually get drunk off the sweet wine so you'll have to settle for sugar highs.  We've been hoping for a dessert-focused nighttime place to come to SF for awhile. Boston had one called Finale, spun off of a HBS class project. Candybar has much better food, but what those Harvard grads figured out is that you need to be near theater destinations to get the kind of traffic you need to stay packed once the novelty wears off. And the Independent isn't quite this crowd I think. As such Candybar will have to work harder for your $9 ice cream scoop purchase. Maybe try to pull you from one of the nearby destination restaurants that are popping up around here left and right.  It might just be good enough to succeed. Everything we tasted was excellent. The cheesecake "schmear" (god would I love that on my bagel in the morning).. The brioche, basically a dense chocolate cake but with an insanely good balsamic caramel ice cream.. The luscious dark chocolate sorbet (you could skip the "foie gras" tapioca they put with it). The only off note was the baked alaska: too sweet, but you kind of expect that.

Ed8JmiYnZYMe86vyKpcEwQ.review_text: I absolutely love coming here! Who can say no to cocktails and sweets? And of course, BOARD GAMES! This little cute joint is a great place to spend your evenings with your boo ting or a couple of friends. I've tried many things on their menu but my favorite by far is their Apple Ala Mode and Passion Fruit Chocolate Mousse. A bite filled of yums and noms that melts at the tips of your tongue! Definitely a dessert place to try. Finding parking may be difficult so I suggest just parking a block or two away and walking. The wait times are always longer on the weekends however if you stop by on a random weekday say Tuesday or Wednesday, there'll definitely be a table for you! :)  P.S - ALL COCKTAILS ARE DELICIOUS.

y3OmRrjc1c7wM4s3gLcxbg.review_text: I really wanted to love you, Candybar. Cocktails and dessert are some of my utmost favorite things. And your desserts are so pretttttyyyyyyyyyy.   Unfortunately, the drinks and desserts we ordered tasted like pure sugar and resembled nothing like the ingredients they're composed of. They were all so sweet that it became bland. If your tastes are refined........this place will not satisfy you much.   Nice place to hang out with friends, if you succeed at getting a table inside the small space. It gets pretty loud in there, so definitely not the spot for real talk.  Friendly staff. Lots of selections. But won't be back anytime soon.

eYmX1qt1HqLNxccbvsO94Q.review_text: Enjoyed the boardgames, Blackstar, and the following items: rasberry delight and chocolate fudgesicle

O5UWPHIktSfDlEkME18vYQ.review_text: Whats not to love? Huge portions of desserts, pretty drinks, childhood-isk board games, good friends and significant other for company? Count me in! The service was friendly and attentive. My only complaint was the heat. It was a little too warm inside.   I liked the yogurt that accompanied some desserts. Therefore, my order of the yogurt cake was great. It was a cool contrast to the temperature in the room. It also came with this matcha mousse that I really liked. Order the tiramisu! It is HUGE and my boyfriend liked it lot; he isn't a fan of desserts too.

JGCl9_pVdard7b316lhsmw.review_text: Candybar is a nifty little addition to the NOPA area.  Very good desserts, but slightly pricey for what you get.  I'm sure I'll be back, but probably not any time soon.  I'd love to see them expand their selection of ports to include some more interesting selections.

5-dGV2Ci9S-gSUc__GIyvQ.review_text: I came here with my friends, played battleship (lost, but it was a very close game!), ate dessert, and had cocktails.  What can be better?  The desserts may be a bit much for people without a sweet tooth, but the cocktails were very good.

AUF3-APCh1q_QD8AaMHRhw.review_text: I have to admit, this place is pretty cool. It's small and cozy and I really like the atmosphere. The board games are an extra plus. Some friends and I went here on a Tuesday night around 9 and it wasn't packed at all. We got seated right away, but parking was still bad.  The desserts are ridiculous! They're so fancy and delicious. We ordered three deserts I think. One of them was peanut butter jelly time I think, which was pretty good. I can't think of the other two and they seem to be off the menu now, but they were alright too.   I would come back to just hang out and try some of their new desserts.

vUir8rThhPSV2I5hv6FoPg.review_text: I purchased the Groupon for this place and am totally thankful I did!    We got 2 different drinks, which were very good and even had a delicious sugar on the rim.  For dessert, we had the homemade ice cream (kit-kat, oreo, reese's), red velvet cake, and the peanut butter jelly.  I have to say that all three were absolutely amazing.  I don't know if I have ever had such wonderful ice cream and both other desserts were so fresh and presented in a really beautiful way.
