This place is great for after dinner or just if you're craving a delicious sweet for the night!  It's a must try!

b6_gR3caZcaf3PIein5ktA.review_text: Candybar, I wanted to love you, I really did. A place that serves dessert and drinks sounded like it was going to be guaranteed a place in my heart, but sadly you did not sweep me off my sweetooth loving feet.  After waiting over an hour and a half to get in we were seated in one of the booth style seats at the window. We quickly ordered the Raspberry Delight and Strawberry Kiss, which turned out to be the winner.  I must say that the sparkling wine was very light. Drinking 4 of these would be like drinking one regular glass of sparkling wine. Not good!   We ordered the Flourless Chocolate Banana Torte, the Peanut Butter Jelly Time!, Lavender Honey Creme Fraiche Semifreddo, and the Strawberry Limeade. They were all good but none of them wowed me. The only one that came even close was the Lavender Honey. I was so sad!  I loved the location and the decor. I really loved that they had a vast selection of board games to play. We enjoyed several rounds of connect 4 but the novelty wore off once the dessert came. Wouldn't go again but I am glad I tried it.

6fh6TTdAzbos9EaCnZDMzQ.review_text: cool hip desert and wine bar

KKO1pPT-YPR0MTAymWQIdg.review_text: I had a groupon (2 desserts/2 drinks for $17) and it sounded like a cool place to go while on vacation in SF. I was a little disappointed when I saw the inside though. It looks a tad dirty in there with little to no comfortable seating, which is odd to me since it appears they want you to stick around and play games or something.  My husband and I were there during the week around 8 or 9pm and there were maybe another two couples in the place. We chose to sit by the front window on one of the cushioned bench seats, though the waiter told us they liked to save that spot for groups. Again, there was no one else there and there were PLENTY of tables available. But guess what happened when a small group showed up about 15 minutes later? Yep--we were told to move. Seriously---there were plenty of spots!  Anyhoo, we had already ordered and I had already paid for the groupon anyway....  I got the peanut butter jelly time dessert with a forgettable and too-sweet drink (not on the menu any more anyway), and my husband got the passion fruit chocolate mousse with a blood orange cocktail.   The drinks were just ok. Nothing I would ever order again. Though the desserts were really delicious. I especially liked how my husband's looked like a little diarama of Chichen Itza.  All in all I probably would've been more thrilled about the place had we not been kicked off the table we had originally chosen. Or had we been a group we probably would've been treated a little better, not that the service was bad--it was just a feeling of "we don't care if you're here or not".

qAs0KtoGxJ2XMPKCLdZVmA.review_text: Finally got the chance to check this place out.   We had a large group (10 ppl) come in on a Friday night at around 930pm. The place itself is very small, but the set up made it feel very open and spacious. We didn't make reservations, and the place was already pretty full. The host was very accomodating and sat us within 15 minutes. It looked like he did some rearranging as the table he sat us already had a "reserved" sign on it.   I absolutley love champagne, and I loved that their cocktails were all mixed with champagne. Delish. Desserts were good as well- my favorite was the macaroon ice cream sandwich. At only $4 it's also the cheapest on the menu. :) The thyme ice cream I read so much about was also very good, but I didn't enjoy the brownies it came with very much.   I really liked this place. The concept is really different too- they have a ton of board games available and they don't rush you to leave. Trust me, we played Catch Phrase for a good hour or so. :) And dessert and champagne are two of my favorite things....i will definitely be back!

x-iDZaQu9yGpb2rpuywTPQ.review_text: I love the concept, but didn't love my dessert.  I ordered the brownie, and it was thick as spackling paste and totally flavorless.  The basil ice cream that accompanied it was delicious.  I had been there once before but not ordered dessert.  I did enjoy playing the board games.    I'll go back again because I love the concept of a dessert bar.

RS5yHRl8w5U1pmC7GzSNLA.review_text: I read about a new dessert bar about a year ago, I have been trying to get here ever since, after many failed attempts I was finally able to try out the Candybar.  I ordered their peanut butter curry sponge cake. This comes with 4 plums, tiny mini pieces of squared cucumber sprinkled across bits and crumbles of coco chocolate pieces, butterfinger ice cream and a piece of cake. I think the cake was the most interesting, it looked like a sponge as they naturally grow in the ocean. If there was a curry flavor in it. I didnt taste it  i would go back :)

ad8cXN5pYhs8EtSUat5WpA.review_text: The World According to Noelle ~Allergic Girl's Guide to Life~  A beautiful pink and orange sunset filled the sky as the fog slowly rolled inland. I'm notorious for getting lost. I got to be passenger on our way to Candybar. I had no idea where we were going for dinner. It was an amazing surprise!  Its very Sex and the City like the setting- simple, beautiful, contemporary San Francisco elegance at its best. A good place for dinner with good friends, a party of four, a date, or solo. The Charlotte York in me fell in love with the soft candle lights, dark wood tables and the overall warm and inviting ambiance at Candybar. We were graciously welcomed by the host and the later by Tan one of the owners of the establishment.  The menus are printed daily. The front page showed savory & sweet selections with fruit and chocolate being a subcategory in each.                                  Our delicious dinner selection:                                                    s   a   v   o   r   y  fruit                      poached local halibut chorizo/ piperade                               pork belly celery salad/ peach sorbet  chocolate           chocolate honey glazed beets goat cheese                               mousse/kale                               kobe bavette chocolate cherry cola  Being highly allergic to nuts, shellfish, berries, cilantro, bananas dining is always a difficult experience. Tonight, I was able to dine without reservations- and throughly enjoy my food without worries of an allergy attack. I've never liked fish but tonight I did. The halibut was moist and the combination of the chorizo on top was tasty. My ultimate favorite of the savory items was the pork belly- the flavors were amazing bursting with the savory pork belly and the cool compliment to the palate of the peach sorbet with a small dollop of lime sorbet on top of the peach- in one word: WOW. For the cheese lover in me the chocolate honey glazed beets with goat cheese mousse were a marriage made in heaven- the creaminess of the mousse, the light sweetness of the beets and the kale- such a winning combination. I love chocolate, cherry, and Kobe beef putting these three items together for the Kobe Bavette was another home-run for the already amazing meal we were sharing.                                                 s   w   e   e   t  fruit                vanilla brioche elderflower apricot/cherry pit ice cream.  chocolate     chocolate cannelone chocolate olive creameux/                        vanilla bean ice cream                         The vanilla brioche had a caramelized top and a perfectly                        baked vanilla brioche below the sweet caramelized                                                        topping, sitting next to the brioche was the beautiful                        elderflower apricot that was fragrant and sweet to the                         taste. While the cherry pit ice cream was creamy and                         delicious it was the elderflower apricot that stole my                         tastebuds and quite possibly my heart.                                         Chocolate cannelone chocolate olive creameux/                       vanilla bean ice cream was visually appealing. A thin                       chocolate cylinder filled with the most deliciously                        decadent chocolate olive creameux and the ends of                       the cannelone sprinkled with chocolate nibs.  Icing on the cake:  Kir Royale- My favorite drink in the whole world and they made it                      perfectly.  Handmade Chocolates: Meyer Lemon-  Beautiful match with the chocolate. Reminded me of my parents Meyer Lemon tree we had when I was growing up.  Nasturtium Chocolate- A beautiful match of chocolate and a flower. Nasturtiums were introduced to Europe by the Spanish. Most definitely yum to the oooh!  They use Valrhona chocolate and its beautifully executed throughout the chocolate desserts.  Overall experience was amazing. Wonderful ambiance and service, amazing food- visually and taste wise. Their attention to detail regarding my allergy problems was impressive. This is Noelle Friendly and Allergy Safe. What a wonderful Wednesday night dinner! Thank you to my sis for introducing me to my favorite restaurant : )

q7ETR2jaE0fk08spaE6B5Q.review_text: What an interesting idea for a bar!  My friends and I visited while on a Ladies' Weekend in SF. We had a Groupon-- which can sometimes lead to less than spectacular service (and that's putting it sweetly. . . get it? [Insert wink here.]-- but the services from service to host was terrific!  The place is dressed in an intriguing style of art from a local artist. I was captivated by one in particular. It is also dimly lit to create an ambiance; but not so much that you can't see around the room. The music is an assortment of several genres; but all of what's popular one various radios stations currently.  The menu consists mostly of sweets (of course,) and wonderfully tasting ones at that! I had the chocolate mousse cake, which. . . if I had died at that moment of clogged arteries. . . I would have died happy. SERIOUSLY. YUMMY. GAH! One of my friends had the S'more dessert and the other had the tarty-granola one. All of us were incredibly impressed!  The drinks were also VERY sweet, but very well mixed.  Our server was FANTASTIC!

5-GjKjU_rYn_SMgMVSmsIw.review_text: this place is really fun and the fact that it's a dessert bar made it even more awesome. i've only been to dessert bars in nyc so it's nice to find one in sf. it's a good place to get your sugar, your alcohol, and some fun with the different games they have.

HjvCswD6I-ojtqEcMM8j9Q.review_text: I love this place. My friends and I come here all the time. It's a great place to celebrate birthdays or to just hang out for a night out after dinner to have delicious desserts or a drink and play board games or read a good book. I love how peaceful it is here and it's a great atmosphere. The music is relaxing but not boring. The staff is friendly and are always on top of everything making sure you have a great experience . I have no complaints of this place. The art on their walls are amazing and even the bathroom is very cute and detailed. I am very happy that San Francisco has a place like this! My favorite wine is the blu Pom and for dessert I recommend the ice cream sandwich which is a macaron with honey dew ice cream and melon bits on the side it's to die for! It's a great experience you must come here!

wZG2xlICfUkJiY1NdPJH2A.review_text: I love the decor in the place. The koi mural on the right side is fantastic to stare at. The setting is well laid out and the service was attentive. Now the desserts... had the green tea ice cream sandwich. Far too sweet! Green tea is meant to be paired with something subtly sweet but "French macaron" wafer was heavily sticky, like a failed macaroon that gathered too much moisture.The accompanying blueberries were a little disappointing. The chocolate nibs were so sparing that there was nothing to taste. The red velvet had a nice touch with the coconut shavings sprinkled on it, but again the cake itself was too sugary. Mint ice cream was excellent- should have bigger portions! The blueberry pomegranate soju reminded me of cough syrup.  I have a sweet tooth for sure, but I like flavor not just sugar. Candy bar excels at flavored ice cream and continues to impress me in that department.  Somehow most people come here as couples or in a big group, so its not a great hang out for single guys. Warning ladies, there's shady guys that hang out at the bar.  Parking is still a challenge, but at least there's other restaurants and bars to check out all near by.

76_cAOrnqPZIZKxgh19BAQ.review_text: Cute place.I love that they have board games, dessert and cocktails - 3 of the things that make me very happy.   I ordered the Peanut Butter Jelly Time and a Red Velvet Cake, per the server's recommendation (and Yelp). Both were good, but I actually didn't get all the hype about the PB & J. Yes, it tasted just like the sandwich that was in your lunchbox growing up, but I don't associate those flavors with dessert and it just wasn't sweet enough. The Red Velvet Cake was served with a vanilla ice cream and the pairing just didn't work for me. Plus, red velvet is just so played out by now that it's tough to be excited by it unless it's really phenomenal. I really should have gone with my gut and tried one of the cheesecakes or ice-cream based desserts.   I will definitely give this place another try, as their other desserts all sounded good. Maybe I'll order better next time.

Ate_psJcSAF-qS_oM3HyyA.review_text: I really like the dessert wines and the cocktails.  The bartender was prompt and friendly.  The waitress, however, is a bit slow and she didn't clear our empty glasses and bottles until we asked, which made playing a board game rather difficult.  I have tried five of their desserts and the were ok, not my favorite.  The desserts were rather pricey for what you get.  The limeade is probably the best one out of the five I've tried.  Their board game selection is not that great either.  Also, parking was a pain.

ePUDFy1Ho0AqLPVLhhTSvw.review_text: Dessert + drinks, what is a better concept than that?  Parking is EXTREMELY difficult to find, and to be honest, it's probably not worth it to trek all the way here solely for Candybar. The wait is roughly around half an hour on Saturday night.  Candybar offers drinks and dessert. The drinks aren't worth it, in my opinion, since they are some form of flavor mixed with wine/champagne. The desserts are delicious, and very reasonably priced for the portions. We tried the Ice Cream Sandwich (must get!), Tiramisu (delicious, but not any better than your average tiramisu), panna cotta (good!), and passion fruit mousse (good, but would not try again).   Overall, I wouldn't come here regularly, but I would recommend this place for a first date.

EVaW-GGDEbYrYhgGUmO0DQ.review_text: cute little place near the richmond district...the place is really small and there is usually a wait, so go early if possible. this place is a dessert bar. yummy desserts with a glass of champagne.  got the sweet tart-sooooooooo good...just super comforting the rasberry moose-just perfect  a glass of mango champagne to go with it just makes the whole night perfect

H1pOm3aWRvYoQXmfLnRlXQ.review_text: Why fix something that isn't broken?  Please bring back the passion fruit chocolate mousse.  That's my favorite dessert.    You should take away the Japanese cheesecake because it was dense like a pound cake which was not what was expected.  I've had Japanese cheesecake made by a sushi chef before and it was light and yummy.     I guess I will settle with the strawberry limeade, my second favorite dessert on the menu.    I like to come to Candybar after dinner to satisfy my sweet tooth.  This is a great place to chill with friends playing board games and having desserts and drinks simultaneously.

XtFI4yHGrpba77obiYKk6A.review_text: Came back here to have some awesome Tiramisu. Its very rich, and not at all sweet, perfect for my taste. I'd recommend coming here for group hangout, or a girls night out :)

TZk_8v1iytboYB9zkc4srQ.review_text: i came here with my friends and got the strawberry champagne drink with some dessert. my friends and i like it here. what else do i need to say?

azCYdv0DvS5f-NZsWdC5pQ.review_text: My friend tells me I have to check out this cool dessert place a few days ago, so I immediately respond - I'M IN! Came in around 9:30 (they close at 10) today, and found a good mix of people. There was even some cool dad with his cute little daughters having a blast picking out desserts/ playing board games.   My friend and I enjoyed the entire L of the booster seat. The set-up is similar to most comfortable and relaxing lounges, except board games line the shelves.  Orders -  & Blueberry pomegranate cocktail: a bit too sweet, but otherwise really yummy. love the blueberry!  & Buttermilk Vanilla Bean Panna Cotta: not that impressive & Flourless Chocolate Cake     Bill came out to $30-something?   Service -  Great service, good looking server   To Sum it all Up -  Yes I still feel super guilty for coming at all when I consider all the calories&cream&goodies I just consumed BUT, I'll tell you this much - I will definitely come with friends again soon because I had fun :]

I6nE4W0fN-Oysd3Zvb2bgQ.review_text: My friend and I visited Candybar the other night and thoroughly enjoyed the serene atmosphere. We wanted to kill some time and drink some wine. They offer a good selection of wine, signature cocktails, and desserts which all seemed really attractive. I had the Almond Panna Cotta which was very light and creamy. I want to come back and try their other goodies.   Candybar presents a casual scene framed with elegance. They provided board games for groups which is a very nice touch. They also had an eye catching curation of artwork on the walls. Incredibly contemporary works and easily commercialized as they do sell each individual piece. All things combined created an enjoyable place to hang out. It felt like a coffee shop where people may study or read, except there's candle light and booze. I was telling my friend it's a genius concept. Perhaps someone should open one in the east bay.

8cU-EmiRkTIjpiLu-kOLAg.review_text: When J called and said she wanted to go to candybar, I was excited as I've been wanting to check it out. I turned off the water I was boiling for ramen (making the night instantly go from $0.25 to $50), and headed out. I'm glad I did though, it was well worth it.  J and I started with a glass of wine. The staff was super-friendly and helpful. We had the pork terrine, which was tasty. The crostinis they provided weren't enough, so we asked for more. No problem. I think they're still working out their portions, but were very receptive to our constructive criticism.  We sat in the front window, which doesn't have much of a view (parked cars on Fulton). Maybe that's why they have books and games. J and I played Connect Four (J 7- Billy 6- damn, i'm buying). It was fun but maybe a little loud for the vibe of the place- every time we finished a game, the sound of the checkers hitting the table drew a neck craning from the other patrons. But screw it, we were having fun.  Derek, one of the owners, is supernice and talked to us for a long time. And it seems Candybar is a family affair with one sis serving and another providing some amazing artwork for the walls.  Bottomline, Candybar is as advertised- sweet and salty. But mostly sweet.

BRwdO0WuvAWstFF_I0wWiA.review_text: Death by deserts anyone? Come here.  You'll be happy with your suicide choice. LOL. This chic little joint is "sweet" in more than one way! Drinks, dessert & games. Great art on the walls that make you stare long and hard, no it's not abstract or Van Gogh or anything. Just really pretty, urban and loud! I LOVE it. Need I say more?  Gladly...   We ordered 3 deserts my personal favorite and maybe the entire parties favorite is the Ice Cream Sandwich! Reviews as follows:  ICE CREAM SANDWICH: "Takes the Cake for the BEST Desert & doesn't even have any cake in it!" A super fun "birthday cake" looking macron with exceptionally delicious honeydew ice cream in the middle, drizzled with chocolate ganache, berries and honeydew chunks on the side. Totally gluten free. Though the menu said the macron is Almond (which in most cases I would pass on a) this macron did not taste almondy at all, this works in my favor but the friend who ordered it may be have preferred a more almondy macron. The ice cream was sooo good, if I were to go back I would order JUST a side of honeydew ice cream   STRAWBERRY LIME AID: "Sweet Tarty Perfection." A cute little parfait cup holds layers of soft vanilla cake, light cream, strawberry mousse and syrup drenched strawberries. I would have strongly preferred fresh strawberries because this is a desert bar but hey! It still taste good.  APPLE ALA MODE: "As Expected." The hazelnut crust coming out soggy and cold was NOT expected but the cream cheese filling had a nice smooth texture. The caramel and the gingerbread ice cream made a really delicious blend, this desert is pretty much as expected. Just make sure when you order it you emphasize your crust being warmed.  From ALL the drinks that were sipped on I'll just review one of my favorites.  Though ordered virgin I'm sure The PEACH DRINK would be good for all you alcohol drinkers, if your looking to go virgin this may be your best option.  We played rounds of Apples to Apples and I'll have you know I won FIRST PLACE, ahem ahem... In the first round.  LOL

fepLYIihV-Z1lD7l1Z9GLg.review_text: When a man gives me sweets, I know he really likes me. When a man gives me sweets and alcohol? I know his intentions are less than honorable. Ahem.   Oh don't judge me.   My first experience here was for Peter's Valentine's Day get together with a group of us the first year they opened. I loved playing board games, getting tacos outside from Kung Fu Tacos, and tasting every single dessert they offered that night because Peter made sure to order everything so we could all share!   My most recent visit was nice. It felt wonderfully indulgent to sit and sip frou frou cocktails while sharing three different desserts.   I often feel frustrated that restaurants treat dessert as an afterthought. Here at  Candybar, desserts are the focus and that tends to make sweet teeth like mine really happy!   Heads up: the parking situation in this area is downright disgusting. It really irritates me that this neighborhood is structured in a way that makes people who do not live in the panhandle feel inconvenienced...wasting gas circling around and around. Some things are so "practical" it actually is pretentious.   Aaaanyway, back on track.   Surprise your date and take her here after dinner.   By doing that you let her know you support her lust for sugar and that you think she is sexy in the skin she is in - no lame crash dieters need apply.   That is hot. Women like running hot sometimes.   Thank me later.

JwQ8oI5iXKaqfBgZSpm19Q.review_text: Love the artwork & the candles/dark bathroom :) Came here with my bf one night last month, I think. Ordered several different desserts bc I bought one of those social living deals. we ordered: Lavender Honey Creme Fraiche Semi Freddo Chocolate Raspberry Brownie Japanese Cheesecake Ice cream trio thing. All of them tasted good. I really liked the japanese cheesecake. The ice cream trio tasted like kit kat/snickers.  It was a pretty nice experience. :)

2ttZShfOh7m_5e_jSrtQQw.review_text: I really like the concept of Candybar and it is a fun place to go, whether you're with a hot date or just hanging out with friends.  They have various board and card games that you can play with, which is a lot of fun.  I do have mixed feelings about that though because Candybar has very limited seating and adding games to the mix just adds to the wait.  (Be ready to wait over close to 2 hours for a table Friday and Saturday nights, especially if you have a larger party.)  Their desserts are really good and creative though which make it worth the wait.  It's always fun to get a bunch of different dishes and share with everyone.  Do note that their drinks are on the lighter side but I guess that compliments the desserts better.

mj0TFO4fyv2K9BydUUZ_Yw.review_text: Made a recent visit to the Candybar - Pretty cool atmosphere, it's a small place and dimly lit to create that mood, with art surrounding the room. They have board games to accompany your dessert and drinks. Prices are decent, ranging from the $5-$10 range. Also, it was happy hour, so hooray for half-off drinks!   Desserts/Drinks ordered:  Lavender Honey Creme Fraiche Semi Freddo  almond brittle, nutella powder, cantaloupe  Was a little iffy on ordering this, since it was something new and unusual for me, but nonetheless, it was interesting- and interesting in a good way! It had all the right textures combined, creamy and crunchy and seemed to be the right combination for my taste buds.  Apple a la Mode  hazelnut crust, cream cheese filling, caramel, gingerbread ice cream  This was not my choice, but hey, why not try something I would never order, right? It was way too sweet for me, although the ice cream was delicious.  Jasmine Sparkle  sparkling wine, jasmine, lemon  This was perfectly sweet and sparkly and passed my taste test!  Worth a try if you like jasmine tea!  Strawberry Kiss  sparkling wine, ginger ale, frozen strawberry  Not my choice again, and of course, it failed, sad to say. Very disappointing- I can easily make this myself, which I have, and it tasted ten times better! This one felt like they just poured in champagne and dropped in a couple of frozen strawberries (actually that's probably what they did). Please change this concoction up!  Overall, cute place for a girls' night out, a date or a Saturday hangout. Definitely worth a try for their unusual desserts. Parking is horrible though, but if you time it right, it may be the perfect night for you!

aEKUC4oQg2CokbwyW_CXSg.review_text: Cool little spot. Went with some friends last night for a glass of wine and dessert. We were able to grab our own cozy nook on a Friday night so if you're looking to sit down and chat over a drink this is the place. We tried 2 desserts, the lemongrass panna cotta and the baked hot chocolate. Everyone loved the lemongrass panna cotta but me, I thought it tasted soapy, but I think it was just clashing with my white wine. The hot chocolate was lush, super yummy but very rich for me. Cool spot though, everyone was playing games, would be fun to go there and hang out over some liar's dice or something.

oy75MIDTfRl9AthMeLergw.review_text: I loved the atmosphere and design of the place.  There are also board games and the staff was really really friendly and kind.  The dessert menu all sounded so good but I went with the Red Velvet Cake which was amazing!  There were home made marshmallows and chocolate on the plate too.  It was a huge slice!!  I paired it with some sparkling wine and raspberry sauce and it was perfect.    I can't wait to come back!!  I highly recommend this place if you have a sweet tooth!  They also have cheese and salami if you want some appetizers before dessert.

YbRnu82z1EfarRcFvy7zGA.review_text: 3.5 or 4 stars.  Came here on a Thursday night with my boyfriend because I had a LivingSocial deal. Definitely a place I could imagine finding in a city like New York! Inside, I loved the paintings, the furniture/set up, and the romantic/jazzy atmosphere!   We ordered two desserts (tiramisu and ice cream sandwich) and two cocktails (strawberry kiss and a blood orange sparkling wine). Individually, each of these were pretty good. Although the desserts + sparkling wine didn't quite go together, so we had to eat the desserts first in order to enjoy the wine afterwards. The mix of flavors didn't go hand in hand as I'd imagined.  -- Tiramisu: Pretty good - but not the best I've had. Personally I like my lady fingers in my tiramisu to be more moist than Candybar's, but there was still a likable balance of espresso taste with the mascarpone cream.  -- Ice cream sandwich: As a fan of honeydew in general and huge fan of macarons, this was great! It was a giant macaron sandwich with three scoops of delicious honeydew ice cream plus some small chunks of honeydew and cantaloupe. I'd never had fresh fruit with a macaron, let alone ice cream, too. But I actually tried eating it as a sandwich, and it was pretty good!  -- Sparkling wines: The sparklyness of the wines was hard to pair with the desserts. The blood orange one was very distinct and hard to find elsewhere, which I like! The strawberry was alright.

nwKsR5_epCypSzGPsMn0HA.review_text: Came here again on a Saturday around 9:30pm.  It was good that the place was not packed so we got seated right the way.  We ordered a Tiramisu, a Strawberry Limeade and two cocktails.  The Tiramisu was ok, nothing special but big portion thou.  The Strawberry Limeade was the strawberry mousse and vanilla cake.  It was cute that they put it in the jar.  But the taste was just meh....  Too much mousse.  But the most scary part was.....I found a LONG CURLY HAIR in the dessert................HORRIBLE.........It was so disgusting!.

VpREWOjt5Pna6OIgXI9Jcg.review_text: I spent the day slathering my pouter with Sugar Doughnut Moment, one of my favorite Dirty Girl lip smackers. I got more and more excited about having dessert and wine for dinner. My pants matched my shoes, and my purse matched my sweater which matched my necklace. I was clearly still on a Sex and the City "fabulous" streak.  And then I learned Candybar was closed on Tuesdays.  So a few Mondays later, I met pals here, a place I had been itching to visit since it opened a few months ago. It's not exactly what I expected, as they have a range of savory dishes, but I still enjoyed the food, the location and the company.  It was odd how no other customers came in the whole time me and my gals were sampling their bites. The fun book selection almost makes up for that, but I still think the joint could benefit from a bigger crowd.  Their tiny dishes were very, very creative. They say the menu changes every day, but we decided to go with beef cheeks (lol name) with chocolate-covered pepper, pork belly with sorbet, beet salad with cocoa bits, a chocolate cannoli and something else I can't remember. The most interesting dish was probably a foie gras pb&j (foie gras mixed with cream and a jelly-like side), which I cold-heartedly enjoyed since it's probably going to be banned in California before long. I loved my drink (rose of pinot noir) and downed a couple with the meal.  The most fun part was realizing that these eccentric combinations actually work. It's on the pricey end, but copious bench seating and low tables make it a good spot for lengthy girltalk.

p10IEB0cdR-M8rM5_pPBgg.review_text: The tasting menu is great if all you want are sweet dishes. I would recommend ordering on your own and including some savory dishes as well. We had the tasting menu and all 3 chocolate dishes came in a row which was a little over kill. But overall each dish was amazing and I thought was a perfect portion for two.

2r0ujxd3Xeg6CntDOuUFgw.review_text: Love Candybar, Fun with games. We are confused why at 7pm when they only open at 5 or 6pm the expresso machine is turned off for the night? We like coffee with our dessert.

vf-jXuq_mRyS5bImqo5R1w.review_text: Excellent customer service, very soothing and warm atmosphere and fast service. We got there around 7pm on a Saturday evening so we did not have to wait to be seated. We were a party of 5 by the way.  Hmmm as for parking... I got lucky and found parking about 3 blocks away next to the Painted Ladies.  The deserts are to die for!!! Our bill was close to $100 including tip for 5 cocktails and 5 deserts.

Lm4oFlebM1U6Yj0cYYbqow.review_text: We decided to get dessert after Happy Hour at Bar Crudo.  We also spotted two other couples that had also just dined at Crudo.  I think the two restaurants should pair up!  My bf and I tried two desserts and shared a Passion Fruit sparkling wine.  The Banana Dumplings in a brown sugar foam were so good.  The dumplings were chewy and dough-ey.  I loved the foam a lot.  This was a very well thought-out dessert.  We also tried the Chocolate Ganache with Thyme ice cream.  I thought the ice cream was interesting, but didn't really add anything to the chocolate ganache.  The ganache was incredibly velvety, dark and smooth though.

tZ7nkIqLAesHT4-zf9dwMg.review_text: Wow!  Inventive and dynamic dessert menu.  Love the atmosphere with comfortable lounge set up, local artwork hanging or painted directly onto the walls and appropriate lighting design.  Proprietor and chef are so friendly and approachable.  This place deserves to be crowded every night of the week.  The chef brings it!  Get there and enjoy it!  We enjoyed three desserts and it was hard to decide which was the most heavenly.

2--3--v8yHU3a3FljCcBRg.review_text: I'd say I'm pretty generous with my stars here on yelp.  I give a lot of 4's and 3's when places probably deserve a star less.  But it's still rare that I would give a place 5 stars.  Yes, 5 stars.  As good as it gets.  The best of the best.  The cat's pajamas.    But Candybar's got it.  The atmosphere, the drinks, the food, this place just got everything right!  This place is cool but comfortable, hip but un-judgmental, fun but functional.    I got the chocolate cremeaux cake with thyme ice cream and a glass of port wine and it was probably one of the best desserts I've ever had in my life.  Seriously, thyme ice cream with a chocolate cake??  how did they come up with that? and how is it so good?!    After dessert me and Grace played uno there and it was AWESOME.  you can also play monopoly and candyland.

09T1oyi6c-9lvyt7gQCD2w.review_text: updates: $3 HH red sangria (yelp.com/biz_photos/n9MM…) $8 for 50/50 (soju & mango?) $10 for huge tiramisu (yelp.com/biz_photos/n9MM…) $9 for chocolate financier (yelp.com/biz_photos/n9MM…) $3 for an Americano $9 for a red velvet cake (yelp.com/biz_photos/n9MM…) $9 for a Buttermilk Vanilla Bean Panna Cotta (yelp.com/biz_photos/n9MM…) Went here for drinks and a cousin's boyfriend's birthday's dessert's getogether (phew). Dessert items are $8-$9 each and are presented quite attractively: - The chocolate mousse was definitely my favorite. It had the right sweetness and texture and went very well with the malt ice cream. There are a few drops of mango sauce around the mousse that balanced out everything (would have ordered another if others weren't full). - The banana bread pudding was ok, not outstanding but not a skip either. It seemed like a wet banana nut bread with excellent vanilla ice cream. I didn't notice the Bailey's Creme that well. - The blueberry mochi cake was pretty good, though the green tea ice cream that came with it really confused the tastebuds (seemed like the combination was meant for a true foodie). - The cocktails are mostly sweet drinks (i.e., bellinis=most have champagne...oh, I mean "sparking wine" to the Frenchies). Prices are $7-$8 each, but the sangrias were $6. We did try the "50/50"=soju, orange soda, vanilla; it was good but recommend to have it before or while eating the desserts, else it will taste bland. The cappuccino to finish up the night was good too. It's a great place to stop in after special occasions, or if you do not want  to hit bars and noisy lounges. That is, this venue is quiet enough for convos but not too much that it feels dead. It has an inviting, loungy and feels hip to hang out in. The website's pics do not give an idea of how inviting and warm the atmosphere is. There are bunches of board  games (e.g., Candyland, Connect Four, '80s trivia cards, etc.) and coffee table books for perusal. The wall is decorated with very impressive paintings. Even with super-tough parking in the area, it is worth a visit. Since it is a small place, seating maybe 25-35 people (but can hold up to 70 if need be; no furniture, standing room only), a YEE is out of the question. But, it would be good for a UYE...coughs.

3y55vZxLjIbjvWrba6Catw.review_text: I used to really like going to this place for a fun after-dinner date. Yes, you can play board games while you drink cutesy cocktails and munch on some sweets. But when you break down the actual quality of what you're getting for the price, it's not so great. It took several trips for me to realize this.   Over time the taste of the desserts have become underwhelming. Specifically I recall their red velvet cake tasting super bland, like it was just taken out of a box, cut up, and I was charged ten bucks for it. I also don't have fond memories of their servers. They really don't do much but you feel guilted into giving them a large tip because your bill is pretty high.   But you're paying for the atmoshere, Right!?! Meh. If you go on a Friday or Saturday night you will most likely have to wait a while outside to be seated, so have fun watching everyone play drunken Connect Four through the window, hope you're dressed warm.   When you do get a table, if you're there as a couple you will probably have to get cozy with another couple. And if it's a packed house good luck getting any of the good board games. You're probably playing some matching game from your Grandma's attic.   Overall, I'd probably take an out-of-towner here for the novelty of Candy Bar but as an SF resident - i'll pass. Grab Candyland, a bottle of vodka, a Safeway cake, light some candles, and do the same thing in your own living room.

VFxrLIlgApHIdOCrkAYIGA.review_text: The desserts were really good, the cocktails were uninspiring and the service was rude. I got to sample a whole bunch of treats thanks to coming with a group of 5! I got the brownie, tried key lime pie, chocolate cake and red velvet cake. My favorite was the brownie, you just can't go wrong with this classic food staple. Cocktail-wise, I don't recall the name of my drink but it was champagne with a thawed frozen strawberry, kinda odd - why the frozen fruit? It was just floating there, not adding to taste or aesthetics.   The service was the worst part of the visit. It wasn't crowded yet it took almost 20 minutes to be acknowledged by the waiter, then he forgot what my friend ordered. Then they didn't have the syrup to make the drink she wanted. Then they couldn't make her drink again for some reason. After the desserts came out, they finally brought out her drink. And my other friend asked for a glass of water when the order was taken but the water didn't get to the table until after most of the desserts were eaten.

Y-FdW1px4ARe-_5_oLPRCg.review_text: Environment? 4.  The eats? 2 (perhaps a 1 based off price, but it's SF, I get it).  The name of the store made it seem like it would be fancier than it actually was, but I still wasn't disappointed with the aesthetics.  It had a Parisian decor/feel to it, with some urban pieces of art.  The bathroom was dimly lit and reminded me of an old circus.. or something.  But it all came together somehow.  I loved how they had board games and I personally loved the window seats which were velvet-textured and you could people watch.  I felt the execution of the desserts weren't that great, and based off the Yelp reviews and my friend's perception of how this place would be, I imagined the desserts would be better than the decor, at the least.  I barely tasted in lavender in the Lavender Honey Creme Fraiche Semifreddo, which tasted like a bland breakfast.  The smores were even subpar to the smores I've made on the beach.  Perhaps more desserts would have been ordered but I didn't want to be disappointed.  We still had leftovers on the two desserts we ordered and I'm confident I could've made a tastier dessert with a Googled recipe at home.  The Blood Orange Cocktail tasted unpleasant and my friend's Strawberry Kiss apparently didn't taste like strawberries.  This place is cute, so if I had to, I'd come back, but only after I had my fill of dessert and drinks elsewhere.

YWsTlH5WINsDvO5OIw4_uw.review_text: The owners of Candy Bar are exceptional, the atmosphere is one of the best places in the city, especially if going on a date, or meeting mixed crowds for fun over their supply of board games, and books, and the food, wine, and beer are amazing.  This place ROCKS!!!  I just miss the Sunday brunches...damn economy!!!

t_R7myUixmTpowZt_v2SYw.review_text: Super cute, cozy place with a great ambiance, it definitely has a romantic/trendy kinda feel to it.  Perfect place to chill and sip on drinks without the getting trashed part.  It's cool that they have a lot of board games for people to play too, and many were.  I tried the passion fruit delight and blood orange cocktail, and my friend and shared one of the chocolate desserts, I forget what it was called.  The drinks were like juice and the dessert was delish, I definitely wouldn't mind coming back to try more.

TJD93Q5hw3xYQEkFis1CQg.review_text: I love this place!  Drinks and desserts genius! I've been here quite a few times always  to have drinks and desserts with some friends. The desserts are a real sweet treat, I sometimes have trouble deciding which one to order. Prices are not that bad, happy hours always a plus, but parking around here is crazy!

bWxxfPP08zWJuM5wKG0LvQ.review_text: Great concept. I REALLY wanted to like this place. Like REALLY. My sweet tooth is legendary and the idea of an entire restaurant devoted to desserts BLOWS MY MIND. This place is really new so I feel bad writing a poor review but really, there's sooooo much room for improvement. I'm hoping they get it together because I love the idea and want it to succeed. Here are my thoughts broken down by area.  Ambiance - It's a bit sterile, the walls are stark white. The tables and chairs are dark wood. There are exposed pipes and exhaust type things. I wish they'd done the walls in a warmer color. They have lighting issues too. If you go in around dusk they have to keep the fluorescent light in the kitchen on which totally disrupts the atmosphere.  Service - Pretty spotty. We had the wrong dishes brought to our table not once, not twice but three times. But I'm willing to over look this since they're so new.  Food - The important part. We were surprised to find they had a savory menu and even more surprised to find out it was pretty bad. (I later found out that in California you can't serve alcohol without a savory menu. LAME!) Anyway, their savory menu definitely needs work. I had the pork terrine and it was gross. Plus they don't give you enough crostini. I had some of my friend's duck liver pate, which was good but again, not enough crostini. I tried another friend's hamachi with kumquat and avocado which was bland and tasteless. I was really disappointed. On to the desserts. We got two of the four course tasting menus. The first course was a meyer lemon fizzy drink with mint gelee, it was to cleanse the palate and it was nice but to me, it doesn't really count as a course per se. Next came the four desserts we chose from the menu. First up, the chevre cheesecake with nicoise olives and coconut sorbet. It was a deconstructed plate that actually worked and I found quite delicious. Next, chocolate brioche with balsamic caramel ice cream and lime yogurt. It wasn't really a brioche and the lime yogurt didn't work at all. Bummer. The temperature on the cake was too hot and it was kind of burnt tasting and the lime yogurt added this totally jarring tangy note to the dish. The last thing I want my chocolate to be is tangy. Next came the baked alaska with blood orange sorbet and fennel and honeycomb which was mediocre. I think maybe baked alaska should be restricted to ice cream and not sorbet. It was again way too tart against the creaminess of the meringue. Last, the warm vanilla pudding cake with pickled mango and olive oil which I quite enjoyed. I found it light and warm and delicious. The last course was their take on milk and cookies which was a delicious shortbread type thumbprint cookie with malted milk (ovaltine!) which I found cute, creative and delicious.  So overall a kind of up and down experience. Hopefully this place will get its legs under it and balance out the menu and service.

yZasT2NGQxdAD6yqA6M0iw.review_text: HMMMM....   Long wait if you come here later in the evening. A surcharge applies for parties of 6 or 7+.  The macaroon blueberry ice cream sandwich SOUNDS good but left my tastebuds unamused. The macaroon wasn't good. =( The ice cream should have had more blueberry taste.   The rest of the stuff wasn't too memorable. I tried the apple pie, the peanut butter thing, tiramisu, and some other things.  I wouldn't come back again. But I'm glad I tried it at least once.

sVu7dQ_isyUr1toSBBrBFg.review_text: Great space and fantastic wine! This is a cool addition to the increasingly crowded SF wine bar scene. This definitely a cozy place to hang out with friends or take a date. The vanilla brioche with  spiced cherries and feta sorbet was worth every calorie, and our server suggested a lovely dessert wine to go with it. (There's also regular wine and savory dishes for those lacking a sweet tooth.)

daEKn0SlW3j3-8zAXx3xBA.review_text: My date and I stepped out for a drink Saturday night and thought we should give it a try. I was impressed that they had Heidi Schrock and Leitz wines on the the list. Our greeting at the door was a bit awkward. They really favor reservations.  The service was good. Perhaps next time I will make a reservation. I think it is a perfect casual date place

6OZxY7Ui8JxHPxKuusoSEA.review_text: We had some time to burn after finishing a meal at Nopalito, and our reservation at Nopa wasn't ready until 2 hours later... so we found Candybar.   The place was quite empty at 7 but completely filled up by 8:30. I guess people don't believe in desert before dinner. =) It was still happy hour so we ordered some cocktails....I think we had the strawberry kiss which was way too sour for me but my friend said the sangria was perfect! I had a beer of course in a nice fancy glass... we also ordered some desert...wish I can comment more on the desert, I didn't try it.   But overall the place is relaxing with some nice artwork on their walls...and check out their bathroom....just as Euge said... a shag worthy bathroom. =)

v-xyxZ-B_r3zS9BGKNjbig.review_text: [orginally written Oct 2011, and saved but forgot to click "publish"]  MANGO TANGO BELLINI. YES. OH GOD YES. sparkling wine + big dop of mango sorbet + mango nectar = YUM. and don't even get me started on the citrus sugared rim. *HEART*  ($8) Also amazing: triple chocolate bellini! like a growed-up version of a chocolate malt shake with sparkling wine and a scoop of chocolate ice cream/gelato. I was in love.  ($8) Serious heart-on for the candilicious drinks here.   Dessert: we split the Japanese cheesecake, with guava gelato and I think some kind of nutty toffee crunchy situation. I wish I could remember what else was on the plate because it was LEGIT. Shockingly authentic - fluffy and light and only a touch creamy. Very very tasty and highly recommended for pre-clubbing/dancing/bar-hopping/sexing purposes. :) ($10) The plate was big enough to share, esp because we'd been eating nonstop that entire day and had a huge dinner. I've definitely been thinking about this cheesecake since leaving Saturday night. Plus I feel like I get my money's worth when i order something a restaurant that is legit difficult to replicate at home - the special anti-gluten flour that goes into Japanese cheesecakes is freaking hard to find. Also, I haven't been to a handful of gelato places that have guava gelato, so bonus points for that. SO GOOD.  Ambiance is pretty hip. GREAT eye candy, and the servers are hot. Music is too loud tho - either do your unapologetic top-40 hits or some classy low jazz in the background. I have no idea what we listened to, and it was loud, obscure, and so boring.  Concept is too cute - nothing says love connection like a violent, trash-talking game of Connect-4. :) They do need to provide equipment so people can play Battleshots though (see googleImages). I would pay good money to play Battleshots with their delicious candy cocktails. Until then, Boytoy and I will settle for PvZ on iPad while sipping bellinis and sweet sweet kisses. This place needs a smush room, also.   All in all, this is definitely a new favorite in Divis. Just be sure to set aside an extra 30-45 min to find parking. And there will be a wait. And it will be worth it.

GpNDOhuWQWylXqkTxb1bfQ.review_text: Desperately craving sugar and champagne one Saturday evening, I coerced two of my guy friends to go with me to Candybar with promises of great happy hour deals on a Saturday.   The commute via public transportation was super-convenient -- right off the Divisadero bus route. The place itself is a little unassuming and easy to miss, but luckily a guy who apparently lives across the street overheard me say, "Yelp said it was a bit hidden ... Think that's it?" to my friends as I pointed to across the street, and he confirmed with a no-nonsense, "The Candybar - yes," as he carried his groceries up his stoop.   As soon as we walked in, we were welcomed by a warm, sugary scent. We got there right at 6PM and there was only one other small party already seated. We sat by the window and immediately grabbed a few of the sillier board games. I would say good selection of games and although it is an atmosphere that encourages a date-night sort of feeling, none of the waiters batted an eye when one of the games called for a member of our party to accomplish the "challenge" of getting on all fours and proceeding to "shake" and "wiggle" his booty at us to a song for 90-seconds.   To the food and drinks: Everything we ordered was shared and loved by all. Not a single complaint. We ordered the flourless chocolate cake with mango yogurt ice cream (not sure why so many other Yelpers hated on the mango yogurt ice cream so much ... maybe they didn't realize that it was mango _yogurt_ ice cream and were put off by the yogurty flavor? At any rate, we thought it was the perfect complement to the melt-in-your-mouth chocolate cake), the lavender honey creme fraiche semi freddo, and the Japanese cheesecake. There was a ten minute wait on the Japanese cheesecake because the chef was just finishing putting it together (we did arrive right at opening), and frankly, that was a plus in my mind -- meaning it was very fresh.   We also tried every cocktail on the happy hour list and, while all were amazing, the two best would have to be the strawberry kiss and the jasmine sparkle.  All in all, we ended up staying for two and a half hours when we probably would have normally stayed about half that time because of the fun board games and lengthy list of tasty cocktails.   I highly recommend checking it out if you're in the mood for tasty and unusual desserts, paired with sparkling wine and silly board games.

IbSvbepyJWnBog0yAyW29Q.review_text: Candybar is a great dessert lounge for pretty much any occasion.  The atmosphere is casual enough for guests  to just sit back and play a few board games with friends yet intimate and classy enough for a romantic evening.  The dessert sampler for $25 is a great option if you're feeling indecisive and when sharing one dessert just won't do.  Unfortunately, my personal favorite, the Passion Fruit Chocolate Mousse, is excluded from the list you can pick from to include in the sampler.  I'm usually not a huge fan of mousses; however, the rich consistency and potent and refreshing flavors of this mousse complemented with coffee ice cream is absolutely irresistible and very different from all other disappointing mousses I've tried.    The drinks here are also delicious and refreshing.  Their fruity combinations make it  seem like you're ordering from an alcoholic Jamba Juice menu. The base of most of their cocktails are sparkling wine or soju.  If you're not a fan of sweet drinks, you can always flip the menu over and order a glass of wine.  The place is usually packed on the weekends but I haven't really had to wait more than 10+ minutes on a Friday or Saturday night.  I'm keeping my fingers crossed for them to expand their dessert menu and stay open a tad bit later!

1hU0ZOWwBxUwAOtQeBxnvw.review_text: I think I have found the site of my 27th birthday party. Yes, that's right, I like this place this much. Everything we tried on the menu was fantastic and hit the dessert spot just the way we liked it, and the drinks were fabulous as well.   The night started out with three friends walking into Candybar looking for dessert and some wine. We got there in time for their happy hour special, $2 red or white sangrias. We'll take a round! The white sangria was sweet and refreshing and had a ton of fruit in it. MMm Mmm... We also ordered one dessert a piece and when everything was laid out on the table we all dove into all of it. Salted Buttermilk Panna Cotta with frozen grapes and olive oil, Black Twig Apple Pie and Goat Cheese Sherbet, and Cayenne Cinnamon Chocolate Mousse. Holy cow is all I can muster. Each one of these items was so different from the other, and so delicious in it's own right.   We kept things interesting by getting into their game stash and played a game of Candyland and Shoots and Ladders! That's right, how awesome is that?! Dessert, wine, friendly staff, a great atmosphere, and old timey games... is there anything better?  We finished off the night with some fresh baked chocolate chip cookies and malted milk. I can honestly say that we indulged to the fullest and after a night like that I can't wait to go back. Consistency is the only thing that will give this place it's last star. As far as I can tell this place is perfect.

05OBSX7kendjWT4iDs771g.review_text: fun =] but parking was a b****! it was in a ghetto neighborhood where cars get broken into and stuff. but the place was nice. the ambience was friendly and kind of loud with people playing with board games and having drinks and dessert. the strawberry limeade and the ice cream cookie sandwhich were my fave!!!

9fe41Vmw245Eho1PghHHKw.review_text: This place is mish-mash of everything. Come into a place with huge potential, but it's not comfy.  Drinks looked good, but we came for an after dinner treat. The dessert menu was funky...mish mash as well. Random fruit in plates that didn't make sense at all.  We ordered two to share, and left at least a 1/4 of both on the plate when we left. I like the idea of Candybar, but menu just eh.

oBgYDUYPl2yI_fD-cB_nIA.review_text: I have a sweet tooth. If you know me, this is an incredibly obvious statement (hell, just read my reviews and you can figure it out).  When a place called Candybar showed up on Groupon, well, that was a no-brainer! Now I'm just wishing we bought more.  Anyways, this is an amazing place to feel like a kid while enjoying adult privileges (read: alcohol). You are greeted by dim lighting and music that sets a nice, lounge-y tone. Wine, sparkling wine, and soju cocktails up the ante while you beat your companions at checkers or Connect 4. Then take a break from the fierce competition for delightfully restrained yet decadent desserts (I found the Apple a la Mode was an incredible combination of sophisticated flavors, and my boyfriend DEVOURED the Peanut Butter Jelly Time).  It's a really good thing for my waist and my wallet that I don't live closer to Candybar.  Food: 5 stars Value: 4 stars (it's a bit pricey without a Groupon) Service: 4.5 stars Ambiance: 5 stars

kN5TZU_4cngfQY8B6PYx1g.review_text: Bringing a new kind of San Franciscan to the hood!  NOPA is getting some Chicago/New York influence at this delicious wine bar/desert establishment. It's been open for like two months now and I've gone twice already! Everything I've tried I've loved. Last night I had a bubbly Pinot  Noir...believe it. Love it.   The lighting and the artwork on the walls provide a romantic atmosphere- can't wait to bring my boy here! Romantic but still a swanky place to take your friends to show off your neighborhood. Highly recommended.

icl0oYE-ykZ_EHyYtKZmKw.review_text: I love dessert and I loved Candy Bar.   The Milk Chocolate Parfait, though not a parfait and tasted more like bittersweet than milk chocolate was perfect.  Relatively light mousse-y chocolate, fresh whipped cream and crunchy bits of toffee...YUM.    Lots of attention to detail; from the spotless dishes, silverware and glasses to the tasteful art on the walls and the stylish coffee table books on the shelves the place felt sophisticated and welcoming at the same time.    Looking forward to going back soon.

jmhAZXgDDeuPMyxrnBA77g.review_text: We came here on a Friday night at around 11pm. We had a party of six and waited about 10-15 minutes. Not bad.  I like how they have board games here. Too bad we were idiots and decided to play Candyland, which wasn't as fun as we remembered...  We got:  White sangria: Tasty  50/50: Delicious! LIke a real orange creamsicle drink!  Italian soda: Not sweet enough. Just bubbly.  Nacho dish: I don't remember exactly what it's called, but it was different, creative, and good. There were cinnamony, sweet pita chip things with shredded mango, avocado yogurt, papaya, horchata ice cream, (maybe some other things), and two sugared jalapeno slices on top. Looked exactly like nacho chips but it was a dessert.  Ambiance: I like their decor and the painted art on the walls. I'm not much of a fan of dim lighting, especially when I'm eating food. We couldn't see the colors of the nachos. I like the big windows they have too.  Service: Friendly and attentive, but it was also too attentive...like they wanted you to leave asap. 10 seconds after we finished something, they cleared it. Same with putting out games away and leaving them on our table. They also give you the check about 2 minutes after you finish your last order. It's like a place where you chill, but they don't seem to want you to do that...annoying for the current customer, but good for those waiting to be seated.

xAyZ1xeaW9zaB1faQBNroA.review_text: This place is really cute and would be awesome for a date.  I dragged my girlfriend here for a post-exam date and she definitely liked the romantical vibe with the candles and dim lighting.  We came during happy hour so there were drink specials going on.  We ended up trying 4 sparkling cocktails.  All of which were decent, but the Strawberry Kiss was probably the better of the four.    We only shared one dessert which was the soft cheesecake.  Take whatever you have come to expect about cheesecake and throw that out the window because this is a very different version of a cheesecake.  It was basically sweetened cream cheese on top of a long shortbread cookie with some stuff scattered around the plate.  I didn't like it at all because I prefer the traditional cheesecake.

CZqB9PPVV0oUjapqODsisg.review_text: Seems like everyone is jumping on the swanky-dessert-bar train nowadays. Candybar is a nice little place to have some dessert, down some cocktails, and play some board games. I really liked the romantic lighting that they have here; the votives on every table add a soft touch.   We had the buttermilk vanilla panna cotta, passion fruit delight, and triple chocolate bellini. The concept of the triple chocolate bellini sounded better than it tasted. The passion fruit delight was really good; the passion fruit syrup added some sweetness to the sparkling wine. I expected to really like the panna cotta, but I was disappointed. The best part was the chocolate macaron that sat on top of the panna cotta. The strawberries in the balsamic reduction weren't bad either. I think the panna cotta itself would have tasted better if it hadn't been made with buttermilk since the strawberry balsamic reduction was pretty tart already.   Overall, cool place; I would definitely return to try something else.

8dp7RxDkx1gOUSaFAUwB3Q.review_text: Super cool desserts + cocktails + boardgames + happy hour =  awesomeness.  Went to Candybar during happy hour on a weeknight and there was barely anyone around. It is a super chill place to just hang out. Friend and I got the Dessert for Two, where we got to choose 4 desserts. We got the Apple a la Mode, Japanese Cheesecake, Lemon Tart, and the Strawberry Limeade. All of which were awesome. Nothing was overly sweet and the texture and flavor combination of each dessert was quite unique and delicious.

ypRztkuHCC9M3NBIau6iOQ.review_text: They say the best way to a man's heart is through his stomach, and I say the best way through a woman's pants is through dessert and wine. Ok that may have sounded a lil misogynic but my point is, this is the perfect place to take a date.  Delicious desserts, sparkly wine, board games, and dimmed soft ambient light... This place is screams COITUS.. I came here with two dudes (my hoes) and they loved it. We bought a coupon from Gilt City and split desserts. Like other reviewers have kindly noted, there really isn't anything that sucks. Every dessert is artfully done and so yummy. I'm surprised the owner didn't go on to work at some five star restaurant as the dessert chef.  But hey, no complaints here.  Thank goodness I have lady parts because that meant I could order the cocktail called Strawberry Kiss, which was tasted like I kissed a strawberry. As for desserts, we had the Straus Yogut Cake, Peanut Butter Jelly Time, Strawberry Limeade, Tiramisu, and the Chocolate Cake. I think my favorite was the Straus Yogut, but my hoes' favorites were the Strawberry Limeade and Peanut Butter Jelly Time. Like I said, there's really no going wrong.  Btw, in case you do end up taking your pants off afterwards make sure you have a toothbrush!

8Z9ugoA4MGwiJVh-CB8bhQ.review_text: We've attempted Candybar twice (with the first attempt about three years ago when the place was still new) but gave up due to the difficult parking in this neighborhood. We finally stuck it out the other evening and drove around and around within two or three block radius of Candybar (mind you while cursing in aggravation and witnessing a parking spot fight) and after about half an hour later we scored a questionable "parking spot". The wait for a table wasn't horrible. It was about 30 minutes.   I liked the concept of this place but was somewhat disappointed with the offerings on the menu. For a place called Candybar I expected more...and quite honestly better.   I ordered the Strawberry Kiss cocktail and it was delicious. I'm not much of a cocktail drinker however the name appealed to me. And totally had me buzzing for the remainder of the evening.   Along with it I had the Ice Cream Sundae which included a couple macarons, (extremely hard ones) brownie, vanilla anglaise, strawberries, strawberry ice cream and bananas. It was edible but the brownies sure were not. The brownies were incredibly hard to cut with my fork so I ate everything else around it and didn't bother with the brownies in fear that I'd crack a crown or something.  I want to give Candybar another try but only if I get lucky with the parking. Otherwise it might be another three years before I get a chance to visit again.

Ed20T0T3jkAqVBBiyXju6A.review_text: 3.5 stars: Service was great.  We dropped by here after dining at a nearby restaurant.  Ordered 1) Burnt smore (3.5/5)  2) Honey dew ice cream macaroons (2/5)  Nothing TOO spectacular, but the burnt smore is something I would come back for-def skip on the ice cream macaroons.

gStPZlsPvf20PSnwQgBqzw.review_text: Overall: 4.5/5 Food: 4/5 Service: 5/5 Environment: 5/5 Price: Average Food: Came here on a weekday at night and ordered Mango tango bellini, which had a good mix of citrus and mango flavor. Flavored salt added a special touch to the drink too. Lavender Honey Creme Fraiche Semi Freddo was very creative with many different components such as mixed candied praline, but cantaloupe pieces was very bland and tasteless. And you can just forgo the tiramisu as you can probably get better ones else where. On a final note, presentation for the dishes was very nice. Service: Our server was very nice, our drinks came out first and dessert came slight after. Environment: This is definitely a good place for a date, with dim lighting and cool art pieces, this place gives off a romantic feel. Price: Desserts run about $10 a piece, which are a good price for an elegant dessert. While drinks are about $7 or $8 each glass, which does seem a bit pricy. Overall, I feel this is a great place for a date or hanging out with friends, plus there are games here to play if you like. I do feel there are hits and misses with the desserts, and pricing wise it is a bit on the higher end. yelp.com/biz_photos/n9MM… yelp.com/biz_photos/n9MM…

aVIp7GqkB-xE2oByrsev7Q.review_text: If you are looking for a semi-lit atmosphere that serves 'sexy' desserts but want to avoid the awkward silence by playing board games, this is the perfect first date place! But for those with a palette for desserts; this place serves subpar desserts for the price you are paying.   Each item is around 8-10 dollars and although they throw in ingredients like lavender, chocolate chiffon and calamansi cream: the execution comes up short.   Tiramisu: Too much cream not enough lady finger, not enough coffee taste. It was like eating mascapone cream with chocolate crumbles on top.   Lavender Honey Cream Fraiche Freddo: Was not good....The nutella powder that they put around the plate haphazardly was way to overpowering and awkward. It was just placed around the plate, how were we suppose to eat it? mix it? by itself?   Ice cream sundae; Was the only thing i enjoyed but really, you can't mess up a ice cream sundae...just scoop ice cream onto a brownie.   Champagne: tasted delicious, didn't give much.   Wait time: Can be long, especially if you have a large group. I guess you pay for the environment and a nice 'hang out' place with friends. Don't have high expectations for the desserts because it will disappoint.

e_7sEw9FevaRkgyFy4S_eA.review_text: I came to this place for the first time last night. It's a low key spot, good music, and intimate atmosphere. Very small but cute place. You can either dress up or dress casual.   I liked how they serve classy drinks and everything on the menu was creative. I'm an  artsy person so the I was feeling the entire vibe there. The desserts aren't your typical "Ice cream Sundae" with the fudge, nuts, and ice cream with a cherry on top. They definitely go the extra mile to twist it up. So, you have to be open minded to something different and new.   I would say this is great place for a date because it's dim lighting with a candle at your table because who doesn't like dessert and good drinks?  Not to mention our waiter was very prompt and attentive.  If you want to try something new and you have a sweet tooth, The CandyBar is your place. I highly recommend it. :)

UplI21UWrE01arN0oZ5bZQ.review_text: Candybar is small and looks rather chic on the outside, but I love the little details that give this place character. It smells like freshly baked cookies when you walk in, there's artwork decorating the walls, and there are boardgames available on a shelf for people to play as they enjoy their drinks and dessert.   Happy hour is great. $4 sparkling wine cocktails! I tried the jasmine and passionfruit cocktails. The jasmine was my favorite, though passionfruit was also sweet and tasty.   I really, really wanted to try the desserts because of the wonderful smell, but was unable to fit anything in. I would love to go back and try them! Despite the lack of desserts, my friends and I had a wonderful time guzzling down sparkling wine and playing apples to apples.

7wS68ArAYnc7BY2DGxaLLQ.review_text: I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!  SERVICE: My friend and I sat at the bar and we had a friendly server! Super cool! Gave us some recommendations - and yes, went with what he thought was amazing! 5 stars.  FOOD: (1) Tiramisu: I'm not a fan of sweet or dessert-type-like stuff, but I LOVE this tiramisu! Was not super, duper sweet! LOVE IT! It was perfect - lightly sweet! Lots of chocolate favors! LOVE the crumbles on the side and the whip cream! Dip the crumbles in the whip cream ... amazing! The tiramisu is one the best I had!   DRINKS: (1) Passion Fruit: didn't really taste the passion fruit, but there was definitely alcohol! Very sharp sparkling wine taste. Instead of tasting the passion fruit, it actually tasted like peaches and pears. 4 stars.  *OVERALL: Tiramisu rocked my world! 5 stars.

om1aydWaYijFepbRO32Esw.review_text: I've been to the Candybar a couple times, and have always enjoyed it. The desserts are good and aren't insanely expensive, the drinks are sweet and tasty (if rather weak), and I love the concept of the place. The best bang for your buck is the dessert sampler....it is more than enough food for two people and is only $25. We had the red velvet cake (rich & sweet, although tasted like it may have sat in the fridge for awhile), peanut butter jelly time (unique and tasted like a sweet peanut butter jelly sandwich!), the banana torte (delicious), and the ice cream sandwiches (I was pleasantly surprised by the honeydew ice cream - it was so refreshing!). I've also had a couple of the drinks and since I like sweet girly drinks they are right up my alley, although the alcohol content could stand to be upped a little.

3GXXeevx7uEdFMrVYekFyQ.review_text: Went out for our annual dinner with some college friends and found this place on Yelp when we were looking for an after dinner dessert place.    Luckily due to the holiday weekend and people being out of town, we actually scored parking just a block from here which is unheard of and was able to snag a table for 6 before it got busy.    Ended up getting 5 different desserts to split (tiramisu, 2 smores, passion fruit chocolate mousse, flourless chocolate banana torte, and lavendar honey semi freddo).  The two that really stood out for me was the passion fruit chocolate mousse and the flourless chocolate banana torte.    Price:  Desserts were $9 or $10 with the exception of the sampler for two which is $25 so a bit pricey for the more standard desserts like the tiramisu and smores even if it was drunken.    Ambiance:  Trendy lounge with board games so would be fun for hanging out.  However, did feel a bit rushed as they practically cleared our plates as soon as you finish the last bite and before others at the table finish and the bill dropped off right after that reminding me of the buffet practice of kicking you out to turnover the table quickly.  I guess they didn't really care much since they charge an automatic gratuity for having 6 ppl.

a1jaqBDi3A71yS8fA6ckYA.review_text: This place had a pretty good selections for their desserts.  My boyfriend and I tried $25 for 4 desserts that didn't have an asterisk next to it.   Try to eat all the ones that will melt first lol.   Prices are so-so. Saw waiter give wrong check to wrong customer and not respond for 15 minutes. Went on his phone too.  There are a few board games to hangout with a few good buddies or taking someone on a date.   Take public transport as 43 bus is not far away. There wasn't much parking outside that I saw.

6EeXSETVS3oVrKvImgE3yA.review_text: service was prompt desserts were yummy portions for the drinks i found were on the small side. granted im NOT looking for a keg but those flutes were hella skinny n small!  PARKING IS A PAIN

08mOpJRCpZe3D8UHszP4FA.review_text: We tried Candybar after eating at Tommy's Joynt.  This is in the NOPA area & we had to drive there.  Only open for about 1 week so far.  We walk in to an empty place & the guy there asked us if we had reservations.  We didn't & I asked for the window seats.  It was fine.  We ordered:  Blood Orange Baked Alaska $9 -comes w/ candied fennel & honey comb.  It's a tiny dessert, blood orange sorbet was fine & not bad.  Candied fennel was boring & didn't see honey comb only a drizzle of honey.  Chocolate brioche w/ balsamic caramel ice-cream/lime yogurt $8.  Balsamic caramel is a salted caramel ice cream was nice, chocolate brioche tasted like a warm chocolate cake.  Just ok.  Friend got 2006 Accornero Brigantino Casorzo, Italy Malvasia di Casorzo $8.50 for a glass of this Bubble.  I thought it tasted like a sparkly grape juice.  One unisex bathroom in the back to the left.  Didn't see light switch only a bunch of lighted candles.  Some tables in the back.  Many board games if you want to hang out.  Recommended probably if in the area, not worth a special trip.

h7atOV8zsclfn_9Rm0BC9Q.review_text: I thought "candybar".... it will be fun, inviting, have alot of fun deserts to choose from and be a really cool casual atmosphere.  Not the case...   This place seemed more geared to the after Nopa crowd than anyone else. It's pricey, has super small poritions, and is a little stuffy.   the deserts are awesome, although expensive and tiny.

BbG-saP_hHFS62OQMIBNsA.review_text: This place is by far the best spot in SF when you are craving dessert, an after dinner drink, art, and a board game!   For those of us who live near Divisadero, this is a local favorite and such a treat to have in the neighborhood! After dinner at any of the amazing nearby restaurants, this is the perfect place to wind down at the end of the night. If a glass of wine, or champagne paired with delish and artistic desserts in an art gallery isn't enough, they have dozens of board games at your disposal!  My favorite mellow nights involve all of the above and a fierce game of connect 4!

6OaTrornYAPhU-M7A8wubg.review_text: Candybar offers a huge variety of desserts with unique twists. It's a great place to take a date after dinner or hang out with some girlfriends.  I had the Candybar Dessert for Two Sampler for $25 to share, which includes four choices of select desserts. We opted for the apple a la mode, honey-almond panna cotta, tiramisu, and strawberry limeade. The apple a la mode was probably the best of the four. It had hazelnuts in the cake for some texture, and the cake itself was very moist. The caramel sauce gave the cake a slight sweetness, and the gingerbread ice cream was a nice topping. The next best one would be the honey-almond panna cotta. It was very soft and light, and the almond flavor was very mild. It also came with fresh berries and a scoop of chocolate ice cream. I thought the tiramisu was a little dry. Usually they have a lot of mascarpone filling, but Candybar's tiramisu didn't. Also, it was chocolate-rum flavored, so it was too rich for me. I wasn't a big fan of the strawberry limeade either. It's supposed to be strawberry mousse with vanilla cake, but I found it overall too mushy. It was also a little sour because of the calamansi cream, which is not a taste I generally like for desserts.  I most likely wouldn't come to Candybar again for desserts, but instead for their cocktails and old school board games. At this fun, unique dessert house, it's all about the atmosphere. But good luck trying to find parking in this neighborhood (NOPA = NO Parking Available)! And come early, around 7PM or earlier, to avoid the wait.

0OW9GBkUAcob-mzObmQAWQ.review_text: I happened to go to the grand public opening of Candybar.  My friend SL introduced me to her buddy Bubbly Ev, Ev-ervescent, if you will.  Ev happens to be a friend of the owners so she gave me a little insight on the place here and there.  The team of siblings all work together to make their Candybar project a success.  It no doubt shows from the windows to the walls to the sweet caramel drops on balls (or rather, canape of coconut sorbet).  The space is aesthetically minimalistic yet cozy, from the white art on white walls, to the mini-sized desserts, to the limited seating.  All the mesmerizing artwork is done by one of the sisters who happens to moonlight as part of the wait staff.  Take a peek into the peephole when you get a chance.  It was a tad cramped being the grand opening, hopefully it stays that way.  We selected a few desserts and wines to try, My weapon of choice was the chocolate brioche.  All the goodies were tasty, but the brioche was the winner in my polls.  Kudos to the pastry chef!  Perhaps I should've had a Riesling, but the Cab I had was quite good.  Hell, I know next to nothing about wine.  But I was told their sommelier comes from French Laundry.  I think that means something.  Why they have wine racks in the restroom defies my logic however. (They were empty, but still, eww).  The beer selection was quite interesting, I'll have to come back to try a few dozen.  Candybar is "Dessert, Wine, Art" according to their website.  It's a simple equation and Candybar delivers.  Thanks Ev for the introduction!

IJABCqLsGgT8DxqujUQmiA.review_text: The ambiance is very nice here and I love the concept. I'm thrilled the menu has both savory and sweet dishes. The service was OK at the table but the bartender was on it. That all being said: waaaay over-priced. None of the desserts blew me away (and one was actually terrible).   Finally, wtf is up with being closed on Tuesdays?? I thought Monday was the dark night for most places?

0RJKcyQDc0g_Hbg5xThV5A.review_text: Very nice place to chill, love their dessert, it is pretty and delicious. Area and neighborhood are good looking for parking, will go back for dessert sometimes.

Hc1VOdWgLIZ4ZeK83iGM_Q.review_text: At last! I get to try this place out with my good friends! :D  Came here for dessert after a delicious meal at Roam Burger (check it out!). We were immediately seated down in the booth where our server gave us plenty of time to decide what to get.  We ordered:  Strawberry Limemade: Nice moist cake with strawberries, cream and strawberry mousse. This dessert was good but a bit on the sour side for me. If you like sour foods and candies, get this. If you like a little bit of sour, share this. Definitely don't recommended getting for yourself if you don't like sour too much.  Macaron Sandwich- SO DELICIOUS!!! Yes, caps lock were necessary because the macaron sandwich was A-M-A-Z-I-N-G. I guess they change the flavors of the ice cream sandwiches frequently but at the time, I got the almond macaron with melon ice cream in it. The sandwich was plated on a bed of chocolate ganache and sprinkled with diced melons. The macaron was nice and chewy and the melon ice cream was...drools... so fresh and light! The chocolate ganache added more sweetness to the plate and the melon cubes were just a nice crunch to the dish. ***RECOMMENDED***  Lavender Honey Creme Fraiche Semi Freddo- Least favorite dessert from here. Never been a fan of flowers yet alone anything that taste like it. Since my friend ordered this, I felt obligated to at least try it. The dessert was very light but I wasn't a fan of the taste (for obvious reasons). The almond brittle on the other hand, was so yummy! It added a nice sweet crunch to the dish since the main attraction of the dish was so light. Get this if you like lavender flavored foods!  Tips:  ~Come here when they open to avoid waits since guests here have a 2 hour limit once seated (people will actually stay that long).  ~Happy Hour from 6pm-8pm! 3 bucks for sparkling wines and sangrias.  ~Get more bang for your buck and get the dessert for two! ( I couldn't get it due to livingsocial deal restrictions).
