RApl7nHRKWM8jOFDNfr1dA.review_text: Really inventive desserts and good service.  Casual atmosphere.  Someone has GOT to tell the bartender to wear higher waisted pants or at least underwear.  It really ruins the atmosphere having to look at the plumber's butt behind the bar!

ZpJpq9bOOOkObXVLlUoS_w.review_text: The management needs to rethink the customer experience, because not everything seems well thought out. The quality of service is mediocre. We, a group of 15, asked for water several times and eventually received 6 glasses and 1 standard size carafe, no beuno. Many of the desserts were ill thought combinations of east-west fusion. They seemed more into bringing unique looking and sounding combinations to the table than delicious ones. If you want to push the envelope with flowerless chocolate cake -the cake needs to be extraordinary first. No one in my party could figure out what flavor of ice cream came with it... something like ginger lobster salmon bisque. When it melted and slid into the cake I had to stop eating it for fear of becoming nauseated.

am2UDS4eHmL99dEDzUVeSQ.review_text: This is the type of candy bar that adults can fall in love with..   Candybar is the quintessential adult dessert bar because there is great music, comfortable seating, and a well-executed menu.  My tastings of the desserts hover within the B+ to A- range.  I appreciate the art displayed throughout the bar, and I really love the cocktails.  This would be the perfect place for a date, a group of friends, or even a sneak-away for that hard working individual.  I can't wait to venture back again--I even wish I bought a second Groupon (ya know, for a "friend").

yr6VuOwJeR2RSRBuOfyOOQ.review_text: Really cute place for a date night or girl's night out!! A sexy lounge with dim lighting and sultry music that serves sweets and drinks... sounds like a win win to me :)  I came on a gno since I was visiting friends in SF. We arrived at around 10pm on a Friday night, so we unfortunately missed happy hour. Wait was about fifteen minutes. Their happy hour deals on the drinks seem amazing btw and I definitely suggest you check it out if you live in the area.  For drinks I recommend sticking to the martinis or bubbly drinks. One of my friends got a creamsicle like drink and it was just way too sweet. Delicious for the first sip and then pure diabetes if you try to finish it. I enjoyed my Just Peachy martini and thought it had the perfect amount of alcohol and sweetness to counterbalance. It also looked so cute with a little peach ring candy as decoration.  Tiramisu - It was WAY too heavy for my taste. They put a thick layer of extremely rich chocolate on top of the tiramisu cake that just ruined it for me.  Drunken S'more - Pretty good but the caramel baileys sauce they put all over it is extremely sweet. Something to share between others so you don't get an extreme sugar high afterwards.  Peanut Butter Jelly Time was my favorite out of three!! Perfect amount of sweetness and it definitely reminds you of a favorite childhood snack. :)  Recommend to enjoy some desserts and drinks with friends as you catch up over gossip or some of their many board games! Definitely something fun to check out when you don't want to go to your average bar or club.

9VVJ7GUnV4b_pmpAKzIflQ.review_text: This is by far the cutest places I have been for a relaxing night now with friends!  The waiters are very nice and can recommend great desserts to try, yet all of them are delicious.   I am sad that it is such a small place! it has a dim setting, very romantic if your on a date or just want a nice chill setting with friends.There are quite a few tables with couches and comfy chairs. You can re-live the past and bring back those childhood memories by playing the classic family games such as candy land, connect four, etc!   They have a wine and beer selection and of course a dessert section to die for and fruity alcoholic mixes to complement.  Overall satisfied and WILL come again!

sd4E5iKUZotDEeiF3cC81Q.review_text: CALL THE FIRE STATION!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! CALL THE POLICE!!!! CALL THE AMBULANCE!!! CALL YOUR MOM! CALL YOUR DAD!!  CALL YOUR ENTIRE LINE OF RELATIVES!!!! this place is FLAMINNNN' ON FIREEEEEEEE! Came here on a Saturday night with my Yelp friend, Ben T, and a couple of our other friends right as they're about to close! THANK YOU BEN T. for getting us in! This is by far the HOTTEST dessert joint/ bar I have ever been to and I am a complete fan girl of it now! Best place to get some exotic desserts, with a side of a drink, AND enjoy some fun board games as well. I believe their menu changes every now and then, because I could not find the desserts I saw on yelp before, HOWEVER, the ones I got was enough to shut me up! Rose Vanilla Panna Cotta: $10. 5stars. Panna cotta is an Italian dessert that mixes cream, milk, and sugar with gelatin. It came with three pieces of panna cotta, peaches soaked in red wine reduction, cookie crumbles, and a cracker. Everything meshed together like a perfect combination. This was definitely my favorite dish of the night! yelp.com/biz_photos/cand… Strawberry Limeade: $9. 5 stars. A cute jar of strawberry mousse, vanilla cake, calamansi cream, and strawberries. It actually had a hint of acidity at the bottom of the jar and it was like the experience of drinking strawberry limeade except in solid form (easier for me to swallow whole *winkwink*)! It was WONDERFUL!. The strawberry mousse was very fluffy and everything was PERFECTLY sweet/sour. yelp.com/biz_photos/cand… Drunken S'mores: $10. 3.5 stars. My friend ordered this and I had a taste however, it wasnt my favorite. But it's probably because I'm not a fan or TOO much chocolate. It consisted of a tart like bottom layer with marshmallow and hot chocolate melted over it with a side of salted caramel. yelp.com/biz_photos/cand… Flourless Chocolate Banana Torte: $10. 3.5 stars. Again, I am not a fan of chocolate cakes, even if i LOVE chocolates, but this was pretty good! It was my first time having a flourless cake! It came with pineapple pieces, peanuts, chantilly, and vanilla bean ice cream. yelp.com/biz_photos/cand… TIPS: -Give yourself at last 30 min to look for parking on weekends -it is about a 45min wait, EXPECT IT, dont complain. -DONT come on the weekends! haha.. THERES A LINE OUT THE DOOR!   -dont come in an hour before they're closing, you will probably not get in (LESSON LEARNED, thank you again Ben T for saving us!) -try whatever has an asterisk on there, its usually really good i think.. haha -BRING YO MULA,CREDIT CARDS, DEBIT CARDS TO SPEND ON THEM DESSERTS HERE!

ZO7Ab3yRzvThVZ1X9ZwNEg.review_text: I was back in town for the weekend and decided to catch up with an old friend over dessert at Candybar.  As soon as we sat down, the server asked if we were ready to order. I told him I didn't know what was good since it was our first time. I asked him for recommendation, and he just said he'd give us a few more minutes to think and proceeded to walk away. Didn't take that too personally. But he didn't come back for a good 15 minutes. We ended up having to ask for him to return.  My friend and I both ordered an Apple A La Mode. I didn't like how strong the ginger taste was (really not a ginger fan) and the overall taste of the dessert, which is unfortunate since I'm usually a huge fan of Apple A La Mode desserts. We initially asked another worker, but she refused to help us and redirected us to our server. But, my friend kept hers.  We waited too long and I ended up asking him to just cancel the order. He still brought it out... I told him I didn't want it anymore and he took it away without saying a word to me. Two seconds later, he brought us the check.  An hour later.. now, my friend (who kept her dessert) ends up with food poisoning.

hN8CP0yR_QS1o8Npe1-lcg.review_text: went on a friday night and parking was a pain. desserts and drinks were pricey and too sweet.  the white sangria was very weak, and i'm a super lightweight when it comes to alcohol. the low tables also made it difficult to eat. no real reason to come back.

AjHFgLursLNKyzsqG_Y4VA.review_text: Is it just me, or has the visual appeal of the desserts seems to have gotten a bit simpler from what I recall years ago? Oh well. My cocktail, the CB Mule, was a refreshing lime and ginger beer mix. The smores dessert was not bad and sweet, although the crust was a little softer than I probably would've preferred, and wish it were a bit more graham cracker-y.  Be prepared for all the desserts to be quite sweet! I'd give this place 3.5 stars if I could. Came here on a Wednesday a bit after 8 (after happy hour ended), got quickly seated, and the place filled up pretty well within the next hour. Probably best to go during happy hours, when the cocktails are roughly half off.

pjkU2Ev_-DtSkDINNTdRSw.review_text: Great idea. Miserable execution.  Candybar has only a beer and wine license, so their "cocktails" are limited to sparkling wine concoctions. Every drink on the menu has either syrup, sugar, sorbet, sherbet, or ice cream added to it. Ugh. Luckily, they had sangria, which was pretty good, but otherwise stay away from the "cocktails" unless you want to go into a sugar coma.  Their desserts are way overstated -- just enormous portions of sugar -- a lot like the cocktails, actually. (And this is a sugar-junkie talking so it must have been pretty bad.)   Dear Candybar, 1. Hire a pastry chef. 2. Make desserts smaller. 3. Balance desserts with a mint leaf or a pinch of salt (seriously). 4. Get a liquor license. 5. See # 1.

S-3Z8u8lUW7T71CRRH2G5Q.review_text: I love the Candy Bar!  I've been eyeing this place for awhile, but every time i'm in the city, I have to leave before this place opens. However.. my fiance took me here for my birthday this year. Thank goodness my bday was on a thursday cause I got to have a taste of their happy hour goodness!  I always wanted to find the Kung Fu Taco truck in the financial district but I seriously never find it. But to my surprise.. the roach coach was sitting right in front of the Candy Bar. Score! Had a couple of the asian asadas and seriously devoured them!  From the Candy Bar itself, I ordered the Peanut Butter Jelly time! Soooo good! Definitely hit this place up during happy hour. So worth it :)

RZmbigUJ14cV75D8W53sQA.review_text: I wish this place was closer to my neighborhood! Kevin H. and I came to the neighborhood as I had a groupon to redeem (but we were one day late - blast!) We had a light dinner at Nopa across the way and saved room for candy bar. We each had champagne cocktails (Strawberry Kiss is definitely the signature drink) and split the dessert sampler like fat kids. It was so much dessert! Everything was very flavorful and distinct. I really enjoyed the lemon dessert and Kevin H. loved the chocolate. Per usual. I think next time we would definitely just get one dessert, time our arrival for happy hour, and bring some friends to play board games!

bWvHrPWRyKRTj9J2IgF63g.review_text: I love the concept of this place more than anything. The idea of a dessert bar is pretty genius in my opinion. However, it all comes down to the food. Keep in mind, I went in to eat a while ago (about six months ago, when it was relatively new) so they may have tweaked a few things.   We went on a Friday night. It was fairly busy, but we were able to get a table. The service was so-so starting out. It got progressively better throughout the night. In fact, the owner was our waiter. Three of us split seven plates. I think three savory and four sweet. The highlight being the dark & white chocolate figs. All in all, the food was executed fairly well and the flavor pairings were interesting, but nothing really blew me away. Not to mention the fact that the seven plates (actually five total, b/c two were comped...yes, knowing ppl in the restaurant business has it's perks) plus one cocktail = a pretty big bill.   My advice is to take a trip to candybar if you are in an adventurous mood for something sweet.

KnXAPzr0Xj0VGWld5_QRFg.review_text: Came on a Sunday night and was crowded with a wait. We were sat quickly b/c just two of us, but were two large groups waiting.  The service was extremely slow because there was only one person who was acting as host and server for the whole bar. When he came by to take our orders, he noted several of the desserts were out. We went with the drunken smores as recommended.  He then came by about 15 mins later and said they were actually out of it, so we decided on the passionfruit mousse. It was really sweet, and the passionfruit flavor was very strong. But good presentation and taste was good.  Overall good concept with drinks, dessert and games. Ideal for a date or catching up with the gals. Perhaps it was a bad night ,but service was slow and menu was lacking.

s81VRLqYFEpXPIQtGx2mnw.review_text: Candybar is a novel concept, being a late-night spot for drinks, sweets, and board games.  I was disappointed with the macarons, but the flour less chocolate torte was tasty.  I am not the biggest dessert person, so I focused on enjoying my coffee and board games instead.    Overall, cute and trendy!  With that comes a high price tag though, and parking took literally 40 minutes.  I'd honestly rather hang out at my local boba spot for board games and milk tea instead.  But if you're looking for a chill lounge that's not your usual bar, this might be a good option for you!

gsGfJwZarPg3usmPiT_clg.review_text: Candybar is an amazing find in the city. This charming little dessert, wine bar, coffee house is tucked away in NOPA waiting to be found. I came here last night with a few girlfriends for a bachelorette and can't wait to return again.  The Strawberry Kiss made me pucker my lips and make out with the glass. Normally I'm not a fan of "girly" drinks, but this one was perfect for the ambiance and helped resolve my taste buds after a French meal.   Thyme ice cream. I couldn't believe how good it was paired with ganache. After last night, I am a believer. We also ordered the banana dumplings and sweet potato pie. The sweet potato pie was paired with a lavender ice cream. Few places get lavender right, and Candybar certainly does that here. My dessert didn't taste like soap or potpourri. The banana dumplings were good, but wasn't my favorite because it lacked a bit of, well, sweetness. Something was missing... perhaps cinnamon? A dash of spice?   Either way, I'll definitely be back, especially for happy hour.

USZ6XUarw563pg1ON8TaVA.review_text: Perfect place to take a friend or lover! Amazing art, decadent dessert, board games and drinks, oh my! The only thing is the fact there was a wait but other than that I had a very good time ordering the "dessert for two". Top favorite of the night was the Lavender Honey Creme Fraiche semi freddo. Will definitely come again.  Quick tip: on weekends, expect this place to be packed after people get out of dinner.

E1Q5Ah-X7WQZiCuPEvk_BA.review_text: Come here with extremely low expectations and the Candybar will satisfy you. It is expensive, noisy, slightly on the dirty side and definitely overrated.   What we ordered: Mango tango Bellini Blu pom fusion   peanut butter jelly time Lavender semifreddo  Do not order what we did. You may escape the pain we went through. The peanut butter wasn't a mousse, the consistency resembled more of a sauce which filled up a typical tart crust toppled with a thick layer of defrosted frozen blackberries.   The semifreddo was served luke warm which was disgusting. It just seemed and tasted wrong. And on top of this, all the cups spoons and tables were sticky and seemed unwashed.

d-5gWThyELEJZdFKUx5Pzg.review_text: One of the more inventive dessert places in the city, Candybar boasts that it is "San Francisco's FIRST dessert lounge." I wonder if Elizabeth Faulkner has anything to say about that. But is her original joint a dessert place under the guise of a contemporary American cuisine restaurant? And what about the copious amounts of Asian Dessert shops? I guess they are hardly "lounges." Crème Brûlée CART anyone? I digress.   So for a dude that lives life on the savory side of things, a sweet shack has to be good and inventive to catch my attention. Results? Well, I ate the better part of the four desserts we ordered. The damage...   Poached Blood Orange and Lychee Fruit Salad - This dish was accented with a lychee granita and lavender ice cream. Very nice, robust flavors in the fruit finished with the smooth, silky lavender ice cream. The ice cream was so delicious I started eyeing my lavender soap when I got home.   900 Watt Almond Sponge Cake - Served with Greek yogurt, white chocolate, cherries, and cherry sorbet. The dish was @#$&in' genius with the fluffy cake, tart Greek yogurt, and sweet chocolate and cherries. And little did you know that whimsical looking fluffy cake was nuked. Hence the "900 Watt" in the name.   Beet Marscapone Mousse - served wrapped in a chocolate canoli this creation was a bit on the veggie side, but you still couldn't help but to eat the whole thing.   That dessert with the Thyme Ice Cream - It was chocolate something. I totally forget. That's because I was so completely engrossed with the Thyme Ice Cream. Like the lavender ice cream, this thyme counterpart was creamy and delicate in texture, but still maintained the overtones of the herb.  Candybar is a definite must try. The inventive dishes captivate you as they combine ingenuity, molecular gastronomy (google it), and some old-fashioned cajones (ca-Hoe-knees). And a big plus if you go with a pastry student. I wouldn't have known about the 900 Watts knowledge is she wasn't there...

-vTrhRbmEzB8Ax87bfL-qA.review_text: Cute little dessert bar recommended by some friends. Candybar is a great place for friends to get together for some sweets and have a drink.  I enjoyed their s'mores and apple a la mode. There are also some games you can pick up and play while you enjoy your desserts! What a hidden jewel! I definitely would visit again to try their other sweets and drinks.  4 STARS

LIa6lWwwufTrHFfaMt_4SQ.review_text: Came here to celebrate a girlfriend's birthday- perfect for a fun weeknight out and delicious cocktails/dessert. And BONUS- I didn't end up having dessert for dinner because of Kung Fu Taco truck right outside. The setup is cute and cozy inside and the service was attentive. Our waiter took the time to get to know us and helped us choose our desserts. We got there right at 7 just in time for Happy Hour=discounted drinks.   I had the white sangria and it was very refreshing- not too sweet either. We split 3 desserts- PB&J (this was my fave), Green Tea Bread Pudding, and the brownies. All were tasty and plenty to share for 4, not spectacular, but good.   4 stars for a novel idea (next time I def want to play some board games).

8rcQA6BIGgzTmBsi-MbSog.review_text: The desserts were presented nicely on the plate but a bit too sweet for me. Perfect for sharing with someone else. The Salted Caramel S'more dessert is to die for. I wanted to take one to go, I loved it so much. The Apple a la Mode was disgusting. Too many flavors caused them to clash. I loved the drinks. My sister got the peach martini and the a jasmine sparkling drink. I definitely loved the jasmine drink.   The art work on the walls were really cool. The ambiance was really relaxed and sophisticated at the same time. The service was alright, not the best that I have had, not really that bad either. In my opinion I thought it was quite slow. The prices for the drinks and desserts were a bit high. I think they could have offered a bit more for the price they were asking.   Another negative about the bar was the fact that my sister and I were seated right near the front door. The door kept opening and it just happened to be the coldest night of the year in December and it was very unpleasant. We could have moved to another table, I guess but it would have been awkward because we would have been too close to other groups of people. I think that that was the thing that I did not enjoy about this place.   So overall, split the desserts because they are really sweet.  The drinks are great, try the Jasmine sparkling drink.  Sit in a booth away from the door to keep from getting cold.   I would love to go here again so that I can sit in a more comfortable spot.

d1VXeXMq67_QgdvWY1tcKQ.review_text: It really depends on the chef. When I went before the most recent chef change, the desserts were extremely innovative, and had all sorts of interesting flavors.  When I went last week, the whole menu selection was a giant "meh", and it tasted like it too.  The drinks, however, are consistently awesome.

V2w-JMKtYisBl7b8lyMowQ.review_text: Gotta say, wasn't a bad way to spend an evening! Got the Gilt City coupon forever ago and had to use it before it expired at the end of the month. The Fiancee and I each had a cocktail and shared the Dessert Platter for Two. Let me tell you, the Strawberry Limeade was fantastic! Sweet, but not sickly sweet.....My fave out of the four we got. Also sampled the Tiramisu, Flourless Chocolate Cake, and the Apple a la mode.   Cute place, kinda small, but I would go back again if I wanted dessert, and especially if I had the coupon. Without it, the bill would have been $40+ tip.

wpTZdFaOITAco8evnTtBUA.review_text: $2 sangria happy hour special plus board games and delicious desserts? Where do I sign up?!  I came here for the first time last night and I can safely say that my life is better for it. My friend and I had $2 sangrias (happy hour special from 6-8pm) filled with fresh fruit, and split a rich chocolate cake and ice cream dessert which just melts in your mouth.  To top it off, we played some intense games of Blockus and Connect 4! What a novel idea! Who doesn't love board games, desserts, and alcohol?   The ambiance is very chill here and I really like the chic decor. The dim lighting and art on the walls make for an ideal date venue.  Prices are reasonable and location is convenient, right off of Divisadero on Fulton.    I'm a fan and I'll be coming back! :)

GwcmbTQ56nTt_ra_BmRIoA.review_text: This place is cute! I  came here this past Saturday night and it was  packed with people... possibly due to the opening weekend. Despite the loud noise and people standing everywhere, the staff was wonderful and friendly!! The gentlemen at the front, possibly the owner and the waitress at our table were very hospitable.   I had ordered the chocolate brioche and the vanilla cake. Both were delicious. If you love chocolate, I highly recommend the brioche. It's a soft chocolate cake served with caramel ice cream. The vanilla cake was paired with thin slices of mangoes.   The portion is enough to share for two... just enough for you wanting to come back for more.  This place is great for small groups, girls night out here is perfect, with your significant other or even a date! (*brownie points!)  It did take a while for us to receive our check but we passed time by playing one of their several board games stacked on the shelf - Connect 4!   Great desert, wine list & a place to hang out to relax over life's greatest  treasures...sweets!   Btw, if you do want to bring your kids, it might be best to bring them right when it opens before people arrive for evening drinks.

SoJHQBDACtHUVEPhr8jWEQ.review_text: Delicious AND fun! I was so impressed by the decor and how swanky it was. It felt like a bar with candy...hence, I guess...candyBAR.  Friend had a LivingSocial deal that we used for 2 drinks and 2 desserts. Even though there was 3 of us, they were kind enough to let us use it. If you're into girly-fruity drinks, this is your place! We got the mango tango and the lychee cocktail, and they were both amazing. Tasted like candy.  The desserts were of a good portion and the three of us ate until we were stuffed WHILE playing board games I loooove that we can pretend we're all hip and cool while playing childhood favorites. This is the life.

e8vBrfCDWjLl3I-okJu0gw.review_text: The Place is SWEET.  BUT...the Parking around the place on a Saturday night HELLA sucks.    Really kills the mode of the night.  It's not Candybar's fault.  We started at 9:30pm, found parking a little shy of 10:00pm.  No. Joke.  Just letting folks know how it was.  Had to circle the Divis streets for 30 minutes just to find parking.  Literally every other venue around the area is competing with each other and the residents who live around the area too.    Some might say it's "The City" and thats how it is...but I'm an SF native born and raised, and this part of the City has the worst parking at night.    Good luck.    You've been alerted about the conditions.  May parking karma be with you.  Now, if you can bare the difficulty in your long quest to find parking, and happy to win the parking lotto that night, Candybar is a nice, intimate spot that you can eat some sweets, drink some suds, and play some board games with your buds.   Very casual place.  the staff was very nice.  served us well.    The game we played was similar to the one in Inglorious Basterds.  Candybar has a deck of cards with historical figures on them, in place of the regular kings, queens, jacks and numbers.  So, we picked out a few familiar faces, and names.  Charles Dickens, Alfred Nobel, Leonardo Di Vinci, Claude Monet, and even Chair Mao to name a few.  We faced the cards down, each picked one, and placed them on our foreheads, hidden from our own view.  And turn by turn (2 questions each, a round) we asked, if he was a scientist, or did he/she write a book?  and then you get the idea...  This was enjoyable.  And this joy took place at Candybar SF.  Hope you find the same, right after you find parking.

dZ_vY_bpPx-YnjYg0M_-yg.review_text: Desserts, cocktails, and board games! Some of the best things in life! I had high expectations for Candybar, and though I didn't fall head over heels in love, I definitely have a huge crush on this place. The presentation and the idea behind  the desserts is lust worthy. Taste wise, the desserts are a mixed bag. The strawberry limeade is delicious, I usually like chocolate-y desserts better, but this one is worth it! The Candybar hot chocolate was average - I would say skip it since you're probably already going to get some cocktails. Drinking hot chocolate and alcohol side by side is just weird. The ice cream sundae was good - the brownie was not as soft as I would have liked but the ice cream was really good! The Candybar lemon drop shot is YUMMY, you don't taste the alcohol at all it's just like a shot of deelicious lemonade! I loved the triple chocolate bellini all this chocolate-y goodness spiked with the perfect amount of sparkling wine is just pure lusciousness.  The mango tango bellini was the fruity version of the chocolate bellini, and it was very good as well! If the couch-y seats are available, I would highly recommend getting one of those especially if you come with a large group of people. They are very cozy and intimate and add to the overall experience. This place is great because it feels like a classier version of a stay in type of Friday night - you still have the comfort of great dessert, company, and board games but you get to look cute and enjoy the city!  Candybar gets four stars for the overall experience it offers and their yummy cocktails! Oh and the waiters are beautiful. Trust me.

VvPjJBX_bU3UK0-OltaAYQ.review_text: Quality - excellent; service - great; atmosophere - fun. It's just too darned expensive! Yes, the desserts I sampled were all pretty great (though our group consensus was to avoid the carrot that accompanies the goat cheesecake). But really, the portions are tiny compared to the price. Not that I want to add myself to America's obesity crisis, but still.   I also really hate having to eat something when not seated at a real table. I felt all hunched over in our little booth, hoping I wouldn't drip on myself or the furniture. If I go back to Candybar it will be for a relaxed drink and I'll likely skip the dessert just based on my own personal stinginess.

xn1FzYlw9Nf4-yHUibC59g.review_text: I was pretty excited to try this place and had really high expectations walking in here since I love dessert.  I found myself being somewhat disappointed.    The decor was a little off for me when we walked in.  It has a lounge type of feel but the white walls and no music playing made it just feel off.  It overhead lamps with the light bouncing off the white walls made it too bright.  The music came on shorter after we got there.  I guess that made it better then.    So we got the menu and it had a dessert tasting menu and then a la carte.  I love tasting menus - you get to try a little bit of everything.  On the back menu, they had a small savory section with spiced almonds, romaine salad, carrot soup, duck liver mousse, and cheese plate.  The selection seems a bit awkward.  This is definitely not a place for a meal and it's suppose to be a dessert/wine bar.  What the heck is the salad, carrot soup, and duck liver mousse doing on the menu?  I think they're trying too hard to put a little of this and that, and the menu seems discoordinated.  So between us 2 couples, we ordered 2 tasting menus, where it comes with a shot of lemonade, 2 desserts that you choose from a list of about 10 things, and then a cup of malted milk with a cookie.  We also ordered a side of spiced almonds, coffee, cappuccinos, and a glass of wine.  We also asked for water, which never came and we asked for it at the end when we were done with the drinks we ordered.  The almonds came first and they were good, just small portion.  Then came the coffee and cappuccinos.  The cappuccino was served in this big ole coffee cup and filled up 1/2 way.  I was expecting it to come in a small, cappuccino cup with the coffee/foam filled to the top.   Wrong choice of cup and the cappuccino was lukewarm.    Then the lemonade arrived shortly.  It tasted more like sugar water with a hint of lemon.  I think they should have brought the lemonade first as a starter and then bring the coffee with the dessert.  I did like that they brought the first course dessert first rather than having 2 desserts come at once side by side.   The chevre cheesecake had good texture, silky smooth.  I liked it til I tasted the goat/sheep milk in the cheese.  I didn't like the cheese selection they used to make the cheesecake.    We also had the carrot cake baked Alaska, which had carrot cake, some ice cream, and then a layer of torced cream.  This was pretty good, probably my favorite of the night.    Then we had the warm vanilla cake with pickled mango.  The cake was good but the mango did not go well with it at all.  The combination was just off.    We also had the chocolate brioche with balsamic caramel ice cream.  I didn't taste balsamic at all and the brioche looked more like a brownie wedge and the texture was like it too.  Brioche is suppose to be airy, not dense.  So while this dish was decent, it threw me off guard.  It didn't meet the expectations of what I envisioned.  Last but not least, the malted milk was too sweet and the peanut butter cookie had this funky Indian spice added to it.  The flavor did not go well, although I give them kudos for trying new ideas.  Now to the service - not very good.  As mentioned earlier, we didn't get our water til we asked at the end of dessert when we asked for it upfront.  The servers did not pay attention to our table to clear the plates when we were done after each course.  They took the plates as they brought the next dish, so we had to help them pick up the finished plates while they tried to put down the next dishes.  Lastly, the servers didn't dress "professionally".  The guy behind the bar was in some Addidas top and another guy was in some worn out jeans and rolled up his sleeves.  I think they're the owners, which makes me think, rather than dressing how you would on a regular day, you should dress better to set a good example for your staff to follow.  So all in all, I give them 3 stars for the idea/concept of a dessert/wine bar and 2 stars off for lack of service and weird decor.  I really did want to like this place.  Sorry...

lIhBq2C-6PWQGS07IUUXKQ.review_text: "you girls must be really hungry and thirsty!"  That's what the waiter said when we finished ordering 2 desserts and the dessert for two and 4 drinks. I didn't know their desserts were that huge.   We had girls night and girls talk! LOVE~   Try to make it to their Happy Hour! So much cheaper!

gvuvcjAVl1ElyXTgU80VRg.review_text: Place is definitely overrated and the two stars are for the idea and ambiance.  This would've been the perfect dream place to be at for late night dessert or a date night except their desserts are horrible and prices are way high.   One word of advice....DONT GET THE ICE CREAM Sandwich.....melon or cucumber or whatever the hell I got does not flow with the macaron shell chocolate cake was basic and not amazing..the tiramisu was the only thing I thought that was decent.

VETVi6kZdECyOLEMz2UVBQ.review_text: The dessert and cocktail are good  . Staff is friendly but took a lot of time finding parking..

llgf6PyH959RyLVZYY_CeQ.review_text: fancy desserts. fancy libations. boardgames?!  is this heaven?  had a lovely time here with my friends eating delicious sugary treats, sipping on sparkly booze and playing the most epic game of UNO ever. (1 star less for the lighting. yeah dim lighting is ultra hip and trendy, but how are you gonna have a dark room and play games!? kinda hard. we kept getting confused with blues and greens. haha)  anyways, come here to have some fun. oh and order the APPLE A LA MODE. you wont regret it.

JYDVoFrHk1CHGOCCo7TsJQ.review_text: I suspect CandyBar was created with the idea that it'd be a great place to take a girl on a date. Sweet desserts and sparkling cocktails, low lighting and local art work lines the walls, and in case your date needs some help with conversation they have stacks of boardgames to spur the conversation. Well it sounds like a good idea, but there a couple things that could be better. 1. Drinks: all of thier chanpagne cocktails are SUPER sweet 2. Desserts are over loaded with flavor combinations (apples, gingerbread ice cream, dates/nut compote...) 3. Servers made us feel rushed even before we ordered our drinks. 4. Close the back door! The draft was freezing and the shady van that pulled up. I hope they were a restaurant supplier.   So all in all, not somewhere I'm dying to go back to but it maybe some other girls' vibe so guys I wouldn't write it off.   PS they do have happy hour every night until 8pm...$4 cocktails instead of $8

jnmczPEkhRsUFos_nBPjTA.review_text: Candybar is definitely the perfect SETTING for a date. Small cozy room, dark wood tables, comfortable seating, fun music, dim light and board games. I got there at 9:15 on a Wednesday evening and there was a line. The host said it was not worth getting on the wait list as they close at 10 pm and there were quite a few people waiting already. I decided to hang out and wait for my date anyway, and I ended up getting a table by the time he arrived. Persistence pays! ;-)  We started with the drinks and while my date ordered the Raspberry Delight (sparkling wine and raspberry syrup), I chose the red sangria. I loved my sangria, but he was not a big fan of his cocktail, although he did agree that he had chosen something too sweet anyway.  Then the whole picking a dessert dilemma! There were so many options and they all seemed - and looked - so good! We chose to share the Japanese Cheesecake (graham cracker streusel, honeydew, champagne granita, guava sorbet) since we both love cheesecake. What a big $10 disappointment! The cake had a 'sponge texture' and was tasteless. The guava sorbet was good, but didn't necessarily complement the cheesecake. I was so confused and disappointed as the place is all about desserts! Was it only the cheesecake??? But now after reading some or the reviews I realized other fellow yelpers had the same experience with other options. That's really too bad.  I would come back to candybar for a drink and to enjoy the romantic ambiance. As to the desserts, I will pass...:-(

0azsHEPpsGYfIXh9dlugHQ.review_text: I went on the Tuesday after they opened - the wine list was decent, and somewhat reasonably priced, and we were seated quicker than I expected. Then we waited. For a really.long.time for a server to get our orders. They were standing around the bar chatting, which really put us off.   A party of three, with three glasses, three desserts and then a mid-range bottle between us = $200.   The chevre cheesecake was the best thing we had all night, but I don't think I'd go back- it's just cost prohibitive to hang out there regularly.

D8nt55Rvy5qo1p04UhfFkg.review_text: this is where i chose to spend my last night in SF before my move to san diego. first time with a girl's night out.  i loved the ambience of this place. great artwork (i esp love the 'starlight' piece..i want it sooooooo bad).- would look fantastic in my new apt. how do we make this happen??!  the desserts were served with great smiles and friendly service. presentation, lovely. we ordered the:  - japanese cheesecake & guava (i loved this because the cheese is very light and melts in your mouth, not all rich like american cheesecake. the guava ice cream....oh man, such a good pairing!)  oh man, i guess that plate was soo good i forgot what else we ordered. :) thumbs up! great for a date night! plus i had a great conversation with the most adorable gay couple who just moved to SF. congrats on your 5 years! great people come here.

WicnH-ajaE6im_WHLSYgVg.review_text: I came in with a party of three right after dinner. We ordered three cocktail drinks and the sampler dessert for two. Interestingly enough, our waiter told us that there's going to be a sharing fee because theres three of us but we r only ordering two people dessert portion. Then, I asked the waiter if there's going to be a sharing fee if we only order drinks and not the dessert and he told us "no". I got really confused because this is a bar/dessert place, why would there be a sharing fee to begin with? On top of it, we did order three cocktail drinks! I would understand if we only ordered dessert for two people. The mango drink was good but the service and the restaurant policy is horrible! Never coming back again.

IkoXyeNTHqpU24dHKmIcrw.review_text: You know what I like?  I like focus.  Now pardon me while the rest of this review has absolutely no focus whatsoever.  When I was living in a tiny little city called Boston (back when I was a wee lad), my friends and I used to frequent a venue called Limbo.  Limbo had a basement floor that had live jazz music playing most nights of the week (including the weekly open mic night with amazing talent).  We either started or ended almost every night out at Limbo because the feel was just ... damn cool.  Fast forward six+ years to a recent excursion I made to Western Addition and you'll know why this place gets five stars.  I could go through the list of specific and very particular reasons why this place gets the coveted five stars (I don't give them out too often); but at the end of the day, it's just a god damn cool place.  Where else can you have a glass of superb wine, grab Connect Four or Monopoly off the shelf and play with some friends while eating a Chocolate Mousse spiced with paprika?  Where else can you roll in for happy hour and have your fill of $2 sangrias?  Did I mention they have both white wine AND red wine sangria?  They don't descriminate...!  Where else can you cozy up in a sultry corner with a beautiful woman with a little romantic lighting to accent the mood?  Where else can you get all of these things in one place that's a classy joint that's just downright cool?    I honestly don't know.  But for now, the owners of this wonderfully decorated and chilled out establishment have won me over.  Tan and Chris are really going for a different vibe here and I like what they've done so far.  Oh yeah, about that whole focus thing: they only serve desserts.  And god damn, it's some good shit.  They're focused.  I like that.  Ooo... there's a hummingbird out my window...

FsLRE98uOHkBNzO1Ta5hIw.review_text: Do you enjoy games? Do you eat dessert? Come to candybar! Candybar is a fun little hangout, fully stocked with different board/card games, unique desserts and cocktails. This is my special occasion dessert destination. The champagne is quality, the dessert portions are small but satisfying. Great non alcoholic concoctions as well. Ideal place for a first date! Staff is sweet and doesn't rush you out of the joint if your in the middle of a game.

Ci5aHpAdMGlhXpN_LI7qaw.review_text: Dessert, cocktails, and board games, oh my!    Candybar was a really fun and yummy experience.  From the moment we stepped in, it was like being transported to a different world, a bubble where all you do is eat dessert, challenge your friends to a game of Connect 4, test your pop culture knowledge with Scene It?, and drink some tasty libations.    The sampler is the way to go - 4 for $25.  Portions are smaller, but you get to sample more.  Here's what we had on our most recent visit:   Big Francesco's Tiramisu - Coffee Chiffon, Chocolate and Rum Mascarpone Cream, Coffee Bits, Chocolate -- The coffee bits were a nice touch, really sealing in all the flavors together.   Peanut Butter Jelly Time! - chocolate tart, peanut butter cream, salted candied peanuts, blackberries -- This was my absolute fave, one I wouldn't have minded having a "full" portion of.    Apple a la Mode - hazelnut crust, cream cheese filling, caramel, gingerbread ice cream -- It was good, not great.  The gingerbread ice cream was good, but overall the dish was just a smidge too sweet.   Lavender Honey Creme Fraiche Semi Freddo - almond brittle, nutella powder, cantaloupe -- This semi freddo was delish.  The brittle, nutella powder (!), and cantaloupe were great accompaniments.    Kir Royale - sparkling wine, creme de cassis -- Glug glug glug *burp* All Gone. More please. :)

Q_rLU91XQYgI6FZPf4JfZg.user_location: West Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
Q_rLU91XQYgI6FZPf4JfZg.review_text: Came here with friends and family for my sister's surprise birthday...I loove the idea/theme of the place!! Booze and dessert, what else can you ask for?! Even though it's a small area, it's very nicely decorated. The menu is simple but has enough variety to choose from too. The strawberry kiss cocktail was SO good, I seriously couldn't stop drinking. I literally kept ordering them, one after another, until people started to worry. She got a special kind of red velvet cake since it was her birthday and it was so yummy. I wish I hadn't drank so much so I could've tried more desserts :P

6_VkzelWeSHzjTVDlGl-Ug.review_text: Dessert: 1.) Sunday = was the best dessert. I wouldn't get any thing else the next time I ever come here.  2.) Rose thing = Tasted like rose...   SERVICE: Good. They have table service.   ATMOSPHERE: Atmosphere is very cute. Very date spot. Casual but nice, dim romantic lighting.. cool artwork on the walls... they have boardgames avail here but I don't think it's exactly the  right place to play games.

zYJgtlVZLYVrxleKpZ20vA.review_text: Nice place, good atmosphere but disappointing. To be a legit dessert destination, you have to do 3 things well - dessert, drinks and coffee. We tried the first two and didn't find it to be anything special. It's not a bad neighborhood spot, but I wouldn't go out of my to seek this place out again. Parking was also a nightmare. We another groupon to use so we'll be back. Will try something else... maybe I'll change my mind.

aNExhM1VYsCJt82kOm61fw.review_text: Happy hour from 6-8 sparkling and bubbly half off including house wine too.   Desserts were delicious, not too sweet and refreshing! Lovely design placement. 4 desserts for $25 to share. Just enough for two! Additional share more than two is $5/pp  Japanese cheesecake, flour-less chocolate cake, strawberry limeade and tiramisu. All delicious but depending on your mood of which will be your favorite.   Board games, art and books are available for use while you're there.   Wine, desserts, games and great company. What a great combo! =)

KdWyen8-pFGa9P7SyR8mDA.review_text: This place has been a little hyped up.   The food: The desserts were good, but not great. My friends and I had the banana bread pudding and the chocolate mousse.  They have a some girly looking drinks with not much alcohol in them and the customary beer selection.   The atmosphere: The bonus is that this is a rather relaxed place. The atmosphere allows you to chill-out and play board games or just talk with friends. The atmosphere is nice, but it still seems a little stuffy. I prefer places where it is less formal and this place is more just confusing.   For a better experience go to Fritz in Hayes Valley where your table is not beside the kitchen.   Definitely check the place out at least once. It is a great place to take a date after a movie or a show or just chill out with friends and feel a little classy too.

AE-ZrjW5HkZu1vOqZYNVOQ.review_text: It was ok. I had high hopes for a dessert place in sf but this was not great. Not bad either though...

ZEpYxzUL-xkJGCSH9Jctdg.review_text: This is one of my favorite places to go with friends. They have really creative desserts and fun drinks. It's a good place to relax and hang out and chat. The bartenders are all so nice and friendly.   The last time I went I lost my iPhone here, but even despite that, I would go back. It's that good.

pmKnNkGVgzhMkwJaTU5apA.review_text: I loved this place when I first saw it on yelp. I even got more excited when I saw a deal on Living Social so I bought it just to go here. This place makes me super cheerful and happy thinking about it! It is such a cute cute cute place for you and your significant other to go on a romantic date after dinner! :)   You could even come here with a group of girls (although the place is sort of small and can get squishy).  Being here made me feel like it was Valentine's Day and there were tons of couples surrounding me.   The wait wasn't too bad...but it does get pretty bad, me and the boy just got lucky. My deal gave us 2 cocktails and 2 desserts. I got the Lychee Martini and Honey-Almond Panna Cotta. Loved the Panna Cotta it was like a gelatin consistency. The boy got some sort of a sweet soda and the Soft Cheesecake. The cheesecake was too cheesy for me.   The only negative thing about this place is that it gets TOO SWEET! I mean I have the biggest sweet tooth but by the end of the night I was good. Getting a sweet fruity drink doesn't help you eat the dessert. If anything it adds too much sugar to your mouth. I couldn't even finish my desserts and I always eat it all!   Eating dessert can be really quick so it is cool Candybar provides board games! Although, all the good ones get taken really fast. I do want to come back here again since I like it soo much! It makes me really really happy.

6ftUbC0vARZTnWHPzZAzsA.review_text: Drinks: 2 - Way too sweet. The fruity ones tasted like a Juice Squeeze.  Desserts: 3 - Overrated. We tried the no-flour chocolate cake and the lavender fraiche--they just weren't that good. Definitely not worth the price.  Service: 3 - It took 15 minutes to wave someone down to get water while we were eating. I don't understand why they didn't give us water in the first place...  Ambiance: 5 - I loved the lighting, the seating, the decor...   Parking: 1 - Took 20 minutes to find a parking spot. (It didn't help that there was a concert nearby last night.)

fSvOdnryI9FPJ2ylcsE2ig.review_text: Awesome date place, as I saw 3-4 couples playing games while sipping delicious drinks and sharing dessert.  We played Catch Phrase while sipping white sangria and champers. We had four dessert and loved each of them. The cheesecake was delicious as was the nachos (they really look like nachos, super cool) and the chocolate and the funnel cake. The desserts are cutting edge innovative. The ambiance is hipster, trendy, but with sophistication. The service is stellar. Also they have awesome happy hour specials.

vSEbd6cnO1RXPKjmd8thSQ.review_text: Oh Yelpers...I love you so.   I believe I typed in "crack fix" to the Yelp app, and Candybar came up.   Or maybe I typed in "Where to play Connect 4 at 11:30 on a Friday".  Whatever.  By the way, in case you're wondering, I am a Connect 4 GENIUS and cannot be beaten.  We had the "nachos" made with cinnamin dusted "chips" (I'll stop using pretentious quotations now) topped with papaya, mango, kiwi, avocado yogurt (which should have been weird but it was amazing) and a candied jalapeno, which was so good, I wanted to have babies with it.  We also had the Peanut Butter Curry Sponge Cake, which was an interesting palate experience; good, but I don't know if I would order it again, and my friend had another dessert, I believe the bitter chocolate ganache, that I didn't even get to try because it was gone so fast.  Service was good, seats were comfy, and we even chatted with our neighbors on the couch.  The espresso they used was also delicious; I had a decaf Americano that tasted amazing.   Every penny I spent here was well worth it, AND they take American Express.   A nice place to go for a special dessert; a bit cost prohibitive if you are in the mood for quantity over quality/interesting.

Pg3Q7516riCrzIXvPgGKQQ.review_text: Candybar is a pretty nice lounge place to hang out play some board games and to enjoy the light snack and light alcohol. The place is dimly lit and the tables are mostly two or four seats here. There's a bar counter inside and some really interesting paintings and prints hung on the wall. Parking in this area is really horrible. I would suggest taking the bus here or a taxi.  == Food ==  There's only desserts, light snacks, and alcohol here.   The desserts are really simple. Things like ice cream, cheese and crackers, and cake. It doesn't taste like they make their desserts at the place.  The alcohol is really light cocktails. Some cocktails taste really good while others taste kind of awful. It's really a hit or miss here for the cocktails. Some are really fruity so my advise would be to order a fruit you like. All the cocktails are sweet to really sweet so be prepared.  == Service ==  Service is good. The waitress was really helpful and she came around refilling water quite often and once in a while to ask how things are going. Pretty pleasant atmosphere she gave off.  == Overall ==  Pretty nice place to bring a date to and hang out for a while. Prices are above average, but it's a nice lounge sit and relax. It's not place to sit down and eat a meal. This place is more of an after dinner dessert place.

7DHoVHlfb8AsSqfvi-UJwQ.review_text: The one and only time I went to the Candybar was for a friend's birthday gathering.  My only issue with this place is that parking was hard to find.  Harder, I think, than it usually is in SF.  But, once we got there it was all good.  The belinis are delicious here.  The appetizers are yummy.  Good wine selection.  We did not have desserts while there, but lots of assorted interesting appetizers.  Honeydew melon wrapped in smoked fish, nice variety of cheeses, nuts and fruit spread with crackers, and some other yummy nibbles.  The atmosphere is great, even the bathroom is decorated nicely.  I would come back for a girls night out.

KTYb_VWsc61HpvHRQSsHsw.review_text: I like this place, because I like desserts, I like board games, I like alcohol and I like that it's a block away from me! I've been here 2 times now, both times to get an after dinner drink with the boyfriend.   Both times, the waitstaff has been extremely helpful and friendly, atmosphere has been mellow and warm. Just felt comfortable. Both times we have been able to play fun board games (yay!).   The first time we shared a dessert and had a few glasses of port and sherry. Last night, we went in at 10 and the kitchen was already closed-actually the whole place was closed-at 10pm! I know its a Tuesday, but as a bar and a place that serves after dinner things, don't you think 10 is a bit early?  They redeemed themselves by being very kind and still letting us come in to have a drink and coffee.   Suggestions? Stay open later! Also, maybe have a few more port / sherry choices on the menu?  Can't wait to go to the happy hour with tacos that the nice man inside told me about!

xzt3gE7M1WAIrY3je5fjFw.review_text: Went here Saturday night after dinner with friends and I liked the dessert very much. This place even has board games for customers to play with friends, which is kinda cool.  One thing that was bad here-some random person started smoking a cigarette in the corner, which is totally illegal in the State of California, so that's soooo not cool.  Needless to say we asked for our check and skedaddled our way out of there.    Our waitress wasn't super friendly, but it was really late, so maybe she was tired?  Anywho, my tiramisu was the prettiest I've ever had, and the tastiest too, but unfortunately I'm big on customer service so everything else put a damper on it.  I would go back if I was in the area, but I wouldn't go out of my way.  But....the desserts are fabulous, and innovative, just wish they were a little more customer-servicey.

JZiejo9KKhIOSGfdBT21qQ.review_text: When a Groupon came up for this place, I'd never been, but it sounded like perfection (desserts & booze - what could be better?) so I bought 4. Now that I've used up all 4, I don't think I'll be back.   The food: To die for. My favorite is the red velvet cake. The idea of covering red velvet cake in coconut seemed a little odd, but it actually worked really well. And it comes with the most delicious ice cream I've ever had. It's mint ice cream, but not your typical mint chocolate chip- type mint, more like fresh-picked-from-your-herb-garden mint. Though one time out of the three that I ordered this, it just tasted like vanilla ice cream with a hint of something minty.  The drinks: Hit or miss. Most of the sparkling wine-based drinks are great: subtle and light. I like the Strawberry Kiss and Rasberry Delight (most of the drinks come with stripper names). My friend ordered something blueberry-y though, and it was sickly syrupy sweet with a disgusting neon blue sugar rim. There's nothing on the menu to indicate which drinks taste like straight slurpy syrup and which are lighter.  The service: Absolutely horrible. The first 3 times I was in here, I had the same cold waiter. The fourth time I was so happy to be in someone else's section until he turned out to be worse. Candybar seems to only hire hipster guys who think themselves too cool to be waiters. They treat you like you're totally putting them out even by being there. Also, I REALLY hate it when I have to ask more than twice to get water. And each time I was in here I had to ask at least three different people before I got a glass.  All in all, great food and good drinks, but the service is bad enough to keep me away.

mQFA26yrXZ0bUtQ4vidXyg.review_text: Good desserts and even better drinks? Yes please!  After hearing about this from several friends, definitely had to try this place out. I decided to take my girlfriend to Candybar for our anniversary and we were both impressed. It was a bonus that we arrived shortly after dinner for happy hour too with the Giants game playing! (Go Giants!)  The atmosphere and decor seemed very fitting as the whole establishment carried a nice ambience.   Anyway, I got a beer and a red sangria while my girlfriend got the Strawberry Kiss (Sparking Wine, Ginger Ale, and a Frozen Strawberry). We also got the Candybar Dessert for Two sampler, which where we chose the Apple A La Mode, Strawberry Limeade, Lavender Honey Creme Fraiche Semi Freddo and Big Francesco's Tiramisu.   I just have to put it out there that the drinks were excellent and they had a decent selection of beers. Oh, and Happy Hour helps too :P But we found that we liked the desserts a lot! Personally, I was not too attracted to the Lavender Honey Creme Fraiche Semi Freddo but that is because I normally do not get them too often so I cannot comment on it. However, I liked the Tiramisu because it had a nice consistency and flavor. My girlfriend found the Strawberry Limeade to be her favorite because she enjoyed the fruity flavor and it was not too sweet.   Did I mention that they have board games too? We enjoyed playing the various games while we drank the night away.   By the way, bonus points for having a Willy Wonka quote in the bathroom. I thought it was a nice touch.  The one thing that bothered us throughout the night was the amount of little bugs that came in through the open door. This is why I cannot give it more than a four star.   Will definitely come back again.

fPniIkE-AHQv5AcJzaBHtA.review_text: I came here recently on...dare I say it...Valentine's Day evening, and it was quite refreshing.  Great vibe, a welcoming staff, conversational decor, an awesome menu of libations and of course, sweet desserts!   Vibe: Candlelight and some red light specials to create the mood,  R&B Slow Jamz (yes, that's a "Z") to bring you back--waaaay back and pretty decor to keep you comfortable without being too comfortable. Staff: The staff was awesome.  Very welcoming, receptive to questions, nice and pleasant.   Decor: Pretty layout, urban art and...board games?  Yes...they made the spot very "homey" and fun without being too loungy.   Libations: I'm a huge fan of red wines.  The menu represented a nice variety to fit everyone's different tastes.  The choice was easy for me...Malbec was my drink of choice of the night.  The cocktail menu looked intriguing.  I noticed a lot of champagne flowin'--Raspberry Delights and Strawberry Kisses seemed to be a commonality among patrons...perfect for Sex and the City Divas. Desserts:  Everything looked amazing on the menu.  We opted for the Apple A La Mode: A nutty crust, cream cheese filling, baked apples topped with a scoop of Gingerbread ice cream.  First bite?  Warm but chilled, mushy but crunchy, sweet...and perfect.   Moment?  No.  Smile?  Yes...

vASaF47nWvCHEEDA8nfCVw.review_text: Claiming to be SF's first dessert lounge is a pretty serious thing.  Interpreted loosely, the term 'dessert lounge' would have included late-night Asian dessert places such as Kow Loon Tong (whose proprietor's patience has made it the final destination of drunk participants of the great Inner Richmond pub crawl) or Creations (also nearby).   One might argue, however, that strict interpretation would get us to agree that, yes, with the expansive list of cocktails, wines, other alcoholic libation and sweet treats, Candybar is in fact the SF's first dessert lounge, if not the most popular.   We got there at 6PM, right when it opened, after a decision to have a pre-dinner dessert (for those who are dubious, I highly recommend it as a way to build appetite for savory food afterwards).  So we got to sit at the table of our choosing and had the full attention of the man who seems to be the proprietor.    We also got to see the place fill up as we were having our desserts: a lone man sitting at the bar, a group of people assuming the corner couches and another group quickly scanning through the selection of board games and settling for Apples to Apples.    The desserts were A M A Z I N G - the three of us had apple (not pie) a la mode with gingerbread ice-cream, PBJ with blueberry and candied nuts and uber-light Japanese cheesecake with honeydew, graham cracker and guava sorbet.  We washed it down with mango / tangerine bellini and a glass of 2009 Loredona riesling before heading out to our next stop - Sons and Daughters.

50eZW1M0viOYJwpojjVSxw.review_text: I live in the neighborhood and wandered into this place, excited that another foodie joint had moved in. Overall, I found Candybar to be pretty average.   Service was ok, but a little over-done. I just felt like the servers made too much of a production over everything, pronouncing the glass of wine on the table mid-conversation. I hate that. I'm at the restaurant to have a good time w/ my friends, not to ogle over you putting a glass of wine on my table forcing me to stop my conversation and focus on you, the server.  Wine selection is good, but staff could use more education. Wine is REALLY over-priced. I work in the wine industry. People: this place is bending you all over! But hey, if you like that sort of thing, more power to you.  Decor is below average, it looks nice but nothing original. Also, the seating was REALLY uncomfortable. Not a place where you can kick back with a glass of (over-priced) wine and chill with a friend. It made me miss Hayes & Vine.  I didn't have anything to eat so can't comment on the desserts. They looked interesting.  While I'd probably return for another try, that's mostly because it's really convenient for me.   And yes, I'm a little bitter that it's another restaurant moving into the neighborhood and not offering parking to patrons. This really SUCKS for people who live in Nopa.

jHKZ-q2MRHej1BwYemAGng.review_text: This place is doin' it right. The desserts are amazing. You can also bring in takeout, order from the Kung Fu Taco Truck when it's there, or order a salami cheese olive plate before your sweets. The staff is friendly, they don't overcharge, and the lounge itself is swank. All this and board games, too. I almost hesitated to write this review because I don't want it to get too crowded :p

87Awbp7ZZdw-CnYpjFAtbg.review_text: The idea of dessert, drinks, AND boardgames is amazing! If you're a sweetaholic or you're like me who goes on ice cream hopping, then this place needs to be on your list!  This place is a little gem, especially for a relaxing night out with the girls. I actually came here with a group of 7 so it took a little while for them to accommodate our big group. It was manageable, but this place is ideal for groups under 5.   Lavender honey creme fraiche semifreddo:  it is semi frozen rich cream with a velvety texture. You know when you eat lavender flavor anything, it tastes like soap or potpourri? Well, THIS dessert was not like that at all!!!! The flavors were not overpowering at all and this one was the best out of the bunch if you want something light and refreshing.   Strawberry Limeade: strawberry mousse, vanilla cake, calamansi cream, strawberries. Calamansi cream is the lime flavor part of this dessert and this was our 2nd favorite of the bunch. Again, very light and refreshing!  Soft Cheesecake: shortbread, pecans, sweet pink grapefruit leche, Rice Krispy crunch, passion fruit sorbet. The cream cheese in this cheesecake was VERY pronounced so if you like cheesecake, this one is the way to go!  Big Francesco's Tiramisu: what I really liked about this one is that it has a sweet and a hint of salt on the bottom of the cake. However, I do prefer a tiramisu with more kahlua/coffee flavor so this dessert was A OK for me.   And the cocktails!  Get the 50/50 if you like orange creamsicle  Sangria was the right balance of wine and fruits. I would definitely order this during their happy hour!  There is a bar that seats about 5-8 people and there are plenty of boardgames; but we didn't even played any of them because our group had such a great time enjoying the atmosphere!  NOTE: Parking was difficult like every other place in SF, so be prepared to spend at least 15 minutes circling around the block, up and down some hills, and in between dead end neighborhoods.

79uOhFwKSdp8CGlTaZFVBw.review_text: Good place, loud and a bit crowded on weekends.  Despite the popularity they seat you very quickly.  All drinks and desserts were excellent EXCEPT for the panna cotta (apparently they don't really know how a panna cotta tastes or understand its texture).  Overall I recommend it

yZsNFcreObiJXjuUKS1f_A.review_text: I would come here again- and usually I don't say that too often about establishments in San Francisco. This place caught my eye- where else would you get gourmet desserts and amazingly sweet drinks whilst playing board games with your friends? I really want to come back here and try more desserts!! Woohoo. (:  My only gripe is that this place is really small, kind of dirty (it is hard to clean up after the previous patrons especially if what you serve melts into stickiness on the tables), and the wait can potentially be long.

Dd6ElS2Cng3Qag_h4IQC-Q.review_text: Coming off an Australia trip high (passion fruit abundance, especially in the Cairns area) my eyes zeroed in on the Passion Fruit Delight and the Passion Fruit Chocolate Mousse.  Passion Fruit + Sparkling Wine + Chocolate = Happy Jenn.  They also had board games for entertainment!  Whether it's for a cute ending of date, or for a chill hang out with friends...check out Candybar!

Eew-Nc5QztRDM3gq5mAqpg.review_text: This place is horrible! Twice we told the waiter that he forgot part of our order and he could have cared less. Only gave us water for 2; their was 5 in our party. Didn't give enough spoons.  The rest of our party that received dessert said their food was lackluster. Definitely, not worth the wait or calories.  Disappointing....

xyqnCAQsARyayfkl0dSNKg.review_text: Came here with a Groupon for four dessert and four drinks. For dessert, we ordered the banana torte (gluten free), s'mores, ice cream sandwich, and ice cream sunday. Out of the four, the ice cream sunday was the best. Maybe because I just really like mint chocolate chip ice cream, torched bananas, and brownies. The s'mores dessert wasn't really like s'mores because it was missing the graham cracker portion; still pretty good though.  The ice cream sandwich was pretty simple, and possibly the most healthy. It was just honeydew ice cream sandwiched between two macarons with some cut up honeydew fruit. The desserts weren't as fancy as I remembered for some reason. I thought there were some fancier choices a few years ago.   For drinks, we got the mint ginger beer, lychee guava martini, and the kir royale. The first two were really good -- the martini even came with a lychee inside. The kir royale was a bit too sweet though, almost like a sparkling wine cooler.   It's pretty cool they have all sorts of board games like Candy Land (how appropriate), but most people I saw were playing connect four -- I guess that's a pretty simple game that only requires two.   Overall, it was pretty good, but I thought their desserts could've been a bit more creative and visually appealing. There should be a dessert better than an ice cream sundae...

HmK5wAh0RGposz7e4oZaMg.review_text: A little overhyped, honestly. This place is cool for hanging out (great atmosphere, cool food), but it feels like it's popularity stems from a lack of competition rather than it's ability to prepare good food/ drinks.  My main issue with this place that the desserts here just aren't that good! For the price it charges (think high end restaurant dessert prices), I would expected better.  I've been here twice and tried a variety of desserts, including the s'mores dish and the peanut butter jelly time, and I was impressed with none of them.  They are decent desserts, but between the price and the hype, I expected much much more.  On to the drinks, I know they are meant to be dessert drinks, but they are way too sweet! They try to make their drinks original by using distinctive ingredients, think jasmine tea, aloe vera, etc., but the final product is nonetheless disappointing.  I've tried around 6 of their drinks there and I didn't particularly like any of them.  In the end, I would say you should at least come here once, just to see what it is all about, but unless friends plan an event here, nothing they serve here would motivate me to come back.  Note also: parking is impossible around here, and there is an invariable wait

59FQMnRFoKlvPDoNSxUygQ.review_text: Cool loungie spot with some innovative deserts that don't cost an arm and a leg. I went here last night with some friends after Tsunami Happy Hour across the street. It's definitely a great place for a night cap as they also have sparkling cocktails, beer, and sangria. I recommend checking it out and trying one of the deserts for sure.

LanpXTIHhEmjnGcWBn9AEA.review_text: My expectations were not met! Sorry, Candybar, I am off to places that serve fresher desserts. Love the idea, the decor is strange but stylish, four-dessert sampler for two is great, but... the dessert itself could be so much better.

W5EkmWx6w8DSW1O4Kpn4NQ.review_text: Ok so this place is pretty cute and a nice break from your every day SF bar. The cocktail menu is super yummy and the desserts are very creative. We tried the strawberry shortcake bowl and the apple crisp with hazelnut and caramel. Bellini + dessert + connect 4 = win!

ZLaCY8Hm-mzv9ZiuO5a3SQ.review_text: This place really rocks.  Artisanal desserts?  We are so lucky to live in SF.  The owners are always friendly.  It's a clean cute space with local art.  Try the nacho sundae....  !!!  It's as good and interesting as it sounds.

6hHQusTGDEPzb6CoZ9YdXg.review_text: Love the concept, and everything was quite good except for the cantalope that was on one of the desserts.  Unfortunately it wasn't sweet at all and didn't taste ripe yet.  Besides that we liked everything and will definitely be back.

zhD0kT_BL9qrTY87Ki4H-g.review_text: Delicious desserts & drinks, and it won't cost you a bazillion dollars!  I had been wanting to check this place out for quite some time, but never made it 'til recently. It was worth the wait, this place is atmospheric and cozy. A great spot for a date or you know a platonic outing. And they have board games, who doesn't love board games?!  It was surprisingly not too crowded for a Saturday night. The service was great, very attentive. While I was there, happy hour was in effect, I think it either goes 'til 8 or 9, so drinks were discounted, including the cocktails. Instead of a cocktail, we went with sangria, however opt for the red. For dessert, I had the drunken s'mores, it's basically a giant marshmallow, chocolate and more chocolate with a graham cracker somewhere in between, and it  was goooood. My friend got the red velvet cake, which I believe also included some marshmallows on the side, and she enjoyed that.

vP0WspRfraMLWaN3k3vKHA.review_text: i love the concept of candybar - and was not disappointed when i finally made it there over the weekend.    i was surprised to find it not very crowded at 930pm on a saturday - but, all the better for us.  we split the gingerbread pudding and baked hot chocolate.  um, yum.  loved the seasonal desserts and the sparkling selection of cava drinks.  service was chill and attentive, which was surprising and welcome - sometimes places like this can get snooty and that would be really lame - especially bc the neighborhood is so chill.  yay candybar you are fun :)

dy4OvKg-9GBhgGaZFaKqTQ.review_text: Really nice owner, service just ok kir royal undrinkable desserts for 10 buck each to much decor bad as well as the music selection.

KP5PUBrgnMVXy0hEWZDzbQ.review_text: Me: Oh my gosh, they have a dessert called Peanut Butter Jelly Time!   My friends: What? What's that?   Me: Wait, wait, wait ... you guys don't remember Peanut Butter Jelly Time? Come on ... (I start doing the arm dance, fingers pointed out) ... Peanut Butter Jelly Time, Peanut Butter Jelly Time ... no?   My friends: (Blank Stares, Long Pause)   Me: (Silently contemplating getting up and walking home)   My friends: Are you talking about that internet banana thing?   Me: (Deep internal sigh of relief) Yes! Yes, yes, yes!   Despite my apparently clueless friends, the bar being out of Malbec, and some guys using the lamest pickup line ever on my wife (good try though guys, good try ;) CandyBar was exactly what I'd hoped for ... a fun, neighborhood dessert spot.   The drinks were yummy and affordable, you can play games while you sip, and the desserts were even better than expected. Really tasty, definitely sharable, and presented well to boot! Just make sure you get there before 10:30 if you go on Friday or Saturday night. We made that mistake and spent most of our time at Candybar, well, standing by the bar. Our bad! It didn't matter though. Because it was still ...   Peanut Butter Jelly Time, Peanut Butter Jelly Time ...

yo85MFVfyOTERwpf214PMw.review_text: I went to Candybar for the first time for my birthday yesterday and loved the ambience and amazing service. They really made my day special without even knowing it! The food was good and all of my guests also liked their food. I can't wait to go to this place again!!

jCcJC5v4D88u7F45zdgWdA.review_text: Deserts and cocktails! Must come. Price is super reasonable. $9-$10 on deserts and cocktails. Great for dates. You know when you go to bars and they give you glass of ice with a little alcohol? Not this place. No ice in alcohol. You will really fill the buzz after a drink.

gJTknzE8KYeqGwYLif42CQ.review_text: I'll give this place a 3.5 rating.  Now I'm going to tell you why...  This was my first dessert lounge and I wished San Jose had one.  I'll be moving to SF soon so that's out the window.  The set up is cute and intimate.  It's candle lit and they have plenty of games for you and your friends to play.  They also have a good variety of drinks (or so I've seen since I didn't drink).  Now for their desserts, I think they rotate them.  For my visit, my friends and I ordered an ice cream sundae, the strawberry limeade, drunken smore, and the apple pie la mode.  I liked the ice cream sundae because the ice cream was so good, and it had macaroons, and caramelized bananas. WHO WOULDN'T ENJOY THAT?! The apple pie la mode was my second favorite.  It was perfectly sweet and I loved the gingerbread ice cream they put on top of it.  The strawberry limeade was super sour so that was a no go for me and the drunken smore had a "drunken sauce" that was an overkill.  If you're a chocoholic, it might be for you.    I didn't like how my water was super lukewarm, especially after eating all that sweet stuff.  It's pretty pricey as well... and their bathroom is super scary because it's dark.  My mind was screaming "BLOODY MARY, BLOODY MARY, BLOOD....."

txWFXIMtDUaheiePKnAQyg.review_text: Oh. My. God.  This is the best place on earth.  The decor is cool and lounge-y and comfortable, the service was excellent, and the desserts were some of the best I've ever had.  And they weren't the boring desserts that everyone has on their menu.  Apple pie a la mode with gingerbread ice cream!  Chocolate butterscotch brownie with candied walnuts and thyme ice cream!   They were both so good, but if I had a gun to my head, I would probably go with the apple.  Which is unexpected because I'm usually a total chocolate whore.   There is absolutely nothing better than sipping a glass of champagne and feasting on fantastic sweet treats at Candybar on a Friday night.

1Uj95bKWyQmpXAVe3N7Wag.review_text: Reasons I loved it: the peanut butter and jelly tart, the simple lemony champagne cocktail, the fact that I had a groupon deal, and because we arrived before the line started. If I had waited an hour and paid full price, I'd have had to give it a 3. So, worth it if you can get there early. Personally, I found the board game thing a little odd. People were mighty dressed up and the vibe was flirty. The board games would drag it down and were unnecessary. Dunno why people are complaining about the dessert sizes. I found them very generous. Granted, we had eaten dinner already.

c4bNOJ5XnKKoHJoQE4zrcQ.review_text: We went here Friday for dessert and it was very cute! There isn't any liquor so the "cocktails" were a little deceiving but good nonetheless! I had the semifreddo which was good but not memorable. My partner had the smores which were delicious!

buhUgeRm7OpQtVE68Q2qZQ.review_text: My friend's mom was in from Chicago, so I took advantage of a Groupon I've been holding on to for the past few months. We were there very early on a Saturday (first customers) so we got full attention, window seating, and no annoying crowd. Each of the three desserts were incredible. We had one red velvet cake, one Japanese cheesecake and one little macron over cherries and homemade ice cream. All were very good, the music was amazing (light-weight, old school hip hopish) and the server/co-owner was super nice. I may have been affected by the Groupon discount, but I loved this place.

_UZXOlXQSudVllv1jXYysw.review_text: na... just a bunch of sweets... nothing special.

fyeO1diymWTO6EteJYWM0w.review_text: Great time all around. I went to Candybar on a double date with Jessica U and it was such a blast from the past. We relived our glory days of dominating at catch phrase and enjoyed some decently priced happy hour beverages.   Happy hour is great here- lasts until 8:00 and drinks are definitely affordable. But even after happy hour ends, the drinks are still reasonably priced. The bartender was even nice enough to let us order the happy hour drinks until 8:15, which was just super.    The bar itself is cool too. It wasn't too crowded when we went and there is plenty of seating. There is definitely room to stretch out and get your board game on...though I noticed we were the only group yelling about our game....but whatever, we're enthusiastic.

h_2NGTYvjOc38cjx90rM5Q.review_text: Julie reserved Candy Bar for a networking event.. Fabulous job Jules! and fabulous location!   CandyBar is a lovely new addition to NOPA. The staff is friendly and very attentive! The wine/champagne selection is perfect.. AND THE DESSERTS mmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm WOW!  The vanilla brioche  spiced cherries / feta sorbet is a MUST.. Feta sorbet scared me when i saw it on the menu, but trust your taste buds. it will dazzle them!  The cheese plate.. delicious!  Two thumbs up for this place!

dRaLq9sF45RYHhKfUd8NMg.review_text: It pains be to give this place 3 stars because i am a foodie that is always on a diet, but never holds back on desserts.  Desserts = Love.  I went here last night with some girlfriends for my birthday.  First of all, parking is HORRENDOUS!  I was pretty patient about parking, because we all know parking is scarce in the city, but wow...parking is no joke in the NOPA area.  Anywhoo, after feeling like we won the lotto (for finding parking) we stroll into this new dessert bar which we have been excited about trying for the past 3 weeks.    Ambiance:  It is pretty minimal, yet very classy looking.  We sat towards the back, but you could tell in the front (where it was a bit more lounge-like) was the place to be.  It is pretty small, so wherever you are, you could pretty  much see everything.
