I went ahead and ordered the 4-course tasting menu.  I started out with the Sparkling Meyer Lemonaide with Mint Gele, which was tasty.  I really enjoyed it, it was lemonade with a kick of mint, but as you drink it, the gelee gives you a little surprise.  My only quirk is that it is the size of a shot.  Actually if i went to any other bar in SF and ordered a kamikaze, the kamikaze shot would be bigger than this fancy lemonade palate cleanser.      I then received my Carrot Cake Baked Alaska  w/candied fennel & walnuts.  I also had the Accornero Brigantino wine pairing.  This was YUMMY.  It was a thin layer of carrot cake with ice cream covered in a meringue which was flamed to perfection.  Didn't really pay no mind to the accompanied fennel and walnuts.    Up next was the Bittersweet Chocolate Sorbet  w/foie gras tapioca & croutons accompanied with the wine pairing of Fontodi Vin Santo.  Okay, i know I'm a vegetarian, but i HAD to try this foie gras concoction.  All it was was chocolate sorbet on top of some grounded Oreo cookie crumbles with a smear of tapioca on the side.  I tasted the tapioca and i thought it was completely and utterly gross.  So this dish was pretty much chocolate sorbet with some crumbs of Oreo cookie.   The finale to our 4-course tasting was Warm Malted Milk w/Peanut Butter Vadouvan Cookie.  The milk was the BEST THING I HAD.  Although I can't even describe where they find the tiniest cups to serve this in.  This wasn't even a "shot".  The cookie was not a favorite, it had a curry aftertaste (yup, CURRY).    I had a LOT of expectations for this place and I know a lot of people on here said it was too pricey.  But I went in thinking, $14 for the tasting menu is not pricey.  Well -- pains me to say this -- but i don't even think the $14 was worth it.  So yes, I agree with everyone else ..... this place is totally over priced.  The wine pairings are in the smallest glasses you could ever imagine and the "experience" was okay.  I had expected to leave this place full of guilt and sin due to the consumption of dessert, but I really left thinking.....it was nice, I'm glad we went, but I don't think I would go back.     And....fyi....I can't really imagine this place to be an after-work happy hour spot.  UPDATE:  Another thing, one of my girlfriend's were pregnant, and when asked if they had any non-alcoholic beverages...the answer was NO.  No effort to accommodate with soda, coffee, or anything.

CGRkejdGiNtvX-lhcOFUZQ.review_text: Candybar... thanks for the sugar overload; it was freaking amazing. Definitely worth possibly increasing my chance of getting type 2 diabetes... tenfold.  If you've got a sweet tooth like me, get the dessert for two that comes with 4 different desserts! I find it totally unfair that the menu has way too many scrumptious sounding desserts to choose from. Quite torturous, actually.  I personally really liked the panna cotta  and lavendar honey creme fraiche semi freddo... They were both refreshing and heavenly. I also got the peanut butter jelly time, as everyone on yelp has seemed to rave wildly about, but I was not a huge fan of it. It was WAY too sweet and overwhelming. The limeade dessert was also fantastic. It had a nice sour tinge, and was nicely presented with strawberries. The tiramisu was boring to me... even the tiramisu at Whole Foods taste better to me, in my opinion.  The drinks were also pretty good... everything tasted amazing and not a hint of alcohol was tasted...   By the way. Boys, if you want to impress a girl, take her here on a dessert date :) Great, cozy environment... and girls love desserts. Duh.

psVsGGrni2Slpbk7zQYyhg.review_text: This place is super cute! Love the concept of a lounge with just desserts and cocktails.  I love sweets and sparkling wine so this is heaven on earth for me :)

NFF0V4ELBBP0W5_lTv7b7A.review_text: I LOVE THIS PLACE!   Took a day trip to SF after visiting my sister in Stockton and got dessert here after dinner.  First of all, it's pretty small so there will be a wait. Luckily I came at a good time so I didn't have to! I really liked the ambiance. Cute and very chill interior. ALSO BOARD GAMES. Can't go wrong with board games!  Onto the food: we ordered two drinks and two desserts.   For drinks, strawberry kiss and jasmine sparkle. The drinks were super tasty! I really liked the Jasmine because it was just the perfect amount of sweetness. The lemon really gave it a nice balance as well.  For desserts we got the ice cream sandwich and almond panna cotta. The ice cream sandwich was SO GOOD. I've only had macaron ice cream sandwiches from Milk in LA which is premade and stored in the freezer. This one is more deconstructed and made on the spot. It would totally go back again for this one. The macaron cookie had great texture. The panna cotta was also really good (not as good as the ice cream sammy though). If you are a fan of almond pudding/jello, you will like this. It's very light and smooth. I enjoyed the berries and the chocolate ice cream it came with.   If I was to base this rating on just the dessert alone, I'd give it a 4.5 but because with the ambiance and what the overall place provides, I'll stick with the 5 :)  Hoping for another SF trip so I can go back!

g9itOL6I2WlZQgBvRIJvJQ.review_text: If you love dessert, then this place is for you.  I stuffed myself with food prior to coming here, so the most I could handle was an a la carte chocolate brioche ice cream dessert which I split with a friend.  It was mighty fine.  I should come back and try the tasting menu....

59QzQ3-dmOD1USV2hQpwkw.review_text: Really nice people own the place, but I'll have to be honest, not a fan of the desserts. A little too experimental - I had a dish that was based around vanilla ice cream, cilantro, and peppercorn. It tasted just like how you'd expect.  I believe the menu rotates and the drinks are great, so maybe I just need to visit again. It's tough though because I have to coordinate an extra manly outfit whenever I'm here to balance out the fact that I'm drinking something called the 'Jasmine Sparkle.'

bQCHF5rn5lMI9c5kEwCaNA.review_text: Super tasty cocktails, many with a sweet/fruity twist to them. Lots of dessert items on the menu, all just the right size and hitting the right point in the spectrum between "bland" and "too sweet." Cozy, intimate, trendy-without-being-pretentious vibe perfect for couples or small groups. Super courteous service. What's not to like?  If you're going out to dinner elsewhere, cut it short and leave room for dessert and drinks here.

ZO0LU4unvbD7p32aTDQiIA.review_text: I like the concept and the space, but for a dessert bar, they should have good desserts.  The chocolate sheets weren't great.  The vanilla brioche was actually very very good, but the apricot fruits on the side ruined it.  Desserts were $8 each, but can be eaten in one big bite.  To me, not worth it.

Ey7u10UjOz7Urroq4J0a4Q.review_text: i haven't been back here since my first visit, so i guess this would be the best (and maybe only) time i review/remember candybar.  i think the overall concept is awesome, but i feel that citizen cake does somewhat the same with less of the snooty feel that candybar gave off.  the lighting and mood is pretty nice, but gourmet desserts may just not be for me.  i love desserts, but heaping amounts of it, not the wimpy, art-like, expensive ingredients type of dessert.  i also DO NOT like savory dessert...those are not desserts...they are appetizers or side dishes.  again, like the concept, but a little too ritzy for me.

9fg9i7ke1NAGhf8W3e97VA.review_text: The drinks and the desserts are good, but it seems to have changed since my first trip and I'm not sure I'll be rushing back. Not that anything was terrible, it was just...eh.

DZnuKkRFHELMq2jSD9okqg.review_text: Man, I have been looking for a place like this for years just desserts, alcohol, and board games. What?!

DjXEUA6ltpOCgzy3Q8D_xg.review_text: When I first heard there was a place that specializes in desserts and cocktails....I was like "say what?!"  After visiting I was like "say YUMmmm!!" Went here for V-day with the gf...I know so cliche but I'm a lover, techie, consumer, movie buff, foodie/culinary enthusiast, such a hopeless romantic and not a fighter.   The place is small but still a little space-ish unless it gets packed and then it's people on top of people..how you doing?! Not on top but relatively close. Still a nice after dinner date/small group of friends spot to hit up.  We had the Soft Cheesecake and Ice Cream Sundae & I had the 50/50. Tried both desserts and they were really yummy. Let me also say the 50/50 is so up my alley but I'm a fan of orange soda pop SO I loved that drink down to the last drop..literally.    If you're looking for the traditional versions of their desserts, you maybe in for a let down. They put a unique spin on them and they are definitely using another technique but it works for me.   All in all, it's a cute little place that packs a big punch for your sweet spot.

eXM67alQxlrA_hMCQ3S0qQ.review_text: How can I not like a place called Candybar?? Mmmmmm candy!  I came here on a Thursday night to support my girl Ting A in her photo debut.  The event was BYOA (bring your own art) which had a number of local artists displaying their work.  I didn't get a chance to order any desserts but judging from the awesome scents coming from the kitchen...I'm sure I would have been a very happy Mary if I had ordered desserts. Instead I shared a sangria which was very tasty and had just the right amount of alcohol.  Definitely a cool place to hang out and get fat or drunk (whichever you prefer ;P)

xj2L3jDzD3BpYVYxSyb5Ug.review_text: Heard about this place through a groupon deal that came up.  I was really excited to visit this place when I was in town because, I love me a good dessert and the drinks seemed interesting based on previous reviews.  When walkng in to the lounge I noticed the large amount of people waiting around to be seated.  The young lady at the door was taking names and informing us it was going to be a 30 minute wait.  Now, I dont know if it is because she was having a bad day or what, but if you want to make your busines money, try to make it sound like you are happy customers are waiting to get into your establishment.  When telling me how long the wait was, she made it seem like I was upsetting her by being there.  While waiting to be seated, I noticed why she was getting flustered, she was the only person (besides the bartender) taking orders, serving food, cleaning up, cashing people out, and seating people.  After only 15 mins we were shown to our table and given menus.  At that point, because she was the only server, the service was extremely slow (not her fault).    I ordered the Apple A La Mode and my wife ordered the tiramisu. The apple a la mode was money!!!!!  The tiramisu was good too but a little tooooo rich.  I mean, I have a sweet tooth, but DAAMMNNN!  As for drinks, they all seem to be a champagne based drink.  I had the strawberry kiss and the wife had a blueberry pomegranate fusion, both were delicious!  To top it off, there is a variety of board games there to enjoy at your leisure.  All in all, we enjoyed our desserts over an intense game of connect 4.    Now I kept debating whether to rate this place a 4 star or 3 star.  I'm gonna chalk up the initial impression of the place (the flustered young lady) as just having a bad day and give it 4 stars.

UzG5IHFUu6H1UyCRbqHHZw.review_text: i'm somewhat of an anomaly when it comes to the sense of taste.        i don't really like chocolate chip cookies.                                                                                     i rarely crave sweets.  i know.  some would say that i belong in dessert hell.  ...however, there are places that may just save my sweet soul...                      thyme ice cream.  sounds strange.  chris, the co-owner, reassures me that it's fantastic.  'it's like a triscuit!' he says.  ...  i make a face that rivals one of disgust x1000.  but i try it.  i'll try anything.  crunchy chocolate crumbs line the bottom of the bowl to prevent the ice cream from sliding around, according to tan, the co-owner.                                            so good.  SO unexpectedly good.  i haven't had the chance to sample any of their other desserts, but my tastebuds are pretty satisfied so far.  ...their sangria is pretty good too.  i prefer the red over the white.  - - has a little more kick in my opinion.  i'll definitely have to sample their specialty cocktails at some point.               i have to commend candybar for successfully feeding hungry yelpers at past yelp events.  we're pretty difficult to please sometimes, so i tip my hat to these gentlemen.  they've also graciously allowed up and coming artists to hang their work on their walls for exposure and for sale.  ...check out their current art installation...  especially the piece by the bar!                                                                   ...super friendly owners/great desserts/yummy beverages/cool art...    p.s.  'tis a feat when a dessert lounge's BATHROOM even smells sweet.  no joke.

NAN8AAQSoTLVEE_b0a7asw.review_text: Came out here with a date on a Friday night after dinner. As we walked in there was a big group that took up nearly half of the place, I guess it was someone's birthday? We were seated immediately. The atmosphere was pretty loud, everyone seemed to be having a good time. Shortly after we were seated, the place began filling up.  My date and I had the dessert for two combo which allows you to pick four desserts. We had the Peanut Butter Jelly Time!, Strawberry Limeade, Flourless Chocolate Cake, and a couple Macaroon Ice Cream Sandwiches. I gotta say I enjoyed all the desserts except for the Peanut Butter one, not really a big fan of PB. It was my first time having any form of Macaroon and it was awesome.  Didn't get a chance to play any of the boardgames because we were in a hurry to get somewhere else right after, but this is a great spot to come after dinner to enjoy some dessert and relax with good company.

pb-Fw9SjbDULRRO9LOP8gg.review_text: Nice little date night place. I think what makes this stand out than others is the fact they offer board games. I just had dinner with my boyfriend in the area and decided to try it out. We went just in time for their happy hour. Drinks were cheaper, but still kinda pricey. I ordered the strawberry kiss and he got the passion fruit. Both were fruity and sparkly.   We ordered the drunken smores and IT WAS YUMMMYYYY. We were too caught up in our battleship war that we forgot about it on our table. I got the idea that if the drunken smores was good, maybe their other desserts were just as good, too! After all, it's a dessert place. I was in a happy wild mood and took the risk of ordering something I've never heard or had before, Lavender Honey Creme Fraiche Semifreddo. Boy did it sound complicated ...  Boy did it also look complicated ... so many ingredients. I take the first bite and so many flavors. I don't know what to say. It's definitely different. Eh, not to my taste. I'm sticking to my chocolate range.   4 stars because of (1) the amazing drunken delicious smores (2) amazing strawberry kiss (3) battleship

qm1Ie-u0MxaxENYQ3e5oLg.review_text: Wish I could give this place more stars, my expectations were probably greater. If you really want to go here, go ahead and try it once, that's what I did. The prices are pretty outrageous for the amount of desserts/drinks you get. The presentation is pretty, but that means, more plate, less dessert. I went here with my boyfriend ready to try many different things, so we got 3 desserts to split and a couple cocktails.  All portions of the desserts were small, so we were able to eat all without getting too full. Also, the desserts weren't anything special, you could go somewhere else and get the same dessert that tastes the same way. Don't get me wrong, it was good, but you could probably get it cheaper elsewhere. The cocktails were probably the taster part of the night, I've never had cocktails like they serve anywhere else. The flavors are very sweet, which I like. They are pricey and probably not very strong, but good to try at least once.  The atmosphere was intimate, but tables are very close together. They have boardgames you could play while you eat, but with limited table space, that can be kind of hard or uncomfortable.  Overall, yes this was a cool place to go and they have tastey options for desserts and drinks. However, they are pricey for their nothing special small portions and it's kind of awkward when your sitting so close to the people next to you. If you love desserts (like me :]), I say go ahead and try it!

7hSJUQLs6oeZIfyktP9c_Q.review_text: Come on candybar.... step it up. You have so much potential, but are really missing the mark.  Hearts of Romaine Salad - $7 for a bowl of plain romaine lettuce? I was really confused about this one.  Asparagus - $8 for four pieces of asparagus? I can buy a huge bunch of tastier asparagus from the farmers market for $2.50. At least do something creative with it if it's going to be just asparagus.   Carrot Soup - This was actually really awesome. But it's just soup.  So we were thinking... it is a dessert place, so that's where they're putting all their energy. I LOVE dessert and I'm really not that difficult to please. It's hard to be in a bad mood while eating chocolate, but they managed to make me kind of angry while I was eating.   We had the chocolate parfait and the baked alaska. I only ate here three days ago and I can barely remember what either of these tasted like. I just remember being incredibly bored and disappointed.   I'll wait a few months and give it another shot. Hopefully they'll get their act together.

Xjxrab7B42JhXAq4oiJd4A.review_text: Went here for the first time for a girls' night out.  This place is nice and cozy. Although we had to wait, it was nice that the servers didn't rush the large parties. Once you get a seat, it's just a nice place to relax and hang out with your friends. However, it really is kind of small and it's hard to come here with a large group without reservations.  (+) Very considerate servers -- the host apologized and thanked me three times for waiting (+) Good drinks, although some are better than others. The Strawberry Kiss was delicious, but the Raspberry Kiss was too syrup-y... but you might like it if you like that sort of thing. (+) Decent desserts. I really liked my brownie dessert, not just because of the brownie, but what came with it. The walnuts and the raspberries that came with it were delicious! The raspberries even had little chocolate pieces inside. The ice cream, however...  (-) The ice cream that came with my brownie dessert was somewhat odd. It was basil-y (or contained some other herb of which we could not deduce the identity). Somewhat exotic, but too exotic for my taste (-) Somewhat pricey, although it was worth it for a girls' night out (WITH a Groupon!)  I would go here again, but wouldn't necessarily insist on it.

7Vu85Jdzp6MYVpvA7WH8OA.review_text: I must admit, I was expecting a lot of pink, black, & gaudy chandeliers.  But that is not at all the ambiance of Candybar.  It was dimly lit, cozy, & chic.  I wish there were more places like this!  The drink menu was bubbly and refreshing -- I loved my blood orange cocktail.  They had a nice selection of wines, too, and gave my friend a generous pour.  Definitely going back for the $3 sangrias at happy hour.    It took us ages to decide on desserts -- everything looked so good!  In the end, we ordered the strawberry limeade (served in a mason jar - so cute), the caramel apple, and the japanese cheesecake.  The presentation was really well done, and I found each of them not overly sweetened and very light.  It seems like the menu rotates, so we'll have to come back soon to try the all the ones we missed!

ndBjWVrotVmlcOUfBy_B6Q.review_text: This place really is about the desserts. Anything else, I wouldn't bother with because they don't do it well. We tried a few of the desserts and they were all really great, even for me who doesn't like sweets.   The drinks on the other hand, woah... The menu does NOT tell you that the bartender makes all of their cocktails with liquid sugar making up 1/3rd of the glass. It was disgusting. I couldn't taste even the faintest hint of jasmine in the "Jasmine Sparkle". It tasted like a grape cooler with added sugar. The rest of our party's drinks were similarly undrinkable.  I would have given 3 stars, especially given the very nice ambiance, but the service was also mediocre and very slow. Some of our party was served significantly before the rest. Very awkward and unnecessary when you are serving desserts, which are largely ready in advance.  So as nice as the idea of a dessert bar is, Candybar is limited in what it can offer and fails on several fronts.

f81Y2EzuRqefayCrL1Ra3Q.review_text: With a loungey, smooth bar feel, CandyBar is a cute little café where I would suggest going to for your first couple of dates. It's a quiet, intimate setting with couches and tiny table areas for your dessert and drinks, yes there is alcohol here. There are also old school board games, none of which are really from my time, but I don't expect this to be a kiddie place anyways.  I ordered a chocolate mousse with mango sauce dripped onto it and I'm not impressed. It sounded so much more amazing than it tasted! However, it looked ultra amazing, the plate with its sauce dripped into orbital patterns matched the café/lounge greatly. I am ultra impressed with the presentation of the dish, not so much with the taste of the food. My friend ordered a butterscotch brownie thing (for a lack of better terms) and that tasted exactly the way it should (though I do not like butterscotch), soft on the inside and crispy on the outside. Both dishes were ultra pretty and Milky Wayed off with some sorta deluxe ice cream. Mm. Delishee.  The food raked in a rather mediocre 2 paired off with a cappuccino for 0.5 stars, presentation took in a 0.75 of a star and the atmosphere another 0.75 star. It's a nice place to be and I would poke around the desserts and drinks until I found something that fit me.

i5kbTB7cb5KOcuOX6P3Y1g.review_text: Stopped in after dinner and couldn't have picked a better spot. At first I was worried - there were a shit ton of people who were celebrating some kind of grown up prom with tuxedos and name tags milling about but their party bus left almost as soon as we arrived so we were spared from extreme douchiness. We went for the 4 desserts for $25 option - definitely the best deal and enjoyed:  Buttermilk Vanilla Bean Panna Cotta - perfection. Not too sweet and the balsamic strawberry reduction was a perfect complement.  Peanut Butter Jelly Time - the tart crust was on the dry side but the pb cream was so delicious it didn't matter. Lemon Tart - the coconut snow paired with the lemon curd was super tasty. The tart crust and coconut macaroon could've been better but was not necessarily bad.  Apple a la mode - the gingerbread ice cream was my favorite part, the rest was on the dry side.   Also ordered some sparkling wine with a touch of raspberry syrup which paired well with everything - total bill $35.   Even though there were a few small misses I loved Candybar and will definitely be back to indulge again when I'm in the neighborhood.   peace, love, and good booze ~ chase

F-7uHcoHDmm38DQ3NeLN4w.review_text: Yes, the way to my heart is definitely taking me to eat desserts!   Great company Delicious desserts and alcohol a really romantic atmosphere  Definitely made the night a very memorable one, especially since we drove an hour here after dinner to get desserts! And on top of that, we had to circle around to look for parking!  However, we finally arrived and we were seated immediately.  We ordered : Lavender Honey Creme Fraiche Semi Freddo- Perfectly done because if lavender was not done right, it can taste like soap! The tart, chocolate shavings, and cantaloupe are perfect complement to the dessert.  Chocolate Flourless cake- Very rich, but it was very moist.  And we both had a lemon drop shot- Tasted like juice, but must have been strong because I felt a flush creeping up! my friend had: Blood Orange cocktail- tasted very similar to my mango cocktail:x and one of the bubbles drink- which tasted just like champagne to me.  I had: Mango cocktail- Very delicious! I liked it a lot! Definitely a recommendation!  and white wine.  Nevertheless, this place is very nice, relaxing, but can get very crowded after 10pm!

cCPjASKs5YpMB4BmN2oSZg.review_text: They're certainly trying hard. The higher-concept ambience and board games were cool and the peanut butter & jelly was pretty darn good. However, the other desserts underwhelmed. Also, I didn't like their kir royale, which is a difficult trick to pull off.

PjNd_KtXwyIHZUKPx84TwA.review_text: If you have a sweet tooth, or enjoy art and wine, this is the perfect place! The desserts were delicious!  I had the Apple Pie A La Mode, and the Flourless Chocolate cake. Yum...  I can't wait to come back!  They always change up the dessert menu and you won't get bored because they have fun board games available or you can just lounge and enjoy the artwork and wine while having a conversation.  I found another favorite spot in SF!  This place was a genius idea! It's such a great dessert spot.  5 Stars all the way!

WZNf3WKBC18_E8qrvayj4w.review_text: We came with a groupon a while back. The place is definitely trendy and a cute place to come on a date or with a group to hang out for drinks and dessert. It is small, so I can imagine it getting crowded. We didn't have to wait long on a weekday evening and got a table near the back. The drinks were nice and bubbly but not very strong. The desserts were super yummy though! I wish we could have tried all of them. I'm definitely looking forward to going back with friends.   Parking in the area is terrible, so carpool if you can!

EuuyiAuEa_s3VSS9i8okmg.review_text: Awesome spot!  A gem of a bar.  Great service, great wine list, wonderful desserts.  This would be a great place to have a birthday party or a private cocktail party.  We ordered the sampler dessert.  It came with a strawberry lemonade drink in a shot glass (very cute and sweet).  Then we chose 2 desserts from the list.  Our choices were the chocolate brioche (which was delicious, warm, and served with caramel ice cream), and a Chevre cheesecake which was delightful, and served with a coconut ice cream.  Beautiful small desserts.  I can't wait to go back.

ggwlUc2SV6Tb7beeC7K6QQ.review_text: The desserts were delicious! There are some really interesting choices like melon sorbet macarons.   I ordered the sampler, which was delicious. My only complaint is that some of the dishes didn't taste as fresh as I'd expect given the cost. The macarons were chewy.

a82LcYfxM9nKdiy1wogD1Q.review_text: After dinner at Tsunami, we noticed this place across the street and decided to peek at the menu.  It was compelling enough to go in...and  we were seated very promptly (a Tuesday night about 9pm.)  My first reaction was that perhaps the space is a little too big for what they are doing.  The lighting/music/etc created an intimate feel - but at the same time the emptiness in the back was kind of a bummer.  It was like going to see a show at a club with hardly anyone there and it just felt empty.   We each had a glass of port and an espresso, and shared one dessert  - it was $40 bucks. The dessert, a chocolate cannelone with ice cream, was good - but it was TEENY TINY (we should have ordered two... but then it would have been $50!)  The chocolate shavings were lacking - no flavor with the consistency of saran wrap.  For what we paid, every bit on the plate (which only amounted to about three bites) should have melted in our mouth and lingered for hours.   One nice touch was that the chef came out and gave us two truffles - he said one was lemon and the other saffron... but they tasted the same.  Maybe the saran wrap shavings warped our taste buds.  Yes, I would go back, though probably only for a more special occasion considering the price... and only if I was already in the area.  The location makes it more of a neighborhood spot than a destination, so I guess time will tell if they make it.

QRBvTcS5o1HJ7hzif0cnRA.review_text: This place is about as go good as it gets for me. I tried the Chocolate Cremeux Cake and it was wonderful. It is a little rich so its definitely made for chocolate lovers. I am definitely going back to try the rest of their menu. On top of delicious cake, they have a happy hour menu from 6-8 serving 3 dollar white and red sangria! Personally I liked the white sangria better, it was very fruity and refreshing.   Candybar is a great place if you're looking for to get together to catch up with a few friends over drinks and dessert. Also they have boardgames available, so Blockus/Connect4/ Monopoly always wins!

hWG1Gt_3ETpB1Eg9m5G6dw.review_text: So, before I get to the wine debacle, let me first comment on the food.  After filling ourselves up with pizza at Little Star, we headed over to Candy Bar for some dessert.  Our first surprise was how empty it was - the last couple of times we'd tried to eat here, the wait had been in excess of an hour and we'd given up.  This time, we walked straight in and were seated immediately, pushing a few tables together to accomodate our group of 6.  We ordered a range of desserts to share - vanilla brioche with figs and white coffee ice cream, a chocolate pave with milk foam, sesame candybars with preserved kumquats and sesame ice cream and something else with hibiscus sorbet.  None of the desserts really seemed to gel together, they had some interesting elements but didn't quite coagulate as a whole.  For example, the vanilla brioche was tasty, the coffee ice cream was tasty and the figs were tasty.  But none of them really went with the other.  They were much better eaten as individual items than as a combined dessert.  Based on our eating experience alone, I don't think we'd be rushing back  However, then there was the "wine debacle"...  When we ordered our desserts, we also ordered a bottle of wine.   A short wine later, the waiter arrived at our table with an open bottle of wine (with the cork jammed in the top) and a large glass of wine.  "OK" he said "who wants to taste the wine?"  Then he proceeded to disclose to us was that the reason the wine was open was because the barman had mis-heard the order for the bottle and had instead just poured a glass from a new bottle.  But since they didn't have any other bottle of that particular wine, they brought it anyway - the opened bottle and the glass that had supposedly been poured from it.  It was immediately clear that this was not true.  The opened bottle had barely a splash missing from it - just enough for the wine to be below the neck, but certainly not enough to fill the large glass that the waiter was passing off.  The wine bottle also had numerous large drips of wine that had run down the side of it - most odd.  Also, when we tasted the wine, there was a distinct difference between the wine in the bottle and the wine in the glass.  All at our table tasted it, and we all agreed it was a very different wine.  The next time he passed, we called the waiter over and asked him to level with us.  We told him what we'd noticed about the level in the wine bottle and that there was no way the full glass came from that bottle.  Additionally, we pointed out the flavor difference.  He maintained the story, even after we poured him a little of each type for his own taste.  However, he went to talk to "that pesky bartender" to investigate.  A gent that appeared to be the owner or manager had observed the goings on and came over to investigate for himself.  We explained again and he too went off to investigate.  Well, the waiter returned, this time with a different story.  Now we were told that the single glass of wine was actually the last of a previous bottle with a splash from the almost full bottle.  While this explained the missing splash from the top of our bottle, it didn't explain the difference in taste between the glass of wine and the rest of the bottle.  In the end, they comped us the wine plus sent us out an extra dessert.  However, we were left wondering exactly what went on with our wine.  Theories abounded - from believing the waiters second story to wondering if the abundance of drips around the bottle indicated that the bartender had poured two open bottles into one.  In any case, we were miffed that we had been lied to in the first case and generally left with a bad taste in our mouth that didn't just come from the wine.  So, my tip for you in all cases is that if you order a bottle of wine, make sure it is opened in front of you.

pzprdk8f8wfsRpfTSFUmbw.review_text: KEWT!!!  After hitting Little Star with some friends we HAD to try this place out for the dessert portion of our double date.  It was perfect.  We all ordered teas and sangria and it went perfectly with our desserts.  One couple had the cheesecake and we had the lemon tart.  The space was also cozy and it was great to see people playing board games which were provided by the bar!  Stylish ottomans and coffee tables makes Keika happy.

zp2NxN0q4PafBPgE2c8LSg.review_text: I can say I'm pretty familiar with the Hong Kong dessert scene. So, I didn't know what to expect from Candybar. I guess to me, Candybar was like a bar with desserts. Yum!  The walls are adorned with San Francisco themed art.  There are seats at the bar or couch-y benches with tables. The menu isn't too big, but it's hard to choose because everything sounds so good!    My good friend and I ordered the dessert for two.  It comes with four of their desserts to share. We ordered the Apple a là mode, San Francisco tiramisu, Strawberry lemonade, and the Japanese cheesecake. I also got the mango tango Bellini. Lemme tell you...this Bellini is so yummy, I almost drank it all in a minute. It was bubbly,mango-y, and so refreshing.  The San Francisco tiramisu was your regular tiramisu. I thought the Japanese cheesecake would be more moist like the ones you find in Asian supermarkets, but it was more dense and didn't have a lot of cheese flavor. There were tons of apples in the a là mode and the gingerbread ice cream had great gingery cinnamon flavor. My favorite was the strawberry lemonade. It was like strawberries on top of a lemon mousse.   They also had board games, but it seemed too busy of a night (Friday) to hog up a table and play games. I recommend getting the dessert for two if you're not going alone. The individual desserts are pricey and small. When it gets busy, it also gets loud. Enjoy your dessert!

i9xSrBMDmccp89U8uC4qSg.review_text: I really wanted to love it.  It's my dream combo...drinks and dessert.  But very sadly it was disappointing.  the 2 stars are for concept, ambiance, and cocktails.  The cocktails were lovely and I loved the low lighting.  The board games are a fun idea.  The desserts.....sad face.  I am a sugar person so for me to say these were too sweet is pretty crazy.  I couldn't make it through the drunken smore and my boyfriend gagged at the brownies that came with the ice cream sandwiches.  So sweet!!!  It would be the place I would love to bring out-of-towners and girlfriends but sadly just can't.

u8N1v4Wm-8LhIw7xXr6qbg.review_text: Such a cute little place. It's cozy, has a nice vibe and  would be a GREAT place to take a date.   The desserts are unique and delicious!! The chocolate mouse cake was divine and the vanilla ice cream was the best i've ever tasted. EVER!  -1 star because the desserts are very small and expensive.

NEOSYsubf7SVeVm8RytxYA.review_text: I could not wait to try this place.  Who doesn't want to have their choice of so many yummy desserts plus alcohol.  Pretty genius to create a lounge for desserts.  I have to say this might be the best dessert place.  Super romantic for couples out there.  The menu provides a wonderful selection of wines and delicious desserts.  You can do a little tasting of a little bit of everything.  I especially love that they provide board games and display a whole bunch of unique artwork around the space.  My favorites are always anything that involves a macaron.

McdM2ZW9Zc_x4TGdp4axeQ.review_text: Four of us walked into this place on a Sunday evening really just looking for a dessert or two to share. The first question asked of us as we walked in was ... "are you here for the kung fu tacos?". Our reaction ... what the hey-yell? =) Anyway, there were a lot of people in the front which made me think there were no seats but the waiter got us some menus and walked to the back of Candy Bar and sat us down.   We took a look at the menu and kinda turned our head when we saw a Nacho Sundae on the menu though somewhat intrigued by how that can be a dessert. The host kindly described what made it all up and we went ahead and ordered that along with the Chocolate Cremeux Cake, Chocolate Fudgescile and White Chocolate Mousse.   Verdict?? It was all yumminess. I must say I am impressed on the nachos. The guac was made from avocado yogurt, cheese strips were mango among other things.. very creative and delicious indeed. It had a blend of flavors that worked incredibly well. I felt like i was having dessert and my mind wasn't thinking nacho after I bit into it.   The other big winner I thought was the Chocolate Cremeux Cake ... it was a rich chocolate cake with an excellent raspberry sauce and cherry ice cream.   I haven't been to a dessert only bar in SF though and this one is a winner.   In additon, the ambiance was dark and loungy but very very relaxed. People were talking and enjoying their kung fu tacos on the front side and the back side is a bit more secluded despite the place not being big... and they had games like Candyland!!!   We washed down the desserts with some gourmet teas ... slightly on the expensive side but they came loose leaf with some filters that kept my tea grain free.   Good going Candy Bar.

l0ITWlrwFr-27Zg-iTBtig.review_text: Apple dessert and the Drunken S'More were both fabulous.  The service is very good and the staff are very attentive to your needs and the quality of desserts and drinks they serve.    Our server Randy was by far the best we have had for the entire length of our stay in the city.  Very much a hip and younger crowd hang out.   Food = Fabulous Service= Superb Atmosphere= Awesome  Overall an A+ Recommend for anyone wanting a different kind of "Sweet Experience" It is sugar for Grownups!!!

1XANyLruTMqMCYelC8qBig.review_text: Favorite neighborhood hangout? Uhm yes. Especially because it's like 3 minutes from my apartment.   I'd seen Candybar on Yelp before when searching "bars with boardgames." The description of the bar and its website seemed way too classy to have boardgames, but alas! they are there.   My roommate and I came in for happy hour last Friday and had the strawberry cheesecake, peanut butter cup, and a few cocktails. The desserts aren't discounted, but they are totally worth the price. They are delicious and creative and even though they look small, they pack a punch. The cocktails....well let's say that 2 sparkling wine cocktails were just right for these girls to turn a quiet evening into a NOPA bar adventure.  But back to the point. I think everything about this place is great. It's always crowded when we walk by late on Friday and Saturdays, but happy hour is perfect timing. If you're eating dessert, sit at a table or else you'll get it all over yourself.

jjRfw-tG4szubJREbacQWw.review_text: I split the $10.xx tiramisu here with my bf. It was YUM but overpriced, and not the best tiramisu of all time. For $10.xx, it should be the best tiramisu of all time. It should be as good as the tiramisu at Victoria's Cafe in the North End of Boston. Wow I actually want something from Boston.   Lovely decor. Overpriced dessert.

Xf5KPJimu8cLFndTL8WPJQ.review_text: I returned to CandyBar this weekend for a post-dinner sugar fest after nearly 2 years or so. Boy has it changed! It is evidently THE happening dessert spot on a Saturday night, it seemed! In an otherwise quiet neighborhood, we knew we had arrived when the sound of trendy music came pouring out the door of this tiny venue!  The dessert menu was delectable as usual. Since there were only two of us and we were already super full from dinner, we chose to split one dessert (which ended up being HUGE!). We ordered the tiramisu. It was fairly good, not the best I've had...but I couldn't hate it either. The top layer of chocolate was a super thin hardened layer, which made cutting into the tiramisu slightly inconvenient as it was toppling the entire cake. I still prefer the powdered cocoa that a tiramisu should traditionally be layered with.  Anyway, a great spot to grab dessert, chill, and play board games (they have a bunch on some shelves that you can play) with friends. Apparently it does get packed on weekends now though, so highly recommend a pre-9pm arrival or you'll be left waiting for a seat in the lounge area (we happened to grab the last seat when we arrived around 9:30pm).  Parking is tough in this area. Cab it, if you can.

eA5i8ETSww-M5TSYh87QZw.review_text: 3.5 mainly because I'm not in a hurry to be back. I finally made it out to Candybar after all these years and I can only see this place as "worth it" if you get a Groupon or go during happy hour. Otherwise, just pass on it.  We had the $36 Groupon deal for 4 deserts and 4 specialty drinks for the 4 of us. We just presented the deal and paid for tax and tip at the end; it worked out smoothly.   BIG FRANCESCO'S TIRAMISU "Big" really meant big! For $10, this was the most bang for your buck. It wasn't the most amazing cake ever but it was enjoyable, especially since it was the size of the old-school Gameboy!   LYCHEE GUAVA MARTINI Tasted deliciously sweet in the first few sips then the soju starts to kick in. Still subtle but making its presence known. The lychee at the bottom made for a nice reward at the end.    One of my friends got the Apple A La Mode and she was able to switch out the gingerbread ice cream for coffee without trouble. Her Peach Martini came with a Trolli's Peach-o too! Pretty awesome.   Another friend of mine wanted a mocktail and they only had 2 options for that - Strawberry Kiss and the Lychee Guava Martini. A bit limited but okay.  Our bill came out to be $75+! Thank goodness for our Groupon deal! I'm so glad I listened to my friends' advice about going only with a Groupon. Until the next deal, Candybar!

gjwYVOucVAOAvciyWwJ4Pw.review_text: Interesting menu...the seating was rather haphazard and chairs on opposite sides of the table didn't seem to be at the same height as the ones on the other side (sat on one of their benches)....seemed as though these guys went dumpster diving the day before opening night.....   Had three items here.  1. Blueberry pomegranate Soju cocktail ..tasted like NyQuil  2. thyme ice cream with chocolate ganache pretty but didn't taste that good.  3. Banana dumplings: too doughy, the milk foam that was served wasn't sweet enough to compensate for the doughy banana.   The only plus point here was their service which was quite friendly.

v7ZTakjDGb9524rmH8DwXA.review_text: So wanted to love this place..but just can't. The desserts were interesting visually but that's about it. I love desserts but these were just sugar. Drinks were just sugar.   There are three categories of dessert in my opinion. Candy bars (Kit-Kats, Snickers, etc), Sugar desserts (the Candybar) where everything is excessively sweet without other flavors, and then there are desserts that can play off a few of your other taste buds giving you  well rounded flavors outside of sugar (Not this place)  Had the following: 1. Peanut butter jelly time-too sweet  2. Honey Lavendar Semi Freddo-little more interesting but cantaloupe seemed out of place.   Drinks were a miss as well.  The sangria was too sweet-couldn't finish Blood orange cocktail tasted like champagne only with sugar cube. Blueberry drink was bit better, had a little sour component that made it interesting. Lychee martini was good, not so sweet.  Games: little outdated but we brought our own.  Bartender was friendly.  Maybe a decent first date place..ambiance is nice and open late.  Unfortunately, don't see myself returning.

wxZVSsVa4KYDIxRkCj0akQ.review_text: meh.   Good enough on the value scale since it was a Groupon.  Not normally in the market for a dessert/wine (only, BOO) place so it was a good deal for what we paid but its not somewhere we would seek out nless perhaps we lived in the area.  The food was good but I was disappointed that what was billed on Groupon as "cocktails" were good but only made with wine.  WTH ???  BOOOOoooo !!! Not quite as good a value as I feel i was lead to believe. :(    Desserts were tasy, ambiance nice, people playing board games, overall a-ok.

5mbtFSeyGxuE4VHMYRi8HQ.review_text: I had my bridal shower here, and my guests definitely enjoyed themselves here.  It has a lounge feel, but is less uptight about dress code and you can play board games  And the desserts were so unique!  Our favorite was definitely the nachos looking one.  What I liked about this place, besides the desserts and bubblies, was the service.  Not only did they let us bring food in, but they also provided plates and forks.  Happy hour ended at 8 pm, but they let us order a last round at the special price around 8:45 pm.  There is something about boardgames that bring people who don't know one another together.  Or maybe it's the alcohol....

_v89YVxq4g5HsHUhGHAhNw.review_text: Really wanted to love this place because anything called candybar sounds fun and good!  The good...games! I love a place I can sit and play some board or card games. The decor and ambiance was also great but that really is about it!  The not so good..the desert! I shared a sundae and it was just not impressive. It might be because I love desert with all my soul and this was just meh . I've read other reviews saying how great it is..maybe for a rookie desert eater? It just lacked flavor..there was barely any flavor actual. Cocktails? Meh..the just didn't really have that "Yum" factor.  The service did suck for sure though. Our waitress never came by to ask if we wanted anything else and I had to grab her for the check.  Would I go back? Probably not. Would I recommend it? Probably not. Would I tell someone to not go there if they asked? No...I think I would tell someone to try it out and see what they think!

pzoxW-OJYS9mxnkXAtJy1g.review_text: as  a self confessed sweet-a-holic, this concept is heaven sent. I'd been getting taunted by friends who had been to  Chikalicious for far too long- now it's my turn to boast of SF's dessert bar!  Went there with a group of yelpers (who beat me to reviews!) and settled in for a 4 course dessert fest. On the suggestion of the waitress, we ordered 4 dessert 'menus' and were able to get enough tastes of each dessert.    Highlights:  -One of the owners actually remembered my name from my calling for a reservation and came over to chat and ask us our thoughts.  -The ubiquitousness of blood orange, first in a baked alaska, then in a signature cocktail.  -Milk chocolate parfait with matzoh toffee and smoked salt. YUM YUM OMG YUM  - Quite possibly, the best nighcap of warm malted milk to end the meal that I ever had.  It was like a box of delicious creamy Whoppers candy melted into a glass of milk.  Needs Improvement  -As mentioned by other yelpers, the lighting is too bright.  If this is meant to be a lounge and evoke a mood, then please adjust the lighting accordingly.   -Warm drinks- none to be had and it was a chilly night. The waitress offered my friend a cup of hot water, but didn't have anything to add, not even a lemon slice. They're bringing Blue Bottle coffee soon, but even tea would have been nice to have.  I know Candybar has not been open very long, so I hope the owners work out some of the kinks soon . n general, I think it is a great addition to the NOPA neighborhood.

r__DWvhHelLwg9zJ8p0Xpg.review_text: I love the idea of a dessert bar and Candybar delivers with great atmosphere, tasty delightful desserts and a pretty darn good white sangria. We had the lemon tart which was light. I'm looking forward to going back for a more decadant dessert.

SZis6B7ppRfYYW-la-peAg.review_text: The decor is confusing, I think it was all thrown together without much thought. They were playing hip hop when I was there and I was eating dessert- I kind of appreciated that the music didn't necessarily match the dessert lounge vibe. The dessert was lovely- the red velvet cake- yes please. If more thought had been given the design and atmosphere of the place, I would have given it 5 stars. These also have an excellent dessert wine selection.

8qhMB7cHwrEYI69LVz2Yvg.review_text: No liquor! I should have inquired before waiting outside in the cold for 30 mins. They brought our dessert to the people next to us--I watched them breathe on/pick at it and determine it wasn't there's for a good 5 mins. Then the waiter took it back, walked a few steps away (I'm watching this carefully), stands there and contemplates sending it back to the kitchen, then turns around and gives it to us. I didn't want to be "that guy" and the people next to us looked pretty clean so I ate it anyway. And the cake was super dry. And I was painfully sober.

p7Zp54sz-ErtTD9s7MBeOQ.review_text: This is a place mostly for "girls nights outs" or city girls treating themselves or a date. I came with a group of friends and I thought the desserts and experience were just ok.  We came early on a Sunday night so luckily there was no wait and sat a table near the cashier/bar. My friend ordered some kind of fruity wine drink and we got her a strawberry pudding for her birthday. My other friends and I shared the banana split. The desserts were decent but overpriced.   I was kinda upset that the dessert sampler did not apply to groups of 3 or more or had some weird restriction. Also the service was really slow. I was not really charmed by the place but I can see lots of women thinking its really cute.

imuWykPt49cPQRwiJ9tcdQ.review_text: Can't say it any way other than i freaking love this place. A really cool spot to lounge at night, get a couple drinks, eat some killer desserts, and absolutely CRUSH some friends at a "friendly" game of Sorry!   Every time I come here I'm never disappointed, the desserts have been stellar each time ranging from Peanut Butter Jelly Time to the Passion Fruit Mousse. The drinks are awesome too, definitely more of the lounge type drinks than the hardcore cocktails, but coming to a spot like this I couldn't imagine why you'd wanna get hammered. Toss in the board games all around and it's a really cool spot to hit up if you have some friends in town and wanna do something different, or if you're over the normal bars and clubs and just wanna kick it.  Bonus points for the dope artwork along the walls too, my friends have caught me eyeballing them in my feeble attempts to come up with ways to toss them in my car unnoticed.

ugk0g6vyv2XavpoTaJSy6A.review_text: In theory, Candybar is every girl's dream come true. Desserts, cocktails, pink decor, music, and even wholesome board games!   You can make reservations, so I recommend doing that if you are planning on coming with a group. It gets kind of crowded on Fridays and I am guessing Saturdays as well. They wouldn't seat us until our whole party was there, and were really quick to seat us as soon as our group was complete, so that was nice.   I felt like our drinks could have been mixed a little better. I got the Jasmine Sparkle because I love jasmine and I'd never had a drink with it before. Unfortunately the majority of my drink just tasted like sparkling wine while the last 20% was pure jasmine aroma. It had potential but failed to impress. R got the Kir Royale (sparkling wine and creme de cassis) which was scarlet colored and a bit sweeter and more satisfying than the JS.   For dessert we got the Apple a la Mode (hazelnut crust, cream cheese filling, caramel, gingerbread ice cream and apples of course!) Again, better sounding than in taste. It was very sweet though I did enjoy the warm apples and the ice cream together. The cream cheese filling was weird and by the time I was eating it I had forgotten what it was so I kind of neglected it because it seemed pointless. I wish we got a chocolate dessert instead. The tiramisu is apparently pretty bomb!   I would say that although the menu at Candybar leaves something to be desired, the environment is unique and an enjoyable place to be if you are looking for a trendy place to hang out while indulging in childhood sins of sweets and board-games.  FYI, parking is a bitch.

BwTPj8XS_iqdSTLPBVMs1w.review_text: Happy Hour here should be illegal. Dessert and alcohol? My kind of place! The cocktails here were to DIE for. I wanted to double fist so bad but my coworkers stopped me as happy hour was going to end at 8pm. Darn. The desserts here are creative. Next time, I'll eat dinner first then come to Candy Bar after. Eating greasy nachos after having the dessert here is a no-no.

DYCNLhA7D3nC9vaVEzvorA.review_text: The drunken smores! Awesome customer service. Love the atmosphere. Parking really does suck tho, had to park like 2-3 blocks away, but that's San Francisco for yeah. However their cocktails are so yummy (;

RfEvAR_lQbv8Je-ryPSxJA.review_text: happy hour.   group on. date night  (be it friend(S) or lover(s).  It was a Wednesday night and I had dessert for dinner.  It was a good thing.    I am not a super sweets kinda gal, but I pretty much polished off that dang PB Jelly time with no problem.  My lady had the strawberry limeade cute mason jar treat and I even liked that.    Sure, as some folks mentioned before, the drinks could feasibly be made at home.  Big deal.  I don't care.  I work in a bar and am not drinking to be completely blown away by inventiveness or technique because inventiveness and technique don't necessarily make for a delicious drank.    That said, we cut the sweetness of the raspberry kiss and it was delicious.  We also enjoyed the strawberry kiss and the one that had orange bitters was nice as well.  I don't do soju so I can't speak to those offerings.    The bartender was really sweet.  Additionally, counter seating isn't the most romantic or fun, typically, but the set up here is great, it was super easy to chat laugh play flirt and not feel like someone was breathing down your neck!  The acoustics were such that I never had to strain to hear even though the place was packed.  There was a line out the door and it sure looked cold outside, but from where I was sitting laughing and clinking my sparkling wine cocktail with my gal all I could think was "Let them eat cake" (or, better said, peanut butter jelly time) and I'm sure they did.  Eventually.

pIWt9TWENyqf52Sn8gch3g.review_text: The concept of Candybar is a very unique one! Take everything that girls love and put it into one very classy place. Here you can get your girly mixed drinks (or a nice glass of champagne) and an assortment of tasty desserts. Did I mention the assortment of games to choose from? It's a nice place to take your girls especially in my case where we took one of my best friends here.   The wait to be seated was very long but you can still order drinks if you are able to wait inside. We waited about 40 minutes which was a bit frustrating. It is also very cramped so often 3-4 people are squeezed where only 2 people are supposed to go. The overall vibe of this place is very hip, lighting is very romantic however, in my opinion (though others might disagree) might not be the best date place.  At first we wanted to try the sampler but got discouraged with the extra charge so tried the Chocolate Financier Cake and Strawberry Limeade. The Chocolate Financier Cake was very fine. I've never had Bavarian cream frozen and it was a great taste with the cranberry sauce. The crumble was my favorite part of that dish. The Strawberry Limeade was a very cute layered dessert to share with my friends. Being Filipino, I was SO surprised to see Calamansi used, it was the first dessert I had that ever used it. The dessert was alright except that the strawberries were slightly sour.   Overall, I did enjoy my experience at Candybar especially with a couple great friends! Be prepared for a wait and to squeeze. Also, you may want to bring a flashlight to their bathroom! :)

hnw7PX_6Wc5K2EBOagv13Q.review_text: I love the idea of Candybar and it's a really cool unique place for a variety of occasions; groups, girls night out, date night, friendly hang out. I like the decor, being able to play board games, and the owners were super nice even though it was crazy busy when we were there.    The reason I'm giving it a 4 is because I think people should definitely check it out, but the owners could improve the place in a few areas.  Here is my note to the owners about how it could be improved!    1.) The food is pretty good, but like a lot of other people said, they could have a bigger variety, specials, or more unique treats.  My friend and I had the apple a la mode (super super delicious) and the Tiramisu (average).  I forget the two drinks, but they are all centered around sparkling wine and very delish.  They could definitely open an hour-2 hours earlier and do an apertivo style happy hour; more appetizers and drinks.    2.) The place is very crowded and the wait can be long (we waited an hour and a half but we came on the last day of the Groupon so our bad, but it sounds like others waited awhile as well).  Like someone else said, the boardgames are cool, but it does feel a little cramped and rushed when there are so many people waiting outside.  It would be awesome to expand the place or get some outdoor seating.  They seem like they are getting more popular and could afford to expand a little or open another location.  Overall, it's a great little place and look forward to seeing how they change in the upcoming months and years!

tZ6UTquj55ULeqKjckOsug.review_text: This place is probably one of the best ideas ever!  Why didn't I think of this? Personally I love desserts, and beautifully hand crafted? Candybar is a great spot for a dessert date or a night out with friends, dessert, board games and maybe a few sangrias.  As we drove around the area searching for parking, I spotted the place because it was dimly lit with a touch of pink glowing out. I knew it had to be it. For a Friday evening at about 7-8PM, it was slightly crowded. We got in and were seated right away. The tables are pretty close together, as the space is small.  I took a look at the menu and decided to get the dessert for 2, 4 for $25? We decided this would be the best option since we get to sample more things at a reasonable price. I realized that the regular option comes in bigger portions. It was okay though, the small portions were good enough.  We got the chocolate ice cream sandwich which was chocolate ice cream sandwiched between a macaron. It had glazed blueberries on the side. This was my favorite.  Apple pie a la mode ties with the macaron ice cream sandwich. It had a great apple pie taste with pie crust/graham cracker crumbs and was topped with gingerbread ice cream.  Lemon tart is basically what it says. A cookie tart filled with a tart lemon-y custard and had ice cream? And coconut shavings on the side. It said it came with a coconut macaron but I guess it was all smashed? Idk, this was ok.  My least favorite was the japanese cheesecake. I did not like the texture of it, but I think that's how japanese cheesecake is. It's basically a sponge type of cake and it came with liquored honeydew and guava ice cream. I enjoyed the two, but the cake itself wasn't that good.

Zcg8WQHGP8kLAIMfbvfgUA.review_text: Sorry but a mini dessert should not cost $15! Maybe I don't like the Yuppy lifestyle. I don't even think their desserts are good at all and I had a sip of their wine that wasn't good. I would rather order one of those cakes from Chili's for 1/3 as much and I would be much happier.

D8i9LE0cqcDDnM3ur5MT_A.review_text: A one-of-a-kind type of place that largely benefits from being possibly the only quality dessert bar in SF.  Desserts- Not quite spectacular but definitely above average. The Apple Ala Mode was essentially a well-made apple crumble sitting in a pool of caramel and topped with apple slices. The highlight was definitely the scoop of gingerbread ice cream that came with the whole thing. It was just a normal cream color with specks that made it look like vanilla bean in the low light but tasted of gingerbread and was a great pairing with the caramel sauce. Quite creative to stick that with an apple crumble-type dessert. I also got to see the Peanut Butter Jelly Time, Flourless Chocolate Banana Torte, and Ice Cream Sundae which my friends ordered. They all looked great and were presented on large plates. The Ice Cream Sundae is a bit of a deconstructed version with three little sandwiches on a long rectangular dish so don't expect a giant glass with a cherry on top when you're ordering.  Drinks- Definitely where Candybar shines true. Dessert cocktails you probably can't find anywhere else. From soju to sparkling wine to sangria they definitely have creative options to choose from which all tasted great. Something to note is that most of the flavors were fruit based rather than chocolate or other types of liquor. I think there might have been one cocktail that had Bailey's but otherwise it seemed to be mostly fruity. I don't think it was a seasonal menu since we were there in the winter but there's a possibility that they change up there menu? I guess you'll have to find out by going sometime!  Overall, a nice casual bar for a laid-back weekend night. They don't have a whole lot of seating but they do have some sofa areas for bigger groups. There's a full bar to sit at as well and board games to entertain! They've done the cutesy/classy vibe well and I can't wait to come back!

1DP8r48ONQsDZOMgr0ZY-w.review_text: I think I'm diabetic now. :)   This place was really fun as it has board games for you to play with while your having your desserts. I had the Ice Cream Sundae which consisted of Macaron / Brulee'd Bananas / Brownie / Vanilla Anglaise / Strawberries / Strawberry Sherbert. It wasn't too sweet so I liked it. I also had something that was the like a s'more but I forgot the name of it. That one was too rich for me to handle. It made me want to scarf down a bag of salty potato chips.   Overall a cool, fun, sweet place and I definitely recommend to try it.

qu7YbYTE_3UTeZOXRy_1lg.review_text: LOVE this place...for someone with not a sweet tooth, but sweet TEETH, this was heaven! My friends and I pretty much ordered the entire dessert menu, so I got a little taste of everything. My favorite was the ice cream sandwiches...with macarons and melon flavored ice cream...my mouth is watering just thinking of it!  We came in a large group of 10 so it was a little challenging finding a space for everyone, we ended up waiting for a little while. I'd say the optimum group number would be no more than 5. Really sweet, almost romantic, dim lit atmosphere.   Definitely coming back every chance I get! :D

U-efbblVKHe0qvvMiVTtwg.review_text: Such a cute and trendy place! I really dig the hipster/modern pieces of art they have on the walls and the dim red lighting gives the place a romantic feel- good for first dates or just a mellow night out with the girls!  Happy hours are every day from 6-8, and it does get a little crowded here 'round that time. Don't forget to check in and put your name on the waiting list so that you'd get seated more quickly! Typical wait time 10-25 minutes on weekends.  Love all their cocktails- try the blood orange and the lychee soju! Their desserts are a bit too sweet for me though. I had the tiramisu once and it was a bit overwhelming.  Would definitely be back! :)

tuHli40Q0WQdIPjOvklUXA.review_text: Candybar. How awesome to have dessert before dinner? Anyways we find the place and get there right before happy hour ends. Candybar Lemon Drop Shots for everyone. For some reason it was pretty strong but tasted super good. Also tried their Passion Fruit Delight. The husband drank the red Sangria. For dessert we ordered the Big Francesco's Tiramisu and our friends ordered the Apple a la Mode. Anyways everything was amazing. Service was pleasant and on it. They also had tons of games available that you can play with a group of friends. I loved the chill vibe and atmosphere. Anyways, Candybar lived up to its name and our visit there was super sweet!

7FIeTx_TBCiLUpGs1sPJPw.review_text: Went on the last night of the Amazon Local deal and it was bananas! Everyone seemed to wait until the last minute to use their deal.  On that matter, the staff dealt with it very well. They tried as hard as they could to fit everyone in their small establishment. They don't have a waiting area inside, but luckily it was a nice night out in the city.  I got the s'mores dessert and my boyfriend got the apple pie. I wish my s'more was hotter in temperature, but it was yummy. The apple pie one was so good, I almost ate all of his!  The drinks were not outstanding, but not something to complain about. I would probably return here during their happy hour (6-8) for a girls night

Ixd5fdjQreCYpsIkaP_cgQ.review_text: Ehh. Maybe because i'm not huge on sweets. I can here a total of 3 times. I didn't think they had a very diverse menu, they only had desserts that can usually be served fancy. A lot of the desserts and wines i thought were overpriced. Most of the servings were either too little or too big.   Parking is always a problem in this area. I would always bring my friends here since they always have a sweet tooth. Board games are a novelty. i only see the teenagers play with them.   This is where hipsters go to look fancy.

BVv2Yt-aHI_9-SR6Eu9EfA.review_text: I ordered two different glasses of dessert wine that we get all the time. Both wines tasted like they had been opened for a while. Desserts were ok but a bit too sweet. We were the only ones in there so they could have checked the wine before serving it.

TIrOT3y33xydiOnNSqDvOA.review_text: Love the combination of desserts, alcohol, and board games!  This place is so unique in that it really caters to the group of people who just want to chill and hang out with their friends after a nice dinner out. My friends and I are over the whole clubbing scene so we just wanted to talk and enjoy each other's company for my girlfriend's birthday.   She picked this place and it was great! We walked in and only had to wait ten minutes for a table of five. The place is pretty small, which is a downer so there is probably a wait usually.   They had a nice assortment of drinks that were fruity and inspired by anything sweet. The mango tango bellini was yummy! Didn't even taste the alcohol, but sure felt it! Skip the Passion Fruit delight.    The desserts are very good. I liked the Chocolate financier cake (perfect balance of chocolate and not too sweet) and lemon tart (not too sour and crust was yummy).   Reasonably priced for everything. We didn't pay more than 60 bucks for all of us. Desserts are easily sharable!  The best part was probably being able to play Apples to Apples while enjoying delightful drinks and desserts with my friends! This is my idea of a fun time!

J6uJ-UuxaLM0ZrXZmc9M5A.review_text: Finally!  I feel like I've been looking for a place where I can go for wine and dessert - and that doesn't close ridiculously early like Citizen Cake.  Candy Bar is cute, cozy, has board games, and plays fun music.   My husband got the Strawberry Limeade Mousse that was killer, and I got the Chocolate Raspberry Brownie which was ok (it was a ganache brownie and a bit too gooey and rich).    We will certainly go back.  THANK YOU, Candy Bar for coming to our neighborhood!

0eNLRQrVaUc10g55CUBIzg.review_text: Not impressed at all.  Went here because of the great Yelp reviews.  I was really excited and had high hopes for this place because I wanted something creative for dessert and was sick of seeing the same old things (chocolate cake, cheesecake, creme brulee, key lime pie, etc) at other restaurants.  We had the chocolate financier and strawberry limeade desserts and neither were satisfying.  The strawberry dessert was ok, but nothing great and was served cold like all the components just came out of the fridge.  The financier was just really unsatisfying.  Neither were sweet or rich enough or had any substance to them.  They were plated beautifully, however the taste just did not deliver.  Hardly $9-10 desserts and definitely not worth going out of your way to get to.  We took a cab from the JW Marriott and round trip cab fare and two desserts were about $55.  Complete waste of money.  If the desserts were good then it would have been different. I left with my sweet tooth not feeling satisfied.  I loved the concept, loved the menu, but sadly the execution was just not there.  I also found the atmosphere and decor to be missing something.  I was expecting a chic, romantic, stylish, bar/lounge type place but there was no ambience and the decor looked like it was just thrown together with no theme and in need of an interior designer.  This could be overlooked if the desserts were out of this world but they weren't. I expected more from San Francisco.  I can get way better desserts in Orlando which is hardly a food mecca.

GO1y1duHFo-AaS4RiLMKDQ.review_text: Came here and I was OF AGE this time, so I could actually order a drink! Hooray!! What a beautiful thing it is to be 22!   The desserts were just as good as I remember. And the mango bellini was kind of intense haha. There was a scoop of mango sorbet in my drink! A scoop of ice cream in my drink? Is this where good people go when they die?   I can't wait to come here with my girlfriends! Seriously . Perfect for a date night or a just hanging with the girls. For guys: if you're looking for girls, you might want to consider Candybar. So many girls. The odds are ever in your favor.

Q7T-fr9HYn07x9hIC5anNw.review_text: Came here with a friend of mine for happy hour. I ordered the Strawberry Kiss sparkling wine and my friend had the Mango Tango Bellini. I thought that the Mango drink tasted better. For desserts, I got the Red Velvet cake with ice cream which was tasty.   There are seats around the bar counter and bigger tables as well. There are a couple of board games laying around on a shelf, free to bring back to your table to play.  This place is good for smaller groups or a date because it does get crowded later in the evening. Call ahead for reservations if you have a big group, and be advised that finding street parking in that area isn't easy.

fjWtBqKEd05oyNdn21Sfqg.review_text: My girlfriend buys Groupon coupons that often find their way to expiration. Last evening, we head out with our last day Groupon, into the rain for a 10 minute walk to the Candybar. Arriving a few minutes past 9 pm, we placed our name behind a waiting list of 15. Undaunted by the list and surrounded by other last day Groupon holders, we scour the menu selecting 6 delectable treats and waited and observed.  We never got our chance to nibble away at the Candybar creations.  It appears that Candybar was unprepared for last day Groupon coupons and the influx of late night visitors was too much for the host to appease. His striking comment was, "It's not my problem that you waited one year to use your coupons." [note, some folks didn't even mention having a Groupon]. After he offered numerous other unpleasant comments we realized that indeed this was his problem; but that he lacked the skills and etiquette of a good host and that Candybar was unprepared for the Groupon burden. Noticing numerous open seats during that last hour of Groupon use, we recognized another issue was the inability or unwillingness to quickly turn the empty tables.  As 10 pm approached, the host announced that he was no longer seating customers. We inquired if Candybar would honor the coupon on a later date. Answer - No! We asked if we could take our order as a take out. Answer - No! We asked if we could enjoy one treat each as we stood waiting. Answer - No. We asked if the host could suggest an option for us. Answer - Yes, use your coupons earlier.   The loss of the Groupon value and no late night treat was merely an inconvenience; however it does reaffirm our vast choices as we walked down the street and into Bar 821, where we were welcomed with open arms. In our one hour of waiting I estimated Candybar turned away (waiting list folks that simply left, or those denied seating) over 35, potentially new customers. I guess we'll have to stay with Citizen Cake on Fillmore because we value kindness and professionalism in addition to awesome treats.

JADdo9NEeO5Az9aOYbyvZA.review_text: Great service, beautiful cozy place, definitely good for dates ;-) Dessert & wine, what else do you want?

9uhOuCTlULaxLZj_j8KWHw.review_text: Good, but not great. Would go back however. Their sparkling wine infusions could be better. I got Strawberry Kiss which was ginger ale, sparkling wine and crushed strawberry and it was just ok. My friend got the 50/50 which had some type of cran-vodka and the alcohol could not be tasted nor felt at all! We shared the red velvet cake which was coated in coconut flakes and ordered the Japanese Cheeecake which came with amazing guava sorbet and honeydoo pieces w/ champagne ice shavings. Really cool! All good, but not great. Will go back to try other desserts, however. Service was good and ambiance was eclectic, but not as ambiant as it should be.

2t2HCw37rOKKWnT8C_yDng.review_text: Candybar is a small and cozy dessert bar.  It has a nice feel.  It's a great place for a date or larger groups to socialize.  I like that they offer different board games for their customers (e.g. Connect 4, Uno, Battleship, etc.)   The place is dimly lit so it's a bit difficult to read the menu.  The tables are mostly two or four seats, but they do have an area up front by the window that can seat at least 8 people.  There is also a bar counter inside where I've seen people sit/stand.  They offer reservations, but only for 6+ people.   I think they changed their menu as I didn't see a few items listed from the previous time I was here. **Food** Soft Cheesecake:  Shortbread / Pecans / Sweet Pink Grapefruit Leche / Rice Krispy Crunch / Passion Fruit Sorbet - It didn't taste like cheesecake at all.  I wasn't a fan.  yelp.com/biz_photos/cand… Tiramisu:  Coffee Chiffon / Chocolate and Rum Mascarpone Cream / Coffee Bits / Chocolate - It was okay. Ice Cream Sandwich:  Almond Parisian Macaron / Chocolate Ganache / Berries / Honeydew Ice Cream -- The best dessert out of the four ordered.  The macaron was perfect and it was plated nicely.   I don't remember the name of the other dessert, but it was a S'more.  I remember there was caramel in it, but we were not fans as it tasted burnt.   **Cocktails** Passion Fruit Delight - sparkling wine, passion fruit syrup:  It's a bubbly.  It definitely lacked in flavor as I couldn't taste the passion fruit at all.  I would not order this again. Mango Tango Bellini - sparkling wine, mango syrup, mango-tangerine sorbet:  I liked this.  The glass came rimmed with sugar and there was a ball of mango-tangerine sorbet in the middle of the bubble.  The sorbet was delicious and blended nicely with the sparkling wine.  It's definitely a girly drink.   **Service** Service was okay.   **Overall** It's cute place for a date or to hang out with friends.  The prices are pretty average for dessert and drinks. However, I've had better tasting desserts.  Parking is horrible so it's probably better to carpool or take a taxi/bus.  Would I come back?  Probably if friends wanted to go, but I've been to better dessert bars/lounges.

dALmtPBisx-S87sMNzAFoA.review_text: This place is super cute.  Great for small gathering (less than 6 people) and date nights. The drinks and desserts are delicious and the service is great.  My favorite drink was the Blueberry Promegranate drink.  My friends and I went to check-out the place because of an expiring Groupon deal.  The deal was awesome and drew a large crowd.  The restaurant has some amazing art on the wall and I loved it. The wait at the restaurant was long but the bartender served us drinks while we waited.  We were told that it is usually less croweded if it were not for the expiring Groupon.   We had a great experience but there are a couple of downers: - turn over of tables are slow because some people stayed to play games (which is an awesome idea if there were more space in the restaurant) - parking is pretty bad around the area

zct7LpIct1XcBnZdFOdE0Q.review_text: We went to candybar around 7ish on Saturday night and it was pretty quite.  A great place to hangout though with a friendly hip neighborhood vibe.  They've got boardgames available to play also, though I imagine that to be more for the day time crowd as the lighting is kept low at night for the lounge feel.    I had the Vanilla Brioche with Pecan Ice Cream and Cinnamon Poached Pears.  The pears didn't have much of a cinnamon flavor to them, but that was fine with me though because the brioche was delicious.  It had a crisp caramelized top, like a creme brulee, and went well with the ice cream.     Also got to try the Cheesecake, which was good overall and kind of like a deconstructed cheesecake, not overly rich so it would be good for after dinner.  And the Poached Blood Orange and Lychee Fruit Salad, was refreshing, though quickly turned into more of a cold fruit soup.    I would highly recommend the Vanilla Brioche and Cheesecake though for future visits.

ZpUI9ze0YlA6nMSHwx3ZYQ.review_text: Came by for dessert the other night. To my surprise, I was able to find street parking upon arrival. The wait for a table was ~20 minutes on a Saturday evening.  The fruity drink for the evening was the Strawberry Kiss which was okay. It was similar to a cough syrup?!?  The Lavender Honey Creme Fraiche Semi Freddo was decent but did have a little too much "noise" in the dessert with peanut butter brittle, nuts etc.   The soft cheesecake was also very mediocre with again too much noise...  Service wasn't too friendly by the staff and the lighting inside the bar/lounge was on the darker side...a little too dark.   There was also a candle for ambiance...but since the table was too small...it was a waste of space!  In summary, this seems to be a dessert venue with potential. Good in theory but poor in execution.

YPOC5SaADtc2QlVaeTb9Sg.review_text: I love love this place!!! My first visit last nite and it's so cute on the inside. Parking is so hard to find...we had to circle the surrounding blocks for 10 minutes. However, it was well worth the wait! A cute hole in the wall dessert lounge with soft red lighting, neo-soul type paintings on the wall, books to read, and old children's games such as Connect 4 and Candyland to share with a friend/partner.  The champagne drinks are amazing! I highly recommend the Raspberry Delight (raspberry syrup and sparkling wine), the Jasmine Sparkle (sparkling wine, jasmine, lemon), or the red Sangria. So refreshing and pairs nicely with all the desserts.
