My friend and I ordered dessert too and tried the Lavender Honey Creme Fraiche Semi Freddo which is a frozen light purple lavender honey semi freddo topped with nutella powder, pieces of homemade almond brittle, and little balls of fresh cantelope. It looked so amazing my friend and I took pictures of it with our iphones. I was so pleased with this place! Plus the bathroom is so romantic too. There is no lighting in the bathroom but, on a table in the bathroom, are pillar candles that serve as the lighting. It is dim but it's supposed to be a romantic theme throughout the place and the bathroom is no exception.  Will definitely return again!!

Ow_oHwqaBBRuUAiNrL8rRw.review_text: Went on a Friday night , it had been opened 6 days so they say.  Already full of customers.  Had a welcoming atmosphere. Ordered a Pinor and had baked Alaska.  Everything was good and the desert was great! will be back. Lots of local  yokles.

wzzmDZgDLsPd4eC5JvSrMw.review_text: OMG.  This place is amazing!  It has to be the best concept ever and its executed very very well.  There's delicious desert and yummy fruity drinks and board games!  Its the perfect place to come with a group of friends and order a bunch of things to share and play 80s trivia games or "would you rather."   The food here is great.  I tried the Chocolate Financier Cake which was basically a very dense brownie and a frozen wedge of pastry cream covered in cookie crumbs and almonds.  It sounds weird, but all the flavors and textured worked for me.  My friend had the Peanut Butter Jelly Time which is a chocolate tart with pb cream and blackberry jam.  I think the jam was a bit overwhelming, but it was still awesome. I cant wait to come back and try the rest of the menu and the rest of the games.  As usual in SF, the parking sucks and there is a long wait.

GeRP723KwUXL32S_h-OdCg.review_text: I'm a big fan of sweets, alcohol, and multitasking. I know, an odd trio of interests. I also get a pathetic pleasure from crossing things off of lists. So when Candybar gave me the opportunity to multitask by sampling some desserts, boozin' it up, and finally deleting this bookmark I've had for months....I was in heaven. I was accompanied by the fabulous Gill C for a "Dessert For Dinner" get together.  First things first, I love the name. It's great. Candybar...one word that completely expresses their entire mission. They could stand to go a little farther with the finishing touches though...maybe some bowls of unique and interesting candies on the tables, a beautiful lollipop as a stirrer for my cocktail, etc etc. Nothing too tacky, just a few small extras.  Ok, now the important stuff. We ordered:  1. Sangria: Had the red. Ordered the white, but they were out of it. This did not please me. The red was good though, a little on the sweet side.   2. Passionfruit Delight: sparkling wine and passion fruit syrup. This was good, though I didn't taste much of the passionfruit.  3. Chocolate Fudgesicle with pralined cornnuts, caramel, and vanilla ice cream. Ok, but too small. I'm not exactly sure what was in the fudgesicle, it almost tasted like non-hardened magic shell topping. the cornnuts were interesting, but not really sure they contributed much to the dish. I could take them or leave them. Size-wise this dessert is way too small.   4. Nacho Sundae with papaya, mango, kiwi, cilantro, avocado yogurt, candied jalapeno, and horchata ice cream. Love the idea here...the execution needs some help. Mostly in the departments of size and ingredient distribution. There was only one candied jalapeno, so only I got to try it. Also, there were 4 chips total...2 chips each? We are ladies who like to eat, and this just isn't cutting it. The mango was cutely diced to look like shredded cheese. I liked that, but there needed to be more of it. Everyone wants their nachos cheesy.  Both the avocado yogurt and horchata ice cream were delicious.   There is a large seating area in front that can be reserved for private parties. There was a party here while we were dining and they brought in about 8 large pizzas from Little Star and stored them on the table right next to us. After our skimpy little desserts I was dying to steal a slice.  The service was a little off. Not really openly bitchy but kind of cold, and I prefer my sweets served with a smile. Also, the server cleared our plates while I was still chewing my last bite, and there were some scraps I was still planning to eat. Give me a minute to finish up woman!  Happy hour is every night 6-8. There are some good drink deals ($3 sangria, $4 specialty cocktails), but no deals on food. Candybar is a good place for a treat, but if you're a total glutton like me, eat a snack beforehand!

z3bdIQgIGkXfF-oqJ2miFg.review_text: I can't believe that I never review this place! We went on a saturday night with a friend that was a sous chef of Campton. I don't remember what we had but it was definitely different and delicious. Our friend is a friend of the chef so we got extra special treats to try. I would definitely try again when I am in the area.

9BX0ogzNycO9H9D8sud1Aw.review_text: What an appealing premise! Friends and I were very excited to try this place while on a trip to SF - but unfortunately, it fell short of our expectations. First of all, everything was highly overpriced. I got a sparkling wine with syrup for a drink - awful! It tasted extremely artificial - I'm not sure how you can screw up this one. The desserts were just ok, nothing special. What really contributed to the experience that we had was the horrible customer service! Little patience, inattentive staff, and a general "get out of here already" attitude ensured that we would never come again.

HaoPeg2ySVEbQKN3gySxHQ.review_text: Sweet Treat.  After finishing dinner nearby at NOPA, we decided to forgo any sweets as my brother wanted to take us to his absolute favorite place for dessert in SF.  Some say dessert is a guilty pleasure.  Well, if that is true, then send me to prison as no jury will find me innocent as I am quite GUILTY of enjoying dessert at Candybar.  SETTING:  The lighting was slightly dim, but I believe there is a bar area, as well as various tables throughout the dining area.  After looking thru the menu, we chose:  SIP:   1.  Strawberry Kiss:  Pucker up cause this drink is definitely an affectionate treat for your taste buds.  Not overly sweet and yet refreshing.  Recommended....by myself and my brother.  2.  Passion Fruit cocktail:  My mom, who doesn't drink that much, nearly finished her entire glass.  She liked it!  3.  Lychee Guava Martini:  Though he prefers beer most of the time, my brother liked this drink.  Perhaps it was a fitting complement to our dessert as he drank all of it.    CONFECTIONS: 1.  Red Velvet Cake:  Delightful.  This dessert is worth it the extra time on the treadmill.  The ice cream aided to combat the tart frosting.  Cake was served warm and moist.  So good and delicious.  2.  Apple a la Mode:  Another sweet treat.  The gingerbread ice cream and apple slices balance this dessert well.   Truly delectable.  GAME ON!: Apparently, there are board games to play to pass the time waiting for your dessert, or just to revisit your childhood for a brief moment.  While waiting, I played 2 games of  Connect Four, a game I hadn't played since elementary school.  I challenged my brother first, and we decided the winner would challenge my mom.  I won both games.  Childhood reclaimed.  BOTTOM LINE:  Wonderful desserts!  Drinks paired well with dessert.  The availability of board games was definitely an added bonus to a fun time.

Da62XGMfcBmeFzYxqfM2OA.review_text: Got here tonight about 8:30.  There was a lot of people waiting.  We put our names on the list and waited anxiously for our table.  We were seated in approximately 20-30 minutes.  We got our desserts relatively quickly considering the large crowd (and the apparent private party).  Had three different desserts - the lavender honey creme fraiche semi-freddo, lemon tart, and the chocolate financier cake.  Lemon tart had some cream on top, broken coconut macaroons, and some sort of powder which I can't remember.  This was pretty good.  Chocolate financier cake also had some ice cream, cranberry sauce, almonds, and breton crumble.  This wasn't bad, but probably my least favorite out of the three.  My favorite, though, was the lavender honey creme fraiche semi-freddo, which came with almond brittle, nutella powder, and cantaloupe.  Eating a little bit of everything made for the perfect bite.  If they sold the almond brittle in boxes, I would buy them.  I loved the stuff.  Other than the wait, everything was pretty good.  And to be fair, it's a tiny place so showing up at 8:30 on a Saturday, there's likely to be a crowd, I guess.  I would definitely like to come here again.

O4YG18YPjlVB6NFhvSkk3Q.review_text: I docked a star off for the ridiculously small portioned sizes. Look, I know it's dessert and all, but they shouldn't be microscopic in size.  Anyways, on to the review. My review is specifically for their desserts and ambiance. Ambiance is great--I came with 2 other friends, but the setting is such a great date place. We were on a girls night out--talking about how ridiculous some boys can be...kidding, we were discussing universal healthcare vs. single payer and the implications one strategy has for the state of the economy over the other..right. So many of the couples looked like they were there on a date. I also love that they have board games--we played Candy Land, very appropriate for a place named Candybar! Also, I won!   The three of us ordered the following and shared amongst each other:  Nacho Sundae: This is the craziest thing I've ever seen. It looks like real nachos, so when you bite into it, your mind expects salty since you associate nacho-looking dishes to, well, taste like nachos. But then, it's sweet. Crazy! My gripe about this dish: they need to have more candied jalapenos, and it should be a little larger.   White chocolate mousse: really good. They serve it with blueberry compote. The white chocolate mousse tastes best when mixed in with the blueberry compote. This was a good size--no microscope needed!  Chocolate cremeaux cake: I think that's how "cremeaux" was spelled. Anyways, this is really good. Served with this raspberry sauce on top of the cake, and thyme ice cream at the side. This was really good, but way too small. I mean, you might as well actually BRING a microscope with you to see this one. It was ridiculous how small this was.   Didn't have the chocolate fudgesicle, but I did see it as the couple next to us ordered it. No idea how it tastes, but the size is insanely small. It's dessert appropriate for a toddler, not an adult. For its price, I would say it's overpriced considering the size. Candybar, please consider making your desserts larger.  Will definitely be back. I LOVE desserts, and a place called Candybar serving up delicious, albeit tiny, desserts is the perfect place to satisfy my sweet tooth.

8cW-bYGkWZgJs4zkLXJLNg.review_text: San Francisco's first dessert lounge, you are amazing. I went here with two friends (including Julia K.!) and like she said, though they close at midnight, they let you lounge quite a bit past closing. No rush, no bother. Truly nice people.  Ambiance: dim-lit Asian-fused lounge with game boards? So cool. Sound level is most definitely bearable.  I had a taste of their strawberry kiss and mango tango bellini and they were both sweet without being overwhelming. Spot on. The mango tango bellini was also spot on, with a dollop of mango-tangerine sorbet in the center.  The Japanese cheesecake($10), on it's own, kind of tasted like any other Japanese cheesecake that I could buy in Japantown, if not Ranch 99. However, the champagne granita just blew my mind in completing the diced honeydew, guava sorbet, and cheesecake plate.   My friends didn't like their passion fruit chocolate mousse too much, but the first few bites were delicious. It became a bit tart, sweet, and thick, but I thoroughly enjoyed the bites I had :)  I came back on another occasion with another friend and had the macaron trio - I would easily come back just for those.   Not the best prices around, but definitely fair. You're paying for plating, service, ambiance, and well... The experience of good dessert. Definitely something that Americans take for granted these days!

ZKdNk5RYb9ZgYYIS01FUrw.review_text: Very cute, fancy dessert joint.   They offer happy hour from 6-8pm which includes $2 Pacifico, $3 Sangrias, $4 Cocktails, & $5 house wines.   Anyways, so my boyfriend & I tried the Drunken S'mores & the Apple a la Mode. I'm not big on heavy, rich, chocolatey desserts like he is so I really enjoyed my Apple a la Mode. It was rich in sweetness but the crispness & freshness of the apple helps cut through that. I also LOVED its hazelnut crust! The Drunken S'mores was also really good but I was only able to handle about two bites!   I would definitely recommend CandyBar for people who are looking for a fun place to go on first-dates (of course, not excluded to them only) & small groups of friends that are looking for an easy, chill place to talk & have drinks. They also offer a wide variety of board games - including Candy Land, Battleship, Sorry, etc. Great icebreakers!

_gcDdPUVA9wwSynicxcpzw.review_text: The space is dimly lit, with an almost stark interior filled with a lot of separate, sectioned areas for canoodling and shenanigans. Interesting canvased artwork decorates the walls and there are some well-used board games for yours or his or her pleasure.   The happy hour menu is great, with a decent and generously poured house red. I failed a little because I blithely expected small bites to go along with the 3, 4, glasses of wine without doing my proper yelper research and found the menu almost completely dessert-focused. Which...well..duh.   So naturally, we had dessert for dinner. The tiramisu was rich and creamy with an almost cheesecake-like consistency. If you have a chocolate tooth you will die happy, and you might die if you eat the whole thing alone. The strawberry limeade wasn't nearly as sugary and lime-y and sour-y as I was afraid it would be. Think instead of a strawberry and key-lime pie with a really, really good crust.

ZQZqkojEi1k6d_h87nHClQ.review_text: Get: Peanut butter jelly time Mango Bellini cocktail  Pass: Pomegranate blueberry cocktail  Tip: Do not try to find parking anywhere near here. Take a cab or walk or something. It took us about 40 minutes to find a spot (this was a friday night)  Nice ambiance. Asian hipster style. Drinks were pretty good and they had a nice selection of unique drinks. They also have board games which is awesome! and cards like UNO and things of that nature. I got the pomegranate blueberry fusion which was okay tasty but the bubbles overpowered the flavor, so it didnt leave a lasting impression. I thought it was pretty good but the melon or whatever fruit was on it didn't seem to go with the dessert very well; it might have just been me though. I got the recommended pb and jelly time. Pretty tasty with a great crust and jelly sauce. I would definitely get that again.   I think everyone overhyped this place for me. It was good, but I don't have a desire to come back

ibRTPCNETk1DIUku4Ccc8g.review_text: Totally thinking outside the box. Great and unique concept. Just a place to go with your gals, on a date, or as a group - for desserts, wine, and board games aka drinking games ;)  Apple a la mode = DAMN GOOD Chocolate Financier Ice Cream Trio = fun for group Lavender Semi = DELISHHH Blueberry Pom Fusion  Berry Kiss Cocktail Jasmine Sparkling Wine Lunetta Presecco Wine

m4yWhyVgWOTxsCqH6EJm1Q.review_text: Very good. The place is super hip; low lighting, cool art, etc. The menu was relatively simple, which I loved. I didn't order any cocktails but there were a number of them that looked really appetizing. We ordered the red velvet cake with coconut flakes and toasted marshmallows. So good. The marshmallows were probably the best I've ever had and the cake was incredibly rich. I would definitely recommend and return here again!

cAsqLtUTckyweDcdA95GIQ.review_text: Nice! A sit down place dedicated to desserts. I would have definitely gone for the wine pairings, but no alcohol right now for this pregnant girl. I had the tasting menu with baked alaska and chocolate brioche (suggested by server). Good stuff! Next time, I'd like to try the panna cotta and chocolate parfait.  The space is comfortable and cozy. Very helpful and friendly staff. Cute, homey, and clean bathroom, too (away-from-home bathrooms are extra important during pregnancy!).  It's a bit pricey for me to come on a regular basis. Will come back for sure on special occasions, and definitely coming back for dessert AND wine once baby g is born.

eRV6uavzjtvLj7Aej59QVg.review_text: Cute place for a chill night sipping tasty dessert cocktails.  I highly recommend the Strawberry Kiss (Sparkling wine, ginger ale, frozen strawberry).  This is addictive.  I'm going to be serving this up at home and for brunch soon.  I also tried the Blueberry Pomegranate Fusion (sparkling wine, soju).  The blue sugar rim made it seem like I was drinking a glass of bubbly sugar water.  If you have a super sweet tooth, then that drink would probably be up your alley.  It was too sweet for me and I couldn't enjoy it.  We shared one ice cream sandwich:  brown rice tea ice cream in between a green tea French macaron sprinkled w/ cocoa nibs, sitting blueberry sauce and fresh blueberries.  The ice cream was delicious and on the light side of sweetness, but the macaron was overly sweet (I could only handle two bites of that).    Super attentive service.  Closes at 10, but no one seemed to care.  I'd definitely return if the mood for sipping a yummy cocktail in a chill setting were to struck me in NOPA.

Dk8uTws4YDUhqGHJoHlETw.review_text: I went there for my birthday and was HUGELY let down.   1. SUPER slow service- waited 15-20 minutes for a bottle of wine to be brought to our table and exponentially longer for other drinks that were ordered 2. Lazy staff- couldn't be bothered for suggestions or to be friendly  3. Bad food  I might go back but not for a while. I'd rather eat dessert and drink wine somewhere else!

GJZALFdXYVLMmbuIIGbuCQ.review_text: Hmmm... I like the ambience, but not the food much. Especially the desserts were disappointing and definitely overprices for that quality. If you just want to hang out with your friends for drinks, not looking for delicious foods, you could have fun.

hhlhSHtZ-i5TuAd6hWBoDA.review_text: Fancy decor, cool street art, board games and cute names... but I see beyond the cute exterior! I got the yogurt cake, and I was shocked to see an unfortunate palette of colours. Orange, white, black and ...damp green. There goes points for presentation - I've taken colour theory and that is not approved by my artistic eye. Good composition though. But I didn't finish it. My cousin got the Lavender Honey Creme Fraiche Semifreddo. Uhm, fancy name for: Lavender Ice-cream bar. Fancy price too. Tasted overly creamy and not lavender enough for the color. Would not recommend coming here unless its for happy hour drinks. P.S. What did I miss - everyone else's photos look so pretty and classy?? Mine look ... psychedelic (s3-media1.px.yelpcdn.com…).

A8piN4-8W7hfxtDUVJEUDg.review_text: pretty good! we had a groupon and so it was a good deal. went on a lazy saturday afternoon. the japanese cheesecake was ok..nothing great...and the apple pie dessert was pretty good! the drinks were great, try the blood orange bitters sparkling wine drink! giving it 4 stars cuz the owner and the atmosphere very chill AND love the board games!

zaFsNhpBMMBdo6ikjS2k3g.review_text: I think I had too high hopes for this place.  Candybar was on my bookmark list all summer and I finally got the bf to take me.  I love the concept of the place: bar meets desserts.  Great place for a date or girls night out (they have games for you to play!).   The drinks were pretty good.  I tried the 50/50, which tastes very similar to the 50/50 creamsicle with the addition of some carbonation.  I also tried their lychee drink (mild, not so strong).    Unfortunately, the dessert was lacking.  I was so disappointed.  We ordered the tiramisu (tasted like it was previously frozen and defrosted; not fresh), macaron ice cream sandwich with honeydew ice cream (the ice cream with icy, not smooth at all), and the almond honey panna cotta (pretty good flavors; the best of the three).  I'm on the fence about Candybar but I'm willing to give it another chance (probably because I still have the livingsocial deal left to use). So keep posted for an update when I go!

jaXH8IWEp0-QbwsTNqAA9A.review_text: woohoo 1000th review!!! i'll update this later when i have the time. but to be very brief. a very chill, cute, classy place. ambiance is very low-key, yet romantic. definitely a great spot for a first or second date, a fabulous night out with the girls, or simply a place to tantalize your taste and eye buds :) specialty cocktails are geared for a dessert loving audience. if sweet alcohol is not your thing, they also have a beer/wine/champagne list. the desserts are plentiful. i had such a hard time picking ONE for myself. forgot the name of the dessert, but it had almond? brittle, nutella powder, and this mousse/ice cream like confection. twas good but i thoroughly enjoyed my girlfriend's a lot more. she ordered the one with macarons and gelato. yep, match made in heave.

EAUrXj9VgqYvGuPYEVYOJw.review_text: I haven't been here for ages and am so happy I was reunited with this place last night. I'm also happy to see that there was a good amount of people there which added to a fun vibe.   I came with my boyfriend...but can't wait to come again with my girlfriends. The champagne drinks are so fun and I can't think of a more perfect way to catch up with friends. Especially friends with sweet tooths.   The apple a la mode was devoured in just a few mintues. We then ordered the chocolate passionfruit mousse cake which was so insanely rich. We even ended up taking half of it home.   They also have fun boardgames and other games to partake in (which we didn't). Fun to have that option!  People who aren't dessert people might not be as big of a fan of this place as I am. But someone like me loves the concept of a dessert bar. Next time I'm going to check out the Happy Hour. Might be dangerous...

3L3TBhvYlzLDVL3xySNcCQ.review_text: I cannot stress how awesome this place is! When I first heard of it, I thought, "Whoa, a place dedicated just to dessert! YES I am there!" I went here to celebrate one of my girlfriend's birthdays, and the atmosphere is cozy, intimate, and very posh... and fun! They have boardgames to play while you wait! This place could totally be great for big groups, as well as intimate enough as a date place...  We ordered the Mexican Chocolate mousse, the Thai Coffee and tapioca, the fudge, and other desserts... and each was absolutely delicious! Candybar changes their menu every now and then, so my girlfriends and I will definitely be back to try out their new desserts. YUM-O!

ZcI_GYq5-CCGSP7C91NVlQ.review_text: Came here with 2 of my girls friends on a Friday night and it was pretty busy, but we were lucky to find parking right across the street and get seated right away. Definitely a nice place for a girls night out to grab some drinks, eat dessert, and talk the night away. There's also board games laying around for anyone that wants to play.   We got a couple round of beers, dessert sampler and another dessert for around $60. Beware, although blue moon is served in a tall glass, it's poured out of a bottle. For the desserts the tiramisu was our favorite. It was the only thing we finished and is the most memorable one in my books.   One thing I didn't like was there's only one bathroom available for both gender. I had to pee super bad and unfortunately got stuck behind someone who took forever to lay a deuce. Needless to say, when I went in I pretty much tasted it in my mouth. Ugh, but other than that it's a nice place to drink and chat, but if you're on a budget I'll give it a pass.

Mc2C3uVVCUvMkLWFlyToZw.review_text: As a disclaimer.. I'm a sucker for board game bars, and this place is exactly the type of place I'd want to spend an evening.  I finally came here last Saturday after an early dinner, and I'm really glad we got there when we did.  There was a table open and we were quickly seated.  We got two desserts: the Soft Cheesecake and the Lavender Honey Creme Fraiche Semi Freddo.  The cheesecake was AMAZING.  The lavender on the other one was pretty strong, which I liked, but the others thought was too overwhelming.  I thought the canteloupe didn't quite work with the dish either, and would've preferred it without.  But as a whole, the desserts were good.  The drinks were nothing amazing.  By their descriptions, I'd gotten excited.  We'd gotten the Strawberry Kiss (this was basically a sparkling rose with a frozen strawberry in it) and the Jasmine Sparkle (I didn't taste the lemon or the jasmine) which just tasted like sparkling wine - nothing special.  It was, nice, however, to have a bunch of games to choose from.  I absolutely loved the atmosphere and am super glad we got there early.  There was definitely a wait by the time we left, which I imagine moves slowly since most people can spend a long while playing games!  But as a whole - this place has it all: games, drinks, and dessert - this is a GREAT date place!

Z88N6qly3Dp5C06XbZ9IMQ.review_text: "Sweets for my sweet! Sugar for my honey..... candybar, I'll never, ever, let you go!"  Candybar, you've convinced me that I should have sugar cravings more often. All those salty snacks that I've been paying attention to should step aside now that I've found you. A piece of advice: girls, leave the boys at home. They'll hang with you thinking, "maybe we can get porkchops at Nopa later on or even a burrito at the taqueria nearby". They'll be disappointed because once you come here, all you want to do is park yourselves at one of their comfortable lounge chairs or take up space at their dark wood tables and play board games while they sit there clutching their growling tummies.  Catherine Li (oh goddess dessert maker!) is some sort of a creative genius. She doesn't use overly complicated ingredients: no gelees, no foam, no sugar domes. She uses simple,straight up ingredients you've known growing up. She transforms and puts together these ingredients, makes it look very pretty on the plate and so utterly delicious on the tongue. Like the peanut butter jelly time!  which has chocolate tart, peanut butter cream, salted candied peanuts and blackberries. My girlfriend LOVES peanut butter anything and before she opened her mouth to order, I said, "you're getting the peanut butter thing right?"  So, all you Reese's peanut butter cup fanatics, this dessert's for you.  The apple ala mode was on the very sweet side of the sugar spectrum and it had a hazelnut crust, cream cheese filling, caramel with a scoop of gingerbread ice cream.   My buttermilk vanilla bean panna cotta was topped with a cocoa macaron, balsamic strawberry reduction and fresh strawberries. I was in the mood for something in the custard family and the balsamic - strawberry combination really works.  My blood orange cocktail put me in the right mood with sparking wine, blood orange bitters and a sugar cube to keep the bubbles floating to the top. Bubbly always makes me feel....well, bubbly! ;)  Candybar, you put me on a sugar high that I never, EVER wanna let go.

XmElOb8V73xkDQypksDloA.review_text: I am a huge fan.  Dessert, wine and boardgames that are a flashback to childhood.  It's a winner all the way around.  Can you remember the last time you played Chutes and Ladders while enjoying a killer Argentinian Malbec?  If you can't then clearly you are overdue for a visit to Candybar.  The desserts were also very good, the cayenne cinnamon chocolate mousse and the baked hot chocolate really stood out.  For the price, the portion size is good, we had plenty to share among ourselves.  What makes this place though is the atmosphere, it's really top notch, relaxed and inviting and just the sort of place that makes you want to come back again (and again, and again!).  The only bummer is that they close at 10, so sad, but entirely beyond their control.

_39ZAS07MMFjRz_QPHHw8A.review_text: Desserts are presented well and the ambience is decent. Besides that, the wait can be long on weekends, parking around there was a pain and generally it wasn't outstanding on taste. They get the third star for being one of the few places of its kind serving dessert and cocktails.

Z5ppNVam0PLJyFxf0dB-MA.review_text: The idea of Candybar was very attractive... the actual experience was so-so.  First, parking is really difficult to find - it took 20 minutes for my roomie, Tiff K., and I to find a spot. Then, it took about half an hour for us to grab a seat.   The place is pretty small and very hipster. There is art on the walls that are quite... unique.  It's not exactly the trendy, classy dessert lounge feel that I had envisioned it would be. There are board games, which is a nice touch and makes Candybar a cool hang out spot, but again... not exactly chic. I guess it's a lounge in the sense that you can lounge around there playing games, eating dessert, and sipping on drinks.   We only tried the Apple a la Mode for dessert - meh. It was okay, but honestly the flavors did not work well together. The texture was soft and almost a little mushy. The one highlight? The DRINKS. I tried the Strawberry Kiss and my roomie had a blueberry pomegranate drink. Both were yummy! The drinks are definitely not strong, but something to sip on more for flavor.   Candybar might be a cool local neighborhood hang out spot... I think it just depends on what you want that experience to be. I wanted cute & trendy and to-die-for desserts. I got hipster, yummy drinks, hang out experience. It wasn't bad, just not what a dessert lounge means to me.

4GZJpiiPJmCu-5PWlc1YSQ.review_text: The service here was phenomenal. The people here were very generous about offering us plates and cleaning up our dinner (which isn't ordered from Candybar, they let you bring your own dinner from somewhere else, since Candybar is for desserts and drinks and games!)  We just had a tiramisu which was amazing, it wasn't too fluffy like most tiramisus I have had. The chocolate had an unparalleled richness and the plate was ornamented with chocolate crumbs that were delicious as well.  Also: I love the art here.. Candybar reminded me of a small gallery. :)

43QXHMaGJX47S78jQoH5pQ.review_text: Desserts here are very creative and tasty, but a bit small for what you pay for. The nacho sundae was very cool and had great flavors, but it would have been nice if it was either a lot bigger or cheaper.  The place is cute and cozy. They have drinks and desserts, but not a whole lot of options. It was a nice place to dwindle down the night, but I can't say I was THAT impressed. They do have a few board games, but none that we were really interested in playing. It would have been nice to see some scrabble.  Our server was was okay. Not much to say about him.  Overall. A-Ok; not dying to go back. But maybe I'd like it better during happy hour?

TODo4tXmIVTlip2JS9H4QA.review_text: I would like to give this place a 3.5 stars.  It has a fun atmosphere and a fun menu.  I think playing board games over new desserts and drinks here seems like a great birthday or girls night spot.  Once the food arrived it was a little hit and miss.  I got a ice cream sandwich, which was only $4, but it left me wishing I got something else; the macaron wasn't doing it for me.  The Strawberry Limeade was way tastier.  The homemade herb ice creams seem to be what they do best, the peppermint was delish!  The drinks were too a hit and miss.  The Blood Orange Cocktail was decent, but think it is just an orange cocktail.  The Strawberry Kiss was a lot sweeter than expected.  I would have stuck with the sparkling wine.  The main problem we had was with the service.  We had a reservation at 9pm for five people.  We got seated close to 10pm.  To keep us happy they gave us one round of sparkling wine, and blamed a particular group for staying too long.  The host claimed they have been there for 3+ hours.  We looked at the group with a bit of annoyance.  But wait, that's not how you rotate in reserved tables.    The service rounded the experience down.  If they would not have given that excuse, or comp cocktails instead, or even not made us flag people down for water, it would have been better.

kie7nzDJYisVYHGWBS373Q.review_text: We had to abandon our first attempt at eating here, because there was absolutely no parking. We circled for 15-20 minutes before we gave up and headed home.  Success, however, occurred on our second attempt.   It was particularly loud, and we were seated on low cushions. Patrons with board games book ended us as we tried to talk over their's and everyone elses' voices. Separating us further, was the low lying table that bumped our knees. We might as well have been sitting across the room from each other at this point.  Yet, I can understand why many would rate this place four stars: their desserts. The Peanut Butter Jelly Time, Apple A la Mode, Strawberry Limeade, and the Japanese Cheesecake came out on a single plate. It was a mean fight, since only inches separated them on the plate. They fought for glory in my mouth and I had to eat them in a particular order to enjoy each flavor. The war would have been won, except for the fact that the waitress had to take our order a total of three times. At least I'm glad she wanted to be sure of our order  Oh, and for some reason, there was a lot of children running around.

-M4ZqHZDsA9vOt7UscVRpQ.review_text: Came here for dessert/drinks to celebrate my dear friend's stellar performance as a very evil female Iago in Othello.    I'd never been here before, but it was a good time.  The parking in the area kinda sucks, so it's definitely best if you carpool or cab here.  The decor was cute and the art on display was fun and whimsical.  I am not sure but it seemed like the art rotated so not sure how long artists are displayed for.  I had the passion fruit sparkling cocktail--the bar is limited but the sparkling cocktails all sounded delicious.  We also split a variety of desserts, but i only really remember inhaling the red velvet cake.  the rest were not memorable, but then again, we are talking red velvet cake...so I was hooked.  If i was in the neighborhood I would come back, otherwise I'd give it a pass.  Bummer though, I am all for dessert lounges...hopefully there will be more in a variety of neighborhoods soon.

i8L_pnkXcJQ8VyApK_3_mw.review_text: Still just as lip-licking delicious as the very first time Candybar's sweets graced my tongue.  And now that i live a mere 5-10 minutes away, im dangerously close to busting the buttons off my dresses and going up a couple sizes in jeans.  Its almost worth it though.  They had a whole new set of desserts on the menu that the girls and i indulged in for our mini session of exhaling.  On the table placed next to our game of connect four:  peanut butter jelly time on one plate and a chocolate mousse with milky way ice cream on the other.  Sinfully deelicious.  Every bite.  Its cross-your-legs-cuz-im-feeling-tingly-down-there good.  That's how damn good it is.  And while we ate the peanut butter jelly time, Tan was nice enough to play the song as well.  Is there any other fantastic way to enjoy that dessert?  And apparently they have taco tuesdays now.  I think i'll start preparing now and buy a few dresses a size up from what i normally wear.

TlgV82AvHhcNI8UM4s3Abg.review_text: I believe it was april or march of 2008 that candy bar opened in the hood.  Here's the story, my old roomie, Tiiffany L's birthday was coming up and i wanted to get her a gift certificate for Candy Bar, as she loves dessert.  Problemo they had just opened up and didn't have any gift certy's yet, but the Candybar folks hooked it up and wrote up some homemade gift certificate.  I was saved, thanks Tan!!!!!!  The concept of Candybar is such a unique simple amazing idea, dessert, drinks, music, art, lounge, and even games.  You really can't go wrong here for after dinner drinks and dessert or before dinner drinks or if dessert and drinks is your main entree.  I brought my folks, family, friends, and visitors to the Bay here and only one person hasn't liked this spot.  I think it might have be someone in the industry, of course it was right.     If you have favorites keep in mind the menu occasionally changes, but every new item i've tried has been a pleasant surprise.  Candybar is a refreshing spot to the neighborhood, the city, and the Bay and gives balance to the trendy wave of sweets from froyo, cupcakes, donuts, and craziness of ice cream flavors.

S9gFoCcEz0fPuu7KQXCTVQ.review_text: Quaint place, great ambiance!  Had the flourless chocolate cake, which is served with blueberry sorbet, cream and these planes of citrus infused white chocolate. Absolutely divine!

mdCAsnSP3uCH2859UYW66A.review_text: It's cute and cozy lounge... However, the drinks weren't as good as I have expected it to be!   Blood orange sparkling wine - tastes and looks nothing like blood orange Jasmine sparkling wine - pretty cool, needs more jasmine flavor Passion fruit sparkling wine - the best out of the three we had yesterday!  There's something wrong with you if you don't like red velvet! We each ordered a red velvet cake with coconut and mint ice cream - mint ice cream was horrible... the cake from red velvet was dry... too much coconut where it over powered the taste of the cake. In addition, the coconut was hard :/  It's a cute place with a cool nitch, however, drinks and desserts can be better!  Parking is a bizatch.... i swear it's worse than Broadway!

3CMiTAhq_o_GP1tLs-ihbg.review_text: What an awesome place. Found a groupon, wandered in with the bestie. Bigger than I expected and great service. Delicious desserts. I would love to come back next time I'm in town!!!

bevssK8rkV3PL-2H-Ze3WA.review_text: OMG!  Fabulous!  I found out that they opened up just a short time after I moved out of the neighborhood (less than a block away)!  Most likely it was the best idea for my budget NOT to live so close to such wonderful deserts.  I highly recommend coming here after EVERY dinner date you have!

4FcfCT4WFGdNI_E09htphQ.review_text: The first time I tried to come here was on a Tuesday night back in July and found it closed on Tuesdays. I haven't been back until last night. The day after Thanksgiving, the place wasn't too packed, and I found parking across the street. We were happy to escape the cold air outside and step into the warm dessert lounge to snag the spot by the window. Their menu has changed since the summer, and prices are slightly lower now. Desserts now range from $4-$7.50, as opposed to $8-12 then, and I no longer see $14 tasting menu. My friend ordered the apple pie with ice cream which was served on a slab - not the best idea since the ice cream melted onto the table. My other friend got the butterscotch pie which was good but nothing amazing; it tasted like a giant reese's pieces. I ordered the salted buttermilk panna cotta which the 3 of us thought was a bit too salty; the salt crystals were uneven and unnerving whenever I bit into them. I enjoyed my white sangria (didn't taste the alcohol), and my friends enjoyed their wine. The bill for 3 desserts, 4 glasses of wine, and my sangria came out to be around $70 + tip. Overall, Candybar is a nice low-key place to drink and hang out if you don't mind average desserts. I wonder if Sunday Brunch tastes better.

5Tc0YXgYDvTTlps0e8xTNg.review_text: Cute concept but I'm not sure how they meet their overhead selling just desserts and cocktails. I will also point out that if you're a single dude, you should be hanging out here because the dude to chick ratio is nil.  Took my boyfriend here for his birthday pre-dessert (because you ALL know that I'M the icing, cake, cherry, chocolate sauce, and whipped cream at the end of a rainbow DESSERT). I have to say that if I hadn't had a Groupon I'd have been even more underwhelmed. My lavender semifreddo wasn't tecturally great and I wasn't overly impressed with the flavor combinations either. My honey got the apple pie a la mode and it was pretty funny because he remarked on how much cinnamon flavor was in the ice cream..except it was supposed to be ginger. He's a level 3 sommelier, his palate is EXTREMELY well developed, so I believe him and his flavor profiles. The service was pretty lackluster and my Kir Royale wasn't that great. My boyfriend was impressed with their wine list so I would recommend going that route. Everyone was playing board games but I think the atmosphere would have benefited immensely from a chill, ambient tune spinning DJ...so many romantic possibilities. We went on a weeknight so it wasn't crowded but I don't think we'll be back...kind of a meh experience for me.

UlFxrF_LfH6B-kXTT3XAlQ.review_text: I went with a friend for desserts and drinks on a Thursday night. We made it for happy hour and each got a cocktail - Jasmine Sparkle for her and Raspberry Delight for me. Sorry, guys - thumbs waaaay down.  While the taste was nice, considering the description is sparkling wine, I'd expect there to be, well, sparkling wine - as in, bubbles.  It was flat as a tween girl's prepubescent chest.    As for the desserts, we ordered 4 and here's the lowdown:  Ice Cream Sandwich 2/5 - Macaron was nice and chewy, the honeydew ice cream was honeydewy in a good way.  The two together - ummmm, for me it's a 'meh'.  Apple Ala Mode 0/5 - Yikes.  Unless you like slimy apple slices and slimy whole hazelnuts, stay away.  This is not your grandmother's apple pie.  In a very bad way.  Lemon & White Chocolate 3/5 - Nice lemony flavor and the granola was more like a crumble which we both liked.  A little less sorbet would have been nice IMO - the tartness kind of took over the subtle lemon in the cake and white chocolate of the mousse.  Drunken S'mores 4/5 - Our favorite of the 4.  Would have loved the rum/brandy sauce they drizzle on top after bringing it to the table to have been warm.    Service was attentive. Our waiter/host was friendly and fun.  Pricing was acceptable but I'd stay away from the drinks.  As I said, if you're expecting sparkling wine in your drink, it's a bit disappointing when it's just flat.  Overall, a fun place to visit once in a while. But there are lots of other joints in SF with phenomenal desserts and drinks that I'd frequent before coming back here.

CBwF2a2qEXpiHulN7MjCyQ.review_text: Cute and Cool. Came here for happy hour last night (Thursday night) around 7 pm and this place was really happening. Kung Fu Tacos' were serving their delicious dishes here (parked the truck right outside). So we drank and ate and ate some more. I had the raspberry Italian soda and OMG! it was "tickle my nose and tingle my tongue" amazing! I wish i got to try the desserts but I had to go... I heard from my friends that it was unique and tasty! Next time. The vibe is "haight sexy chic"... I liked it, not my style but I can appreciate it. The place also features local artists' work on their walls.   I can see myself having an intimate birthday gathering here for my haight friends..... Will be back for their desserts.

pIica2781l-4ICsTzkxhKg.review_text: Is zero stars not available? Surprisingly rude waitress added 18% tip to our group's bill. Desserts were overly sweet. No subtlety. We were seated near the bathroom and it smelled like poop. People kept bumping my chair because it was so crowded. The noise was so loud we had to yell at each other the whole time. How did this ever get any good reviews?

u5H1YLDtXH7hC-j89hnhwg.review_text: The desserts were good, ok for the price, but the bar itself is cool. Slick, lounge feel, but the best part is they have games!  Had an awesome time playin candyland with fat tires with my friend. My next goal is to get my boyfriend drunk  there and kick his ass at chutes and ladders....

skTAJPAt-pYYJKQIZgO8bw.review_text: The waiter was friendly and that was the most redeeming quality of this place.  We got the sampler platter and had a really hard time enjoying any of the 4 desserts we picked.  Having 15 years in the restaurant industry, I understand what the chef is going for, unusual flavor combinations and new twists on old classic.  Sadly, none of them really worked for us. There seemed to be something off about everything we tasted. Too extracted, too contrived, too much sugar and just not good...   And good luck with parking. This neighborhodd sucks.

jNHqLtd-l9zF35JXSKpvNg.review_text: This place only serves desserts and cocktails.  So make sure you eat something beforehand if you're hungry.  They have the cutest desserts.  Presentation is great.  My friend and I ordered the tiramisu and the strawberry limeade.  Like many reviewers before me, the strawberry limeade dessert is really good.  It's different than anything I've ever had before.  We also each ordered the strawberry kiss cocktail which was tasty and pretty, but it was a very small amount in a champagne flute with an entire strawberry floating in it.  An entire strawberry=very little actual champagne.  I'd probably skip the drink next time and order more dessert! YUM  Oh, and they have board games for you to play as well.

NfJOIoFS4vd5VuqIyRD2Kg.review_text: LOVED this place.  PROS: +Cute decor +Seriously top notch desserts (we ordered: Strawberry Limeade, Ice Cream sandwich, Japanese cheesecake, and some kind of raspberry brownie concoction whose name escapes me--all were fantastic!) +Decent portions for the price +Equally delish drinks (we ordered: Mango Bellini, Kir Royale, 50/50. The Kir Royale is great for someone who doesn't mind a strong drink undisguised; the Bellini is fruitier and much sweeter) +Sophisticated, mature clientele (mostly: see below) +Nice array of boardgames, including some I have never heard of before +Fantastic attention to sweet little details, including the check being presented in an empty Whopper's box!  CONS: -Loud; kind of hard to hold a conversation -SMALL venue! :( we had to wait about half an hour to get seating -On a related note, this was definitely NOT  to hold an entire bachelorette party, bride-to-be with the genitalia on your veil... -Pricey if you're there without a Groupon  a few TIPS for the uninitiated: 1. Definitely call ahead to make a reservation if you can, especially on a weekend night 2. You don't have to be 21 to come in, sit, and and order a dessert! (Can anyone say... designated driver? :) )  I wanna come back with my friends for happy hour!

B0hHReh4tYTNIB7Po8mxtQ.review_text: LOVE LOVE LOVE this place... its my favorite go-to spot for drinks and desserts.  Their peanut butter jelly time dessert (crunchy chocolate tart filled with peanut butter mousse topped with blackberry jam and fresh blackberries and salted peanuts) is my favorite, but when I'm in the mood for French macaroons, I also love their "ice cream sandwich" made from a giant green tea macaroon filled with ice cream (it comes with a brown rice ice cream, but its not sweet enough for me, so I asked for vanilla and they were nice enough to accommodate my request). Their ice cream trio (oreo, reese's peanut butter, and kit kat) is tasty, but the scoops are small.  The champagne bubbly drinks are rather small-ish, so I get their Riesling.  Another big plus: they have board games there so it makes for a fun (and not crazy) night.  And even though the place is small, I've been here ~3 times on Friday/Saturday nights and haven't had to wait more than 10 minutes to get seated because the turnaround is quite quick.

Kidvjq-NROoeDaXcZcnCcA.review_text: We went to Candybar with high hopes, we left disappointed.  Candybar calls itself a dessert lounge, but advertises a savory menu by a different chef from desserts as well.  Sold by this idea, we decided to have dinner there as well.  That was a mistake.    While they may have a different chef for the savory menu, the food is one step bellow bar food in how satisfied it leave you.  The menu consists mostly of items that require little or no cooking, come in small quantities, and are relatively expensive. The later point was exemplified for me by the thin six pieces of scallop sashimi, as I had been to the market a few days before and brought six large scallops to cook at home for the same price.  At this point we decided to give the place the benefit of the doubt, as it does bill itself as a dessert place, so we jumped into the dessert menu with gusto. Sadly, here we were also very disappointed.  There were four of us, as most ordered different items, so that we tasted most of the dessert menu.  The consistency of the amuse was rather odd, and the gelee that was supposedly at the bottom almost nonexistent.  The baked alaka was no better. The blood orange sorbet inside one dimensional. The chocolate brioche bred pudding, was not bred pudding and it did not taste like brioche. It was more of a chocolate taste with a very simple flavor. The warm vanilla cake was disliked.  The thickened olive oil tasting strange.  The party that ordered the panna cotta did not realize at the time it was cheese flavored and disliked it. Surprisingly, this is the one disk I liked, but as a cheese course, not a dessert. Finally, the malted milk at the end was overly sweet.  In addition to the food, our particular table was the last one before the kitchen entrance and the bathroom. As the wall angles in, when people sit across from the table, the space between the two tables is very narrow, which results in every bumping into you if you are lucky the sit there.  It is also rather annoying that you cannot select desserts a la carte, and that you are forced to have a dessert tasting.  After $240 and a couple of hours, we left, thinking it was a shame that the place did not work out, but with no plans to visit again. I give it two stars for at least trying an interesting concept, but execution did not leave anything to commend.

NJLdv2QpPyPIRhujt9AC2Q.review_text: Loved this place! A cute concept that I'm jealous I didn't think of first. An array of delicious desserts including treats like drunken s'mores, lavender semifreddo, and house made red velvet cake. A full bar to to compliment the sweets, and friendly attentive staff to boot. Yay Candybar!

p4ntMuasXUOQbgzdjmQ37w.review_text: The Basics: 9PM on Friday night Party size of 5  Prices of desserts 7-10 Prices of cocktails 7-9  Make reservations if you'd like to check out this place on a busy night, but be ready to accept a free glass of "sparkling wine" because you'll be seated 45 mins to 1 hour after your expected time.  Minus 1 star.  There's a good variety of desserts offered here, we ended up ordering the Strawberry limeade, Peanut butter jelly time, and red velvet cake. Strawberry limeade...absolutely delicious!  Tangy, sweet flavors of goodness spruce up your night.  They also serve it in a jar, how cute!  Peanut better jelly time...my friend loved it, but the thick peanut cream reminded me of a face mask consistency (not that I do that often).  Red velvet cake had coconut on the top, which gave it a twist.  What really won me over was the home-made Basil ice cream!  YUMMMM  I also ordered a Blood orange cocktail, which I could have done without.  Now get this... they put an orange peel at the bottom of the drink but by the time we were done I looked at my drink with about 5 mLs left and the peel disintegrated into sugar!  I know they add sugar, but was the peel made of sugar too???  Ambiance was very good too.  Artist drawings and paintings all around.  Music good too and it wasn't too loud.  Kiddie games to entertain you (and make you stay longer to frustrate those with reservations).  And don't forget to check out the bathroom!  O yea and parking sucks.  Take the bus, carpool, or tell your boyfriend you want a girls night out and ask him to drop you off.  :P

xCgBQKwgihh2wuAjE1dZnQ.review_text: We came here on a Saturday night and they were out of everything except for the cheesecake and a lavendar sorbet with blood oranges.  I really wanted to try a lemon tart.  The cheesecake wasn't heavy at all.  I think it was served on something similar to a graham cracker with a little scoop of mango sorbet on the side.  I ordered the sparkling water and the waiter mentioned it would come in a full size large bottle, but for some reason, I ended up with a glass of sparkling water.  What ever happened to the full bottle?

BeVehxvlhW1x4g-Qk2I7Lw.review_text: Came here on a date with my boyfriend and two good friends on a Friday night. I was recommended here by my roommate.   The location was nice. The venue itself was much smaller than I expected. Not enough seating for the crowd this place was attracting. We waited at the bar for almost 45 minutes before being seated.   While at the bar, I had two strawberry kisses. They were delicious. Upon sitting down, I ordered the ice cream sundae to share with my bf. The dessert was very very good but the portion was a bit small for the price.   The best part about Candybar is the board games. We played candyland (fitting right?) and then played cards for over an hour. I can see why the table traffic would move very slowly in here because of the games.   Overall, good experience.

1zkQK41CPXT4fcCpOshYDA.review_text: We've been going here since they opened and are never disappointed.  The desserts are truly inspired, often unexpected, and always delicious.  The menu changes frequently, so there are always new things to try, and the owner, Tan, and his staff are wonderful.  I highly recommend this place!

9A7T1nJq09QwDQ0kgv1hjw.review_text: Cute little place and good concept. I liked the art on the walls and the soft lighting. The board games were a nice touch and the desserts were great! I had the pumpkin pie that had a softer than ususal pie filling. It was good because it didn't feel overly heavy. Others had the semifreddo which was a bit diffictult to eat but the flavor profile was nice. The peanut butter and jelly dessert was a bit over the top for me, though I love peanut butter.  Overall, the best dessert was the cheesecake with the passion fruit sorbet. Excellent textures and wonderful fruit flavors in the sorbet and the melon peices on the side. That will be my go-to in the future.  Word to the wise, they take reservations however, this place is really small. Even if you make a reservation, you may not get seated because most people don't leave their table due to serious time invested in an intense game of connect 4 or chutes and ladders. Just be ready to wait on a busy weekend night. They do orders to-go if you're not interested in hanging out for a table so that's always an option.

LU7ikPXZ5R8tv4oNQZQkKw.review_text: This place is the azn invasion.  Its a great place to take a date.  If the are azn.  The desserts were pretty good.  No azn desserts.  Just basic American and Italian desserts.  They need some azn desserts.  They will get more azn customers.  This place is good for groups.  Make sure you have an azn person call for a reservation.

tMtTSS_ypMP74bacZrhuWQ.review_text: We ( fam of four) came here right when they opened  at 6pm on a wed nite and we were greeted and seated right away. Super friendly and welcoming staff. Parking wasn't too bad but could def see it being challenging. We used a groupon and chose 4 desserts and cocktails (mocktails for the kids) Flour less choc banana torte- so good, rich yet refreshing with a hint of banana allowing  choc to still be the main attraction Ice cream sundae- 3 brownies topped with mint chip and the caramelized bananas and strawberries on the side - dense and rich brownies Ice cream sandwich- giant macaron with the best honeydew ice cream we ever tasted as filling Drunken s'mores - yum! Favorite part was what seemed to be a home made marshmallow Drinks were just as tasty.  We will definitely be back. Thanks candy bar!

QmvvC6z-_xHrhdE8q37BAA.review_text: I've yet to come here when the KFT truck is here during HH, I really wish I could have some of those duck tacos. Speak of which, I'm having a bit of a craving for tacos right now. Anyways...  Priscella T. and I ran in here on a rainy Friday night at 7:50PM, (yes, 10 minutes before happy hour ended), we sat down and immediately ordered two cocktails right away. I had the Strawberry Kiss which was a mix of Sparkling Wine and strawberry juice... OMG, it was soooo delicious, they can sneak up on you, so beware. Having five of them would get me in a lot of trouble. Eek. Priscella T. ordered a Passion Fruit Sparkle and that was also very tasty. Cocktails are normally $8-9 but during happy hour they're $4.  We, also, ordered a slice of the Red Velvet Cake at $8. The red velvet cake was soooo moist and topped with a generous amount of creme cheese frosting which was sweetened perfectly! And the coconut shavings added a nice texture. The plate was accompanied by a tiny scope of vanilla bean ice cream, garnished with red velvet cake crumbs/shavings, something red and crumbly.  When we had downed our drinks because we had dinner plans to make, Tan brought each of us a glass of sangria. OH. MY. GOSH! The $3 Sangria was, also, very tasty. And I appreciated his generosity. Thank you!  We enjoyed our cocktails whilst playing Connect4, I got my butt kicked by Priscella T. Yes, I admit defeat. They have a variety of games including MadGab, Chutes and Ladders, Monopoly and Eat It!. The lighting is dim and the  music is not too loud. You can actually hear the person sitting across the table.  My girls and I will be back for more Happy Hour!

Znid_azpcHmdRMHGicmkWA.review_text: Wow! WoW! WOW! Candy Bar, you are AWESOME! Me and my friends came here for their happy hour...(we were so excited to try this place we got there too early). The restaurant is pretty chill and inviting.  There are board games for anyone wanting to feel like a kid agan. Me and my gang played Candy Land and Battleship which I got spanked in both. Boo! But anyways I tried the Mango Bellini that actually came with a scoop of mango sorbet..yummy! It was sooo good, I seriously had to put my glass out of my reach  so I didn't down it.  We also had a desert sampler and honestly there was soo much food I couldn't tell you what we had. But believe me when I said there was no survivors!  All I remember was the carrot cake and it was so soft and delicious.  I tried the Sangria and it wasn't anything special but the happy hour price was worth it.  My friend really liked it.  I cannot wait to go back and enjoy another mango bellini.

UVxY0iyPaqY7s4BSFtt-xA.review_text: What can you say about Candybar except:   Suuuweeet!   it is a cool place with a great vibe and comfortable decor, and super sweet service. Or as they bill themselves: "Dessert, Wine, Art"  Great concept actually. Serve sweet desserts (by Catherine Li) of about 9 beautiful choices, all superbly constructed and gorgeously plated, ranging in price from $5 for the Housemade Ice Cream Trio of Kit Kat, Oreo, Reeses's pieces.....to $9 for Red Velvet Cake, Blueberry Mochi Cake, Apple Pie a la Mode, Peanut Butter Jelly Time or Chocolate Mousse. In between in price are Strawberry Limeade, Chocolate Butterscotch Brownie, and Chocolate Chip Bread Pudding.  Suuuweeet!  Add sweet specialty cocktails, such as Passion Fruit Delight (7), Blood Orange Bellini (8), Raspberrry Delight (7), Strawberry Kiss (8), Kir Royale, Jasmine Sparkle, or Blueberry Pomegranate Fusion (all 8), and you have dreams in your mouth that are  Suuuweeet!  Next time I will have to try the 50/50, which is Soju/Orange Soda/Vanilla for $8, or the Spicy Michelada of Pacifico/SaltRim/Tabasco/Lime juice (6). They also have 4 or 5 each of Bubbly, Red, White and Dessert wines.   They have a great Happy Hour (6 - 8pm) with $2 Pacifico, $3 Sangria, $3 house sparkling wine, and most of the specialty drinks above for only $4!   Suuuweeet!  Add the Kung Fu Taco truck being parked outside from 6 - 8pm on Tuesday's and Thursdays, and you can add $2 and $3 delicious tacos to your Happy hour priced drinks!   Suuuweeeet!  Finally you have art on the walls by local artists for sale, and great seating spaces for groups to share fun. The service was also very efficient and very friendly! Little Ali served our group of 20+ people with a smile everytime!  Suuuweeet!

W9RU376D6Ny0GzFKtc7uNQ.review_text: Desserts, cocktails and boardgames makes a perfect after dinner hangout.  Strawberry Limeade (Strawberry Mousse / Vanilla Cake / Calamansi Cream / Strawberries) was lovely paired with the Strawberry Kiss (sparkling wine, ginger ale, frozen strawberry)  Super cute spot - will be back!

X79mZxMK4cfhNsKUUZdxGw.review_text: Mmmm... OK. The server was slow to arrive for our orders and never stopped in to check on us, which meant my water glass went empty. Sadface  Red velvet: Overly decadent, overly dense, overly sweet. Also, the marshmallows are kind of non sequitur. Skip for next time.  Ice cream sundae: admittedly, I was hoping for an actual sundae instead of a deconstructed one, but it was still pretty tasty. The bruleed bananas were my favourite part. :)   Disclaimer: I'm a pastry chef, so my dessert judgements are always a bit skewed. Don't let it stop you from trying it!   But the service did kinda leave something to be desired.  The drinks were fine, and not especially noteworthy, but I'd drink the Jasmine Sparkler I got again if I were there.   Plus, they have games! And a magic 8 ball! And REALLY cool art!  I'd go back to try something else still, since their sundae was decent.

CO3V-Hv7xoyBvjriZ_q_Wg.review_text: I was so excited when I heard about this place!  I love the idea of a dessert lounge, but the desserts need major revamping... both in taste and size.  We got the following:  -Matcha Green Tea Chiffon Sponge -- the cake tasted like it had some dirt mixed into it with a small scoop of green tea ice cream on the side - Nacho sundae - handful of cut up fruit and ice cream on 4 pieces sugared pita slices... very delicious, but TINY PORTIONS. - White Chocolate Mousse with blueberries - this one actually tasted good, but the mousse was a "loose mousse" aka runny, watery white liquid.  Not your typical mousse. -beet marscapone cheese mousse- half a scoop of mint ice cream on top of coffee grounds, with a wafer roll filled with beet puree.... not recommended.  First of all, for $8/dessert, make them a decent amount.  I've tasted far better desserts in San Diego (at Extraordinary desserts) for $8-9 with also 3x the portions.  What we got last night was less than what any restaurant would serve you...  It was definitely NOT worth it. SMALL. TINY. MINUSCULE.  You get the picture.  The ambiance is romantic and definitely a date-spot.  They have spacious booths and tables, which are good for moderately sized groups.  They also have board games for you to play and also ice breaker cards.   The place has the right idea, but when you're charging $12/glass of muscat, and $8/dessert for small portions of dessert... it gets ridiculously expensive... and again, not worth it.  We were out of there in 30minutes.  Would not come back.  My search for bomb-ass gourmet desserts continues...

1ljC2JgUafYC9wtEUXJ3bQ.review_text: not that impressed.  i LOVE the idea of this place, and i had such high expectations, but it did not hit the spot!!  i envisioned it to be a little more cutesie / girlier / french, or even something like extraordinary desserts in san diego.  in fact, the reason i came here was to find a place to replace extraordinary desserts because i now live in san francisco.  i love the cool items on their menu, but i don't love how small the menu is.  i wish there were more variety.  some of the desserts were amazing, but some of the desserts were not really there.  still, they were all very aesthetically pleasing.  price was a bit high for the quality of the food, but you're paying for the aesthetics.  i feel like the decorations didn't really match.  i didn't really like the art (there's a 5 fulton bus picture hanging on the wall, some asian art) because it didn't really match the "candybar" title.  service was really fast and wonderful, though.  hostess and bartender were both incredibly nice.  i'm coming back here again with different friends on saturday, and then probably coming back with another friend on valentine's day :)  i think this a great place to come and chat with friends, play board games, gossip... etc :)

NknWFPAxaGxx_OJIEYVXWA.review_text: What a bummer this place was!  I have been waiting to go to this place for months now and what I thought would be heaven, turned out to be a huge mess.  First of all, there is no personality to this place what-so-ever.  It's a really bland place with no atmosphere to speak of.  I was bored just walking in.  They offer games to make your time there fun but most of the games had pieces missing so we couldn't play.  If you are going to offer games, switch them out for new ones once pieces go missing  so people can actually enjoy being there.  They had a creative menu but I wish that the flavors lived up to the hype.  For a place that is all about sugar, you would think that their drinks would be sweeter.  I got the strawberry kiss.  They used a cheap champagne that tasted like cheap alcohol.  There wasn't enough sweetness to call it a kiss.  What was supposed to be a sweet strawberry kiss, turned out to be just a bad kisser.  The desserts were even worse.  Really weird combinations that didn't compliment each other very well.  We got the Candybar Dessert for two which is actually a great deal.  4 selections of their desserts that were decent sized.  -Peanut Butter Jelly Time: This isn't what you think at all.  It's a tart thing with, what is supposed to be a peanut butter mouse in the middle with blackberries on top and what I guess was supposed to be a jam sauce?  It was topped with peanuts but the whole thing, while different, should have tasted like a peanut butter jelly SOMETHING.  All of the flavors were separated.  It should have blended together but when eating it all at the same time, cancelled out each other and tasted really bland.  I tasted the peanut butter, I tasted the black berries but it didn't taste like peanut butter and jelly time.  -Strawberry Limeade: WHAT THE HECK!  BORING!  Again, all the flavors were really bland.  Nothing stood out or tasted delectable.  The strawberry mousse was too soft, almost watery, and there wasn't enough cake or crust or anything for it to taste like a dessert.  -Apple A La Mode:  While the ice cream was really good, the rest was a mess.  The cake was too dry.  Again, nothing blended well.  It was just awful.  -Lavender Honey Creme Fraiche Semi Freddo:  Don't even go near this one.  It came with some synthetic powder on the side that threw off the taste of everything.  Yuck.  I would give this place a much lower rating but their staff was really nice and the bartender is all about being generous.  I was watching him pour drinks and he made sure that the glass was full to the brim.  He was very calculated about this too.  Very patient and wanted to make sure that the customer got their moneys worth.  That's a bad ass bartender!  I think this place is ok to try once and maybe with a group of friends but I will not be going back or recommending to anyone for fear of sheer embarrassment of recommending a bad place.

S5WQcThM04eH7Eu0YJ1a1Q.review_text: "I know a girl who's tough but sweet... I want Caaandy!" Know the song? The Strangeloves had it right -- love IS strange and sometimes dessert is the only thing that will do.   My girlfriends and I went after work, and we were the only folks in the joint (literally). All the better for us though, because we got all of the lovely attention of the gracious host and friendly waitstaff. I think Candy Bar is supposed to be an after-dinner spot, but the savory dishes made it a fun shared plates place as well.  Pastry chef Jake Godby (Fifth Floor, Coi) has created an innovative little menu, half savory and half sweet. First, my faves: the pork belly with peach sorbet, and the PB&J -- a foie gras cream, peanut brittle and jam concoction -- was better than the sammies of my youth. I was disappointed in the beef cheeks, which tasted rather bland, even though it was soaked in caramelized onion broth and topped with a red pepper bonbon.   With a glass of Malbec, our tiny plates disappeared faster than you can say "where the...?" I sincerely hope this is the first in a wave of dessert lounges, for times of extreme indulgence.

D8JswSWcY-fznIm05Y3WZA.review_text: Great spot for a date or small groups. The menu changes often, but the desserts are amazing and this is coming from someone who does NOT like sweets. The cocktails are unique and generally good, but they're mostly "girl" drinks...nothing wrong with that but it would be nice if they had more options and perhaps a bit stronger. I say this with the caveat that It's been 5 or so months since I last went there. Anyhow the coolest thing is that they have board games so you can get to know friends or your date a bit better while sharing dessert over cocktails.

Afet1LgMgLd-GbHclNN23Q.review_text: The menu is wonderful.  The desserts were fantastic.  The coffee was okay.  The service was crap, however when they realized that they forgot about us, they were incredibly apologetic and gave us some free dessert.  Beignets were really good.  My fav was the carmelized carrot dish - don't remember what it was called, but it was amazing.

TIaPtfeo_QcmsIBAhd4PNg.review_text: Update: I went to CandyBar a second time and wasn't as impressed as the first time. Cocktails were still delicious but desserts were just ok. I wonder if they have a new chef? Presentation was still wonderful but the flavor and texture weren't so memorable. I probably go back if I'm in the area with a group of friends & we don't know where else to go, but I won't be making a special trip for their desserts.

KheemzNvPqrxDtOqdrOQ5g.review_text: It's what you would expect; dessert with a splash of youthful play.   Desserts are good, definitely previously frozen and not fresh which is unfortunate. We had their tiramisu and a honey/lavender brick type thing; both cold and good, but nothing spectacular. Both tasted a little frozen still.  They also do not have a liquor license, so expect drinks with Soju and Sparkling wine...which was fine for us. We had sparkling wine cocktails to pair with our desserts, and they were pretty good. A little sugary but hey, you are at a place called Candybar.  I'm giving them a solid 3 stars mainly because our server was so friendly and chill, even after discovering we were there with a Living Social deal. Also, I really love all the local artwork and childhood memorabilia incorporated into their design. A legit Suzybake Oven was my towel holder in the ladies room,...so cute!  Lastly, board games and cards? Can't beat a little extra added fun to your happy hour! Very cool that they have those on hand to share.

zHGclvkpYOFPoChJNBqreA.review_text: Nice concept.  Very friendly staff and warm, inviting ambiance.   I tried the S'more's which I honestly didn't care for as the chocolate sauce tasted of booze way too much for my tastes...drowned out the flavors of the tart and marshmallow.   My colleagues had the pana cotta and apple tarts and both were excellent.   Parking is a challenge.   Allow an extra 15-20 mins for circling the block repeatedly to find a spot.

ZTv26RUeZm6etyt5oJLWjg.review_text: ***This review is for the candybar truck at SOMA Streatfood***  Excellent selection of desserts without crazy waits/crowds.  pick up your food and enjoy at home.

5X0eSDja58EOYvs_CPXbfg.review_text: Ok, first off... This place is very cute and cozy.  It's not your usual, "talk over one another" type of place.   It's comfortable and nice!  Well decorated with perfect lighting and comfortable furniture.  I was very happy with the service and I had great company as I always usually do:)  However, I was very disappointed in the red wine list.  Not much of a selection and most of the reds were dry and a tad over priced.  IMO.     On the other hand, their selection of whites (sweet - hence the name, and not -so-sweet) were FAR BETTER.    I don't know, I guess I've been spoiled with the many other wine bars in this city as far as "selection" goes.  I do recommend this place, but if you're a red wine person, just be prepared.   Hopefully they'll expand their list....  Oh!, and they have "fair" pours!

KyGkyqSPuJW-Sq7OXPVu2w.review_text: I went here a couple months ago for these brazillian chicks for their birthday. This place is amazing. The interior is a really relaxing, and the desserts are so good! I think I will come back I just need to find a date this time, lol

keT8EgJYaBL0toNFthVOyw.review_text: Yesterday was the first time I had ever even heard of this great new place in my neighborhood.  After having a fantastic dinner at our home my Roommate and I were looking for a nice (sort chill) place to have a an after dinner drink and share a dessert.  We decided it would be a perfect night for us to try this cute little spot we had been discussing earlier in the day.  It was a a little crowded when we arrived close to 11pm but, we were able to get a cozy spot on a bench in just a few minutes.  All the dessert wines looked so delicious we decided to get a few and have our own little tasting.  We had the Pinot Gris, Grenache and Tawny Port.  Great selections! We accompanied the wines with the Lavender Tres Leches.  Amazing!  The crystallized lavender garnish was the most amazing thing I've ever experienced.  To top the evening off we found some really friendly neighbors to share in a game of UNO with us.  Even though our little game went past midnight, the bar's closing time, we were never pressured or even mentioned to that it was time to start heading out.  The ambiance and decor reminded me of New York City but, the friendly staff and fun crowd were definitely San Francisco.  Thanks Candybar!  See you again very soon!

-7qXyEUe3RIs8CjBK8aEbg.review_text: Candybar is somewhere I wish I could live in forever. I love sweets and I love to lounge and this place is definitely my sweet spot to enjoy both in a cozy artful atmosphere where everyone is all smiles!  My bf made reservations for our party of 8 and we were graciously seated in our own comfy alcove with cushy seats and a window view. Our dessert hopping group was lucky enough to make the tail end of Candybar's happy hour which is 6-8pm daily. Their $4 sparkling cocktails are sweet and fizzy and give you a delicate buzz perfect for playing silly fun board games that they have there for anyone to play. My favorite was the Blood Orange Cocktail that tasted like a sweet ripe blood orange was just freshly squeezed into the glass and love the suger cube tossed into the flute and watching it dissolve into dancing bubbles that tickles your lips as you drink it.  I wanted to order one of every dessert but we started with the Tiramisu, PBJ Time, and Lavender Honey Crème Fraiche Semi Freddo which was my absolute favorite of the night. The rich crème fraiche texture with the suble honey hints to the semi freddo so full of sweet yet savory lavender flavor and fragrance really sung to me and filled me with romantic thoughts. It was paired with almond brittle which was eaten up quickly by the rest of my group so I didn't get to try it but it must have been a brilliant pairing. I enjoyed the tiramisu more than any that I've had recently and the PBJ time will be a favorite for any peanut butter lover with a sophisticated twist. Our waitress Mai was especially kind and helpful in every way even though it was a full house.  Also, this night at Candybar was particularly memorable because we heard President Obama announce the death of Osama bin Laden and the bartender was nice enough to pause and turn up the volume of the tv for us to listen to the speech in dramatic shock and silence.  Candybar is my kinda place! I only wish Candybar was open earlier in the day (they open at 6pm) and that parking in the area was easier to find. I can't wait to try the rest of their desserts and cocktails!

wG9d5TxOKKgbd8O08-kntA.review_text: I tried two items, both of which are in the photo gallery:  - The vanilla brioche, with figs and almond ice cream.  Highly recommended.  The brioche has a thin, crispy caramelized layer on top, like the top of a crème brûlée.  Inside, it's a light custard french toast.  Better than the french toast dessert at Clementine.  - The peaches and cream with caramel popcorn.  A disappointment, because the peaches were very under-ripe, and the concept of pairing caramel corn with peaches just doesn't work.  The dessert also features a gelatin-like peach gelée; it's flavor can't compete with the other parts of the dessert.  The menu on the web site is out of date; check a sample menu in the photo gallery.  A note on parking: it's impossible.  But you may have better luck finding on-street parking 2 blocks over on Baker St.

H74c_2LheXJmtEJd2EV6WQ.review_text: Came as a result of Groupon. Making a reservation on a Friday or Saturday would be a good idea if you have a party greater than 5. Inside gets really hot due to all the people inside and lack of airflow. It is also dark except for the candlelight. The environment serves as a place to kick it with friends, play games and have dessert. However, this wouldn't be my first choice since the dessert here isn't that great...and it's on the higher end. For a group of 5, we tried the Lemon Tart, Lavender Honey Creme Fraiche Semi Freddo, Japanese Cheesecake, Chocolate Financier Cake, and Mango Tango Bellini. Personally, I didn't find any of them amazing. The presentation is nice but the taste wasn't quite there for me. I liked the Lemon Tart because of the crust but that's about it. The Bellini tasted strong, but no effect.  The absolute worse thing was finding parking. We parked near McDonald's which is about a 10 minute walk from Candybar.

51DacJvYh42ttaz53ofrWQ.review_text: I dropped in on a Saturday night after reading about Candybar in SF Magazine's dessert issue.  I came looking for some of the best and innovative desserts in the city, but on the front left disappointed.  Neither dessert I tried was particularly great, but it seems like a great hangout with a cheerful vibe, and a really comfortable setting.  I ordered two desserts ($8 each).  I ordered the apple cinnamon soup with financier cake because there was an appealing smell of cinnamon in the air when I walked in.  And after finding most of the other options too fruity, I ordered the chocolate cremeux with thyme ice cream.
