The financier cake was rather dull and too easily overwhelmed by the fruity tartness of the apple cinnamon soup base.  While the apple soup was better than your average apple cider, I'll admit that it was pretty strongly reminiscent.    The cremeux was better, though not by a whole lot.  it was basically a chocolate mouse with a slightly bitter chocolate.  The pomegranate was a nice contrast, but mostly it tasted like a more typical chocolate mouse with strawberry or raspberry.  While you could notice the thyme in the accompanying ice cream, you wouldn't be hard pressed to convince the less attentive it was just vanilla.  The staff was really friendly, most people were having a blast playing board games, and the music was quirky and upbeat, which made it hard not to smile.  If you're already in the neighborhood, it's definitely worth a visit.  But with such tough parking, I can't yet recommend it for the desserts.

iSzumcUHyvyG16EIZPB_Kw.review_text: Nice atmosphere, bartender and floor manager guys VERY helpful and professional. Our waiter Kevin was aloof, didn't want to be there or talk to us, and served us cold tasteless coffee. My gf was ok with the desserts but they were totally forgetful to me. Kevin was "too cool" for us and his lack of service ensures that I won't be back.

7IyZBsbOzUqkdulWTvieAg.review_text: I've been here on at least 3 different occasions. I believe the drinks are delicious and sweet although I would stay away from the Chocolate Bellini as it is an assault on the taste buds. And, I believe that the desserts are, for the most part, nice and light despite being creamy and sweet. I keep going back because it's a nice lounge where I can just have a conversation with my friends and eat some delicious sweet treats. Plus, there are a few bars nearby in case we want to do more drinking later on.

1OzUQ42__vP7s9e8wrqoqg.review_text: For as often as I go here, you'd think I'd rate it higher! It's a fresh idea. The desserts are tasty. The decor is crisp and the seating is comfortable. Their servers all seem to have a real chip on their shoulder, however. I've never gotten a smile out of them--and I'm not a stingy patron. I tend to be easy to please--just don't treat me like my business is a pain in the ass. All said and done, though, it's a fun place to drop into if you need a late-night hangout!

qthtyjV-1dHIApNHtWB40A.review_text: Great idea, but poorly executed.  With the name "Candy Bar" wouldn't you expect that they had candy? Yeah, apparently not, which is why their name should be Dessert Bar instead.  The place was pretty cute and had cool artwork, but I feel like the front windows should have had curtains over them and the whole place should have been darker. Since it's a dessert bar, it's surprising that they close so early (10pm I think), don't most people have dessert after dinner?  We ordered all of the desserts off of the A La Cart Menu. The desserts were good, but they definitely were not great....as Simon Cowell would say, "they are very forgettable"! And they were all things that I could probably make at home, couldn't they at least have put some blood oranges or some interesting combos of flavors.  The service was friendly although, when we asked if the wine we were ordering was good, the waiter said that he hadn't tried it yet, I will give them the benefit of the doubt and say that it is due to the fact that they have just recently opened.  Overall the place was nothing special (and expensive) and I probably will not be going back unless they make some big changes!

FuPsBiugKkjHWEtG72bKfg.review_text: Cute place to sit down and get to know someone over desserts, drinks, and childish board games. Beware! Parking may be very difficult!   Came here to end the day of a double date with my boyfriend, brother, and his girlfriend. We had a groups for four desserts and four cocktails. The desserts were good but not if you have a nut allergy. It seemed like many items had nuts with them.   My boyfriend ordered the apple a la mode. It was alright... We did not enjoy the gingerbread ice cream. I ordered the sundae without the bananas. It came with three little brownies with a small scoop of mint chocolate chip ice cream on each brownie and was topped with a macaroon half. On the side was some sliced strawberries. I definitely enjoyed my dessert.  For our drinks, I ordered the strawberry kiss and my boyfriend ordered the mango tango. I enjoyed the strawberry kiss much more. I felt like I could drink them all night.   We enjoyed our time there with a Connect 5 competition. I subtracted a star for its prices on the desserts. Did not expect the desserts to be so expensive for how small it was.

KxBYaUy007O8hl0LjIVnow.review_text: Torn to review this place. I had a good time, but it would be over priced if not for the LS deal. The board games were fun, the drinks were ok and the desserts overwhelming. Not nut allergies friendly FYI. Not holding that against them but the desserts we had were more rich and creamy without much subsistence to them. Still good, not great.

i6IRahEGVbfOC8XcglHZaw.review_text: It's great to finally find an environment that is cozy and classy like CandyBar.  Once you walk in, from the interior design to the seating, there is a very elegant ambiance about this newly opened wine and dessert bar.    The bar has a nice selection of wines and sweet/savory tasting menu.  The desserts were so yummy!  The pastry chef is so talented with it's deconstructed desserts, I felt like I was enjoying a dish that came out of Iron Chef.  I would recommend the milk chocolate parfait with it's toffee chips.    When around SF all you seem to find are crowded rowdy clubs these days,  CandyBar offers a nice, classy wine and dessert bar around the neighborhood.  We will definitely be back!

mxrAnnJDalCLB9A4bZzqRQ.review_text: Looovee this place for desserts - so good and artful with their food! The sparkling wine menu is great too - who would think jasmine wine is yummy? Nice, comfortable, but parking can be a pain  ps: the jayz picture is good - they should have a tupac one too

5wlHRbDGQ8shSqiaQK9NrQ.review_text: Drink menu looked great but we came for the sweets. Desserts were good but there was at least one awkward element in each one that didn't seem to play well with the other flavors. Good ideas and unconventional flavor combos but I am just a traditionalist when it comes to desserts I guess.

HJGq8K9MrcrjnzLlPGZsDw.review_text: Drinks were "good/excellent".  Desserts were "good/excellent" and original.  Service was "excellent".  Prices are "moderate" but well worth it.  Very nice place to get a nice drink and dessert.    You might want to come here early or else it will be packed with people at night.

2Sf58ceaNru-RFabRtUvvA.review_text: I like this place, but it is flawed. The service is pretty friendly, but they will also snag your almost but not quite empty sangria glass before you finish. And ordering from the server takes much longer than going to the bar, which is annoying if you are trapped on the inside of a table.  That being said, their sangria is tasty (a bit sweet). The white sangria is not bad, but even sweeter, and also white sangria is an oxymoron! The chocolate butterscotch brownier with thyme ice cream was quite tasty, and I am certainly interested in trying other desserts.  As far as a space to hang out goes, it's pretty good if you have a relatively small party and can get there early enough to snag a table. The actual area is pretty small, so if you have to stand, it's pretty tight.   Overall, this place is worthy of say, 3.5 stars. But it's got a fairly unique vibe and I'm sure I'll be back.

pme7GsuU86rKc78DMoyBIQ.review_text: After hearing all the rave about Candy Bar, i gave it a try with a group of friends and ordered different sampler plates that covered all the desserts in the menu but i'm sorry to admit that none of them was that great in terms of the taste and the look.

wh3H2u0u8SHH3To4mbdpAg.review_text: So this place is awesome. I think it's a really unique blend of a lot of different things socially. The desserts here are exceptional, I had the the ice cream sundae and there was a ton of flavor, really sweet, the mint chip ice cream made it quite exotic.   I love how the place also has board games, gives the bar a really youthful vibe. Additionally, the bar gives the bar a different social appeal it's a great place if you're looking to drink, or looking to chill and get some sweets. Personal favorite and these unique places in SF continue to impress me.

fQuLe-KuojSco4DRbcFpGw.review_text: since i'm an avid kung fu taco supporter, i happened upon candybar when KFT was parked out in front of the joint. to be honest, this was quite serendipitous-- we were in the area for the little dragon show at the independent, and there was no place to eat except in some random doorway or the inviting candybar tables.  i decided to order the "peanut butter jelly time" dessert because i felt bad. hit the spot, but i was lukewarm about the whole idea anyways. aside from the local art, the decor was like your standard wine bar with a well-stocked shelf of communal board games.  they don't have hard liquor, but there are soju/sake cocktails. my friend ordered the sangria as well, since it was happy hour. though i didn't have a bad experience here, i'm pretty loyal to fly bar for drinking and the atmosphere. i'd definitely go again-- i'm curious to try the other desserts, and the mood of the place would be more appropriate if we weren't so amped before the concert.

9UokkqJpMj2pJ3bAgKehcQ.review_text: Super cute bar/dessert place. I came here with 3 of my friends and we each got a drink + shared one dessert. We opted for the Drunken' Smores which was delicious! It was drizzled with bailey's irish cream and wasn't too sweet for my taste. It had the perfect amount of sweetness and bitterness.  The drinks are very fruity and barely taste like alcohol. Isn't that a good thing?  I would definitely come back here with a group of girlfriends.

VafnKfpYOlZ5s1gBWSRuEw.review_text: The desserts here are incredible. Without a doubt probably the BEST late night dessert place in San Francisco! Yes I know that is a strong statement to make, but I believe it is that good. I can't remember everything I ate, but I remember every bite was a party in my mouth; with taste buds doing the dougie and gangnam style dance. In addition the presentation of each dessert is unbelievable! With the taste and presentation your getting, in my opinion, fine dining desserts at a very reasonable price. Desserts, Wine, Cocktails - what an amazing concept for this restaurant/lounge.  Customer service was great as well. I remember one time we didn't realize that they were closing up shop and we were the last customers, but the workers aloud us to finish our plates and leave whenever we were done (rather than being rushed out).  Games: yup thats right, this place got board and card games that I used to play in my elementary school days. Connect 4 anyone? UNO? Battleship? These sure brought back the memories. However, I do wish they would have Mancala, something my friend and I missed from our childhood.  Im almost afraid to tell people about this spot because sometimes the line can be long, but this place is really good. Dimmed light environment with great music plus good company makes for a perfect hang out spot.  Will return shortly, the Connect 4 battle continues!.....

eKUGKQRE-Ywi5dY55_zChg.review_text: ATTENTION ALL MEN: Need a hip, intimate place to bring a date and get her drunk the classy way? Well, then Candybar is the PERFECT place to bring her. Not that I condone getting people drunk on a date *lips sealed*!   Candybar serves up unique and beautifully presented desserts that are equally delicious and sexy cocktails that will impress your date and if not, it will at least give you both some endorphins and liquid courage to avoid those awkward "silent" moments.   My friends and I came to Candybar on Thursday, 5.13.10 for the Kung Fu Tacos HH on Tuesday and Thursday from 6-8 PM.   We arrived at around 6:45 PM, ordered our tacos outside which were brought inside Candybar for us to enjoy.  DRINKS ($6-$9; some are $4 from 6-8 PM):  *Stawberry Kiss (Sparkling Wine, Ginger Ale, and Strawberry): YUMMY! I'm not really a cocktail type of gal, but the Strawberry Kiss was very light and refreshing. The wine was slightly sweet, not too dry, and had just the right amount of bubbles to tingle your tongue. The whole strawberry was plump and sweet. Beware, this is a creeper. My friend and I have a HIGH alkie tolerance and we each had 3 glasses each which gave us a buzz as if we had 3-4 straight shots of GG or Remy.   *50/50 (Soju, Orange Soda, Vanilla): My other friend ordered this and it tasted like a spiked orange sherbet and vanilla popsicle. It was sweet, creamy, and STRONG enough to get him BUZZED; keeping in mind, he drinks GG like water.   DESSERTS ($5-9): *Apple a la Mode (Hazelnut crust, Cream cheese, Caramel and Gingerbread ice cream): A perfect balance of sweet, salty, tangy, creamy, and nutty. The hazelnut crust was buttery and had a great crunch from the toasted hazelnuts. It was layered w/ the cream cheese and tart apples. Surprisingly, the gingerbread ice cream went every well the dessert and added just a hint of spice.  *Buttermilk Vanilla Bean Panna Cotta w/ Balsamic Cherry Reduction and Cocoa Macaroon: OMFG! One of the BEST desserts I've ever tasted. The panna cotta was velvety smooth. The buttermilk gave it a slight tang w/o overpowering the vanilla bean flavor. The balsamic cherry reduction complemented the panna cotta perfectly; adding some sweet tartness. Oh, and you can't forget the cocoa macroon which was crispy on the outside, but nice and chewy in the middle.   *Red Velvet Cake w/ Cream Cheese Frosting, Coconut, and Mint Ice Cream: YUMMMMMMY! The BEST red velvet I've ever tasted. The cake was still warm and was airy and moist. The thick cream cheese frosting was rich and creamy, and the coconut added the perfect amount of sweetness to balance out the slight tartness from the frosting. The menu stated "mint ice cream", but it seems we got a vanilla ice cream instead. The ice cream was rich and creamy and also helped balance out the sweetness from the frosting.  SERVICE: Despite having to flag down the waiter several times (it was peak time afterall), he was very fast and friendly. He made it a point to ask before HH ended at 8PM if we wanted another round of drinks, so we can take advantage of the HH prices.   AMBIANCE/DÉCOR: Intimate, comfy, hip and fun. There's a small lounge area in the front with sexy red velvet couches that allow for more intimate conversation. A bookshelf separates the lounge area from the tables in the back which is stocked with books and nostalgic childhood board games like Candyland, Chutes and Ladders, Sorry, Connect Four, and etc.   Hip-hop and R&B music bumping in the background and hand painted Hip Hop murals (Missy Elliot, T.I., etc) w/ an Anime twist gives CB a funky sheek vibe.  *Sigh* If only there was a dancefloor...   PARKING: Street which can be very difficult in the NOPA area.  I can't wait to come back very soon....*AHEM*! LoL!

SRcmpMtVnu8SZRFBh9uVwQ.review_text: I just tried Candybar for the first time on Wednesday and all I can say is why didn't I find this place sooner?!?  They have a great happy hour special where you get champagne cocktails for $4 each.  I had the Jasmine and it was fantastic!  My friend had the mango and she liked it a lot especally because it had a cute sugar rim.  I also tried the blood orange and it's nice if you don't want something on the sweet side but if you're one of those types then this may not be the place for you.  We shared the red velvet cake with cream cheese frosting - holy smokes that was one of the best deserts I've ever had - it came with homemade mint ice cream too!  Then we tried the brownie with fresh berries and basil ice cream.  It was a really delicious brownie and the basil ice cream was good too.  I want to go back soon so I can try so many of there other delicious treats!

KOV-7eQchJHDWcT_3pFtOQ.review_text: What a cute concept! I've been here twice, and I've been pleased every time. The place is dimly lit, has a cafe-type vibe, and even provides board games for your enjoyment. I've only gone in big groups, but this would also be a cute place to take a date.  They offer both dessert wines and desserts, and because I bought a groupon-type deal for this place, our group splurged in buying countless desserts and drinks for all of us to enjoy.   We ordered the strawberry limemade, which had strawberry mousse, vanilla cake, calamansi cream, and strawberries. They served it in a jar, which made the dessert taste homemade! Many of the cocktails we got were also delicious, some of the glasses were even rimmed with sugar! I can't remember everything else we ordered, but I was overall pleased.  Left this place with a stomachache for all the sweetness overload, but it was a small price to pay for everything they had to offer!

Q8TGsARjdIfWsnXqgQYHhw.review_text: Been to Candy Bar a few times with different groups of people and it's always been a pleaser.  They have some unique bubbly cocktails as well as some basic beer offerings but the desserts are pretty much the main draw.    I recently had the Tiramisu which was pretty awesome and the time before that I had the Ice Cream Sandwich that had macarons for the cookie parts.  This was pretty good but I felt the macarons were maybe on the harder side and every bite squeezed more ice cream out.  For drink, they have a champaigne-jasmine cocktail that was pretty good and of course they have soju shots (I recommend the watermelon).  The drink menu is pretty unlike anything I've seen at other places so there's plenty to explore for subsequent visits.  Otherwise it's a small joint with some board games to play around with but if you come with good company with a sweet tooth, Candy Bar is the place for you.  Also had no problem with small dogs.

iC63wYPcVPK-lRsZa1xIuw.review_text: Delicious, fun, but expensive. I love the board games and the desserts, but I mean you do see the size of your dessert and you must wonder... what magical ingredients they put in, but no more expensive than a fancy restaurant I suppose. ... and you do get the benefit of board games so can't complain on that point. I think I'll come back for a happy hour - $2 sangrias, what? Fantastic.

Lx-s5OayOrCrbDrneCw3jg.review_text: It's not bad but by the same token it's not awesome. My date and I are solid bakers and we could honestly tell you what was wrong with the dessert. The both of us are by no means professionals but we can tell you that we can make better at home. We both agreed that the place did a great job at attempting at a very difficult and unique concept. The execution however felt rush and didn't blow our lids. The space was poorly planned with ikea furniture and I felt that the venue was too scrunched. Again, I appreciate that they did a really good job at attempting to create something. But for the price they're charging, it simply doesn't justify the lackluster dinning. They really need a boost in every direction to get it to that next level. Quality is paramount not rent.

wyKi5kzzggDMEQSIGBpjWA.review_text: I wish I lived in the neighborhood so I could go to Candybar often, especally during Happy Hour. You can't beat a good $3 Sangria and top it off with a delicious dessert! On a quiet Sunday night this place was chill and I'll be back again to try more desserts.

vcOtDqQ2Cc731kFjklFeBg.review_text: Came here on a Friday night. My loverman and I were all dressed up with no where to go after his friend flaked on us. I thought of Candybar but didn't say anything since I figured we wouldn't find parking anyways. Then its about 10 at night and we still weren't able to find anything to do so I mention this place. Loverman thinks its perfect, dessert for me and wine for him.   We call to make reservations for 10:45. He told me the people on the phone were really nice. I thought for sure we would take an hour to get there but it only took us 20 minutes. Haha. This is why I am never late. I always overestimate how long it will take to reach my destination. (That totally sounds like some therapy statement). It then took us another 20 minutes to find parking and a short walk in the drizzling rain after, we got there at exactly 10:45.   The place wasn't packed and there were a few tables open. Loverman asked the waiter if they had Prosecco and the waiter said they didn't. Then the waiter reads the drink menu himself (it was on the back of the menu and neither of us noticed there was a menu on the back) and then tells us they actually do have it. WTF. Your menu is so limited, how do you not know what you carry?   He orders a glass along with the Strawberry Lemonade dessert and I order the Apple a la Mode dessert. I totally see the two employees talking and looking over at us for a good five minutes but I didn't say anything. Later when I was talking to my loverman, he was all distracted and then he told me he was trying to figure out why the employees were behind me arguing about us. Who does that?  Extremely rude and unprofessional to be talking about your customers right in front of them.   The desserts were mouth watering except my dessert came with this weird chunky white cream and I looked at the menu and it wasn't listed as an ingredient so I have no idea what it was and it tasted really weird. It was not semen guys. Get your mind out of the gutter.   Also they served our desserts with the biggest spoons I've ever seen at a restaurant. They were like serving spoons. Who eats desserts with spoons that big?!??! I asked for a smaller spoon and the one I got was just barely smaller and then the waiter gave me another slightly smaller spoon.   Loved the ambience. I had a blast playing some 80's trivia game with my loverman. It felt like a fancier cafe experience which is always my favorite. Just being able to sit and talk and relax.   Amazing food + relaxing ambience does not a good restaurant make.   Negatives: Rude employees. Weird ingredients in their dessert. Giant serving spoons given as dessert spoons. No parking. Employees don't know what drinks they have.   I will be back. Possibly with my own spoon and I will be ignoring the employees as much as I can and just focus on their yummy desserts.

sBxDJGP-gLYrKhMNoniqAA.review_text: This place is right up my alley. I love sweet drinks and I don't pass up dessert.  For drinks, I got the Strawberry Kiss, my fiance got the Mango Tango Bellini. Mine was yummy, but his was heavenly, it had sorbet in it! Mmm. Our desserts were the Apple a la mode, Japanese Cheesecake, Peanut Butter Jelly Time, and the ice cream sandwiches. All delicious but my fave was hands down the Apple a la mode. We'll be back!

hvDTwx6lmmJaa2wp_6jUdQ.review_text: We discovered this place because of a groupon (which was a really good deal $17  for 2 desserts and 2 drinks) and decided it would make for a cute date night.  We went on a Thursday night and got there around 7 and were sat down at a table instantly.  About 20 mins after we got there there was a huge wait list!! so a piece of advice get there EARLY.   Have dessert before  you go out to dinner...live a little! =)  -Drinks were Delicious and creative & Desserts were rich and super tasty!! definitely wanna come back with  group of friends!!

vj-71bWcddq5l-FEkThVbw.review_text: Candybar is a cute little bar (not a full bar) in NOPA. Candybar had a pretty good list of happy hour specials. I was able to try Sangria and Passion Fruit Sparkling Wine and a few other sparkling wines with fruit. Yum yum yum! Plenty of seating for everyone and the service was great. On Thursdays I believe the Kung Fu taco truck is outside.

oeSP4tyY8VKMW-ndSMVv1g.review_text: Yum Yum Candybar!  What an awesome idea!  They have boardgames galore so you can play while you eat/drink, although when we tried to play "Sorry" a lot of the pieces were missing so we couldn't play :(.  We ended up playing apples 2 apples instead.  I had the Strawberry kiss which was awesome.  The other drinks that we had in the group were also good.  Happy hour! $4 drinks!  We also had the Dessert Combo which was picking 4 of the desserts: - Peanut butter jelly time: OMG so good this one was the best.  It was basically an AWESOME peanut butter cup with jelly.  It was the big hit with the group - Strawberry Limeade - My favorite of the 4, it was like a small strawberry mousse with a graham cracker crust on the top with a lime kick. - Apple a la mode - It was a good small little apple pie type dessert, was was the least favorite of mine. - Japanese cheesecake -  Now I thought this was going to be awesome, until I realized it was the cheesecake you can buy for $1 that comes pre-packaged in the Japanese grocery store.  Don't get me wrong, it was still good but I knew what it really is....  The staff was friendly and the music was awesome.  I would definitely come again and highly recommend.  Good for groups.

lXKjU1d7uy4aG0c5dNTATw.review_text: celebrated a birthday here for our friend nicole. we had rounds of strawberry belinis, lemon drop shots and more shots! i didn't get to taste any of the desserts that were ordered but i can tell by my friends they were rocking a buck fifty smile after each spoonful!

fHS0bQ-l5rHME_xXKQSYXQ.review_text: Strawberry limeade dessert paired with a California brew of character: seriously, there's lots to like regarding this diminutive ode to the sweet tooth, and the place was jammed with casually resplendent friends when we happened in on a Friday night.   Fast forward to the dessert selection and prepare to be bowled over by an assortment of treats borne out of dentist spite: there's a treasure trove of candy happening, and my palate at least was amped to be on the guest list for this party. Thanks for the memories, Candy Bar: I'm sure there's a decadent bite or two happening down the road.

JKGfEkxAcUJW4eMOzwF4tg.review_text: Dessert and cocktails, what more can you ask for?  I ordered a passion fruit chocolate mousse. It was a hefty potion with a scoop of gelato and bits of chocolate. Presentation is gorg and the taste, of couse, delish.

WOS8cJxKIaFjslcnyHYhiQ.review_text: A pleasant enough end to the evening after small plates at Nopalito. It just has a few things counting against it. The dessert we shared (the red velvet cake with mint ice cream) was good--not great--and for a dessert-only joint, it fell short of delivering a big impression. Also, despite the cozy, boardgames-and-local-art (and only slightly hip-tardy) atmosphere, and the place being pretty quiet, it felt like we were rushed out. Here's the check, what's your hurry? Still, we may come back, if only to try the intriguing butterscotch-chocolate concoction with thyme ice cream. And, ok, the board games.

UsDwIzzhc5Ty5c3m0rLQ2w.review_text: As a dessert person, I was thrilled to see a place dedicated to just desserts. Most of the desserts I tried were quite good. My only disappointment was that there was nothing warm to drink. The staff mentioned they were expecting to set up Blue Bottle coffee soon. The wine selection was great and the ambiance relaxed. The tasting menu is worth getting just for the warm malt milk at the end.

rwNO7Ru33qDe-7FNQhs2Hg.review_text: What a great idea! I finally got to check out the first dessert bar in SF and I was not disappointed. All of the desserts were good, though my favorite was the chevre cheesecake - delicious! The vibe here is very cool and relaxed. The staff are all very attentive and helpful. Also, if you are there at the right time, they are very generous with giving out freebies like freshly baked chocolate chip cookies, or a few tastes of wines they are considering to add to their menu. I would definitely come back here. Great date place for all you single folks.

_p85hjFgp0rbHdKX1JLPLQ.review_text: Popped in here after dinner the other night and was pleasantly surprised.  I give 5 stars simply because there is no other place quite like this and the concept is strong. Good desserts, paired nicely with after dinner wines an such. A solid addition to the neighborhood further enhancing the mighty Divis corridor.

APvW86gM1HfVjj1LEU303A.review_text: I have a new love and his name is "Madeira"! Seems that I sampled this potion in Spain, but for some reason, the memory didn't stick. This time, an impression was made! Thank you to the waiter who suggested I try this taste of heaven, and thank you for allowing the b/f and I to sit side-by-side while sampling those delicious desserts. My favorite was the chocolate mille-fuille, though we also tried the blueberry coffee cake (just because I HAD to know what the corn ice-cream served on the side would taste like) and the chocolate cannelone. I love all that is corn, but that said, corn ice-cream is just meh. The cannelone was good though. Definitely a date spot. Not much in the way of singles.

QrMagkgTk5Yb-UKauRsa1A.review_text: The concept of this place is great: cocktails and elaborated desserts in a loungey atmosphere. They even have board games (albeit sticky)! Perfect for a date right?  However, my dessert was so disappointing that I simply couldn't eat it! I had it in front of me for a good hour and kept trying to go back to it, to no avail. I got the Apple a la mode: the cheesecake was floury and pasty, the hazelnut crust was soft (!), the caramel was burnt, and the gingerbread ice cream overpowering. Yet I do have a real sweet tooth and I've never turned down a dessert before - NEVER. I tried my friend's dessert - strawberry limeade in a jar - but likewise it was not edible: the fruits were tart (could have sweetened them!) and the lime cream was so acidic! No balance whatsoever.   Bottom line is: these desserts completely miss the mark... Way overthought, noticeably unbalanced, and overall a BIG let down. Please get another pastry chef!

Zr5Il-XqYU4kHd7iY5v_RA.review_text: The Good: The Drunken S'mores are very good. The gourmet, adult version, if you will. The cocktails were decent and reasonably priced for SF (Strawberry Kiss and Lychee Guava martini, $10/each); they also serve beer and wine.   The Bad: The ambiance is undecided. Low lights and jazz - romantic. Raucous bartender and bar, close tables, board games - lively. Concept - upscale. Execution - casual.  The Ugly: I'm sorry to report, my darlings, that this is some terrible service. I'm not a needy patron (I've been a waitress, it's the worst), but almost every common complaint you could have, they met: uninterested seating, long wait for unfriendly/unhelpful/impatient waiter, brings one drink - desserts served - missing other person's drink until inquired about, incorrect check sent back twice, and on and on ...   But not again!

6sfoZGTuU3a-R_wSgQYwKQ.review_text: Love this place. Always a good ambiance and great desserts! I highly recommend the tiramisu!

-jyhFYV6qQ7TCCJDxjVLbw.review_text: i have a separate stomach for desserts. however, i hate it when desserts are way tooo sweet or have no taste at all.   this place is to die for. the japanese cheesecake is delicate, light, and melt in your mouth goodness. strawberry kiss is like nothing youve ever had before.   very small place so there are lines to wait for a seat. definitely ideal after dinner date place!

3idgX-PvIIU841rhXlQiKA.review_text: Desserts and drinks (bubbly concoctions.) Board games. A really great date night place since it's romantical with music quiet enough to chat...and since the girls can have all sorts of sweets desserts.   I love their carrot cake.

Um_3RMoEU2enGVr1G3cpVA.review_text: Awesome.  I will dream about the panna cotta forever.  It is a Fourme d'Ambert cheese with cinnamon toast and fruit.  So amazing  A great drink menu and you get a 4 course tasting menu for only $14.  Great deal, fabulous food.

VuvFxWaHBygYf-TzB8S36Q.review_text: One of those hidden gems that actually has you craving it from time to time.   I really enjoyed my outing here.   Happy Hour is the best time of day but honestly, don't be scared to try it other times as well.   So many wonderful choices of sparkling wine cocktails.  The lovely array of desserts are well worth the price.   I suggest a sampler, it's fun to share and to try the different items offered.     It's small and can seem crowded by the looks of it, but you really feel like you have some space and privacy.

hOPhxpCvB2bKjRoMG16OCw.review_text: LOVE the idea of this place - intimate setting + great desserts + drinks over board games?! YES PLEASE!  the place is filled with a mix of people ranging from first dates to bachelorette parties and everything in between. You can easily spend a few hours here but it does tend to get crowded towards the end of the night and they do have time restrictions on tables on busy nights (though I never had an experience being rushed).   in terms of the sweets, i tried the drunken s'more which was truly delectable! - graham cracker crust with chocolate, salted caramel, and a toasted marshmallow! It seemed popular too, since I saw several tables ordering the same thing. But i think their menu changes often, as I didn't recognize most of the photos on yelp on their menu, so beware. but whatever you get will be good, I'm sure! so go check them out!

f63D9EmLiCj_DJHgSKe5zw.review_text: Amazing spot- out of this world desserts, drinks and elegant, friendly atmosphere! gather.com/viewArticle.a…

QocBlTr2yzZd6IjJMPo0Cg.review_text: LOVE this place. Took my girls here to try it out. I think the concept of the whole place is so cute. The ambiance is great, delicious cocktails and dessert, and board games!   Mango bellini is excellent. I would've ordered 6 if this wasn't the first spot we hit up. My friends also loved the strawberry kiss. Lemon tart was to die for. And the ice cream trio was really good too. So many choices, it's hard to choose! Lemon drop shots were delish as well!  Next time I will have to come back for happy hour!

7DaPNCdydomVTm_0tEv7kA.review_text: Board games? CHECK. Drinks? CHECK. Sweets? CHECK. Dim lit relaxing atmosphere? check, check, check, anndd CHECK! I love desserts and anything sweet. Therefore- completely feelin' this place.  The tiramisu lacked mascarpone cheese and moisture so I do not recommend it. However, the Honey-Almond Panna Cotta and our two drinks- the 50/50 and Passion Fruit Delight more than made up for what the tiramisu lacked. I kind of wish the drinks were stronger but I suppose you're there for delicious desserts and tasty cocktails and not necessarily to get drunk...

p3ZmxLEKGzuooI7fPWrpIg.review_text: I really wanted to like this place, really I did. Love the idea, love the ambiance, they seem like they had all the right ideas when they came up with this place but, sadly, its just not very good. The plates look gorgeous but they're completely lacking in flavor. I don't just mean sweet flavor, I mean any flavor. I asked for a recommendation and got a fruity concoction that was the definition of meh. I left it 90% uneaten and got a chocolate cake. No flavor, no sweetness, no nothing. I tried my date's s'mores cake and it too was bready but lacking in flavor. The only thing I can compare it to is when I have had traditionally asian desserts that have such subtle flavors you might as well not call them dessert. Ok, if I'm going to have something with a ton of calories, a ton of fat and I'm going to have to go run for an hour the next day to make up for it, I want some flavor payoff. Added to the fact that this place is wildly expensive, I just can't recommend it.

6p_b23-lIwJORpceR1bS_Q.review_text: Candybar's concept is not only awesome--dessert, drinks, and board games, it's also your answer to the loud/crowded sportsbar when the occasion calls for a quieter, more intimate atmosphere. (Sometimes it's nice to escape to somewhere where you can have a real conversation) And it'll definitely satisfy any sweet tooth.   From the dessert menu, we ordered the Tiramisu and the Flourless Chocolate Banana Torte--loved em' both! The presentation was beautiful, and the little extras (vanilla bean ice cream, nuts, dark chocolate, whipped cream, pineapples, etc) added to the decadence.   The cocktails were okay...they're all made with sparking wine, soju, or some combo of the two. I wasn't a fan of the mango bellini because it sounded great in theory, but the sparkling wine was an awkward mix with the sorbet. The lychee cocktail with the soju and sparkling wine was a winner though. They also serve other beverages including wine, beer, and non-alcoholic beverages.   Candybar is a nice indulgence, and a fun departure from the norm. It's also a fun place for girls' night or date night.

ANuPj15hsfHW0fJbxOGIYg.review_text: I am SO FREAKIN' STOKED that this place is right around the corner from my house!!! I have not had a bad dessert here...everything has been mind boggling to oh-so-yummy...and the wine selection is outstanding: Everything you need, nothing you don't. If you can get the apple strudel crumble thing, DO IT...it's amazing!  I love the relaxed atmosphere...it's a place I can go with friends after dinner for great conversation and yummy treats without worrying about being 'dressed for it." My husband and I walk by Candybar with our dogs every day, and the staff always comes out to greet them. This is the kind of place that defines the term 'community', and I am so happy they are in our hood!

iLjMdZi0Tm7DQxX1C1_2dg.review_text: There's a new saying going around that 'great customer service is the new marketing.' It's the concept that the best marketing initiative you can invest in is simply providing superb customer service to your clients, whether you're a restaurateur or an auto mechanic. Makes sense, right? You treat someone well, then they tell their friends, then their friends tell their friends, and so on, culminating with a snowball of loyal followers. In my humble opinion, Candy Bar (in my only experience thus far) has totally nailed that theory.  Since my lady and I are new to the Western Addition/NOPA area, we've been trying to check out the different businesses in the 'hood. We've hit most of the bars, some of the restaurants, all of the liquor stores... and last night, we decided it was time to satisfy our sweet side with a trip to Candy Bar.  Right off the bat, the staff were totally friendly and accommodating, and there was a great vibe with people playing games, celebrating life with glasses of champagne, couples sharing beautiful looking desserts, and more. We were seated rather quickly, and our server was very helpful in answering questions about items on the menu and giving advice on which drinks would pair well with the dessert we chose (chocolate/raspberry cake with homemade ice cream). We were actually torn between the cake and the nachos (a creative take on actual nachos, but with avocado ice cream, shredded mango, kiwi, candied jalapeños and cinnamon chips), but we went with the cake.  To our surprise, after having a pretty lively debate over which dessert we were going to choose, our server ended up hooking us up with the nachos for free! How cool! Especially since we've never met this dude before. We were both pretty excited about this random act of kindness, and we hooked him up with a pretty sweet tip (no pun intended).   The desserts are small, but mighty. If you're trying to share a plate, you might be slightly disappointed. I'd probably suggest you save up and come in on a special occasion, order a handful of different confections, get some booze through your veins, and hang for a while. It has one of those coffee shop vibes to it where seemingly, you could chill there for hours on end and never feel rushed.

4RUXeyp_Af2C5t9JFyJlBQ.review_text: This place was pretty awesome. Parking is pretty hard to find, and so is the place. We passed by it a couple of times and I couldn't see it. Playing board games while drinking and eating is super fun, but it's a little hard to do with a small table for two. We got there a bit early when it was still empty, but as we left, it was filled with people.   We played some Connect Four (btw, I was beating my bf's butt) and got some dessert and drinks.  The peanut butter jelly time just reminded me of the song and I knew we had to try it. It was pretty good, but the tart was a little too hard to cut into. The flavor of peanut butter was pretty overwhelming, but the blackberry glaze and fresh blackberries were good. I think that was my favorite part.  The cupcake trio was something I definitely had to try. It was pretty decent for cupcakes, but I was not overwhelmed. The chocolate chocolate one was the best - it was nice and moist; the frosting which was a buttercream wasn't too much either. The red velvet, I thought was a bit dry, but I enjoyed the cream cheese frosting. The blueberry chocolate cupcake had a buttercream that was too buttery. I felt like my lips were coated in butter by finishing it. It was kind of gross to be honest. I couldn't even taste the blueberry flavors.  I got the strawberry kiss which was pretty good. I didn't enjoy it as much I think because I didn't want to drink since I had to do more work at night and didn't want to drink too much. The bf got 50/50 which tasted like orange cream soda and not like alcoholic drinks.   Overall, we had a great time and it wasn't too bad. $40 for 4 things. I wanted to try the tiramisu, but maybe next time. It was nice to do some "date" things with the bf again.

yW-GBoKnzyduaG86Y1NLzw.review_text: I'm kind of a fan. I came with a couple of friends to just relax and catch up. It was pretty late on a weeknight, pushing 10PM. Hey...assuming normal working hours, this is a reasonable "late" since we all had work the next day!  Giants game playing on the TV (point!). Parking in that area is terrible. Absolutely terrible. But what do you expect in that hood?  We decided a flight for the 3 of us. Our thinking was that even though it was $10 more to share for more than 2 people, it gave us 1 additional dessert, which was worth it. Then our waiter points out that we can order a $10 dessert, which means for the same price we can have 5 desserts. Umm...YES PLEASE.   Ice Cream Sandwich: Was pretty good, but very difficult to eat as an ice cream sandwich. Think of it just as half a macaroon with some ice cream on it. Open-faced sandwich, if you will. The honeydew ice cream was really good! If you like honeydew.  Lavender Honey Creme Fraiche Semifreddo: It was good, though there was a bit too much honey in the almond brittle. It became difficult for me to chew. Its a good option if you wanted dessert at an awkward date and didn't want to talk. Just keep chewing. Or, if your date asks "did you just check out that guy/girl??" Pop a brittle in your mouth and it gives you about 2 minutes of thinking time.  Apple Ala Mode: Overall pretty good. Had a good ginger taste to it, which is always nice.  Big Francesco's Tiramisu: I love coffee items. This was a decent hit for me, but it was a bit too soft.   Passion Fruit Chocolate Mousse: this was our additional one. I loved the passionfruit mousse, because it actually TASTED LIKE PASSIONFRUIT. You have no idea. I've been seeking this taste in the USA for the longest time. A lot of places will give you the aroma of passionfruit, but kill it with sweetness. Passionfruit is supposed to be sour! Just a bit of the sour bite to it! This delivered. Big time.  I also had a 50/50 cocktail, which reminded me of an alcoholic orange creamsicle. Awesome...and perfect.

Xorep_PXj9XQH3UVquaZAA.review_text: Was taken here for my birthday last night and had a really great time. First visit. Didn't even know the place existed. It's a wine bar that does pairings with sweet and savory dishes. I myself just wanted wine but the desserts were yummy and the wine choices were pretty good. The service itself was excellent. They were really accomodating to our large party of about 12 and continually checked on us to make sure everything was going well. Everyone had a great time and I think the bill was pretty reasonable. At least people commented that they felt that it should have cost more. If you are in the area or manage to find a coveted parking spot in this neighborhood, you definitely should make a visit. Good for groups and dates.

2upKabdFGrDviO1z7JRj5g.review_text: A fantastic find.  I cruised in on a Wed and grabbed a seat at the bar to do a little reading.  I was there solo, so could not join all the tables playing an array of board games, but will definitely be back.  Candyland (of course), battleship, apples to apples, connect four and more are available to patrons, inviting you to hang out and stay as long as you like.  I had the carrot cake, which was insanely good, a 50/50 drink (way too delicious, I could have had 17 of them without blinking) and both red and white sangria.  One of the owners was helping me at the bar and was very nice, chatting with me in between filling a whole lot of orders.  Great spot for a date or to just catch up with friends.  Menu limited to only dessert, but I definitely want to go back to try each one...

XzuGe_Q2b955aZQRHpSjRQ.review_text: Sleek and cozy lounge with red booths and scattered tables.  Definitely a place to catch up with friends or to sidle up to a significant other.    I loved the ambiance - dim with candles and strung lights, cool artwork and photography, booths by the window, and a cool red/black/white color scheme.  Very sexy.    The concept is great - drinks and dessert.  Their idea of a happy hour is drinks with a BYOD (Bring Your Own Dinner).  I loved the extensive list of cocktail drinks and wines.  They have several dessert wines that stray from the usual Muscat and Rieslings.  I had a Royal Tokaji Red Label from Hungary, which was quite smooth and delicious.    I dock a star for the miniscule dessert portions, which are pricey and pretentiously small.  The bf and I shared a beet marscapone mousse, served with mint ice cream and crumbled coffee and chocolate bits. The creamy texture and flavors worked together nicely and you can tell everything was fresh.  However, it left me craving for more.     The "gourmet dessert" concept doesn't really win me over, but I'd definitely come back for the scene and the drinks.

j5v4kI6Ktc1EoaSMJHEMOg.review_text: not coming back.  but to be fair, please read all before making your decision.   out of 4 desserts tasted, 3 rock and one is a waste of calorie consumption.   the promised board games, which were part of the reason we went here, are badly maintained.  out of 5 games tested, none had its instruction included [1 of the 5 didn't need any]. waitress was cold and less than pleasant; the 2 waiters were nice to OK.  noise level - too high, bad acoustics lighting - too low for board games, not doing justice to the desserts, ok for having a conversion, if you ignore the noise level.  restroom - clean enough.  ventilation - bad.  door was open and still it was stuffy and uncomfortably hot. soundtrack: hip-hop, pop OK.  sadly, given the noise level, it's not the place to actually listen to the music.   what ensured we are never coming back is the $3 charge for an extra shot of espresso for a latte.  not only the latte was still bad, NO PLACE charge for an added shot the same price as you may charge for stand alone espresso.  prices range from $0.50 to$ 0.75.  even $1 charge is considered a rip off.  yet here they are comfortable with $3.  UNACCEPTABLE.   around us: everyone else was having alcohol-based drinks with the desserts' calories.   if, after all of above, you are here for the desserts, the lemon, peanut butter and cheese cake - ALL were great.   the Strauss yogurt cake: the description is much better than the cake.  a waste of calories.   the candybar for two, which is what we shared, is a platter of 4 desserts to be shared by 2 for $25.  most desserts range between $7-9.  menu says they'll charge an extra $10 for a third person sharing.  again- GREEDY, GREEDY.    recommendation to owner:   1. don't be so greedy 2. make your waitress put on comfortable shoes.  maybe she'll be more pleasant without the pain her boots were giving her.   3. keep games in better shape, instructions to be included.

l06vY3W92fSrD6vdmnqMMQ.review_text: Some of the desserts are a little too "exotic" for my liking, but I love the Strawberry Limeade! Think strawberry lemonade shortcake. Been here a couple of times with friends and have always had great service, yummy drinks, and swoon worthy desserts!

qAgeGYO7RXc9YCbHOAE3-g.review_text: Great concept of with just being an intimate dessert place. I see you can play board games while you wait, but it is kinda too dark to really get into that. Meh, or maybe I'm just blind. Your call really. But what caught me by surprise was their desserts! Being a place that specializes in desserts, I was not impressed at all! We got the sampler, and the macaroon ice cream cakes were good, but everything else was just either too tardy or too rich/sweet. Being said that, avoid the strawberry limeade! Wow, that mousse cake is just horrible. Overall, it is okay, but I've had way better.

9fMFfFzAfQc8uPnZTbwFTw.review_text: experience has informed me that dessert at "upscale" restaurants is always good, but often forgettable. sometimes it's fun and tasty, but occasionally i realize that i probably would've been just as content with a snickers ice cream bar, green tea ice cream, or a brownie from the gas station.  perhaps that says more about my palate than the state of pastry chef creations.  but anyway, candybar's desserts are truly the real deal. we ordered four exquisite, impressive gems off the tasting menu and every single item rocked. perfect juxtapositions of flavors and textures with lots of innovation.   warm olive oil vanilla cake with pickled mango. it's not even up my alley but i loved it nonetheless. the cake was moist, soft, slightly wet, and so flavorful.   baked alaska with blood orange sorbet and candied fennel. very creative, and fun to eat.  two separate chocolate dishes -- both excellent. one of them exercised harmonious balance of salty and sweet (my favorite dichotomy in dessert), and the other was just plain awesome. couldn't get enough.  on top of the fact that the desserts at candybar are actually amazing, there are other winning factors:  1) decor. handsome, stylish, and simple. i had the pleasure of photographing it when it first opened, and it just won me over.  2) great people. the co-owner tan is a really down-to-earth, earnest, sweet guy. his heart is entirely in the restaurant.  3) convenient locale. the divis & fulton intersection just got that much cooler with this addition.  4) an ostensibly classy savory menu. haven't ordered anything from it, but intuition tells me i wouldn't be disappointed.  in general, it's about time someone opened up a dessert lounge! it makes so much sense. everyone's always wanted one. it's just a great spot to go with friends if everyone's craving something sweet. it's totally comfy and cozy, with a neat wine list too.

FSsyUrLUVeo5m__klDHtFQ.review_text: Ok so this may be going against shear numbers..but that is OK...  We had a party of six and thought try out Candy Bar for their desserts.  Located in the Richmond district of San Francisco, the establishment is actually quite a nice setup. Its gotta nice lounge type vibe to it. We put our names on the list and were told to wait 10-15 minutes. So we did. ..and waited. ..and waited.  We inquired about the seating ...but apparently there was a group of ten that had "reserved" a spot but nowhere to be found. Fair enough ..we did not have a reservation. So we waited. ..and waited....and waited.  We inquired about the seating ..but the party of ten still had not arrived. At this point the party has been at least 30 minutes late. The host had attempted to contact the party..but response. So we thought...lets wait...and waited some more....  At this point it was pure frustration. We were told that we can sit in the reserved area and order..but if the party showed up ..we'd have to move. Move where ? There were no other spots open to sit.  One thing we did not understand is you have six customers wanting to spend money ....but would rather wait for ten..and hoping they will show up?  So we walked out with disappointment without ordering and wasting an hour hoping to get seated. I can recall the host said "it'll be 10-15 minutes" when we came in...Really ??  Sorry Candy Bar. Pretty lame...could have done a better job.  Thanks, -NP

yZ3QUuIcAdtClov7VPG6_Q.review_text: I was really excited that there was finally another dessert house in SF that wasn't HK style and wasn't all the way in Castro. Candybar was warm and friendly, has a happy hour from 5-8p, and had modern plays on traditional desserts that were super delicious.   We had ordered the Blueberry Mochi with green tea ice cream, chocolate mousse, apple pie a la mode, and red velvet cake. All were equally superb and attractively presented.  I did not order champagne/beer this time but do like that I have that choice next time. Champagne cocktails are only $4 during happy hour so I'll be back!!  The only con is parking availability. This part of Divis has worse parking than Union Square. You'll have to sing your lucky parking song to make it here...

43pJfnOJ5OBJnD-ydM7RfQ.review_text: Solid dessert bar type of place.  They have sweet drinks and the desserts are pretty good as well.  The place gets crowded at times, but it doesn't get too crazy.  They have board games as well.  The drink I had was good, not very stiff, but tasty.  I tried some of the desserts and those were good as well.  Not a bad place to go.

3G9Jkn7hKc8fmbdK8_lC8g.review_text: cute little spot. i dig the idea. i dig that you can have a 5 course dessert extravaganza. i dug a couple of the desserts. they are tiny though!   i had some foie custard thing. i guess i should have looked into the "foie" a little closer cause a meaty tasting "dessert" is quite an unpleasant surprise. custard in tube form isn't all that appealing either.

ML375bqniJ0yyPl8wI9pYQ.review_text: I love Candybar. They're only open for late night from 6pm, and their Sangrias are absolutely to DIE for!  Their desserts are tasty and they're very creative and they're not even that pricey! One of the best places yet for a late night dessert craving.  YUM!

w7RP1MZad3YO7Vjgp3s3Dg.review_text: This is place is perfect for your dates with your SO. It is intimate, dim lighting, not loud at all and good lighting. Most of all, the desserts are yummy. The cocktails too are delightful. We ordered the s'mores and chocolate flour-less cake and they were both very good. just thr right amount of sweetness.  Their drinks were pretty tasty as well ( Sangria and Lychee martini) They have happy hour from 6-8 and you can bring outside food to go with our drink. The owner is really friendly, very helpful and provides excellent service. They have board games as well which is a nice plus. This is one of my favorite date places in Nopa.

IuTG1Y6KoonMGfkaYYZJkA.review_text: Very shiekh place! Great to go with a group of people to lounge and sip wine, have a beer, and great creative dessert. Being from out of town, we craved a little dessert and this place seemed to fit the description. We ordered the lemon tart with black sesame ice cream ($8), it was what was expected but the ice cream did seem a little melty! We went a little too early on a Saturday so it was a little dead but had we waited a few more hours the place would have been popping. Didn't have time to take in the entire experience, however the walls are displayed with various street art, great ambiance! Would definitely come up again with some friends.

wdlYaXuUsi9vtvkz7NpybA.review_text: The melon ice cream in one of the desserts was so delicious! I'm not much of a sweets person so my review is pretty bias. We ordered 3 diff desserts and all of them were way too sweet for me. I did not enjoy it very much, but my friends loved it. On the brightside, the fruity wine was nicely paired with the desserts.   It's a small loungey atmosphere here. They also have all sorts of games you can play with your friends. Great place for a little date, girls night out, or late night tapas hopping dessert place.

-kF4NedSmOrUE1wWudoevg.review_text: Sunday - early evening- craving a single shot of fine whiskey and a delightful lemon tart. Did a quick search and came up with -Candybar. My friend and I got here around 6ish..   First thing we noticed was the delicious smell..  The smell of sweetness was amazing and throughout the place. We were seated immediately, although within 30 minutes the place was full.  Happy hour was from 6-8, so we were able to have the Jasmine Sparkles for $4.  We ordered 2 desserts - Lemon Tart and Lavendar Honey Creme Fraiche Semi Freddo.  Both were very good--I will comment on the Creme Fraiche-  it was a bit too frozen.. had to seriously cut through it, which I shouldn't have had to..  Overall, great idea-- this place will and obviously does quite well. I will bring friends here.  :)

zh5EWaCWcdg4wFz8gDlvbw.review_text: C oncept is great -- a dessert lounge (with board games!) A tmosphere is wonderful with nice decor and music N ot impressed with the menu, though D esserts are unique, but are mostly off-the-mark Y ou should try the Candybar Dessert for Two sampler B rings you four desserts of your choice A void the Panna Cotta -- has a bit overwhelming sour taste R ecommend the Japanese Cheesecake -- very fun to eat

YFG_qsnCwHTxgPAYYW-YQQ.review_text: Very cool concept.  Went with some friends and each ordered a dessert tasting.  Really liked the baked alaska, the chocolate mousse with toffee, and the chevre cheesecake (surprisingly mild). The real superstar was the warm milk at the end-- they need to make that one of the offerings. We also got the cheese plate-- the cheeses were ok, but  were too similar in flavor and texture.  My other suggestion is to dim the lighting -- some of the florescent light from the kitchen was seeping into the restaurant.  Overall I think this is a really cool idea and clearly a labor of love--  I'll be excited to try it again in a couple of months after the kinks get worked out.

s55E-iE2AmQjUlmV2OwipQ.review_text: I'd like to preface this review by stating that I loved Candybar even before I stepped foot in the place. How could you not love a bar that specializes in DESSERT, WINE and ART? Best of all, it's located in NoPa, two blocks away from my old house!  My aunt, sister and I headed to Candybar after Orson. (Yes, we are a family of piglets and indulged in several desserts that night). Candybar is a small, minimalist lounge with polished concrete floors, creamy white walls, pendant lighting fixtures and red velvet banquettes. The walls are covered in abstract paintings from a local artist and employee of Candybar, Nicholas Park. I thought his work was pretty cool. I posted some photos of Candybar and one of his paintings in my "Local Photos" section.   Two things to know before you go are:   1. Candybar is small and not the place to congregate if you're with a large group of people.  2. Reservations are a must. It gets packed in there!  Candybar has a great selection of savory and sweet desserts and each dessert is paired with fruit or chocolate. For example, you have the option of ordering a savory dessert with fruit (pork belly apple celery salad with peach sorbet), or a savory dessert with chocolate (organic poached egg chorizo with chocolate bread crumbs).    We decided to order sweet desserts since we already had dinner at Orson. I ordered the most popular dessert, the vanilla brioche with spiced cherries and feta ice cream. My sister ordered the peach creamsicle with caramel popcorn and my aunt ordered the corn and blueberry fritter breton with blueberry sorbet. The vanilla brioche was phenomenal (although I didn't really care for the feta ice cream and spiced cherries); it reminded me of my Mom's tres leches cake with a caramelized sugar crust. The blueberry fritter breton was good, but came with a side of grapefruit that was super random and didn't mesh with the dessert at all. The peach creamsicle with caramel popcorn was even better than the vanilla brioche. The caramel corn was rich and buttery, the whipped cream was slightly sweet and airy, and the peaches were perfectly ripe and sweet. It is a nice play on textures. We also ordered three raspberry Bellinis that were excellent too.  The service was spectacular (our waiter was very attentive) and the owner spent 30 minutes at our table chatting with us. He absolutely adored my aunt. Just when we were about to explode from excessive food consumption, the owner brought us another dessert compliments of Candybar. He said he was very impressed with my aunt and why not celebrate her birthday with another dessert?! 5 desserts in one evening? You've got to be kidding me!!! He brought us the chocolate cannelloni chocolate olive creameux with vanilla bean ice cream, which is as equally divine as the peach creamsicle.   I love the concept and appreciate what the owners are trying to do. Candybar just needs to throw a dj in the mix and I'd be in heaven!!! DESSERT + WINE + ART + MUSIC = HEAVEN!  5 stars baby!

DYwL0jGTHTaLmj3PCt-a7w.review_text: parking is horrible, bad service (had to wait over 5 min to take my order), we ordered desert for two there was 4 of us, the desert was meant for the ladies, when it arrived the deserts looked really good so I wanted to try the some, when I asked for an additional spoon, the waiter wanted to charge me $10 for extra spoon... Really?! desert was soso, but over priced.

U6KBNi5oTnOetfiFsKi2RA.review_text: I have to agree w/the majority of reviews here... nice idea but it's not there yet: 1) Poor waitstaff...the awkwardly came around and seemed to keep wanting to take the plates away, also didn't seem to be fluent w/the menu offerings 2) Overpriced...especially for the... 3) PORTIONS.... are you kidding??? that's the smallest dessert i've ever seen!! and the dessert wine to pair w/the dessert... those are some TINY pours. I understand you're not supposed to have a lot of it but come on! 4) What's with only giving one pre and post dessert drink for 2 people?? This refers to the "1st and 4th" course ... wow can you really call those courses?   btw that curry cookie was noooo bueno... as much as i like wild flavors and combinations, peanut butter and curry is awful in cookie form.  HOWEVER, I suppose if you ordered the tasting for YOURSELF...then yes the portions and price aren't 't so bad. and for what it is, the milk chocolate parfait one was tasty ... the combination of milky fluffy creme and soft chocolate parfait, toffee, and sea salt was great... so i would like to come back and try the more exotic "courses"  ... and this time not pair it w/an $11 shot of vin santo.

IdnbvI-jYalwwSdLldiw0w.review_text: Came here for a friend's birthday on a Friday night at 9 and it was still pretty empty - we'd made reservations though, which I recommend because it can get crowded later on in the night and we were expecting a party of 10. For earlier dessert/drinks and smaller parties, I think just showing up would be fine.  We got the corner booth right in front of the window, so it felt nice and private and we had a clear view of the apartment across the street playing that new Kinect dance game - we must've turned around and watched and laughed on at least 3 separate occasions. But I digress...  For drinks, I had the jasmine sparkle and the strawberry kiss - definitely like the first one better. The strawberry was a little too sweet, and so the jasmine helped balance out all the already sweet desserts we were having too. I tried the 50/50 too, and it really does taste like an orange creamsicle! We also got a round of soju shots - I had the watermelon basil, which was interesting. Can't quite decide if I liked it or not. You could definitely taste the watermelon, and the basil added an almost spicy kick to it.  For dessert, we all shared the apple pie a la mode, carrot cake, peanut butter jelly time, chocolate financier cake, and Japanese cheesecake. I enjoyed all of them, and both the carrot cake and the cheesecake came with an ice cream/gelato on the side too. The PBJ really tasted like a PB&J sandwich! I think the apple pie was my favorite - I had the lowest expectations for it, but it was so warm and comforting yet still cool and sweet.  I would definitely love to come back again to try more desserts and drinks and play some board games, either with a group of friends or for a chill date :)

1Dv3d9FamgS7xOfcDlXQ6Q.review_text: I saw a groupon for this place and since I was in town, thought I'd go.   I enjoyed their chocolate mousse with passion fruit. The sweet/tangy combination just works!   We also got their tiramisu. I wasn't so thrilled for this one. My image of tiramisu is that the cake is soaked in coffee. But the cake was quite dry. I don't even think there was any liquid on the cake part. The filling was good though.   Parking is hard, so come prepared to circle around the block a few times. Nice atmosphere and ambiance.

mb2ZCVoglkfitoBGR1lk2w.review_text: Candybar hasn't gotten much better in the year or so it's been since I last  came.  Menu is too short, seating is too uncomfortable, and there just doesn't seem to be enough here to bring me back.    It seems like this place should be the answer to a desire for wine and chocolate, which is exactly what my friend and I were in the mood for last week.  But we get there are there are only 5 desserts offered, only one of which has any chocolate in it.  3 are fruity somethings which I don't prefer.  There's no like basic chocolate plate or something.  And then the wine list is all of 5 deep for reds.  5 red wines!  The shiraz I got wasn't very good.    I dunno.  It just feels like this place isn't doing enough to really satisfy it's own identity.  Grow the menu, pad the seats, lower the lights and I would love to make this a weekly spot.

EOz7Ulrelv1PT670-iMOvg.review_text: Went for happy hour on a Thursday night.  The cocktails were nice and sweet.  Ordered the strawberry kiss, which actually had a strawberry inside the glass!  The desserts were amazing.  We ordered a sampler:  strawberry limeade, lavender honey creme fraiche, tiramisu, and flourless chocolate cake.  The presentation was so beautiful.  My favorite was the tiramisu, with the right amount of everything.

yK8lb7eBwKI56hvyVmDUKA.review_text: butterfinger ice cream + Ice wine + good conversation... I'm a little biased, sure... but really... its such a cute spot to take a date, or small group of friends. Or come alone. And hang out at the bar... almost all the regulars (myself included, now) are generally nice, welcoming folk. larger groups too, but call ahead to make sure you get a seat. I've had my eyes opened to all sorts of new and exciting wines/desserts here... who knew beets and mint and chocolate were good together? or that you could make an almost cake in the microwave be soooo good?  the desserts are wee, but rich enough, and original enough to make up for it.  I wont lie, its not usually a cheap evening, but.. again... worth it! so grab candy land (come on.. who DOESN'T want to try it again) and sit for a glass (or 5) of wine and have a great evening.

trsr1OL-Cn3ZYjTNYIxfKQ.review_text: Don't get me wrong: I LOVE the concept of the place.  Dessert lounge?  Sounds fancy and hip, but unfortunately it failed to deliver.  To start, the decor of the place is cool and modern; what you'd expect when you think lounge and San Francisco.  The vibe and ambiance of the place is very cool.  Unfortunately, if you're going to be chilling in a dessert lounge, chances are that you're not coming at 7 pm.  We made our reservation at 10 pm, but were bummed to find out they were already out of likely their most popular dish that night.  (And if you haven't heard a billion times, parking is a bitch, so you would think coming later would help, but ...)  While the dessert menu isn't what you call extensive, the remaining interesting desserts were mainly chocolate dishes.  Our party enjoyed our dishes, but found the cayenne chocolate mousse too strong and overpowering.  The wine menu was good and the service was excellent and friendly.    So, Candybar is a solid 3.5 stars.  While we loved the concept, decor, and service of the place, our evening found us with a dessert menu that was "one note" and failing to impress.  But hooray for this place and maybe we just came on a "off" night...

9zXbVNk1DwPPUZ4FHm46Yw.review_text: My bf had been wanting to come here every time I go to SF because he bought some coupon but parking sucks here! We were lucky to find a spot a couple of weekends ago though :)  The wait was extremely short...actually, I don't even think we even waited? (On a Saturday night too!) Got a table instantly. The atmosphere is super cozy and although the tables are really close to each other...I didn't mind it.   Game boards for you to play. My clumsy hands accidentally made a game fall on someone LOL. So if you're that person, I'm VERY sorry!!   I ordered the blueberry pomegranate champagne and tiramisu while he ordered some pb&j dessert and...some drink I don't remember as well hahaha. I'm horrible at this. My drink was deeeeelicious. The tiramisu wasn't the best I had...I actually wish I could taste the rum, although I don't know if there was any inside (I'm not an alcoholic). So if there was....I hope they would add more next time so I can actually taste it!  Staff was very nice...although they accidentally gave us two bills.   Overall, great place to hang out, but the dessert didn't wow me :)

zpT7HWE3o77YVfG4S07H9A.review_text: Been very stressed lately so I turned to YELP for a stress reliever. Came across Candybar, scanned through the menu and decided to check it out with a girlfriend.   The lounge is extremely cute and romantic! Nicely dimmed with candles and portrait decorated walls, the place completes the reputation its name hold.   Between us two girls, we shared the Apple a la Mode (my favorite), the Sweet Tart for my Sweetheart and Japanese cheesecake. Each plate was beautifully presented and tasted just as great as it looked.  The only bad thing about the place is the bathroom. There are no light besides candles. It was so dark in there, I had a hard time finding my way in there.   Parking was a pain in the butt too.

-w0EI4v_364f8tiisaarWA.review_text: One of the few dessert places I know that also serves adult bevs. A nice little place that features art and offers board games to enjoy with your date or group of friends.  It can be very romantic for couples, dim lighting, music, dessert and champagne. For friends night out, everyone should get something different that way everyone can try more from the menu. The latest dessert I tried was the "Drunken S'More," which consisted of gram cracker base, topped with toasted marshmallow covered with chocolate. Delicious! My friends had the "Ice Cream Sundae," which was 3 brownie things as the base, 3 scoops of mint chocolate chip topped with pistachio macaroons, strawberry slices and banana covered with toasted sugar (I'm not sure if there's a real culinary term for that) sides. Also very delicious and fairly light. I had the Strawberry Kiss cocktail and my friends had the Mango Bellini and this coke with wine drank (don't know the name).  Definitely stop by and enjoy.

Njr-4deTIXPvXfKHaXn_0A.review_text: I had bookmarked CandyBar way back when they first opened, and I finally found the perfect excuse to visit!  I came by here w/ my bf this past week to kick back and nibble on some sweet treats in CandyBar's sleek lookin' space on a drizzly Friday night. We ended up sharing Cheesecake w/ blackberries & Mango Sorbet as well as the Nacho Sundae, which included little cubes of mango, kiwi, papaya, and a hint of cilantro (the salsa) along w/ Horchata Ice Cream and a couple caramelized banana slices. I have to be honest, I wasn't too impressed w/ the desserts- they were good, but mega small portion-wise and unfortunately didn't have us raving about them post-dessert.  What I DID love about Candybar though, was its divine cocktail concoctions. I highly recommend their Blood Orange Bellini (sparkling wine, lavendar syrup, blood orange sorbet) and 50/50 (Soju, orange soda, vanilla). The bellini had such a wonderful blend of ingredients and the 50/50 tasted just like a Creamsicle on the rocks. Yum!  I was tickled by the selection of board games they had out- Connect 4, Chutes & Ladders, Candyland (how fitting) and a few others I had never heard of. What a great place to relax and have a little fun! I highly recommend this place as a date spot!  The waitstaff was friendly and the atmosphere was just what we were looking for- a place where you could easily chat w/out shredding your vocal cords, a place that had a few cool pieces of art, and a cozy place to chill out at.  I'll be back for cocktails, especially since my faves are on their Happy Hour menu! (6-9 pm. I believe Tues-Fri, but I'd double check)

S28i68otcPSSuPTNRJtuhQ.review_text: dear candybar,   we could have had a great time together.  we seemed to understand each other -- i love chocolate and alcohol, and you happen to serve both.  but it seems you've suffered a fate that i too have had befallen on me many a time.  and that is being in the wrong place at the wrong time.  but there are other reasons why it just won't work out between the two of us.   candybar, you are a plush wine/"art"/chocolate bar in a pizza/laundromat/"da projects" part of town.  why did you move to such a place?  was the lease cheap?  had you just broken up with your boyfriend that lived in the marina and when it came time to move you didn't want to stay in the marina and nob hill wasn't far enough either?  i beg of you, explain why you moved to nopa.  you fit in like a square peg.  also, what up with your champagne selection?  there are 4 choices, two of which aren't available by the glass and are $83 and $124 per bottle.  and no veuve cliquot?  even my 83 year old grandma knows, every place that a date may take place at, should serve veuve.  chicks love it more than mani/pedi's with their gay BF after brunch on sundays.  things are a little awkward too.  the soft benches up against the walls are nice, but the folks relegated to the piano benches/ottomans have to sit in some pretty precarious positions.  its tough to talk to the people across the table from you, and i've had to make a point of not wearing a dress/skirt because of the fear that i'll be the last to arrive and have to seat myself on a low, plush cube meant for feet.  in closing, you had a good idea, but neither the location nor the scene nor your unique desserts seem to be what you had strived for.  i hope we can stay friends, but i think we should see other bars/patrons.  best of luck to you, -kat s.  p.s.  i do like what you did with the bathroom.  no flourescent lights, only candles = sexy.

bnPpoAsVbULVN8EsUYGGCA.review_text: Tuesday was a different kind of high.  I came straight here from Creations Dessert because I had a Groupon and was in the area. Whatever, I can run around the hills afterwards to burn calories.  For a warm, Tuesday night, it was pretty empty at around 8. The inside is dark but a nice, cozy and romantic place, like the perfect place for a second date. It really lives up to it's name--sugar crackland. Everything in its menu is made up with some sort of fruit-berry--everything. You will not find mojitos or pina coladas on their drink menu, but try some orange soda with vanilla and soju or some fruity drink with sparkling wine. I got the Cherry Blossom Martini, which was okay, nothing to be excited over, a little bitter if anything. I also got the Ice Cream Sandwich, which isn't one, but 3 macarons with honeydew ice cream, The macarons were supposed to have almonds but I didn't see the slightest piece of almond in them.   The honeydew ice cream, however, was delish and was a nice treat. It looked very foamy, which was not appealing but it had a fresh honeydew aroma and it was sweet but in a delightful way. It was my first time having ice cream in macarons so I was not used to having to bite off macarons and ice cream at the same time. Not sure if the chocolate was necessary but if you're going to get this, prepare to get your hands dirty because it is a dish that requires one to get down and dirty. I had chocolate all over my hands as if my mom were feeding me fudge pudding in a baby eating chair--yeah, that kind of filthy.  Kevin was nice the whole way through and normally people frown at your vouchers but he was indifferent and checked on us occasionally. It is a little pricey and I'm glad I got a Groupon but a very nice, relaxing experience for socializing.

ZCYeKmyTZmW5zBVUS0cXWw.review_text: So imagine this, you're sitting at home on a relaxing evening, perhaps you just got home from work or a long day of studying in the law school library, and you feel like going out to a casual, relaxing place with a friend or special someone-- Candybar, nestled in Western Addition/NOPA neighborhood, is your place.   It's perfect because the little lounge can be a dressed up date night, or simply a place for an evening out with friends playing Battleship or Apples-to-Apples. The drinks and desserts are light and sweet, and perfect if you want a little something, but nothing too heavy. I've been to Candybar several times with friends, and went there on a girls' day with my mom and sister. I absolutely love the Mango Tango Bellini. They actually give you a lovely scoop of mango sorbet in the sparking wine. It's amazing! For dessert, I've tasted Apple la Mode, Strawberry Limeade, and the Lavender Honey Creme Fraiche Semi Freddo. Candybar does an excellent job of mixing unique flavors like fresh cantaloupe, Nutella powder, gingerbread ice cream, and lots of other tasty tidbits for the modern palette.   However, there is a reason they only achieved 4 stars. They close at 10 Tuesday through Thursday, and are not open Mondays-- so plan accordingly. Also, they have a special where you can choose any four desserts except ones with an asterisk for $25, however be aware of this misleading bargain-- these 4 desserts are like little samples of the regular ones. Furthermore, one of the waitresses took our plate before we were even able to finish the dessert. When the desserts are this delicate, delicious, and expensive, taking a patron's plate prematurely comes across as disrespectful and impolite in every way. Hopefully this was just a slip-up on her part.   Nevertheless, what a special little dessert lounge. One that is sure to be an enjoyable and tasty experience.

E0hnzH2Kx50pYjIOhMxfuA.review_text: My friend wanted to come here and give it a try with his girlfriend so off we went.   We ordered  Big Francesco's Tiramisu - Coffee Chiffon / Chocolate and Rum Mascarpone Cream /Coffee Bits / Chocolate...$10  Ice Cream Sundae - Macaron / Brulee'd Bananas / Brownie / Vanilla Anglaise / Strawberries / Strawberry Sherbert (Gluten Free)...$10  Smore's??? - Toasted Marshmallow/ Salted Caramel Chocolate Sauce / Chocolate Cake   Also ordered drinks: Candybar Lemon Drop Shot $5, Blueberry Bellini??? and Lychee Guava Martini. Sorry, I can't recall the exact names, by this point of the night I forgot a few things and didn't take any pictures of the menu.  I can safely say that I have had better desserts else where.
