I found all of the desserts to be very standard and lacked anything interesting. Execution, for the most part, was fine and presented well.   Drinks were on the sweeter side, no surprise, but were good. I would recommend the lemon drop shot.   The host was nice and their timing for seating was pretty accurate. I called to ask when our table was ready and as soon as we showed up we were seated before those who were there after us. I am glad to see they hold their tables and are fair.  Overall Thoughts  Candybar did not satisfy my sweet tooth but maybe you will have better luck

bSbNCLR3t7NR27l4tIkSgA.review_text: I came here last night for the first time, and can't believe I've never been here before.  Considering that two of my favorite things in the world are sparkling wine and red velvet cake, last night was a very serious moment of joy.  I had a few glasses of bubbly, which were fantastic.  I also tried the red velvet cake with cream cheese coconut frosting-- so good!  The mint gelato served with the cake was super refreshing and light, and was a nice compliment to the sweetness of the cake.  The owner, Chris, was so friendly and generous.  I can't wait to go back with some friends and snag a table, a board game and a bottle of bubbly.

Q_yIbRXuE4AHxRr4Fnd_Vw.review_text: Super cute n happy hr rocks my socks!  Found this quaint spot while I was venturing food joints in the city one day.  Love the cute artwork and available boardgames and such that you can entertain your group of friends with while sipping on cocktails and delectable deserts.   Verdict: Doesn't get much better.

NsjSlioYH8sXPVEyCl297Q.review_text: I love this place! Second time here and it was even better than the first!  My boo and I had two desserts: strawberry lemonade and the peanut butter and jelly ones (sorry, I can't remember the names as I was getting tipsy on champagne). The desserts were phenomenal!   My only suggestions are: Bring water to the table automatically (It took awhile to flag someone down to get water!).  Also, after you bring dishes, check back in with your guests a few moments later...they might really need water and don't want to be left hanging while you're sitting up at the bar!

UQFE3BT1rsIYrcDvu_XVow.review_text: Amazing place for a date (just get there early if you don't reserve a table in advance).  love the old-school board games and the new school ones (Marry, Date or Dump is a great way to find out who your significant other has a crush on...even if it's hauntingly disturbing)  Every bubbly cocktail is good and the desserts are crazy delicious for items made from scratch.  the ice cream sandwiches were off the hook. so was that lavender cake thing.  I mean seriously...  champagne cocktails, desserts, a dark little booth with a candle and sinking your date's Battleship....  How can you go wrong?

upmvpx1-gu8q7l9XpWdY5g.review_text: Got there stupid early, early bird special style, had to walk around for 15 minutes before they even opened, dag, where's my groupon?   Naturally we had already finished dinner by 5:15. It was time to get our cocktail and dessert pants on.   We have special pants for this type of finery.  The cocktails were the soju-style that the best of SF new cuisine places are relegated to. For those, however, they were lovingly crafted. Since it was only us two, and the two workers, a waiter/chef and the bartender, we chatted about the giants and drank his deliciousness.  The desserts that came out were pretty hard core. As environmentalists, we finished the entire things, but they were quite sizable for the gourmet style quality.   Jessica got a "Strawberry Limeade," a cake and cream parfait thing served charmingly in a glass jar with a lid. It was super rich, super lime, super cream - clearly the lid on the jar was to prevent it from flying around the room and attacking the Salami and Cheese plate, the clear Lex Luthor on the menu.   I got a Tiramisu. Not since I'm boring, and not since I'm unadventurous, but I love seeing what super high quality dessert chefs do with the one dessert item that can class up an indie pizza joint like Rat Snark Slices. Yeah, look THAT up on yelp.  The Tiramisu was really good. Super creamy, at the top end of sweet without going over the edge, it was like a beautiful sugary trip to the grand canyon of vistas, sweet coffee/chocolate flavors, and mixed metaphors. It had this coffee crumble dusted and clumped attractively around it, that was ... savory? salty? It set off the creamy, intricate sweetness of the tiramisu in a way that I can't describe - even inaptly - yet can still taste the next day, sitting here in my office.   If they could steal a dozen bottles of top shelf 80 proof stuff, then this would be the 5 star dessert destination in the entire city.

OGYkBU5yil7uyLleDv2MNw.review_text: What a great little spot!!! Desserts, Drinks & Board games!!! We enjoyed the drunken s'mores & ice cream sandwich & a blueberry pomegranate drink....Everything was YUMMERS!!! We had a great time & we must go back!!!

4jPsIgMZT4_Ks5-myaW9Bg.review_text: Candybar is where your childhood sweet tooth meets your adult alcoholism.  Initially I was hesitant because of the too-clever-to-be-true name and soaring popularity, but they got the better of my inner child and my outer adult.  Parking is difficult (as expected) and the wait takes quite awhile (as expected).    The ambiance is fun and bubbly, girly but not overdone.  The couch, low coffee table, and Connect 4 felt like an incredibly fancy living room.  Bring the desserts and drinks, and I'm like a little kid at a playdate, with a wholly adult facade.  Drinks are very pricey (~$10 for a small cocktail in a champagne glass) and tasty but not spectacular.  The champagne based ones are mostly high-end mimosas made with fancier juices.    Desserts are not top-notch designer status, but they are pretty good.  Essentially, they are artsy renditions of your fond childhood favorites, playing along with the identity crisis theme.  Portions are surprisingly generous; I'd recommend sharing one dessert among ~3 people, unless you are ravenously and drunkenly starving.    (+++) Apple Ala Mode (hazelnut crust, cream cheese filling, caramel, gingerbread ice cream), $9: I'm not a huge fan of apple pie, but I got this because all the other ingredients sounded delicious.  The crust is good enough to be a dessert in itself, and the gingerbread ice cream could easily have found itself into a cone at Bi-rite.  Despite the cream cheese and caramel, it wasn't all too horrifyingly sweet or creamy.  (++) Big Francesco's Tiramisu (coffee chiffon, chocolate and rum mascarpone cream, coffee bits, chocolate), $10: Being one of those snobs who makes tiramisu myself, of course I brag that this isn't as good as my own secret recipe.  Seriously though, it's good but could definitely use more rum and was a bit too dense.  The piece is one ginormous slab though, and will surely satisfy any tiramisu cravings.  (+) Peanut Butter Jelly Time! (chocolate tart, peanut butter cream, salted candied peanuts, blackberries), $9: Yes, exclamation point necessary!  I've never quite seen such a nice-looking dessert based on the quintessential brown bag lunch.  It's ingenious in concept and blows up your expectations; in reality, peanut butter and jelly can only go so far.  While it was tasty, it was in the inferior league of desserts and wasn't extremely memorable.   Service was not as attentive at times, but it was good.  Brownie points for the good-looking servers.

uV8kG4yg7RPlrH56qzDoVw.review_text: This chic little place is about a block away from Little Star Pizza so after our delicious meal we walked over here to continue the celebration for my friend's birthday.   It's a cozy little place, probably couldn't seat more than 50 people. But I like it because it's nice to chill. The atmosphere was laid-back and unpretentious. The walls are decorated with different art pieces and there's also a wall with a black board on it with one of the employee's painting. Pretty neat.  We didn't get much to drink but we did order some desserts. The pear one with the popcorn ice cream was delicious. The other one was a chocolate ganache and it's a must try for any chocolate lover.  Also, there are board games and card games on a shelf! A big plus if you have a group of friends who just wanna chill.  I'm a fan for sure. :)

NTqyRdMnM2LUqfzVxywQKg.review_text: Love this place! Perfect for a date or catch up dinner with a friend. The art on the wall paired with the music (which wasn't super loud that you had to have a screaming conversation, perfect volume! :) ) gave a cool ambiance to this dessert bar. I had the jasmine sparkle with the japanese cheesecake and I don't regret it for one second! So delicious! The only drawback to the place is that parking was stressful, but that's the city for you... Definitely going to come back next time I'm in town :)

EiwxlbR8fb68lMgEXhcWKA.review_text: I thought this place was kinda cool but the desserts are definitely pricey so it's not really my kind of place since I'm not really a huge fan of desserts to begin with. I came here on the recommendation of some friends who just thought it was a fun place to hang out. I will admit, the atmosphere and board games definitely give this place a cool hang out edge.  We were seated right away in the sort of "back" area and as we were ordering, the front of the room broke into this random mob dance thing. The whole room in the front were filled with people simultaneously dancing to many different songs that were coming out of who knows where.  It was fun, funny, cool? The desserts were, as usual, way too sweet and the drinks were just ok.

NnL6HUNY9ckb9mSbTGkjOg.review_text: Still haven't completely made up my mind about this place.  I've been here three times now. First two times, I wasn't impressed with their dessert menu. Also, the desserts, though beautifully plated, were small and disappointing.  I had a completely different experience the other night, though. I was tempted by everything on their menu. Finally settled on the Japanese cheesecake and ice cream sandwich. Ice cream sandwich was amaaazing! Loved the green tea macaron.  Great cocktails too. My favorites- strawberry kiss, mango tango bellini  If the desserts stay as delicious as they were the other night, I will definitely be coming back here. A lot. Perfect place to end a date or catch up with friends.

SrSr-KYsO2_QxxQlTYQVig.review_text: This place is great!  I am really diggin' all the cool art up on the walls.  the vibe here is really chill, there is music but it's not overpowering the ambiance.  I would say it was a 25+ atmosphere, which i really liked.    Now to rate what we sampled: Japanese cheesecake - graham cracker streusel, honeydew (dipped in vodka) and homemade guave sorbet.  This was absolutely delicious!  i esp enjoyed the guava sorbet!  Ice Cream Sandwich - green tea french macaron with blueberries, cocoa nibs, and some brown rice tea ice cream... VERY GOOD!  My friends devoured this.  I also liked this place a lot because we walked in around 10:30pm on a saturday night and we got seated in a prime location... immediately.  Given our group was small (6 gals with a blow up "toy"  no less), they treated us very well.

YVb4ACwqBBFXTjLkNVQalg.review_text: Pretty cool concept, why couldn't there be more in the city?!? Sometimes after dinner, you just need a sweet somethin somethin and this fits the bill! There are plenty of asian snack/dessert places but this is something different.  Most everything we had was yummo and really nice presentation! Their portions are good enuff for sharing and they have a tasting menu for those who want to try it all!!  My favorite was the ice cream sandwich. For some reason I thought the ice cream would be vanilla but it was chocolate. I think vanilla would be a better choice though to balance the nice fudginess of the chocolate macaroons. One of the best macaroons I've had, but prolly not a true macaroon since it was crispy on the outside but brownie-like on the inside. Blueberries on the side were a nice touch!  Tiramisu was also good, light overall, and good coffee taste. On the side were some chocolate crumble infused with coffee crumbs.  The PBJ tart was a delight. It really tasted like a pbj sandwich. The random pieces of salted peanuts were a nice surprise!   Carrot was also nice, pretty moist and light. The frosting was not overwhelming at all, like some places do it.  I'm not the biggest fan of apple desserts, I always feel like they're too sweet. But the apple a la mode was not! I liked how the apple slices were thin and not all mushy and soaked in sauce. And it came with yummy ice cream!   Parking's tough in the area, and there seems to be quite a wait. Ambience is nice, they have board games which makes it feel like a nice night in, only that you're out. Wish they had a liquor license though, it was only wines, beers and wine cocktails.

33OzyvMjDhGTUJubr4CWIA.review_text: Brilliant name for a dessert lounge....Candybar!  How I am in love with this place. I love their Apple a la Mode which taste like apple pie. I am a pie girl and I love apple pie. I love their chic and hip design. I like their concept of dessert, alcohol, and board games. What a nice way to spend time with your date and friends. It is one of those type of places you MUST check out at least once in your life time, but as for me I will come here often!  Before planing a trip here, please come here early to find parking space because it is near residential area and nearly impossible to find parking.

r4m3F6H2AFC6f3Vtb1xzLg.review_text: dessert + wine = love  with only 4 weeks under its belt, there's still room for improvement. it may be easy to miss because the name on the glass door is not very visible. a great hang out for groups of all sizes.

XbxaaX2uwi84gcVoXSnPKA.review_text: Burning out on 821 (great bar but  I don't want to kill it for byoverdoing it---that happened with me and Taco Bell and it sucked), we've been heading over to Candy Bar every now and then. At first I felt bad for this little bar that couldn't (or so I thought) since it was mostly empty when we passed by. However it seems to be picking up steam and  I have seen more and more people here.   Why I like it:  You don't have to wait at the bar to get a drink here. They bring it to you. The Happy Hour deals are good with $2 Pacifico and $5 sparkling cocktails (get the raspberry one). 821's sparkling cocktails are $3 during HH, but here you get way more alcohol since the flutes are bigger and filled to the brim and Happy Hour is a couple hours longer.  I had the Pumpkin Seed Cake and it was great. I highly recommend. The bathroom here is awesome. The atmosphere is awesome. It's dead on some nights but a perfect place to go if you want to hang out with friends or catch up.

mnPxnubI04bNQPg1NUrRBA.review_text: This hip dessert bar has a super cute concept which draws in the 20-30 something crowd. This is great since we don't have too many of these in the area, but bad because there is an average of at least 1 hour wait. Its location is both a blessing and a curse as there are other cool bars and restaurants in the vicinity which you can hit up while you wait for a table here but parking is extremely ridiculous.  Passion Fruit Delight: Light, bubbly, and delicious but nothing I had to wait an hour in line for or couldn't buy at BevMo or Safeway. Looking at the menu again, guess I should've seen it was just passionfruit syrup they added. Well, I would've seen it if it weren't so dark up in there!  50/50: This one was much more creative and tasted exactly like an orange creamsicle! Creamy and frothy with the soju smoothly creeping in... oh so dangerous if you were to have more than just one! This got me swaying to the R. Kelly track that was bumping in the restaurant... oh heeeey!  Chocolate Espresso Pudding: this one spoke out to me because of the red velvet cake and maple bacon pecan crunch. I LOVE bacon and it sounded totally adventurous but I really hated how the espresso pudding killed all other flavors in this. It was so overpowering, I didn't taste any maple, bacon or pecan. I found myself trying to scoop up more cake with the pudding to balance out the extreme bitterness but there wasn't enough cake. Total disappointment.  Big Francesco's Tiramisu: while the espresso pudding had too much bitterness, this tiramisu lacked any. It was sweet like milk chocolate and had no remnants of the bitter coffee that was supposedly in it.   I really hope my 2nd visit will allow me to add back a star or two!

T4rJAU9B8xPc5_1Y8IALIQ.review_text: If the service here was better they would have four stars.  The desserts were better than decent.  I had the PB&J Time and I loved it.  My friend got the Tiramisu and it was OK.  But the female server there just sours the whole experience.  Don't you just hate it when you go out to dinner, drinks, whatever and your server just seems like they hate their job and they hate you for being a customer.  It is such a shame because someone may have put their entire livelihood into this establishment and then they make the mistake of hiring miserable people and it just ruins the experience.   Keep the food, keep the fun atmosphere, get rid of the sour puss.

xkV_dLl9_26mlOrbDIDl5A.review_text: OK, just an fyi, my buddies are the owners of Candybar.  I never wrote a review for Candybar because I thought the desserts were just average or maybe it just wasn't for my cup of tea.  I would've given them at most 3 stars and they would've kicked my butt.  so here I am finally giving them an honest review.  now, with their new menu I will stand behind my 5 stars because it really is THAT good.  the desserts are more familiar and more suitable to my taste.  here's what we ordered:  1.  Banana Bread Pudding  with toasted almonds, Bailey's creme anglaise and vanilla ice cream  2.  Chocolate Mousse with mango sauce and Oh Henry! malt ice cream  3.  Orange and Coffee Bavois with espresso gelee and bruleed persimmon  I have to say I cannot pronouce some of the words above but I can pronounce DELICIOUS!  kudos to the chef Cat for the new menu and for dessert I'll actually eat and enjoy!

QCgf-Pkrq74ydSvD1tg1Nw.review_text: Not blown away by this place. Cool hip Asian atmosphere, but the desserts were just alright. Presentation was beautiful, but the red velvet cake was way too rich. The tiramisu tasted good and light- wasn't overly sweet. Had to wait awhile on Sat night to get a seat, but they do offer a variety of board games which is nice. I got the blood orange cocktail which was so-so, nothing spectacular. Which is how I would sum up this place.

JmhzuC87dCbZiMez2bKKfw.review_text: Wow, I can't believe this place got such good reviews.  Yeah, it's super cute, the waitstaff is pretty nice, it's romantic.  BUT...the food is not good.  The a la carte desserts are blah, to say the most and the accompanying little drinks that come with the sampler are way too sweet.  The cheese plate was also pretty bad.  The whole point of getting a plate is to sample cheeses that have different tastes and textures.  We got a plate with 3 semi-soft white cheeses that pretty much all tasted the same.    And this place is pricey.

8WmrEtUcSvZ4vntAE92xaQ.review_text: The desserts are great.  People playing uno until all hours hogging up the seats a little too long though.

GLcRir0Dl0zXQai1vJh7Xg.review_text: Went there for a friend's birthday and has gone back once since, definitely more in the future.  The concept reminds me of an Asian dessert place: drinks (cocktails instead of bubble tea), desserts, complete with board games and coffee table books, great for hanging out. I love the atmosphere, but maybe not all the artworks on the walls tho.  As for the dessert, the presentation is always great but I enjoyed some more than others:  The passion fruit chocolate mousse was rich, not super chocolatey, which overall worked well. I would have loved a little more passion fruit curd.  Chocolate raspberry brownie is tasty altho seems a bit standard and small for the price. Same goes to the flourless chocolate cake and I wasn't keen on the banana yogurt (personal preference).  I normally love macaron but the green tea shells for the ice cream sandwich was a bit too sweet. The rice tea ice cream offered a bit balance to the sweetness.  The panna cotta is my favourite: first of all, great portion, generously topped with quartered bing cherries. The flavour is just right, creamy and balanced. I wish I didn't have to ration the balsamic cherry reduction.  Even tho I hardly drink, the cocktails are all delicious (based what I tasted from friends' order) and the happy hour is a great deal.  Service was great. With reservation, a large group of us were seated promptly. Small group had to wait so I'd advice going a bit early to get a table and take advantage of the happy hour.

SSD26yoDiBSSITalN3In7g.review_text: I went to CandyBar on a Tuesday for happy hour, which is from 6 - 8 pm Tuesdays and Thursdays.  We sat at the lounge area, as opposed to the tables in front of the bar, and ordered.  The crowd was chill and just about all female.  I'd say the ratio was 1 guy for every 10 women.    A handful of the sparkline wine (you can't call it champagne, right) cocktails were happy hour price ($4).  The Blood Orange cocktail tasted like regular champagne, and the Strawberry Kiss was pink and fruity.    The dessert at CandyBar was so good!  The Apple a la Mode was delicious. The hazelnut crust, cream cheese, and gingerbread ice cream were so good that if the apples weren't there, I wouldn't have missed them.    The Kung Fu Taco Truck did not arrive, as advertised, during happy hour.  Well, we left at 7 pm, so maybe it came by after we already jetted to the next place in search of a full bar.

ygh1FAM5zmfWFeKsV6wJRg.review_text: When you walk in, you are instantly greeted with an amazing smell akin to someone slaving all day in the kitchen to produce baked goods as rich as a thousand mermaids massaging your taste buds.  Ok, the imagery was a little much, but damn, this bar is hands down the best smelling bar ever.  I had the blood orange bellini and the chocolate brownie with walnuts and thyme ice cream.  The orange bellini was perfect!  Not too sweet and not too gasoliney (you know, when you get a drink and it's so strong it tastes like pure gasoline).    It was the candied walnuts that made the chocolate brownie dessert...these nuts melt in your mouth.  (That's what she said.)  It was my friend's birthday so I was lucky enough to sample a few other desserts--the red velvet cake and the nachos--a mix of tropical fruits and ice cream on top of chips.  (And they were nice enough to bring her the cake out with a candle!)  The red velvet cake was delicious--just the right flavor without it being overwhelmingly rich.  I liked the nachos, and they did a pretty good job of making the tropical fruit look like cheese and guac, while the ice cream was akin to sour cream.  So they were tasty (and I love tropical fruit), but I didn't love these nachos because I think the mental image of what should be salty nachos threw my taste buds and brain for a loop with the sweetness.    Just remember--don't go in expecting it to be a full out bar.  It's really more of a dessert shop/specialty drink bar, but they do have some classy bottled beers.

Og5lv2yeSg-JRxbxc5_8PQ.review_text: I had a really bad experience here: 1) with the food 2) with the service  Let's start with the food.  From all the Yelp reviews, I can already tell the desserts are on the sweeter side, but goodness it was disgustingly sweet.  BUT THAT'S FINE.  I knew what I was getting myself into.   However, what was a total turnoff was when I asked the waiter to recommend the least sweet one.  He basically just said they're all the same and that he has no idea what each tastes like.  When we tried ordering a cocktail, we received the same 'whatever' response from him.  When we were paying, he also gave us the wrong bill and momentarily denied that it was the wrong one.  As much as I love the idea of a dessert bar, I'm not coming back.

x0i6NgHySrXWgb17gVMTuQ.review_text: I can't believe how many reviews/stars this place got after a while!  I went there with the mister when it was still pretty new, because of our love for dessert places. We also very much loved Finale in the Boston area and wanted to find something similar.  I did get a chance to talk to somebody who works there, and it seems like they did draw Finale as a reference when they opened up the place. Woot :)  It's not quite the same, Finale is more like traditional dessert comfort food, with a modern style presentation, whereas this place just have modern fusion-style desserts. Also, Candy Bar is a lounge, which means comfy couches, low lights, and a great place to hang out.  I still love Finale's selection, but this is definitely very promising and I'll come back again just to try the ever changing dessert menu. I'm glad to see that so many other people also love the place as much as I do!  One note though: parking around the area is definitely a tad bit shady. I wish it were in a more accessible neighbourhood (I live in the peninsula).

_q_MC7ebjDOCpX5Ec7TXEQ.review_text: The buttermilk panna cotta w/olive oil and frozen grapes are to die for...absolutely delicious. Savory, melty, sweet & salty piece of heaven.  The cayenne cinnamon chocolate mousse was fluffy, chocolatey and had a definite kick to it...the apple crisp was cinnamony, crunchy crusty top with a moist melty apples. YUMM. again, the white Sangria is fabulous..and happy hour from 6-8pm. $2 Sangrias? can't get much better than this!   Board games like CandyLand & Chutes&Ladders make it even more memorable!

Sz6JeWg0AaiT__VQjwvYEg.review_text: My bf and I came here around 6pm because I had a groupon and ordered the dessert for two.  We ordered the panna cotta, japanese cheesecake, tiramisu, and lemon tart.    There was something strange about the strawberry sauce on the panna cotta, it tasted a little bit too sour for the both of us and I had to pour it out.  The Japanese cheesecake was done really well, like all Japanese desserts, its really light.  The tiramisu tasted more like cake and you can't even taste the rum, and the lemon tart was an ok dish.  Later that evening, my boyfriend and I went to the movies and I had terrible  sharp pains in my stomach that caused me to walk out of the theatre twice.  My bf experienced similar pains about 20 minutes after I did.  Since we didn't eat anything else that evening, I've isolated the stomach pains to the Panna Cotta.  :(  I hate to give this place a bad review because the location is really cute, has great wall art, and cheap bubbly...  but I can't pinpoint the pains to anything else.

yMmWN4BNNCKPvOi7PMKHvg.review_text: I take dessert seriously and so does Candybar.  Not only is it a fabulous concept but it's a fabulous place. They have really unique desserts and pairings and you are sure to find something that will delight the taste buds. Unfortunately I can't remember all of the delicious dishes I taste tested but I can tell you that it ranged from coconut and red velvet to chocolate and thyme ice cream. I also tried a specialty drink and although I am not a fan of sweet cocktails I did enjoy it. Fortunately for me they had sangria and a great wine selection to choose form that paired nicely with the dessert.  This is a dessert bar, so don't come hungry unless you want a serious sugar high. The desserts are great but man, are they decadent. I've been in groups which is nice because you can order a few dishes and have the opportunity to try more than one dessert.  Candybar also offers quite the selection of games to keep your party entertained and ample seating for everyone. It's a very cozy place with couches, tables, dim lighting and great artwork. The staff is friendly and accommodating and most importantly ladies, the bathroom is pretty. It's huge, clean and I just kind of wanted to hang out in there for awhile.   Candybar is a great place to indulge, indulge, indulge!

celaMP9ZFrqnypwJr_YX8Q.review_text: Awww, I really thought I was going to like this place. Too bad. I went here with my friend tonight. We used our Groupon for two desserts and two beverages. The place is really cute and the atmosphere is relaxing. But the food didn't wow me. I'm not much of a sweets person, so the food tasted extra sweet to me. I had the strawberry limeade. The presentation was nice, but the flavors were too strong for me. The top part had strawberries, so that was sweet. Underneath there was a moist cake, but it was too sour for me. I liked my dessert more than my friend's though. She got the apple a la mode.  Just too sweet for me especially on the bottom. I don't know if i would come here again. Maybe to try something else. The place looks good to take a date. There are board games, so that was cool. The staff is attentive. Overall, I like the concept. I just don't know about the food.

e1L-fispN322qToZPLEuSg.review_text: I was kind of surprised that there was a market for just pure desserts (I don't think there are any baked goods here), but the place was pretty packed.    Apparently all the desserts are made in house (including the ice cream to my surprise)! I managed to sneak in just before closing time, and got a taste of banana ice cream and a gluten-free brownie. I guess the non-gluten folks requested something...non-gluten-y, and the dessertier, Cathleen Li, obliged!    The brownie was chocolatey and delicious, especially for something supposedly healthy. I'm not a big fan of bananas, but I was amazed to learn it was made in-house. The texture and consistency was just so professional. I argued with my friend saying it was probably not in-house, but I was wrong. Of course, I have no idea how to make ice cream, so as far as I am concerned, ice cream may as well be made with voodoo magic.

3Hew_nvGd8tATlbjqY3aJw.review_text: Candybar is THE #1 date venue.  I came here with my boyfriend after dinner and had a blast playing connect four and monopoly while sipping on $3 white wine sangria!  That is correct, it was only $3!!  The service was great, the drinks were delicious and I loved the art work on the walls.  I didn't get a chance to try the desserts, but they sure looked amazing on the table next to us.  I highly recommend this place if you're looking for a cozy lounge to relax and chill.

kv9Vg5FbJiFgcNQ_FOJ2Ng.review_text: Think of a little upscale asian dessert place.  It's a small place, nice chairs, and nice ambiance.  Expect to wait because some groups might want to hang out there.   We ordered lots of desserts that I can't remember what we got.  Presentation is good.  Dessert is okay.  Quality is ok. It's a good idea and it's nice to have more of these.  I love sweets!

CSeWID1TbPxeFwaLRATjfA.review_text: I came here with a groupon... i got the apple pie-ish thing.... it was too sweet and the crust was kinda mushy.  The champagne cocktails were yummy.  We also got the smores which was pretty good.  I would come back again.  This place is a nice, romantic spot for after-dinner dessert and drinks.  there are board games to play which is fun.

swocJWD8R1iH20-lveXh0Q.review_text: I had a lot more fun then I expected.  I read the mixed reviews and was a little weary coming in with my small group of 5.  We found a dark corner booth to sit at and had no problems ordering and everything came out in a timely manner.  Our server/maybe owner was funny and attentive too.    One of us, the big eater, ordered the sampler of 4 desserts for himself.  He thought they all were good and could have eaten another 4 but refrained.  I got the honey and almond panna cotta.  I thought it was delicious but felt that mine was one of  the more simpler ones.  My friend got the lavender dessert and it was massive and surprisingly delicious.  The sundae was was also massive and looked awesome.  Lychee martini was delicious but the sparkly ones lacked the fruity flavor and just tasted plain.    The boardgames were not a hit with us.  Our table was too dark to play UNO and we couldn't figure out which cards were green or blue.  Once our desserts and drinks arrived there was no room on the table for anything else.  Yes, I would come back.  But parking was awful.

vdXPnHK6wtcbAC-IUcKj5w.review_text: To sum it up: I expected this place to be WAY better than it was.  I'm not really one to go off much about the ambiance or decor of a bar/restaurant, but this place looks straight up cheesy and cheap, which is a huge juxtaposition to the semi-expensive, yet tiny desserts.   My date and I split 4 desserts--no we are not gluttons, the portions are small... one might even call them miniscule--and we chose the Japanese cheesecake (this was ok), some kind of flourless chocolate cake (surprisingly flavorless for a chocolate dessert), the lavender honey craime fraiche (did not like this at all....) and the ice cream sandwich (this one was pretty damn good).  So out of 4 desserts I tried, I enjoyed 1.5 of them... not such a great ratio. These were honestly some of the most underwhelming desserts I've eaten in recent memory. We also each had an $11 glass of non-remarkable malbec (for him) and pinot noir (for me). Definitely not impressed with either of those.  On the other hand, the service was fine. No complaints there.  Good idea for a bar, but given the price tag they need to step it up a notch (or several). It was ok to check out once but I doubt I'll go here again.

WdE8eWEeZ7aYcnR8kf6u8A.review_text: Wonderful ambiance and a great place to hang out and grab dessert with friends! I really enjoyed my time here, and I am looking forward to coming back with more people soon.  Food: They featured a wide selection of specialty and creative desserts. I opted for their version of the sundae, which was delicious, and very different. The portion initially looked small, but it was quite filling when I finished it all. I would also recommend possibly getting a few options and then splitting them in order to sample the menu better. They also have a wide selection of cocktails and beverages that were very unique.   Service: The service was generally pretty good, as I have no complaints to make. Since this is more of a place to come to hang out and eat dessert while hanging out with your friends, I didn't expect people to come by asking if I needed anything very often.   Atmosphere: I think the ambiance of this place was my favorite part. It was cozy and had a very intimate, lounge-like feel to it, which I really enjoyed. It's a perfect setting for catching up with friends, while enjoying some tasty treats. I also liked the selection of board games that they had for you to play, which made the night very fun and entertaining.   Before coming, I would also recommend checking out some of the groupon deals that may be available. We bought one that saved us a ton of money!

Wmh9vK9LX-sxeuTb6vzM2A.review_text: The first time I came here I had the passion fruit cocktail and the panna cotta. The panna cotta was a little lack luster but I guess it is panna cotta so it's going to be pretty light. The passion fruit was tasty (but very sweet so watch out if you're not into sweet drinks) and I tried my date's strawberry kiss which was also good.  The second time I came here we split the strawberry limeade which was excellent. Still light, but much tastier and more interesting than the panna cotta. I had the blood orange cocktail which was really good.  I'm giving it 4 stars because the strawberry limeade was really good, the happy hour drink specials are nice (and the happy hour actually lasts long enough for me to go after work!) and the service is friendly/helpful and honest. A bit pricey though, but if you're making a whole outing out of dessert and drinks, this is a good place.

WA2iWuSCriz7uzL4c74mIA.review_text: If you're looking for a chill atmosphere and enjoy drinking wine while eating pastries this is the place to go. I had never been to a place like this before and I love how they have board games to play.  Spent some time here sipping on wine while playing strawberry short cake memory cards.

nbfyMmgqnxXIp7EDqTmkqw.review_text: Parking is impossible in this area. They have fun board games and card games and Happy Hour from 6-8PM Desserts were delicious, drinks were a bit (and by a bit I mean a lot) too sweet but still tasty

87hSO1uA83c5SQ9x8hoDlA.review_text: Was soooooo good! The desserts are great....So are the drinks! MAKE A RESERVATION! This place is fairly small and they have some great happy hour deals...so it gets super packed quick and the wait can be quite long.... Some people can't even be guaranteed seating. Really cool art work on the wall! Kinda pricey but me and my friends had a good time....So I would say that it was money well spent!

z-oO1tVXUwLt8G1NDZwWDQ.review_text: Sweet cocktails and desserts? YES PLEASE.  This place is awesome. Came here on a date night and ordered the Strawberry Kiss wine cocktail and the dessert platter for two.   The Peanut Butter and Jelly Time was mediocre in my opinion (contrary to all other reviews...)  The Apple Pie was incredible.  The Strawberry Limeade was my favorite!  And the Ice Cream Sandwich was awesome!  I'll definitely be back to play some board games and indulge with my girlfriends!

0Ge1Y7IhNWA7KWp2t5ZNKg.review_text: A fantastic date spot. It's an intimate and somewhat quiet lounge. The desserts are well executed, although notably missing a cheesecake option. It is clear that a lot of thought went in to the desserts. Ingredients are purposefully introduced and well balanced. Need help deciding on a dessert because they all sound delicious? Try picking one based on the texture you're in the mood for. You won't be disappointed!

sRxyVJ3c5paXVsQaouomGw.review_text: Delicious desserts and yummy drinks!   So I went with a few girlfriends and the wait wasn't too bad on a Saturday night surprisingly. When we got in I really liked the ambiance and the many board games to choose from. I got the Bellini because I thought it would be sweeter and less alcohol but boy was I wrong. It was pretty strong and I didn't finish it. :(  By my friends got a peach ring cocktail and a jasmine lychee cocktail and those were delicious.  AND THE DESSERTS WERE HUGE! We barely finished two of them. Would definitely love to come back again when I have more of a hankering for sweets! :D

JV52cxJMw8A0p642mUqJFw.review_text: If you have a party of 6+ make sure you make reservations!   Parking is TOUGH but I think its worth it. At least once.  Two of us came in around 10pm, after 40min looking for parking, and waited 15min for a table.   We had:  Mango Tango Bellini: Yumm! The scoop of sorbet balances the sweetness of mango and bubbles.   Triple Chocolate Bellini: Had a nice chocolate taste  Strawberry Kiss: Sweet. Pretty much champagne with a frozen strawberry  Half red wine and coke (Forgot the name): Sounded interesting so I thought we should be brave and tried it. Tasted like flat coke + red wine. Wasn't a good combo for us...  Ordered the dessert sampler for 2:   Lavender Honey Creme Fraiche Semi Freddo -  my FAVE. So refreshing, must have again!  Tiramisu - was nice and light  Buttermilk Vanilla Bean Panna Cotta - was ok but was too strong on the blasamic.  and macarons!  When I go back, and I def will, I want to try this BIG cookie people next to us were sharing. Wonder what that was! Should've asked but I was too engrossed with my own plate of goodness. :-)  Loved the ambiance!

rpqKQErEs36haM0ccKcI9g.review_text: Candy Bar... could the name of a place be any more straight forward?  The moment you walk in, the smell of sugar-coated sweetness hits you like a brick wall.  Thankfully, it's not an over whelming mental-cavity type of scent.  The lighting sets the mood for a romantic setting and every seat in the house is designed to keep your date or party close together.  With a good selection of drinks and some unique desert plates, I had a fun time here.  The service was fast and friendly.  Don't expect to walk away full.  If you do, you''ve either racked up a hefty bill, or a hefty waste-band around your pants... or both.

xSJr86JwAZk_iwFSifc0zQ.review_text: For what it is, CandyBar is up to par! (I make a good mascot with my genuine knack for cheesy rhymes)   Whenever Master [Ultimate Food Connoisseur] introduces me to yet another amazing, hitherto be discovered establishment, I get suspicious and wonder if I'm date #67 and Master is a skilled merchant of trade, wowing women of all shapes and sizes with his vast knowledge of SF's greatest eateries. LOL, with that said, this is a great place to set trap, I mean o___O impress someone.  The setting is very romantic almost purely purveying to couples, think candle light so dim you can't see. This isn't for Friday night with 5 'homeboys' and if you go with 5 girls you're gonna wish you went w/ your boyfriend, or wish you had one to go with here... :p  It's very red velvet inside and no I don't mean it's made of red velvet cake, I mean the furnishings are red velvet and the walls are mahogany and sandalwood, your only options are wine, coffee and some world class confectionary art ranging from ordinary, to highly unusual [i.e. caramel popcorn and cake? ?]  I'm mildly indignant by all these other reviews that describe these creations I didn't even see on the menu. At my time there (late late evening), the menu was one page and there was only five things to choose from [Blueberry cheesecake w/ graham cracker crust, traditional chocolate lovers, vanilla with yellow cake, pear ice cream with cake] I sampled all of them and Master and I agreed the Red Velvet was the only piece of decadence, the other desserts could be perfected in the privacy of your own home with the help of Betty Crocker..... and the portions were modest and gone in 4 bites [MELTED INCREDIBLY FAST, WITHIN SECONDS OF WAITER SETTING PLATES DOWN] for 10 bucks, and the cocktails cost as much as the dessert and gone twice as fasts, making gluttony inevitable leading to a quick decline in your funds resulting in their profits rising exponentially LOL   I'll take the steep prices for the nice setting, friendly service and the awesome shelf of books and extensive collection of board games they have. Overall delightful place, very unique and worth a shot at least once. Bring $50! 3 desserts 2 cocktails, you can stomach the sample like portions, provided your wallet can stomach the bill.  Place is fucking hard to find, so is parking. You have been warned young padi-wan

bG6DkJKwhKMMQ0Z3GSOpmA.review_text: Not as jam packed with d-bags as I was expecting it to be. Really, I've passed this joint at least 50 times since it opened & never really had the urge to mingle with their clientele base (it seems a little too stuffy, faux-classy even, & feels much more apt for the Marina), until a friend & I had a showdown last weekend after having a few beers at Waziema. "Hey man, let's goto Candybar!" "Fuck you, you're full of shit." "Try me." "Fine, let's do it." "Fine. FINE."  Luckily, we were wearing respectable jackets, or blazers, if you will -- anything else in a place like Candybar & you'd feel under dressed. It wasn't as wholly unpleasant as I expected it to be. I think the two star rating is based on the whole concept of high cost champagne/dessert bars creeping into my beloved Western Addition rather than my specific disdain for the experience. It was late in the evening & not at all crowded. I mean, I won't make a special effort to make it a regular stop, but I wouldn't rule out setting foot inside the place in the future.

zujeqOdg6KBsw0HY-d_-XA.review_text: it sure looked pretty but it was..ehhh sure the sofa seats were nice, but if i'm paying a place to sit, i'd go somewhere free for example a bus stop. i guess you're paying for the ambiance, but overall, expensive and super duper small.   good experience, but will most likely never do it again

aVaa64zb_-d6VTY3XcXyIQ.review_text: GROWN UP DESSERTS!!! (4.5 stars)  Sweet tooth galore!!! Treated RayBoo to some sweets because we both have have the same sweet tooth. Dinner, desert, and quality time together (as usual).   - Desserts, yummy - Price, out of pocket - Service, good - Ambiance, dim and sexy  HEFFER STATUS.  DRUNKEN S'MORE DESSERT ($10) - Super duper sweet and rich, you have been warned. I had to ask for a glass of water on the side to bland out the sugary taste in my mouth. I did enjoy it, one of the chocolates had liquor it in and it was very rich.  50/50 COCKTAIL ($8) - soju, orange soda, vanilla. I love anything creamsicle flavor so I had to get a cocktail that was basically a liquid creamsicle popsicle. It was so good, love it and will order it again. It was shaked well because you couldn't taste the soju at all.  BLOOD ORANGE COCKTAIL ($7) - sparkling wine, blood orange bitters, sugar cube. Didnt really taste the blood orange, just a hint.   BIG FRANCESCO'S TIRAMISU ($10) - Coffee Chiffon / Chocolate and Rum Mascarpone Cream / Coffee Bits / Chocolate. Pretty good, tasted like any good tiramisu elsewhere. The coffee chiffon and mascarpone cream made it that much better!  Will I be back? Yes, I hope soon!!!!  Until we meet again and until the next review....

QFJqrX5e9UD2TUYMwA2XzA.review_text: The atmosphere at the Candybar was nice - it's always makes you feel warm to see others enjoying each others' company.  But when it came down to our own table, the drinks and desserts were so-so.  And my gosh, they are expensive for what they are.  I guess you pay for the ambiance.

Iovy9ItislQQuQQVYHR1ng.review_text: Went here with a party of 12 for my boyfriend's Birthday. All of the guests were from San Jose and all agreed that CandyBar was worth the drive.   It wasn't exactly what I was expecting. I thought it was more of a full service bar with decedent desserts. However, it's more of a dessert focused restaurant that showcases a bar (with only sparkling wines, wines, ports and beers-no cocktails or shots) and not an ACTUAL bar you can walk up to and order drinks from.   The service was fantastic. I emailed in advance to make reservations, so when we showed up, BAM there was our table.   The desserts were fantastic! The Tin Roof Sunday was a hit with our group (actually I think almost every pair split one of those). The carrot cake looked really yummy as well as the chocolate parfait. The presentation of ALL plates were fantastic!  CandyBar really hits the spot...your sweet spot :o)

K0zrsXqu55JPwT4dnvNUDg.review_text: Happy Hour ($3 Sangria and $2 Beer til 7:30pm)  After hearing about the lounge dedicated to sweets and alcohol, I couldn't stop thinking that I had to try this place out.  So I brought two of my friends with me to share the Tastings Menu, which although is a little on the expensive side, it reminds me of eating specialy desserts like at a Michael Mina restaurant.  While it wasn't so highly regarded by my friends, I found it something else.  The mix of flavors was certainly different from the usual pastry or ice cream shops.  In order to come here ready to enjoy, you have to forget all the regular flavors you're used to and embrace whatever is served to you on that nice white canvas plate.  While several things came as a part of the tasting, I found the following perhaps my favorites:  -Blueberry with sorbet and white chocolate shavings -Chocolate creme cake with thyme ice cream;  -Coffee caviar over some ice cream

yKjSyMKBIDtovONtNs7QpQ.review_text: Aroused by my prevailing appetite for dessert, I came back for my second visit to Candybar. We came here on a Saturday after 9:30 pm, as a party of 4. By 10:00 pm, there were more patrons and seating became limited. Though the actual taste of the dessert is not momentous, I must express my admiration for the venue's trendy ambiance. Sexy spot for a date! Candy bar is a dessert lounge with an imaginative and fun menu. They also serve wine and cocktails that compliment the desserts. FYI ladies and gents, there's even beer!   DRINKS  We started with Negro Modelos for the dudes and Blood Orange Cocktails for the girls. The Blood Orange Cocktail, made with sparkling wine, blood orange bitters, and a sugar cube, was crisp and exhilarating. Tickling my tongue, the sparkling wine's naughty bubbles were enchanting, and the incorporated sugar cube did not make the cocktail too sugary. Also, the cocktail cleansed our palates between dessert bites, and elevated our dessert experience by eliminating contending flavors. Proceed with caution though: this one's a creeper! ;)   DESSERT  For the dessert sampler ($25.00), we selected the Red Velvet Cake, the Apple Ala Mode, the Lavender Honey Crème Fraiche Semifreddo, and the Big Francesco''s Tiraimsu. You select four desserts from the menu, except for the desserts with the asterisks *. The sampler is made for two, but pay an additional $10.00, if you would like to share it with additional people. The overall harmonious presentation of the dessert sampler plate was simple and balanced, which allowed for ultimate accessibility to each individual dessert.  BREAKDOWN   Red Velvet Cake ($9.00 when ordered b itself): NOT love at first bite. An utter disappointment. The composition of the cake was regrettably dense, not airy and silky, as it ought to be. We were practically eating a brownie. The red velvet flavor was virtually absent, as I did not taste any cocoa.  The 'vanilla cream cheese' frosting did not showcase the tangy flavor of cream cheese.  I also did not understand the function of the toasted marshmallow with this cake--the marshmallow did not symphonize with the red velvet.   Lavender Crème Fraiche Semifreddo: ($9.00 when ordered by itself): My favorite from the sampler. It was light and decadent. I rejoiced in the fresh pieces of firm cantaloupe and the distinctive texture of the crumbly nutella powder, which paired sublimely with the crème fraiche. 'Semifreddo' means half cold, so the crème fraiche had the texture of a frozen mousse (half ice cream and half whipped cream). I also indulged in the crunchy almond brittle on the side. I would order this dessert again, by itself, from here.   Apple Ala Mode ($9.00 when ordered by itself): The grainy hazelnut crust and the caramelized apples complimented by the milky texture of the gingerbread ice cream.  The dessert was supposed to have a cream cheese filling, but the cream cheese flavor was understated. Nothing remarkable.   Big Francesco's Tiramisu ($10.00 when ordered by itself): The rum mascarpone cream was not rich and creamy as it ought to be, and it did not impart the rum flavor that I was anticipating. The dessert overall was still tasty and chocolaty, but it did not leave me yearning for more.   MEH - Mediocre flavors, buuut quite noteworthy and amusing textures. Bring your date before 10 pm for the chill vibe, sensual dim lighting, the eccentric wall art pieces, AAND BOARD GAMES!

lZZFNrjENwIMQifciYAWFg.review_text: The ultimate love/hate relationship...  What I love...  1.  Amazing desserts - yummy range of items to choose from.  Last night we had the Flourless Chocolate Cake, Ice Cream Sandwiches, Lemon Tart & Peanut Butter and Jelly.  Here's the recap... -Flourless Chocolate cake - perfectly done.  Not too sweet, but sooo rich and chocolately. -Lemon tart.  I'm a sucker for lemon desserts, and this was lovely, but a bit too heavy on the coconut that went with it. -Ice Cream Sandwiches.  Fab macaroons provided the base for the sandwich, but the blueberry ice cream was a touch too sweet. -Peanut Butter & Jelly.  Soooo yummy.  Chocolate tart crust, peanut butter cream, berry sauce with salted caramelized nuts.  Heaven!  2.  Fizzy drinks.  Call me a sucker, but I love sweet fizzy drinks.  The Strawberry Kiss is perfect, and when mixed with the Blood Orange cocktail provided the perfect amount of sweetness for my husband.  3.  Games.  Stupidly fun to sit there & play Candyland while eating desserts & drinking sweet fizzy drinks.  The not so great...  1.  Snotty waitress.  Please leave the attitude at the door & the smug smirks to yourself.  So sorry we inconvenienced you by making you wait on us...  2.  The wait.  Come early unless you want to wait for a loooooooooong time on a Friday or Saturday nite.  Given the combo of dessert, drinks and games, people sit and camp at a table forever!  What I hate?  ...the detrimental impact on the size of my arse by coming here!

64o6vJrByaGTStMvvU45JQ.review_text: I'm very torn. On the one hand, their sweet wine selection is like nothing I've seen before. On the flip side, everything is so overpriced that it is hard to justify it.  I had a glass of  2006 Braida Vigna Senza Nome Moscato D'asti. A very small glass about half the size of a champagne flute. For $11. Now I'm not above paying that for a glass of sparkling wine, but a 750ml bottle of this costs $13. That's one hell of a mark up.  The one big benefit is that I now have a nice long list of bottles to buy for myself to keep at home... probably for pennies on the dollar compared to what they want for them.  The desserts were quite good and I especially liked the little mini milk chocolate and cookie at the end of the tasting menu. I scraped my plate getting the last bit of sweetness off. I would have licked it if no one was looking. :)  One thing that was cute was they had a couple board games. Someone was playing with the connect four game next to us. Actually I'm not entirely sure they were playing it. I saw them assemble it at least. :) I can't imagine playing a full game of scrabble there though. Though it might be entertaining for a birthday party.

k6XML-BqnuKnbePSaf1qbQ.review_text: This is another good date place or just an amazing lounge to chil and have dessert and drinks with your friends.  The place is really cute.  The art on the wall are modern and hip.  Both times I've been there, I sat in the corneer by the window.  It's very intimate. But you go here for the Dessert!!! amazing!!! This is sweet tooth heaven andan A on presentation.  Favorites: Apple pie ala mode with gingerbread ice cream- This is always a hit.  it's just comfort.  its oozy, crunchy, yummy, not too sweet and the ice cream goes really well.  Red velvet- it was good but nothing to really run home screaming about. it hit the right spot, nonetheless  Brownie with basil ice cream and candied walnuts- very very good.  The basil ice cream just added a new dimension to the dish.  definitely recommended.  strawberry limeade- if you want something citrus-y this is it.  i love its cute presentation and the fact that they use calamansi.  We filipinos love our calamansi.  Mango bellini- this is my faovrite drink. i love the sugar rimmed champagne flute the small scoop of mango sorbet inside.    Chances are you will end up paying may more than $10 per person.  Also, it's street parking only, and it is dreadful finding parking in this area.The service here is very nice too.  I've never had to wait for a table here, despite it being packed...maybe it was just my luck :)  Bottom line: if you are looking for a great artsy, hip place to lounge with your friends or a special someone, candy bar is defintely a great option.  highly recommended!

OS3CJztGFHUvySVWJQbArg.review_text: sometimes when i watch Top Chef on Bravo, I find myself wondering what it would be like to eat some of those crazy "meals"  those chefs wip up on a drop of a dime. Then I shrug and eat more of my cup o' noodle.  well, lucky me, I got to go to Candy Bar and experience some desserts that seems like they were pulled from Top Chef via television ala Mike TV in Willy Wonka.   So I may not be sexy and had a refined taste like Padma... but these desserts were pretty damn good. Don't get me wrong.... they were expensive, but they were good.   This is were the reviews gets shady- i don't remember the names of the stuff i had, because they had fancy raise your pinky type names so I'll break it down common person style:  I got a tiny shot glass filled with strawberry stuff- that shit was probably the best thing I got the whole night.   Then I got "cheesecake" it was like a smear of cream cheese with some tatsty bits on top. eh, not to much a fan, but it was food all the same.  My friend got some chocolate business that rocker her world.  Then out waiter brought out some tasty as malted milk and a tiny cookie... which was BOMB! Who knew that milk and cookies could be so naughty delicious.  The setting was crazy romantic... great sexy mood lighting, lounge seating, games, books, like sitting in a fancy person's living room. A fancy person  who's trying to seduce you.   The staff are really friendly and awesome... which is rare in such haughty places.

yH9C4D7cANSBkjq5RzaKcA.review_text: I bought a groupon that included 2 cocktails and 2 drinks for 2. It sounded like a great concept, so I took 2 of my girlfriends to enjoy this deal.   Pros: *AMBIANCE ( cute, and inviting) *GAMES (board games available for anyone to play) *DESSERTS (big portions)  Cons: * SERVICE (the host/server was not very friendly and served us warm water w/o ice...gross! He also gave us a little attitude when I asked for an extra spoon for one of my friends. "The coupon is only for 2 people" but he ended up giving it to us) * DRINKS (were a little too sweet for me...but if you like fruity drinks...you'll love them) *DESSERTS (even though they were big portions, the desserts were "average"...nothing to go home raving about)

P2fXcmsU_vrs4zB2IfsHnQ.review_text: Where have you been all my life? I love you. The Bff and I went here and what a cute little spot! Whether you are with your girlfriends, significant others, or anyone you love having company with, this place is the spot. And hello--dessert!!!! Divine. I almost died--it was good. We shared the trio ice cream--kit-kat, oreo, and PB cup!!! SOoooo good. We also had the Lavender honey dessert. Yum. Mango bellini and passionfruit sparkling wine. Do you want me to go on? I will definitely be back. Love you. Oh, and if sparkling wine isn't enough for you...they have board games to play--Connect 4 and Battleship just to name a couple! :)

mOd3oN7AHW-jzErDfwqyrg.review_text: Immediately upon entering I felt uncomfortable. The lighting is very dim and completely red...like you're in a darkroom. They might have been going for a laid back, romantic vibe but it was just very...suffocating.  Service was quick and efficient for our group of 6. It took me a while to choose a dessert, out of the 10 or so options, because nothing sounded that appealing. I finally settled on the drunken s'mores, and ended up avoiding all the chocolate tart (which was 90% of the dessert...I ordered a s'mores, not a chocolate tart!) - it was tooth achingly sweet and dense. Combined with all the slightly "drunken" chocolate fudge on top, I don't say this often, but there was too-much-chocolate! Maybe if they called this a "double chocolate tart drowning in chocolate fudge," people would be more prepared for it, instead of expecting something resembling s'mores. They didn't attempt very hard at making it a s'mores with the cold, solid marshmallow on top...--- a cold, unmelted, solid marshmallow!! Ugh! Do you even understand s'mores??  Aside from that I tried the "apple pie a la mode"...which was like 60% cream cheese. Well I'm glad I finally got to try some (disappointing) desserts at Candybar, time to not come back! I'm sure the desserts are probably better if you're in the mood for them and the happy hour/alcoholic beverages might be good? Another good thing is that servings are big (1 dessert is probably enough for 2 people, unless it's the ice cream macaron sandwich).

zFPs9j4-lz5ze_IZGEoTYg.review_text: I love this place! The desserts are great! The cocktails are wonderful, mango tango Bellini to be exact!

A7FNqfL30IjpcQ6fQffoOQ.review_text: I went here, approaching with trepidation. I mean beef in chocolate sauce. I know! Ew, ugh, gross, right?  WRONG!!! This was awesome. It was savory not sweet. My drink, a lager with cayene peper and lemon paired well which was a shock in the sense that It just sounded a little off.  The decor is sparse but stylish, the art is has a surreal quality to it that I found pleasurable, and the service was attentive but not too clingy. I will be coming back often as it is the kind of place which is swanky but unpretentious. A rare pleasure in the city nowadays.

p9zfZnJ9iIsbIA19hvHpxw.review_text: Did the dessert sampler for 2 amongst the 4 of us. Paid the extra $10 for the sharing cost. Most of the desserts were yummy- I enjoyed the Lavender Dessert along with the Strawberry Limeade Dessert. Everything else was fine. We were hoping for more coffee and tea selections. Ambience is nice for a girls night or date night. Not a place for kids.

G8NqFdctwZPfE1f9ls--IQ.review_text: I love the concept of this restaurant.  I am big on desserts and felt that they were par, but nothing phenomenal. What WAS phenomenal was the wine. These people really know their stuff and the waitresses will find you tasty-times pairings to go deliciously with your dessert.  Don't go here if you don't have a sweet tooth. The majority of the wines are dessert wines. It is called Candybar, so have some common sense, you know?  Some people listed some issues with the service, my experience with the service was fabulous, but I'm not sure how much it varies, since I've only been there once. It was a Friday/Saturday when I went. The place is crazy small, but it didn't take us long to scope out a seat.   My major beef was that parking which was ridiculous. I would recommend taking a cab.  Overall, I think they need to step up their game on the dessert menu too, since that is the focus of the place. I didn't think the brioche was that fierce. My friend had a desert that was like a flourless white cake. I can't remember what it was called, but that one was the best out of our group of four.  Three stars for the dessert Five stars for the wine and wine pairing Evens out to four stars.

YZxZopC-X-fSONb3Dq2DUA.review_text: Very nice interior design.  Great place to hang out for dessert after dinner!  They even provide board games like Connect Four!  What a treat!  Chocolate mouse was good as was their mango pudding + ice cream.

8qpFUPR1wd3uz8N1QaWj_A.review_text: Having driven by one evening, we saw the line out front, confirming fellow Yelpers comments about the wait time for Candybar.  So we had a plan on a recent Saturday. After finishing lunch late in the afternoon, we decided that we would head over to Candybar after they opened at 6pm to try out their desserts. Thinking that getting there before 6pm, I thought parking would not be an issue.  The Panhandle area is densely populated with multi-unit buildings and with restaurants and bars in the area, parking was quite challenging.  After about 30 minutes, finally scored on a space about five blocks away. We walked in at 6:30pm and were the first patrons of the night and had our choice of tables. Checking out the menu we started out with some "happy hour" sangrias.  Happy hour is 6-8pm every night with $2 Pacificos, $3 Sangrias and $4 sparkling cocktails. After confirming some desserts on the menu with our waiter, we ordered: Ice Cream Sandwich - Almond Parisian macaroon, chocolate ganache, fresh melon and honeydew ice cream. Beautiful presentation.  A refreshing, lighter dessert with the cubes of honey melon.  Nice for those that don't like super sweet desserts. (yelp.com/biz_photos/cand…) Big Francesco's Tiramisu - Coffee chiffon, chocolate and coffee mascarpone cream, coffee bits and chocolate.  A contrast to the Ice Cream Sandwich.  The layer of chocolate made this a very sweet dessert.  The mascarpone was light in rum and had a stronger coffee flavor than coffee.  This was different than the traditional tiramisu with rum soaked ladyfingers.  (yelp.com/biz_photos/cand…) Overall, beautifully presented desserts with efficient service.  The challenge is parking in the area and the wait during the evening "dessert time."  To avoid the waiting line, follow their slogan on their window, "Eat Dessert First".

6kNYj3We_DSlc6y_QMiqmg.review_text: yes, this is a review based on management/service rather than actually partaking of the drinks and desserts.   as lots of people apparently do, i forgot about my groupon until the last few days it was valid. so i and a friend showed up on the last day, 8/22, a bit more than an hour before candybar closed (my friend wasn't free till that time). there was quite a line, and we were told we may or may not get a table. long story short, we waited the entire hour, only to be told that they weren't seating anymore--just when our names were coming up on the list. (since several people hadn't even been served yet, this was not a question of us ending up staying far later than others and causing lots of inconvenience that way.)  the host said we could come back and use the amount i paid for the groupon ($17), but we would not be allowed to use the full value (two cocktails and two desserts, about twice that). since we had arrived when the groupon was still valid, but were turned away because of capacity, i asked "are you sure?" and he said, "yes, there's nothing i can do."  waiting all that time and not getting seated wasn't exactly fun, but sometimes you draw the short end of the straw, and i wouldn't cast aspersions for that. given the mayhem in there, and that they were essentially giving all those customers 2-for-1, i do think the host doing the seating and the bartender i was watching mantained good composure (second star for that). my negative review comes from what i felt was poor handling of the situation. if someone comes to your restaurant in time to use a promotion, and not being able to use it is beyond that customer's control, it is sound managerial/business practice--and only fair--to provide an extension of X number of days (even the next day would have been fine).   the point of groupons is to try to build future business through good will and word of mouth. candybar failed in that regard, and i'm not sure whether or not i'll be back at all.

NoHJb7x8IEakUJTx6_vGTA.review_text: If you want a pleasant way to end your night - this is it. The menu can cater to any sweet-tooth out there. They have everything that you could every want - and all their treats, I guarantee you, you have never tasted... ever. Amazing.   To keep you company, they have board games.  For a busy establishment, the waiters are on top of their game - in fact, they own the game.   Being the nature of the place, you have long lines, people jumping over people and that one idiot getting drunk every time there.  If you can get a seat for yourself... or for two, take it.

disS5oye86976awyFa4Tsw.review_text: Tasty! I went there with a friend for her birthday with the intention of having dessert for dinner. And we did.  We started off with some champagne cocktails with sorbet in them. Unfortunately, where we were sitting there were a million little fruit flies trying to get in our drink! Really, there were a lot. We asked to move, and things were better.  We had a cheese plate, an apple tart and the vanilla brioche. Let me just say that the vanilla brioche was AMAZING!  They also brought us their homemade fudgcicle on the house (presumably because of the fruit flies?) which I could only have a bite of because I was so full. Luckily, when it comes to sweets, my friend is a bottomless pit.  I'd definitely go back, but it's really pricey. We spent almost $100 for two drinks a piece, two desserts and a cheese plate after tax and tip.  And they make all of their ice cream! Yummmmm...

e-uR0uACjDx9lFE2rBEDrA.review_text: This spot is such a cool idea! Desserts, drinks.... And place to just chill and play old school board games while enjoying your company. Came here on Valentine's Day. Luckily we got in early, because there was a line of people as we were leaving.   There was four of us, so I got to try four different desserts: ice cream sandwich, apple ala mode, peanut butter jelly time and the red velvet cake. I liked my apple ala mode, but my ice cream was melted (not even cold) when it came out.  We had a fruity martini (can't remember the name), white sangria and a couple of watermelon soju shots. My martini was really good.  Enjoyed all this yummy goodness while planning a competitive game of chutes and ladders. :)

7SoXe5hhPNWqzpobQyRHPQ.review_text: I was on vacation in San Fran and went on groupon (maybe living social?) and found a coupon for this place. I wasn't sure what to expect, and when I walked in and saw the art and hip atmosphere with the ironic childhood board games I was hoping I hadn't stumbled into the local holier-than-thou hipster hangout, especially because I was with my Mom (so uncool!). I was pleasantly surprised, however. We played a few mean games of competitive connect four, shared the flourless chocolate cake and a blueberry ice cream sandwich, and drank a coffee and a strawberry cream soda (yum!) Nothing was too sweet at all, we actually ate before dinner (wild, i know) and it wasn't that usual heavy, too sweet feeling you get when your appetite is spoiled. To top it off, the owner Tan was super sweet, and we chatted about traveling and whatnot before we headed out. I would definitely recommend this place if you're visiting the Bay area and looking for a non-touristy hang-out. Well done, Candybar!

gsWrfEOgrZGlJ3-lzkTWfg.review_text: I ordered s'more dessert, very rich, very sweet, the apple pie like one was ok. The cocktails were excellent. I got the passion fruit one and the one with sorbet atop the champagne flute. Bomb bartender. The waitress was super spaced out the whole time. She never once offered us water, I had to ask during dessert.

RscoPhnfz9HFXN7X8czFlg.review_text: After reading so many positive reviews we decided to come for desserts and wine. To be honest, both my husband and I were expecting a more extravagant selection of desserts... We thought they offer more 'fusion' & unique type desserts.   Overall, the place is more casual and romantic. They do offer quite few cocktails, wines, and other drinks.   We tried the sampler that included four desserts and each of them was good.   Service was wonderful! Like I already mentioned, if you are looking for a quite, casual, romantic place that offers good desserts it is the place. If you seek something unique and extravagant it is not the place to go.

9BPqJgGb2AOYtFB0weP0xw.review_text: My three friends and I visited after my sister recommended it to me. Immediately, the three of us newly 21-year-olds were welcomed with the warm, hip vibe of the place. We chose a low table in the front corner by a street window, and we knew we were in for a memorable experience.  Looking at the menu, we prepared ourselves not to be stuffed after the meal. We decided on four entrees to share. (My favorites ended up being the "beef cheeks red pepper bonbon" and the "kobe steak.") While the dishes were definitely small, tapa-sized portions, each of us was able to enjoy the rich flavors of our choices. And, surprisingly, we were pleasantly full at the end of the meal (but I suppose Americans who are used to stuffing themselves completely would be less satisfied). We finished the night with three desserts to share, with a fourth comped by the owner when we told him how we heard about the place. Hands down, the chocolate cannelone chocolate olive creameux was sensational and kept us wanting more.   We will be back! Though, perhaps next time we will choose a regular table as it was a bit difficult leaning forward to eat a full meal...

0VELkLA9ujEAa3exO7grSQ.review_text: Delicious desserts and drinks! We tried the 50/50, hot chocolate, and lavender honey cream semifreddo.

lLfcbYGTeVxQN5Ig0ompJg.review_text: 5 STARS for the ambiance 3 STARS for the desserts 4 STARS OVERALL  I've been meaning to check Candybar out for some time. So when I saw a Living Social deal for $17 for 2 desserts and 2 cocktails, I had no excuse not to.  First off the ambiance is super cute. Especially for a date night. They have a bunch of games you can play while waiting for your dessert or even while having dessert. Just keep in mind the tables are small, so playing a board game or anything that takes up too much room might be hard with 2 desserts on the table. We played a couple games of Connect Four. I loved that game when I was little so it was a great way to relive a little bit of my childhood while having dessert.  On to the drinks. I'm not a huge fan or super sweet girlie drinks so I tried to stay away from ordering anything to sweet. The Mango tango bellini and Cherry blossom martini were both nice and light and given they were frou frou girlie drinks, not to sweet.  Now the desserts. The tiramisu was huge! This is definitely worth the price if you're looking for quantity. But I found the tiramisu to be overly sweet and chocolately and not much else. Not enough coffee or rum flavor. The flourless chocolate banana torte was the most disappointing. I was craving a banana dessert and really, there was no banana to be found. I probably should have checked the pix on yelp of this dessert, but I was really disappointed by the chocolate banana torte. Was wishing I had ordered something else.  I'm glad I gave Candybar a shot, but I probably won't be back unless I have another deal. I don't think the desserts and drinks were worth $36 altogether. But if you're looking for a cute place to take a date, I'd definitely recommend Candybar.

vx4kwFHidIlpcTwr7Wd1TQ.review_text: Went here with my girlfriends for our GNO on a Wednesday night around 9 pm. Thank goodness it wasn't crowded! We ordered two Dessert Samplers, in which each of the sampler, you get to have 4 desserts on the menu, excluding the ones with a dot/star next to it. So, technically, we tried 8 desserts total: Peanut Butter Jelly Time, Strawberry Lime, Soft Cheesecake, Candy Bar Hot Chocolate, Big Francesco's Tiramisu, Apple a la Mode, Honey Creme Fraiche, and Ice Cream Sundae.   There were 5 of us, and usually with the Dessert Sampler, if you have more than 2 people ordering, then it's $10 more on top of the 25$. Not too bad I guess considering the fact that we got to try majority of the desserts on the menu.  I would say my favorite ones out of all of these would be the Tiramisu, Strawberry Lime and the ice cream inside the sundae. Their desserts are pretty sweet for those who have sweeth tooth like me. I guess it's also because we were eating 8 desserts at once so that could be the case as well. Desserts were gorgeous so I give 'em props for presentation.   I've also tried their Peach Martini, and my other friends ordered the Lychee Martini, as well as Mango Tango. The Peach Martini was a bit stronger than the Lychee one, but it was very good! Haha, girly drinks for sure!   Overall, I love the atmosphere and decor here. It's definitely a more girly, date type of environment even though personally, I wouldn't go on dates here especially at night, it's way too dark here....(O.O, shit I want to see my date's face, not go on a blind --literally -- date), and us girls went a little crazy with the pictures, but the struggle was real since there were not much light for the pictures. BUT nevertheless, I like this place a lot. I finally get to try it after a whole year of trying to go, and it was worth it!   P.S. Parking is a pain in the A.S.S. Just be patient. #goodluck.

R359nKd5QtwiNuZwMlPlQQ.review_text: I don't think I can be bothered to come back to a bar that can't serve good drinks. Just become the cake/dessert store and we'll be cool.

B856VSGCvHAB-mil7JVprA.review_text: I am a fan because overrall, this place has a great vibe, good drinks, and variety of delightful desserts.  This place has a nice feel. Feels like a lounge, but funnier, because you can read or play boardgames. It is a great place for two people or larger groups to chat and socialize.  Ontop of this environment, you can order fun drinks and fun desserts.   PASSION FRUIT DELIGHT: It is a bubbly, but I didn't taste too much passion fruit. But when I ate it with the desserts, it was delicious.  MANGO TANGO BELLINI: I like this. I like how they put a ball of mango sorbet into the bubble. The sorbet was delicious and the sweetness blended with the sparking wine deliciously. A very girly drink, but I liked it.  ICE CREAM SANDWICH: Chocolate Macaroon Sandwhich with blueberry ice cream. I loved it. I can't wait to go back for this one. The chocolate macaroon was perfect. One of the best I had. And I really liked it with the blue berry ice cream. Creative and tasty. I totally recommend this if they have it on the menu. TIRAMISU: It was good, but not as good as the ice cream sandwich. Tasty and good size. I didn't like that the top was thin chocolate sheet cause it made it hard to eat with my spoon. It didn't cut apart when I used my spoon. Maybe I should ask for a fork next time.   This place is cute. Other than having difficulty finding parking. I can't wait to try happy hour next time. Should be fun because the place is so comfortable.

Wpnxvk84he10ZA44SUCa5w.review_text: Yeah, I just can't attest to the average 4-5 star rating for Candybar. The sweet tooth I have just didn't make me crave for another visit.  The pseudo sugar highs (+'s): + Dessert for Two option for $25 on the menu lets you pick four desserts. My party of three girls found this to be the perfect solution to satisfy everyone's needs. + Reception was amiable and pleasant. + Atmosphere was nice. Everyone crowds around their low tables of dessert and drinks which are lit dimly by candlelight. Feels warm and intimate. + Big Francesco's Tiramisu infused with coffee chiffon and coffee nibs--yeah i took several bites beyond my share. Nice and not heavy. + Smore concoction was pretty decent. Don't think I'd go out of my way to seek it like Bi-Rite ice cream.  The sugar crashes (-'s): - Yeah parking sucks. Period. - Expect 30-40" waits on a Saturday night. This place is crazy popular but note not open on Sunday. RSVPs NOT taken. - Desserts didn't wow us. Let's start with the Ice Cream Sandwich of macarons and honeydew ice cream. The macaron--was hard. It shouldn't be. - Lavender Honey Creme Fraiche Semifreddo--yeah well lavender tastes like soap to begin with so to truly mask the association the balance of sweet and fragrance has to be just so. It wasn't so. - Flourless Chocolate Banana Torte. Ok this is pretty standard. Almost every eatery offers a chocolate torte. That means this dessert is not so inventive and pretty staple. That said, it was not that interesting and I think Trader Joe's has something similar.  TIP: Get there early to avoid the crowd. Prepare to hunt for street parking.  Overall I want to love this place because the concept of desserts and drinks are winsome but afraid the pastries just don't do it. They just don't have that cronut effect where people stand in line starting at 4am to get one. And they are not inventive or addictive enough to make me hunt for a parking spot AND wait in line to get that sugar high.

1m4Hmm7IbgGjVupM7CQSMw.review_text: First off let me just say that if someone said, let's build Nikki M a bar that would be exactly what she loves and adores they would have created me this Candybar masterpiece. Wine and nothing but dessert???? I MEAN COME ON. It's a "dessert lounge" even the name seems positively decadent!
