They had a lot of really innovative things on the menu like a dessert soup and thyme ice cream. The only thing I felt was lacking was a little simplicity. Give me some milk and cookies, yo! It doesn't always have to be frothy or poached or blanched or whatever.  Another major plus for Candybar? The board games. All kinds of games. Yes, even Uno. And we love us some games!  Both the host and server were very friendly, and welcomed us in after a long Saturday at the beach. They had just opened and it was virtually empty so I can't speak to the crowd here, but I enjoyed the space a great deal since we were able to co-opt a huge booth and take over.  PS Candybar, I fully intend to have my birthday party there this year so i'll see you in July. I heart candy.

nrqbDl_0PZ1NUw81sJk8fA.review_text: Great idea with bad execution  The idea of a dessert bar is great and Candy Bar has the chance to be THE  destination in San Francisco...if they fix their wayward direction.  if desserts are the main business of your restaurant, they need to be excellent.  Candy Bar's desserts are good but not excellent. Also the desserts are somewhat small, so sharing goes quickly with small portions.  I was looking forward to a great wine and dessert wine list..strike two.  For starters the champagne list is filled with several names that I was not very familiar with.  Candy Bar is the sort of place that will attract dates and groups of girls for a night out, so having a champagne brand like Veuve Clicquot or Chandon would be a good idea to help increase sales. Brands that are well know tend to sell well. The list of wines was okay but I was hoping for some great Sonoma pinots but no such luck. They have a few decent ports but again the list isn't great.  Again, I like the Candy Bar concept but they are missing the mark.  I will give it  another try, hopefully by that time they make some changes in the menu offering.  And if I'm really lucky some better seating options.  And remember...The candyman can cause he mixes it with love and makes the world taste good...maybe Candy Bar will figure this out

Hv0D0BDrsarzvJSQXVschA.review_text: Okay so I'm being one of those really annoying people who reviews something before it's even open. Oh well, I plan on going soon, but until then here's the scoop from Daily Candy:  You'll never know, but Candybar is exactly what it claims to be: a new bite-size dessert and wine bar in the Western Addition opening softly tonight and to the public on Sunday.  Pastry chef Jake Godby's (Fifth Floor, Coi) four-course tasting menu sends you to the Milky Way with organic, house-made options -- chocolate brioche with balsamic caramel ice cream and spiced yogurt, perfect milk and cookies. Sate savory cravings with nibbles like roasted potatoes with hazelnut romesco.  The menu pairs with wines; microbrews; Blue Bottle coffee; or a boozy-sweet concoction of sherry, Carnegie Porter, and vanilla ice cream. Indie tunes, emerging artist displays, and board games make for serious playtime.

hVbK6ik0kMfu40Cm0Ht1Bg.review_text: $3 Sangrias. Kung Fu Taco Truck outside, you order from inside and it gets brought in. Awesome kick ass desserts.   - red velvet cake tasted like the devil himself, but was not too rich so perfect   - blueberry mochi cake is definitely a slam dunk  What I liked most was the artwork on the walls. I wished there was more direct light, but the place was awesome otherwise.  Parking is difficult so take a cab.

8ah8CpKHFzP9CDR6XZ0XJw.review_text: what a GREAT idea!  often times, when we're out w/ friends for dinner, we don't want the good company & conversations to end when the meal is over and the bill delivered.  inevitably, we end up trying to catch up in the cold outside the restaurant because we're not quite ready to go home but can't agree on where to go next.  candybar provides the perfect solution!  the space is just cozy enough to accomodate a couple or more than few friends.  what better way to end the night than w/ delectable desserts &/or some wine :)  something for everyone.  we attended the soft opening friday night.  love the decor and the art.  sipped some wine and had to leave early (yeah, i was the one w/ the baby), but we'll DEFINITELY be back!

aWCyi4bqWI7TavF7p1ePAw.review_text: I absolutely love this place!  If you love sweets and board games, this is your place! I love coming here for desserts/drinks and playing Connect Four with friends. This place tends to get busy on weekends, so I'd suggest to come on a weeknight.

BDR9W9lQjpCssHl4HV6tHw.review_text: Love the desserts in this place. The parking sucks but I will come here every chance I get. Love the ambience. Love the Desserts a good balance of salt and sugar.

FqYYd3p-phMkZ5GVjkUzxg.review_text: If I were to run a food or drink establishment, this would be it--dessert, dessert wine, and coffee are three of my favorite things. In San Francisco, Candybar really is one-of-a-kind.  When Candybar first opened, it had a dessert tasting menu. You sampled four very tiny dessert courses for only $13. It was a brilliant and innovative idea; unfortunately, apparently people didn't understand the concept of a dessert tasting menu and would buy one and share it between several people. Ah, Philistines.   But even without the tasting menu, this place is great. The pastry chef seems to have a taste for the creative. The baked hot chocolate with homemade marshmallows (one of the more traditional choices) was amazing--it's like a chocolate lava cake, but just the gooey center, which is, of course, the best part. My friend had the salted buttermilk panna cotta with olive oil, which was also good. Presentation is elegant, as well.  The space itself is nice--cozy and sophisticated. And the bathroom is clean and attractive. I can be kind of prissy, so that stuff is important to me.

jb2qKBqittzOBgnW58jFmQ.review_text: What I love is that all the desserts sound like crap on paper, but they were shockingly good.  We just had a la carte the choco parfait (the matza toffee with smoked salt was yum. i like me a good salt lick) and the choco brioche with balsamic caramel ice cream and lime yogurt was tasty too.  Kind of pricey for just dessert, but that is the price of luxury!  How about prune ice cream with a scoop of Sonoma organic dirt and chicken liver? I think they can make it taste good!!    [Note: I just made that last one up.  It's not on the menu of course.]

zCqZCsuDD-u7qKxRS5ihRQ.review_text: Beautiful uber-composed desserts. I had beet and mascarpone mousse with mint ice cream. Delightful. Great space for a 4+ star dessert without the 4+ star dinner. 8 dollars for what I enjoyed felt like a steal.

7wOMzYCST8yJ4vicwAwaHg.review_text: Unexpectedly, I came here for the first time last week. My friend had gone there the night before & she wanted to go again. I eventually agreed & glad I did so :)  We arrived at about 9:30pm on a Thursday evening. There were quite a number of people in there. Luckily, they had a table for 2 available right away.   Here's what we ordered:  Honey-Almond Panna Cotta - O M G! Sooo DELICIOUS! :) I've tried Panna Cotta once before & this definitely didn't disappoint me. It comes with cherries & chocolate ice cream, which were AMAZINGG! :)  Mango Tango Bellini - YUM!! A sweet cocktail. You can barely taste the alcohol (which is probably a worse thing later on haha). I would definitely recommend this! :)  Candybar Lemon Drop Shot - Not bad at all. Only $5, why not. Haha.   Service was good. Gentleman was very nice. I like the atmosphere here. Chill, candlelit, board games, yummy desserts & cocktails...what more could you ask for?!  My friend & I ended up purchasing the Groupon deal for Candybar. I can't wait to come in the next time & use it :)   Such a fan of Candybar! :)

ahr4N06CLSXoBPpIvOdTKA.review_text: Cool concept but the execution seems to miss the mark.  With a name like candybar you would think they would have a wide assortment of candy and desserts, but the menu is limited.  The place offers some fancy drinks and desserts with prices on the higher end.  Desserts are $8/9, portions small, and not much to choose from.  They try hard to be innovative with the desserts but don't always succeed.  I would say interesting, but not so sure all the ingredients work well together.    I agree with some of the other reviews that the place needs to offer some signature dishes rather than constantly changing the menu which is very limited so you don't know whether to expect a hit or miss.  The old board games are fun but they don't seem to fit in with the concept of pricey drinks and desserts.  They seem to have a more casual crowd for the games who probably just want some coffee or beer and a chocolate chip cookie or chips while they play old board games and then some other clientele who want to lounge with fancy drinks.

2P9dFRWtA0J1xgZI3PvfoQ.review_text: I think this place was made just. for. ME!  Tasty drinks and decadent desserts..mMmmm...90s music, 90s board games..  The  place isn't vast in size (max cap. ~40), but the space is used well and charmingly intimate.  It'd be perfect on a date for the *wink* last stop to grab wine and desserts before heading home *wink*.  Nothing gets a girl like champagne and red velvet cake!  The bubbly and soju cocktails can be rather dangerous for a girl like me who can guzzle tasty drinks down like Gatorade!  My favorite one is an Orange Creamsicle one I specially request them to make.  Second favorite would be the Blueberry Pomegranate (...the sparkly sugar-lined rim delights me haha).    The menu consists of different desserts that are appealing to both the eyes and palate, just like Cordon Bleu graduate pastry chefs in the back ;)

OHgKRj1-Bs0XDsmdO8vDng.review_text: This place is the cutest thing ever. It's the perfect chill and romantic place to go. I went there twice, in the day and night.  At night I went with a bunch of friends and we were kinda amazed at how cute the place was. Cool decor and art on the walls and lounge seating kinda. They also had board games which is totally genius.  I LOVE THE APPLE A LA MODE!! Best damn thing ever. I wish I had the recipe but it's warm and very rich. My friends ordered the strawberry something and mousse which wasn't that good.  Second time I went was with a date and we had fun playing more board games but i ordered the raspberry brownie with mint ice cream which was suggested to me but I didn't really like it. The mint ice cream was straight up mint. I know, duh, mint but it was weird. We also had the peanut butter and jelly and that was okay. i wasn't satisfied so I ordered the apple thing again!  Overall, the vibe and environment is a totally cute place to take a date t night. It's warm and dim lights. I guess depending on your taste the desserts are a hit and miss. I'm telling you the apple a la mode is bomb.  PARKING is difficult at night!

bQOouBetqy31RaEY1v5nqg.review_text: Went here again to use a Groupon or LivingSocial deal that I bought a while ago. And the drinks were delicious but the desserts were pretty bad! I still do not understand why they took off the menu the best thing they had, red velvet cake with coconut frosting and shreds! I've been asking them ever since and they keep saying it's not coming back. BRING IT BACK!  The other good dessert that they have, the Lemon Tart they were out of when we tried to order it! So we had to settle for that chocolate/bacon/red velvet sponge in the cup (disgusting by the way) and apple a la mode, which was decent. Mango Tango bellini and strawberry kiss drinks were yummy, though. I wish I could like this place more because I love the idea of it, but it is just not the same as it used to be (dessert quality wise).

emF8KqAfI2VL6Sfaek9gFg.review_text: Kickin' it old school in the old 'hood with Candybar...  Side story to go along with the review is that I used to live right up the street from this place, which had only been open for maybe a couple of months at the point when I moved. In those two short months, however, notice I did that the address here is1335 Fulton, and my old house's address was 1553 Fulton! When I met the owner Tan at Yelp's Project One event, I told him this, and I joked that he may be getting some of my old mail by mistake. Ha. Ha.  Well, even if I'm the only one who finds this inverted-version-of-my-old-address-is-Candybar's-­address idea amusing, at least it enabled Tan to remember me when I showed up here last night for a post-dinner snack. It's always nice when people remember you! Add to that a nice, helpful wait staff and a loungey, intimate interior (there's something unique and sexy about the lighting) and you may very well feel as if you're chillin' in your supercool neighbor's living room.  My date and I shared the chocolate brioche with vanilla ice cream and strawberries. It had a crispy, creme brulee-like outside and a moist, substantial inside which was filling and decadent in a conventional way. But it was our second surprise dessert (thanks Tan!) that won the favorite award of the night: lavender ice cream and blackberries served on a white chocolate wafer. So simple, yet the flavors were different and delicious. Judging from these and the little bites served at Project One, I'd say Candybar's got some really smart and creative dessert chefs in tow!  Ah, Candybar. If I needed a reason to move back to NOPA, you'd probably be it.

-u0YqrtaV2WS4qJcaJfJeA.review_text: Tried this place and it seemed like a great idea...lounge area..desserts...drinks/bar..but in reality it's a little disappointing.  Drinks were either too sweet or too weak.  The sangria tasted like just juice.  Service was just average...most guys serving/hosting there looked like poster boys for hipsters! They were either too busy trying to look cool/show swag that didn't bother getting water for our table.  Desserts were exaggerated in price range 9-10 dollars for something that was no bigger than your fist...they tasted good but nothing out of the ordinary.  Maybe I came on a bad day..will give it a try again in the near future.

FW09IW3FXPr2Qu1Tsk5a7g.review_text: Hey Candybar~  I'd give you 3.75 stars if I could, but I want you to take my comments into consideration, so the 3 stars is to get your attention... (sorry!)  Summary: Excellent experience. Expensive.  Details:  Many things were exceptional - decor, ambiance, music, service, quality of the product - I applaud the innovative concept & skillful execution in getting this off the ground!  ...but I gotta take down a star for one of my top pet peeves: tiny tiny portions. Coupled with an expensive wine list with just a couple of choices under $10, and I'm spending $20-30 for dessert & drinks...no can do as a regular habit.  I want to come here regularly after dinner & share desserts with friends, have a drink, and keep it under $20 per person after it's all said and done. This is hard if not impossible to do with the pricing & portions here. The warm vanilla cake, while sublime, was hard to share even between 2 people - you just feel a little ridiculous sharing something smaller than a hostess cupcake on a plate. For $8 a pop, I think the desserts should be comfortably sharable among two people, 2 dishes for 3 people, etc.  I pray for you to consider 1) pricing your desserts to $5-6 each, or 2) making them bigger. I'm not sure how this affects the supply/demand/revenue scenario, but I think you can strike a balance, and it looked like you'll be getting your take through the healthy beverage offerings.  Speaking of... can you offer a couple more moderately priced wine choices? If I'm coming here after dinner, I've already spent a good amount on food & wine. I know your ambiance deserves a premium, but please help me keep the financial pain within a reasonable threshold.

52nHXA618zIoenoJp1XqEg.review_text: candybar.  not so sweet after all.  ZING!  i really wanted to like this place.  i really really REALLY did.  i LOVE sweet wines and i LOVE desserts even more.  but to my utter disappointment, candybar was a complete disaster.  i'm going to preface this by saying that most of the issues that happened tonight were probably due to the fact that they just opened a week ago.  they should really consider making some drastic changes to their establishment if they want to avoid what happened my friends and i tonight.  it was partially our fault because we didn't have reservations.  we walked in at about 8:30 PM.  there were a few tables open and one bench open.  we told them we didn't have reservations so they offered us the bench.  with a party of four, all of us sitting on a bench wasn't the ideal conversation set-up so we asked how long it would be for a table.  about 20 minutes they said.  just in case, they penciled us in for 9:15 but they said it should be a lot sooner.  9:15 comes by and after two rounds of drinks at the "bar" we still don't have table.  the "bar" is so small only about 6 people can stand around it.  the place is pretty crowded by that time and they offered us the bench again.  anxious to sit, we decided to just take the bench.  alright.  so we sat, looked at the menu and waited for someone to take our order.  and we sat some more.  after about 15 minutes of just sitting there, a waitress tried to take our menus away.  "oh, wait.  we didn't order yet."  the waitress said that she'll tell someone right away.  15 minutes went by and another waitress asked us if we wanted to order something.  we said yes.  she then got distracted by a worker at the bar.  and simply walked away.  yes, she walked away.  no, "hold on a second" or "i'll be right back".  she just plain up and walked away.  we were dumbfounded.  she came back about 10 minutes later and informed us that we have to first close our bar tab before we could order.  say what?  why they couldn't just switch it over, i really don't know.  so we paid and she brought us back our receipt.  then she left again before taking our order!  after that, my friends were all so pissed off we just decided to leave.  of course right when we were about to stand up, the waitress came back and asked what we wanted to order.    screw that.  we left and headed two blocks over to NOPA.  we sat down at the open seating area, ordered 4 delicious desserts and left within half the time we spent at candybar.  another surprise at candybar was the fact that the even the bartender hasn't tried all the wines!  we asked how one of the wines were and he said that he has never tasted it.  uh.... what?  most establishments have their bartenders and waiters sit down and taste each wine so that they know about the wines they serve.  the fact that even the bartender has not tried the wines really suggests to me that they shouldn't promote themselves as a wine bar.  so my friends and i have a few suggestions for this place: 1. get rid of reservations on crowded nights - unless you want to run your place more like a restaurant than a lounge, the reservations have got to go.  you'll alienate anyone who wants to just have a few drinks and some dessert.  sure, if someone wants to eat dinner, then allow them to make reservations at earlier times.  however, if you want to break into the bar scene, you can't restrict people from sitting at open tables.  2. get rid of the board games on crowded nights.  the last thing you want is a group who sits at a table for two hours playing connect four when they aren't really drinking or eating.  3. educate your workers.  "i've never tried that wine" should never EVER be spoken by a waiter or a bartender.  4. put more movable chairs in the "lounge" area.  there's a lot of dead space that can be used.  make the most of it.  i have high hopes for this place which is why i really would like to come back in a month or two to see how everything has developed.  the wines were very good and the desserts LOOKED tasty (keyword: looked).  once things are fine-tuned, candybar might be everything i was hoping it would be.

VK-ds3dGSSBoavkFde3e2Q.review_text: Dessert and wine, my girlfriend's two favorite things:  what will we do: Come here all the time!  The desserts are decadent, almost too pretty to eat, and delicious.  The wines are perfect to pair with the desserts.  The atmosphere is relaxed, casual and grownup all at the same time, if you can while playing board games and eating dessert and drinking wine.  All in all, it's like having friends over at your really grown up apartment with wine, dessert and games.  Love it.

GqzoKYXv6F1O85bhywyoSA.review_text: I hope that last star will be earned when I come back next time for their desserts!  If only I wasn't so stuffed from dinner!!  Parking in this area is terrible!  You end up driving in circles for awhile if you are not lucky!!  CandyBar itself in the front doesn't have a distinct sign, but there is a redish light at night for you to identify it.  They make it look mysterious with tinted windows but once you go inside, you have this warm, candle-lit, and intimate setting.  It is perfect for dates and just hanging out, with their different kinds of seating arrangement around the venue.  This gives me a small glimpse of NYC.  They have a wide variety of desserts, specialty cocktails, wines, beers, and non-alcoholic beverages for you to enjoy.  Ordered the strawberry fizz and the drink that consist of red wine and coke.  They were delightful and so LIGHT to drink.  It didn't make us fat like we usually feel like.  Each were about $8 each, which is not bad at all for a dessert bar.  I love their modern decor and koi fish mural painting.  I can't wait to come back for their desserts and to enjoy their MASSIVE selection of board games to enjoy with your loved ones,while eating/drinking at this cute place!    Need to hit their happy hour :)

88qLfMt45wIB1in74KrDMA.review_text: When the waiter asked what I wanted, I responded, "thai noodles!" Since I had rushed to a birthday gathering I hadn't had time to have dinner before desserts. I skimmed the menu for what looked like the most filling dessert and I decided it was the Apple Pie a la Mode...which was delicious! Hazelnut crust, cream cheese filling, caramel, gingerbread ice cream - all of these flavors come together so well!  oh...and $3 Sangrias!! Hell yeah!!

0frQy-1eGN9YUJutO_KXHg.review_text: Milk Chocolate Parfait tops it.  It's delicious.  I went with a party of 6 so with the tasting menu, we pretty much tasted all the dessert items.  Of the items tasted, I clearly remember the Milk Chocolate Parfait (the toffee crunchies ... mmm!), Carrot Cake, and Vanilla cake so I recommend them!  What made the experience that much nicer was each dessert item was presented so artfully and nicely.  I like foo foo stuff.  Great date place.

FX2Yzodqx2cYu1jTSSL12g.review_text: In my opinion xmas lights in wine bars don't mix, either does bad old school hip hop music, in a lounge setting where everyone is sitting around playing board games. Is anyone else confused?  We were a party of 10 seated in front in a reserved area since we made reservations, though at 9pm on a Friday night it wasn't very crowded.   It took at least 30 minutes for someone to come over and take our drink orders. The waiter, who was also the host, was a dude dressed in shorts and a plaid shirt who looked miserable and annoyed being there. I asked him for a NON-sweet cocktail option and he suggested the Jasmine champagne. Turns out, definitely the most sweet option on the menu, after sampling some friends drinks. It was so sweet and syrupy I couldn't even drink it. I finally got his attention and asked if I could get a glass of perseco, he said sure and then came back with the drink 30 minutes later when everyone was ready to leave. I told him we were about ready to go and he told me I could down it pretty fast. Thanks dude, I love chugging sparkling wine.   Speaking of wine, you'd expect a "wine" bar to have more than 5 options of red and 5 of white and have a waiter that is more knowledgeable about the drinks, not a guy that looks like he just spent the day drinking at Dolores Park.   I'll also mentioned that the desserts took about 30 minutes to come out when we ordered 2 for the table. I can't comment on them because I didn't try them.  Overall I don't see any positives about this place unfortunately.

2S37zEYJaLV_gcstDwClwA.review_text: So, I'm a baker and therefore tend to avoid buying desserts because I really like the ones I make. However, I can admit when I am out-done. And this place has some pretty amazing desserts. Not only are they delicious, but they are perfectly proportioned and presented so beautifully that I let myself splurge a little and go out to the City just for Candybar (probably 2-3 times a year). The sparkling wine cocktails are delicious as well. I usually go with two of my good friends, and we sample each other's orders. Their dessert list changes, but there are always fantastic options available. I suggest going here with a small group, maybe a little early because it can get packed! In a group, you can sample multiple desserts and cocktails and not feel like you just consumed all of Willy Wonka's  factory.  There are also a bunch of board and card games available for you and your friends to play! I really enjoy this place, even if it is very dimly lit and a little pricey.  Hint: Both Living Social and Groupon regularly have deals for Candybar!

G9Vb6yQ047TC3O_-GG4WZA.review_text: Candybar You are my world You look so sweet You're a special treat Candybar All I want to say When you're with me You brighten up my day All I know When I'm with you You make me feel so good Through and through The way you walk And the way you talk You always look so good You make me forget my thoughts youtube.com/watch?v=fg2p… I shared the sweetest meal with my sweetest gal pal here, and it couldn't have been better! All the savory and sweet small plates we had were delectable and heavenly: - Chocolate honey glazed beets with goat cheese and kale - Poached halibut with chorizo - Pork belly with celery salad and peach sorbet (must be eaten together in the same bite -- this was my favorite dish of the entire meal) - Kobe bavette in chocolate cherry cola - Vanilla brioche with elderflower apricot/cherry pit ice cream - Chocolate cannelone with chocolate olive creameux/vanilla bean ice cream - homemade truffles And of course, it couldn't have been complete without glasses of Kir Royale! Many thanks to owner Tan, who made our evening extra sweet!

fEOnxiI-AR7Tto36X5DAHg.review_text: One relaxing Friday night, we wandered over to Candy Bar after stuffing ourselves with Little Star Pizza and excellent pinot noir.  I LOVE dessert and this place was really cute, but the whole "nouveau" dessert concept was a bit much.  I would have preferred some good ole classics on the menu in addition to some of their creative fusions.  The chocolate molasses dessert with celery ice cream had too many funky tastes for me.  The fudgesicle with cinnamon cream and corn nuts was decent but not spectacular.  The vanilla brioche with creme brulee crust and apricots was the star of the night - I would go back for this one, the right balance of sweet - and I think the owners know this too because they brought this dessert out last.

oNyu20y9tAZcnn-4vk9pOw.review_text: Egh. Egggghh. :```(  I like the concept. I love desserts. I have an adventurous palate--or so I thought--but the Candybar dessert menu pushed my limits. And then didn't deliver. At ~$8 a pop, I would've rather had Cheesecake Factory.  There were 6-ish options... one paired green tea cake with thyme ice cream. Another included peanut butter, curry and cucumber altogether. Yet another included parsnips. I already ate my veggies, thank you.  Service was fine, music was good, and I liked the availability of board games... but seriously. The options looked bleak on paper, and failed to impress once we actually tasted them.  I would possibly be a fan of this place if it were in, say, Little Rock, Arkansas (with prices to match the market); but here in San Francisco -- I feel like I wasted a dessert :( !! Humphry Slocombe, please!!!

ZBLZIOrO3DZJzDFlFO-bJw.review_text: Tasty Deserts + Minuscule size + high price tag = candybar.   I won't argue - the deserts are VERY tasty, but that definitely comes with a pricetag and not necessarily with the size to match.   I love the desert lounge idea, I really do. If they were just a tad bit bigger I'd be psyched and it's be a 4 star review.   The standout for me was the Chocolate Brioche.  You may burst out laughing when you see the three cookie and 2 fluid ounces of mil you get with the milk and cookies (for $6). Don't say I didn't warn you.   Service was great and the place is very well decorated. I think they need to work on portion sizes and possibly price.

6c191dCvTYxLvjnJANiIjw.review_text: We had read great reviews of this place, so my girlfriend made reservations.  The best thing I can say about this place was that the dessert was...ok.  When we arrived, they didn't have our reservation - even after calling us to confirm a few hours before.  We were seated, perhaps as punishment, by the kitchen door, adjacent to the bathroom, and backdoor.  My shoulder was actually touching the guy's sitting at the table next to us - SOOO CRAMPED!  Was expecting a place to kinda relax, but with the cramped space and waiters knocking my chair on every trip to the kitchen, that was impossible.  We ordered dessert and coffee, but then were told they were out of coffee...uuh ok.  The smell in the place went from stale cloth (presumably from the kitchen curtain), to pot smoke (presumably from the waitstaff out back, to shit (obviously from the bathroom a few feet away).  We rapidly finished our mediocre dessert and escaped to fresh air.

_GkoLHrQdmnSwLgRUEsXJA.review_text: -Finding parking is difficult. If you drive, park on Fell St. and take a stroll. -Intimate place to catch up and/or go on a date.  -If you want to try more desserts, order the "Candy Bar Dessert for Two." -What I've had, and will continue to get: Soft cheesecake and Lavender Honey Creme Fraiche Semi Freddo -Other things to try: Peanut Butter Jelly Time!, Ice Cream Sandwich - Drinks: Mango Tango Bellini, yum  **************  Let's start with the negatives. This is beyond Candy Bar's control, but finding parking here is a pain in the butt. I remember turning over to the driver and saying, "We are never coming here again. ever!! even though the desserts are good." I wasn't even hungry, but driving around in circles sucked. However, we found a SOLUTION. Don't look within a one block radius unless you plan on getting really lucky. We found tons of parking on Fell St leading up to Golden Gate Park, which is only a four block walk from Candy Bar, so no biggie, right? Plus, you'll probably be walking down Divisadero St and will see some fun restaurants you might want to check out in the future. The walk is not bad at all.   Most reviews highlight the board games, but I've never played any. There's chatter all around you, and it's a dimly light place, so perfect for talking with your party over desserts and cocktails.  There are so many desserts on the menu that you'll want to try, but of course, at the price of $10/dessert, you can't afford too many. So, I recommend getting the "Candy Bar Dessert for Two." I think there's a fee if you share with more than one person. Anyway, it was the perfect amount. Four desserts for $25, which is typically the price you'd pay if you bought four separate desserts anywhere else. However, some desserts are not included in this deal :/ like the soft cheesecake. :(((  Soft Cheesecake: A great combo of shortbread, pecans, sweet pink grapefruit leche, Rice Krispy crunch, passion fruit sorbet.  Lavender Honey Creme Fraiche Semi Freddo: almond brittle, nutella, and cantaloupe - we get this every time  Ice Cream Sandwich - honeydew sorbet was great, packed between macaron shells  Peanut Butter Jelly Time! - yummy salted candied peanuts added perfect crunch to the peanut butter cream  Tiramisu - it's good, but my least fav compared to the originality of the other desserts  Service is on par, in other words, they do their job: fill up your water cup, take your order, ask if everything is going well. I do want to highlight, though, that I once came in with an expired Groupon (and as you know, those still retain the purchased value), but they still gave us a complimentary soft cheesecake! WAHH! I think it might be because I mentioned I wanted that, but it didn't come in the "Dessert for Two" option. Now, that's accommodating service!  I'll be back. Just gotta park a few blocks away to avoid an unnecessary temper tantrum xP

GiD1dNspKw7lTVF_rfOjlA.review_text: Awesome place, with such a neat concept! Highly recomended. Had the drunken smores- amazing! they have really cool cocktails and you can sit and play boardgames.. (wish the lighting was a little better)

hSQn3iPSN-JeFxPvCYmNvA.review_text: First of all, the atmosphere is very good, decorated with lights and candles, wonderful place to rest and chat. We ordered a lavender flavored dessert and a green tea-vanilla cake, both are excellent, the lavender one is very special. The cocktails are fine. We used a half off coupon, and didn't expect this could make us full without having dinner! We will definitely come back.

SjX_4tpusPeZd_5a7txkXQ.review_text: Candybar is not your average party scene lounge, it really is a DESSERT BAR that serves wine/beer on the side.  We made reservations for 8 and got a booth in the front, right next to all the board games.    They serve champagne, wine, beer and DESSERT!  My favorite dessert was the green tea ice cream sandwich.  You can taste the biiterness of the green tea bread and it went really well with the ice cream in between.  I also ordered a glass of "strawberry kiss" sparking wine.  This went well with all the desserts we ordered. :)  Parking is a pain and it took us almost 20mins to look for parking.      They close at 12am, so make sure you have additional plans after the lounge.   I will be back!

SsU9BmqDebTxj8it12kNlw.review_text: Eh, this place was alright. The desserts were good but honestly, they're way over-priced because the portions are super tiny. We got the dessert plate for two, but I forgot which ones we got. I know one had banana and chocolate something .... and that one was good! I also got the "Strawberry Kiss" cocktail, but that wasn't too great.  The parking sucks, so good luck with that! Go with your friends, drop them off to put their names down and THEN look for parking. Look far, because you probably won't find anything close.  The service was eh, too. Our waiter wasn't very friendly. We were seated at a table against the window, so my 4 friends and I were in a line. When we saw a 2x2 table (2 facing the other 2) we asked the host if we can sit there and he said no, they need it for a party of 5. We saw the party get seated and they had 4. Not cool.

xie4mBJQr78_eRSENLXNkg.review_text: If you're planning to go to Candybar, make sure you go there early to find parking. Trust me! it's so hard to find parking there. Most likely it will take you 35 mins to an hour to find parking (it's that bad) The atmosphere there is super romantic and super relaxing. Candybar is definitely perfect for a date night or for a girl's night out. While you wait for your desserts to arrive, there's different kind of board games and games that you can play.  One con that I sort of don't like is that once you're done with the desserts, the waiter will rush you to leave.

3n5cOMWafMPPuNHYUD8C2A.review_text: The last 2x that I came here, it was almost dead and I'm hoping that was an anomaly because I would hate to see this place go.    I really enjoy their desserts, particularly how inventive they are.  Flavors that I would never have thought to put together magically comes together really well.  Don't come here expecting creme brulee or plain chocolate cake.  Instead, come here and try the angel food cake with greek yogurt and cherry sorbet.  Or the nacho sundae.  And definitely hit up the happy hour!

Za8VyFxoPAnfYoMCjNrTxA.review_text: I love this place, I love it a lot! Their dessert drinks and desserts are delicious!! I think everything on their menu is good! Thinking about it makes me drool!   They have board games for their customers to play.

5_MhGhgowfS92cu_BQQRkg.review_text: I would have given them 5 stars but I took 1 away cos of the loooooong wait. You can easily be asked to wait 30-45 minutes!! The space is def. cramped n crowded.  Decors n music are loung-y and cool. I like how they also have board games for you to play with friends.   Staff is nice and helpful.  I highly recommend the Honey - Almond Panna Cotta, easily one of the best I've had.

MxnNT3MSGco7hQN6-pCNow.review_text: Aww this place is really cute! Its exactly how it sounds- fun sweet place.   My fellow Yelper CeCe celebrated her birthday here and had the whole front sectioned off to her on a Thursday evening.   There were many fruity/desserty type drinks and  I got the Stawberry kiss- champagne with strawberry.. yummy.   Also ordered the Japanese Cheesecake that was less sweet than regular cheesecake and game with graham cracker bits, melon, and guava sorbet.  I loved it!   As the night progressed the music got louder.  Great place to lounge, enjoy yummy treats and have good conversations.

l0E2uND3lPHlg8_rjd0m1Q.review_text: YUMMY!!!!!!  TO DIE FOR SMORE"S!!!!!!!!!!!!! Chatted up the bartender turned out to be one of the owners, super chill,  cool down to earth guy. Good vibe Fab concept will be back!!

7NRGsP8yrZ3iYaUUZ8xnnA.review_text: DESSERT and BOARD GAMES and DRINKS?! this place was totally made for me and my bf! haha  I bought the LivingSocial deal waaay back and finally came here on the last day of the deal. There was a wait outside and they told us it would only be a 20 minute wait so we decided to take a walk for a bit. When we got back 15-20 min later, the hostess said she already called our name :( So she put us back on the list and we waited maybe 20-30 min longer.   The seating is a little awkward here since the tables and seats are pretty low. The tables aren't that big either sooo it is kinda difficult to play a big board game and eat at the same time. We just played "Would You Rather?" while we waited for our food and drinks.   DESSERT: I got the Ice Cream Sundae which comes with macarons, brownies, strawberry sherbert, strawberries and bananas. The brownies were really yummy which is surprising since I don't really like brownies. The macarons were disappointing though :( I didn't like the texture since they were a bit too crunchy/hard.   My bf got the Peanut Butter Jelly Time and OMG. This was DELICIOUS. I wish I got this instead hahaha! I wouldn't have minded us both getting it, it was that good! The chocolate tart and peanut butter cream tasted soooooo good together. It was a perfect combo of salty and sweet. The blackberries and peanuts topped it off perfectly too :)  DRANKS: I got the Strawberry Kiss which has sparkling wine, ginger ale, and frozen strawberry. It was reallly tasty. Definitely didn't taste like alcohol at all loll and I barely got buzzed off it. But it was cute! And there was a strawberry in there :)  My bf got the Blueberry Pomegranate Soju and it was also yummy but I liked my drink more haha :D  Overall, I really like the concept of the place. It's probably more fun to come with a group to play a board game though. The dessert here was delicious, especially the PBJ Time and the drinks were yummy :) I'll be back!

vpEUTxk-Deb3LaJwm3c-cg.review_text: I had higher expectations for a dessert bar/lounge named Candybar.   First of all, I thought the desserts were way too small for a dessert place. If I had been served the same size dessert after a nice dinner, that would have been fine. We went sort of hungry, saving room at dinner for the desserts, and we were greatly disappointed. The flavors of the chocolate currant cake we tried were good, but it was tiny! And there was a fruit salad with a lavender ice cream that was not that great.... When you are going out specifically for dessert, I'd appreciate it being a satisfying experience, instead of feeling like you have to order two, therefore spending $19 just on the desserts before drinks. I guess I also thought perhaps they might be candy inspired, but nope.  The game selection was a little weak. Plus, people would take multiples to their tables leaving none for other tables. Sure it is fun playing games of your childhood with friends, but when there are no directions or missing pieces.... your enthusiasm for the games quickly dwindles.   3 stars because our chocolate cake was good. Otherwise, it would have been two. I'd rather eat dinner at a restaurant and just spend my $ on drinks, I guess. I really wanted to like this place more than I did.

yUjXPUjPBOvpPCDLw-OIPg.review_text: LURVE this place. The desserts and drinks are inventive and delicious. My favorite was the blood orange fruit salad. The textures and flavors that were in that dish was to die for. Great Prosecco too. The staff was very kind and quick with our order. We even got a free dessert after inquiring about one we saw at another table.

hgUSn_pO-HWU949eY4hCOA.review_text: I came here on the recommendation of a friend and we came last one night about an hour before closing.  The place was packed! I didn't think we'd be able to get a table but somehow we did.    The menu was amazing! So many different drinks and desserts to try! We ordered the sampler for the 4 of us- I'd hardly call this a sampler! IT"S HUGE! If you have a major sweet tooth this a place for you. They say that this is for 2 people when it was more than enough for 4.  We went a couple of weeks ago so I've sort of forgotten what we had but I remember liking 3/4.  We also had coffee and water which took a long time time to get which was kind of annoying.  They seemed rather understaffed and everyone was running around.    The price seemed high but it was a lot of food.  I also liked that they had board and card games available.  Alcohol, games and sweets? Sign me up! I would go back earlier in the evening next time.

2FYx5c0EsILYTxbJ625ehg.review_text: My bf and I came here for dessert. Tried the sampler which we enjoyed! While we were enjoying the dessert we noticed they had a shelf full of games. We ended up having a romantic nite eating dessert and playing board games.  Our desserts:  1. Peanut Butter and Jelly: my bf loved this one! It was his favorite. I wanted a glass of milk (too peanut butter-y for me) with it before I could have anymore...but he was happy the way it was. 2. Strawberry Limonade: Perfect balance of texture and sweetness.  3. Vanilla Panna Cotta: great dessert but got to be plain 1/2 thru. I needed more texture. If you like smooth simple desserts this one is for you.  4. Apple a la mode: my favorite of the nite even though I'm not a apple pie fan. Well executed.   I don't think you could go wrong with whatever you order. Cocktails are fun too. Make reservations.

JiFBQ_-vWgJtRZEEruSStg.review_text: The desserts were okay at best but the atmosphere is really chill. There are board games  available to play but the instructions were missing.  :( In all, nice little outing but nothing too fancy to brag about.

I5kKyqGki1GAV_gttwd2PA.review_text: Yes will be back here next time I need some GOODIES . Not bad on price as well. Heard about this place and was not sure but I AM NOW !!! I will be back

GABWrw5Et9jubriKwMUDbw.review_text: My Saturday night surprise was very sweet.   Literally.   We shared the dessert for 2 sampler: tiramisu, flourless chocolate cake, panna cotta and lemon tart. My favorite was the tiramisu.  Games: not a huge variety, mostly candyland, chutes and ladders and card games.   Jasmine sparkle: sweet but not too sweet. i was trying to pair it with the lemon tart but really, i just love champagne.

9EI94e2iuU7-zWxr05eJGQ.review_text: had a groupon for this place so the boyf and i went on a tuesday night. it looked fancy and dark when we got in but then there were board games so that was kind of conflicting information about the atmosphere. furthering this, we wanted to sit at a table rather than couches, but also wanted to play a game. so we grabbed connect four and sat at a dark table with a candle.  i had the jasmine sparkling wine and the boyf had a creamsicle-tasting drink. he also got tiramisu and i got the lavendar honey ice cream. the drinks were really good and so were the desserts. i love lavendar honey ice cream and this was amazing. it was richer than normal (i think it's a frozen creme fraiche?) and just really creamy and delicious. came with some great almond brittle too.  service was really good. our waiter was very nice about our awkward finagling of connect four on our tiny table and onto the one next to us.  it was very good, but honestly, i don't think i'd pay the regular price of those items. i think the ice cream was nine and the tirmisu was ten. our drinks were tiny and eight or nine bucks too. it's just not good enough for the price but it is good. i think i'd go back to hang out and play games but it wouldn't be a regular place to get drinks and snacks.

2Oh2eUHcP7Cn3AwldLFIgA.review_text: I came here with my buddy Brent T last week.  I think I was expecting something more like a late-night bakery than a dessert bar, so I was pleasantly surprised.  The ambiance is definitely a very hipster vibe with the low, colored lighting, underground hip hop music, and the artwork on the walls complete with a shelf of board games patrons were free to enjoy while they were there.  It was sometimes hard to tell who the servers were because they were dressed like the patrons.    Brent T summed up our desserts pretty accurately, so I will just say that my favorite was the lavender honey creme fraiche semi-freddo (love love love the almond brittle!!), and my least favorite was the lemon tart.  This would be a great date place if the volume was low enough to have conversation.  But maybe that also makes it perfect for a date because they have to LEAN IN CLOSER for conversation.  Score, lol.

wL-pr_3Cn6U9baJ3df9VXw.review_text: What a trippy place - It's almost like the scotch tape store in an old SNL skit.   How narrow of a market can you get? CandyBar is narrow! It is dessert and wine, with some bubbles too.   The menu is very small and very focused. There were seven or so desserts to choose from and about 8 types of wine by the glass and a couple champagnes by the glass. Including a rose. Very nice. I think it may have been a proseco, either way it was very good.   As i chose a dark chocolate something with sugared cranberries and a Meyer lemon granita, I had a nice hearty Zin. I love chocolate and zin.   My lil sugar had the baked hot chocolate. My favorite choice of the night. It was simply amazing. He wasn't too fond of the homemade marshmallow but i sure was!   My BFF had the Cayenne Cinnamon Mouse. Wow. Different and oh so good. We had a couple bites that were crazy spicy and sweet. I like the mix of sweet and savory, it was really good.   Still, the baked hot chocolate was amazing, chocolate souffle esque cake under a thick measure of dense hot cocoa and a dollop of thick creamy homemade marshmallow! Yum   Its a very cool spot and we walked right in on a Saturday night about 10:30 or so.   Its a cool look and a polished finish yet they have boardgames you can play and it has a total neighborhood feel. Its off the beaten path and not readily visible unless you are on the missin to find it.   But do find it! Have some hot chocolate and play some games with your mates, its what life is all about!

6Ct6xwJt7AJD9amnMkNckA.review_text: 4.0 Stars  Candybar.  It's a mix of a dessert cafe, bar, and art gallery.  That's a new concept to me and I like it.    Once I stepped into this place, I felt a pretty good vibe.  Maybe it was the relaxed atmosphere, maybe it was the intriguing desserts, or maybe it was the Jay-Z beats playing over the sound system.  (...and the Jay-Z song was on...and the Jay-Z song was on...)  Sorry about that. Too much Miley Cirus over the radio.  I digress.  Whatever it was, I was ready to have a good time.  My friends and I got there at 10PM on a Saturday night.  Be forewarned though.  The parking around here is known to be atrocious.  Just read all the countless reviews about that.  I had to circle the place for a good 30 minutes before I found a decent spot nearby.    Once we got in, there was a little more waiting.  It took about 15 minutes before we got a table to sit down.  While waiting I got a chance to peruse the dessert menu so I knew what I wanted when I got seated.  Peanut Butter Jelly Time! - $9 *Chocolate Tart/Peanut Butter Cream/Salted Caramel Peanuts/Blackberries *This was super tasty and I tasted like I was eating a giant Reese's Peanut Butter Cup with fruit. *The Salted Caramel Peanuts were a good mix of crunchy and sweet. *The Chocolate Tart crust was delectable too.  It was like a chocolate cookie.  I enjoyed my dessert and played a fun game of Sorry! with my friends.  They offer a wide range of games to play so you definitely won't get bored here.  Check this place out. Your eyes will be opened to a new experience visually, audibly, and tastefully.  Quick Tip: If you can, make a reservation before coming.  It tends to get packed on Friday or Saturday night and people like to hang around and talk after they finish their desserts or drinks.  == A MUST TRY! ==

sY_uz6P1sux3tKt1TEGqjA.review_text: We went to Candybar after a very filling dinner at Tataki and it turned out, I still had room for 4 different desserts (Of course I cried myself to sleep 2 days later after checking my weight but oh well...)  Nice and relaxing ambience, tasteful book selections, lots of board games to choose from, and the desserts!  I kept telling myself that this is gonna be the last bite but it never was...   My personal favorite is the lemon tart. Can't wait to go back and try some more.

kNT1CgO1Q2Go1BeBqktzRg.review_text: We called for a reservation and had to change it several times and they were very polite about that.  Came here with a group of 7: 4 guys, 3 girls on a Friday night.  Parking was a pain as we parked probably 5 blocks away.  Atmosphere was chill.  Dark lighting so the boardgames that were on the side, were less appealing cause who wants to play in the dark.  We ordered the Japanese cheesecake and Big Francesco's Tiramisu.  Both were good.  While the girls ordered their cocktails, the guys all ordered beer.  It really seemed like a place for a girls night out.  Waiters and waitress were friendly and were quick to pick up empty plates and glasses.  The atmosphere is really a bar, just meant for a female audience.  If I was a chick, I'd take my girlfriends here for a girls night out cause of the dessert and cocktail selection.

hOwNzTU0g0UzNLNQhhuHEQ.review_text: I love the concept of a dessert bar! Alcohol and dessert - yes, please :) We had the Drunken S'Mores with Salted Caramel and the French Macaron Honeydew Ice Cream Sandwich both of which were out of this world (although the ice cream kind of hardened the macaron....). Cannot wait to come back!

kWUFveeNiUM4jHMgc04QgQ.review_text: Such a fan!  Jasmine P. and I met in SF to continue our food/drink adventures, and this was definitely one for the books.   We got dessert for two (Four desserts for $25):   Ice Cream Sandwich Almond Parisian Macaron / Chocolate Ganache / Berries / Honeydew Ice Cream (Gluten Free)  Apple Ala Mode Hazelnut Crust / Cream Cheese Filling / Caramel / Gingerbread Ice Cream  Big Francesco's Tiramisu Coffee Chiffon / Chocolate and Rum Mascarpone Cream / Coffee Bits / Chocolate  Flourless Chocolate Banana Torte Pineapple / Peanuts / Chantilly / Vanilla Bean Ice Cream (Gluten Free)  They all left me with a happy palate, accompanied by the Mango Tango Bellini and the Jasmine Sparkle cocktails. Great place for a date or for a night out with the girls! The atmosphere is cute and intimate without being overly romantic, so Candybar is a versatile post-dinner place!

SI0B9MRW_x3O9ua-L3gvPA.review_text: loved their chocolate indulgence dessert, so freaking good!! also their white chocolate one was good too!! defintley coming back here for more desserts and try the wine!

WwmWdDCJREohcxQqfnOL-A.review_text: I had such high hopes! Got a glass of mediocre wine (wine list isn't extensive so everything should be good). Apple a la mode committed the worst sin an apple pie-ish dessert could do --cold! The apples should have been heated up! The desserts tasted pre-made to be honest.  Gingerbread ice cream on top was great. I wish I had just gotten a bowl of that instead. Our server was bored/disinterested. Rude.   Nice that they have board games. Playing Connect 4 was the highlight of our night. Food and service were sadly lacking.

OqH85SAF0oLijVY_SeAk8A.review_text: Veryyy romanticals *__*    Because the Toast is so good at the plans and making them, instead of a regular dinner reservation at NOPA, we had a 10pm reservation. I'm not much of a late dinner kinda gal, but it really worked out. We stopped by Candybar for some pre-dinner drinks. The happy hour seems pretty good. Unfortunately, we missed it before we even left, and we're never usually in the area around those hours. Darn :/   I tried the Blood Orange Cocktail and Toast had the Frozen Strawberry Cocktail. Both drinks were very yummy and kinda girly. The atmosphere is very candlelit red glowy romantical. Totally a date place. Since we had some time to kill before dinner, we also tried the Raspberry Cocktail. Also very delicious and sweet. There are boardgames and fun stuff like Connect 4, Battleship, and Uno.  I definitely want to come back and try the desserts! They look soo good. 10pm reservations = more time for teh drinking. WIN

CXoCh1bwbIKGYbY6xdP9Dw.review_text: Good desserts, a bit pricey. If you are looking to hang out, good luck. On a busy night once they take the dirty plates and you do not order anything, the check comes and it's time for you to leave.

uNTI2oxtBl2voaKs2phqdg.review_text: We got the carrot cake and it was the best ever. It came with the banana ice cream which was also amazing. Service could definitely be better. I just love this concept of a dessert lounge.....cocktails, desserts & boardgames pure genius!!

af6ayEH9BzsOPQRoxKNE0Q.review_text: Went here with a girlfriend last night for the first time and I have a feeling I'll be back! This is a unique spot in the city with a total girls-night-out or let's-prolong-our-date-a-bit vibe. The menu has a good selection of different desserts and champagne-based cocktails as well as your traditional beers or wines by the glass. (There's also a cheese plate option for when your brain explodes from the sugar rush.)  We split the flourless banana torte and the peanut butter jelly time. I was a huge fan of the banana torte - yummy, not overwhelmed by banana like that fruit often tends to do. I'm the hugest fan of PB&J sandwiches, but I was less of a fan of that one. The girls at the table next to us insisted we order this one, and it was decent but if/when I come back I'll try something else.  Cocktails: strawberry kiss and red wine sangria, both recommended.  Plus one star for the amazing selection of board games. If I can eat chocolate while kicking my friend's/date's ass at Connect Four, it's a winner in my book.  Happy Hour is 6-8 and has $3 champagne. I will be making it out to that at some point.  Minus one star for not letting us change the ice cream flavor on the ice cream sundae. I really wanted a sundae, but strawberry is not my thing. Let me order it with vanilla and I'll give you that elusive fifth star, candybar.

knw4pSBABkPEG0zto6oTGg.review_text: Love the atmosphere.  It's a laid-back dessert bar with boardgames.  I've been here twice with a rather large group of friends.  I've tried quite a few of their desserts such as apple a la mode, carrot cake, strawberry limeade, buttermilk vanilla bean panna cotta, flourless chocolate cake and tiramisu.  None of the desserts really stood out.  I'm not a big fan of desserts (except ice cream and apple pie) so I can't really give a fair review.  I tend to find desserts to be too sweet.  The one dessert I would not order again is the apple a la mode.  It was really sweet and that's about all I can remember.  I did enjoy the ginger ice cream though.    Staff is great and very accommodating.  We were a party of 8 and the place was packed on a rainy night.  They were going to close in 45 minutes and we were still waiting for a table.  A table finally opened up near the window and we were able to squeeze ourselves into the spot that really seated about 6. They let us stay about an hour after closing.  While they closed up, we chatted away.  Not once did they ask us to leave.

VmlShd8k2tq7-O4TVx5R1Q.review_text: My review depending On Who You Are:  You love desserts! If you love desserts and have a sweet tooth then Candybar is a perfect place for you! Candybar serves different types of desserts with creative presentation.   You love sweet alcoholic drinks + wine! Candybar serves their own mixed drinks and dessert wines. My fav is Strawberry Kiss, its not too sweet or bitter.   You don't want to spend another chill night at Starbucks! Candybar is a great alternative from the regular coffee shop down the street. They have cards, board games and etc to keep you entertain.  You dot like desserts! If you don't really like desserts but willing to hang out with your friends then you might not like the concept and the prices. The desserts are tad expensive especially if you dont have a sweet tooth.

HCqnqm1qysExwgDxXdCgCA.review_text: This place is such a cute joint for a little date rendezvous or a girls night out!  Everything fromt the service, the drinks, the ambiance, and the board games.    Candybar is an intimate joint that isn't really made for big parties.  I wouldnt go here with more than four people, but I guarantee that you will have a fun time.    My friend and I played the game of life over some champagne cocktails.  It's like a grown up play date!

4x7LmgcKW3ASIvxr2drHSQ.review_text: I was really looking forward to fall in love with this place... But I didn't.   Good selection of desserts. I love the ice cream sandwich the most. Very good macaroon, haven't had one in a long time. With blueberry vanilla ice cream, yumm....  My friend picked the Japanese cheesecake. There is nothing japanese about it. The sorbet, graham crackers, and chopped honeydew just didn't come together as a plate....  We also had the recommended Chocolate financier cake with frozen bavarian cream. The cake itself was mediocre, but it was a good plate overall.   I will be back to try more desserts for sure!   A lot of drinks with sparkling wine... I had the blood orange with sugar cuba. Pretty interesting.  Oh, I love the decor. I also love the service.

vSMdYDzFiWcjMjosmcKPlg.review_text: It's a fun hang out place with great desserts and great drinks if you're looking for nice place to get together for a birthday celebration or a bridal shower this is the place to be...however, it's extremely hard to find parking and if you do, your chance of parking far away and on a hill is high so be prepared to hike in your heels ladies.   I ordered the red velvet cake with a glass of Riesling and they were both superb.  The Peanut Butter Jelly Time was a bit much so I wouldn't recommend it unless you're a huge fan of peanuts and more peanuts.

4MJ7go3WJwIcak_17vWw9w.review_text: Came here to celebrate Cece C.'s birthday where I hung out with fellow yelpers, Sarah Z. and Jimmy H. & everyone else who was very friendly.   The atmosphere was very modern like a coffee shop but dimly lit therefore you cannot get some work done here.   I loved the couches. I ordered a  Strawberry Kiss  sparkling wine, ginger ale, frozen strawberry...8 - I am not a heavy drinker and this was perfect for me. Tasted like strawberry juice and the whole strawberry in there was delightful!   I shared a sampler for $25 with another attendee:  Lavender Honey Creme Fraiche Semi Freddo almond brittle, nutella powder, cantaloupe - tasted like ice cream. I loved the hint of lavender. It felt healthy! Ha Ha!   Big Francesco's Tiramisu Coffee Chiffon, Chocolate and Rum Mascarpone Cream, Coffee Bits, Chocolate... YUM YUM!   Strawberry Limeade strawberry mousse, vanilla cake, calamansi cream, strawberries - This was my favorite. It came in a small glass jar with the cut strawberries on top. It really did taste like a strawberry limeade!   Flourless chocolate cake - It tasted like a brownie. The highlight was the sorbet that was sitting on the side.   It is slightly pricy. I spent 20 dollars. Service was amazing!   Tip: Order the sampler to share. You get to taste more items.

prDIzYC5FhN90ELcmeTlkA.review_text: This place an awesome place to take a date or a gal pal to catch up and chill out. They have some really interesting sounding cocktails and I loved that they had board games [Connect Four, FTW!] The design of the place is nice and feels like your friend's cool loft or something. Their deserts are also pretty decadent and music choice is great. There's a great atmosphere and I would recommend coming before or after dinner.

puS8HuNdeXhhl5F4bb0EEg.review_text: When my friend and I had dinner, I suggested we have dessert at Candybar instead.  What a great decision for the night.  We wanted to sit at the bar and it only took 5 minutes of wait.  We got the "dessert for two" on the menu.  For $25 you get to choose 4 different desserts to share.  It was the ice cream sandwich, the chocolate financier cake, strawberry limeade and Lavender Honey Creme Fraiche Semi Freddo.  Great choices, full of flavor, rich in sweetness.  The ambiance is definitely perfect for dates.  The art works on the walls are great conversation pieces as well.  We had the chance to chit chat a little bit with one of the owners, Chris.  We made sure he knows we liked the place, at how simple it was but truly elegant.

hdZWFVg0tr50Ps2uwG5YlA.review_text: Came here with a few friends on a quiet Sunday night.  We arrived 5 minutes before closing and the waiter told us we can come in if we hurry.  Maybe since it was a Sunday night, we found parking right outside the restaurant.    Food was 5 stars.  Everything came out really quick and the services was pretty attentive.  We ordered the following:  -Lavender honey creme fraiche semireddo - my fav!  So yum!  It came with some almond brittle that was just so sweet and crunchy!  I absolutely loved the subtle lavender flavor too.  Bliss! -Green tea ice cream sandwich - My 2nd fav dish!  This dish surprised me!  Green tea ice cream squeezed between two macaroon cookies.  The cookies were so soft and the ice cream very creamy.  Loved it! -Japanese cheesecake - this dish was ok.  It was very good but it didn't taste that different from other Japanese cheesecakes I've had.  The guava sorbet that it came with was full of flavor and I couldn't get enough! -Apple a la mode - This was a bit sweet for my taste.  There was caramel drizzled all over this dessert and it was just too much for me.  I didn't get a chance to try any of the cocktails but I will definitely be back to indulge myself some more!

ErEJsypAr9r48gy92Nbxpw.review_text: I'm not necessarily the biggest dessert person. Not that I don't love them. Just because I know that once I start eating sweets I will not stop. If that makes any sense.  My mom wanted some dessert after Espetus Churrascaria, surprisingly because I was damn full after that meatfest. We stepped in and it was hella dark. From far away, we thought it was closed. But once I saw the menu, I saw the words CALAMANSI in one of the desserts and i was like, wait WHAT?! Obviously there had to be some Filipinos working up in here because no one puts calamansi in their dishes otherwise. And if they do, they call it kumquat or something. We ordered the Lavender Honey Creme Fraiche Semi Freddo and the Strawberry Limeade. Initially, I thought I was going to like the lavender one better, but the Strawberry Limeade (which had the calamansi cream) was just uber delicious. It took a long time for us to figure out what it tasted like, but we finally figured it out. It tastes like a damn STARBURST. A starburst in dessert form, omg are you kidding me? I have to come here again.  This place honestly feels like a chill place to have desserts and drinks with a few friends for some lifetalks and maybe even play some board games. If you aren't looking for that crazy-let's-get-wasted night, then this is a nice alternative. I will defnitely be coming back here again.

x1paA3aUHJTurbtFkBSOGg.review_text: Another overdue review!   Came a few months ago because I had a groupon that was almost at its expiration date. Parking around this neighborhood sucks! Took us a few rounds til we got lucky and got a parking a block away. The place was packed but we got seated within 5 minutes which was nice. It's pretty loud inside and can get warm fast, the spot is on the smaller side and is very dim.. cute for dates. We had two different drinks, I forget which ones now but both had champagne in it and I noticed a lot of the drinks did. We had the ice cream sundae which had macarons under the ice cream. Sooo good! and we also had the tiramisu which was delicious as well. Can't wait to go back and try the other desserts! Yum!

UrB2DRfEgwDzORmlpjasrg.review_text: Came here two nights in a row.  First night had no problem finding parking because I arrived before 6pm, they open at 6.  The second night, Saturday night, we were not so lucky, came a little after 6 and spent 40 minutes looking for parking.  It was terrible to have to drive around and around, all over the place, two blocks away, three blocks away, you get the gist, just about killed me trying to come here again.    However, I had two Groupons and I was going to use them before the expiration.  I'm tired of my groupons expiring lol!  (I've cut back on purchasing groupons! :)   You get two cocktails and two desserts.  I'm not going to go into too much detail but I didn't think the strawberry limeade was that great, 50/50 cocktail was yummy! the other champagnes were, you know, champagnes.  The ice cream sundae was good, the tiramisu was very good.  The panna cotta wasn't bad.   It's a great place to come and hang out, chill, eat some dessert and drink some cocktail.  If you have a groupon, it's a good deal, otherwise it might be a bit on the pricey side.  However, they have happy hour so that is good!   A side note, if you guys like a place being super dark and that includes the bathroom, you'll love this place lol.  I had to hold the menu to my face like I lost my glasses just to read it, they do provide a candle on your table for 'reading by candlelight' :)  I did a lot of squinting, and wondering if my vision would be affected after this experience but I did figure out what I wanted to order eventually!     Last thing, first night had a male waiter, exceptional service!  Second night, a girl in a ponytail that might need to work on her customer service skills a bit! :)

cTIO1CeKMzTwezaL0gugAg.review_text: I came here last night to celebrate a friend's birthday, and was very, very pleased with the excellent service and high quality of the desserts.  The Apple A La Mode with the cream cheese filling, hazelnut crust and gingerbread ice cream was DIVINE. The only way that dessert could be made better was to include more of each ingredient!  On a Sunday night, the ambiance was chill and welcoming. My only critique is that the lighting was a bit dim, and the music a bit techno-y.  It would've been nice for there to be softer lighting and some Carla Bruni playing in the background on a Sunday night.    Candybar is perfect for large groups, and even accommodated a four-legged friend.  The NOPA area has been yearning for a place like this, and I am glad that such businesses are moving into the area.

yk49vJJZrmtwJzqsZeghmw.review_text: Have you ever felt so comfortable in a place that you completely lost the passing of time? That happens when everything is about perfect and you reach a state of flow - halfway between the gutter and the stars as FatBoy Slim once put it - great company - excellent food - unobtrusive and yet attentive staff - irresistible beats at the right volume - maybe it's raining outside and you can hear the drops in the background, another layer of an hypnotizing, groovy soundtrack -  you feel both melancholic and content at the same time - feeling nostalgic for something that you are still living that very moment.   You might experience something like this at Candybar, a place that tries to combine wine, art, and desserts - I can't possibly think of a better trifecta - and does it terribly well. Achievement unlocked, as the gamer geeks would say.  Although the tables are very close to each other, Candybar can still provide a unique, cozy, intimate experience. I had brunch here and it was love at the first bite. I mean, where else can you taste Basil Yogurt with organic granola? A vanilla toast that speaks perfect French?   Coffee is excellent, the wine list is extensive, desserts are ace. The dishes are so funky that you feel compelled to preserve them under a glass. Contemplation as the ultimate form of consumption. Here, "art" is delivered on a plate. Chocolate coffee, wine: my three favorite drugs at an affordable price. It's all very decadent. I think I saw Marie Antoinette sitting at a table eating a cake today.   In short, Candybar is dangerously addictive. Elegant but not pretentious. Classy but not arrogant. Stylish but not overdone. Less is more. Scandinavian decor (not IKEA). Candybar is the new black.  Ideal if you are longing for a lounge.   If I had to compare this place to a tune I would pick something from Kruder & Dorfmeister. Or Tosca. Yeah, Candybar is track #5 from "Delhi 9". The one featuring Earl Zinger.

RTf5YTfKtKRmJU94BJhGzQ.review_text: Let's break this place down in compliment sandwiches shall we?  +We were quickly seated and accommodated. -The hostess/server seemed to rush us to order when we were waiting for a friend that was parking. +We grabbed some fun looking board games. -They were sticky and had some missing pieces. +The cocktails were delicious. -The hostess/server wanted us to order desserts. +The desserts that we were taking our time to order anyways were outstanding. -The hostess/server was truly a hoovering nuisance.  +The ambiance is upper class, laid back and warm.   But we were confused. It's a board game place. Boardgames take awhile to play a round of .. especially for 6 of us, and it's not like we weren't ordering anything. Why, Ms. Hostess, do you have this attitude? They are also very picky about letting us share anything even though we secretly did anyways.  Service. BOO [to the hostess] and YAY to the owner/manager/guy Board games. EH.  Food. CLAPCLAPCLAP Price. $$$ ouch  Recommend: +50/50 +Mango Tango Bellini +Strauss Yogurt Cake +Lavender Honey Creme Fraiche +Japanese Cheesecake DON'T GET Triple Chocolate Bellini. It's weird.  I also recommend you to ignore the hostess you get the negative vibes from. If you hate the people you serve, please resign. And we split the check but luckily, it was through a manager guy that was really nice about it :)  Street Parking.

rquMVml4tqfF331Wnsw7FA.review_text: Candy bar is a great place to take a few friend on thurs, fri or saturday. It's very cozy and a great place to talk and catch up with friends.   Thursday's they have the kung fu taco truck parked outside and you can grab a few tacos and head inside for some unique deserts and play board games or you grab a glass or two of their sangria.  Their sangria (white and red) are both really DELISH! Definitely a place you should check out.

fL8ujZ89qTyhbjr1Qz5aSg.review_text: I went here a while back... our server was kind of pretentious, so it makes me reluctant to come again.  We got a deconstructed cheesecake or something, and it was really good, although it was pretty small. Also, strongly flavored.   At the time, I wasn't into drinking because I couldn't taste anything but alcohol, so I can't really say much about the drinks. The desserts were really pretty and tasty!  Still... snotty waiter...

s85CyN43xNEMT9l62wVf5g.review_text: I came because of a Groupon, but I will definitely be back because of the desserts!  The red velvet cake and the peanut butter jelly time were fantastic!  Light and fluffy where they should be light and fully and rich where they should be rich!!  Some of the best desserts I have probably ever had.

Sl5pPtwzI-_BoOYhP0BCxw.review_text: 3-stars...   With just a few kinks to work out, Candybar is a stylishly elegant new wine and dessert "bar" over on *that* side of town **points in NoPA's direction**.  In the name of keeping things on the sunnier side, I'll give you the goodies first. Rather, I'll call it as I saw it and let you be the judge.  The host (owner?) showed us to our cute table near the back of the small space, and was really cool to have created a dessert & wine pairing menu just for us! Nice touch!  We opted to start with some of the (few) savory options. Fortunately, they'd given us the head's up, and we'd grabbed a little nibble down the road.  For the table, we shared duck liver mousse with crostini and a blood orange marmalade coulis, scallop ceviche, delicately garnished with slivers of avocado and kumquats, and a country-style pate with currents. All delicious. All teeny-tiny. All perfect with my frizzante of pinot noir!  For the next course, we went for some dessert pairings. I opted for the chocolate brioche with caramel ice cream. My BF decided on the chocolate parfait -- deconstructed and served as a chocolate shingle, garnished with whipped cream. Both were lovely and really tasty. And teeny-tiny.   Per the paring menu, my brioche was to be paired with a red tojaki... no idea what it was, so I asked. Was it like tocai fruliano? Was it a dessert wine? Was it a fortified wine? I was intrigued. Apparently, our server wasn't as she had no idea what it was, and when she returned all she had to offer was that it was a dessert wine, sweet and a bit spicy. Uh, 'kay.   Let me stop for a minute and mention some expectations I tend to have at  non-inexpensive, super cute, shiny-new wine bars. I know, I know. Expectations in any relationship are a sure-fire set up for disappointment, but hear me out on this one. All I want is a good product and a knowledgeable wait staff. And if the server is unsure (totally valid... OK, even! especially in a newer place) I expect someone who *is* in the know to come by and tell me all about it. It's wine. There's always a story behind it as well as a good reason why it was chosen to be eaten with certain stuff. Now back to business...  I got the honey-colored tokaji, it was sweet, it was spicy... it wasn't necessarily my favorite with the brioche (the pinot noir I'd ordered shortly before was better) but it was really good, and I totally enjoyed it.   Here's another side note that I don't think my dining companions got: when the server came by after placing an order for everyone-but-my 2nd round, I told her that I would be having the same thing my friend to the right was having. She said, "the frizzante?" I said, "No. The pinot noir." Panicked look, she rushed off. When she came back to the table, any mistake that was in the works had been corrected and we all got exactly what we'd requested.   Again. New place. New staff. Workin' out the kinks. We had a lovely time and will gladly go back. I'm sure that in time, the staff will rise to the occasion soon enough and all will be worthy of 4, maybe 5 stars. Until then, this has been my story and I'm stickin' to it!  p.s. Tokaji is Tokay... Hungary's sweet white wine made from grapes infected with botrytis mold that creates the honey-like color and richness. Yum!

IeIWEdLJcmL1R2KqRuLPHw.review_text: Came here for dessert with my SO and found this place very interesting. Art was cool and interesting. Tables were a bit small and short ( I'm a big guy so include that in my opinion)   Cocktails are interesting and unique.  My SO had citrus cocktail that had a slowly melting sorbet in it and it was very good. I had the Lyncee guava martini and I had mild flavor but but was good. (I had a little drink regret after having a sip of her's).  All in all a great place for and interesting drink and a little bit of something sweet to share with a date.

k5vAqz4dTDeD9zDMweULRQ.review_text: I'll enjoy this more when I'm 21+ so I can get something to drink with my dessert. I had the chocolate mint meltaway with egg nog. It was pretty good but way too much chocolate for my liking. But it's a small menu, I guess it's seasonal since you don't see eggnog every day.   I loooove that they have Candyland as a game. My friends and I were playing and the one who wanted to play the most, lost, she was very disappointed. I hope that they accumulate more games soon.

YOZP4_4Xiu1iQ6qtD4kE5g.review_text: Candybar is a sexy place. The desserts are sexy, the cocktails are sexy, even the menus are sexy. I'm serious. The servers are helpful and smiley... almost eerily so. It's just such a happy, dimly lit place around the corner from an otherwise blank stretch of bars and corner stores.  It's a little bit pricey, but anything you get at Candybar, I swear, is as much a meal as you'd get anywhere else. It's not really an after dinner kind of place (not unless you eat lightly, which would be a damn shame). There's something alluring about all those tiny bites and slender glasses mixed in with a mess of boardgames. It's a fun, light, almost too-cool spot for a date, a friend date, or even a hangout with your mom. No, really. All kinds of people come to Candybar, and for good reason.  There's pudding with crumbled bacon and red velvet cake, some kind of sorbet-like pie situation with chopped bits of nectarine; more basic options, and cute, fruity or tangy, distinctly colored cocktails that even the toughest dude or lady would enjoy. It's worth the sometimes twenty-minute wait.

EZDA0JnQXTSmUGMeDNaYxw.review_text: Great place to kill some time if you're waiting at a table at little star. Surprise happy hour with mixed fidelity drinks, and a plethora of board games take the edge off the wait (and little star will call you when the table is ready). Server here was super-friendly, place wasn't too packed for a wednesday night. Definitely a sport to check out.

e5F0jMzKHdMaOvHmmEuQEQ.review_text: Aside from the horrible parking situation, this place was fantastic! It took us around 1 hour (not the fault of the establishment) to find parking, but once we did, we were impressed. The ambiance was casual, quiet- great for a friendly conversation amongst a few friends. They have a terrific selection of sparkling wines and desserts.  Ambiance: I'd definitely give this 5 out of 5. If you're looking for a quiet place to have a couple of drinks and talk, this is the place to be!  Price: Prices weren't bad. I'm rating the prices a 3 out of 5 because it wasn't completely overpriced, but not cheap either. Expect to pay $6-8 per drink. Selection: The selection was killer. They have sparkling wines with strawberries, orange or raspberries and much more. I'm not a huge fan of sweet drinks, and this hit the spot. It wasn't too sickly sweet and not too biter. Service: Service was a bit slow, but not too bad.  I'd definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a relaxing evening out with a few girlfriends!!
