I plan on returning the next chance I get.

9nuv3DsQJFjApI3UgHvgxQ.review_text: Great people working there.  We arrive 30 minutes before Candybar was to open and they still allowed us to sit in the corner to relax while they worked everything out.  Board games and books to boot.  The Strawberry Kiss ($4) was pretty yummy.  The Jasmine one was nice and light too.  For dessert we just shared the chocolate brownie with raspberry and basil (home-made) ice cream.  I was pleasantly surprised at the basil ice cream though I kept trying to imagine it to be mint.  The candied walnuts were delicious.  ($9).  I think Candybar would be a great place to go before of after dinner.   I'd love to try more from their menu.

CX9Ho8E8GAPgjVSxfGLUHQ.review_text: Candybar have great service but the minus stars are due to the desserts. The only dessert I liked was the smores. It may be too sweet for some but I thought it was very rich and delicious! Very good! I'm disappointed in a mediocre tiramisu, plain and nothing special. It was a little bitter. The peanut butter and Jam dessert had too much jam and I was highly disappointed. Idk why yelp reviewers like it. Same with Apple la mode dessert, plain dessert and lack flavor, the only thing I like was the gingerbread ice cream on top. That's it. The banana dessert served with brownie and ice cream was ok. I wish the brownie was warmed up so it was less hard to spoon apart. Lastly strawberry kiss was not bad but I won't say super good. It was decorative tho.

QqLZs_jBN_HCSnkki48lSQ.review_text: I really enjoyed coming here and would definitely return, because the cocktails were so fun and delicious! The desserts were a bit of a hit-or-miss for me. Of the ones I tried, the only one I liked and would order again is the mango mousse with a chocolate coat. But it seems like the dessert menu changes periodically so it may not even be a listed item anymore.

VFYDy2839GEOq7bh8ntMYw.review_text: After coming back from NY...this is one of the few places I can go to get a good dessert.  I wish the city had more places like this little gem.    The 2 desserts I love here are the Honey-Almond Panna Cotta or the Lemon & White Chocolate.    In addition to good dessert...you can play board games and grab a drink.  Only thing is that when you come at night on the weekend, there's usually a wait.  But I guess that's expected for the weekend.

yg04mIl82nD84gYy3AReBQ.review_text: Parking is. H.O.R.R.I.B.L.E. so you MUST leave an hour before your reservation is you want any chance to make it on time.  We were late for our reservation so had to wait a bit. The bar area is a little wierd... standing room only, no barstools.  There was confusion with the menus, apparently you get a different menu directly from the bartender vs. sitting at a table.  I think the walls could stand a bit more artwork but the comfy lounge seating & board games seemed fun & entertaining.  Drinks:  *Candybar Bellini: Raventos Cava/ Blood orange sorbet/ blood orange &  lavendar syrup.  --Looks like cherry kool-aid but much tastier & grown up like. I would have ordered another if I hadn't had to drive home!  *Moscato: Briada "Vigna Senza Nome" Piemonte, Italy (moscato d' Asti) --A nice dessert wine, not too sweet and a bit bubbly.  Desserts:  *Chevre Cheesecake: Coconut sorbet, nicoise olive, caramel.  --I was skeptical about this, not at all what I expected, but turned out to be a winner!  Served on the softer side & I couldn't figure out the nicoise olive part, but all of the flavors blended well together.  Delicious!  *Chocolate Brioche: Balsamic caramel ice cream, lime yogurt. --I read this was the one to order and Yelpers, you were right! Definitely not your typical brioche, but definitely tasty. It is more cake & brownie-like, served warm, with an excellent chocolate flavor. Went well with the caramel ice cream and lime yogurt - just enough to cut the sweetness a bit.  Our total bill was just under $30, they knocked off $5 since it was his bday.  If we can find parking, we might just be back!

rGdW50y9qjzvx2Zboyl9Mw.review_text: If you happen to go to nearby NOPA and the hostess tells you that wait is close to an hour ~ what is there to do? Give your cell phone # and tell 'em to give you a call when your table is ready and head to The Candybar.   What a great concept...Candybar is a dessert lounge, located in the city's Western Addition neighborhood.   The kitchen is dedicated entirely to desserts (by Catherine Li)   There are a variety of board games and reading materials off the shelf and the wall is decorated with impressive graffiti art.   The place itself is pretty chill and cozy that makes it a great lounge to just hang out.   All of their ice cream and sorbets are made in the house.   We ordered:   Ice cream trio of Oreo, Kit Kat and Reese's peanut butter cup. ($5)   Strawberry Lime aide -  strawberry mousse / vanilla cake / calamansi cream / strawberries ($8)   Buttermilk Vanilla Bean -Panna Cotta-  Cocoa macaron / Balsamic cherry reduction and cherries ($8)   Beers start at $4, cocktails at $7-8 and sangria's (white/red) at $6.   --------------------------------------------------­---------------------------------------------   and now to the most important part.....   Happy Hour is freakin' everyday from 6pm-8pm   $3 Sangria  $4 Sparkling Cocktails  $3 Champagne  $2 Pacifico  .

nS7bO8kEzYXIxMqmDudD_g.review_text: I don't understand how this place has such a high rating. Got the sampler dessert with the ice cream sandwich, Apple a la mode, strawberry limeade and lavender honey semifreddo. Ice cream sandwich wasn't great. The honeydew ice cream had good flavor but didn't think it went well as a whole. I'll stick with lavender in my candles because it was weird in this dessert. On both these desserts, the fruit topping was completely flavorless and added nothing. The strawberry limeade: cake was good, but so sour. Apple a la mode: gingersnap ice cream had an unpleasantly strong cinnamon flavor and was missing ginger flavor. The cake was otherwise ok. I would not go back. It was a weird atmosphere also. Groups were waaay to cramped around tables and it was a lot of groups of bros in a cutesy dessert place...

-PfB5lPsUgrulIGQ_u6JWQ.review_text: Decent drinks and decent desserts.  I wasn't floored but I didn't leave disappointed either.

dviPtjXu-AzbefzWExaxGA.review_text: Candybar is such a great concept that I'm wondering why there aren't more of these around SF.  We went when it was still light out so it looked a little dingy inside, but with a little modern girly redecorating, I can see this doing really well in the touristy neighborhoods.  Try the jasmine sparkle if you enjoy jasmine tea.  The white sangria is also good although it just tastes like apple juice.  Happy hour is a great deal if you have time to kill before dinner--both Bar Crudo and NOPA are nearby.  We didn't get to try any desserts but I want the apple pie and japanese cheesecake when I come back.

xYhE81kALW3IJNEkDTaEng.review_text: I love the concept of Candybar. Desserts, drinks, and a hip lounge. Sounds perfect, right?  Eh, not exactly.  I'll start with what I do like. The atmosphere is a trendy and modern lounge-like style, with soft dim lights, (real) candles, sofas in the corner, and a red romantic interior. They also have cool art decorations on the wall and various board games available (Connect 4, Magic 8 Ball, Monopoly, Apples to Apples, etc). Perfect for a romantic night out!  The drinks are unique and tasty. The mango tango bellini (sparkling wine, mango syrup/sorbet) is a great fruity drink with sugar sprinkled on the top of the glass. Yum!  Now let's move on to the desserts...  Desserts: Lemon & White Chocolate cake/mousse with sorbet -- Sorbet was too sour. Red Velvet Cake -- Cake was too mushy and a bit tasteless. I expected rich red velvet and cream cheese flavors. Lavender Honey Creme Fraiche Semifreddo -- Unremarkable. Disappointing, actually. Tasted like it's been left out for a while. The cantaloupe was hard and didn't taste fresh.  Overall, Candybar is great for only the vibe and the drinks, but the desserts itself are rather disappointing. Yes they look pretty and extravagant, but I've had better at much smaller less well-known cafes. If you're paying $9-10 for a slice of cake, you'd expect it to be at least mediocre, right?  Get the Groupon that is $20 for 2 cocktails and 2 desserts! Definitely worth it!

_Kt01zAkzGDjSphy7W3qOA.review_text: Awesome art, amazing dessert & fancypants drinks. What's not to love? I'm obsessed.  Try the tiramisu and a blood orange cocktail, you won't regret it.

wPu-IJdZMEbFVEFSXflIAg.review_text: I absolutely enjoyed everything about this place.  I have to add a disclaimer that I am friends with one of the owners but I would not post a review if I didn't have anything nice to say about it.  So,the fact that I'm taking time out of my work day to do this says something!    I'm sure the palate forward desserts can be intimidating to people but I found all my dishes wonderful, interesting and absolutely divine.  I couldn't believe the bill when it arrived - it was SO inexpensive!  I was SHOCKED.  I thought we got some special treatment but I re-read the menu and the tasting really was $14.  I loved the Chevre cheesecake with coconut ice cream and the warm vanilla cake (not huge fan of mango and I'm allergic) but the warm milky drink that came with the peanut butter cookie with a hint of curry (v. interesting and tasty) was incredible.  I call it Melty Marshmallow - I wanted to drink that and the amuse bouche of strawberry gelee all night.  The art is super stylish as is the wait staff.  The bathroom is also quite pretty as well.  I am really impressed and all around found that our fellow dessert diners were all in good spirits and enjoying the quality food and ambiance.   I would love to go back for the savory dishes and there was mention of possibly brunch in candybar's future.  Can't wait!

1WuequxCEST6Z1LVNjGdPA.review_text: One word to describe this place: OVERRATED! I first heard about this place a while back on the Food Network. I came here with two of my friends and we had high expectations. It was pretty busy and we had to wait a bit for a table. We had a mission coming here and that was to order dessert, eat, and then leave. There were a lot of young people our age hanging out, drinking, and playing board games which I thought was nice.   For the desserts, we each ordered our own and decided to sample each others'. I ordered the peanut butter jelly time and my friends each got apple a la mode and Japanese cheesecake. I'm a dessert snob. My friends aren't and they can be easily pleased with just about any dessert. I only liked the guava sorbet from the Japanese cheesecake since I go crazy for guava anything! My peanut butter jelly time was good, but it was too thick and rich for me. My favorite was the apple a la mode. They were all good, but I don't think they were worth what we paid for them. It's all hype. All for aesthetics and fancy presentation, but I was not wowed. These were not "to die for, OMG I have to have it, craving it every day and can't stop thinking about it" desserts!

hFGYC-wjaZCSuhMdO8K_Tw.review_text: Two stars for the atmosphere. An unmeasurable quarter of a star for the food and drinks.   I ordered the Pumpkin Seed Cake. I asked the waiter to explain the beer foam and brown sage ice cream aspect of the dessert. It was nothing special. The beer foam was exactly that--beer foam to fancy up the plate. The brown sage ice cream was nothing incredibly special. The cake was dry. Boo.  My friend ordered the cheesecake which she really enjoyed. The kiwi made it a bit sour, but upon removing those pesky things, it tasted mych better. We also ordered some of their sparkling wine, which wasn't bad. All in all, the food was mediocre for the price they charged. Would I return? Yes, if I'm in the neighborhood and friends are looking for a place to hang out.

DrDcxgabnswIJOA6xoE99Q.review_text: I like the concept of Candybar: a laid-back yet sophisticated space to enjoy yourself.  To me, the place seemed like a giant living room:  couches, chic tiny tables, artsy lamps for mood lighting and artwork for sale adorning the walls. They even have boardgames: connect four, candyland, and scrabble to name a few, simple fun.  Candybar has an extensive wine/beer list. My friend who knows the owner says they don't serve hard alcohol because this would take away from their overall theme. Besides, would you really enjoy a savory meal/dessert with a cocktail? Our group didn't order any entrees- we opted for desserts and drinks. My recs: (1) Warm Vanilla Cake (2) Baked Alaska. Yummmm.  The staff is friendly, the crowd is older but not pretentious or hipster and overall I felt good vibes. If going in a group 4+, I'd recommend making reservations, but this could easily be somewhere to bring a date as well.   True to its name, it's a sweet place. I'd go again.

HQQ_yksK_dC8GlP_Yw7lFg.review_text: I've been wanting to come here for at least 8 months, especially after all the good things I've heard about it from yelp and friends. So of course I had really high expectations of this place.   Right as we walked in, my friends and I were overwhelmed with the smell of chlorine (or something similar). It was almost sickening how strong it was and definitely didn't help with our appetites.   We were luckily seated right away even though it was a Saturday night (yay!). My friends and I weren't that hungry since it was post-dinner so we decided to just get some drinks and share a dessert. I ordered the mango tango bellini and wasn't really impressed with it. It didn't taste very mango-ey to me. My friend ordered the lychee guava martini and she liked it. We tried the panna cotta and it was good. It came out so nicely decorated and very aesthetically pleasing! They definitely deserve 5 stars on appealing to the eyes.   I think I would come back to try some of the other desserts because many of them sounded really good but we were just too full to order anything. I think I would pass on the drinks though.

FJbzGF1UOu9nFELE738suw.review_text: expensive, but i guess thats what to expect from a place like this. used a groupon deal.  this place is super dark, they must be saving tons on electricity and charging tons of small snacks! geniuses!   the flourless chocolate cake is amazing.  tiramisu was pretty good  had the passionfruit drink, was pretty good.

H94FpSplyizi-jDTt0lUSA.review_text: I don't know... I don't get this place.  I guess I'm just not sophisticated enough to appreciate this place.  A friend had referred us to this place and my friends and I were excited to go.  But when we got there, we were so disappointed.  Each item is overpriced and so tiny in proportion.  I wouldn't have minded paying so much for a small portion if it was actually good.  Each dessert was mediocre.  It was good for a first try but I will never go there again.  Good service though.

knyL5Q53vbgGmEBQLPLxVQ.review_text: 4* for the ambiance 3* for the desserts  What you're paying for: ambiance and upscaled versions of comfort food desserts. What do I mean by upscaled version? You'll probably get a deconstructed s'more, maybe some foam, and a pretty plateful.  Looks-wise, this place is hopping.  The desserts are pretty, the drinks are shiny, and the decor is hip.  This is great for date night, just friends going out (they have games!), but beware that the line might be lengthy and people might stay long.  Taste-wise, I enjoyed the desserts and drinks we had, but I felt a little sugared out afterwards. Sweet drinks + sweet desserts = give me something salty!  I liked the experience...I'm glad I had it...but I'm just not sure it's worth a return trip.  Flourless Chocolate Banana Torte:  Good.  Personally, I would have liked it better without the banana flavoring or the peanuts, but I understand the comfort food inspiration.  Drunken S'mores:  Good.  Deconstructed: choco tart with graham cracker crust, alcohol'd choco sauce, and a large toasted marshmallow.  Again, it's interesting and I get the comfort food inspiration, but I'm just not incredibly impressed with the result.  Conclusion: Been there, done that.  It was a pleasant experience and if you haven't been, I'd recommend going once!

MAfCgDeJdM61I0JoiKHN-A.review_text: Little neighborhood gem.   Art work that adorns the wall is FANTASTIC!!  Middle bookcase has available board games to entertain.  Music selection played when I've been wonderful: soul, old school/lounge hip hop, oldies classics.   The drink and dessert selection is good.  Not too much, but a great variety of different and interesting sweetness.  I've tried the kitkat ice cream and reeses pbutter ice cream.  Also the pineapple upside down cake with banana ice cream.  Also the panna cotta (which is the only thing on this list that I don't highly reccommend.)  Am I a fan of Candybar?  I'm coming back!

eZQC4Ng7NMKkOvBAdenbrw.review_text: I got to try out Candybar for the first time this weekend and I am a fan.  It is a delicious place and really cute.  The music they play is really pleasant.  I am really looking forward to going back on those nights where you want to go out, but maybe don't want to spend too much.  Everything is delicious and very affordable.    Try it out! I will be back.

Xj0O2l0bp633ebmG468aZw.review_text: Cute as heck place for 9:30 pm dessert. I had the apple pie - small PERFECT portion and great deconstructed form. Hazelnut crust was outstanding. I love the board games. And the soundtrack.

x5bg_m9FXy2xut2pPqjWQQ.review_text: I came here with the girl and another couple.I bought the groupon for four desserts and four cocktails. The deal was definitely worth it.  I ordered the apple a la mode. It was ok because we didn't enjoy the gingerbread ice cream. My girl ordered the sundae without the bananas. It came with three little brownies with a small scoop of mint chocolate chip ice cream on each brownie and was topped with a macaroon half. On the side was some sliced strawberries.My girlfriend liked her dessert.  For our drinks, My girl ordered the strawberry kiss and I ordered the mango tango. She enjoyed the strawberry kiss much more then I enjoyed the mango tango. The drinks were definitely a way to be romantic.  We enjoyed our time there playing board games and eating all our desserts.

C2MlFhbt7vZWBnxuS40TUA.review_text: Girls Night Out! - This is the place to be. Sweets, drinks, & absolutely amazing ambiance and customer service.  I'd recommend this for a place to take dates as well... its so cozy and intimate. The decor.. love it!  Their strawberry limeade...drools... actually in general everything I had that night was an orgasm in my mouth.. Flavors so fresh that its impossible not to love.

zgYxq64c19y_IqhNGyg2BA.review_text: Awesome ambiance! Great selection of desserts.

Valva2MGzBW8ux3641YINA.review_text: Yelp reviews failed me bad for the first time! I came for dessert before dinner, yes I just said that and was bummed out! The best part was that I beat my friend at connect 4 3 times in a row! Yes they have board games at candy bar. Ok on to the disappointment, Apple Pie Ala Mode- The cake was nasty it was dry and all I tasted was a bunch of nuts. Apples were not juicy, they were candied in something. I felt like I was eating fruit cake. I didn't want to waste my money so I tortured myself and took as many bites as I could. My friend got the Smores, Can we say HARD DRY Crust, Marshmallow wasn't gooey toasted, chocolate tasted cheap. I made a Smore camping a million times tastier! I don't get it.   Ok I give them props for their drinks though, that's what the 2 stars are for, service was good too. The 50/50 tasted EXACTLY like a orange creamsicle! Delicious. The Peach drink tasted EXACTLY like the peach gummy ring candies it was scary good!   Finally tried Candybar and I don't think I need to go back ever again, sorry.

0WevaqedEPCwY7nybLPjIQ.review_text: So much fun! Great place for friends or dates. Really good desserts and interesting drinks. Need to go earlier in the evening because the popular items on the menu run out.

J4zHBWKedUfgubfFEgkG1w.review_text: My PIC loves the Apple A la Mode....which is no doubt has the delightful taste that lace with caramel and pecan. Highly recommended.   Mine was Ice Cream Sundae that consists of macaroon, bananas, brownie, vanilla anglaise, strawberries, strawberry ice cream which was quite sweet even with the acidity from my decaf was not able to compensate. Its flavor was consistence. I would say the macaroon did the best job for the entire plate. Happy with it for now. :)   Definitely, the coffee that I ordered was not that good: bland or is it because it's decaf?  The alcohol drink is much much sweeter and yet not too over kill.   Overall, this place is hip and romantic to hang out as group/date. Another thing is that the wait can be forever ! expect at least 40 min or more. We went on a Tuesday's night and at dinner time too and yet still have to stand to wait. Maybe, they need to have chairs and less board games for some pple to hang out way too long yet others to wait. That's just my two-cents.

vRziAXWI72nOFWNml4ldMA.review_text: Surprised I haven't wrote a review about this place. Took my girlfriend here a couple times and both times she loved it. The deserts are definitely delicious. We had some sort of trio of sorbets with a sauce and a decadent flowerless type'ish chocolate cake. Paired with some good wine it was an awesome spot to take a date.

BbBzub67X5sAHHTEtk2GAA.review_text: TLDR: Awesome desserts, cute venue, shitty parking, somewhat pricey. ----------------------------- The dessert/drinks here are good but parking sucks!!!  4 for the food, +1 for cute venue, -1 for parking, -1 for prices... which summarizes how I got to the 3 star rating. Service here is nice though =) and patient.. doesn't rush you even if there's some people waiting outside, which is nice.  Drinks: In my opinion, the drinks are too damn sweet ESPECIALLY if you're going to eat dessert with it..... next time if I do come, skipping the drinks (just got it cuz of the Groupon deal) They were good but just too sweet. I am a girl that dilutes my juice though, so take that to heart, haha. Drinks were pretty decently priced.  Dessert: Yum! Same cost for dessert if you compare it to if you also get a dessert as a nice restaurant (meaning still pretty pricey for me!) They were good and reasonable for what you get, cuz what I got was pretty damn good.  Apple pie: AHH heavenlyyyyyyyy. That is all. Cheesecake: It was pretty good too. I like the concept of the deconstructed mango cheesecake - mango sorbet on the side, cream cheese sandwiched between 2 lady fingers, and then rice krispies and some type of buttery granola on the side. =]

gm0V0GmBBlUlTqoZHsjWqw.review_text: Date/Time: Saturday - 9:30pm Occasion: Birthday dessert / lounging for a girlfriend Party of:  18 Ordered:  Passion fruit delight sparkling cocktail & buttermilk vanilla-bean panna cotta Location: super chic little place...i like! however parking is a PAIN so arrive early to search for the parking.. Total incl gratuity: $25  I really love the idea of this place.  It's a great place to spend with great company!  We came to celebrate a birthday.  I couldn't not order a dessert.  After reading a few yelp reviews, it appeared that the panna cotta was going to be our dessert choice.  I was pleasantly surprised.  It was very refreshing.  I was looking for a dessert wine to complement my food.  I ended up going with the passion fruit sparkling cocktail, which was an excellent choice.  It was sweet and had just the perfect amount of alcoholic kick.  The service was laid back yet attentive enough.  Great music, chill environment.  Fabulous place to come catch up with friends, spend a relaxing evening, and indulge in some good desserts and drinks.

Y4fBC_VURY9fhWuErWtTrQ.review_text: Fun lounge to kick it with friends or with your significant other. Pretty good intimate dessert place with plenty of nice quirky things from the light bulb dangling lights at the bar to the wonderful artistic paintings on the wall. A fairly dark place, but each individual tables is dimly lit up by candle-light. If you came with a group, that's fine too. Plenty of card & board games alike are there for your entertainment - free to use of course.   Reservations are recommended as the typical wait can range from 30min-45minutes. Parking can get kind of hectic at night especially on weekends.   While this place does serve alcoholic beverages, definitely go for the desserts. My choice - Candy bar Dessert for two - ($25) which gives you a choice of 4 desserts excluding ones with an asterisk. Still good for the money considering each dessert ranges from $8-10. Just don't come here if you're on a diet. You will cave and you will lose.

s_P6RCD1zeLPCBon8lVhNw.review_text: I went here on a Saturday night around midnight. It's a perfect spot to go after dinner but before hitting later nightlife spots. The dessert options are good, everyone I was with really liked what they got.  Pricing is a tad high for the size of some of the dishes, but drink prices were very reasonable. We had a lot of fun with the shelf of games. Apples to apples is a pretty solid activity while eating cakes and drinking! The coffee here was good too. If you're on a date in NOPA, pass on dessert and stop by this place.

lAyJFyvQbjyopwX_5OkBlg.review_text: My first visit to this place.  Nice ambiance, decor, and a small library of many interesting books, including some of the most interesting cook books, I can sit there and read all day.  Menu is small, but each item is interesting, and make you want to try all of them.  The use of sweet elements in savory dishes are interesting, without over powering the main ingredients.  For instance, the chocolate adds a nice crunch to the poached egg, and goes really well with the saltiness of the chorizo.  Desserts were great, they show the staffs are very talented, and pay attention to the smallest detail (perfect macaroon by the way).  Many people here are complaining the portion size of the dishes here, you people should learn to appreciate the quality of the ingredients, and creativity of each dish, not the quantity; if it's not for you, then you should go to Denny's, or go get a Big Mac happy meal.

qNjCuieUtsotbuJez5nhaA.review_text: Edit - I recently got in a grump with this place for the experience described below. I still think my comments stand but since I've now had the chance to actually visit it's only fair I update my review!  Great date atmosphere - It's cosy and warm and hits the right spot between informal and stylish. We intended to maybe try at least two desserts each but the portions were surprisingly generous (rightly so, for the prices) - not humungous, but I was expecting teeny tiny tasting desserts - and with the sugary drinks we only tried two desserts between us. I had the APPLE A LA MODE which hit ALL my buttons - caramel, cream cheese, apple, hazelnuts. The gingerbread ice cream was perhaps a little too cinnamony for my taste but that's just personal preference. Plus it wasn't a pie with dry pastry (not my favourite) but with some kind of buttery brioche or something. Loved it. My o/h had the lemon meringuey pie which was also great. The only thing I'd definitely avoid next time is the triple chocolate bellini - white wine and chocolate don't mix, and it brought back horrible memories of this gross Christmas chocolate/red wine drink I tried to foist on all my nearest and dearest a few Christmases ago. Apart from that, the drinks were great.  Would go back if I was in the neighbourhood and maybe try the cheese/charcuterie plate and another dessert. Board games are a good idea as you can't really knock back pretty cocktails and desserts the same way you would beer & pretzels in a pub, so the games add to the fun atmosphere.  You can only make reservations for groups of 6 or more, but there was enough room for us to drop by on a Saturday evening.  -- original comments: --  We had planned our evening around finally getting to enjoy the Groupon for this place - looking forward to an excuse to celebrate with some tasty desserts and drinks - but we were curtly turned away at the door because of some problem with the kitchen. We had taken a while to travel to Candybar on public transport which was detouring all over the place, so I explained that it had been a hassle to get there, but no, they weren't accepting any orders for the rest of the evening.  Such a *huuuuge letdown*. People were in there enjoying drinks, and I don't see how a kitchen problem would prevent us from having a glass of wine. We wasted an hour and a quarter of our precious Sunday evening, and a couple of bus fares, riding around on the bus for no reason, and weren't even offered a discount for future use or anything at all.  But the thing that makes me really angry is: there was NO MENTION of this on their website, which I had checked before leaving. Their twitter and facebook haven't been updated in over a month. A company's internet presence is ideal for precisely these kind of situations - communicating quickly to your customers.  I am not particularly inclined to go back to a company that clearly cares so little about their customers who go out of their way to support local businesses, but since we have paid for the Groupon, we have to or lose out even further!

cnAkM-A2MhqswsgJ2pl9eQ.review_text: Great concept, poor execution.  My bf and I had the red velvet cake and drunken s'mores. He had a glass of wine, but I was done drinking for the night and had tea. The wine wasn't so good, but that could have just been our luck of the draw.  The desserts were okay, nothing better than you can get in the grocery store and the portions were too large. Half the price for half the portion would have been appreciated. The s'mores were too boozey. Both were also really too sweet for my taste.  Service was okay. The host was the waiter on the Thursday night we went. Rather than showing us to the table, he pointed us in a direction to sit down, but then didn't like the table we tried to sit at. He explained that they would get busy later and he didn't want us to sit there.  The ambiance couldn't decide what it was - dark and jazzy, but too cool to comfortable sit for a while. Strange for a place that offers board games. The tables were really too small to host a game. However, there was a couch area in the front.  Overall, we won't go back - we were pretty disappointed.

SclmXBFXOwbSwuUbzpEjtw.review_text: Desserts were very rich in flavor. Good portions but is very sweet. So share with someone.   The drinks were ok.   I'll be back for the desserts.  Btw, the service was mediocre. Could be better. Waiter did not introduce himself or greeted us because he said they don't do that in NY. Weird.

gILPvBzdDQjVGt6gIdLrew.review_text: Where are the milkshakes and chocolate martinis??? Come on!

3AOuFaEvafDQ9W5Lr2WQXw.review_text: I know this is a wine bar, but this place would be RAD if it had a full bar to support after dinner drinks like, white russians and grasshoppers.    That said, the desserts were a 4 of 5.  Good but not ohmyfreakingosh good.  The idea of putting board games inside is a nice fresh touch, but seating solutions need work.

DQdWWpxraYdORpYDDT0nMg.review_text: I agree with the review below.  The dessert was ok for the price, roughly $5-7.  However considering that it was a desert and wine place, I expected a lot more from this place.  Maybe a wider selection of wine and a dessert menu with more of a wow factor.  The decor and atmosphere of the place is nice.  I'll probably only go back if someone plans something there.

8V3a9TI0bZZayhWCsQtVzA.review_text: This was a fun concept place.  Great things about it: the lounge and the seating area was great. We sat in a corner on top of pillows by the windows. It was a little dark so I couldn't take pictures of the food with my 3GS Iphone (yeah...I'm THAT guy at restaurants). We came here after dinner at Tacolicious (see my review on that too!) for a UCLA college reunion with a few friends  we ordered and shared....  Flourless Chocolate cake: the BEST dessert of the night  Japanese Cheesecake: BAD BAD BAD. only because we expected it to be like a regular cheesecake but it was like eating pound cake. I like poundcake, but I ordered cheesecake. way too doughy to be a cheesecake.  Apple a la mode. it was good but nothing special  Strawberry LImeade: it was very tart and even though it was a little too tart for my own taste, my spoon kept digging into it either from deliciousness or guilt for wasting dessert. either way, it was a pretty good dessert  Grade: B. I really liked the concept of this place and the chocolate cake and strawberry limeade were good but the other two desserts especially the cheesecake was blah. I'll come back here to give it another try sometime later down the road

Zia61WCddJBqIc_Z5-7coA.review_text: Not really your cup of tea if you're looking for american desserts. After looking at the pics on yelp, I decided to purchase their groupon which was $36 for four desserts and four drinks. CL got the red velvet, I got the ice cream sundae, J got the ice cream sandwich and S got the chocolate banana cake. For drinks, I had the guava lychee soju along with S, CL got the peach soju and J got an italian cream soda. Everything was fusion style. The one server was super busy and did not seem all that happy. Anyhow, this is not a place for all american desserts. If you like sweet fruity desserts, then this is the place for you. The soju drinks took awhile to hit me but once it hit me I couldn't stop laughing at everything. Wasn't too happy that we got taxed for the $36 groupon. Anyway, probably won't be back.

kZJWAY828P8QZTqVYzhTCg.review_text: For a self-proclaimed sugar addict, it is shameful that the first time I ever tried Candybar was just last month. I should have been the first person in line on opening day; I'm in the area quite often due to my obsession with NOPA (the restaurant.) I don't know why it took me so long.  Better late than never ("but never late is better..." Sorry...I'm letting pop artists, this time Drake, infiltrate my reviews again. I'll stop now.)  Candybar is absolutely lovely. Lights that are low, booths that are super comfy & games (like Battleship & Chutes & Ladders) to bring you back to your childhood...if you were allowed to drink alcohol & consume fancy desserts in your childhood.  I tried two desserts: -- Lavender Honey Creme Fraiche Semi Freddo (almond brittle, nutella powder, cantaloupe $8): great texture, like a creamy, more frozen gelato. -- Passion Fruit Chocolate Mousse (chocolate cake, tuile, passion fruit curd, vanilla bean ice cream $10): you can't go wrong with passionfruit & chocolate.  Playful flavor combinations that look that works of art.  Perfect setting for a larger crowd seeking after-dinner drinks, dessert & a place to catch up for a few hours.

UE-rXhA8njNnADFkDA3EuA.review_text: Sugar explosion in a relaxed, comfortable atmosphere with boardgames. Leave your calorie counter at home.

Qvi4cm0uxSIVbtKUdEukyw.review_text: Went to Candybar for the first time tonight. My friend and I had about a 15 to 20 minute wait which wasn't too bad. The atmosphere was nice and cozy. We sat at the bar and enjoyed watching the bartender make all of the great looking drinks.  I ordered the Strawberry Kiss drink and the Apple a la mode dessert. Both were delicious.

OaRk-RwFEzfOtc45ff0fGA.review_text: The desserts were glorious.  We tried the first three items on the menu seeing that those are apparently their most popular and some of the most decadent (knowing their un-American portions - we had to order rich) - the red velvet cake, apple a la mode, and peanut butter & jelly time.  The mint ice cream that came with the red velvet cake was especially divine.  We practically licked the plates and look forward to going back to try the other items.  Their list of non-alcoholic beverages leaves more to be desired though, like a cup of coffee (I suppose an americano is close).  It's a cool place for dates, but an equally great place for a couple girlfriends to catch up and rant about the goings-on in their lives, which is what we did, and what a wonderful evening it was.

YHV4HKDoVAear1EcH1F_GA.review_text: After 2 times at Candybar, I've had 2 very different experiences.  The first time I went was probably about 6 months ago, and they had these incredible "Dessert Nachos" on the menu (Please bring those back! They were amazing!!!). My friend ordered the spongecake, and while the plating was beautiful, it definitely lacked flavor. The service was above par, and we had some delicious sparkling wine cocktails. That experience rated around 4.5-5 stars.  My second (and most recent) experience was about a week ago. I brought my boyfriend here for his first time... We settled in and grabbed the board game "Battleship"... it was my first time playing it. I love that they provide different board games to stir in a little competition. Nothing completes a date like a dose of healthy competition!!! This time we ordered the chocolate butterscotch brownie, which was so-so (let's just say it didn't compare with the dessert nachos from my last visit here). We ordered a beer and a champagne cocktail as well, and those were fine. The main problem with this visit was the amount of time our entire visit took. After finishing our dessert and first round of drinks it took about 20 minutes to flag down a server to order more. When we finally got a server's attention we decided to try 2 spicy micheladas. These were TERRIBLE!!! I think they may have gone a little too heavy on the tabasco sauce, but they were un-drinkable. We tried to down them but ended up having to send them back (and I NEVER send drinks back). The server was very nice about it though, and took them off of our tab. We ordered another beer & paid. While I definitely like this place, my second experience was just less than stellar, and I wished the desserts were up to par with my first time here. I'm sure I'll be back, but based on my second time here, the service was just too slow and the food and drinks just weren't as awesome. Oh well. There's always next time.

EzSrmCtkptei9Pl12Fdjiw.review_text: The place is small, intimate and perfect for all your 'will this date turn into something more' needs. Panty dropping central, folks. Happy hour goes until 8pm with emphasis on champagne based drinks.  The deserts were grand, as were the board games.  The bar did get backed up, but it's the sort of place you linger at anyways.

SJofXUnnPxA62tkWsp0sGw.review_text: Disappointed with the customer service at the business.  Had a Groupon coupon to be used by today.  The business seemed to be unaware of the amount of outstanding coupons they had.  And human nature to wait until the last minute.  The business was running as though there was not a waiting list of 20 groups.  Business lacked creativeness in addressing the waiting people and how to gain them as return customers in the future.  Asked to take the dessert as take out and told it was against policy.  Asked if the coupon could be extended I was told it could not.  Half the battle in developing a business is getting someone to test you and then become a return customer.  Turning away guests does not seem the best avenue to develop a business.

Y9S8vqeaKmG8jqR597uHZg.review_text: ohhh what a fun night out!  Ordered a few desserts, drinks and pulled "Marry Date or Dump" off the shelves for a ultimate girls night! The desserts were quite scrumptious ( we had the apple a la mode and the ice cream sunday) and my cocktail was fun and girly (passion fruit delight). While in theory, it sounds like the perfect place larger groups, this place is quite tiny so I wouldn't come with 10 people. Fun for groups of 4 or 5 to get sparkling drink, a yummy dessert and to play few board games. Only a few downsides #1 they close at 12 which is sort of early if you wanna make a night of this #2 parking can get sort of tricky on weekends and #3 they dont take reservations for parties of 6 or less. Even so,  I think this is place is fun and unusual. Would def recommend.

r-Y00BpksG8RmgRZxywrYg.review_text: Great atmosphere.  Really fantastic.  Delicious fruity cocktails for you girls and adventurous guys.  The best desserts I've ever tasted and I'm not a dessert guy.  Wash everything down with one of the refreshing, ice cold beers here.  They come in nice, chilled glasses instead of just being lazy and giving you the bottle it came in and taste great after shoving your throat with confectionery delights.

2SBxCX9cDzrLVdSweCQrXQ.review_text: Desserts + Drinks = classic girl's night, right? so my friend showed up at my place in a tight black dress and heels and made me change accordingly.   turns out this place is pretty jeans-and-nice-top casual. whoooops. oh well! We still had a marvelous time. we ordered a drink and dessert each. I think candybar must change their menu a lot or something, because most of the desserts in the yelp gallery didn't exist.  The drinks are really yummy and pretty! I feel like you can order anything and it'll all basically be pretty good - can't really go wrong with sweets. Everything was really instagramable.. I felt really girly lol.  it's an intimate, romantic, low-lit setting but most of the people around me were groups/not coupley at all.

AVdgH8-6WKn-XiJZMgX0eA.review_text: Went here last night on a double date with my girlfriend, my sister and her boyfriend. We were seated right away. My sister's boyfriend had a groupon for 4 dessert 4 cocktails combo. I ordered the Strawberry limeaid pastry and a litchi martini. My girlfriend got the tiramisu and a Mango Tango Bellini. My girlfriend normally doesn't drink but her drink was alright for her. She wished she had a side order of ice cream for the tiramisu. It is very rich in flavor.  My drink was just a normal litchi martini. And the strawberry limeaid was pretty good. I was able to enjoy it. We were able to play Connect4 and I saw a lot of people playing other games supplied.   The ambiance is really nice here to end the night with some friends or a date. We did see kids with their parents there which was fine but felt a little out of place.  Service is really great. Music was at a great volume that you can hear people talking and enjoy everything.   Must try? YES Try again? Definitely

qAhA0L_Twusb5OUKp_tp_A.review_text: cocktails = good The waitress was a little upset that we didn't order dessert, but the place is really cute. And they have board games. Perfect romantic date spot or hangout spot with a few friends :)

6wcbR1kK4hG2sQNN_k5EVg.review_text: The best! The bf took me here for my birthday and I was so excited.   The vibe was great, and the waiters were even better. Yummy drinks, and gorgeous presentation of the cakes/ice creams. Great combinations.   The games people play are such a fun touch.   Definitely coming back here!

tY6RmwRBjdJ7_-ZF9wNzxA.review_text: We came here near closing and were lucky to even get in due to a birthday party taking up the whole place (not that it's a big place..). It has an interesting cool-artsy vibe with random paintings painted directly on the wall, a small bar, and mostly low, cushioned stools and benches for seating.  I had the strawberry limade: strawberry mousse, vanilla cake, calamansi cream, strawberries. It was freaking amazing. I would eat that again and again.

tGxhVMTDSdG1n5oJH0k0Ug.review_text: I've never felt so inclined to write a review for another place more than I do for Candybar. This establishment is the eptiome of what i look for when searching for a place to try. Everything from the walls of art to the inimitable desserts accompanied by the avant-garde sparkling wine cocktails is pure poetry for your eyes and tastebuds. With it's dimly-lit ambiance, modern decor and groovin' jams, it makes for the ideal spot for a rendezvous pour deux. Or three. Or four.Or everyone you know!    We happened to stumble in during Happy Hour which is held on Tuesday and Thursdays and they were carrying HH on until closing, which was delightful because we were able to order their bubbly for half off. We tried their Ice Cream Sandwich which consisted of two delectable green tea macarons mediated by brown rice ice cream and blueberries. If you're looking for something that's lightly sweetened , this is the winner.   Lastly, as if the desserts weren't enough, they even have board games to keep your group occupied. Awesome place down the street from the buzzing Diversadero that will be sure to leave an impression.

N9_LBDM2Uq4tOXUhfmDoow.review_text: Came here because my group of friends had found a Groupon deal ($17 for 2 desserts + 2 cocktails). Our tab came out to be under $3! Definitely look out for deals because they are posted frequently.  We got there around 8pm on a week night. The wait was about 35 minutes (not to mention finding parking took another 20 minutes!). The interior was very artsy (nice paintings, modern decor and furniture), and very dim.. I couldn't exactly see what I was eating until I used my camera flash lol.  OUR COCKTAILS. Guava Lychee Martini ($8?): 5/5. DELICIOUS. I personally love both the guava and lychee flavors, so the combination was amazing.  Blood Orange Cocktail ($7): 3/5. mostly tasted the sparkling wine, with a TINT of orange.   OUR DESSERTS. Apple ala mode ($9): 4/5. Hazelnut? Check. Gingerbread ice cream? Check. I really want to love this dessert, but in the end, I couldn't finish it because it got too sweet with the additional caramel syrup and cream cheese..  Ice Cream Sandwich ($9?): 5/5. This was the first time I ever had an ice cream sandwich between two macaron tops. I think what made it so good was the honeydew ice cream! First time having that flavor, too. I think they change the ice cream flavor every so often, so I would ask what it is before ordering.  I also want to point out their huge selection of board games! Overall, I would classify Candybar as a casual date night or a GNO kind of place. :)

I-FmdvI28N7OIIt4JZOgIg.review_text: I must say that I'm not the biggest fan on desserts, but this sweet bar is a sweet place that won me over with their fancy dining experience over bubbly champagnes and unique, delightful desserts!  The variety on the sweet menu, is creatively mixed and baked.  SWEET TOOTH DISHES THAT WERE ORDERED UP: *Apple A La Mode - The warmness of the dessert and the gingerbread ice cream that was topped on it, made it a worthy dish to test try.    *Candybar Hot Chocolate - Melted chocolate poured over marshmallows, this is made for a chocolate fan!  *It's Peanut Butter Jelly Time!  With chocolate tart, peanut butter cream, salted candied peanuts and blackberries, it was an interesting mix.  If you like PB and J, you will like this!  *Ice Cream Sundae - Ah, that was my favorite!  It was a super-sized macaron that was filled with the fruit of the day, ice cream and with diced up pieces of fruits, that was served on the side as decoration!  You can eat it too, of course!  It is a fun place to gather at - especially when it is a girls' night out!   Service was great and accomodating.  They provide board games on a shelf, a dimly lit setting, luxurious and comfortable side lounge seatings and a scrumptious, wonderful time!

Z5oN3zegJtCcL1AJm08sRA.review_text: This place is a gem. Awesome desserts. Home made icecream that melts in your mouth. It is a great place to relax with friends.   The best part is that they have board games. I was there playing connect 4 with my date for most of the night.   Awesome deals for happy hour too. 2 dollar sangrias?? wow  Highly recommended.

bUzVbYQM6g-MCkGPWbdDAw.review_text: Parking is a pain to find! I wasn't able to go here once because I circled around for 30 minutes and wasn't able to find parking. But once you find parking, boy are you in for a treat!   Here's what I tried: 1. Ice cream sundae - comes with brownies as well. The brownies were really rich. A little bit of brownies and ice cream with every bite really balances the richness from the brownies out. One of my faves!   2. Big Francessco's Tiramisu - It's not too sweet, the cream and chocolate were good. There's a lot of different textures going on and all of it coming together in one bite - DIVINE. Another favorite.   3. Red Velvet Cake - dense, moist, good. Nothing special.   4. Strawberry Limeade - bleh. Tasted like mush. It's served in a cute jar, but other than looks it has nothing good going on.   5. Ice cream sandwich - this is like the sundae minus the brownies. The honeydew ice cream was good. If i have to decide between this and the sundae, i'll go with the sundae.

Httk6gs4_1Hn_bxvfjux6w.review_text: Absolutely enormous desserts bound to curb sugar intake for the rest of the week (but only for a few hours for some) - Why has no one else capitalized on this novel idea?   Candybar is the cool place San Franciscan yuppies go to these days to get their sugar high. It's got a great loungey feeling with the dim lighting and reddish hues across the walls, making it feel intimate and somewhat private. The single corner space is great for groups (we surprisingly managed to fit about 10 people there)  The desserts are killer - of course figuratively and literally. Unless you have a major sweet tooth or had a really crappy day and need a powerful pick-me-up, it's bound to satisfy your taste buds (and your stomach). I'm not the biggest fan of the drinks here, but the variety of desserts available is enough to please any anyone.

BydvYTo1wnBYk5J-kSdGZQ.review_text: Desserts, alcohol and board games! What's not to like? Small intimate place with tables and some couches to lounge in. They have a unique drink list with many to choose from and their dessert menu shares the same. We wanted to try something new and this was around the corner from our date night dinner.   We tried the peanut butter jelly time and I was impressed by how great it looked but it lacked the taste I was hoping for. The concept was there and the plating was great but I think I would've liked to try something different.    Picked up a few games of connect-4 and while the couple next to us were playing battleship. It was like being a kid all over again. Nostalgic and good times.  Fun spot to lounge at with your s/o or a group of friends.

OSplnDFAyP-526qTVyiN8g.review_text: Okay, the wait was a bit long, but it was worth it.  The desserts were creative, eclectic, exotic, delicious.  This is a place to go out with friends or on a date.  There are games (Connect Four, Candyland, etc.) to play and great music to boot.  Very hip and fun.

Nk82agffKPNdmn16gpcROA.review_text: I've definitely heard the name Candybar float around before, so upon dropping by, I semi knew what to expect. Sweets.   Being in the NOPA area, there's surprisingly an abundance of Asian people here hahaha.   Aside from all of that, I tried the CB Mule (ginger beer with lime) which was delightful and quite enjoyable... and refreshing to say the least.   My buds ended up getting Lavender Honey Creme Fraiche Semifreddo. I didn't get to try that out, but I'm going to guess that it was pretty good considering there wasn't a single crumb left.   The dB level was pretty high in here so if you're going to have a convo between you and your crew, it's OK to speak even though it looks like a quiet place since it's so dark.

93N4D4zw4-qltGpLQn447Q.review_text: Located on the corner of thug and crime spree.  Just playin'.  Not a bad neighborhood although I did have an incident here that included some hoodrats that were up to no good.  Lucky for me, I speak ghetto and I'm fully aware of the code of conduct so we got out unscathed.  City life is grand but I digress.  Candybar is definitely a chick bar.  I'm not even going to front.  A lounge specializing in desserts, wines, and specialty cocktails of frou-frou goodness.  Please, this is now in my top five of Holy Trinities (I'll get around to posting that list someday).  The vibe here is very sleek and very romantic.  Gentlemen, are you paying attention because your girl is trying to hook you up here.  If you want any self respecting woman to lie on her back with her heels pointing to Jesus, take her here.  Honestly, some of the drinks here are as decadent as the desserts.  The 50/50 really does taste just like an orange dreamsicle.  Sangria's, both red and white, were also tasty.  As for the desserts, they offer a tasting menu Sun-Thurs.  We went on Friday night so booo, what a major let down.  Really Candy, you must reconsider that decision (I detest being denied).  Instead, I asked what their specialty/bestseller was as well as his personal favorite and that's what we ordered.  For the record, the bestseller is the Chocolate Cremeux Cake which has a black currant sauce and thyme ice cream.  Herb in ice cream???  I've heard of certain um herbs used in brownies, but ice cream?  Hmmm, very interesting...I wonder...and mental note is made!  Sorry, back on track.  The ice cream had a very interesting flavor.  So much so I wouldn't eat it on it's own.  But the pairing with the chocolate cake and currant sauce was perfect and completely worked.  His personal favorite (and now mine) was the Fruit Tart.  C'est magnifique.  Talk about party in my mouth.  I think I got pregnant just off that first bite.  So while I was sitting there having multiples, I spot the selection of card/board games they offer.  Awesome, because what could be better than trying to concentrate while inebriated.  I pick my poison, Connect Four (an oldie but goodie), and start whipping some ass.  Who knew.  The more I drink, the better I get.  Yes damnit, I am the Connect Four Queen (bow down).  Other key info: parking is tricky here (big surprise there) and it's not close to Bart.  They do have happy hour until 8 freaking pm (yay) with $3 Sangria's and $2 beers to boot so yeah, I'm sooo coming back!

_jg7sgGBRKiW3PZoep0-oQ.review_text: Parking is bad. But Happy Hour is FANTASTIC!  They have it every day before 7 I think. Parking is horribile as always.. street parking.  It's hard to have a huge group of friends here, but you can make reservations.  We got cute bubblies and tiramisu and this strawberry cake in a bottle. VERY TRENDY. Romantic atmosphere for a date I might add.  I love how they have games as well :) We brought it back old school with Connect 4 !

rYKSDn7jPJkGwciI5vltgw.review_text: Came here after a hearty steak dinner and I loved the ambiance and all the board games. I was slightly disappointed because I do have a nut allergy so I was very limited as to what I could have, I would say over half the menu items contained nuts. With that said, my boyfriend shared the red velvet cake that came with coconut shavings and marshmallows. It was delicious! I am looking to come back but please add more nut free desserts! =]

QmRf2XpI0ghInvvhMhHJbA.review_text: this place is so cute.  casual, unique, makes a great date night.  we came on a wed night and the bar was pretty full.  We tried three of the desserts nacho sundae,chocolate fudgesicle, and 900 watt almond sponge cake.  chocolate fudgesicle was my favorite...oozing chocolate in a chocolate shell with vanilla ice cream and candied cornuts.  the nacho sundae was really cute, served in a basket, it really did look like nachos.  cinnamon triagle crisps, horchata ice cream, guacamole cream, candied jalepeno's still with a kick, with a fruit salsa.  very creative and delicious.  my least favorite was the 900 watt sponge cake.  it had this sour cream or creme fraiche on the place that i thought was too sour even when eaten with everything else.   the sponge cake itself i thought was lacking in almond flavor.  cool texture though.    overall i would love to come back again and again.

ElP6UKudyNOvCFobgHoILA.review_text: delicious desserts, chill ambience......good place to hang out with friends/date.    taco truck T/Th is a bonus

a923ofqpLwcfneeNeNTJ4g.review_text: After finishing dinner around the block, we came here to finish the night off with something sweet. Such a cute concept full of so many options and very friendly service! When you walk in, you're surrounded by an intimate atmosphere of low, candlelit tables with a small bar in the middle. There's a shelf stocked full of various board and card games for customers to peruse and play at their leisure as well - really rounding out the playful/dessert experience.  My boyfriend ordered the passion fruit cocktail and we had the flourless chocolate/banana cake - each were terrific! As you'd imagine, the drink was rather sweet, but it had a nice, fruity aroma and taste. It was refreshing and just the right size to nicely complement the dessert. The dessert was a generous serving - not overwhelmingly large - but certainly more than enough to share between two people. The cake was served with a dollop of whipped cream on the top and a large scoop of vanilla ice cream on the side. There was also a portion of candied pineapple on both sides of the cake. While I didn't taste much of a banana flavor, the cake itself was great - very rich, dense and fudgy. When eaten with a bite of vanilla ice cream and a bit of whipped cream, you had a great mixture of flavors. The vanilla softened the denseness of the chocolate cake. The pineapples, while fun to eat, were almost too much of yet another flavor/texture to introduce into the dish. While I enjoyed eating them, it was almost hard to get a forkful of whipped cream, cake, ice cream and pineapple all into one bite.  We sat at the bar and the bartender who served us was very attentive and knowledgeable about the menu. We'll definitely be back to sample the rest of the menu!

0puAw4D-I1e1mX5pkj80AQ.review_text: Great place! I loved the atmosphere. Very casual and cozy. People sitting around playing games, eating desserts. The desserts are great. It wasn't overly crowded. I'm glad I found this place.

2D76oqm7ZwcCU9D6XYEH1A.review_text: Candy Bar...come to Denver and show the rest of them what they're missing out on!  Dessert, cocktails, great music, comfortable seating, and games, helloooooo fantastic night in store!    One of the many places my cousin and her bf took me to on my visit to lovely San Fran was Candy Bar.  Ah, what a wonderful place.  It combines all my loves into a beautfifully decorated venue; dessert, cocktails and games :)    It may seem a bit pricey, but sometimes you deserve to treat yourself to a bit of sparkly fun.  We each ordered a dessert cocktail, my cousin's beau opted for a beer on draft, and we split one of their tasty desserts.  We arrived on a not so busy night, so everything came out pretty quickly.  The art pieces used to decorate the place serve as fun conversation starters.    If you ever find yourself in San Fran, this is a must-visit!

Uw8TDUxIPOwfvVonu9x5xg.review_text: I like the idea. And I liked the art.  Cons: -parking horrible -dessert almost not edible from sugar overload  -dessert offering not compelling -board games are cute but it's so dimly lit I'm not sure how you could actually play one.  I won't be back.

8c2n50ngClm2o_YhQjkbPw.review_text: Fancy drinks and cute desserts.   This is one of the best girls night venues I've ever had. If you want to hangout without the bass and the creepy boys this is the spot. Light music, dimmed lights, and sparking drinks. It is romantic enough to take your date out, but since their speciality is sparking drinks and sweet desserts, yo man won't enjoy it as much as your girls.  Parking is ridiculous. NOPA is a little evil.   I had the strawberry drink and the mango drink. The mango was better, much more exotic and blended well with the champagne. The dessert were soo good. My friend and I shared the platter. Good choice of desserts, not too sweet and a lot of ice cream.

b_2CVNHzw8HHH4lDfErxVw.review_text: Red Velvet cake is the best cake I've ever had - the mint ice-cream that it comes with is out of this world.  Nice place to come for a desert and a few drinks.

TLiv7pKzS1ruZ4rD1ZzhJw.review_text: I want candy...I want candy....Candybar's concept is exactly my kind of place: a dessert bar with board games where you can hang out on a date or with friends.  Candybar also has funky artwork on its wall and good music playing in the background.  Pros:  -desserts! I recommend the green tea macaron ice cream sandwich -great place for wine and desserts with large group or small (although this place is small) -UNO, Connect 4, all they need is banagrams and I could spend hours here  Cons: *Panna cotta was a definite miss *Japanese cheese cake tasted like the ones at 99 ranch market, very dry, although the melon granita was a nice accompaniment *I did not care for the mango ice cream with chocolate cake pairing. It didn't sound good on the menu but I love chocolate cake. Unfortunately it didn't taste all that great either. *Service is perfunctory. Not fantastic but not horrible either. *Parking is a pain in this area and they don't take reservations on the weekend.

RvivmAmnVtCod7w5bf8dgw.review_text: Candybar is an interesting place to try - dessert for 21 and over - ESPECIALLY when there's a groupon that can turn your $90 bill into a $15 bill!!!!!!!!!!!! 4 desserts and 4 cocktails. Offer ends in September (I think). Better jump on that train now!  Parking is sucky. Sports channel on the flat screen over the bar. Games on the shelf for you to grab, by awkwardly reaching over people. Dimly-lit bathroom. Red curtains and lighting make an Asian glow not so Asian-glowy, which is nice.  The couches were awkward because they're the same height as the table so it makes eating or playing games awkward (or just bad for your back), unless you sit criss-cross applesauce on the couch.  I HIGHLY recommend the Lemon & White Chocolate. A lovely scoop of lemon sorbet on the top with a cluster of blueberries over granola crumbs. Lemon cake and white chocolate mousse layered over each other in a little jar. Lovely presentation. Delicious execution.  The cocktails are made mostly of sparkling wine and/or soju. Not too much of a fan but they have other drinks on the back of the menu. It seems the online menu is more lengthy than the physical menu.  In all, it's lovely. But not somewhere you'd become a regular at unless you lived in that area...

-kXJlkBaFc7NxKCVf4CgJg.review_text: Nice place for desserts and drinks.  Bring your friends and play board games

3zyBvSsgLEWYsPpnFIxV2g.review_text: Listen to Floetry  and when you hear the words Candy and Bar... all you gotta do is say YES.   Yes to chocolate dunked pannacotta Yes to olive oil baked cake Yes to sexy candlelit bathrooms Yes to earthy, sophistacted decor  Yes to friendly, attentive, eye-catching service Yes to red and white fresh fruit sangria  Yes to farmer's market inspired brunch and orange fizzy bubbly   Don't deny what you feel  Open up your mind and just rest Candy bar you make me so so so so so so so .......

ZBic_G4PNvE7oGCsEBeC2Q.review_text: Great spot if you're looking for good dessert in moderate portions (good size for one person, too little to share between two), wine or a delicious fruity belini, kickin music, great ambiance, high heels and a board game...this is the place!  Fills up quickly as the space isn't that big, but really fun spot for a party or to meet some friends.

7rod7UokFmLaO2oalTGnvA.review_text: They brought our food to the wrong table and someone dropped board games on my head. Apples to Apples cards fell all over me. Drinks are decent but no liquor.

CF9Xxwhn33S6lNNHZtbY1Q.review_text: Nice owner but surly staff. Have the Peanut Butter & Jelly Time. An OK stop if you're in the area.

s4eGhA7wluf_g-4ib9s_4w.review_text: The decor of this place is cute with dim lighting, art on the wall and low seating.  It's definitely a great place for a date.    The desserts are fabulously decorated and the specialty drinks are very fruity and light. I also really liked the board games that they had laying around.  It's a fun place to hang out to talk and get to know someone.    The only Con that I have about the place is that it's a bit pricey for the amount they give you.

IT6jLy3uQg6K9yGSrAEyHg.review_text: The wait is kinda long, the parking is hard to find, and the desserts are sort of disappointing :( It's really cool that they have board games, but desserts were VERY lacking :(

08Sh6PGFv1rTTFDArvwusQ.review_text: This is an intimate dessert lounge located at Fulton/Divasadero in the Western Addition 1 block from Alamo Square Park. I have to say this is a very classy place to just hang out, indulge in some gourmet desserts, and sip on some cocktails. The front area is a more casual bar area with stools and sofas while the back area is slightly more formal with table service. The atmosphere is very romantic and laid back with candlelit tables. We came here on a Thursday night around 10 PM, which is technically their closing time. However, they were very friendly and still admitted us within 5 minutes after a table opened up. The inside was still packed and they were obviously not closing for the next hour or so. We used our Groupon and ordered our cocktails: Mango Tango Bellini (sparkling wine, mango syrup, mango-tangerine sorbet) and Strawberry Kiss (sparkling wine, ginger ale, frozen strawberry). The cocktails were pretty good, but not great in the sense the ingredients used were very basic (you can mix them yourself at home). But at the very least you can tell the sparkling wines were very high quality. The real highlights here are the desserts: Lavender Honey Creme Fraiche Semi Freddo (almond brittle, Nutella powder, cantaloupe) and Apple a la Mode (hazelnut crust, cream cheese filling, caramel, gingerbread ice cream). The desserts were fantastic and very shareable. I would come back for just the desserts alone. The music was suitable for face to face conversations and consisted mostly of R&B slow jams: not too hyper, not too mellow. You can still clearly hear conversations from adjacent tables though (can be good or bad). I would expect to pay around $20 +/- $5 per person for a dessert + cocktail. The walls are adorned with interesting artwork from local artists on a rotating basis. Also, there is a big selection of board games available for larger groups. Lastly, this place is CLOSED on Mondays. All in all, the prices might be a little high, but I'm definitely coming back for the awesome food and trendy atmosphere.

Wt_dOAD87C8ni8Rbn25wsA.review_text: For a place that specializes in sweets and desserts to go with their drinks, Candybar was a bit underwhelming. The dessert menu touts all sort of wondrous curiosities such as "Buttered popcorn creme brulee and orange creamsicle cookie," but upon ordering said dish, I received a pretty standard creme brulee with a handful of caramel popcorn on the side, and a madeleine cookie with a piping of orange zest whipped cream on top. What a cop out!   So anyway, the desserts were unmemorable, but not bad either. Maybe I'm just a dessert snob too.  The saving graces for this establishment are the happy hour drinks and the atmosphere. Both the white and red sangria were delicious at $2 a pop. You could chug those suckers thinking you were drinking juice, only to find that you were drunk 20 minutes later. (Guilty.) Candybar itself is a cute place. It's chic and cozy without being pretentious. They also offer an assortment of books to read and tabletop games like checkers to play if your date happens to be conversationally challenged.

AjWFrKlkIrw6Oj8iY8eQeQ.review_text: This is a great place to go, enjoying dessert while having a fun time playing games.  There's a nice selection of dessert to choose from, as well as cocktails.  I'm not much of a fan with the cocktails, but the dessert has been pretty good. Ice cream sandwich: crunchy apricot macacrons sandwiching honeydew ice cream. Drunken S'more: marshmallow and salted caramel in a nice thick crust drizzled with fudge.  It's definitely delicious, but way too sweet so you'll need to share. Strawberry Limeade: nice presentation in a jar but way too sour. A bit pricey, but there's been Groupon's floating around in which you pay a discounted amount for 2 desserts and 2 drinks.

1DiDNvfbL4Os1C3UOYalHA.review_text: Went here some weeknight in Spring and it was an okay experience, a good place to go to as part of a date. Personally, if the guy and I spent the entire date in here, I think I would be really disappointed. Drinks selection is limited but unique. Desserts are decent and more on the "boutique" end but the two I've sampled didn't really have that wow element. The decor, art books and the games contribute to the pleasant romantic atmosphere, but the lighting is too dark that it isn't a wonder it's deemed a make-out room!

MzuYyDfWtFcIMNnhXNcnQg.review_text: Cute, great idea. Fun hangout on a Saturday night except that it's a little loud (it might have just been the insanely obnoxious table of young Asian girls squawking and snapping pictures non-stop). But seriously, great place to go. Definitely will be coming back. Comfy seating, cool vibe, and great blend of cocktails, desserts, and games! We got some tasty fresh cocktails (they're almost all made with sparkling wine, so they're kinda light/wimpy cocktails) and played Catch Phrase while waiting for our desserts. Seriously an awesome treat for adults. :) The couple to our right was playing Connect Four, and the 4-top to our left was playing Apples to Apples. How fun is that?! My husband got the Ice Cream Sundae and it was really good -- great flavors, combinations, etc. I got the Flourless Chocolate Cake and it wasn't the best I've had... wasn't really sweet. Overall, I'd say it's a super fun place, good for a date or a night out with friends. Not a lot of room though so you do have to wait a little while for a table. Good service, sweet waitress, good drinks, great ambiance. :)

g3cEKgn07a4KtpSdySdUWg.review_text: This place is uber-cool. This is the perfect place to satisfy your sweet tooth. If you like sugar (and I mean a lot of sugar) then this is the perfect place for you.   The scene is cool and chic. I really love the decor with its cool paintings and murals. The music here is excellent, think Musiq Soulchild and Sade. This is a perfect place to bring a date or catch up with an old friend, since the ambiance is intimate and not too loud. You can have a nice conversation or play the various board games they have in stock. Damn those people who hogged the Connect 4!  The cocktails here are super sweet. I felt like I was drinking a milk shake or a smoothie instead of a cocktail. If you have a friend who is not a heavy drinker this is a good place for them because the drinks taste nothing like alcohol. I had the 50/50 cocktail, which is made of soju, orange soda, and vanilla. It tasted like an orange creamsicle. Please don't revoke my man card, but this was pretty darn tasty. Don't worry like a true man I switched over to beer after downing this milkeshake er I mean cocktail. My friend ordered a Strawberry Kiss (sparkling wine, ginger ale, and frozen strawberry) and a Mango Bellini (sparkling wine with mango sorbet). Both drinks were refreshing and delicious. There goes my man card again.  The desserts here are really good. We got the dessert sampler, which came with 4 desserts of your choosing for the reasonable price of $25. Not bad at all. For our four picks we decided on the apple a la mode, flourless chocolate cake, tiramisu, and Japanese cheesecake. Each dessert was well crafted and presented nicely. The only dessert I wasn't a fan of was the cheesecake, which is surprising considering I love cheesecake! I felt the texture and consistent was more cake like than anything else. It lacked the creaminess of a traditional cheesecake.  If you are in search of some cavities, this is the place for you! This is a great place to chill and relax, save the drama at the door. I will definitely be back here again!

UXBYCdQSy19sjDhCO-9LHQ.review_text: This is definitely a sweet spot!  Killer desserts, good wine and a very accommodating staff.  But the best parts lay on the shelves; board games, card games and books galore!  UNO with the neighboring table, port and a yummy dessert make for a great night anytime.

IBrL-6twlZmQBGLdV2DQiw.review_text: Good for wine and snacks with your group of 30-somethings friends.  Bad for singles wanting to pick up and seeking eye candy.  Food was hit and miss.  Some things were good: Allspice meringue "kisses", crostini w/ lemon verbena ricotta and pear.  And some things we were warned were bad: meat dishes, chocolate pudding.

A7x60kNtgbXpCjMn_BUXIQ.review_text: Love the music they were bumping, boardgames, the artwork and decor, and GROUPON! They close at midnight on a Friday. We got there at 11 and didn't get seated for at least 30 minutes. We tried two drinks and 3 desert plates.   The Strawberry Kiss and Mango Tango sparkling wine cocktails were pretty yummy. The desserts on the other hand were pretty much just decent. We tried the red velvet cake, peanut butter jelly time, and flour-less chocolate cake. I liked that they had dollops of icecream, sorbet, or cremes on the side of the dish that garnished and complimented the flavors of the main item. You can really taste the ingredients in their ice cream and sorbets. The mint icecream that came with the red velvet really tasted just like mint leaves, wasn't a huge fan of that. I love mint but not the taste of leaves. It was a little strong for me.  If you like peanut butter or Reese's, you should definitely try the "peanut butter jelly time".    The concept of the place is cool and it's a nice place to chill with some friends for a night on the town, but cause of the price I subtract half a star and will probably only be back during Happy Hour.

dBKPMP6-N27n2Wvcqx9QSg.review_text: Loved it, and I will definitely come back!   1) Desserts - tried three different desserts, and they were all ok. Nothing to rave about, but dessert is like pizza - it can only be so bad, and I will always eat it if it's there.  2) Drinks - great selection of regular wines, dessert wines, and cocktails.   3) Ambiance - cute little lounge, very very dimly lit as others have said.   4) BOARD GAMES - best. idea. ever. The only thing better than playing games with friends is playing games with friends while sipping on sweet wine in a cute little lounge. After this place, I've gone to every other lounge feeling a bit dissatisfied that there were no board games there.  5) Tip to the guys: **perfect date spot!!!** The girl will love the sweets (in both edible and liquid form), and the fun games will prevent any awkward silences, provide laughs, and great opportunities for fun bantering. Total win, really.

uO_Fbh_k28FGt4yqXdysCQ.review_text: came here on a saturday night after dinner. it was tough looking for parking in that area but that was expected. good thing our friend went there and got a table beforehand.   as i walked in, the place is pretty dark.  sat down and it was pretty noisey all around. people were celebrating birthdays, hanging out, or on a date.  they also have board games that you can play with.    their menu have a good amount of dessert plus they also have wine and dessert wines so it's not just a dessert place.  - apple a la mode (hazelnut & pinenut crust/cream cheese filling/caramel/gingerbread ice cream): i m not a big apple dessert fan but this was good. i had one bite of it but didn't think it was bad.    - blueberry mochi cake (blueberry gel/lychee snow/green tea ice cream): i liked this one. the mochi cake was good and the lychee snow was paired good with the mochi.   - strawberry limeade (strawberry mousse/vanilla cake/kalamansi cream/strawberries): this was my favorite! this dessert is light and flavorful. the strawberry, the lemon, the cake... everything was good.  a good combo!   - chocolate chip bread pudding (toasted almonds/chocolate creme anglaise/vanilla bean ice cream): i liked this one too.  the bread pudding was warm and eating it with the ice cream was good.    this place is a good hang out place if you're around the neighborhood.  i think there are other dessert places i'd try before coming back.

_RZUfGvv13R4PACFngFxDA.review_text: This is such a cute and FUN place to be. They only open for a few hours a night, so I recommend coming about a half hour after they open so you can get a good spot to sit. They have happy hour from 6-8pm and the strawberry kiss is delicious. We also had the 50/50 which tastes just like the orange ice cream from when you were a kid, just in a smoothie. It was pretty darn good.   We came on a Wednesday night and it was peaceful, not too crowded, friendly service, and fun games to play. We played connect four and uno and it was just a good way to catch up with friends and enjoy a drink or two. Definitely a place to relax and forget about work/school.   I wasn't too fond of the soft cheesecake because it kinda tasted like a mix between cheese-wiz and normal cheesecake. Too much cheesy flavor for me, but the drinks were great!

rJmVQyRJXQlfjZznKN8z6w.review_text: Overall: 3.5 stars  Desserts: 3 stars Environment: 4 stars  I went to Candybar on a Friday night with my boyfriend for some late night dessert and we had a great experience. The desserts were presented well and the portions are perfect for two to share. We tried the Apple a la mode (Apple cake, cream cheese frosting, poached apples, and a scoop of gingersnap ice cream) and the Drunken S'mores (caramel with hazelnut crust, with marshmallow, drizzled with rum hot fudge).   I gave the desserts 3 stars because they were a little too sweet for our taste and because I grew tired of each dessert after the second or third bite. It was also really nothing special.  The environment, on the other hand, was great! It was very intimate, romantic, and really trendy/hip. The lights are dim, there are art pieces covering the walls, and everyone in the establishment has a glass of wine in hand. Candybar is basically a lounge or bar that serves desserts!   They also have an assortment of boardgames, so this place would definitely be great for groups as well!

69_rcB15Nu1GTC3gg4m0Iw.review_text: fun place! drinks are kind of expensive, but hey, that's life in the city. i honestly haven't tried any of their desserts, but they do look great! my favorite part of this bar is the board games. yup, board games! so fun. i came across this place while wandering around with an old friend i hadn't seen in years. i love candy, so i thought this place would be cool. we sat in a corner and he drank beers while we played EAT IT! eat it is a fantastic trivia game that's all about food. i was really good at it, so therefore, i love this game. we didn't really follow the rules, but just asked the questions. it was a really fun and relaxing atmosphere! the bathroom is nice too - low lights, very romantic for a bathroom. check it out!

LgqaNO1mXwWncSfmSn2AtQ.review_text: Refrigerated desserts in a fun, board-gamey environment. Desserts could be better except for the PB&J tart.
