wbe3nWYyjwaw_bgebBBaQA.review_text: Surprised my friend for her birthday and so we headed out there around 10:40pm.  Took us all about 30+ mins just to find parking.    Venue is tiny so big groups are not recommended.  They close at midnight and after standing outside for over an hour we finally got seated........at midnight.  I was expecting a crap load of candy and delicious varieties of desserts but was very disappointed with their small selection.  The drinks were good but overpriced.

RkK4bTvjehYciX_zUaAgMg.review_text: Omg. The ice cream Sunday with gluten free brownies was perfect! The lavender I've cream semi freddo was so delicious also! Delicious. We ordered the lavender champagne cocktail and it paired perfectly. This is a great place to go with friends or a date.

M6h9KYZHFaZYmVFopXq1mw.review_text: I was craving dessert at around 11:15pm at a bar south of Market and 15 minutes later we found ourselves here. I had a 'Mango Delight' (mango syrup & sparkling wine)that was nice and tart but was a little bit on the thick and sweet side then the 'Pumpkin Seed Cake', which was pretty much perfect; it came with a brown butter sage ice cream. The only downside is that though everything on the menu looked ridiculously good, a lot of the items contained oranges, which I am allergic to. Sad faaaceee.

U9-QTVVewv-NB0sG9hy9-w.review_text: This place is super cute for girls night and date nights. I went here with a couple of girlfriends and we really enjoyed the ambiance. I order the Passionfruit chocolate mouse and I have to say it was everything I expected and more. Not overwhelming and just the right amount of sweetness. I was sold after my first bite.

-sIddonB3VH3bc92cQLW_A.review_text: This place is super chill, like a living room complete with couches, boardgames, interesting art all over, and mood lighting.  All of the sparkling drinks are great!  Happy Hour was awesome, my girlfriend and I ordered maybe 7 drinks and the Japanese Cheesecake (which was good, but not dense and cream-cheesy like a normal cheesecake.  It was really fluffy, like made whipped eggs or something), unknowingly stayed for over two hours, and peaced out pretty tipsy.  It's a great place to take a small group of friends, your boo, or pretty much anyone, its intimate, has great drinks, and great desserts-- perfect combo in my book.

JVcyzABtBNK5T0taFqf45w.review_text: The ambiance is sleek, warm and hip. But most importantly, the gourmet savory dishes and sweet desserts are to die for. we LOVED the Chevre Cheesecake..it was sooooo goooood! They also had a variety of dessert wines. We are definitely going back to try the rest of the desserts.

D97kGuzfRCRQ3GIQ0hP9tg.review_text: Interesting atmosphere with ikea short tables, modern music and decorations and art. There are board games while you wait for your desserts, and some creative champagne cocktails-- (one pomegranate/blueberry champagne cocktail had blue poprocks on the rim instead of sugar). The desserts that we were able to order (see gripes below) were amazing! The person who put this menu together and prepared the desserts has some serious creativity and talent. (Carrot cake with bananas and carmelized nuts and OMG "salted caramel" flavored ice cream- not on the website's menu, but amazing!)  We took public transit and it is really easy to get a cab on divisadero so I can't comment on lack of parking.  Gripes: Half of the desserts were "all out", which the wait staff informed us when he handed us the menu--bummer. One of the ones that we ordered was also out, but we didn't tell us it was out and just never brought it to us. They also still tried to charge us for that dessert that never came. It took us forever to get the credit card back (and there were only 8-9 tables!). The place is small and can't really accomodate large groups (it  was difficult to get a group of five at one table. The wait staff was extremely casual, being unprofessional at times. I understand that the vibe was a modern hipster dessert bar, but they they were very slow for  two people being responsible for only 8-9 tables, inattentive, seemed annoyed to be there and didn't even know their own menu (what was still being offered). It took a long time to get simple drinks delivered to our table.  I suggest the owner get new waitstaff and train them that waiting tables is more than just writing down orders and bringing food from the kitchen. I really liked the desserts, but it was pricey. I am not sure we would have gone is we didn't have a $35 dollar off coupon.  so, three stars for the desserts, no stars for the slow, unfriendly wait staff.

2s2rjbtJkbl278SAVJuCGg.review_text: So, I get it. People love dessert. But I would go somewhere else for my dessert. The people were friendly but the desserts were lack luster. The place was pretty chilly on the inside but nicely decorated given the small space. Kudos for the cute bathroom design. However, at the end of the day, I came for the desserts and left feeling like I could've done better by going somewhere else and - given it was my "cheat day" - I felt a little disappointed. That said, this is just my opinion. I have just had better desserts elsewhere from places that are not dedicated solely to dessert. :(

61L6v94EIKKsY2d5UUxl7Q.review_text: Came here with a friend to catch up around 7:30pm on a Wednesday night. It was relatively empty- throughout the whole time we were there there were at max 3 other groups present.   The vibe is intimate with dim lights and candles on every table. Great spot for a date! ;) they have table seating as well as group couch/table seating and bar seating as well, so take your pick!   Oh and happy hour is from 6-8!  We tried the honey lavender Creme fraiche and the drunken s'mores. Both were delicious!  I liked the Creme fraiche more but that may be because I don't like chocolate as much.   We tried for of their specify cocktails, and all of them were very sweet, which is not exactly to my taste but if you're looking for an alcoholic drink that doesn't taste like alcohol at all, then this is the place for you!   Overall good experience but it was good that we had a groupon for this..

5HqM0wJUNjHk_c7LNhInow.review_text: i love really artistic, modern contemporary feels to small dessert bars like this, equipped with good music as well.    2 things to try !  Sangrias -  (white sangria for a more refreshing fruitful taste & the red sangria if you like the more traditional wine taste).  Made more sweet than normal, but delicious ! i like drinks where you don' t have to force yourself to drink it down because the alcohol taste is over-powering the taste of the drink.  Hazelnut Semi-fredo - very thick and creamy, with a light hint of  hazelnut flavor to it.  Its like ice cream but better !  *note skip the buttermilk panna cotta.  I normally LOVE panna cotta, but this combo is a NO-GO ! the tangy sourness of the buttermilk on top just ruins the whole sweet taste of the creamy panna cotta on the bottom

4Iy2pfgNFjAAvB9JjFVGqA.review_text: Came here for a girls night out to chit chat, sip on sparkling wine, and to try out the desserts. The drinks were delish! The desserts on the other hand... not so great and the price.. ehh. I've had better.

jZaW5XEiEuZo_JhpxMBDSQ.review_text: My girlfriend and I came here for some drinks and desserts. Although it's unfortunate that there isn't a full bar, and the scene is a bit hipster, the taco truck outside (and the amazing desserts inside) make up for it. Yes, a couple bucks for a little taco seems pricy, but one taste (especially of the duck taco) will make you realize it is well worth it. The best part is that you're allowed/encouraged to bring the tacos inside. Bonus: Cards, board games, etc,  are yours for the playing.

YZ3ldDKLvAmlda1oe4d3Hg.review_text: Really delish desserts that are French/Italian inspired! The drinks are super sweet so if you're into that this is definitely your place. If not, then you won't like the alcohol options. There's always at least a 30 minute wait, even on a weekday late at night, but it's so worth it because it totally maxes out your sugar fix.

oQa5irnvpnMdVDF7sPYvxQ.review_text: This place is ok, Ice cream.sandwich was yummy, so was the red velvet, pb+ j time tasted nasty the crust was burnt, Apple... with ice cream disappointing. plus i can't believe they didn't have milk, especially since they sell such decadent desserts, you need something besides alcohol to cut the sweetness. :(   but my over all experience was good. I played connect 4 with my date and kicked ass. :) then i let him win a game so we would cry lol.   can't wait to come back and try the other desserts with someone else

DRAfyZnnFfM60nxlUbqQHA.review_text: The Candy Bar is a small cute little space with desserts. We were seated fairly quickly which was a plus. Me and my girlfriend shared the dessert sampler. We got the macaroons, melon ice cream and some other dessert which was not that great. I expected the desserts to be a lot better but it fell short. They also have a cute bathroom and many board games to play with your friends. I would suggest coming here with your friends and to order some dessert wines to have a fun evening!

q57yOu2K2BLEsLpbTPaWjw.review_text: Great atmosphere for a low-key mellow night out with your large group of friends/few besties/date night/other possible combos. The wait wasn't too bad- there were a few people ahead of us when I went with my friend at 10:30PM on a Friday night (They close at midnight), but we got seated in 20 minutes or so. We looked over the menu during the wait and decided to share an Ice Cream Sundae and Mango Tango Bellini drink. Everything sounded so amazing and delicious! The ice cream sundae isn't your typical solidified dairy in a transparent cup. It was three separate brownie pieces topped with strawberry ice cream, syrup and finally covered with a strawberry macaron displayed on a rectangular plate. It was good! My friend and I aren't a brownie fan, so that part was okay. The bellini was cute but won't get it next time. We played some connect four afterwards, my skills has drastically declined after competitive playing during rainy days recess in elementary school haha. They have a lot of table games which makes it a perfect place for hanging out. I would definitely come back again! :)

uSCYNal_CJDPGBYUAenyoA.review_text: I wasn't exactly screaming out for a bar where preprepared desserts are assembled and matched with champagne cocktails, but now that I know I have one I can think of worse things to do with an evening.   "Peanut Butter & Jelly Time!" was better than the Financier Chocolate Cake, mostly because I was not expecting the cake to be "deconstructed" (seriously?!) so rather than an ice cream cake (which could have been amazing) it was a frozen mouse that was too recently removed from the freezer and a big chocolate madeline, both sitting on some kind of crum-stuff that was way too plentiful.   So if you're deciding between those two...get the the peanut butter and jelly.    You can also tell there's this attempt to look cute going on because they have a bunch of (modern remakes) of Candyland, but the lighting is way too low to encourage anyone to actually play.

yjG7OzHvhS6xl3D5HldaUw.review_text: SUGAR SUGAR SUGAR. DIABETES GALORE!  Cocktails: 50/50!!!! It consists of orange soda, vanilla, and soju. Definitely reminded me of the childhood days of orange cream soda in glass bottles...except this time there's a slight hint of soju in it. Kind of like an orange yogurt soju! YUM.   The Mango Tango Bellini (sparkling wine, mango sorrbet) was an awkward combination. The carbonation of the wine did not mix with the sweetness of the sorbet, confusing my taste buds with this weird combo. Def. a no-go.  Desserts: Got the "ice cream sundae" with macarons, brownies, ice cream, and lots of strawberries, and the lavender-honey semifreddo. Both were extremely sweet, full of sauce, and extremely average. Not too big of a fan of either (although I thought the lavender was an interesting twist with the almond brittle..kind of reminded me of the Nojo sundae), and most definitely not worth the price.  Loved the board games though!

jkIWv_FJnY273XCRyEIjWQ.review_text: If mediocre tasting desserts and overpriced drinks is your thing, this is the place for you. A lifetime of groupons would not get me to return. It would be nice to have just a normal dessert on the menu: pumpkin pie, strawberry cheesecake, brownie ala mode? The desserts: too much fancy and not enough flavor.

YjfgvFbbFcRiB4KdwXSLdQ.review_text: My husband and I had just finished dinner at Tsunami across the street, and had an 8pm reservation at Candybar. We arrived there an hour early on a Saturday night. The host was welcoming and seated us right away at a cozy table near the kitchen. The ambiance was soothing, romantic, hip, with a quiet downtempo groove playing in the background. Decor was modern and minimalist. Our server was friendly and responsive. We had -- what else -- the dessert sampler menu, which was divine. The amuse was a little shot glass of sparkling lemon gelee (I think that's what our server called it). It was a little too sweet but still tasty. I had the chocolate parfait and warm vanilla cake -- absolutely DIVINE. Hats off to the fine pastry chef! The "mignardise" (milk and cookie) was a cute way to end the "meal."  The milk was actually a condensed milk/dulce de leche concoction that was out-of-this-world. The accompanying cookie was tiny but delicately flavored.   Hubby ordered wine but since I'm not I'm not a drinker, I can't comment on their wine list.  The 'hood is a bit rough, and you'll have a 5% chance of finding parking, but it's worth the effort to get to Candybar. There are a couple of great bars nearby -- Fly Bar and Bar 821 -- so you can make a night of it and head over after satiating your sweet tooth.

iZ2jdT2LLTGzKWwyXdqveg.review_text: This is the  perfect place for a girls night out! Nice ambiance and very attentive staff. The menu consists of petite sized savory and sweet items. Don't be afraid to try something new. Love the white sangria!

bRZgkpM8e8Hpu4KXhvp7VQ.review_text: This is a nice, little dessert restaurant and bar near the Panhandle. This place has some low lighting to give a little more of a romantic feel. Order some dessert and pair it with a glass of their sparkling wine and you are good to go. Also, they have some board games and card games available so you can have a game at your table during your meal.

QIta4g4-1fciUDzJg7Ug3A.review_text: I, like a bunch of other people who recently reviewed this place, came here with a soon to expire Groupon.  We came the day before it was going to expire and there was a line, but not too bad, about 5 parties of 2 ahead of us, we waited about 35 minutes.  But it was freezing, that street is a wind tunnel.  They keep it nice and toasty inside though.  Parking wasn't that bad, I found a spot in about 5 minutes one block away.  We had been there the week before on a Tuesday, when their web site said they were open, but they were closed that day for some reason.  I wish they had posted that on their web site as I checked it before driving over.  But we discovered the pie shop about a block away, and actually enjoyed that more than Candybar.  I am a sugar addict, I eat sweets everyday.  So I can't believe I thought the drinks and at least the dessert I had, were way too sweet.  My friend and I both had the Strawberry Kiss drink, it tasted almost syrupy to me.  I had the peanut butter pie with blackberries, and I didn't like it much at all either.  Way too much sticky blackberry syrup on top.  The combo was not at all good on my stomach.  If I came back, but I doubt that I will, I would stick to a dessert only.  I really like the concept and thought I would love this place, but I actually feel a little nauseous even thinking about it.

H9YMMFSivW58yJJNOZqBHw.review_text: What an awesome dessert lounge! The hubby and I visited Candybar on our last visit to SF. Everything on the menu sounded absolutely delicious. I ended up getting the red velvet cake with the cream cheese frosting and vanilla ice cream. The hubby went for the trio of homemade ice creams. The red velvet cake was so moist and delicious - by far the best I've ever had. The trio of ice creams were also very yummy (all made in house and named after candybars - kit kat/oreos/reese's pb cup). We know the perfect place to visit in SF when we're craving something sweet =).

-MSNa0DlT3per7pltOa9yw.review_text: WOW. I had heard of this place and finally got to go last week. The decor is great. It's fairly spacious and and a cool and relaxing layout. It was happy hour during the time what we went so all the sparkling cocktails were $4. I had the Jasmine Sparkle and it was delicious. We ordered the dessert sampler where you get to choose 4 desserts for $25. We had the Strawberry Limeade, the Japanese cheesecake with guava sorbet and champagne granita and honeydew, the tiramisu, and the apple a la move. OH. MY. GOD. It was heaven on earth. The Japanese cheesecake was definitely my favorite. Its a lighter cheesecake as opposed to the more dense american cheesecake. The guava sorbet complimented the cheesecake and the champagne granita was the cherry on top. Would i come back? In a heartbeat.   Oh, and they also have board games handy in case you want to stay and hang out. With that happy hour? Not a bad idea ;) Would be a good place to go with a date or a group of friends.

_vY8AQuh_LhZxAFhV97shQ.review_text: Awesome tasting deserts and fun board games available for the whole family!!!  Being at the tail end of pregnancy means lots of sweets/deserts cravings...thank goodness I have a loving husband to explore yummy places together

Sa2VtPcy03IULkgA6vNMTw.review_text: i came here tonight & really enjoyed the experience.  as soon as you walk in, you smell the sweetness of baked goods.  a dessert lounge is such a creative idea! as for the drinks, i only tried the strawberry kiss which was pretty good.  had four desserts- the ones i enjoyed the most were the ice cream sandwich & the cheesecake.  the ice cream had a rice flavor which was delicious and the sandwich (green tea?) portion complemented it very well.  i usually do not like cheesecake because it is just too rich for my taste.  the one at candybar was very light and the guava ice cream it came with was very enjoyable.  i did not like the dessert that was covered in chocolate... the cream filling (made of passionfruit) did not go well with it.  it's a good thing they have happy hour because their pricing is a little much for dessert.  however, i have to admit everything about this place was very thought out- from the decor, the presentation of the plates and the ambiance.  what bumped candybar from a 4 to a 5 was their outstanding service.  i was running late for my friend's birthday and as we all know parking in this area is the BIGGEST pain.  the waiter overheard our phone convo and kindly offered parking in their garage space.  i thought that was an extremely kind offer, not to mention i was a quick minute from losing my temper (i was looking for parking for a good 20 minutes).  not only did he save me from my parking disaster, but the staff made sure our party had everything we needed. once we ran out of drinks, they quickly brought us a glass of water and checked up on us frequently (not to the point where it was excessive).  possibly the best service i've received from dining out & ya girl eats out a lot!!!  overall, i had a good time.  i will probably be back due to the great experience i had & will definitely recommend this place to friends!

A-AWLm1o13JCA0Qhnljutg.review_text: Parking sucks. This is San Francisco. Clearly not a fault of Candybar, but it needs to be mentioned because you are much wiser to drop off the rest of your party to put their name on the list while you spend the next 30 minutes hunting for a parking spot.  Atmosphere is great for what Candybar aspires to be. Had a good chat with the owner who tries his best to accommodate everyone on the list. A bunch of my friends (including Chena N.) came here on a Saturday evening on the premise of desserts and drinks. Okay, I'm the one drinking - everyone else had water. Lame.  Their bloody orange cocktail was simple and well executed. I would order it again. The sugar cube adds a nice visual as well as taste to the drink.  I ordered the Drunken S'mores. Very good with a nice thick slab of marshmallow on a chocolate tart. I also sampled their Panna Cotta, and I couldn't believe how fragrant the rose was - strong enough to live up to the name, but not overpowering.  I would definitely come back, and am kicking myself for not having tried this sooner.

lQgW7RJOWkYWguHwjw_RzQ.review_text: Go to a coupon site and get their dessert for 2 w/2 drink coupon. You get to sample 4 desserts and it's worth it! Cool little place with boardgames and comfy chairs.

3fWRgb3uOpnU_GS_dbnEGw.review_text: Honey and I took my out of town uncle and aunt from Vancouver here for dessert.  Ambiance was really nice and the service was attentive.  Ordered wine and the tasting menu.    Desserts were just mediocre and that's not so good when it's the cornerstone of your business.    It's a cool place, love the idea.  I'll give it another try and I'd probably order something from the a la carte menu next time, but for now, it's not first on my list.

GPo8hF7NKr1-aPhhv4DjQw.review_text: Two words: date spot.  Yet rather than losing my appetite amidst all the cupcaking couples, I thoroughly enjoyed a night here with one of my best girlfriends, shamelessly instagraming our delectable choices and making a mental note to return with our mothers.   Greeting you at the door is a sugar coated aroma blended irresistibly with the cozy, dimly lit ambience - so make a reservation, because standing outside in anticipation is cruel and unusual.   The desserts are so artfully crafted I almost hesitated to dig my spoon in and ruin the picture, but let's be real - chocolate espresso pudding with a pecan, red velvet, BACON, crumble? I'll let my tastebuds do the viewing. The sparkling wine cocktails are the cherry on top. Without a full bar there's no temptation to get sloppy, just the right amount of alcohol to put you in the mood to cozy up next to your boo (or bestie or mom) and breathe a sigh of contentment.  In good company (however you may define it) what's not to like about a night of dessert, wine, and board games?

3eV-9dGi5H7ViyduOUCAtw.review_text: Meh! The 2-star Yelp description of  "Meh" says it all! I was so stoked to try this place too. Champagne drinks were a disappointment and tasted like really cheap champagne. Desserts were small and just "meh". Highlight was that they had board games to play as you hung out. I'm not going to lie, my husband and I made a run to target after this to buy some board games for the house. I won't go back but I'm glad I got it off my list of places that I had to try.

ZJqS2Ay9Ga59bNJTgJkAhw.review_text: Desserts, desserts, desserts, need to say more!   The desserts were excellent, and the ambiance was very warm and inviting!  Great place to take your spouse for a nice end to a romantic evening! In fact is my wife and I favorite Sunday evening spot.......  I really like Candybar's concept. It's a fun place to go out if you're not really hungry for dinner, and don't want just drinks, but still want to sit and talk for a while. Their great decor features original art; great friendly service. Although the desserts are creative and pleasant, and the dulce malted milk positively delightful, we would've liked to see a more inspired wine list; this place has great potential but needs a better wine/champagne selection, reason that I am taking off one star.   The decor is decent and features original art. Really to like the place but they need to step it up a notch    By the way, there is no real food here, so eat your meal before arriving.

gZk25h81Vinfr_-Fz6KpAA.review_text: I love candy, and I'm not averse to a fruity cocktail every now and then, too, so giving Candybar a try seemed promising. The atmosphere is a bit weird -- kind of clubby with its dim lights and funky HK-style art, but then there are the board games, which is cool. Desserts and drinks both average around $9 each, and the desserts are definitely shareable. Like many other reviewers, I had a Groupon, and our waiter didn't put up any kind of fuss or try to pull some shady fine print on us. The drinks are all made either with soju or sparkling wine, and all of them were pretty sweet. But, hey, you expect as much from their descriptions on the menu! The desserts were surprisingly tasty; this place definitely tries to be a little creative and fancy with its flavor combo. I was surprised by how sweet the Drunken S'mores were -- seemed like that would be the easiest to pull off well -- and how dense and kind of flavorless the red velvet cake was. Those were the negative surprises. I found the PB&J pretty fun, but you have to love peanuts because there are a whole lot of them on the plate! The sundae was tasty, too, with classic green (it's gotta be green!) mint chip ice cream. Didn't much like the macarons that accompanied the sundae, but the brownies were tasty. It's unlikely I would come back again, as the ambience kind of threw me, but were a friend to really want to try it, I'd have no reservations. It's hard to find good service!

SuszXK44UVRLujjEHpabYg.review_text: I'm a big dessert person so when I heard about opening of the Candybar, I had to go!!! I went there with my sister and a friend on 3/29.  It was fun playing Bingo at our table but we were so disappointed with their food.  We each ordered drinks and dessert tasting - baked alaska, warm vanilla cake etc.  Too sweet, too small & flavorless. Very disappointed...

_pw3dyQUwTcB94bkvJdI8A.review_text: Fun for a get together or first date.    However, because the food doesn't leave me craving to go back for more (it's good, just not amazing), I don't know if I'd go back again.  Considering that I'm a sweets person, it is a little surprising.

psRJ0pMAKAufssK2t06a0w.review_text: Came here with a few friends because I had purchased a groupon and I was actually suprised of how crowded it was! We came around 7 pm and was still able to grab a couch seat right by the window. We all ordered a cocktail, I had a lychee martini, and my friends had a strawberry kiss and a pomegranate blueberry I believe.  All were tasty but I think the lychee was the best.  We also got three desserts to share, the ice cream sandwich (had honeydew ice cream in between macaroon cookies), the apple a la mode, and a s'mores dessert which was like a caramel chocolate tart with marshmallow on top. Out of the three we enjoyed definitely enjoyed the ice cream sandwich the most.  The other desserts were just a little too sweet.  Over all we had a great experience and this is a cute little spot for a date night ;)

DoxlwKliGyLiyWoN0akO0g.review_text: What a cute little dessert bar! It was definitely more of a romantic candle-lit ambiance but also a great place to grab some drinks and delicious desserts with good friends. The music is toned down so you can hear your company and converse without having to yell. There are plenty of couples still whispering sweet nothings to each other in the corners though if you like to see that kind of stuff.   I ordered the white sangria ($6) which was very sweet but very refreshing! Chopped apples and orange pieces floated in a layer on the top and were sized to flow perfectly into your mouth instead of impeding the flow of liquid. If I wasn't so full from dinner I would've tried a bellini since they looked quite tasty. I tried my friends' red sangria, strawberry __ (blanking), and blood orange cocktails. All of which were delicious. The hazelnut semi-fredo was amazing as well.   I heard the happy hour is a steal and that sometimes they have a taco stand outside and you all know how much I love tacos so I'LL BE BACK.

pvmvgoVjlQf28Ywz3NuD_A.review_text: A group of us came here for the desserts after catching Wicked at the Orpheum. It was a good spot for our big group since their were large loungey areas.  The dessert and drink menu offered just enough items, without it being too overwhelming.  We ordered one of each dessert offered for the night and shared among the group. Some of them included:  1. Chocolate Fudgesicle: this was interesting with the cornut brittle.  2. Chocolate Brioche: My favorite! The spongey brioche with a crunchy top layer went well with the cold ice cream. 3.Citrus Salad: this was my least favorite. Something was just strange with this- it didn't seem right to have a fragrantly strong dessert.  4. Chocolate Cremeus Cake- Pomegrante sauce. The cake looked rich, but in fact, it was very light and airy.   I see this as a good place to bring friends who aren't so much into drinks but are fans of desserts. Overall, good to try once and couldn't complain about the service.

PfbmDAiFhv_c4s_Aat_bow.review_text: Dessert meets unapologetically girly booze meets walking distance from my apartment?  I'm THERE.  It's been a few months since I tried Candybar with a friend, but we were both pleased and have been meaning to return.  Our bubbly was nice and not excessively priced for the type of venue, and the bartender was pleasantly attentive.  OK, I guess it's not hard for a dude to be pleasantly attentive to two obviously tipsy ladies having a relationship hard luck story sob-fest while sitting at his bar, but still.  By the way, Candybar is the perfect venue for that sort of thing, should you need one...  We didn't adore everything about our desserts but they felt like an honest effort to get creative using interesting ingredients and, as a whole, were very tasty.  They're particularly great to share with friends, because really, who needs an entire portion of lavender-flavored ice cream?

cpgJTQADZFCodzC7zqA6Pg.review_text: Great concept, right? Drinks and Dessert! Bring on the smiles.  Honestly though, the concept is better than the reality.  We ordered 5 desserts...a chocolate mousse thing, tiramisu, PB&J etc. etc.  Not a single one was impressive.  To top it off, the guy who was serving us was Suupppppaaah disinterested in our party of 10. Really? You don't want to let down all that many peepz. Don't think I'd be back, which is disappointing.

sxdfddO23yhpPlH21wfKUA.review_text: Happy hour until 8pm?  I'm there.    All the different champagnes were so lovely.  I loved the "Strawberry Kiss."  It's to die for.    The desserts were amazing.  They were just as tasty as the boy that made them.  I kept seeing this sexy tattooed man walk to and from the kitchen.  I pointed him out to my friends and they proclaimed, "Let's make it happen!"  They talked to the waiter and found out he's the pastry chef, and more importantly, he's single.  Perfection.  Tan, who I affectionately referred to as "Tom" (and by "affectionately" I mean I was drunk and actually thought his name was Tom), was amazing.  He brought my boy out.  He told us that he got off work at midnight and that we should come back.    We sure as shit did.    Overall, this place is too cute.  I had the best time.  I'll be back as soon as this champagne hangover subsides.

xT3GqwqDXm5xNaPhXQksjA.review_text: i've been wanting to try this place! it's great that my friend and i went there earlier, so it was a bit quiet and not much crowd. the place is very intimate, small, and swanky--somehow. we got the choco financier cake with bavarian creme, and the trio of ice cream... both aren't bad. customer service wasn't a nightmare and what's interesting is they DO have board/card games available for entertainment.  i will definitely come back...and maybe have my next bday celebrate it here.

40aRVWRDWoYs4Txq-YVRcA.review_text: Been meaning to try this place, but haven't had a chance to. A living social deal finally prompted me to try this place out, for a good price too!  Dim lights, with the added effect of many candle lights softens the edge that the paintings on the walls portray. The place was small, and on a weekend, wait time for a party of 2 was 1 hour! I wasn't that surprised that it took so long to get a table though, because there were about 2-3 big groups. With the added bonus of a selection of board games on the shelf, it is a nice place to chill and hangout with friends..but would also take people forever to leave.  For drinks, we ordered a Mango Tango Bellini and a Blueberry Pomegranate Fusion. The mango one was quite delicious and the mango sorbet inside gave the drink something special. The blueberry one was a bit on the sour side and I felt like I was just drinking berry juice.  For desserts, we had Japanese Cheesecake and Ice Cream Sandwich. Very delectable and a good blend. I liked that the dessert wasn't overly sweet, with a good balance of taste and texture.  Next time, I'd be sure to arrive early or make reservations. One thing to take note of, parking is incredibly hard to find! It took us roughly 45~50 minutes just to find parking about 6 blocks away.

RjS4yZZBlziOagSHk5AQcA.review_text: This spot is a great addition to the nighborhood.  These guys brought wine together with dessert.  What more can you ask for?  I'm there for the wine and my wife is there for dessert.  It's a win-win situation.    The staff is friendly and knowledgeable.  The desserts were different (in a good way), creative, and of course tasty,  For those that prefer wines, they have a eclectic collection of wines.  Many that I wouldn't have tried had they not carried it.    I still remember this duck pate that I had as an appetizer.  I don't know how they prepared it, but it was fantastic.    I've been here a number of times and it would be many more, but parking can be real pain.

y04xGWT2JIHW0Q-vGeyjUg.review_text: Cute spot to hang out with a group of friends or girl's-night-out. The desserts were REALLY good! We had the chocolate cake (melt-in ur mouth and not very cakey...$9) & lemon tart (perfect tanginess accompanied by the buttery dough...$8). The drinks were also yummy... the 50/50 (soju, OJ, vanilla..$8) was my favorite bc it tasted like a tu-tone popsicle =)  They also have fun boardgames.... so we just chilled, drank, nibbled on our sweets and played speed connect four=)    Chic, fun, and laid back...

jTxVm8kdKBxdO3FpvFSM_w.review_text: I had SUCH a wonderful experience here.  From the decor, to the ambiance, to the desserts and dessert champagnes, to the games.  We went on a weekday at around 8pm and were seated right away... the hostess and server were very friendly!  Then we took our time as we ordered 2 desserts and 2 drinks, per our groupon.... then another dessert since we were 3 girls.  We had the peanut butter jelly time, apple a la mode, and the chocolate financier cake.  All 3 were terrific, although our personal favorite was the peanut butter and jelly time.  It wasn't too sweet and was very creatively made... I highly recommend others to try it too!  As for drinks, we ordered the mango tango bellini and the passion fruit... both were delicious.  All things ordered were elegantly plated and presented.  I would say one of the best things though, were the games.  We got caught up playing "True Colors" and ended up laughing and chatting for over 2 hours.  It's such a great place to catch up with old friends, hang out after dinner, or bring a date.  I will definitely be back... with my husband this time!  =)  Thank you candybar, for exceeding my expectations!

hhEuEJw8ClyuosDCTuukjA.review_text: After my birthday dinner, we were craving some good wine and dessert. After a quick Google search, Candybar's site came up boasting a luxury lounge feel with great wine and desserts. Upon arriving, the ambiance was more of a coffee shop/diner than lounge. Definitely not cool or hip in any way. The red velvet seats were dirty and had unknown substances spilled on them, so we all huddled on the non-velvet chairs. The service was pretty bad and our waiter's attitude acted as he could care less if we were there or had a good experience.  The wine list - if you could call it that - was more of "do you want red or white?" but the dessert list was pretty good. We got drunken s'mores and the ice cream sandwich. The s'mores was good but a little too chocolatey. The melon ice cream in the sandwich was amazing and I wanted to eat an entire gallon of it myself.

MSRq1PRc0HBHjSH5SlaFmQ.review_text: Have been here several times & love this place! Agree with the post below- great concept... We usually venture over here looking for something sweet after the happy hour 1/2 price pizzas at Fly Bar. Loooove the Peanut Butter & Jelly time! They also have a variety of board games you can play. Cozy atmosphere, but pretty small. Gets crowded on the weekends.

VIizV17US2OUqe2rEknuog.review_text: Great little place!  Just came here last night to get some post dinner drinks/desserts and of course, play some boardgames. What a gem! We got seated right away and literally within a half hour the place was packed (surprisingly for a Sunday night) .. Our table of four split 2 combos (4 desserts) - the highlights were the flour less chocolate cake, macaroon ice cream sandos, lemon tart and apple pie. The best part truly of this place is the relaxed vibe... We stayed for about 2 hrs and laughed harder than we had in a long time - playing old school boardgames and eating great dessert.   Definetky would recommend for small groups and dates.... Thumbs up :)

t_L5W32yaD9pYRuRQkxT5g.review_text: Cute place, good dessert.  My cherry blossom drink was meh, but service was really friendly and the macaron sandwich was pretty darn good.  I did come with a Groupon and thought it was a good deal, but without it, it's a bit pricy

CaPyiVJ7QAnT-Fp4CSmbRA.review_text: I'm glad a dessert place like this finally opened up in SF.  This is what was really lacking in the bay area and I hope more places like this start opening up in brother cities such as Fremont, San Mateo, and San Jose.  They have very affordable desserts that compliment very fresh and delicious desserts.  The most memorable was the fresh chocolate chip cookies with malted milk.  You get three and it was only $5.  How can you beat that?    The lighting is a little dark and caters more to the romantic couples though it would work for a group of friends.  Only advice is to increase the lighting so the patrons don't get tired in short time span.  They have games and puzzles to play as well from a large bookcase.

gnmbPDBQoLW_SVdSqv07vw.review_text: One of my favorite dessert place in the city! I have a huge sweet tooth and my body is definitively paying for it. Anyhoo ...   I use to be regular. Came to candy bar every weekend to the point the owner or worker knew me and always said welcome back! I took a break and came back like half a year later and he STILL remembered me!! Yay!!   The wait was super long :( going to candybar on a weekend night with just 2 people is the best because you can get a table pretty quick.   My favorite dessert there is the strawberry limeade, ice cream sandwich (melon ice cream & macaroons!) and my favorite drinks are 50/50 & lemon shot because I'm such a light weight.

Qu9EHdFbrYXQECwl-tGq9A.review_text: Candybar is one of the places I love to frequent because I can come here for their awesome happy hour (which ends later than most places...at around 7 or 8...darn I forget) and get drunk while feeling classy. The place is small, but that's what makes it so awesome. The atmosphere is very warm and cozy and is the perfect place to seduce your date post dinner. They also have some cool art on the walls and board games like Connect Four or Blokus for people to play.   The drinks are yummy and the desserts are both fancy and funky. The menu changes all the time so the good thing is that there is always something new to try. The downside is that sometimes a dessert which should never disappear, will do just that. The first dessert I ever had here was their cheesecake and it was so yummy. I came back hoping to relive the moment but alas, the menu had changed. So sad...I hope they bring it back! I also had this nacho sundae once which was the cutest thing I have ever seen. They basically created a dessert to look like nachos with salsa, sour cream, and guacamole. Mmm!

M_7cjIKGD3HfQ1G6SyjhkA.review_text: The perfect place for people whose backends are full from having too much money in their wallets but mostly from being fat.  I'm certainly not one to judge how people spend their money--but $100 for a dessert you can finish in 4 bites and a couple glasses of bubbly?  This is why people hate America.

YGfWXlF23VVk5HLKfoKNtA.review_text: This place is a great addition to the neighborhood and the staff here are incredibly sweet so the name is very fitting! Excellent wine list- and a good balance of sweet and savory dishes on the small plates menu.  The space feels very open and the atmosphere is quite casual.  They had board games available and I never turn down an opportunity to kick some ass so I challenged my friend to Connect Four.  Considering we were playing to see who would buy the drinks, I knew I had a lot at stake and my concentration was high.  I ended up winning of course so I got to drink for free and bask in my glorious achievement of being a skilled player of a game invented for the ages 7+.    The pork terrine was excellent. I suggested they add just a couple more crostini or cornichons to the dish and make it more proportional. They also have a duck pate which I didn't try ( I think pork pate/terrine usually has a more mild flavor while duck tends to be richer in flavor)  I also sampled a Riesling from the white wine menu and even though the server didn't know about the wine, she offered me a taste and it was quite wonderful.  My suggestion would be that the staff definitely should get to know the wine a bit more. But she handled it well and was a total sweetheart.  I like that the place is family owned and run because you can feel the love that they put into this place. I will definitely return and I can't wait to try the other savory dishes.

htB7ndigLzcMgxXXxwyCUA.review_text: I came on a Saturday night as an after dinner dessert treat. I bought the groupon for $17 for 2 cocktails and 2 desserts.   Drinks: 3 stars- They weren't particularly special except they put fruit in each drink.  Desserts: 5 stars- DELICIOUS, I had the limeade with strawberries on top and it was served in a cute jar. Very light but still filling. Also had the tiramisu which was delicious and coffee grounds with chocolate on the side was a nice touch. Also, portions are perfect!

BgyKWaiuft8zANumHuiQ8Q.review_text: If you can find parking, Candybar is quite an experience. I was struck by the classiness of the establishment when a gentlemen opened the door for entry and exit, wishing us well for the evening.   This place is not so much of a dessert destination as it is a social destination. The ambiance is classy and relaxed and the desserts match the ambiance. The desserts are sophisticated and the tastes surprising. If I lived in the neighborhood, I would be regular if for no other reason than the ambiance.

dPllAQ27hQbjSxeOlYOl3A.review_text: By far the best dessert I've ever had. We had the apple a la mode and I'm not much of an apple person but this was AMAZING! We also had the tiramisu; it was good but not as good as the apple a la mode. The drinks are awesome too. They are a dessert in themselves. I had the 50/50 and it tasted like a orangsicle.   Prices are a bit expensive, but I had a Groupon. I would definitely go back for a special occasion.

CSfjaTVpxugpRNEd0RtsxQ.review_text: This was a cute little place offering a delightful menu of dessert and sparkling wine/fruity type drinks which were all very refreshing. Not your neighborhood Willy Wonka candy store. This is seriously a dessert place for mature palettes. The dessert shop and bar was low lit, had fun art on the walls and a whimsical chandelier. I loved the cubbies full of books and classic board games. It is just a fun and cool concept.  Notable desserts: Peanut Butter Jelly Time ~ chocolate tart with peanut butter cream, salted candied peanuts and blackberries  was a sophisticated take on childhood nostagia. It was the right combination of tangy, sweet and salty!  Drunken S'more ~ with Bailey's chocolate sauce not too sweet, good didn't really wow me but delicious nonetheless!  Apple Pie A La Mode ~ hazelnut crust, cream cheese filling, caramel and gingerbread ice cream, nice texture with the crispy hazelnut crust meeting the soft cream cheese filling and ice cream, yum!!!  Flourless chocolate banana torte ~ pineapple, peanuts, and vanilla bean ice cream. Chocolate and banana really do go well together! There was a great balance in this dessert.  Strawberry Limeade ~strawberry mousse, vanilla cake, calamansi cream and strawberry layered inside of a small jar, fun to eat!  Cocktails that I like:  Passion Fruit Delight ~sparkling wine and passion fruit puree Strawberry Kiss ~sparkling wine, strawberry puree and gingerale  Lychee Guava Martini ~ soju, lychee, guava nectar  Jasmine Sparkle ~ so refreshing sparkling wine wine, jasmine and lemon  The cocktails were generously poured  and well made. Cozy, trendy without being pretentious. Perfect for couples or small groups. Super courteous service. I love desserts and I love cocktails so this is a place that makes perfect sense to me. Four stars!

cmZsjBEXce-L6arBcn0DMg.review_text: Whenever I crave an unusual but delicious dessert I walk over to candybar.  I love the the smell of this place right when I first walk in...it's heaven.  The staff is warm, friendly and attentive.  This place is a perfect first date place because you should dump anyone that doesn't like dessert and wine!

qVWzlwN6Y4K4wh7gsncpng.review_text: It's OK. It's kinda cute. It has bored games. Desserts are small portion but high priced. The drinks are pretty good. I would come for their happy hour though because I hear the strawberry kiss and the mango tango I'd on the menu!!

AOorj__BPVS3r_xhcbrciQ.review_text: Such a wonderful little cozy spot! If you love sweets and alcohol you have to try this place. It's also a great place to finish off a first date =) All drinks and desserts are reasonably priced.  I had the melon ice cream maccaroon with chocolate ganache and melon bits. It's pretty sweet but the melon bits evens out the sweetness.  I also got to try the Apple alamode. Not too sweet so eating both desserts at once was just prefect for my taste buds.  For my cocktail I had the mango tango. The glass is rimmed with a candy sugar and inside the glass is a scoop of mango sorbet. Yummm I came here at Aaron's 9 oclock on a Saturday night. It was packed but was seated within 5 mins.

2arktuJpl9ppv732COJbhA.review_text: I went tue night to celebrate a friends birthday. And I was so excited that I wanted to share. It's a lounge/bar/dessert place/play games place. I loved sipping my drink, eating my  yummy choco chip bread pudding whilst playing connect four and catch phrase. I'm totally gonna frequent this place

9OyPEDQ0N6i0rWv9S-XjgQ.review_text: This place is the perfect spot for a cute date or girls night out. The desserts are unique and tasty, there are drinks for all tastes (cocktails, beer, and wine), and games for when you want a bit of extra entertainment!  At the enthusiastic recommendation of the girls sitting nearby, two of us decided to split the Peanut Butter Jelly Time and the Flourless Chocolate Banana Torte.  The Peanut Butter Jelly Time ($9) was a chocolate peanut butter tart SMOTHERED in blackberries and some sort of jam-like substance, served with delicious candied peanuts. I liked it, though I would say that it had diminishing returns. After a few bites I became pretty overwhelmed by the peanut butter and blackberries.  The Flourless Chocolate Banana Torte ($10) served with vanilla ice cream was pretty good though fairly standard. I couldn't taste much banana flavor in the cake unfortunately. Don't worry - the pineapple listed on the menu is only a side garnish. It was actually pretty nice to have a some tartness after all that sugar!  On a separate occasion, I tried some sort of ice cream sandwich with macarons and remember liking it quite a bit. I don't see it on the online menu, however...  As for the drinks - I started with a sparkling wine cocktail with blueberry-pomegranate juice. I'm not a big fan of sweet drinks usually, but I really enjoyed this! My friend ordered the Stawberry Kiss and seemed to like it. Next time I'll either split ONE dessert or stick to beer to avoid sugar overload!  And finally, THE GAMES: Battleship, Connect 4, Chutes and Ladders, Apples to Apples, the list goes on! Really fun way to spend an evening!

p2gELbhxFgDmvJDxHB2D4w.review_text: Came here after dinner on a Friday night around 10:30 with the gf and some friends since we all had a sweet craving that needed taking care of. I've personally driven past this place a million times and the few times we've tried to go parking was absolutely impossible. But fortunately we lucked out that night... 2 and a half blocks away hah!  We walked in and got seated right away luckily (there were 5 of us and it was fairly packed inside but not overly crowded). It was dark inside with the lighting setting a more intimate mood but at the same time more social (if that makes any sense) since there were couples there as well as groups of friends. Best way to describe this place is dessert lounge. The menu was made up of fancy desserts as well as a fair sized drink menu, the drinks being comprised of beer, wine, champagne, specialty cocktails (made with soju and such, not hard liquor) and similar. Also, they had board games and cards there which I thought was pretty cool.  I went with the Apple a La Mode ($9). It came out along with the other orders fairly quick and I gotta say, I was impressed. The plating was exquisite and the flavors were on a whole other level! Take note tho they're really sweet so be prepared!  I forgot the name of our server but he was great. Nice, sharp, sense of humor and happily willing to split our single check between 2 cards and cash so a shoutout to you good sir. I would definitely return here, probably like after dinner or something. The desserts were great, the prices for them seemed just a wee bit high (average around $9-$10) but I guess that's expected for a dessert lounge? And prepare to spend some time looking for parking!

AqwTAjoyG5HfhQi2-ab4cw.review_text: I love the kitschy atmosphere with the board games. My boyfriend isn't really a dessert type of guy, but I could totally see having a great girl's night out here. The drinks were on the sweet side. i wish they served hard alcohol instead of just wine and beer. It really limits the creativity of the cocktails.  We shared the tiramisu and the apple/hazelnut concoction. The tiramisu was very good -- light and not cloyingly sweet. Even with that, it got pretty heavy after a while. Neither of us particularly cared for the other dessert. It was way too heavy, with the cake drenched in a syrupy goo and the cinnamon flavor was overwhelming.  Our server looked pretty pissy and did not make us feel welcome. Maybe it was because we used a groupon. I think this is certainly a place that I want to come back to because there aren't that many dessert bars in the city.

zxSXv_Z7S73A_2T_tyNSbw.review_text: So I came here a while ago and had a long wait and a tiramisu which was just not very good. But I always wanted to come back again and try their red velvet cake (on a day when I'd actually allow myself to eat something so decadent...) and try one of their drinks, and finally, this past weekend, I was able to.  Actually, I went one night when it was so crowded I couldn't even get in. When we got there we were told that the wait would be longer than they were open for so we had to leave. The next night we came back (early!) and they told us there was a two hour wait, but to come back in half an hour. Confusing. I think the girl was doing the best she could. We came back in exactly half an hour and they said another half-hour, but I noticed there were definitely not that many people ahead of us actually waiting for their name to be called on the list, so we waited outside for just 10 more minutes before we were called. Phew. I didn't want to have to have ANOTHER night canceled because they were again too crowded.  I had about had it--I mean, I'd come here a few months ago and also had at least an hour wait, and the dessert was sub-par. Why on earth had I come back again? Clearly people liked it, but it had to be a helluva good dessert to prove it to me.  Service was friendly but very slow. You'd think they'd try rushing us out faster since they had such a long line of people who, if they were actually told straight-up that it'd be a 30-60 minute wait, would actually stay in line and business would cycle faster and they'd get more money. They also screwed up my boyfriend's drink order (as well as the drink order of the girl next to us) but they could have been really busy or short-staffed that night and they brought us the correct drink with no trouble.  I would have gotten irritated except for when we got our dessert...  holy cow...  that red velvet cake...  AHHHHH  HEAVEN  SO much better than the tiramisu. And I ordered the blood orange drink that was exactly the kind of drink I like--just the right amount of sour. My boyfriend got the semifreddo which he didn't like at all so maybe it's just the cake that's good, but OH. WOW. It's the kind of red velvet cake for people who like really dense cakes that are deliciously sweet and fatty, not light and airy. It didn't have a lot of frosting and usually I'm a frosting gal but wow, this cake was so enjoyable when you just took a slow bite and let the flavors melt in your mouth, I could eat it every day for the rest of my life and not even mind the health consequences because MAN was it good. If you like red velvet cake, you need to try this cake.  So I don't know. So far I didn't like the other desserts, and maybe the drinks were a little pricey, but the servers were nice and the red velvet cake was omnomnomnomzzonmz...soooo...if I ever have a day I decide I'm particularly worthy of an extra couple thousand calories, I'll be back. Trust me.

1YitSIu4R1A7Gjfazn3pNg.review_text: I absolutely love this place! Drinks, desserts, and board games? Yes, please! They have very unique desserts and drinks (and they're all delicious). The ice cream sandwich is amazing - almond French macaron cookies sandwiching honeydew ice cream. All of their fruity champagne cocktails are yummy as well. The atmosphere is very intimate and cozy. They have fun art hanging and the service is good. They are slightly pricey but I think that is to be expected of a place like this,

VaPQ_fUy775jzzoNPWR0kQ.review_text: Came here with seven of my best gf's last Wednesday night for Happy Hour (6-8pm thank you) and was pleasantly surprised by the ambiance, drinks, food and the games!  My friend made a reservation and we got the window seat in the front corner. Pretty comphy seating, with dim lights and awesome throwback hip-hop.  Three of us arrived early and immediately got to ordering drinks..I had the Blood Orange cocktail all night, while others in my party had the Strawberry Kiss and the Red and White Sangria. I still think mine was the best, but the Sangria was okay too.  For dessert I split the Carrot Cake with a friend. Not your traditional hunk-o-cake but it was moist, served with some whipped cream, not from a can thank god, and a little dollop of ice cream (see photos).   My friends ordered an assortment of:   Tiramisu: awseome...big portion definitely share-worthy with lots of yummy coffee "crumbles" around the plate  Chocolate Financier cake: (see photo) pretty much a chocolate cake and a cheesecake I think...I concentrated more on the other desserts  Panna Cotta: delicious! A strawberry balsamic reduction is a great surprise at the bottom and I dont even like strawberries that much  Ice Cream Sandwich: yummy chewy cookie loaded with ice cream and blueberries. Divine.  For all the desserts and the numerous rounds of drinks we got it (I had at least 6, dont judge) the total was only $28 a person. We also got to play Apples to Apples...love it! and there were lots of couples and business guys grabbing an after work drink as well. SO bummed I didn't know about this place before as I live down the street, but I will definitely be back for another visit!

FocjwNt9GbOSln9iFCFwtQ.review_text: Candybar is a fun place to hang out post dinner with friends or if you're on a date. They've got a 15-20 different board/card games that you can use while you're sipping fruit infused champagne and nibbling on desserts.  As far as the desserts, I wasn't entirely impressed but I do give them credit for being inventive. They pair interesting flavors together such as green tea ice cream with an oversize lavender macaroon.   If I were to try something again it would be the Apple Pie a la Mode and the Chocolate Mousse. I'm not a fan of coconut shavings so was turned off by the red velvet cake.   The drinks are crazy good though! A little pricey ($8-10 for a flute) but definitely worth trying at least once. I like the strawberry kiss.

KaYOfYUmbHl3WBMIcYz-iw.review_text: Over priced. I had a red velvet cake slice and it was not good.  I love red velvet and eating desserts! I rarely not finish my desserts but at Candybar I just couldn't eat it all !!! Can't order lattes or speciality coffees.  It is nice you can play board games and the art work is a nice touch. I feel the concept is good but the desserts need work.  Simple no frills desserts to me would work better.  Trying to hard on tweeking desserts that doesn't please the palate. There are some desserts that are good being made the old fashioned way.

QQv2tPG5NfQJvQDoZO7ehA.review_text: Im giving this place 5 stars now because they've expanded their dessert menu and there's so much more to choose from!!!!  LOVE LOVE LOVE! It's all about the Peanut ButterJelly Time dessert!  This is the PERFECT place to come after dinner to relax and have a lil' piece of heaven :)

OIhURI9iLw4-mh7fHE-M1A.review_text: We started out with the shrimp mousseline stuffed squash blossoms.  They tasted and looked like hot dogs.  Enough said.    The desserts were appalingly small.  I was excited about the dark and white chocolate and figs.  I thought it was going to be something having to do with chocolate covered figs.  The dish comes, and its a big plate, and the ingredients pushed to one side.  There were two quennelles of some sort of ice cream, I think that was the white chocolate part.  I asked where the dark chocolate was.  He said it was the cookie bits.  I lifted up the figs and there were three teeny tiny pieces of chocolate cookie somethingorother.  And the figs, oy vey.  I think they took one fig, sliced it into three pieces, and made them look pretty.  The basil foam was tasty though.  It was really pathetic.    My partner got the parfait which was incredible and rich.  It was small too but because it was so rich, you couldn't eat a lot of it.  It was like a half melted candy bar.  I envisioned some layered thing in a glass.    As for wine, I wanted some sort of madeira that they were out of, but of course they had one for $3 more.  Got that, it was good, but $10 for a few ounces?  My partner and I ended up swapping drinks.    The service was nothing to write home about.  Our waiter (a smile wouldn't have killed him) came up to us right away and because we didn't know what we wanted he gave us more time but we basically didn't see him the rest of the night.  Any time we wanted anything we had to get the attention of the greeter man at the front door, or anyone else passing by.    Yes, you feel slightly hip on the big banquettes sipping your wine, but if you want dessert, take your $6 over to Sweet Inspirations on Market in the Castro and get some incredible eats that last more than one bite.

oykwT5s_KKQNtlOvpyGjcg.review_text: I use yelp regularly but have never written a review- so this is my first one.   Probably the worst service and treatment I have experienced living in SF for years...that alone says a lot. I purchased a Groupon- wanted to give this place a try. Yes it expired 3/16 and yes I (along with many others) went on 3/16 to claim our Groupons, but A.that is our prerogative and B. it didn't say there was a reso needed and it didn't say no takeout)! A Groupon expiring on 3/16 means that you can still claim it on 3/16. When I arrived at 8pm and saw the line of waiting people, I was just going to pick a few things up to go.   When I finally spoke with the host:  RUDE HOST: "You probably won't be seated by 10pm and we close at 10pm" ME: "Ok, can I order a few items to go?" RUDE HOST: "No." ME: "Hmm...can you extend the Groupon one day so I can come back?" RUDE HOST: "Nope."  ME: "So....I can't be seated before you close....I can't order anything to go... and you can't extend the deadline for us because you are unable to accommodate us?" RUDE HOST:  "You had a year to use it." ME: "I understand that I had a year to use it, but I am here, before the expiration and I would like to use it and I can't" RUDE HOST: "Yep."  All I could think of was how dumb business move this was. Here were a bunch of people, who could potentially turn into returning customers, refer others, write great yelp reviews and ultimately boost business. I totally get that these businesses probably only break even on Groupon deals in hopes of getting great marketing- but I don't think that the people at Candybar understand that by treating their new eager customers wanting to try THEM out rudely, and by ultimately pocketing our money without being flexible because they could not accommodate us, they are turning their potential supporters into haters. Not only will I never go there and veto group outings to go there, but I would advise others not to go there as well.   I'm usually a super positive person so its a bummer to write such a negative review. All they had to do was extend the deal and everyone would be happy. Too bad.    Hope they change their mind...

rsmX4xMkWsC5g2OmrKYNOQ.review_text: I had a great time here saturday night, got there around 7-7:30 just in time to beat the rush. Went with my boyfriend , We played Would you rather and Table Topics.... after 2 glasses of wine we were having a great time. We ordered the Tiramisu which was great and fresh. The wine list is less than ideal, but I understand that the clientele might not be as concerned with the wine as they are with the dessert or "signature cocktails".  The service was great and the place has a fun vibe, great to go with your boyfriend but NOT on a first date .... It gets loud so you end up screaming at each other ... which we didn't mind doing :) Such a fun place to go with a group !  Dont expect a good wine selection but order yourself a glass of bubbly and tiramisu and you'll have a blast!  GREAT service on a Saturday night, by the host and the bartender.

8pONVRF4HDD9ynt5lCynTQ.review_text: Call me what you like, this is the one place to avoiod the skinny man-jeans and American Apparel shiny spandex pants so popular in this hood these days. Candybar's a class act. A decent wine list plus delicious (and lady-sized) desserts plus engaging, friendly owners and staff equals 4 stars. The decor is dim and kind of sexy. The seating is comfortable and overall, they manage to make it cozy, modern, and sexy all at the same time.   Throw in panna cotta and some champagne and now we're talking. The staff really is lovely. I can't believe the neighbors (i.e. the "I'm so original and not a yuppy but look the same as everyone else in this neighborhood" hipsters) have been so averse to this darling little gem. I mean, what the hell is the difference between Candybar and NOPA? Oh yeah! Candybar is better. Go there now.

9UMoH_L6TsrNWAkvxLeDYQ.review_text: I was so pleasantly surprised by this place because of the friendly staff and great vibe.  The place is small, and you'll probably wait for a spot on a weekend evening but it's totally worth it.  Hubby and I grabbed a place at the bar, which wasn't a bad place for people watching.  If we had more space, we probably would've gotten one of the board games you can borrow from the bookshelf.  The bartender was so nice and really made it fun to be there.  We had the ice cream sandwich and apple a la mode for dessert and blood orange cocktail and strawberry kiss to go with.  They were perfect pairings.  Can't wait to come back!

8gO5GPyZZgtpouv1pmPprA.review_text: THE HYPE! oh the irony .... this place is definitely a let down. I know droves of people love it, but seriously after you get over the small gimmicks (board games and cards provided) and the nice atmosphere, the desserts here aren't actually delish? Yes that's right, they are very average. Any upscale restaurant that doesn't "specialize" in desserts have about the same quality and flavors and most have even bigger portions for dessert! I did enough the "next door neighbor's treehouse" vibe that the decor and area gave off, but seriously the food, the prices, and the drinks were all a total let down. Definitely NOT recommended.

UHiMQhuEGuUy4T5ag18zOg.review_text: Saved room for dessert after a great dinner and headed to candy bar on a Saturday night.  The desserts looked pretty delicious, but the drunken s'mores was a bit too sweet for my taste.  The apple a la mode was pretty good for the first couple of bites, but overall it was nothing too impressive.  We definitely expected more considering it was a restaurant based almost entirely on sweets. The drinks were pretty weak, we got the strawberry kiss and Guava Lychee Martini.  The strawberry kiss tasted alright, but the guava lychee martini tasted really strange.   It was pretty cool that they had games, but it felt a little awkward with the tables so close together.    Overall, it had a nice atmosphere, has board games you can play, the desserts were nothing special, and the drinks tasted alright but were very weak.  Parking (street) was a major pain on saturday night, but that was expected.

zd_TQ_Pm9A_KdiBAcEpP8A.review_text: This place is disgusting. "Cocktails" are cheap sparkling wine with different snow cone syrups. Why wine? This is a "bar" without a liquor license.  So the deserts should compensate for this, right? Resounding no. They were unbearable. This is not hyperbole: both the s'mores and strawberry limeaid tied for the most disgusting food items I have ever tasted. Everything had a weird chemical taste and we both started feeling sick while we ate this garbage.  We made it a third of the way through our melted adult snow cones and chemical-sugar medleys.  Maybe you've lost your sense of taste and smell and you're wondering of this place is for you. I pray that you're also blind and deaf. Shitty bro street art adorns this train wreck's dub-step-Passion Pit-echoing walls.  I'm not a food snob and don't have an agenda. I'm honestly offended that an establishment like this profited from me... this is more of a PSA than a review. Such abysmal, dirty, filthy, abhorrent trash.

FjT39HLJBDAne_KqbNmAkA.review_text: totally a gem. lounge-y, relaxed, super nice and attentive staff.

JR0G0xlQRep0jRea1_9QIQ.review_text: Good find.  Candy Bar! Combining two great things, desserts and alcohol. Finally I can get a girly drink and not feel so damn judged about it. They make it fun, they got board games. I'd definitely make a night here, bust out the monopoly and have some orange deliciousness (i can't remember the actual drink name) I didn't even have to order the actual desserts to get my sweet fix.  One star minus was for parking. It is a female dog to get to the bar if you don't live in the area. I went with maybe 5 friends, and we were all parked 6 blocks away from the bar.

R5QmeesF5XYUsvP1XJqDYQ.review_text: I'm doing this review in conjunction with my last review as a theme.  This place is a dessert bar; I've discovered that I'm a fan of dessert bars!  It's a great concept:  dessert+alcohol=what's not to like?  So, we ended up here on Saturday night for dessert & a drink.  I had a late huge lunch, so this was my dinner, along with some snacks at a friend's house party.  The place is surprisingly warm & cozy inside, especially since they kept the door open.  The setting is slightly more casual than the dessert bar that I went to in Pasadena, as I don't think they serve meals here, and they have board games on shelves for you to browse & play!  Think of it as a nice café/bar.  I was in totally casual clothing, since I'd been out and about in a sweatshirt, jeans, & tennis shoes all day, but most of the other people there were slightly dressed up.  I'm guessing that most people had come from a dinner out elsewhere.  So, we shared  Chocolate butterscotch brownie with candied walnuts, fudge, thyme ice cream:  pretty good, nice presentation, not sure if they make their own ice cream, but thyme is quite the unique ice cream flavor (but having unique ice cream flavors seems to be the trend nowadays) Green tea bread pudding with toasted almonds, chocolate chips, vanilla bean ice cream:  pretty good, again, nice presentation The portions aren't very big, so it's a good thing we weren't very hungry. I had the strawberry kiss to drink.  It's a spritzer type sparkling wine mixed with ginger ale, with a frozen strawberry in it.  I had a hard time deciding which "cocktail" to get, so this was the server's favorite, so I got it & was happy with it.  Located on the south side of Fulton, between Broderick & Divisadero.  Parking can be a bit challenging in this area, which we discovered firsthand.

OWxvilxA4L_6njVDYqbN6w.review_text: I had a great experience. Our waitress was named Kim. She was fast and great! Will be coming back.

e2c_SnA8ioMxTSzM8cXlYg.review_text: A group of friends and I decided to visit this dessertery based on Yelp reviews and one of our group member's suggestions.    We were sorely disappointed.   First, there was a wait, which we actually didn't mind at all.  A small "intimate" place like this definitely would be overcrowded on a Saturday night.  However, the host was quite rude when we wanted to put our names down on the seating list.  He kept telling us that there were groups ahead of us, but there was no one waiting around at all.  Seats began opening up, but to our dismay, the people that WERE NOT there, were still ahead of us!  Further, we found out someone to be a co-owner of some sort kept taking photographs of the patrons, including us, who, by definition, were not patrons yet!  Again, I'm all for owners to promote their business, however, I think she should seriously consider CA Civil Code Sec. 3344(a) before doing anything with those photos!  After waiting 30 minutes for NO ONE, we decided to leave.  Ready and willing customers, just walked out.  We will not be returning here, and we suggest, against popular demand, that you don't either.  It's just bad business. Period.

Fe7C6jRUU5l4_An-xsLzNw.review_text: Ambiance: Romantic interior with dim lighting. Low lounge tables, cafe tables, bar.  YUM: Japanese Cheesecake with guava ice cream and melon granita (light cheesecake, fruity ice cream, and fresh fruit...DELICIOUS!!).  Bottoms Up: Strawberry Kiss, Passionfruit Delight (fruity syrups with sparkling wine)  Money Honey: $18  Notes: This place is super cute! It is definitely a great date spot. They even have a small collection of board games to play.  The desserts are fancy and really really good! Come for the happy hour (I know I will!)  Eat it. Love it. Repeat.

cfVDBmjnlY2iJaBqz7D2Ng.review_text: This place has a cute romantic atmosphere to it. I wish it weren't so dark though cause I couldn't see the desserts. I got the dessert for 2, which was your pick of 4 desserts for $25. When it came out, it was too dark to see any of them so I couldn't tell which dessert I was eating.. The whole time me and my date were eating the lavendar honey semifreddo we thought it was the apple a la mode and thought it was really cool that they used cantaloupes instead of apples LOL. we're dumb. Everything was pretty good, but I didn't really enjoy the limeade one. It was too sour.

PQPk3yifh1O0C7tYAmGfLg.review_text: +3 stars for the drinks, atmosphere and desserts - very tasty. Coffee drinks were just right. The bar drinks and beers were served with care. Fun stuff!  - 1 star for the (extra) small portions on the desserts. Felt like an off night.  +2 stars for really great service - from being seated to being waited on - top flight.  All together a mixed bag on this one - board games and trivia cars a-plenty saved CB from a 3 star review. Have been back plenty of times, great place.

pOsSRzm0ZOXE9FcJ5pWxYg.review_text: Amy C.'s Ideal "Dinner" Menu  1st Course:  Dessert 2nd Course:  Dessert 3rd Course:  Dessert 4th Course:  DESSERT  CANDYBAR's Dessert Tasting Menu ($14)  1st Course:  Refreshing Sparkling Meyer Lemonade "Shot" with Mint Gelee 2nd Course:  Choice of one of 8 Creative & Tasty Dessert Options                          (Faves:  Chevre Cheesecake                                          Blood Orange Baked Alaska with Candied Fennel                                         Warm Vanilla Cake with Pickled Mango) 3rd Course:  See 2nd Course 4th Course:  Warm Malted Milk with Addictive Itty Bitty Peanut Butter Vadouvan Cookie  I think I'm in LOVE!  (Or on a sugar high.  Same difference.)

r2ES4hClsS5TkQdCcp5ZQw.review_text: Came here at 6pm (opening) with the intention of getting desserts, but opted for drinks instead.  The menu overall was overwhelming because everything sounded delicious. It was happy hour 6-9PM so my 8 dollar drinks became 4 dollar drinks!  I tried the strawberry kiss, mango tango, and blood orange. The strawberry kiss was definitely my favorite, it was refreshing.  The waiter/owner (?) was very nice and helpful. I loved the decor. It seems like a nice place to go for a girls night out, though not judging the boys who love a nice cocktail and macaron.  They also had board games to pass the time away. Will definitely come back to try the desserts...... and have a few more drinks.

tGKclv_2sBJPay9IocOOjg.review_text: This is my go-to for a Girl's Night Out (GNO) in the city!   Candybar is conveniently located, especially if you live in the Panhandle/USF area or work nearby. Parking can be challenging, but usually there are a few spots on side streets or off of Fulton/Divisadero. The ambiance is very intimate; dim and cozy, but unfortunately, a bit loud. Fortunately, I can look past the noise and appreciate this place for what it offers: unique desserts, potent-but-undeniably-tasty cocktails, and a fun atmosphere.   During my most recent visit, a girlfriend and I ordered the "Candybar Dessert for Two" with the Almond-Honey Pannacotta, Lavender Honey Creme Fraiche Semifreddo, Apple Ala Mode, and the Flourless Chocolate Banana Torte. Needless to say, all but one of the dishes were demolished. We unfortunately, didn't care for the pannacotta. Everything else, though, was exquisite. The Lavender Honey dish was exceptionally surprising for me - I'm very sensitive to flavors reminiscent of bath soaps, shampoos, etc. - but the chefs and Candybar made the lavender flavor not only tolerable, but delicious. The Chocolate Banana Torte has always been a mainstay for me, and I couldn't help but order it on each of my 4+ visits, including this one. For drinks, we ordered the Strawberry Kiss, Passion Fruit Delight, Red Sangria, and two Candybar Lemon Drop Shots (obviously not all at the same time). The cocktails were pleasing - sweet and definitely packed a punch.   Overall, my experiences here have been nothing short of amazing. Prices are moderate, so do expect to pay a pretty penny. Despite that though, a night out at Candybar with my girls is always a good time!

lNHQ7ssntHRgOMvNSVT0DQ.review_text: I had high hopes and expectations for candy bar. The concept of ordering desserts and drinks only, without being scorned by waiters into eating something else, was very refreshing. I equally appreciate their board games focus making this a great spot for groups. If you want to go solo there is a welcoming bar area to relax too.    For our first visit we decided to order the plate of 4 desserts of your choice to share at $25. I think 3 desserts would have been enough, the portions were still big. The winner, was the strawberry Limade which was a fluffly hybrid of cake and mousse, it had just the right amount of sweetness and tartness from the lime. Second runner up was a lavender based dessert. Peanut butter tart was a disappointment, the base was so crumbly meets gritty. Apple crumble was ok.   Overall, they could have done a better job decorating the place. Why make a cool concept dull with worn stained furniture, dim wall paint and art work?!! Dated is what comes to mind. The desserts were ok and enjoyable. Having said that I would have liked to see more variety since all they do is desserts and a bit of creativity plating.

_UPpbCYfoKZRtjfBuEqGwA.review_text: wow, how did the seating not get mentioned in these reviews?  sure, the front part of the room looks cute and cozy, but having a table a foot away in front of you, with a surface lower than the level of your seated butt...is unnatural and awkward when sauce-y food is served.  i felt my body wanting to slide down to the floor to use the table as a...well, table.  N asked me, "do other people look uncomfortable, too...or is it just us?"  well i don't know if they FELT weird, but they certainly looked it, like no one was really there to stay, like we were all sitting in a waiting room.  awk!!  people with their hands side by side on their laps...3 girls craning over to share 2 desserts at their knees...[and what is with sharing tiny desserts?]  but they were all playing board games!  it was like that scene in a wrinkle in time where meg goes to find charles wallace on that planet and no one else acknowledges that something is very freakishly wrong...  when my lemon tart came (it was good, though), i decided the only way i was going to be able to eat normally was with one leg crossed indian style (i would've gone all the way had my jeans not been so tight oof) and with my plate in one hand.  we couldn't lean back, either, because the seat padding didn't run all the way to the glass, so i would've felt like i was sitting like...IN the window frame had i sat all the way back!  sigh.  oh well, a good strong back (or a bar/real table seating) highly recommended for this place.

Jyw0es75PPjlx7RvOGswuw.review_text: This is the place to go for a sugar rush in NoPa! They offer a wide selection of fresh and creative desserts that perfectly combine unique flavors and textures. Probably the best desserts I have ever had! The drinks are wonderful, especially the sparkling cocktails. They offer happy hour specials and frequently offer 2 for 1 Groupon deals. This is a great, elegant bar option for those of us who prefer wine or cocktails over beer (although Candy Bar does have a selection of bottles beers). Great for a date, girls' night out, or for a group of friends! I recommend going during happy hour, which lines up with regular dinner hours. This place is busiest after dinner/late at night on the weekends, but  I've never had a problem getting a table.
