gD6xgFoMwZJHMvm1n-9zDA.review_text: Came here on a Thursday night.  Was waiting to get seated. The hostess acknowledge my party; however when he put down names on the wait list, he put the name of the party the came after us first. I was pretty upset at the customer service that I received at this establishment.

6Chth4-xjMGgTtaAZkrYxQ.review_text: Having had a very early dinner at Little Star, and out at a decent hour from the Bryan Adams show at the Independent, I and the husband was eager to try out Candybar, just opened about a month ago...   It is utterly charming.  I highly recommend sitting at the bar and speaking with Tan (sp?), the owner of the establishment.  The menu is split into Tasting Menu and A la Carte options, and they have an extensive selection of dessert-friendly wines and other liquors that range from champagne to ports and madeiras.  They also serve their own signature cocktails - on our visit we tasted a cava served with strawberry sorbet and strawberry-lavender syrup; and a beer with a chile-powder and salt-dusted rim.  A note about the tasting menu - it is just that - a menu intended to give the diner tastes of several different things. The emphasis is not on portion size, but on the variety and complexity of flavours highlighted.  The offerings are similar to what one would receive at a high end dining establishment, with very unique taste profiles and surprising executions (e.g., a deconstructed "cheesecake") that are really too sublime.   We chose the Chevre Cheesecake  coconut sorbet / nicoise olive caramel and Bittersweet Chocolate Sorbet  foie gras tapioca / croutons.  Both were spot-on, and if you're a little leery of the unusual combinations (what? foie gras tapioca?!), trust that every single bite is delicious.  When we complimented the strawberry-lavender syrup in the cava cocktail, Tan mentioned that he had obtained it from June Taylor - a local merchant who creates all her wonderful fruit syrups, butters and conserves in Berkeley. In addition, he also offered us one of the two free samples June had given to him during his last visit to her!  If you're looking to extend an evening in the neighborhood, perhaps after a dinner at Nopa, or the soon-to-open Bar Crudo (can't wait!), Candybar is simply perfect ... different, very romantic, with an amazing set of unique dessert and drink offerings and super-friendly staff.  p.s. - if you're in the mood for less sweet options, candybar also offers a small set of savoury nibbles like soup, cheeses and terrine.

K_Zn-LkipFGMuaR_ug2vcw.review_text: First impression: The place is a lot smaller than its website pictures have you believe.  Second Impression: The dark lighting, cool music, and abstract (but not really) paintings create a nice, romantic ambiance--much more chic and mellow than a club or regular bar but more fun than a traditional restaurant.  My friends and I chose this place after scavenging for any restaurant/lounge that was open late. We came across Candybar, and its tag line of "San Francisco's first dessert lounge" made it quite attractive, and even its name, CANDYBAR!, sounded so hip.  We were all minors, so we just ordered desserts, which were mighty overpriced. What can I say, they have a good business going...We ordered three desserts to share among the three of us: a cake, cheesecake, and sorbet. They were very delicious, but let's just say it was good that we weren't that hungry.  They offered board games and such, and so we UNO'd the night away.  Yeah, we're a wild bunch. . .  I would definitely want to come back after I turn 21, most likely after a dinner or so.  It's a nice place to wind down with a drink, and I believe they have BYOM (Bring Your Own Meal).  Oh, and can I just say that their bathroom is lit only by candles with a full-length mirror inside!  Nice!  They're just asking for customers to have a little romp in there.

AhOI8uoCq7BSScQ2RoyFHQ.review_text: What's not to like about a wine bar that only serves dessert? Throw in plenty of board games to play while chatting/sipping/sweet-tooth-satisfying and you have all the ingredients for a good time. The red velvet cake had a cream cheese frosting with coconut all over it. The cake itself was pretty good but, as with carrot cake, was merely a vehicle for the cream cheese frosting... It was accompanied by a mint ice cream that was unlike any ice cream I've ever had - it tasted like it was made with fresh mint rather than "mint flavoring." So good. We also tried the strawberry limeade, which was served in this little mason jar thing - also very good. Minus 1 star for the small portions; and that it took us 20 minutes to find parking, which you can't really blame on the bar but I'm going to take my road rage out on them anyway...and because they did not appreciate me announcing loudly "you sunk my battleship!"...

hIe4SRHcQk5Prk9O2bmRtw.review_text: Full disclosure - I am a baker. Not professionally but I have more than a handful of people who would finance a bakery if I thought that waking up at 3am everyday sounding like a good idea (it doesn't)  Now that my disclosure is out there here we go... I was REALLY excited about this place. If I opened up any type of bakery/sweets place I would have it be a desert bar. Too bad this one left me questioning my decision.  My husband and I went here on a Tuesday night. It was rather empty which was nice since I heard the waits can be brutal. We walked in to see the waiter and the bar tender staring up at the Giants game and ignoring us. The waiter came over and sat us shortly after. Throughout the night there was barely anyone in there and yet it was impossible to get his attention - turn off the TV and start doing your job.  We then ordered the Flourless Chocolate Cake, Ice Cream Sandwiches, Lemon Tart & Peanut Butter and Jelly.  I had a Kir and my husband had a sangria. Drinks were good but I have to say the deserts were okay.   Flourless Chocolate Cake: REALLY heavy + REALLY sticky. The pairings on the side were delicious - white chocolate and thyme, strawberry sorbet - yum!  Ice Cream Sandwiches: macaroons were heavy, didn't have feet (bakers know what this means) and were totally overpowered by the ice cream. Not a bad dish but not great.  Lemon Tart: I really liked the coconut macaroon accompaniment on this. filling was great - tart crust was thick  Peanut Butter & Jelly - YUM! This was by far the best but I will say that it needed to have the peanuts chopped up so you could have a little with each bite.  All in all I have to say I wouldn't go back here. I came here cause I was curious and I had a GILT voucher but honestly the games that are missing almost everything and the lack of service and the mediocre deserts have me wanting to put on my apron and make something that we can enjoy at home.

L-EpIwrWQ7ArnqC1WV_HAg.review_text: Great service, tasty drinks, and the dessert was amazing. Really friendly place. Happy Hour is especially reasonable.

8pDgDxzBdQKbTaNX6mxJGw.review_text: Sugar and alcohol, what could be better? It's everything I always dreamed adulthood would be.   Only bad thing I have to say about the place is that since it's set up and run like a restaurant, there wasn't a whole lot of intermingling between groups when I visited. Oh well.

W5spiZ9GhAJDtdiYbnBN4g.review_text: You would think that a place that is known for their desserts and drinks, that their desserts would taste a little bit better?  We ordered 4 desserts and all came out with beautiful presentation, but taste-wise, it was a letdown.    Drinks are fruity and sweet which is perfect if that's what you're in the mood for.    This place is tiny and super cute.  I would come back if I wanted something fruity to sip on, but I'd get my desserts elsewhere.

iZpUe9cfZX4p_JpKK60psQ.review_text: To sum up, let me tell you how the five of us had to play too many rounds of roshambo loser takes a bite, to get through the nasty concoctions we were served. Take the matcha sponge cake.  It comes with radish shavings, a scoop of strange, in the form of what should be green tea ice cream but tasted like a dirt sorbet, and a dollop of what looked like caramelized meringue but tasted like raw egg whites.   It came in a nice dish though, I'll give you that.  Or take the dessert tacos.  Yeah, there's the problem right there - why?? I ask you, dammit?   I'd have understood if it tasted good.  But when it's this nasty, and ugly to look at, you have to ask why? why? why?? would you do this?  Did I miss something, is this supposed to be health food, or just taste like it?  Hmm, desserts that taste like health food... someone's bound to get fired over that one.    We played a charades type board game over drinks- they have a bunch of board games here for the conversationally challenged- and really we tried but couldn't get through the desserts without being incentivized.  I suppose we could have just left, but competitive roshambo also gave us something to do while we figured out a plan to rescue us from the wrong turn we took walking in to this place.   And the drinks, well, i want to take a good look at the person who put this list together- I'd shake my fist, shake my head, then walk away.  There was the one port, when there should have been several.  And it should have been great, or at least good, but at $10 the tawny served in a thimble was downright horrible.  And for beers, there's a $6 pacifico beer which they pour into what looks like a 4 oz cup for some reason.  i just don't get it.    Lots of couples and awkward looking first dates on this particular friday night.   I doubt this place sees much repeat business, except for the cheap drinks at happy hour... and  unless you really really like board games, or fancy yourself "artsy" sitting under an abstract painting.

L_s3ksHCgkc97CR4Wr5WwQ.review_text: Went there for Valentine's Day date.  Cute little place.  Has a bunch of board games to keep the atmosphere fun and casual.  Made a last minute reservation the day that we were going, but they accommodated...probably didn't' hurt that we went at 11pm.  When we got there, they did not have our name on the reservation list, but still kept our planned spot.  There were still a few other groups that came in after us.  Very cute intimate bar area, has high back chairs that seat 4 at the bar.  Cute banquettes throughout, cozy atmosphere.  Average menu, about 10 selections.   Plated very thoughtfully.  I ordered the Apple a la Mode and my husband got the Chocolate Butterscotch Brownie.   The apple dish was good, but by the end of it, was too sweet for me.  Could have been the hot chocolate that I ordered with it as well.  Hot Chocolate was good, but was not able to finish it.  Had a cinnamon flavor to it.  My husband loved his dish, how deconstructed it seemed and the pairing of all the flavors.  To me, too sweet.  I'm more of a subtle sweet dessert person.   Wanted to try the Ice Cream Trio - but had hit my sugar max and did not get a chance to order.  My original order was for Peanut Butter Jelly Time, but they were sold out.  Had a cold, but it seemed like there was quite the libations menu, will have to try one day.  For 2 desserts, one hot chocolate, 3 great white beers...our bill was under $40.  Very affordable.    Overall, was a nice experience, my husband would definitely give it a higher ranking than me.  Would go back and try more of the menu and possibly a cocktail or two.

YXsJVcTJ5L0-jrj6rLK3jQ.review_text: What seemed like such a good idea and got off to such a good start, has faltered badly and slipped from good to acceptable, to finally atrocious.  My most recent visit (9/20/08), we ordered the ice cream sandwich and the S'Mores plate. The terms of these dishes were loose interpretations, at best.  I dug my spoon into the ice cream sandwich and eagerly put it into my mouth, but once the tastebuds got working, there was nothing there but treacly sweetnes and a sugary vanillin flavor profile.  i think a 10 year old child could have served me two cookies and some Ben and Jerry's, which would have been preferable.  I just was wondering what were they going for here, because I've never had something so indiscernible. As for the S'mores, it was an attempt at being novel by serving the whole shebang on a cedar plank and using a brulee torch to melt the marshmallows.  Well this fails when you bring out the dish cold and you don't heat up the cedar plank.  The "graham crackers" and the "chocolate" were brownie shaped squares, and I could barely tell the difference.  Some chocolate sauce was puddled untidily nearby, which had separated and butterfat was glaring at me- a huge points drop.  It too was as unremarkably flavorless, probably due to its mindbending and cloying sugar content.  I wanted to spit it out. And considering what we are paying for a dessert house, I want to be impressed.  None of the desserts I saw actually broke the z plane.  Everything was sadly one dimensional.  I think the desserts you pay good money for ought to be rising to the occasion, and use elements such as tuiles, flowers, and spun sugar to rise up into the 3rd dimension.  We're looking for ooh's and ahh's not ugh here, Candybar.  The space is so nice, I would give it another chance once I find out the kitchen has been vetted of the amateurish attempts, and a real pastry chef is once again hired.  Otherwise, this can't go on!  Sadly, I wished I had asked for my money back and made my complaint in person, but that night I was just too tired to give a shit.

baSDvZweZk6qLY_kHPvYzQ.review_text: Concept: GENIUS!!!!!!!!!  Dessert and Alcohol?! Oh yeah......  Came here for my girl, Mina's birthday.  The place is sooo inviting with the dim lights, artwork, comfy couches...Almost like the room is seducing you. Hahaha...  Here's the breakdown~ Pros: Loved the artwork (some more than others), Desserts were good, Servers were friendly, Alcohol was tasty, and...Good music!  Cons: A bit small and closes at midnight on a Friday night!  This night owl needs more time than that!  Favorite Thing: Mango Bellini (mango sorbet reward for downing your alcohol? mmm.. mmm... good!)  Most Unique: Pineapple, Vanilla Bean Soju Shot?  SOOOO weird...I MUST HAVE IT!  And it was pretty good...couldn't beat the Mango Bellini tho...so freakin' good!  Personal Tip: Here for someone's birthday?!  Grab a board game like connect four.  Each person who takes a turn, the bday person has to drink!!!! I personally LOVED my idea...birthday girl didn't like it as much!  :(

4pzr6KuS85859EICMI7MDw.review_text: I just discovered Candybar's fantastic happy hour.  6-8pm (I'm unsure if it's only weekdays, but I discovered it on a Friday)  $2 Peroni and Pacifico $2 Sangria, red or white $4 Orange Fizz (Mimosa) $5 Champagne  They even honored the happy hour prices on our second drinks, even though we ordered them after 8pm. Nice.  And they now do a Sunday brunch!  Fantastic!

NQUS2avQQXqXm1qNKo18AQ.review_text: Tried out the Candybar last night with a bunch of friends.  It's definitely a happening place.  It was pretty crowded there, but luckily one of my friends had made a reservation.  It's an ok place for groups, but it gets pretty darn loud in there.  I think the combo of alcohol and board games causes people to get very loud and boisterous.    My friends tried a wide variety of menu items and were pleased with their orders.  However, I tried the Nacho Sundae and it was NOT good at all.  There's was too much going on with it...too many strong flavors.  I would not recommend it.    Overall, it's a nice place to meet up with others, but I wouldn't want to spend too much time there because of the noise level.  Beware, parking is not good.

nsawcqioX0NDmqsDsM8L4w.review_text: This place is definitely worth a stop. Wine, beer, and desserts. The menu changes weekly, but they should establish a signature dessert. The presentation is great.  Mixtures are interesting but sometimes just shy of pizazz. Wine selection is OK.  Sometimes really loud bars are difficult to catch up with people and this place does a fine job.  Music isn't too loud and comfortable seating that can accommodate sizable groups. Board games are available with one called "Eat It", questions about food, which was interesting making/figuring out what the rules were.  No complaints on service.

5Cudzo0QUFMh7hnb9k_Pug.review_text: The parking situation here alone is enough to not convince me to come back to visit this establishment. Unless I happen to move to this neighborhood (very unlikely) or I'm visiting someone who lives near this place (also unlikely).  I can see why people are in love with this place, but honestly, it wasn't anything special.   It is a cute place to kick it with friends as they have games and books, but if you wanted to get all romantic/lovey dovey they have 'sensual' seating in the back.  We had a Groupon which kind of forced our hand to go. I don't even recall how the desserts were. Something in a small mason jar and something chocolatey. Hmm..I love sweets and desserts, so that says something if I can't remember what we had.

Fe_9lLtiKrGSIBEky36kWA.review_text: I like this place.  I've been here several times and I was amazed by the quality of food.  The most recent visit, I ordered the candybar bellini, salmon with delicate mashed potatoes, pork belly with natto (fermented edamame?sp/), and the apple tart. It was all amazing. The salmon with mashed potatoes were so delicate and flavorful.  The pork belly with natto was exotic.  I enjoyed the combination.  And the apple tart, was full of all sorts of good spices and I did not want to share.  My other favorite drink is the Jasmin sparkle.

uTSGqJGFwngSLTSckILesw.review_text: I still adore this place. Though the savory menu is gone, the dessert menu still rocks. I went in last night to enjoy happy hour which is from 6 to 8 every night ($5 cava...yum) and shared a couple desserts with my friend. The lavender tres leches is quite possibly one of the most amazing things I've ever tasted!!!  I was so excited to see that most people there last night were playing boardgames which I think is such a cool thing. At Candybar I can support a local business, enjoy fab wines at good prices, play monopoly and have delicious desserts. Score!!!

j9NgVF-C3KBf0U3YKvtIKQ.review_text: $3.00 Sangria= happy me. This place was perfect. We happened to walk by, wanted a little drink, and the window seat was calling our name. Seriously, $3.00 Sangria. And it was delicious. The Candybar is definitely worth visiting if you are in the area, especially for happy hour. Oh, and the staff was super friendly.

bhwE0w5qucdWviNCVRQdvw.review_text: I went to Candybar on a whim during a weekend trip to SF. I loved this place. (Can they open one in LA, please?) I loved how all of the desserts have a unique spin on them; for instance, the Red Velvet Cake has coconut shavings on it and the Apple a la Mode comes with gingerbread ice cream instead of the traditional vanilla. Plus, they've got tons of board and card games available to play.

QMvKdCyjwCzqQey1Y32nKQ.review_text: I really like the idea of this place, but didn't love it on my single visit.  If you want a little adventure after dinner this is a great place to try, many of the sweets seemed very creative and more interesting than one might find on a regular dessert menu at a restaurant.

uzdUXO3OPI2Czt14aUrDvg.review_text: I was a bit of a skeptic about this place and left impressed and eager to return. I love their cozy decor and artfully displayed desserts.   Being a red velvet cake extraordinaire, I opted for the mini red velvet cake topped with shredded coconut and served with a side of mint ice cream. Ordinarily I wouldn't pair mint ice cream with trusty old red velvet, but it was a match made in heaven!   On a side note: they have board games! Love it!

YhgKBemOaY0hNtITK9t7MA.review_text: A great end to an evening that was going down the tubes till we got here.  We went there for desert on my daughter's birthday. We'd been at a joint that's touted as the best restaurant for kids in The City. It turned out to be anything but.  Desperate to salvage the evening I found Candybar while Googling good places to have desert that were nearby (we were in Laurel Village).  Candybar was friendly and  had great atmosphere - and though five-year-old girls wearing their birthday crowns aren't their normal clientele they made our family welcome and offered some amazing deserts at reasonable prices.   Oh, and the drinks are good too.

CFKTSDcrR1mZBVjTxsQLWg.review_text: love this place!  went to the grand opening last saturday (3/22).  great setting to chill with a group of friends!  the place was packed, not a surprise for a dessert lounge.  the crowd seemed to be enjoying themselves.  pretty art and yummy desserts (tried half the menu and loved it all)!  still have to go back to try the savory menu and the rest of the desserts.    you should definitely check out this place ;)

w2ux1v1lcOEnA9x6YkqHuA.review_text: Dessert Lounge?  I love the ambiance! Lights are dim, candles are lit, and the place is really warm and cozy. They have cards and board games for you to play!  I really liked their dessert presentation. I was disappointed that their actual menu did not have some desserts listed on their online menu. My friends and I ordered the Flourless Chocolate Cake, Passion Fruit Chocolate Mousse, and the Buttermilk Vanilla Bean Panna Cotta. Everything was good except the Panna Cotta, it tasted weird. Too buttery? Balsamic Stawberry Reduction (whatever that is)? I don't know it just tasted funny in my opinion.  Docked a point because of our waitress. She was nice (fake?) but I really didn't like how she kept on staring at us as if we were going to run away, I mean come on the check is only going to come up to like what? $30? I also don't appreciate how she gave us the check when we weren't even done.

kS1MQHYwIfD0462PE61IBw.review_text: definitely agree--a great concept, and hard to find parking. their desserts were not impressive though. what happened to the savory ones, the tasting, and the selection tried the matcha green tea cake -- where was the greentea and the chocolate fudgesicle -- kinda boring even with the cornnuts nice presentation, and great ambiance but not somewhere I'd return to

Qskce7UNeuSDvKQucJ1-ww.review_text: Dessert, booze, and a hearty game of Apples to Apples? Yes, please!  During a recent visit to San Francisco, a friend and I procured a gilt city voucher for 2 cocktails and a sample platter. They honored it no problem and we were able to choose from any of their desserts and cocktails. Most of their desserts were perfect and they offered a huge variety. Are you craving something fruity? decadent? refreshing? They have it all. See drink and food breakdown below:  Jasmine Sparkler - fragrant, aromatic, perfect with the desserts and highly recommended.  Blueberry Pomegranate something - This drink was a little too sweet for me when eating so many desserts.  Tiramisu - A classic tiramisu. If you like espresso, chocolate, and cream (who doesn't?) get it.  Strauss Yogurt Cake - buttery and fruity! yum! Flourless Chocolate Cake - heavenly and decadent. The cake was paired with guava sorbet which kept it from being too heavy.  Lavender Honey Creme Fraiche Semifreddo - Cool and creamy, this was much like the lavender honey ice cream I had earlier at Bi-Rite Creamery.  Chocolate Cupcake Trio - Moist cupcakes with the perfect amount of frosting. The vanilla bean and chocolate were great but the blueberry cupcake was a bit indiscriminate in flavor. With so many other great desserts on the menu, I'd recommend spending your bucks on something else.   Another great thing about Candybar: despite the trendy vibe, this place is quite cozy with its friendly service and an abundance of board games.   For the last year, I've been hoping someone in LA would open up a venue with the simultaneous swank and intimacy of a lounge, but throw in some delicious quality desserts (Side note: Who is the pastry chef here?! I want to marry you.). No one's done it yet, but I think Candybar would be the perfect transplant. Seriously, I had a lengthy conversation with the owner and asked him to open up another branch in LA. Definitely a fun place to enjoy a night out.

0lfE9n4_jeAYtT4vqI6WOg.review_text: "Eat Desserts First."  Dark, cozy lounge. Fast yet extremely professional service. Desserts and drinks are house originals. Sometimes they won't have the desserts you see in the photos on Yelp, because they now have something even better!  Desserts, drinks, happy hour, board games, card games.. Fun time! :) Did I mention the fancy water glass? I love every little detail about this place.

aYJHYl5zvQ73u82AlwGlBg.review_text: Friday night - got a table adjacent to the bar, where people kept "spilling" over our table, making me feel like I was at a busy airport lounge.  Continuing with the spirit of an airport lounge, my eyes were particularly irritated, courtesy of the photographer's professional flash that kept going off ever 3-4 minutes, which my table was facing.    The staff was tremendously nice, but very disorganized - 3 people took our order, yet our water arrived 20 minutes later.  The water glasses had a strong chlorine odder, which made it impossible to drink out of.  In the attempt to independently fix the problem, I went to the bar to get straws, but guess what - the bar does not carry them.    Meanwhile, the waitress managed to spill white wine on my friend, as she was passing by.  Thank you for not making it red, as it wouldn't have looked great on his white linen pants.  15 minutes later, as our food arrived, we were notified that they were out of the wine we ordered.    Despite the food, which was good, I have had just about enough with my "relaxing" Friday outing.  Cozy space: (-1) star Ambiance: 0 stars Noise level: (-1) star Staff with good intentions: 5 stars Confused and disorganized staff: 0 stars Food: 4 stars Opening week bonus: plus 1 star Total: 2.65 stars

ihZv07ToZl7U4aTrKTaiiA.review_text: I ordered a chocolate chip bread and sangria.    I'm not a dessert person so I think it was still kinda sweet to me, but I will still go there again to try other dessert.

RvVNfrVXso5NClIPbWl95w.review_text: Who doesn't love a candy bar?    Went on a special Valentine's Day date here.  Really cool idea and the desserts were tasty.  The happy hour is really what makes this place worth it. ($3/$4 from 6-8pm)  We ordered the sampler dessert which was 4 desserts of our choosing for $25.  We really enjoyed it.  I got my ass whooped in Connect Four 6 games to 4 too.  Why not 5 stars?  The place became packed real quick.  We were literally the first couple in the joint when the doors opened.  We arrived before the ONE server they had.  This place is WAY too busy to rock just one server.  While the guy was nice, he was more the laid back type.  About as efficient as a one legged man in an ass kicking contest.

8-KK8lKMnj4kyAMBNgkjSQ.review_text: We went the first night Candybar opened.  And yes, it's in the NOPA area, so we drove around for parking for twenty (but it felt like forever) minutes.  The place looked nice from the outside.  although, since it was a new spot, you didn't exactly know what the place was.  There was a lot of people that night.  But, we had reservations at ten and got seated promptly.  Surprisingly, after reading all the reviews. we were able to get seated.  And yes, the menus were on copy paper. But, I didn't know what to expect the first night.  My cousins and I looked at the dessert menu and was able to try two desserts for $14.00.  And low and behold. it was awesome! The chocolate brioche was the best!  They gave a drink in between the desserts to clean our palette.  And we had wine.  The wine for a bottle of Moscatto was $23.00 when a glass of Moscatto was $7.00.  A difference of two bucks.  But, I don't think the bottle was worth it.. considering the bottle filled all three of our glasses..once. and that was it.  So we ended up getting a glass..and it felt like the same thing. but two dollars cheaper.  The wait staff was good thing. They were very friendly and knew much about the desserts when asked.  Maybe this was all just because it was the first day. I would go back again. Maybe after a month and see how it's changed.

Q_8qAEFkzrzTVAJhLsxmBg.review_text: A dessert lounge and wine bar- sounds genius to me! (and what other way can you be assured women will flock? Sweets and wine come to this girls mind!)  From my pretty blue bubbly drink to the ice cream trio, my first Candybar experience consisted of dessert prior to dinner!  We wandered over to after putting our name on the reservation list at NOPA (fun tip- get the pork chops when you go), had a seat by the front window, and enjoyed a festive and blue-sugar rimmed cocktail out of a champagne flute. The berry beverage was superb, and I got the chance to enjoy the best of any candy bar lover's dream- a trio of ice cream, including  Kit Kat, Oreo, and Reese's Peanut Butter Cup! How did Candybar know those were all my favorite sweet treats?  Can't wait to come back on a girls night and sample a little more of everything!

7EaPhtI69HEcGAvX0tFEkA.review_text: It's a rainy Sunday afternoon and I'm trying to catch up on Yelp reviews!    The overall concept of Candybar is fantastic!  Dessert, Wine, and Art?  Very cool, indeed!  The board games are another smashing addition to what fun can be experienced in this swanky little dessert place.  A combination of great company, wonderful wine, games, and delicious desserts definitely can round out the perfect evening, which is exactly what I had.  Fun times, for sure.  It's such an elegant way to 'kick it' with friends, most definitely.  The interior design of the place is contemporary and minimal but it certainly forces you to have fun with friends and/or concentrate on that special person.  So, yes, it's definitely a good date place after that nice dinner!  Candybar is like a great song you put on repeat a few times.  The dessert menu changes monthly and they are fun and interesting combination of flavors. Granted, my companion and I got the traditional birthday cake with a small scoop of ice cream atop cocoa pebbles and a glass of wine.  It was like a grown-up kiddie party with Connect Four and all.  Seriously, it was a great evening out and I just need to try other desserts.  Got to!

LzmC0SDuCp4Tps-k9fc0sQ.review_text: ok fine! my 4th time back.. (or is it my 5th) i dont' remember. i can finally give them 5 stars! why? 4 words.. GREEN TEA BREAD PUDDING.. i loved it.. i can swim in it.. if only i knew how to swim would do it! i came here last thursday for happy hour.. the kung fu taco truck was parked right outside. so my friends and i had out tacos just.. played a game of candyland and moved on to desserts.. but we all know what was our hearts desire.. the GREEN TEA BREAD PUDDING and no, none of use wanted to share it.   it taste like how bread pudding should be made, but cover that with green tea! with a scoop of ice cream on top!  i love it so much, i hope they will keep it on the menu! we got here at 7 and didn't' leave until 11. i know they close at 10 but they didn't even bother kicking us out.. but this place was so crowded at 730! it was super packed, i've never seen it so back out of all the times i've been there. i actually bought 2 groupons for this place.. now i wished i bought more! we played monopoly for the rest of the night.. FYI- BYOD(bring your own dice)  some of their board games are either missing some pieces or the instructions.. which i find it normal.. what do you expect from a place that has boardgames and cocktails. on btw..all 4 of us had their starwberry kisses drink all night long.. and at happy hour prices too!  perfect!!!!!!!!!!!!! the host here is super cool too, he even offered to go to the taco truck for us to get the tacos.. i feel like coming back here once a month!!! which i find highly possible . i love the music they play here (if you can hear it) all night light drinking my strawberry kiss, playing board games, enjoying my dessert and listening to alica keys "empire state of mind" allll night long.

2-IA-jVpiZIxC0gi8QQUpQ.review_text: My biggest mistake was filling up on pizza hours before coming here....  First time being to a dessert bar, but it will not be a last.  Board games and delicious drinks complement great desserts.  It's definitely set for a romantic feel, but felt fine as a casual indulgence too.  We began with a game of Bananagrams! and some cocktails.    Lychee Martini - very sweet but with lychee overload flavor (and a lychee in the bottom!)  Mango Tango Blini - The wife got this and enjoyed it very much.  Food: We went with the dessert for two (four items) AND ordered another a la carte.. because.. well.. we're pigs.  Anyways... Strawberry Limeade / Strawberry Mousse / Vanilla Cake / Calamansi Cream / Strawberries - excellent and very refreshing with the fresh berries and spike of lime to tone down the heavy sweet & richness of the other items  Peanut Butter Jelly Time / Chocolate Tart / Peanut Butter Cream / Salted Candied Peanuts / Blackberries - ode to pb&j, this item was very comforting to me since i tend to indulge in peanut butter with little than a spoon.  Red Velvet Cake / Vanilla Bean Cream Cheese Frosting / Coconut / Toasted Housemade Marshmallows - This item was very good.  Pretty heavy too (it was the last one we ate) but very flavorful.  Even though I'm not sure why it had marshmallows with it, they were homemade, delicioud and we didn't care  Lavendar? Semifredo / Cantaloupe / Brittle - Great flavors and very light.  The cantaloupe provided an interetesting background flavor that went well with the floral flavor of the lavendar  Smores / Bailey's Chocolate Sauce - MUST GET!  The chocolate flavors were great.  Topped off with another homemade marshmallow that had been lightly charred the bailey's spiked sauce made this dish over the top  I'd highly recommend this place to anyone, just don't fill up on pizza beforehand.. of maybe you should so you avoid going too crazy here.

2Qfa3o72sq04_MCUxy3Shg.review_text: Everything I wrote in my original review a year and a half ago is no longer true. (Sort of.) Then- I didn't go on dates with boys Now- I go on dates with my MAN. *Swoon* Then- my cat didn't live with me. Now- she is currently sleeping at my feet. Then- I wanted to take my cat here so could have a partner to play Battleship with. Now- I learned I am not good at playing Battleship. Or Connect 4. Or gracefully losing a board game match. Then- I did not like their signature cocktails. Now- I knew better and ordered wine.  Then- I didn't order their signature tiramisu dish.  Now- Ordered their tiramisu dish, definitely recommend.   Still a great place for a date- JUST NOT if you are super competitive and prone to losing,

07p1XwEmcGrV42Fn0k0mGQ.review_text: Although it is a beautiful idea, it was poorly executed with mediocre desserts causing my usually generous ratings to drop from a 3 to a 2.  We arrived on a cold, chilly [any night in SF] Friday night in hopes for some delectable and exquisite desserts.  The decor was warm and cozy, with miniature tables scattered about and lit candles covering every surface.  Board games + wine were in abundance in this modest, yet chic space and the walls were covered with interesting paintings.  There was no wait [surprisingly] and we were seated rather promptly.  After giving it some thought, I decided against my usual dessert choice of red velvet cake and opted for the "Peanut Butter Jelly Time" while the bf chose the "Chocolate Chip Bread Pudding".  Although my dessert was visually appealing,  the taste left nothing to be desired.  Nestled inside the hard chocolate cookie tart laid the peanut butter cream, scarily reminiscent of plain old Reese's pieces, topped with salted caramel peanuts and fresh blackberries.  I may not be a pastry dessert chef but I'm almost positive I can create an exact replica after a few attempts.  The chocolate chip bread pudding was unlike any I've ever tasted.  One bite was enough to place me back on my diet, and that's saying alot.  $18 for 2 average tasting desserts, hmph.    Only in San Francisco, I swear.

mjMN4kpfrcXuF3RKinMwxw.review_text: I had a living social voucher for Candy Bar and used it on the night that it expires. When we got there, they said it would be about an hour before we could get in. That was cool, I understand they are popular and in SF one must wait for something good. We put our name in and went around to some other bars in the area.  The service here was eh....not bad but not good either. Anyway I ordered the the Mango Tango Bellini which consisted of sparkling wine, mango syrup, mango-tangerine sorbet. The drink was good with the sorbet floating on top. My friend ordered a round of Candbar Lemon Drop Shot, a perfect way to kick-start our experience.   For the desserts, we all shared the tiramisu, the house-made s'mores and a sundae with strawberry ice cream and strawberries. The ice cream was my least favorite. It was good, but nothing special about the ice cream. The tiramisu was my second favorite. It wasn't too heavy of  dessert. My favorite was the s'mores. Great interpretation of a s'more. I loved the house-made marshmallow!  Final thoughts: I would come back here to try different desserts and drinks.

9sxvJvvTtw8y2YRDcaL9nw.review_text: Great place for happy hour.  6-8pm.   Cozy, sexy but fun atmosphere. Plenty of seating. 2 corner seating area for groups.   Board games stock the shelves. Candyland, Connect Four, "Would you Rather...", etc...  Was here with a group of girls. Ordered plenty of white and red sangria. $3 during happy hour!!! I preferred the red sangria.   My other friends ordered Jasmine Sparkle which was REALLY good.   There is one small TV that hangs above the bar. I needed it to watch a basketball game...afterall it is March Madness!  Cons: Parking is a bit difficult as it is near Divisadero. Take the MUNI. There is no happy hour food menu. They only serve desserts which do not have happy hour specials.   Still a great place to catch up with friends after a long day at work. Sangria and dessert? How can you say no?

3HHLpfU7q4HoREEOXtt7pw.review_text: I've been eyeing Candybar for awhile and finally got a chance to stop in this past weekend on a girl's night. It was pretty busy but we were seated after a 15 minute wait...not too bad for a Friday night!  Candybar is the perfect place to go on a date (guys, listen up!); it's very intimate, cozy, laid back, and perfect to snuggle up with that special someone on their comfy, red couches. I'd also say it's perfect for a girl's night out; there's tons of fun board games to play whilst sipping on champagne and having some sweets. Who doesn't like to play Apples to Apples drunk?! ;)  I ordered the Apple a la Mode - warm pieces of apple with a crunchy hazelnut crust, filled with cream cheese, drizzled in caramel, and topped with gingerbread ice cream - as did one of my friends, and it was heaven on a plate. It was SO delicious! I pretty much love anything 'a la mode' and Candybar did not disappoint! My other friend ordered the Ice Cream Sundae which came with strawberry ice cream, macarons, and fresh strawberries and bananas. So sweet! It was amazing but the trophy goes to the apple a la mode for sure.  Service was great - our server explained some favorites on the menu and always came to check up on us. He always made sure we had enough water because we all know how thirsty we get after indulging in some sweets!  I definitely recommend Candybar after a dinner date or anytime you are craving something sweet!

Xr_SlEuylg5DSC8UUsqYfA.review_text: Holy smokes. This place is spectacular. Every dessert is absolutely delicious. While the dessert portions are smallish, the drinks are generous and, more importantly, amazing!  I highly recommend the Jasmine Sparkle and the Strawberry Kiss. This place is a must for anyone with a sweet tooth!  The Happy Hour prices also are great. Roll in early, claim your favorite board game, and enjoy a good time.

EZEUzgG1W3foHKQ_IQIV2A.review_text: I think this place can be a hit or miss. I've been here a couple times and the first time, the desserts were great. $8+ but still good. There were enough options. Second time around,  only chocolate option was no longer available and the desserts we were left with were pretty bad. They rotate their menu every 3 weeks or so.   I like that it has a very mellow ambiance and there are board games to play if you bring a medium to large crowd. And they take reservations!   Definitely worth checking out. Especially for post-dinner dessert and wine.

duFP2mFpWc-qc21T5XKvNg.review_text: I've been here twice - and never tried their desserts - but I still give them 5 stars.  That's how good this place is - honest!  :)  True to their name, only thing they serve are desserts and some alcohol (Candybar, get it???  LOL)  Awesome sangrias - I liked the red ones better!  Cheap beers during happy hour (and even otherwise) - and some great cocktails.  Real cozy, comfortable lounge seating.  And the best staff ever - I love the service and the real laid back, personalized attention.  Very cool ambiance, very relaxing and calming - a great place to chill with friends.  They let you bring outside food in which is so cool - especially with Little Star Pizza right around the corner :D  Simply incredible place (though parking will frustrate the living jeezus out of you!!!  Be warned)  ~ 5 stars - I've had the most awesome experiences here with the most amazing friends in my life :)  # 235

TMb1kJaTlB9nkrIFHfdJMg.review_text: They have many board games, especially nostalgic kid ones like Battleship.   I had the ice cream sandwich which was with macarons. It was hard to use my spoon to try to cut a piece to eat because the ice cream made the macaron filling really hard but once I got all components on my mouth, it was so good especially with a piece of fresh melon for contrast. It probably would've been easier to eat if I had picked up the whole thing with my hand but had to try to appear somewhat civilized lol.   We also had a variety of cocktails but all were on the syrupy sweet side. I guess we were at a dessert restaurant.  Overall fun place to hang if you're in the neighborhood.

K1lkv1Zpnzsl3n08Zv04kg.review_text: Candybar is like an upscale Quickly, but instead of tea, snacks and boardgames, it serves liquor and wonderfully plated desserts, with boardgames.   Came here with a friend as she is a dessert connoisseur, we started off with a strawberry kiss and a blood orange cocktail. Drinks were tasty.  For snacks we had, the Japanese cheesecake and Lavender honey creme fraiche. Both had really nice textures and the flavors were extremely light and a quality much like asian style desserts.  Good experience and great service.

ACUVZ4SiN0gni7dzVDm9EQ.review_text: I was sitting in my cozy seat perusing the sparkling cocktails and dessert menu, eying up the board game area and I couldn't help but think to myself that the owners of this bar are totally setting boys up to get some serious action. And as if they were reading my mind, or just perhaps to further prove my point Candyman's "Knockin' the Boots" came on.  Sir Nicholas and I ordered a couple of rounds of drinks and 2 desserts to share while I mercilessly beat him at Connect 4. (A man in the Bahamas once taught us both the trick to winning this seamlessly easy game, but I think I remember the lesson a little better.) Nick's first drink was made with Soju and Fanta and tasted like orange cream soda. It's a great choice if you like drinks with alcohol that don't taste like they have alcohol. I started with a sparkling cocktail that had a sugar cube in the bottom and blood orange bitters mixed with champagne. For the next round he had a michelada (spicy and delicious!) while I sample a French Kiss (sparkling wine with ginger ale and a big strawberry), also quite good.  Our desserts of choice were a carrot cake that came with bananas and salted caramel ice cream and an apple a la mode served with gingerbread ice cream. Both were excellent, but I preferred the carrot cake as the apple a la mode became just a little too rich after a few bites, especially when paired with my sweeter cocktails.  While this isn't a bar I'd go to just to hang out and have drinks it is most definitely a bar I'd go to repeatedly and you can beat your bottom dollar that every friend I have that visits me will be taken here at some point during their trip as well.

q0HDybhT0V9dXrs63_WqWQ.review_text: I was torn between 4 and 5 stars. Sometimes it takes a lot for me to be a ".5 person," so whenever this happens I can't help but be on the conservative side. If I have to question it, then that alone should say it all. But enough about me and my internal rationalizations.  I've had a Groupon for Candybar for months and for some reason took me over 1 year to actually walk in the door and see what this place was all about. Walking in, my friend and I were greeted by a gracious host/server. We sat down along a wall facing a huge coy fish mural, which I immediately fell in love with.  HUGE points for the games you can sit down and enjoy. It definitely makes for a casual date that taps into your inner child.  On the menu:  Apple a la mode - a sweet play on the apple pie, the richness was just enough. Because these plates are on the smaller end, it's great that this dish isn't overly rich so I can finish it and move on to the next one.  Peanut butter & Jelly - a small tart-like dish with what seems to be a peanut butter mousse (?), with a blackberry syrup and fresh blackberries on top. Now I only had a bite of this one, and it certainly seemed richer, sweeter.  Strawberry kiss - sparkling wine, ginger ale and strawberry syrup. An unusual combination that took me a couple of sips to get used to. It finishes light and sweet.  Spicy Michelada - Ok, for those of you who know me, I strive to find the perfect michelada (read my review for Nopalito). Not it. This one was alright (2-3 stars for me), it had the right amount of spice, but was missing some ingredients and flavors for it to pack a punch. I guess my search continues...  50/50 - a drink mixed with soju, making it hard to pick out the alcohol. The glass it's served in is short, and looks like a pumpkin (the drink is bright orange). Flavors are sweet and mild, I wouldn't want more than a sip of it.

I-4TLojynEMylzQwGZcJSA.review_text: Pricey but totally worth it.  Great spot to take a date after dinner.

TVJoa1isoHj02_iToGaXcA.review_text: I love this concept. Dessert AND wine. Why didn't someone think of this sooner?? So, here's a warning, the desserts will have ingredients that don't seem like they won't work together, they absolutely do. Once you taste it you'll see how they tastes compliment each other.  Plus, I love the decor of this place. It seems like they put someone's living room in a bar. I know that sounds funny but once you walk in you get this swank yet cozy feel from the place.   This is definitely a place worth checking out. It's kind of in a deserted corner of SF but absolutely worth the visit. Have to be honest, a part of me didn't want to tell people about this place, but we met the owner and he's so sweet that we wanted this place to do well for his sake.   Anyway, check it out soon so you can thank me later.

2qqUJSBq8TSMPgSIBOt1FA.review_text: A really simple concept done in a fun way. Parking in this area is a son of a gun so figure it out ahead of time. I came here at 10 pm on a Saturday and though the place was packed I was seated in a couple of minutes. They have a single page menu of desserts and sweet drinks. You can also pick 4 options of dessert for $22, the ones with the asterisk you cannot use. Each dish was either $9 or $10.   Service was pretty quick, the seats behind the curtain near the bathroom were kinda blah. They can def do something more with it. Board games and cards are available on a shelve in the front. I did like the flour-less chocolate as well as the apple a la mode, the peanut butter jelly time was :x. It was a cool place to visit but not a place I would see "regulars" at.

p0Fh5Cp7s9FNmOOyoSCwyg.review_text: I love this place!  Peanut Butter Jelly Time and a Strawberry Kiss.  Yes please.  I love that it's just desserts and sweet drinks.  There are board games too.  Love, love, love.

WecuAsHBDZGj7Z6_sJcQAw.review_text: Adult s'mores.  You remember this dessert as a kid. Graham crackers. Chocolate. Marshmallows.  Why life gets better with age: You can now order it at a bar. With homemade marshmallows. And chocolate sauce with rum.  It was good back then. It's even better now.  Plus you can do pineapple vanilla bean soju shots and play board games while candles set the mood.  Growing up was fun. Growing older is even more fun. And delicious.

oJLtbKfE5QDJIQh7vqRQrw.review_text: Ambience ---5 stars Selection of games ---- 5 stars Drinks and coffee ---- 5 stars  I had a good night overall and it is a sweet place to celebrate w a group or with your sweetheart.   The actual dessert?? The other yelpera were right. Taste like they have been sitting in the fridge for weeks---- negative 10 stars.   The tiramisu is worst than costco's, and the macaroons are harder than rocks. Not so good :(

R4DVayqiW63jHle7AG_NXQ.review_text: Amazing.  A 3 block walk away from where I grew up, meaning when visiting my parents, I can swing by whenever I am in the mood for something sweet!  However this place is definitely not weight watchers friendly so I'll definitely have to visit in moderation.  Went in yesterday night with my friend Bridget because she had a Living Social 2 desserts and 2 drinks special. I had the tiramisu, Bridget had the Strawberry mousse dessert. I also had a blueberry pomegranate sparking wine drink and my friend had the 50/50, an orange drink with sorbet.  The food and the presentation was simply amazing. The tiramisu wasn't the absolute best I've ever had, but it was PDG (pretty darn good), light, not too rich and sweet.  Bridget's strawberry mousse dish was a little bit too sweet for me, but still good.     I think I should probably mention that yesterday was a Tuesday night, and I arrived right at 6:45 and was seated instantly, but still the place was almost completely full. As the night progressed, the line got longer and longer and longer and was eventually out the door. I'm like, WOW! On a Tuesday? Crazy!  Long story short, get here EARLY.  Most of the people were probably trying to take advantage of the happy hour where drinks are either $3 or $4 from 6-8pm, I think. But I was expecting that kind of a line on the weekends but definitely not on a Tuesday night! :(   Another thing I've wondered about was the games.... I mean seriously? Why would a place that is that packed provide games for patrons to make them spend extra time at tables? I can understand it if the place was slow but there is always a line, especially in the evenings so I'm surprised they would be encouraging people to stay longer playing games... but  I guess the games are a nice touch.    Support this place, your sweet tooth, AND your dentist! Hehehe.

AUSdKejXG9RNY5lTWzWfyw.review_text: I have to update my review on Candy Bar.  We first went is it just opened, in March 08, but have been back multiple times.  The quality and ingenuity of the desserts are top notch.  I highly recommend Candy Bar.  Great place for a date or after dinner, when the restaurant you have been to just doesn't have what you are looking for.

mytkOxFAZst4F0_WtsHp-A.review_text: Okay, first thing's first:  Parking in NOPA sucks and for that reason alone you shouldn't even bother visiting Candybar.  Still not dissuaded?  Well then in that case, make a reservation so you can get a table, and then prepare yourself for an onslaught of sweet awesomeness.  Candybar features a very comprehensive selection of sweet wines (along with a number of sparklies and other wines), and an array of what can only be called amazing desserts.  What they do here is take fanciful preparations of tasty desserts (sorbets, small cakes, cookies) and then throw a small twist or two into each one, like the fennel flavoring they add to their baked alaska with carrot cake, or the hint of curry in their tiny but richly-textured peanut butter cookie.  The prices are reasonable too, with a four-course dessert tasting menu (pre-selected "appetizer" and "final course" along with two additional choices of your own) for $14, and the very helpful waitstaff will be pleased to aid you in pairing a drink (or two or three) with your selections.  About the only ding I can make against this place, other than that parking issue I mentioned, is that the table full of hotties didn't come over and hang out with me.  Totally lame!  ;)

gvL4KZtBtZHqBkivYHeusw.review_text: The menu looked delicious, the drinks looked decent. We never found out because our waiter was to busy texting on his phone and completely ignoring us. 2 stars for ambience and getting my mouth watering.

8NQ5Uck0qiirJyUNEbaUAw.review_text: 2.5 stars  Cute concept. Dessert and board games!! Buuut... Games sorta lame (3 connect fours? Really?) more fun to watch ppl's awkward dates ;) Desserts were fantastic!! Next time ill go w more ppl... Since my sweet tooth is only moderate I had PB jelly time and apple a la mode (gingerbread ice cream? Swoon) Drinks were okay Ambiance is intimate/ casual  I'm not sure when I'll be back but I'm not against the idea!

8-mmWztN_Z711pevSPBoXw.review_text: I had the opportunity to come here last Friday evening with a girl friend of mine. There was about a 25min wait, which wasn't to bad since it was a nice evening. So we could chat outside without freezing our toes off. Candy bar is a small quaint store front with board games and fascinating pieces of art work on the walls.   During my visit we ordered:   * Lavender Honey Creme Fraiche Semi Freddo (almond brittle, Nutella powder, cantaloupe)  * Ice Cream Sundae (macaron, bananas, brownie, vanilla anglaise, strawberries, strawberry ice cream)  I would definitely come back again and have a good at one of their cocktails.

An-apf27PxeLotGwbkpxXQ.review_text: Just went there for the first time because of a groupon.  Never heard of it before, but so glad we did.  Great place to go for desert.  Delicious deserts and great, original drinks.  Great atmosphere, they have card & board games to play, or you can bring your own.  The staff are great and we never felt rushed.  We will be back!

e9d8GLTHjdSMTUc6M54USg.review_text: Guys, this is a descent spot to take a girl on a first date.  What better way to put the girl in a good mood then buying her the best part of the meal...dessert!  And if it isn't going  well, it's just dessert, the two of you don't have to endure an awkward meal.   This place can be fun for a group of friends too.  They have a pretty decent selection of board games you all can play, and they serve booze, which means you can easily make a drinking game out of the experience!  The food and drinks were kind of expensive.  I spent close to 50 bucks for 2 people (4 drinks and 2 desserts in total)  and the desserts were kind of small portions, but all in all, it was a fun experience.

PxpP_eZHGEdTj49CXzhwkg.review_text: Wonderful as always. We love this place and they always make us feel so welcome and comfortable. They'll even bring free samples! Best desserts ever!

FGGJICwF3w6gzJNNbczEwQ.review_text: Honestly, I do not understand what the hype is all about. I am a bad yelper, I only review on occasions when I have a GREAT experience, or one like I had last night. We walked into Candybar excited to enjoy a dessert and cocktail. My drink, the Soju, was like orange cough syrup in a cup. When we asked the "server" what he would recommend, he said its all about personal preference. Thanks a lot for the help, dude.   Now, lets get to the dessert. I ordered the Apple Pie a la Mode which was a 1/10 in terms of preparation and taste. The apples did not taste fresh, and the crust was soft and mushy. Really not enjoyable.   And my girlfriend ordered the Ice Cream Sundae with brownies and strawberry sherbet. Her review: "This brownie tastes like a break-n-bake brownie that was baked last week." I laughed because this was so true. However, the strawberry sherbet was delicious. I am guessing Candybar does't make the ice cream in house.   Anyways, just wanted to share my opinion. I would highly recommend ordering dessert at the restaurant you are at, no reason to head over to Candybar (except for playing Connect Four).

Hl1f4VO0a9KdGrrRCPMqSA.review_text: Great for pricey wine by the glass and desserts, not so great savories and minding your money.

LaOKB42H5WnE4MnfOjvSBw.review_text: Went to Candybar one night after a wedding for some casual hangout time with another couple. There was a party of 40 there in the bar area so it was pretty loud but we had reservations for a table so it was a little more quite there. We ordered the mocha brownies, chocolate mousse, cedar smoked smores, and the pumpkin spice cake. All the desserts were excellent. The presentation was very artistic as well. The menu changes all the time so we were very lucky to get a good selection of desserts.

ibvH1Y7Rh_tstiWgH0OFTA.review_text: mMmm yummy. A dimly lit place, great for a romantic dessert sesh or some relaxing lounge time over a board game!  I actually really enjoyed their Lavender Honey Creme Fraiche Semi Freddo, but also liked their Chocolate Flour less Cake and Japanese Cheesecake!  Their desserts are $7~$10 each. Their happy hour until 8PM has $4 cocktails (Usually $8) and sangria for $3.

c4wRqAEQqM-Eex-W3o2b6w.review_text: I've been to Candybar multiple times, and it is always a great place to relax and enjoy some treats with a group of friends. The atmosphere is very relaxed - sit on long couches and grab a board game to entertain. Drinks are sweet cocktails with interesting (many Asian-inspired) flavors.   The desserts are always such a treat. Here are comments on some that I've tried: 1) The macaron ice cream sandwich has a great, refreshing, and not-overwhelming honeydew flavor. The actual macaron cookie isn't chewy like a true macaron - it is hard and crunchy - but since it is a cold dish it probably has to be that way. 2) The tiramisu is DECADENT. Very sweet and chocolate-y. 3) The lemon is & white chocolate is perfection. If you like lemon - this is for you. The tartness of the sorbet is so fresh and light and goes perfectly with the soft mousse. 4) The lavender semifreddo is also wonderful. It comes with nutella powder that is a really interesting texture on the tongue.  I also feel like the portions have gotten a bit bigger since I first visited Candybar... but maybe that's just me.   I always love coming back here!

aJSKz9rZYBHvfbPA0rsKLQ.review_text: So i've been here 2x, each time with a coupon deal for 2 desserts and 2 cocktails.  I want to like this place. I really do. A bar catering to the dessert crowd? Yes! The problem is, they missed it totally in the execution.   The bar itself looks great. Very cool artwork, nice boardgames for you to play with your friends/date.   If you're going to have a bar serving VERY sweet things to eat, make your drinks menu more varied than "champagne" + something sweet in the "champagne." It's just overpowering sweetness when you're trying to then eat something else super sweet. Maybe try to go on the herbal / citrus side of things for some cocktail options.  Same with the food menu. A zillion items, none of them really crossing over into the savory-sweet dessert side. Everything tastes sorta mediocre while trying to be fancy. I ate at a spot in Portland that was known for its dessert and we had something with dark chocolate and some sort of salty, soft cheese and it was divine. Their menu is surprisingly large at Candy Bar, but everything on it is just overly sweet. Also, you can tell that they really pre-make everything as most things come out quite cold from the fridge.   What's weird about giving a 2-star on this spot is that I *love* dessert. I just cannot deal with everything being super sugary sweet, not balanced sweetness with the other ingredients. Give me some rich dark chocolate with cayenne pepper and I'll pair it with a sweet beverage or a citrusy beverage and something sweet/salty to eat. Also, why not have fancy coffee instead of just a "diner style" pot? I'd certainly opt for some sort of coffee drink and/or espresso with my dessert.  Alas, they really missed the mark here and we're going to give our last coupon away.

axVfHflwZUtX_dGy3iIdzQ.review_text: I contemplated taking away a star just for what it might do for my waistline because I'm going to have to keep going back.  The menu is extremely creative - I mean, who would have thought feta ice cream would be good on anything?!  You can tell a lot of thought and talent go into their food and wine list everyday. The best part?? The portions are completely normal so you can actually eat more than one dessert.  We had the vanilla brioche spiced cherries / feta ice cream  and the chocolate cannelone chocolate olive creameux / vanilla bean ice cream.  Unique flavors. Loved them!  I went with a girlfriend, but this is a great space for a group or a date or frankly, if you're just in the mood to treat yourself.   You'll win big points with anyone you bring there for the first time. Trust me.

d9WIz0Xuh9ECkHfVmqbhIw.review_text: Candy bar is one of the best dessert diners that I've been to in SF.  Their desserts are creative and very tasty.  Just go in there knowing that you'll basically be spending the same as you would for a meal for dessert.  That said, its worth it.  Our favorite is the Smore.  The PBJ isn't that far behind. Service is excellent.  Water refills are plenty.  Drink service is quick too. A couple of downsides to note.  One is that you'll be surrounded by tons of hipsters.  Two is that it gets very crowded.  And three, they place a 2 hour table limit on you.  With such a huge line, I totally understand why there is a limit.  It just makes it feel more like a Denny's (get you in, eat, get out) vs a more plush dessert bar that it is.

iR54aSd1mCRvdnr84t_VRA.review_text: Cute date place for sure!   Love that each desserts was very unique and the drinks were refreshing.   Order:  - all the bubblies.  -watermelon shots  -lavender honey creme  -peanut butter jelly time   Skip:  -strawberry limeade (too sour)  -chocolate banana torte  I would come back here for another date night for sure.

SsqChvV0PwZUkyGwCF_ZKQ.review_text: Terrible desserts, we tried the candybar desert and got to pick 4 desserts of the menu: apple a la mode, ice cream sandwich, tiramisu, and lemon & white chocolate sorbet, so this wasn't just a bad apple on the menu. The deserts tasted bland, made of cheap ingredients, way too much sugar, the ice cream in the sandwich was watery, and the sorbet was so sour it made us cringe. The chocolate on the tiramisu was more chocolate fantasy, i.e. very low coca content. Hardly any apple in the apple a la mode, plain bad. I don't get the 4-stars, this was 1 of the worst dessert places I've been too, period! Go to Ghirardelli, at least you get real chocolate and ice cream.

ADSsiOCvkjst94Tj035xYw.review_text: I had high expectations for this dessert bar since it was featured on First Look desserts. I'm willing to give it another try since I only tried the drunken smores and the macaron sandwich. Out of the two, I recommend ordering the almond macaron sandwich with honeydew ice cream.  I was a bit dissapointed with the drunken smores. In my opinion, it would have been better if it was torched a bit more to stay true to the essence of smores a.k.a melted goodness.  The sandwich on the other hand was quite refreshing. It was light flavored, and it wasn't overwhelming.  Overall, I'm not a big fan. I've had better and cheaper desserts at other places. The desserts were aesthetically pleasing, but it wasn't mouthwatering. However, I do like its laid back atmosphere. It seems like a good place for a lil catch up with friends.

YAG90mceVFQLdvl4wndvQg.review_text: I love this place! It's so quaint. However, they need to get more games...I suggest operation.

s_8y9EUxlOQ_HsV_L5jfWw.review_text: A rare Friday off...so dinner and drinks after!  Woohoo!  I love the fact that Candybar has happy hour until 8pm.  How great is that?  Yummy dessert and even yummier drinks...    Oh, and if you are not too out of it, they have a good selection of board games too.  If you are looking for a place to hang out with your girls (or guys) and be able to have conversation or just to chill out for a bit...this is the place.    Our #1 is the mango bellini!  Parking can be tough in this neighborhood so give yourself some extra time.

Md8nzWQJVKdeDLMDQA7vug.review_text: I have only been here once, but I will definitely be coming back. This is a cute place to come and have a few drinks and dessert. You can also play a board game which I think is pretty cool! I really like the setting it has dim lighting nice low key music and the seating is arranged nicely. I can't wait to come back here to show my friends!

GtydL3IpjoLH5MYLDUgSxg.review_text: definitely a great place for anything: girls night out, date night....  my gfs and i had a night out and the desserts we all got were overly sweet. just the way I like it. I'm not much of a sweet person but I would like to come back and have another bite!

PDax7cEtvaqaCuGkCG1faQ.review_text: Love the idea of a place that serves excellent desserts and drinks.   My wife and I checked this spot out on her birthday, and it definitely won me some husband points.  Onto the food! We ordered the ice cream sandwich; some of the best macarons I've ever had: chewy and crispy at the same time. It was a great contrast with the subtly delicious honeydew ice cream. Ice cream sandwich with bigger-than-normal macarons as the buns? Yes, please.  Our chocolatey options was the big smore. Graham cracker crust, dark chocolate, and a massive, toasted, creamy marshmallow at the top. Great compliment to the fruity ice cream sandwich.  We washed all this down with a sparkling white wine.   Super affordable. Super comfortable. The games are a nice touch (though I wish there were more). A win, for a date night.

ldgUHQjxGAd76GZt1AogAA.review_text: I have quite the sweet tooth, so coming here was a delight. I had the drunken s'mores, which was so rich and flavorful. Definitely satiated whatever dessert cravings may have been left. It was also worth the few stains my clothing fell victim to (note: be careful when consuming these products).   The reason why I'm giving this place 3 stars, though, is that the service was particularly lacking. I was with my partner sitting at the table waiting for a good 10-15 minutes before someone came to us - all while those who came in after we being seen immediately as they walked in. I'm not sure was to what was going on behind the scenes or their serving/bussing schedule, but at that time it didn't appear too packed and it was frustrating having to wait and do things yourself when you see the servers out there leisurely walking around.

D-anvESbGXSH60T4AalPEg.review_text: Came here with a group of friends (guys and girls) for happy hour because one of them had a Groupon.  ATMOSPHERE Good luck finding parking. We barely managed to find a spot after circling like vultures for 15-20 minutes.  The place itself is super cute! It's the perfect place for cute candied drinks and desserts. It's not that big and seating is kind of awkward. We had a group of 6 and were seated in the corner at the front of the place where there were huge glass windows. It was weird sitting there sippin on our dranks and munching on our cakes while people stared at us as they walked by.  Service was forgettable. Nothing more to say about that.  Oh, and there were random games on the other side of the room, but we didn't bother getting up to look through them.  FOOD They have so many desserts to choose from and they all have cute/clever names (ex: peanut butter jelly time). After much debate, we settled on:  1) Apple a la mode with gingerbread ice cream 2) Flourless chocolate cake with mango ice cream 3) Red velvet cake with vanilla ice cream  Portions are SMALL. Don't come here for a meal. Come here for light desserts and sparkling drinks!  The CAKES were all VERY GOOD, esp the apple a la mode. However, oddly enough all the paired ice creams were NOT good. My friends couldn't even eat the mango ice cream because it had such a weird flavor that didn't even resemble mango.  The RED VELVET CAKE was good, but I did not like the mountain of coconut shavings that covered the cake. If it wasn't for the coconut I would've devoured the cake in 2 minutes.  DRINKS 1) Passionfruit delight 2) Strawberry kiss 3) Sangria  All the drinks were FABULOUS-- sparkly, cute, classy, and sweet! As someone who gulps down drinks quickly, I was sad that they didn't come in bigger champagne flutes. My favorite was the STRAWBERRY KISS. The passionfruit is good, and it's a little lighter than the strawberry. There were real fruit pieces in it too! Yummy!  Overall, great place for a girl's night out! It's a little overpriced, but worth a try if you're dressed up and want to have a fabulous evening out with your girl friends.

yp0l56u5X1uOqzWgeOo8Kw.review_text: Good place to grab a great desert.  Went on a Saturday night I had the Ice cream sandwich with Macaroons (really good).  My date had some strawberry thingy...which was like a strawberry shortcake (it was a little too rich for me).  Nice atmosphere.  Staff was pleasant.

eE6axPqJS2dkrHqxLLLXPw.review_text: We came in from the central valley and made it a point to stop at the Candy Bar!  Loved it!!  Parking is tough, but we lucked out and found some spaces a block or so away for our four motorcycles.  We will be back :)

oNeyHF8MKilKZOUENpTk3Q.review_text: This was a fun place to meet up with friends on a Friday night and pretend to be living in "Sex and the City" for an hour or so. The look of the place is sleek and decidedly artistic; the bathroom was lit entirely by candles, which I highly enjoyed.   It's not the kind of place you go to if you want to leave with a full belly. The dishes are small and offer a few intriguing, visually interesting bites rather than full-blown meals. I ordered the  brioche and enjoyed the contrast  between the hot richness of the creme brulee-like brioche, the cold, creamy cherry ice cream and the firm, vibrant apricot.   Go here if you want to feel hip and try some pricy yet daring culinary experiments.

s1l3ZIGbMbgj3EFg8biExw.review_text: I went there last night with a couple girlfriends, and we sat on the lounge by the window. Our, not 1 but TWO, waiters were very nice and helpful, not to mention very good-looking! Even though our desserts were small, they were perfect. Very flavorful and nicely presented. I liked the small size because then you can order more and not feel guilty about it! We had already had out share of wine before we arrived at CandyBar, so we ordered cappuccinos instead. They had just gotten the espresso machine and were a little slow in making and getting to us. Our desserts came before our coffees, but our 2 lovely waiters kept giving us updates and apologizing to us, which was nice. I will definitely be back there soon!

rhROLqZmn8HiSJGUn8cB-A.review_text: Meh. This claims to be a desert place but the deserts were just OK. But they have a nice warm vibe going on with games and candles. But wait then they were playing EDM. This place needs to figure out what they are and be that. Warm desert place with cocktails with games or a bar with EDM where you can dance , drink and eat desert ?

PJGD7zKksRjePnAIppFoiQ.review_text: I miss this place so bad.  The last time and my boyfriend went, we both ordered the ice cream sandwich, two super tasty macaron cookies and several scoops of light and refreshing honeydew ice cream., because neither of us wanted to share.  That's how good it is.

1ZTNu00nDlxrGz73ROt7Lw.review_text: This place is soo cute.. especially if you're someone who loves desserts like me!! For a drink, i had the mango tango bellini and my husband had an italian soda. And for dessert? I had the icecream sundae and my husband had the strawberry limeade. We both have no complaints whatsoever. Service was great, ambience was romantic/ casual at the same time and there was even great instrumental music playing. Whoever came up with this place is a genious! A dessert bar?? This is going to be a usual "go to" place for us..

0DbUR_SJ3fJUGZEjb8JYvw.review_text: You don't seat a customer(group of 2) and then move you and have you wait again because a table of 2 next to you is about to go and they can combine two table to serve a group of 7.

AONG2lZsnm1iV8Rf7zR-GA.review_text: This place really needs to figure out what it's theme is. You have a low light, romantic setting with dessert and drinks...mixed with everyone's favorite board games from childhood to choose from (that are impossible to see given said low lighting), and club music?  And when I'm paying 9 bucks for a piece of pie, I expect a decently sized, pretty good piece of piece. I did not get a 9 dollar piece of pie.  What I got was a piece of pie that was OK, but not good enough to justify the price. I got the apple a la mode. The gingerbread ice cream was a weird addition to it. Call me old fashion, but I would have rather had a scoop of vanilla on that puppy. However, the cream cheese filling was great. If only that piece of pie was bigger than a few square inches, I might be more inclined to go back and try something else. My friends dessert was of equal size and quality.  I will give them props on their drink though. The passion fruit delight was delicious.

wpZ9k0YwORFZtMBJEM2N8Q.review_text: what a beautiful setting...  great decor, diverse menu of sweets and light hors dourves (in house chef!), great wine selection with a good range of affordability, personable service...   bar, table and booth seating were all comfortable.  extra kudos on the clean zen-like restroom.  my only minor gripe is the lighting is bit too strong.  perhaps my inner romantic ninja wants a dimmer, more romantic setting.  (did i just write that?)  overall, a very classy wine bar.

8Lc3-TTHjExd79GSQIHnAw.review_text: The perseco was good The group tasting prices are weird because they charge a $10/person sharing fee but they don't increase the portion sizes.  We got individual items instead. Everyone was really nice and the ambiance is really nice.  Great for a date!  The desserts were amazing!  My favorite was the vanilla brioche.  It was soggy like bread pudding and amazing.  Let me try to remember the others.  The thousand layer chocolate was good, but not great.  The basil foam with coffee ice cream was good too.  We all like foam!  I'm talking to you, Mercel.  The cheese plate was good.  The parfe was amazing.

KXSzTO-bi6_Fcysm0mEHpg.review_text: i love the desserts! it wasn't much but just the right amount. i had the strawberry kiss for cocktail and it was pretty good too! everything was very delicate and cute. although parking was really really hard to find, and the place was really small....it can be really loud but overall i enjoyed it.

W-La-8pnqIYBk2eyfoA4Gw.review_text: Looks fancy, but is a chill place to hangout. play catch-up, or go on a date! The desserts are pretty tasty and each seem to be made right from the heart. Tried the Ice Cream Sandwich which was honeydew ice cream sandwiched between an almond macaron. I didn't think the two flavors sounded complementary, but they definitely were! They have an option where you can choose 4 desserts for $25. It's a smaller portion of the desserts, but you're able to try more types! Good for sharing.   The drinks were less exciting. The Mango Tango Bellini and Passion Fruit Delight tasted typical, nothing special.   I'd be back for a girl's night out. Dessert tastes better when shared.

8mw2X0uRU4A5FnBMOx3__w.review_text: Groupon=PACKED aka hour wait on a Wed, but was assured it's not always like that. Despite the crowds, the staff never let on to how stressed they were and kept smiling through it, even if they were a little slow. The cocktails were pretty good and the desserts were quite yummy. They do have games you can play at your table...some of the seating was awkward though and you had to bend down a mile from the bench to reach the table. Fun atmosphere...awesome for a date.

_UXWlGpGI8QeDUZMyjP3jw.review_text: Low light setting, candle light center piece, and desserts gives this place a romantic feel. I came here with my best friend for a living social deal. We ordered a blueberry bellini (on the sour side), a mango bellini (OMG for mango sorbet in my drink ), Japanese cheesecake, and green tea ice cream sandwich. 2 drinks and 2 desserts later made me want to come again even with almost impossible to find parking spots and 1 hr wait for a table.    5 out of 5 for food and service. but minus 1 star for the very long wait and 6 blocks away parking (searched over 45 mins to find it)

jKjTC8f0sXiSaRt9qELVGg.review_text: Owner took over 3 weeks to get back to me so I went with another vendor for my desserts.

MJ8lq1t68qMGjOB5wE9o5w.review_text: One look inside you'll notice something different about the bar. It's clientele? Preppy and in their early 30's. The food? Desserts that people don't think about would taste good, but it TASTES GOOD! The ambiance? dimly lit with hints of artificiality. It took me awhile, but the bar didn't look out of place, it WAS out of place. It's the type of bar you'd find in L.A... but in San Francisco.  I did like the fact that they had board games in the bar. It seemed like a good idea to be able to play some Monopoly or Yatzee while sipping on some cocktails, but the tables were amazingly cramped. I guess they wanted to pack more people in, but it's a small issue. We ordered our food and it arrived promptly. My girlfriend had the nacho sundae platter (is it a play on the words "not your sunday"?), our friend had the matcha green-tea cake, while I had some fruit tart thing that's served in a little jar, the white chocolate mousse it looked like creme' brulee. It was made of three layers and garnished with the white chocolate mousse on the side. Reviewing their menu online, I learned that the three layers were Blue berry compote, Kalamansi Sorbet, and Candied Parsnips. Upon the second spoonful I realized it was the Kalamansi sorbet that really excited me. It was amazingly smooth and the chill kept the whole dessert together - a tingling delight at every bite. The blue berries were fresh and the parsnips were delightful. I almost forgot about the mousse. The sorbet was a true winner, and I had a cup of coffee with it that went together really well. The cake was mediocre for the price, but my fruit snack and my girlfriend's nacho desserts were both tasty.  Lastly, I enjoyed the food and the presentation of the food, but I wouldn't make a trip to San Francisco for it. Now if I was already in town, it would be a different story. Bon appetite!

JGdKYphlPcJTBhHBjCfdig.review_text: NOTE: Dessert Menu varies daily! So don't be surprised when you don't see the item you want the next time you go here.  The items we got:  Peanut Butter Jelly Time! chocolate tart, peanut butter cream, salted candied peanuts, blackberries...$9 This dish was very good the first bite, but the portion was so big and the dish itself was so rich that none of us could finish eating it.
