I went for my birthday with two of my friends and we just missed happy hour by half an hour :( but i still liked it- we had the apple a la mode and raspberry dessert wine and orangesicle shot- so good but really expensive if not at happy hour.

0AlnetQ_-a4f7kY0Sker2w.review_text: Dessert, Candyland, Connect Four, Drinks, Music.  Fantastic Happy Hour.  Apple a la Mode w/ Gingerbread Ice Cream = What happens to apples when they go to heaven.   Jasmine Drink = Champagne, meet jasmine tea with a slight apple-esqe after taste.  You are original and delicious.  Service was good, though they seemed a little overwhelmed but handled it the best they could.  Post sugar high Susan checking out.

zGOXKICJ-X6tcoIHaGaITg.review_text: Date Night! Warm, candlelit atmosphere.  A boy. A girl. After dinner drinks and nibbles for the sweet tooth. We slid into the plush booths just before the end of happy hour. Yummy white sangria for $3,  full of crisp apples, pears, and oranges slices.  We shared: the cheesecake- wonderfully rich perched atop a crisp nutty hemp seed brittle with blackberries, and mango sorbet. the chocolate cremeux cake- a dense bittersweet chocolate cloud of heaven topped with a tasty black currant sauce and a dollop of thyme ice cream. When did they start stocking decks of cards and board games? (Yahtzee, CANDYLAND, and UNO) I didn't notice the shelves on my previous visit, but this was a fun way to flirt a little and interact. Or just an excuse to stay around and order another glass of sangria. Drops of rain pitter-pattering across the windows while 'In a Sentimental Mood' (Duke Ellington/John Coltrane) reverberated throughout the cozy space. A lovely tuesday evening. . .   *Inside info for the guys: Groups of single women chatting. Why not park yourself at the bar and strike up a conversation*

VfkA4OlerlF2LRq_m3ql5Q.review_text: Alright Candybar, you go against my entire 'HOT BOD DIET PLAN', but you are so damn worth it. ugh. your tasty treats, extensive wine list, sweet cocktail concoctions are killing me... slowly..  Foods/wines: Great desserts! I've had many of their plates (not all to myself), and they are out of this world. One that really stood out, was the giant french macaroon with ice cream as the filling. yes. sounds orgasmic? well it tastes even better! I learned that you cannot go wrong with trying something new here.  Great selection of wines, fairly priced. They also have a sweet cocktail menu. Their cocktail concoctions are also delicious, a bit sweet for me, but oddly leaves me wanting more.  Diggs:  I seriously need one of those credit card sized flash light magnifier things they sell on them mid-night infomercials to read the menus here. It is dim. So dim i can barely see my friend across the table. However, I gotta admit, this place reeks of romance. Perfect place to take your special/temporary chick on a very special/impressionable date.   They also got board games!   Dimly lit bathroom to either do the dirty dirty or just the dirty.   Candybar is one of those san francisco hidden gems. while parking is truly a bitch, its def. worth a trip esp. for the desserts and board game. IE candy land, with which apparently,  has no asian characters. not cool.

jFZ7xAhnT5tteHgqL-zw2g.review_text: I expected the venue to be much bigger from the pictures I've seen. Unfortunately because they offer board games, turnaround is very slow - though they do have a 2 hour maximum for occupying a table. The drinks and desserts are very pretty but I would say they look better than they taste. Pricing is fair, though if you come before 8pm you can catch happy hour, which is a great deal! Highlights of the cocktail menu: + Strawberry Kiss: sparkling wine, ginger ale, frozen strawberry + Mango Tango Bellini: sparkling wine, mango syrup, mango-tangerine sorbet + Passion Fruit Delight: sparkling wine, passion fruit syrup Dessert menu notables: + Ice Cream Sandwich + Smores I enjoyed playing apples to apples with my friends while sipping on colorful drinks, but the wait was a little too much to bear and the desserts were only "aight". Drinks were alcohol light, which is how I prefer them but steer clear if you're a real alcoholic ;).

F8UXRG5R_TgSNJmKKQMTSA.review_text: Pretty neat atmosphere, we got 3 desserts :)  Red Velvet : 3/5: coconut broke it and the frosting was too sweet Carrot cake: 4/5: it was good! the salt they added really was good Apple dessert: 4/5: really good too  Mint Ice Cream was an interesting touch, another make it or break it, I enjoyed it while my other friends did not.  This would be a really good place for a birthday party..

H5EY1CeIx4m_pNChKZkq7A.review_text: 2.5 stars for Rudeness and Ok dessert. It would of been 3 stars if our waiter had more hospitality and paid attention to us. When my group and I arrived around 9p, Candybar was packed with many patrons. Luckily a big group was leaving. Picture this, we sat down and I grab a couple of menus. Fail right there. Why didn't our server give them to us? SECOND my party has to approach the only waiter to order. THIRD no introduction of what his name was or gave us his suggestions what was good to order. FOUR never came to check up on us to see if we needed anything and he gave us 4 forks when there was 7 of us. FIVE he was walking around mindlessly paying attention to others. SIX do I have to ask you for water when I mentioned in the beginning we would like water all around. SEVEN asking for the check which apparently took 20mins? Then to process it, was ridiculous. 3 credit cards and the rest was cash took way to long.   Suggestion to staff: PAY ATTENTION

p7GcbNJav26_VnZKvW5tHw.review_text: So my friend and I went to this place on a Friday night after eating at Nick's Crispy Tacos. We had a Groupon that let us get two desserts and two drinks for $17, which was really a great deal. The desserts tend to run around $10 each and drinks are about $8 each. The drinks are definitely not worth it. They're nice, don't get me wrong, but they were not very strong and were mostly just sparkling wine drinks. The desserts were a much better deal in my opinion because they were incredibly well done.  We got the tiramisu and the flourless chocolate torte. The tiramisu was heavenly. The mascarpone cream was perfectly done; it was a gigantic piece as well (more than enough for two people). The texture was super light and quite possibly my favorite thing of the night. There were some coffee-esque crumbs and a sheet of chocolate that really topped off the whole thing. The flourless chocolate torte wasn't quite as impressive, but it was still quite good. I mean I enjoyed it, but it paled in comparison to the tiramisu.  Seriously though, go for the dessert (tiramisu rocked my world) but not the drinks. The drinks are probably ones that you could make at home... and they're super weak. Might go back... but $30 (had to pay the tax/tip on the night obviously) for drinks and dessert is a bit too much in my opinion. Go if you want to impress, but it's definitely not an everyday thing!

FEjzwiucdKH-3PaOHmfXbg.review_text: my girls took me here for my bday( for after dinner drinks). its a cute little spot that is a must!   PS: the green tea french macaroon, TO DIE FOR... SOOO YUMMM.

q6J0RrdafRqkxR_ffONHcQ.review_text: It's really dark in here.   BUT, oh how good it is!  They have board games in here, so not only can you release your inner fat kid, you can also play like one too. My friends and I played Apples to Apples for like HOURS.   The deserts range from $9-13 - there's also a pretty big selection -  the cakes have way bigger portions than any of the other items - There was like 5 of us so we all agreed to order different things  so we could all share. I ordered the Tiramisu, which was DELICIOUS - not to sweet, just right!  I dont really remember the other dishes we got but the Apple Pie and the Tiramisu were on the top of my list.   Also, if you want to plan an event here, you need to make reservations for this place atleast a month in advance, i guess due to their limited space - another thing to keep in mind is the parking, which, like every place in San Francisco, is horrible - plan accordingly.

6kWAL8wWRAe17ARc78Ay9w.review_text: Though I was initially turned off by the super AZN vibe inside of Candybar, I had a really good time here with the group I came with. The desserts were fine, and drinks were good, and playing Apples to Apples while being fueled by sugar and alcohol wound up being pretty awesome.  Dessert wise, our group ordered two: Peanut Butter Jelly Time and the Ice Cream Sundae. The sundae was tasty, and not overly sweet, which is something that usually turns me off about desserts. The Peanut Butter Jelly Time was pretty awesome, though the tart was a little too rich for me.  Drink wise, I'm usually drawn to blood orange anything, so the blood orange cocktail kind of called out to me. It was a little too sweet for my liking, but it did the job. For my second drink I had a Kir Royale, which was much, much better than the blood orange cocktail.

z4DUjqfmLSZAq7tdPecOZg.review_text: If you love desserts, come here! I was absolutely impressed by the delicious desserts and the ambiance. It might be difficult to find the place at first but just make sure you look at a nice white house.

u0aYziTTakyAU8EygSy3tQ.review_text: I love this joint- they have board games, delicious drinks, fancy desserts, pretty good happy hour, and a friendly wait staff. Check this place out iwth friends.

Zy3FB5D7FSMU2VbmnjHxHg.review_text: Omg this is the adult candy store. Can't go wrong with amazing dessert, wide range of alcoholic drinks plus board games. It's cozy so you'd want to hang out there for hours eating, drinking, playing games and chatting it up with friends.

xceJT1G2Yhel3W2lRxRTDA.review_text: The Candybar is a very very cool spot for drinks and desserts.  Crys and I stopped in tonight after Little Star Pizza so I was too stuffed to eat.  I did have a bite of her panna cotta though and it was buttermilky and tasty.  She also got some jasmin drink that was on happy hour special for only $4... good deal!    It's a comfortable stylish joint and the waiter is a cutie!  I love the art on the walls (though it'd be nice if the artist did some Asian guys with White Blond girls - haha).  See ya there!

y3Gb0zhTZQO1SMS8xluoxA.review_text: This is an adorable, funky cool beer/wine bar with great service, ambiance dessert ang game offerings.  Lovely restroom, everything is sparkling clean everywhere.  I want to have a party here someday.

XxaH0WvREdM0sv56nHOGPg.review_text: 5 stars for ambiance (cute, dimly lit venue with interesting paintings to look at and fun games to play on the side)  3.5-4 stars for the desserts, or at least the ones I had. Ice cream on the ice cream sundae was great, but the brownie was kind of rubbery... Tiramisu was everything I though it would be- good, but not rave worthy. Didn't try the drinks  Would be a fun place to take a small group to!

VgtcRwMPiAEeuPsayXB4kA.review_text: Japanese cheesecake, ice cream sandwich: awesome. Blueberry pomegranate fusion cocktail...not my thing. Strangely reminded me of the bar from A Clockwork Orange...

zD33XS8Dc8bO4jarzpBgww.review_text: Candybar is a dessert bar located on Fulton and Divisadero. If you don't know it's there, you might not be able to find it. I discovered this place while searching for a new dessert place to try. What caught my eye was all the pictures of the elegantly decorated desserts, the cocktails, and the concept of playing board games while eating and drinking with friends.  I've been to Candybar a few times and each time, I ordered something different. This last visit , I ordered the Red Velvet Cake and a lychee guava martini. I loved the cake. It was a huge slice. The red velvet cake was moist and covered with vanilla bean cream cheese frosting and shredded coconut. On the side of the plate are toasted marshmallows. The entire dessert was very delicious and it's one of their larger portions. Most of the desserts here are cute but relatively small, which is to be expected from a place that specializes in desserts. I thought the lychee guava martini was just okay. There was a single lychee sitting at the bottom of the glass. I didn't really taste the flavors of lychee and guava so I was a little disappointed with my drink.    Overall, I thought it was a fun experience. The service was pretty good. We were seated and served pretty quickly. The atmosphere is perfect for a date. They keep the entire place lit with minimal lighting. Each table is lit by a small candle.   I recommend this place to those who enjoy a good dessert. It is a little on the the pricy side so look for the Groupon/Living Social deals if you're not sure this is your type of place. But I know I look forward to returning to try more of their desserts and drinks.

cL4aqMF_L7cCn87eSfsrYA.review_text: So delicious!  Get a shot of shoju and a dessert.  The Lavendar Honey SemiFreddo was crazy good!

2WJ27ha9HEK_4ezuIjx_IA.review_text: If i could give 10 stars i would.  I love this place!! I was told by a friend who lives in SF area about this place and as soon as i looked it up online, i knew i found my spot.  Its a combination of things i love, desserts, drinks, games, and an atmosphere for great time.  i've taken a lot of my friends here and they love it and say "good job" to me for finding this place. I love the drinks, i always make sure i start off with the "strawberry kiss" drink.  i also love the paintings they have on the wall.  i'll always come back here =)

RuMTrArIbDDFHlXJYPZFfA.review_text: I'd been meaning to check this place out for a while because it sounded interesting. It's pretty solid all around, but definitely has a thing or two to improve upon. It was nicely crowded on a Saturday night. Not too crowded, but not too empty. Waited about 10 minutes for a table for 2.  Drink: Michelada.  I've had great Micheladas before (Tacolicious in the Marina, for example). This was not one of them. I felt like it technically fit the description but I think if the bartender actually tasted it he would make some adjustments to the way they make it. In particular, it had a lot of ICE in it, which is highly questionable considering it's a beer based drink. The Ice melted just a little bit and killed the carbonation of the beer. At that point the drink was worthless so I didn't finish it beyond halfway.  I understand that many people like to make their Micheladas with ice, but I'd either consider using less ice or just having well-chilled beer and glasses on hand...  The PassionFruit/Chocolate mousse dessert with vanillabean ice cream was fantastic! As good as I would expect from the best restaurants in the city. I definitely recommend it and this dish gave me faith in the overall quality of what this place offers.  The velvet cake with coconut and mint ice cream was a bit disappointing. I think this cake would have been much better off without the coconut. Perhaps it could have been artfully placed to the side or as a bed for the cake. A lot of people really don't like coconut so I think having the option of including it or not would be good. The mint ice cream was cool in the sense that it was REAL mint (not your mint-chocolate chip ice cream from safeway), but at the same time it lost its novely and felt weird in relation to the flavors in the cake. Still, I appreciate the effort in doing something a little different. The cake itself was so-so, it was hard to appreciate it under all of that icing and coconut.  Since I only tried two items and one drink, I'm not going to ding them too badly for it. Overall I thought the place was really cool. The people and crowd were nice, the board games were a nice touch, and the ambiance/style of the place was really cool and unique in general. I hope things work out for this place, but I have to wonder how it is turning much of a profit based on what it does. Fortunately for CandyBar there really aren't any direct competitors in the space, so I'll be back again for a post-dinner drink.

AQvdQADQzM7NLLdg88feUQ.review_text: The environment is very lounge(y). Most of the walls are lined with open booths, with a couple tables and chairs in the center. The ambience has that classy upscale lounge vibe. Just walking in, there is a sweet scent that wafts by, further confirming its presence as a strictly dessert oriented establishment.   The menu is somewhat seasonal, with some menu items being replaced every season. However, the menu layout is simple, giving descriptions that easily allows one to identify which item is which and what it is made with.  Our party ordered the following:  -Lavender Honey Creme Fraiche Semifreddo with Nutella Powder/Almond Brittle/Cantaloupe  The semifreddo had a distinct layering of flavors comprised of the flowery lavender, the sweetness of the honey, and the chocolatey nuttiness of the nutella powder. The almond brittle added a nice crunchy texture to the semifreddo. Unfortunately, the cantaloupe was a bit overpowered by all the other flavors and textures that was in the rest of the dessert. Complicated but delicious.   -Strawberry Limeade with Strawberry Mousse/Vanilla Cake/Calamansi Cream/Strawberries  The presentation of this dessert reminded me of a parfait with layers of different elements and flavors. When each of these layers are combined together, it is reminiscent of a light and airy strawberry limeade. A light and refreshing dessert.  -Apple a la Mode with Hazelnut Crust/Cream Cheese Filling/Caramel/Gingerbread Ice Cream  Essentially a deconstructed apple pie. The cream cheese, caramel, and gingerbread ice cream ensured that the pie was rich and decadent. The hazelnut crust provided a great nuttiness and crunchy texture to the pie. The caramelized apples helped reinforced the fact that this was, indeed an apple pie. Only complaint is that the dessert was slightly too cinnamon(y). Overall, this upscale version of apple pie was fairly delicious.  -Big Francesco's Tiramisu with Coffee Chiffon/Chocolate and Rum Mascarpone Cream/Coffee Bits/Chocolate  The tiramisu seemed to be a fusion of a traditional Italian tiramisu with a typical Asian-style cake. The tiramisu was mostly comprised of the coffee/chocolate chiffon instead of the traditional ladyfingers, with a relatively small layer of the rum and mascarpone cream. The rum and mascarpone cream lacked the richness of the traditional mascarpone cheese and the strong booziness of the rum. This may or may not be a negative thing, but for me, I prefer the rich creaminess of the marscapone cheese and the booziness of the rum. The coffee and chocolate bits were more of a flourish and didn't add much to the dessert. If anything, this dessert was more like a light cake with the flavor of tiramisu. As a dessert, it was good; as a tiramisu... not so much.  - Flourless Banana Torte with Pineapple/Peanuts/Chantilly/Vanilla Bean Ice Cream  The flourless banana torte had a very smooth texture. The overall flavor and texture of the torte actually reminded me of Chinese mooncakes with the flavor of lotus, but without the heaviness of the mooncake. The peanuts helped add a crunchy texture to the smooth texture of the torte. The pineapple helped add a slight tartness to the overall sweet richness of the rest of the dessert. The ice cream helped ensure that the rest of the dessert was able to remain relatively rich.  Overall, the desserts were all relatively good and well balanced. None of the desserts were particularly too indulgent and rich; all of them being well constructed with all the flavors trying to work well together without being too overbearing. A great spot to come with friends or a date.

rmBmo4UXZc-lI8sdko1Slw.review_text: A classy little lounge that serves dessert and drinks.  I came here at night with some friends for a casual hangout. It's definitely a great spot to chill and get to know someone. A cute spot to take a potential date.  They have a central shelf that holds a bunch of random board games (Candyland, Connect-Four, Chutes n' Ladders etc). It's a great way to relax and have some fun while you enjoy your bubbly and sweets.  The dim lighting provides a classic ambiance and the walls are filled with inspirational artworks.  I would have given this place 4 stars except the dessert portions are rather small for their pricing. Don't get me wrong, the dessert tasted good, but I was expecting it to be better, especially at $10 or more a plate.

43qFDY7Fi_RRlKxIONGpQw.review_text: When I heard about Candybar, I was expecting to walk into a place a little more well-lit, for some reason. It was actually not very well-lit at all - house lights were turned down and the flames of tea candles were burning brightly. But Candybar is actually still a happy place with a lively atmosphere. Who doesn't love dessert, drinks, and board games (Yup, you read that right - BOARD GAMES) with great company? I love the concept of a place that only serves dessert and cocktails. As a before or after-meal treat or just to satisfy your sweet tooth, Candybar not only provides a decadent variety of items to choose from, but also a comfortable and trendy environment to share them in, whether you're with a date or with a small group of friends.  I bought a LivingSocial deal sometime last year that entitled me to two desserts and two drinks. I took my best friend out last night so I could finally use it. The host seated us in a section where we were sitting a little bit close to two other couples, but it really didn't matter since we were all minding our own business. The place looked full at around 8:30PM when we arrived. My friend picked up the ridiculous but fun "Would You Rather?" card game while we waited for our drinks and dessert, which we played even when our dessert was ready. I ordered the Passion Fruit Chocolate Mousse and the Raspberry Delight and she ordered the Peanut Butter Jelly Time and Mango Tango Bellini. I was very happy with the dessert and drink I ordered! The mousse had the perfect texture and flavors of both chocolate and passion fruit and the coffee ice cream was a bonus, though I think I could've done with a little less of the chocolate cookie crumble. The Raspberry Delight was pretty much just raspberry sparkling wine but it paired well with my dessert and was quite lovely. I also got a taste of my friend's Mango Tango Bellini and the flavoring was just perfect.  Seriously though, whoever thought of including the shelf of board games here is a genius. I'm a sucker for board games, so to have them available in such a unique spot gets a thumbs up from me. I saw Battleship, Sorry!, Connect Four, and cards for the 80s edition of Scene It! amongst others, and my friend and I grabbed some decks of Uno cards when we were finished with our desserts. Who says you can't have some kiddie fun when you're having adult beverages?  Furthermore, the decor and interior is pretty snazzy - lots of sensual and pretty art pieces all over the place. Even the bathroom wall is emblazoned with that "dreamers and musicmakers" quote by Willy Wonka. (Sorry, I forget the exact wording of it and I'm too lazy to Google)  Though personally, I'm not jumping out of my seat to go back so soon but if I find a good reason to, I definitely will. Everyone should come to Candybar at least once to relax and treat themselves and the special ones in their lives!

RugiruRsLxooWa5aE5Z5lg.review_text: Candybar is SF's lesser than perfect rendition of LA's Syrup Desserts.  I stopped by Candybar with a group of friends and with my GroupOn special; 2 desserts + 2 drinks. We happened to come in during their happy hour specials also, so we were able to get a few extra drinks economically. The service was kinda slow, but we we're able to keep ourselves preoccupied with games - (new deck of) UNO!  Our drinks slowly trickled out, and unfortunately they were nothing special... very generic juice+champagne/mimosas (tip: pass on the strawberry kiss). Desserts are (pretty?)gastronomical, but also nothing to write home about - you're better off ordering dessert where ever you had dinner, or saving your money and just having games/desserts at home. The whole place is very lounge like, and very dark... I prefer bright places, especially if your drinks are weak and you expect us to play UNO - so is this blue or green!?   Overall, for what they put out and their prices... its not worth it. Not to mention slow service... when our check finally came, the waitress was also, for lack of another word, slow - she discounted the 2 cheapest drinks/desserts ordered within our party... so needless to say, we had to "set her straight".   TL;DR: Cute lil hangout place, but really nothing special. Save your money and enjoy your game/dessert night IN.

7HXulVlyJnFI2D6seSa5kA.review_text: Best place in the city! The clan at Candy Bar make you feel right at home. But even better than being home because the lighting and seating areas are nicer, the wine is poured for you and you don't have to bake. The key lime pie was amazing, the chocolate mousse, the baked alaska.... it was really yummy! Great relief from the bar/club scene. Great date place and over rall it was an amazing evening!

Es2KXpk2lXYGPEJwUCxfRg.review_text: This is a pretty neat wine bar that offers uber fancy dessert plates with an array of wine cocktails to bat. The sweets are utterly amazing. Don't expect a short wait or a typical apple pie. If that's what you're looking for, head to Merrit Bakery or Le Bou. If you're into a cool urban hipster experience with great drinks, board games & fabulous sweets; go here!

gisZy0HKXvX4YMspboRmZQ.review_text: Let's be honest.   You wanted dessert. That's cool   You got here, and were not expecting this place to look that classy. I know I didn't.   Then we all sat down, only to find board games.   Now everyone at the table is arguing like 5 year olds.   I WANT TO PLAY CONNECT 4 DAMN IT.   Desserts are also elegant and fairly well executed.

K7scBY6P6b7uUN-9HLzRvA.review_text: Love it.  WIne and dessert.  Great idea.  Friendly folks.  Great wine and wine recommendations.  Tasty desserts.  Love the fact that you can play a game with a few folks while you socialize.  Cool art too.    Gets loud sometimes.    Thank (thank-able entity of choice) they don't have a television in there.  That always kills the ambiance.  Great after-dinner place.

MT-C1GLOFo8brllzCVZhVg.review_text: Guys, this is the place to go for that second date with the new girl you're interested in.   After you've completed that first over coffee or tea date and have broken the ice aka you two have both accepted that there might actually be some chemistry and you're willing to test the waves further without launching or maybe launching into the commitment of a dinner date a nice restaurant beforehand, you should go to Candybar...only if you want to impress her, she really likes cocktails, desserts, board games, or a combination of the three, and she likes cutesy young (aka has lots of people in their 20s) places.   It's the chance to hold her and warm her up outside while you wait for your table inside. Cuddling is usually good unless your date doesn't like being touched.  It's the opportunity to hold her hand on the table if the table has room with the board games, desserts, and cocktails on it. Romantic candle light, anyone?  You could even play footsie underneath the table and start warming up for that first or second good night kiss at the end of the night or middle depending on how you roll.    Good luck!  PS - The honey vanilla panna cotta is amazing! Super light and melts in your mouth!

JxotojpExvYIaT4JZpH9pQ.review_text: The service was excellent. There was a large party of us (about 8) who showed up when the bar was slammed at about 8pm on a Friday night. The host was very gracious and explained that there would be an hour wait due to a few birthday/bachelorette parties. He then offered to take our phone number and call us back when a table that could seat all of us became available. FABULOUS. He called later that night, we walked back over and enjoyed wine and desserts. Our server, Nick was wonderful as well, very attentive with the water refills, etc. A little slow with our check, but, hey, it was busy in there as it got later. The wine list was decent, the desserts were just okay in my opinion.    Conceptually, though, I like what they're doing here. I like the dessert tasting menu option as well and the fact that they have good beers on the drink list. Also, I LOVE the fact that their beverage focus is on wines, sparkling wines, ports, beers! No hard alcohol.

X-dBBqO2Hhv5cFgtPfHb8A.review_text: This place is terrible.  They don't take reservations.  Tried going twice and both times the wait was over an hour and half, second time they said they couldn't add our name to list because they were closing in an hour and had an hour and half wait even though only 4 groups of 2 were.waiting outside.   Waste of $30 in cab fairs twice. Will never go back and discourage others from going to unfriendly and unaccomodating place. There are too many good places in SF to waste your time trying to go to this place!!

HdiWWB40eOwrNttQb3zX8A.review_text: Went for my friend's birthday, and I will definitely be coming back.  It feels really cozy, almost like having my friends come to my house for drinks (if only I had a dessert chef *sigh*).  I like that there's music but it's not too loud, it' s very good for conversation. The desserts we sampled were delicious.  And the wine... oh the sweet sweet wine! A friend of my friend recommended something called Banyuls.  He described it as dark semi-sweet chocolate... but it was much better.... THANKS NICK!    The parking in the area is pretty bad.  I parked about a 1/4 of a mile away!!!  But what's a big purse for if not for carrying a handy pair of flip-flops  :  D Is this a bad neighborhood?  Should I have not parked so far away?  Sometimes ignorance is bliss!!!

Jldzk3pQnaang4nhTQsGzg.review_text: I have to admit that this place is cute for what it is but I don't know how I feel about the 2 hour wait. I also don't know how I feel about all these AZNs who flock this place like its the sunset..  Upon coming here, I thought it was going to be a really cute lounge bar, the kind where you can dress up and enjoy extremely feminine cocktails and desserts and be girly! Well, I got a slap in the face when I got here at 10pm on a Friday. Not only was there the dreaded 2 hour wait, but there were kids around 16 years old hanging out. Not that I have anything against that, but it totally ruined the ambiance for me!  However, I must say that the artwork in this placw is really unique. Anyway, I didn't want to stand around and wait for a table so I headed over to bar fly down the street for several drinks before coming back. When our table was finally ready, I didn't find the dessert worth waiting for, BUT their strawberry sparkling cocktail was superb!   To those who don't really have much of a sweet tooth but rather an alchy tooth, I highly recommend their cocktails, and there's NO WAIT at the bar.

TCim7E_XTZN6aahAsckbqg.review_text: for a second i thought i was walking in to a club since you could smell the alcohol right when you walk in plus it is dark.lol  it was the weekend when we came so theres a bit of wait.the place was packed. when we got seated....i understand that it was a bit busy and i guess they are short staff but it took us how many times to call the server to take our order.which is kind a sad.i guess thats the purpose of board games that you could take and play while waiting....which is fun but i could have enjoyed it better if it wasnt so dark. the dim lights made me sleepy. We ordered the drunken smores and ice cream sundae. It was the best.!! All 5stars is for the dessert. Didnt realize that the chocolate syrup in drunken smores have alcohol and didnt realize that you could put a little bit,well it was my first time there so i let the server pour all the chocolate.lol yumminess

QKWUGR0FsqSWepDwbIhAFA.review_text: A groupon took me here.  Perhaps its better at night but I was in the area after the Fillmore Jazz Festival and thought I would try it out. Its a little off the beaten path nestled between a few homes.  Walked in and was warmly greated and shown to a casual corner sofa area.  Sat down and immediately saw the assortment of board games, played connect 4 the whole time!  Ordered the Peanut Butter Cup and the Red Velvet Cake.  Both were decent desserts but for being a dessert lounge I did expect better tasting food.  Presentation was great and maybe that's where they excel the best.  I would go again but to try their happy hour and perhaps at night with a handful of people, this time it was just me and my boyfriend.

3wjqn70BkV8nXzqBDLpUvQ.review_text: Are you kidding me?? Dessert... art.....alcohol...is there an asterisk on the sign that says "Heaven"?? Granted, I have only had the red velvet cake but it is amazing and even better when you wash it down with some fancy Champagne drink with a strawberry floating in the bottom. I am so sophisticated. On Thursday night, a taco truck swings by for happy hour specials in case you don't have a sweet tooth....which I am not sure why you would be here anyway, but that is beside the point. They also have fun childhood games but avoid Blockus at all costs....you know who I am talking to out there. This game is the non virtual version of Tetris and kills my buzz.

UtDT_YOhEQH6vau1-aCbmQ.review_text: Very cute idea. We had the Baked Hot Chocolate and a White Chocolate pudding. The pudding was very interesting in an odd way. It was seasoned with too many different flavors and came with a lemon granite. The lemon granite was the best part. The Baked Hot Chocolate was your typical molten chocolate cake, so nothing too exciting. The restaurant is cute and the music was great (old school hip hop.) The service was ok. The server just took our orders, served us some food, never checked back on us, until he bussed out plates and left the check.  I had very high hopes for this place, but I don't think I'll be visiting again.

DVnDB6C2m5xqEFnjfwCdDA.review_text: Sunday, 8:30PM.  Bourgie prices + bourgie prices are generally a no-no for this phatty. Candybar falls under my minority list of exceptions.    Sweet, modern setup. The bartender for the evening, Chris, is a nice fella native to the Bay and shot the breeeezy with us. Behind us were widely spaced tables and a shelf of BOARD GAMES. How awesome is that!?  +Good service (solid recommendations, replenished beverages in a timely manner) +Cool decor, clean shop +Meticulous preparation for each dish  Sugar rush: 1. Brownie bits + vanilla ice cream      +Warm brownies, firm exterior 2. Red velvet cake      +Melts in mouth (drool)  And then...? Bring the Lady for the artistic and creative desserts and to enjoy the ambiance. Bring the crew for board game mania. Either way, bring someone and enjoy the Candy!

3Q8xmjnmIIjjD_9-ohwOPA.review_text: Came here with a group of friends on a Sunday night. Parking is hideous.  This place is pretty small. Reservations are recommended depending on group size and day of the week.  Service was friendly and good with follow up. I ordered a strawberry kiss (sparkling wine with a frozen strawberry), which was sweet. The 50/50 soju drink is really good--tastes like those orange cream drinks!  I had the sampler (4 desserts) which is WORTH IT. I don't know why you'd spend $10 to eat a regular portion of one dessert... The sampler is perfect for trying a bit of 4 desserts (and they're adequate portions) cause you get to try different tastes and textures. I ordered the strawberry limeade, lavender honey creme fraiche semi freddo, big francesco's tiramisu, ice cream sandwich. YUMYUMYUMYUM!  I'm actually not a huge dessert fan, but some flavors that I love include lavender honey, mascarpone cheese and liquor, and almond flour (macarons)  Strawberry limeade: the waitress recommended this, and it wasn't my favorite out of the 4 items ordered, but it was light and the strawberries on top gave it a fruitier "healthier" taste.  Lavender honey creme fraiche semi freddo: pretty delicious! This was smooth and flavorful and not too heavy  Tiramisu: one of my favorite type of desserts. They do a pretty good job, but I like my tiramisu brandy-heavy, and this one did not live up to standards. However, it was incredibly smooth and still tasty!  Ice cream sandwich: they did a really good job with the macaron cookie part. It was fresh and chewy. The sorbet on the inside was good, but I feel like it would've tasted better and more macaron-ish with ice cream instead of sorbet.

cENkqoppNIO1yNdyBICFsw.review_text: I love this place. I have came here with friends twice and both times we left very satisfied. This place has good desserts, drinks, fun games, great ambiance, good customer service, young vibe, etc. It is a great if not fantastic place to go to impress your date (hint hint!) or just a casual hangout with friends. The price is very reasonable, around $20 for a dessert and a drink. I like the couches and coffee table approach instead of the standard square tables and chairs (boring). The lighting and decorations of the place just give off a very romantic and trendy vibe. Love it!!

xzpRWdRx5yytBiU5mkYokw.review_text: I somehow mostly end up here everytime I come to the city to eat. There's always something new to try in terms or desserts and dessert drinks. They have board games as well as card games so you can relax and hang out with your friends. Its a really small place so it gets packed quickly. come early if you don't like waiting.

WnnqbrtXQw0lYOd3p7XGzw.review_text: Candybar is the little bar that could...    Open for a little over a month, Candybar is a warm, tastefully/minimally decorated lounge that serves delicious, but pricey dessert and wine parings along with several small, savory dishes, at a big price.  The service staff is friendly and well-versed on the desserts and wines they serve, but they're *very* unorganized.  You'd think that with 3 different people taking our orders and serving our table of 12, things would be spot-on, but it may actually have contributed to the chaos.  All 3 were getting confused about who gets what, forgetting forks, not refilling water or bringing new water glasses for our late-arriving guests, not removing finished plates, even forgetting an order (mine).  But my Fourme D'Ambert panna cotta  with caramel dates and little, warm, mini cinnamon toasts along with the great company that night was enough to make me forgive the disorganization, the $30. bill (just for my dessert, a half-pour paring and a glass of wine) and the 20 minute parking-spot search, but not forget.  Just keep chanting "I think I can, I think I can...", Candybar, and I'm sure you'll get it down someday.  Until then, I'll be across the street at Tsunami.

zKjnzaHojLBSXndsW-_W5Q.review_text: I love the taste and sound of candy and even better if its Candybar.  Has a great ring to eat.  Been here several times now for UYE and birthday thingy.  Yes just like what it sounds.  It is a place where you get your cocktails and desserts at one place.  It is a fabulous place for happy hours and extend up to 8pm.  They have different types of desserts nicely display on the plate for the pleasure of your eyes as well as your palates.  Their cocktails are awesome.  I love their Sangria#3 and their specialty drinks $4.  My favorite is the strawberry bliss--a sparkling drink with a sweet taste to it.  My kinda cocktail.  The ambience is very warm and cozy.  Nice on those cold nights in San Francisco.  The only negative thing I have to say is Parking Parking Parking.  If it weren't for parking, I would be here on a weekly basis.  Maybe not....watching waistline.  But parking is painful here but well worth it when you are at Candybar.

gBEihTFxWQ5CzOH1tGjAPw.review_text: 3.5 Stars + Accepts Credit Cards + Happy Hour + Fast Service + Nice Spot for any Occasion - Hard to find parking I was looking for a nice dessert spot to take my gal pal Phoebe to celebrate her 25th birthday last week. Rather than treating her to dessert first then head to a bar for some drinks afterward, what better place is there to take her than a somewhere that serves both :D. Thanks to Yelp, I was able to find Candybar. So this is exactly where we went. Parking was such a hassle! We arrived at around 8:20 pm and found parking at 8:50 -- 6 blocks away from our destination. We didn't mind the short walk but when its raining, and you have girls wearing heels, that's a different story hehe. Anyway we arrived at Candybar around 9, leaving us with only 1 hour to chill. Tan greeted and seated us right away near the back of the bar/restaurant. Each of us ordered a drink and a dessert. I had the Jasmine Sparkle (Sparkling Wine, Jasmine, and Lemon) $8 yelp.com/biz_photos/n9MM… and Carrot Cake (Walnuts, Currents, Bruleed Bananas, and Salted Caramel Ice Cream) $9 yelp.com/biz_photos/n9MM… for dessert. The Birthday girl Phoebe had the Strawberry Kiss (Sparkling Wine, Ginger Ale and Frozen Strawberries) $8 yelp.com/biz_photos/n9MM… and Chocolate Mousse (Mango Sauce, Roasted White Chocolate, and Milkey Way Malt Ice Cream) $9 yelp.com/biz_photos/n9MM…  Stephanie had the 50/50 (Soju, Orange Soda, and Vanilla) $8 yelp.com/biz_photos/n9MM… and an Apple a la Mode (Hazelnut Crust, Cream Cheese Filling, Caramel and Gingerbread Ice Cream) $9 yelp.com/biz_photos/n9MM…. I thought there wasn't anything special about the Jasmine Sparkle. I was hoping there would be at least a hint of Jasmine or Lemon in my drink but unfortunately there was none. Stephanie's 50/50 on the other hand was my favorite. It was sweet and creamy and kinda tasted like a melted Orange Creamsicle. There weren't much alcohol in it however. The Carrot Cake and Salted Ice Cream went very well together. None of the elements overwhelmed each other and it definitely looked like one of the "healthier" choices on the menu. I wouldn't mind ordering this again. Overall, I'm glad both the girls had a great experience here and I would recommend Candybar for any occasion. Parking may be a bit on the hard side, so wear comfortable shoes just in case ladies!

VeuwCtfmB4VyXWuUYbZp8w.review_text: We went for a girls night so we tried a couple of the savory items and all of the sweet.  Be forewarned the savory items are small bites so don't come here expecting a meal or substance to support all the wine you're going to drink.  We had a couple salads (egg & celery and romaine), the Jumbo asparagus (3 stalks) and the cheese plate.  As for the sweets - the table favorite was the blood orange baked alaska and split between the chocolate brioche and the milk chocolate parfait as the 2nd fav.  If you like salty sweet, you'll like the parfait.  The panna cotta was a bit pungent since they used fourme d'ambert - (bleu cheese).  Others liked the vanilla cake but I thought it was a bit eggy.  There was also the chevre cheesecake which was a deconstructed cheesecake as there was no crust and just bits of crust sprinkled on it and wasn't cake or cheesecake at all in texture, but it tasted good.  They brought an amuse for everyone which was very light and refreshing and ended with their version of milk and cookies - warm malted milk in a cute little cup with a peanut butter cookie.  For the wine we ended up starting with a Pinot and ending with a Gewrztraminer.  We were having a hard time deciding and they let us sample a couple different ones before deciding on our bottle, but sadly they were out of the bottle we wanted.  3 1/2 stars for now - I'll return again to see if we can bump the review up.  Yes it's new, but the servers should still get a lesson on the wine list and the difference between them all - it's great that the owner knows the wines so well, but maybe some tips to the servers on their differences would go a long way.   Overall we had a nice time and since it was mid-week we were able to enjoy the space and our conversation at a leisurely pace.  We didn't play any of the board games but I was definitely eyeballing  the scrabble board.....next time.

nyXNNLKjSWtDQka5PrFoew.review_text: Came here on a Saturday night for a friend's birthday and did not anticipate parking to be SO difficult! we drove around for 45+ minutes..the bf and I were THIS close to giving up. We finally made it to Candybar without losing our sanity.   Very nice interior with a loungy feel with reasonably priced drinks and desserts. Highly recommend the Mango Tango Bellini! Spent the night reminiscing back on our childhoods with boardgames. (Did you know Chutes & Ladders require ZERO skills or strategic abilities?! ) Great relaxed atmosphere where we never felt rushed or cramped.  Ended the night people watching (aka spying) on a couple trying to determine which date they were on and how well it was going. We are now experts at analyzing body language and reading lips.

OKMrqnNwDCflvNXqBDcRCg.review_text: Candybar is an awesome joint for a GNO! ;) That being said, this is NOT the place to go if you want to get blasted. The drinks are not strong at all, and I think that's one of the reasons why this isn't a 5-star review. For the price you're paying (~$7-10) for the mixed drinks on the menu, you'll probably need at least 3-4 to feel gooooooood. Trust me, even their lemon drop shot was quite weak. Then again, Candybar is not really a bar bar where the main purposes are for people to drown their sorrows or make men bolder and women looser. This is also unfortunately why Candybar closes earlier than a lot of the other bars in the city.   However, the concept of Candybar is pure GENIUS! I mean, who doesn't love board games, or any other group-engaging activities. This place is definitely fun if you want to have some fun while eating dessert at the same time. Side note: not all desserts are made with alcohol.   Parking can be a pain in the butt since it took me 35 minutes to find parking. But I think everyone should experience Candybar at least once!   Gentlemen, prepare to impress the ladies if you surprise them here after a date. This is not a bad way to woo her. haha...

_D25AL2bbVQNOJLOrdk0uQ.review_text: Light alcohol drinks + Yummy Desserts + Modern design and decor + Friendly Staff + board games! = a great place to hang out, drink, and enjoy your time.  $3 Sangria was yummy and sweet with not bitterness! Wish I could of drank more (than one), but I'm the DD.    The Peanut butter time was really good, the peanut butter was more of a very soft cream on top of a hard-ish not really a tart type of crust.  Overall, smooth tasting from start to finish.  The modern decor was really interesting from the comic book inspired art framed on the wall to grafitti on the wall.  Sitting was great with the adjustable table and ottoman seats.    anyone game for Apples to Apples?

WcBmK5DYh1lhxSBqJGVgNA.review_text: I had a friend visiting from out of town a short while back and, much to my delight, she had purchased a Groupon to Candybar in preparation for the trip.  I am a HUGE fan of dessert lounges and have been dying to try this place for some time now, so I was really excited that I would finally get to!  We tried walking in on a Friday night since they told us that they did not take reservations for parties of 2.  NOT true!  Make a reservation!  It was packed and the wait was 45 minutes, so we put our names down for Sunday evening and came back 2 days later.  No reservation was needed for Sunday evening.  It was empty.  Lucky for us!  We ordered the Apple Pie a la Mode (hazelnut crust, cream cheese filling, caramel, gingerbread ice cream), the Passion Fruit Chocolate Mousse (chocolate cake, tuile, passion fruit curd, vanilla bean ice cream), and a mango sorbet bellini.    I started with a bite of the Apple Pie a la Mode.  Oh. Em. Eff. Gee.  My eyes rolled back in my head and I was speechless.  Candy Bar served up the best apple pie of my LIFE!  The hazelnut crust was absolutely to die for, people!  It was crumbly and delicious and just perfect.  The combination of brown sugar, cinnamon and butter was absolutely mind-blowing!  We both agreed that it was an outrageously good dessert and for me, that's what makes Candy Bar a 5-star place.    The passion fruit mousse was very nicely done.  It was definitely the more aesthetically pleasing of the two desserts we ordered and the tart citrus of the passion fruit nicely complemented the dark chocolate shell.    The mango sorbet bellini was pretty good, though we both thought it was a bit strong.  Not going to lie,  I was kind of fascinated by the scoop of mango sorbet in the drink.  I thought it was a nice touch and it gave the bellini a creamier texture that I appreciated.  It took it from just a regular mixed drink to a dessert drink.  The mixed drinks at this place look amazing, btw!  If I was more of a drinker, I would have been in heaven.    All in all, I loved Candy Bar!  The ambiance is terrific and it would be a great place to take a date or to go for a girl's night.  The red walls and art work give it a warm but sultry atmosphere.  And let's not forget the board games!  I've been looking for a bar in the city where you can play board games for awhile now (yes, I'm kind of a nerd), so I was absolutely stoked when I saw that they have a decent collection (though truth be told, I did not peruse the title and cannot therefore speak to the quality of these board games).

0AOKNlcrwNtd4cLVhJsabw.review_text: Went here last night after dinner and loved it!  The atmosphere was great and the menu was amazing, it was so hard to decide what to get.  I ended up going with the soft cheesecake and it was deliciously unexpected.  Kind of like deconstructed cheesecake almost.  I also go the mango tango cocktail to pair with it and it was soooo yummy!  I loved the little scoop of sorbet in it.  I pretty much was in a sugar coma by the end of the night.  One piece of advice, make reservations!  It was my first time so I didn't know to do this.  It's a small place.  Luckily, we got there at around 8:30ish and only had a 15 min wait for table.  But by the time we left (around 10ish), there was crowd outside waiting to get in for a table.    Overall, great experience, and I would definitely come back!

APv0NMsIBT9HsyGuUFTDVA.review_text: The desserts are incredible, and I love the cocktail/dessert pairings.  It's a cute, unique place that would be great for a date, but also works for larger groups.  Actually, they even keep a supply of games on hand, so you can go grab a board game and play at your table.  I understand the parking comments, but honestly I'm used to it -- I live nearby.  :)  It's true, though, that this place's hours coincide with the most utterly impossible parking hours for the neighborhood.  Good luck!

fSe47_WBlrUmLsswRC-cng.review_text: Super Cute Novelty. I mean a whole space just for Sweet-Tooth's like ME. With an affinity for sweets as far back as I can remember I have tried just about every candy, pie, cake or dessert. My degree in pastry helped quite a bit with 5 days a week, 8 hours a day of chocolate, pulled sugar and hand rolled truffles I know my sweets.  Anyway I love that they are open LATE! Went around 11pm....That's a huge pull. When you go out for dinner and they just didn't have what you were looking for, Go Here! Great lighting and a Soju bar (for those of U who don't know what that is, it's alcohol but for lightweights)  Great sampler platter, their menu items are constantly changing so don't be disappointed if you go in for something you see a pic of on Yelp and they don't make it anymore.   The desserts were creative, fun to look at (because part of what the experience is, is seeing it first)   ***Pssss...hard to find parking and pretty busy so be prepared to wait 20-30 for a 2 top!

Djk49JjpKl9HQNpmiX669Q.review_text: I CAN'T BELIEVE THEY RAN OUT OF MACAROON ICE CREAM SANDWICHES?!?!?!?!?! I ONLY WANTED A MACAROON ICE CREAM SANDWICH AND I DIDN'T GET TO EAT ONE!!! I'M WAS SO DEVASTATED AND DISAPPOINTED!!!.....ok, I'm done complaining......  So I ended up having a flourless chocolate cake and that was pretty darn delicious! Don't get me wrong, I would never had that over an ice cream sandwich, but I guess that held me over and I didn't turn over tables and start a riot like I had intended once I found out they were out of ice cream sandwiches....ok, back to yelping....the flourless chocolate cake was pretty dense since it's carbo counterpart was absent. It came with this thin bark of white chocolate which complimented perfected with a small side of fruity orange color sorbet/ice cream that I could only guess was mango flavored.   Will I return?  YES!!  As said by the Terminator, "I'LL BE BACK... FOR MY ICE CREAM SANDWICH!!!"  (They actually edited that second part out of the original movie script.)

o9BYfOvm1iodLEIdHoa6ww.review_text: What's better than starting reviews again beginning with the last place I went to today?  I came here to try the place out with Mr. Face using a Groupon for 2 desserts and 2 cocktails. The location seems almost a little hidden... it's a nice little place; I dig the art that they had on the walls. I know that it's such a small thing to notice, but the candle that was on our table looked a little sad because it seemed super short in the wax... it was so itty bitty =(  Anyways, I ordered the semi freddo and the mango tango bellini, while Mr. Face ordered the ice cream sandwich and the jasmine sparkle. It's unfortunate to say the least that I didn't exactly dig everything.   I felt that my drink was on the strong side. Maybe I'm just too much of a weakling when it comes to alcohol as I drink very little, but I didn't taste much of the mango and I got made fun of because Senior Face said that I kept scowling at the glass. His drink was ok... didn't seem special to me. I downed my drink when he said to even though he didn't finish his... punk.  As for the desserts, they were very well presented. My semi freddo looked nice, but I loved the simplicity of the chocolate smear and the blueberries for the ice cream sandwich. They didn't wow me though... The semi freddo was only good when every element was consumed together; I'm the kind of person that enjoys things more when you can enjoy every part together AND separately. Otherwise, the semi freddo was reminiscent of soap and the brittle tasted a little burnt. I wonder if something was with my taste buds today? Something about the ice cream sandwich faintly reminded me of play-doh.   It's a good thing I didn't use names because as we waited I kicked Mr. Face's butt playing connect 4... 2 or 3 times in a row. We'll prob come by a couple more times to try other things before I figure if I like it or not... I say I because he's not as picky as I am. Good thing I had the Groupon, as it gave us a good deal... I don't know how I would have felt about the experience if everything was full price.

AL0_BZxfrdNlJht2mz3PGA.review_text: The winning factor in this place is not, as you would think, the desserts. I would say the defining quality is hands down the environment. The desserts are just ok but they are not over priced so just ok is... well ok. The specialty drinks are not very strong and little high dollar but they have other stuff that compensates it nicely. But the experience itself is worth the trip. The room is fun and lively, the walls are peppered with interesting and exciting art, and the bookshelves are chocked full of classic and new board games for you to enjoy.  It is a go and chill out with you girlfriends kind of place for sure.

2bHSZhM0huV8LRh3YHaOSQ.review_text: I'm now having a secret love affair with their sangria. Please don't tell my recipe - she's the jealous type (Spanish you know).

qGi0xjK3HM3Lfr6kSwKZdw.review_text: It's our annual Christmas eat-fest in the city and I remember Lindsey R. raving about Candybar. And being a fellow Yelper and a fellow fat girl... I took this as an invitation to try this out. I mean the answer is simple, if you dare to cut out main course, appetizers, salads and soups--what is there to complain about?  My True Religions started crying as I felt my ass expand, just by grazing over this menu. It's a great concept, very chic and inviting. The board games are a nice touch as you graze over an excessive amount of calories placed in front of you. My chocolate coma eventually made me greedy in Connect 4 and I just couldn't do it anymore. The portions of desserts is varied, things are laid out beautifully... art on your plate and art on the walls.  It just sounds like a 3-hour Weight Watcher themed opera. The notes hit higher when you feel the cottage cheese erupt on your thighs. How many points, is this?   But who gives, it's dessert. Just open wide.  The dessert choices change monthly. The choices itself looked adventurous in the ingredients, I remember basil, frozen cranberrys and melt-away lime (?) so do come with an open mind. But really choose what appeals to you. I had a Baked Hot Chocolate with homemade Marshmallow, because it ripped off the menu and waved at me in the face. When it came out it was like a 6-year-old's version of a souffle, it was great. The marshmallow is overwhelming on top, but that's your invitation to dig. The chocolate purposely already on my spoon (as a part of the presentation) is a nice touch to the dish.  After trying to purge on it, I secretly thought in my head that the Barefoot Contessa or Paula Deen would come out and show me how much butter was in my dessert. But then I realized I was just drunk.

Y3QU8Jj3lYuVa2LmunvnRg.review_text: I was really excited when I heard about the opening of this place. For those of you who live, have lived or just have a general interest in NYC and the great restaurants there, you might have heard of Chikalicious. *clicky* yelp.com/biz/chikaliciou… I fell in love with Chikalicious and I wanted to fall in love with Candybar just the same. But unlike my love at first site experience with a little fru fru gangsta, it just didn't happen with Candybar. I called in a reservation for 7pm on Sunday for 4. I asked if wine parings were offered and was delighted to learn that they were. After a light meal at Papalote, we made our way down to CB and were politely greeted and seated. The table was a bit too big for the space and poor Tiffinie was on the traffic side. I would say poor me since I was pinned against the wall, but since I'm small, and i have an freakishly strong bladder, I didn't mind. I love the decor of this place. Simple with a splash of color. Tiffinie commented on the lighting over the bar, stating that she liked it and everyone nodded in agreement, until I mentioned that it reminded me of the light bulbs from the movie SAW and then Eugy shuddered. (he doesn't like scary movies)............ Some board games are provided for entertainment, but this didn't really make sense to me. The tables are on the small side and the plates are on the large side. Board game on the table with largish plates along with various glasses makes for an uncomfortably cluttered table. Not a good idea in my opinion. A wine paring list was printed out especially for us since I specifically asked for it when I called in the resvy. That deserves its own star! I'm no good at picking out wine or bubbly anyway, so having the paring list made decision making easy. For starters, I had a Moscato di' Asti. I have always loved the muscat. The japanese muscat gummies are the best. Eat that and drink a sprite at the same time and it's almost like you're drinking muscat bubbly. Yum! First we went for the savory items: Scallop sashimi w/ avocado and kumquat - I loved this! The kumquat gave it a nice zing. Pork terrine w/ pickled shallot, mustard, pickles and crostini - This was really good. Especially with the pickled shallot/mustard combo Duck Liver Mousse - Thanks to Tiffinie and Jeff (who I now openly restaurant stalk) I tried this wonderful dish for the first time. This mousse on crostini with wine? drooooooooooool~ On to the dessert - Warm Vanilla Cake - Something sweet and warm was oozing out of this cake. SO DAMN GOOD!! Chevre cheesecake w/ ice cream (i forget the flavor!) - This came in a bowl but had pretty much melted when it came to the table... Though it tasted good, wasn't happy that it came out pretty much in soup form... As far as service, the host was super friendly and accommodating. Our server seemed a little aloof and took forever getting back to us with info on one of the wines that was on the pairing menu. I understand that this place has been open for a very, very short time and that's why I was patient. Normally, I wouldn't have been so patient. But even despite the short presence in the restaurant scene, this place shows GREAT potential. I'm going to give it 6 months and come back. I hope by then, all the kinks will have been worked out.
